characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-prey captained by Kruge on a covert mission to the Genesis Planet. Stolen and commanded by Admiral Kirk; re-christened with historical irony by Dr. McCoy.
name: H.M.S. Bounty*
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Subcommander Taris' warbird. Responded to the Federation incursion of the Neutral Zone, near Iconia.
name: Haakona
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Humanoid arms dealer. Associate of Quark's cousin Gaila. Ruthless. Treats his business associates like family - until they cross him.
name: Hagath
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Treachery x 2 Anthropology ENGINEER Your hand weapons may report here.

lore: Using a universal translator and other communication technology, such as at Worf's station aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, starships can greet any ships they encounter.
name: Hail
text: Plays on any ship "flying by" one of your ships; it must stop at your location. OR Select two ships; they cannot battle each other this turn.

lore: Hirogen captured by Penk on his son's first hunt. Has fought at Tsunkatse for nearly two decades. Trained Seven of Nine, hoping she could end his captivity.
name: Hajur
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Biology MEDICAL Anthropology Geology Archaeology

lore: Hirogen captured by Penk on his son's first hunt. Has fought at Tsunkatse for nearly two decades. Trained Seven of Nine, hoping she could end his captivity.
name: Hajur*
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Biology MEDICAL Anthropology Geology Archaeology

lore: One of the greatest Kazon-Ogla warriors. Serves under Razik. Admired by many young Ogla, including Karden. Killed a Relora with his bare hands to earn his name.
name: Haliz
text: OFFICER Biology SCIENCE Leadership Stellar Cartography

lore: Site of dilithium deposits and obstinate inhabitants.
name: Halkan Council
text: Seeds or plays on table; any players may download one [MQ] Constitution-class ship here. Native to this timeline: all [AU][MU][OS] cards, and all [OS] Equipment cards. Once per turn, one such card reporting at this location may report for free.

name: Handshake
text: Plays once each turn (for free) if you have played no cards this turn and have fewer in hand than opponent; they must choose to discard three cards or allow you to draw three. OR Plays to look at top five cards in any draw deck or discard pile for ten seconds; rearrange as desired. OR Plays if you have at least three other cards in hand; discard entire hand and draw seven cards. Discard incident after any use.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Genetically engineered scientist from Moab IV. Granted asylum aboard U.S.S. Enterprise in 2368.
name: Hannah Bates
text: SCIENCE Physics

lore: Member of Karemma Commerce Ministry. Helped to defuse a torpedo lodged in the hull of the U.S.S. Defiant. Learned of Ferengi business philosophy from Quark.
name: Hanok
text: V.I.P. Acquisition Diplomacy Smuggling ENGINEER DL/ {Any [Rule] card}

lore: While stranded on a savage world by the Kazon-Nistrim, the crew of U.S.S. Voyager encountered a carnivorous creature with an appetite for Starfleet engineers.
name: Hanonian Land Eel
text: Unless SECURITY, SCIENCE, and STRENGTH>50 present, kills Away Team member with lowest CUNNING or fewest [*] icons (opponent's choice).

name: Harness Particle 010
text: Plays on table. Target {Omega Particle} (download if needed; it is immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}) at your mission with no [BO] objective on it. Your Borg may scout that location. After scouting complete, if your staffed Borg cube there, you may probe: [Enigma], [Incident], [Objective]: Perfection achieved. Place on mission; discard Particle. Doubles point boxes of your subsequently completed [BO] objectives.

lore: First maje of the powerful Kazon-Relora, blood enemies of the Nistrim. Commands countless soldiers and a vast fleet of ships - including his own Kazon Raider.
name: Haron
text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology MEDICAL Greed Stellar Cartography

lore: U.S.S. Voyager operations officer, his first posting out of the Academy. Until then, had never missed calling home every week. Plays reed instruments. Unlucky at love.
name: Harry Kim
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Music Youth May volunteer for random selections (if applicable).

lore: Nanobiogenic weapon used by both sides in the T'Lani-Kellerun war. Julian Bashir and Miles O'Brien developed a method for neutralizing the virus using muon frequencies.
name: Harvester Virus
text: Place on planet. End of every player's turn, one personnel on planet killed (random selection). Cure with 2 MEDICAL, Exobiology and Computer Skill.

lore: Outraged by a crime on Deep Space 9, Bajorans defaced Odo's security office. The xenophobic vandals were quick to judge the "shifter" simply because he was different.
name: Hate Crime
text: Place on a non-Borg personnel who is the only member of its species present (opponent's choice). That personnel may not use any of its skills.

lore: Helm officer of the U.S.S Enterprise-E. Lieutenant Hawk piloted the ship through a temporal vortex. Member of Picard's zero-G assault team.
name: Hawk
text: OFFICER When aboard, your ship may treat each nebula as if its span were reduced by 1. Navigation x 2

lore: Jake Sisko was exposed to the horrors of war when caught in the Klingon attack on Ajilon Prime. Not a soldier, he was unprepared for the hazards he faced with the colonists.
name: Hazardous Duty
text: To get past requires 2 OFFICER; then place on mission until solved. If any non- OFFICER dies here, its owner loses points (discard dilemma).

lore: Losing a crewman under one's command is one of the most difficult realities an officer must face. The tragic loss of life is significant even to a Vulcan.
name: Hazardous Duty (Voyager)
text: To get past requires 2 OFFICER; then place on mission until solved. If any non-OFFICER dies here, its owner loses points (discard dilemma).

lore: Identification: XENOLOGY DRONE Task: Assess suitability of alien cultures for assimilation. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Two of Twelve
text: Archaeology Anthropology Exobiology If present where probing for {Assimilate Planet}, once each turn, you may discard probe card to probe again.

lore: Female Kobliad security officer. Representative of law enforcement agents found on non-aligned worlds. Pursued the criminal Rao Vantika for 20 years.
name: Ty Kajada
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership

lore: Small shuttlecraft. One commanded by Benjamin Sisko guided a silithium comet through the Bajoran wormhole.
name: Type 18 Shuttlepod
text: May report with crew (each must have Navigation) to your Defiant-class ship.

lore: Typical shuttlecraft carried aboard Intrepid-class starships. U.S.S. Voyager carries an unusually large compliment.
name: Type 9 Shuttlecraft
text: May report aboard your Intrepid- and Nova-class ships.

lore: Modern Federation shuttle with warp capability. May be armed for special missions.
name: Type VI Shuttlecraft

lore: Class of runabout often named for Terran rivers. First commissioned in 2368. The following year, the U.S.S. Enterprise delivered three Danube-class vessels to DS9.
name: U.S.S. Danube
text: Reports for free to {Docking Pads}.

lore: First launched in 2284 as a test for what proved to be the unsuccessful transwarp project. Now uses standard warp drive.
name: U.S.S. Excelsior
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Holodeck; Prototype; Tractor Beam;
lore: Prototype in this elite class of ships was the U.S.S. Galaxy, after which the class was named.
name: U.S.S. Galaxy
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Holodeck; Prototype; Tractor Beam;
lore: Prototype introduced in the early 2370s. Its bio-neural circuits respond faster than optical relays. Average crew complement of 140. Capable of a sustained warp 9.975.
name: U.S.S. Intrepid
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Small ship class from the late 23rd century. Named for a character in Shakespeare's play, The Tempest.
name: U.S.S. Miranda
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Modern class of ship featuring large upper equipment modules customizable for specific mission uses.
name: U.S.S. Nebula
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Class of small ships often used for scientific missions. Named for 20th century rocket scientist Hermann Oberth.
name: U.S.S. Oberth
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Representative of Cardassian scientists. Member of Ministry of Science. Worked on subspace radio relay project in 2371 with her associate, Gilora Rejal.
name: Ulani Belor
text: SCIENCE Physics Stellar Cartography

lore: Typical Hupyrian. Hired by Brunt as a bodyguard during his brief stint as Grand Nagus in 2374.
name: Uri'lash
text: SECURITY Honor Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Jem'Hadar; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Typical Jem'Hadar soldier. Fifth. Assigned to Terok Nor while station was occupied by the Dominion. Drilled in station defense tactics.
name: Varat'idan
text: SECURITY Astrophysics Geology

lore: Representative of female Romulans trained in the field of science. Assigned to assist with interphase generator project.
name: Varel
text: SCIENCE Physics Computer Skill Youth

lore: First officer of the Alliance battle cruiser that intercepted Kira and Bashir's runabout when they first crossed over to the mirror universe.
name: Vartoq
text: OFFICER Biology Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel; Vedek;
lore: Bajoran Vedek. Typical member of Vedek Assembly. Accompanied Minister Rozahn to Deep Space 9 in 2370 to deny Skrreean request to settle on Bajor.
name: Vedek Sorad
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy MEDICAL

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Female; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Mission Specialist;
lore: Klingon female trained in Klingon anatomy and medicine. Propositioned Commander William T. Riker on the I.K.C. Pagh in 2365.
name: Vekma
text: MEDICAL Honor

lore: "I am the beginning; the end; the one who is many. I am the Borg.... I am the collective."
name: Borg Queen
text: When reported, selects any skill; may change skill at start of each turn. May download {A Change of Plans} or a Borg drone in place of one card draw.

lore: "We all originated from lesser species. I myself came from Species 125. But that's irrelevant now. We are Borg... Our thoughts are one... One order, one voice."
name: Borg Queen (The Borg)
text: When reported, selects any skill; may change skill at start of each turn. May download any [BO] Event or Interrupt card in place of your normal card play.

lore: Enigmatic Terran rebel. In the mirror universe, Vic Fontaine inexplicably fights other Terran rebels. Even more inexplicably, he is not a hologram.
name: Fontaine
text: CIVILIAN Navigation Astrophysics MEDICAL Music DL/ Two {disruptors (each must add STRENGTH +2)}.

lore: Identification: BORG UNICOMPLEX Task: Centralize all collective operations. Coordinate.
name: Unicomplex
text: Seeds or plays at any [S] mission with no affiliation icons. Once each turn, {Borg Queen} OR one unique drone OR one unique ship may report for free here.

lore: Re-creation of the famed 20th century human. Author of the theory of relativity.
name: Albert Einstein
text: SCIENCE Physics x 2 Astrophysics

lore: Typical Cardassian warship in the mirror universe. Type 3 designation. Part of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance fleet. Stationed at Terok Nor.
name: Alliance Galor
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Bajoran short-range interceptor used in the mirror universe. One of the few military contributions Bajor offers the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance.
name: Alliance Interceptor
text: May take off or land once each turn. X=4 if moving within a region.

lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey. Standard patrol and pursuit craft of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. One of the most expendable elements of the Regent's fleet.
name: Alliance K'Vort
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Ore mining and processing station representative of facilities used by the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance.
name: Alliance Nor
text: Seeds or plays at any mission in Mirror Quadrant (except in the Badlands Region). [eDS9] {Ops} may not seed or play on this Nor.

lore: Fast and powerful battle cruiser. Backbone of the Alliance fleet. Their only weakness is in their targeting systems; they've been known to chase warp shadows.
name: Alliance Vor'Cha
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'hadar Attack Ship; Jem'Hadar Ship;
lore: Jem'Hadar attack ship produced at Chin'toka shipyard in Alpha Quadrant. Constructed after enemy forces restricted Dominion access to the Bajoran Wormhole.
name: Alpha Attack Ship
text: May avoid being targeted by {Establish Tractor Lock}. Invasive Transporters

lore: Maquis terrorist. Cal Hudson's co-pilot. Helped abduct Gul Dukat, blaming him for supplying illegal weapons to Cardassians in the Demilitarized Zone.
name: Amaros
text: ENGINEER Navigation Physics

characteristicsKeywords: Jem'Hadar; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Jem'Hadar Fourth. Representative of Dominion troops deployed to hold Terok Nor after its capture near the end of 2373.
name: Amet'alox
text: SECURITY Transporter Skill Stellar Cartography

lore: Conduct analysis of the metaphasic particles in this nebula.
name: Analyze Radiation
text: Astrophysics + Biology + Navigation Span -2 for all Son'a ships.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel;
lore: Representative of Bajoran engineering apprentices serving on Deep Space 9. Assisted Miles O'Brien with computer "pup" in 2369.
name: Anara
text: ENGINEER Physics Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Equinox-related personnel;
lore: One of the U.S.S. Equinox crewmen stripped of rank by Kathryn Janeway upon joining U.S.S. Voyager. Fit in with his new crew without major incident.
name: Angelo Tassoni
text: SECURITY Navigation

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Equinox-related personnel;
lore: One of the U.S.S. Equinox crewmen stripped of rank by Kathryn Janeway upon joining U.S.S. Voyager. Fit in with his new crew without major incident.
name: Angelo Tassoni*
text: SECURITY Navigation

lore: Representative of Cardassians in the mirror universe. Strives to be noticed - without raising the ire of Security Chief Garak. Has done neither thus far.
name: Aramax
text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Greed

lore: Dissident. Typical member of Cardassian underground. Loyal to Ghemor. Helped Kira Nerys escape Obsidian Order in 2371. Has hopes for a better Cardassia.
name: Ari
text: OFFICER Honor Transporter Skill Computer Skill

lore: Mainstay of the Bajoran Militia. During the 2370 coup attempt by the Circle, assault vessels commanded by General Krim and Colonel Day invaded Deep Space 9.
name: Assault Vessel
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Mission Specialist;
lore: Typical Klingon Intelligence specialist. Dispatched to Deep Space 9 with Morka and Bo'rak to investigate Romulan activity.
name: Atul
text: SECURITY Klingon Intelligence

lore: Versatile Maquis who has served exceptionally aboard U.S.S. Voyager. His many assignments have included tactical, ops, and guarding the brig.
name: Ayala
text: SECURITY Astrophysics

lore: Versatile Maquis who has served exceptionally aboard U.S.S. Voyager. His many assignments have included tactical, ops, and guarding the brig.
name: Ayala*
text: SECURITY Astrophysics

lore: Third serving under Omet'iklan. Representative of Jem'Hadar officers. Participated in eradication of dishonorable Jem'Hadar renegades on Vandros IV.
name: Azet'izan
text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill

lore: Typical freighter used by merchants and military. Based on a standard Bajoran hull design. Frequently hauls goods and passengers to Bajoran settlements.
name: Bajoran Freighter

lore: Patrols high orbit of Bajor and surrounding region. Used by the Circle to shoot down a subimpulse raider during the attempted coup of 2370.
name: Bajoran Interceptor
text: May take off or land once each turn. X=4 if moving within a region.

lore: Nimble fighter used by the Bajoran resistance during the occupation. Kira Nerys commanded one in 2370.
name: Bajoran Raider
text: Once each turn, may report with crew, take off, or land. X=4 if moving within a region.

lore: Used for scouting and scientific tasks. Bears a resemblance to other Bajoran vessels, although much smaller in size. Tahna Los stole and commanded one.
name: Bajoran Scout Vessel

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran ship; Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Tractor Beam; Warship;
lore: In a parallel universe, the Bajorans grew increasingly hostile after overthrowing the Cardassian Empire. This massive ship attacked the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370.
name: Bajoran Warship
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Participate in bat'leth competition held at this Klingon settlement.
name: Bat'leth Tournament
text: Honor + {any bat'leth} *+10 if bat'leth is {Sword of Kahless}.

lore: Klingon trained as an officer for the Klingon Defense Force. Formerly in command of Narendra III outpost.
name: Batrell
text: OFFICER Honor

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Klingon battle cruiser, circa 2267. Some were provided to the Romulan Star Empire in exchange for cloaking technology. Commander Charvanek captained one.
name: Battle Cruiser
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ Any [Univ] [OS] Klingon or Romulan

lore: Klingon male trained as an officer for the Klingon Defense Force. Served as junior adjutant to the diplomatic delegation for Gowron.
name: B'iJik
text: OFFICER Navigation

lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Explore galaxy for biological and technological distinctiveness. Assimilate.
name: Borg Cube
text: Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Assimilate new cultures and technologies. Add to the perfection of the collective.
name: Borg Cube (The Borg)
text: Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

lore: Identification: BORG OUTPOST Task: Distribute resources in specified unimatrix.
name: Borg Outpost
text: Seed one at any [S] mission with no affiliation icons OR build at such a mission (or at an assimilated planet) where you have a Borg ENGINEER. DL/ {Transwarp Network Gateway}

lore: Identification: BORG PROBE Task: Explore unimatricies at the borders of Borg space. Locate biological and technological distinctiveness.
name: Borg Probe
text: May report with crew to any Delta Quadrant location (limit 3 cards aboard) if your {Borg Queen} in play. Tractor Beam

lore: Identification: BORG SCOUT VESSEL Task: Search for assimilation targets. Establish transwarp connections.
name: Borg Scout Vessel
text: May report with crew to a {Transwarp Network Gateway} at any spaceline end (download doorway if necessary).

lore: Identification: BORG SPHERE Task: General-purpose vessel. Provide contingency option when meeting resistance.
name: Borg Sphere
text: May be reported aboard, carried aboard and launched from any of your Borg cubes.

lore: Identification: CLASS-4 TACTICAL CUBE Task: Respond to incursions into Borg space. Eliminate resistance.
name: Borg Tactical Cube
text: Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard (for free, once each turn, if a [Def] personnel). Tractor Beam

lore: Gather plant life for medical research from planet with highly ionized atmosphere.
name: Botanical Research
text: SCIENCE + MEDICAL + CUNNING>35 {Atmospheric Ionization} may seed here.

lore: Standard ship design used by a reclusive, territorial race with powerful psionic abilities. Possesses technology which allows it to seem invisible to enemy vessels.
name: Bothan Vessel
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Breen ship; Dominion ship; Energy Dampener; Tractor Beam; Warship;
lore: Employs biological technology. Used in attack on San Francisco in 2375. Thot Gor commanded one.
name: Breen Warship
text: Your Breen may report aboard. Energy Dampener, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Ferengi ship; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Old surplus Klingon Bird-of-Prey. Much smaller than K'Vort-class ships. Ferengi bought this one to support a covert vendarite mining operation on Ligos VII.
name: B'rel
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

lore: Attractive young vocalist and part-time nurse. Known as one of "Omag's girls." Overlooks the fat Ferengi's disgusting behavior because of his generosity to her.
name: Calandra
text: CIVILIAN Youth Music MEDICAL DaiMons present are attributes all +1 (cumulative).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Ensign Calloway is representative of Starfleet medical technicians. Served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370.
name: Calloway
text: MEDICAL Youth

lore: Small ship configured for both military and civilian use. Ferried prisoners from Bajor to Terok Nor during the occupation. Natima Lang commanded one.
name: Cardassian Shuttle
Cargo Bay
text: Smuggling, Acquisition and [Non] Navigation personnel may report here (or download here in place of a normal card play; player draws no cards that turn). Once each turn, if a freighter, transport or [Fer] ship's crew member completes a "cargo run" (brings a non-weapon Equipment card here from another facility), for each mission passed (except starting and ending locations) owner may draw a card or download a {Gold-Pressed Latinum} here. (Once per game per Equipment card title.) Any Nor: Docking Ring

lore: Map dust clouds and other hazards in the Expanse.
name: Catalog Phenomena
text: SCIENCE + Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography + Computer Skill

lore: Lieutenant commander typical of executive officers stationed on smaller Starfleet ships. Posted to U.S.S. Voyager. Scornful of Maquis soldiers and sympathizers.
name: Cavit
text: OFFICER Leadership Anthropology Transporter Skill

lore: Characteristic member of the I.K.C. Kla'Diyus crew. A pilot rated on many designs, he enjoyed the new tactics made possible by the ability to attack while under cloak.
name: Ch'dak
text: OFFICER Navigation Physics If on a [Kli] [Films] ship, it is RANGE +1.

characteristicsKeywords: Hologram; Capturing-related card; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Holographic re-creation of U.S.S. Enterprise transporter chief. Used to aid mental reprogramming. Taibak forced Geordi La Forge to "kill" the chief repeatedly.
name: Chief O'Brien
text: ENGINEER SECURITY Transporter Skill Navigation Music Once each turn, may download {Brainwash} here.

lore: Lt. Commander Christopher Hobson is representative of staff officers in Starfleet. Served aboard the U.S.S. Sutherland in 2368.
name: Christopher Hobson
text: OFFICER Computer Skill

lore: Beam volatile sample aboard ship for possible use as a weapon component.
name: Collect Sample
text: SCIENCE + Astrophysics + Transporter Skill + (Smuggling OR Treachery x2)

lore: Survey uninhabited class-M world for possible colonization.
name: Colony Preparations
text: SCIENCE + Geology + Biology + SECURITY When you solve, may download {Colony} here.

lore: Typical Starfleet shuttlecraft, circa 2260s. Assisted in the search for the missing Galileo 7.
name: Columbus
text: May be reported, carried, and launched aboard your Constitution-class ships.

lore: A little-known class of attack craft. One such vessel attacked the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2368 at Surplus Depot Zed-15.
name: Combat Vessel

lore: Build ketracel-white production facility in the Alpha Quadrant.
name: Construct Depot
text: Navigation x2 + Physics + Vorta + ENGINEER When you solve, download {Remote Supply Depot} here. Opponent's side: Not attemptable, no gametext, no pointbox.

lore: Representative of Kazon aligned with the Pommar sect. Has served as bodyguard to Minnis. Stood watch over a group of Trabe being held prisoner on Sobras.
name: Corez
text: SECURITY Treachery Geology DL/ {Kazon Disruptor Rifle}

lore: Male from Parada II. Typical of rebels who supported peace talks with the Paradan government. Rescued Miles O'Brien from government forces in 2370.
name: Coutu
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Honor Exobiology

lore: Standard Automated Commander built by the Cravic to wage war on the Pralor. It is among the oldest of their androids still in operation. Commands a Cravic Warship.
name: Cravic Unit 122
text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Navigation

lore: Powerful ship built decades ago by the Cravic. Still used by their androids to continue war on the Pralor units.
name: Cravic Warship
text: Tractor Beam Your {Cravic Unit}s may report aboard.

lore: Typical crewman on the I.S.S. Enterprise. Seeks any opportunity to be made an officer. Isn't likely to find one on Kirk's ship.
name: Crewman Wilson
text: SCIENCE Treachery Stellar Cartography

lore: Representative of Cardassian military security guards. Glinn assigned to guard prisoners at Hutet labor camp. Wanted to be intimately involved with Major Kira.
name: Dakol
text: SECURITY Navigation Leadership Treachery

lore: "We are Pakleds. We want to be strong."
name: Danderdag
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Navigation

lore: The Hirogen created relatively few Breen holograms, given the limited and conflicting information about their species gleaned from the Voyager databanks.
name: Dar
text: SECURITY Biology Stellar Cartography

lore: The Hirogen created relatively few Breen holograms, given the limited and conflicting information about their species gleaned from the Voyager databanks.
name: Dar*
text: SECURITY Biology Stellar Cartography

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Ensign Darian Wallace is representative of Starfleet security officers. Held numerous positions aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Darian Wallace
text: SECURITY Anthropology

characteristicsKeywords: Holodeck; Particle Scattering Device; Tractor Beam;
lore: Typical Tamarian vessel. "Picard and Dathon, trading knives at El-Adrel. Children at Tama's knee. Sokath, forging knives for his brothers."
name: Darmok
text: When reporting, choose Tractor Beam OR Holodeck OR Particle Scattering Device.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Glinn; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Glinn. Aide to Gul Macet. Attempted to discuss transporter technologies with Miles O'Brien aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, but was rebuffed.
name: Daro
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Transporter Skill

lore: Klingon field scientist serving under Governor Kor. In 2267, helped establish the Klingon command center on Organia.
name: Daval
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Computer Skill

lore: Reckless hunter who tired of participating in holographic scenarios aboard the commandeered Voyager. Joined Turanj in hunting prey, against express orders from Karr.
name: Davar
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Biology Treachery

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Imperial Romulan Warbird. A massive ship significantly larger than a Galaxy class starship.
name: D'deridex
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; D'deridex Class; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Upgraded by the Tal Shiar near Orias III. Used in Tal Shiar/Obsidian Order attack of the Dominion 2371.
name: D'deridex Advanced
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Representative of Cardassian medical personnel. Assigned to Terok Nor infirmary in 2358. Frequent patron of Quark's bar prior to the 2369 evacuation.
name: Derell
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Anthropology

lore: Representative of maintenance workers assigned to Avery III. Alien prisoners made to assist him often wish they had instead been put to work digging tunnels.
name: Dilanum
text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Treachery

lore: Male trained in Klingon anatomy and medicine. Studied the effects of Tribbles on the Klingon nervous system.
name: Divok
text: MEDICAL Biology Youth

characteristicsKeywords: D'Kora-class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Ferengi military vessel. Standard D'Kora spaceframe optimized for battle readiness. Most DaiMons enjoy the raw power but lament the minimal cargo space.
name: D'Kora Marauder
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: D'Kora-class; Ferengi ship; Tractor Beam; Transport;
lore: Ferengi trade vessel. Same spaceframe as the D'Kora-class marauder, but has a smaller crew complement and devotes far more internal volume to cargo capacity.
name: D'Kora Transport
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Battleship; Dominion ship; Holodeck; Invasive Transporters; Jem'Hadar Ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Massive Jem'Hadar battleship developed during the Alpha Quadrant war. One easily withstood an ill-conceived attack by the U.S.S. Valiant in 2374.
name: Dominion Battleship
text: Holodeck, Invasive Transporters, Tractor Beam

lore: Typical Hirogen hologram based on information taken from Voyager. His memories of the hunt were transferred to The Doctor in the hopes of gaining his understanding.
name: Doran
text: SECURITY Archaeology Transporter Skill

lore: Typical Hirogen hologram based on information taken from Voyager. His memories of the hunt were transferred to The Doctor in the hopes of gaining his understanding.
name: Doran*
text: SECURITY Archaeology Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Female; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Female Cardassian in the mirror universe. Science officer aboard Terok Nor. Occasionally keeps high-profile visitors under surveillance for the Intendant.
name: Dorza
text: SCIENCE Biology Stellar Cartography

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Representative Ferengi scientist. Helped Lurin invade the U.S.S. Enterprise. Paid more attention to Dr. Crusher's molecular models than to his guard duties.
name: Dr. Borts
text: SCIENCE MEDICAL

lore: Dr. Farek is representative of male Ferengi trained in medicine. Seized control of the D'Kora class Ferengi Marauder, Krayton, in 2366.
name: Dr. Farek
text: MEDICAL Greed

lore: Typical of chief medical officers assigned to starships on short tours of duty. Stationed on Caldik Prime during the accident resulting in Tom Paris' discharge from Starfleet.
name: Dr. Fitzgerald
text: MEDICAL Exobiology

lore: Re-creation who said, "I'm with you every day, Geordi. Every time you look at this engine, you're looking at me. Every time you touch it, it's me."
name: Dr. Leah Brahms
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER

characteristicsKeywords: T'Lani; Harvester Virus-related card; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Male T'Lani. Typical medical technician. Worked on harvester virus elimination project in 2370.
name: Dr. Nydom
text: MEDICAL Biology Honor

lore: Male Bolian. Representative of Starfleet scientists. Molecular archaeologist on sabbatical from Daystrom Institute annex on Galor IV. Friend of Vash.
name: Dr. Royse
text: SCIENCE Archaeology

lore: Planned to ambush U.S.S. Voyager in 2371 in a region filled with subspace vacuoles. A vengeful version of Kes from five years in the future tried to aid his efforts.
name: Drenol
text: OFFICER Treachery Diplomacy Stellar Cartography

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Male; Mission Specialist;
lore: Klingon trained in the field of science. Studied the effects of Berthold rays on plant life. Served aboard the I.K.C. Pagh.
name: Dukath
text: SCIENCE Archaeology

lore: Sixth. Typical Jem'Hadar alpha. Served under Kudak'Etan. Assisted with repairs to U.S.S. Defiant captured by his away team in 2374.
name: Duran'Adar
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Geology Physics

lore: Typical of mid-23rd century Romulan medical staff. Authored several papers studying the effects of cloaking fields and other technology on Romulan physiology.
name: D'vano
text: MEDICAL Computer Skill Transporter Skill Biology

lore: Typical graduate of Romulan Astrophysical Academy. Research assistant to Dr. Telek R'Mor during the doctor's last year at the academy.
name: D'Vin
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Navigation Youth

lore: Generic interactive Emergency Medical Hologram. Programmed by Dr. Zimmerman. For short-term use.
name: E.M.H. Program
text: MEDICAL May download from hand (suspending play) to your ship or outpost.

lore: Emergency Medical Hologram. More sophisticated - and more eccentric - than the earlier Mark I version.
name: E.M.H.-Mark II
text: MEDICAL Biology OR Exobiology (may use only one per turn). May report aboard {U.S.S. Prometheus} (for free). One per ship or outpost.

lore: Representative of Jem'Hadar assigned to guard Dominion operations on Cardassia Prime. Fourth. Bred in the Alpha Quadrant.
name: Edan'Atal
text: SECURITY Astrophysics ENGINEER Honor

lore: Identification: ANNEXATION DRONE Task: Facilitate assimilation of enemy vessels. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eight of Eighteen
text: Transporter Skill Computer Skill SECURITY Where present, allows your transporters to beam through opponent's SHIELDS.

lore: Identification: ANTITOXIN DRONE Task: Analyze biological and chemical weapons. Adapt. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eight of Fifteen
text: MEDICAL Exobiology May download {Borg Nanoprobes} in place of your normal card play.

lore: Identification: ASSAULT DRONE Task: Supply enhanced combat apparatus. Patrol. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid
name: Eight of Nineteen
text: SECURITY Where present, your Borg are each STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Identification: ASTROGATION DRONE Task: Calibrate warp matrix. Increase efficiency. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
name: Eighteen of Nineteen
text: Navigation Computer Skill While on your ship, RANGE is +1. (Cumulative.)

lore: Identification: AUGMENTATION DRONE Task: Equip drones with cybernetic components. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eleven of Eighteen
text: Where present, your {Implant} cards play for free and may be "reabsorbed" (placed beneath draw deck) if discarded. Cybernetics MEDICAL

lore: Identification: BIO-MED DRONE Task: Reabsorb damaged biological components. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eleven of Nineteen
text: Once every turn where present, may "reabsorb" (place beneath draw deck) another of your Borg just killed. Biology MEDICAL

lore: Identification: COMPLINK DRONE Task: Ensure network data continuity. Augment. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eleven of Seventeen
text: May seed (limit one) face up at your outpost. Computer Skill SCIENCE Nullifies all {Computer Crash} cards in play.

lore: Identification: CONNECTIVITY DRONE Task: Monitor interlink aboard Borg vessels. Maintain. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eleven of Twelve
text: Computer Skill ENGINEER Biology May download {Borg Vinculum} here in place of a card draw. DL/ {Borg Data Node}

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Energy Dampener; Invasive Transporters; Jem'hadar Attack Ship; Jem'Hadar Ship;
lore: Jem'Hadar attack ship constructed in Alpha Quadrant. One of the first Dominion fighter craft upgraded with Breen energy-dampening technology in 2375.
name: Enhanced Attack Ship
text: Energy Dampener, Invasive Transporters

lore: Security guard aboard I.S.S. Enterprise. Easily dispatched by Dr. McCoy and Mr. Scott with the old "you distract him, I'll hit him with the hypo" trick.
name: Ensign Davis
text: SECURITY Treachery

lore: Dedicated crewman aboard I.S.S. Enterprise. Abandoned a promising career in the sciences for the greater advancement opportunities in security.
name: Ensign Gaffney
text: SECURITY Geology Astrophysics

lore: Duplicitous female agent. First Vorta to contact the Federation. Posed as an oppressed fugitive in order to win sympathy - and opportunities for espionage.
name: Eris
text: V.I.P. Treachery Diplomacy MEDICAL

lore: Conduct negotiations to establish peaceful rapport and cultural exchange.
name: Establish Relations
text: Diplomacy + INTEGRITY>32 + (Leadership OR V.I.P.) When you solve, you may download a [Non] personnel here.

lore: Sentient artificial life-form incorporating an advanced microreplication system. Specializes in repair tasks. Servomechanism designed by Dr. Farallon.
name: Exocomp
text: ENGINEER If aboard ship, can repair damage in two of your full turns, without returning to outpost.

lore: Gather data on newly encountered phenomenon.
name: Explore Interstellar Matter
text: SCIENCE + (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) Your {Subspace Warp Rift} and {Tetryon Field} play for free here. Opponent's side: Opponent's {Calamarain} plays at this mission (or a copy).

lore: Re-creation of mythical Klingon beast. Guardian of Gre'thor, where the dishonored go to die.
name: Fek'lhr
text: V.I.P. Honor Treachery

lore: Common shuttlecraft of Ferengi design. Dr. Arridor commanded one.
name: Ferengi Shuttle

lore: Identification: COUNTERMEASURE DRONE Task: Nullify resistance to scout operations. Biological Distinctiveness: Klingon species.
name: Fifteen of Seventeen
text: ENGINEER Exobiology May download any one {Adapt} card in place of one card draw.

lore: Identification: CYBER DRONE Task: Analyze suspended animation principles. Biological Distinctiveness: Klingon species.
name: Five of Eleven
text: SCIENCE Cybernetics Wherever [Com] Borg present in the same hive, may prevent your Borg from being placed in stasis.

lore: Scout ship of Flaxian registry. Retaya commanded one in 2371 during a Tal Shiar assignment to assassinate Garak.
name: Flaxian Scout Vessel

lore: Female member of the Dominion. Changeling. Characteristic of the members of the Great Link. Adept at mimicking the solids.
name: Founder
text: V.I.P. SCIENCE Exobiology May morph (exchange with your Founder in hand).

lore: Identification: GUARD DRONE Task: Compute defense effectiveness. Maximize. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Four of Eleven
text: MEDICAL Computer Skill While on your ship, SHIELDS are +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Typical Ferengi waiter. Serves his employers as well as can be expected for a young, impatient, aspiring opportunist.
name: Frool
reports: Tower of Commerce, Ferengi Trading Post
text: CIVILIAN Greed Youth Reports for free to {Ferengi Trading Post}.

lore: Romulan officer representative of those serving the Romulan Star Empire. Pursuer of DNA program in 2369.
name: Galathon
text: OFFICER Archaeology Greed Treachery

lore: Military spacecraft used by the Cardassian Union. The Type-3 Galor-class warship is the backbone of the Cardassian fleet.
name: Galor
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Typical member of Shakaar resistance cell. Cared for the mortally wounded Kira Taban. Now a part of Kira Nerys' memories of her father's death.
name: Gantt
text: MEDICAL Resistance Anthropology Youth

lore: Because of their cloaking technology and precise strategic planning, re-creations of Romulans were often used by the Hirogen in ship-to-ship hunting simulations.
name: Garren
text: SCIENCE Geology Navigation

lore: Because of their cloaking technology and precise strategic planning, re-creations of Romulans were often used by the Hirogen in ship-to-ship hunting simulations.
name: Garren*
text: SCIENCE Geology Navigation

lore: Typical high-ranking officer in Bajoran militia. Familiar with Bajoran defense technology. Issued the order to refuse landing privileges to Skrreean ships in 2370.
name: General Hazar
text: OFFICER Leadership Astrophysics If aboard {Assault Vessel}, its {Tactical Console} is +1.

lore: Assess value of rich mineral deposits on planet near edge of explored space.
name: Geological Survey
text: SCIENCE + Geology + Computer Skill * +10 if 3 Geology OR 3 Greed present.

lore: Male Cardassian characteristic of medical personnel in military service. Treated survivors of Klingon attack on Cardassia Prime in 2372.
name: Ghoren
text: MEDICAL Biology Music Geology

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Ensign Gibson served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise as helm specialist during the 2364 diplomatic mission to Daled IV.
name: Gibson
text: OFFICER Navigation x 2

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Ensign Giusti is representative of staff officers in Starfleet. Served at the Ops console aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370.
name: Giusti
text: OFFICER Youth

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; High Council; Male; Mission Specialist;
lore: Klingon trained in the field of security. Guarded the Klingon High Council chamber in the year of Maktag. Served as security chief for the Hegh'bat division.
name: Gorath
text: SECURITY Honor

lore: Representative security officer serving in the Romulan military, circa 2268. One of two men sent to starship Enterprise in exchange for Captain Kirk and Mr. Spock.
name: Gorrus
text: SECURITY Navigation

lore: Male of Dopterian race. Representative of non-aligned agents. An opportunist. Had an encounter with the sisters of Duras in 2370.
name: Gorta
text: ENGINEER Physics Greed

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Representative of Starfleet engineers stationed aboard Deep Space 9. Assisted Miles O'Brien during repair and retrofit of the station.
name: Graham Davis
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill

name: Guest Quarters
text: If unoccupied, any non-Borg V.I.P. may report here regardless of affiliation. Once each turn, any player who has a V.I.P. unopposed here may, in place of one card draw, draw two cards and place one of them beneath draw deck. (Not cumulative.) Any Nor: Habitat Ring

lore: Typical Jem'Hadar navigator. Fifth under Omet'iklan. Responsible for safeguarding devices assigned to his unit.
name: Gurat'urak
text: SECURITY Navigation Transporter Skill Protects one card present from {Disruptor Overload}.

lore: Kazon-Nistrim representative of technicians in Culluh's crew. Gained knowledge of bio-neural technology in his time aboard the commandeered U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Halok
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Biology DL/ Any ENGINEER-related Equipment card

lore: Representative of the Hirogen's holographic prey. The Cardassians' deceptive nature - and unpredictability when cornered - made them a worthy challenge.
name: Harath
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Computer Skill

lore: Representative of the Hirogen's holographic prey. The Cardassians' deceptive nature - and unpredictability when cornered - made them a worthy challenge.
name: Harath*
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Computer Skill

lore: Typical mentor of fledgling hunters. Stationed at the training facility near the Ovion system. Prepares young Hirogen to join Decaren's hunting group.
name: Harkan
text: SECURITY Anthropology Exobiology

lore: First officer of the Excelsior in 2285. Called to stand in for the helmsman, who was on leave when Admiral Kirk stole the Enterprise from spacedock.
name: Henreid
text: OFFICER Leadership Astrophysics Navigation

lore: For 100,000 years, the nomadic Hirogen have hunted prey, establishing outposts throughout their territory.
name: Hirogen Outpost
text: Seed one at a [HIR] mission or any [S] mission with no affiliation icons OR build at such a mission where you have a Hirogen ENGINEER. Has a Holodeck. DL/ {Hirogen Hunt}

lore: Maquis crewman who thought briefly of rebelling against Captain Janeway after a close friend's death in 2372. Ultimately found his place in the Voyager crew.
name: Hogan
text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill

lore: Maquis crewman who thought briefly of rebelling against Captain Janeway after a close friend's death in 2372. Ultimately found his place in the Voyager crew.
name: Hogan*
text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Dissident; Male;
lore: Student of Natima Lang. Dissident. Member of Cardassian underground sentenced to death by Central Command. Sought refuge at Deep Space 9.
name: Hogue
text: CIVILIAN Youth SCIENCE Navigation Honor

name: Holosuite
text: This site must be placed adjacent to {Quark's Bar} (or another Holosuite). Has a Holodeck. {Holoprogram} cards may be played here (limit one; station controller may discard it during their turn). [Holo] Equipment cards and compatible [Holo] personnel may report here, and may be transferred directly to/from owner's ship docked at this station. {Terok Nor} OR {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

lore: Representative of technicians serving the Vidiian Sodality. Posted to the Avery III installation. Confident in the sophistication of his data encryption routines.
name: Hophalin
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Archaeology Physics Treachery

lore: Small ship usually manned by a hunting pair. Often travels in groups like that which subdued Voyager in 2374. Its monotanium armor scatters enemy targeting scanners.
name: Hunting Vessel
text: X=7+ number of your other staffed [Hir] ships here. Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: NX-74205. Built to battle Borg. Recommissioned to oppose the Dominion. First ship to test ablative armor and quantum torpedoes. Captained by Benjamin Sisko.
name: U.S.S. Defiant
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods)

lore: With a single thought, Kevin Uxbridge killed the entire Husnock race (50 billion lives) everywhere in the universe. Their powerful ships remain.
name: Husnock Ship
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Though the basic form of the Klingon cruiser had been the same since the 22nd century, this design introduced in the 2270s boasted upgrades to all major systems.
name: I.K.C. K't'inga
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Univ] Klingon [Films] personnel}

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Class of ships identical in configuration to the classic B'rel class Klingon Bird-of-Prey, although much larger.
name: I.K.C. K'Vort
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Large attack cruiser. The modern mainstay of the Klingon Defense Force.
name: I.K.C. Vor'Cha
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Typical battle cruiser of the Terran Empire. Outfitted for a variety of mission profiles, including conquest, domination, subjugation, and Imperial enforcement.
name: I.S.S. Constitution
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Univ] [TE][OS] personnel}

lore: Unify diverse nation-states via coercion and occupation.
name: Impose Order
text: Diplomacy + Treachery + STRENGTH>40 * Unopposed OFFICER on planet may steal points.

lore: Typical diagnostic engineer on U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Assistant to Paul Porter. Female seismologist from Tycho City, Lunar Colony.
name: Inge Eiger
text: ENGINEER Geology

lore: Typical male Dosi. Violent and impatient negotiator. Threatened to kill Quark because of the Ferengi's annoying tenacity.
name: Inglatu
text: CIVILIAN Greed Acquisition MEDICAL Geology

affiliation: Any crew may attempt mission. Your {Salvage Starship} objective may target this location.
lore: Investigate reports of Borg presence in this sector.
name: Investigate Incursion
text: SECURITY + ({Shelby} OR Leadership + OFFICER x2) X=30 (45 if [Bor] or [BO] card or {Borg Ship} dilemma here). Opponent's side: Your Borg ships may report with crew here.  Points: [30]

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Nurse; Support Personnel;
lore: Bajoran nurse representative of medical assistants on Deep Space 9. Helped Dr. Julian Bashir extend the life of Bareil Antos in 2371.
name: Jabara
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Youth

lore: Representative of first officers serving in Starfleet. Assigned to the U.S.S. Odyssey. Courageously fought against the Jem'Hadar in 2370.
name: Jace Michaels
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Physics Honor

lore: Member of the medical staff aboard the Enterprise, serving under Doctors McCoy and Chapel. Specialist in microcellular biology.
name: Jacobson
text: MEDICAL Biology Honor

characteristicsKeywords: Humanoid; Captain; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
lore: Male humanoid. Typical transport captain operating around Deep Space 9. Attempted to violate the aphasia virus quarantine issued in 2369.
name: Jaheel
text: CIVILIAN Navigation Computer Skill SCIENCE

lore: Romulan trained in the field of security. A former member of the Tal Shiar intelligence service.
name: Jaron
text: SECURITY Geology Youth

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Gul; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Representative Gul in the Seventh Order. In 2369, unsuccessfully attempted to reclaim Deep Space 9 for the Cardassian Union.
name: Jasad
text: OFFICER Physics Stellar Cartography

lore: One of many Bajoran nationals living aboard Terok Nor. The Intendant, quite a fan of his talents, often invites him to perform at special functions.
name: Javek Len
text: CIVILIAN Music SCIENCE Astrophysics

lore: Klingon trained in the field of science. Smuggled Federation secrets to the Romulans in the form of amino acid codes.
name: J'Ddan
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Treachery

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'hadar Attack Ship; Jem'Hadar Ship;
lore: Nimble attack fighter used by the Dominion. Has ion propulsion drive and ventral impellers. Virtual display technology. Polaron beam weapons.
name: Jem'Hadar Attack Ship
text: May avoid being targeted by {Establish Tractor Lock}. Invasive Transporters

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'Hadar Ship; Tractor Beam; Warship;
lore: Mainstay battle cruiser of the Jem'Hadar fleets. Capable of serving as a mobile base for attack ships. Equipped with shield-penetrating transporters.
name: Jem'Hadar Warship
text: Invasive Transporters, Tractor Beam

lore: Representative of young Romulan scientists trained in frontier exploration. Cited for his work exploring uninhabited planets.
name: Jenok
text: SCIENCE Geology Exobiology Youth

lore: Re-creation of a female Romulan. Alien entity assumed this body in 2369.
name: Jera
text: MEDICAL Biology Youth

lore: Hunter ordered by Karr to assist in triage on Voyager crew members wounded on the holodeck. Like Jorik, performed cursorily at best.
name: Jetarn
text: SECURITY MEDICAL Computer Skill

lore: Representative of staff in engineering. Has a wife and two sons. Is building a model of U.S.S. Voyager. Doubts he'll finish before the real one returns home.
name: Joseph Carey
text: ENGINEER Physics

lore: Representative of the brave security personnel in Starfleet. Ensign Travis stood his ground against Borg intruders at defensive checkpoint 3 on deck 4.
name: Joseph Travis
text: SECURITY Honor Youth

lore: Typical Cardassian officer. Proud, dedicated and constantly seeking to advance his rank. Posted to Cardassian Central Command in 2370.
name: Jural
text: OFFICER Astrophysics SCIENCE

lore: Longtime Maquis member. Helped Thomas Riker commandeer the U.S.S. Defiant. Helped Ro Laren steal medical supplies from the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Kalita
text: OFFICER Anthropology Computer Skill Navigation

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: One of the Bajoran deputies serving on Deep Space 9. During Cardassian occupation, helped chart Badlands and served as pilot on raids against Cardassian forces.
name: Kallis Ven
text: SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill

lore: Typical crewman of I.K.C. Voq'leng. Has low regard for Kohlar. Eagerly aided T'Greth's bid to seize a new ship after the captain foolishly destroyed their battle cruiser.
name: Kamok
text: SECURITY Computer Skill

lore: The Karemma conduct trade operations for the Dominion. Their vessels can be found throughout the Gamma Quadrant. Hanok commanded one.
name: Karemman Vessel
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel;
lore: Starfleet psychiatrist representative of Federation medical personnel. Came to Deep Space 9 in 2374 with a group of genetically engineered misfits.
name: Karen Loews
text: MEDICAL Biology Anthropology

lore: One of the secondary bridge officers on I.K.C. Voq'leng. Has already begun training his successor; the Nehret has been known to claim his family quickly.
name: Kar'meth
text: SCIENCE Biology Stellar Cartography

lore: Science officer aboard the I.K.C. Amar. Tried to analyze the sensor data from the intruder V'Ger. Unfortunately, his expertise was in the planetary sciences.
name: Karnog
text: SCIENCE Geology

lore: Small fighter based on the same design as the larger Raider. Karden commanded one when battling to earn his name.
name: Kazon Fighter
text: May report for free aboard your {Kazon Raider} if no ships aboard. DL/ {Blue Alert}

lore: Since losing its homeworld, the Kazon Collective raids others, establishing outposts throughout its territory.
name: Kazon Outpost
text: Seed one at a [KAZ] or [NON] mission OR build at such a mission where you have a Kazon ENGINEER. Has no transporters. DL/ {The Kazon Collective}

lore: Ship design stolen when the Trabe were overthrown in 2346. Favored by sects with more limited resources.
name: Kazon Raider
text: Kazon shuttlecraft may report, be carried, and launch aboard. Tractor Beam

lore: Kazon shuttlecraft. Equipped with bow modifications designed to puncture a starship hull.
name: Kazon Shuttle
text: Once each turn, may take off or land. DL/ {Boarding Party}

lore: Enormous Kazon vessel used as a mobile base of operations. Dwarfs even D'deridex-class ships.
name: Kazon Warship
text: [Univ] [Kaz] ships (except Warships) may be carried and launched aboard. Tractor Beam

lore: William Riker, vested with the powers of Q, created an "ideal mate" for Lieutenant Worf.
name: K'chiQ
text: CIVILIAN When reporting for duty, select any skill. May change that skill at the start of each of your turns.

lore: Typical leader of Bajoran colonists who fled Bajor during the Cardassian occupation. Resides on Valo II. Helped Jean-Luc Picard locate the terrorist Orta.
name: Keeve Falor
text: V.I.P. Leadership Biology Honor Your [Baj] CIVILIANs present are attributes all +2.

lore: Cardassian warship. More powerful than Galor-class spacecraft. Design commissioned by the Central Command after war with Federation in 2366.
name: Keldon
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian ship; Cloaking Device; Keldon Class; Tractor Beam;
lore: Faster than standard Keldon-class vessels. Secretly upgraded by Obsidian Order. Staged in Orias System.
name: Keldon Advanced
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Klingon soldier reporting to Governor Kor. Stationed on planet Organia in 2267. On Kor's orders, helped round up Organian citizens for execution.
name: Kered
text: SECURITY MEDICAL Archaeology

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Male; Mission Specialist;
lore: Second Officer Klag, of the I.K.C. Pagh, is representative of Klingon warriors throughout the Klingon Empire.
name: Klag
text: OFFICER Navigation

lore: Klingon trained in the specific field of security. Guarded the House of K'mpec when K'mpec was poisoned in 2367.
name: Kle'eg
text: SECURITY Honor

lore: In the mirror universe, the Klingon Empire is a member of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. The Alliance establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Klingon Empire Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a [KCA] ENGINEER.

lore: Typical chief surgeon of a K't'inga-class ship. Friend of Krase. Strongly opinionated, he often provided his captain with advice, whether asked to or not.
name: Komal
text: MEDICAL Biology Archaeology Honor

lore: Representative of headstrong hunters. Once punished by Netek with months of remedial training. Never believed holograms to be worthy prey.
name: Konuric
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Geology

lore: Typical bodyguard of the High Council leader. Lost an arm defending Gorkon. Refused prosthetic replacement to give his appearance at the assassins' trial greater impact.
name: Kor'choth
text: SECURITY Leadership Honor Transporter Skill

lore: Fifth. Representative of Jem'Hadar soldiers serving under Goran'Agar. Escorted Federation prisoners taken captive on Bopak III.
name: Koret'alak
text: SECURITY Physics Stellar Cartography

lore: Typical section head in Regent Worf's crew. Frequent target of the Regent's temperamental outbursts. Finds being a bridge officer to be a mixed blessing.
name: Korvek
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Archaeology

lore: Klingon trained in the field of engineering. Reputed to have consumed fifteen rokeg blood pies at one sitting.
name: Kromm
text: ENGINEER Physics

lore: Typical Nausicaan bodyguard. Protects FCA Liquidator Brunt. Doesn't mind working for Ferengi cowards as long as the money is good.
name: Krozh
text: SECURITY Navigation Treachery Guramba May report where you have FCA present.

lore: Transporter technician under the command of Lurin. Guarded a U.S.S. Enterprise transporter room during his DaiMon's unsuccessful takeover attempt.
name: Krunk
text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill

lore: Re-creation who assisted in the Age of Ascension ritual. Perfected current pain-stick design for ritual use.
name: K'Tesh
text: ENGINEER Stellar Cartography

lore: Breen soldier. One of Thot Gor's bodyguards. Secretly questions the advisability of the Dominion/Breen Alliance. As cold as a winter on his home planet.
name: Lam
text: SECURITY Anthropology Computer Skill

lore: Typical first officer in the Ferengi Alliance. Serves under Taar. Tried to find favor with Portal 63 on an ancient Tkon planet.
name: Letek
text: OFFICER Treachery Geology MEDICAL May nullify {Ferengi Attack} at this location.

lore: Typical Jem'Hadar soldier. Reports to Remata'Klan. Demoted to Sixth for firing his weapon against orders.
name: Limara'Son
text: SECURITY Astrophysics Navigation

lore: Lieutenant Linda Larson is representative of staff engineers serving in Starfleet.
name: Linda Larson
text: ENGINEER Youth

lore: Ambassador Lojal is typical of Vulcans dispatched to represent the Federation. Agreed to recommended Julian Bashir for a commendation in 2369.
name: Lojal
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Mindmeld Anthropology Navigation

lore: Conservative helmsman of the Starship Excelsior. Serves adequately in the position, but is less knowledgeable about the ship and its limitations than Captain Sulu.
name: Lojur
text: OFFICER Navigation Transporter Skill

lore: The Lokirrim, at war with photonic insurgents, forbid the use of holograms in their space. Their ships can emit a disruption field that decompiles holographic matrices.
name: Lokirrim Vessel
text: Tractor Beam All [Holo] cards here are deactivated.

lore: Female Klingon representative of medical assistants throughout the Alliance. Sees very few patients, but has assisted in countless interrogations and autopsies.
name: Loreva
text: MEDICAL Exobiology

lore: Typical Vidiian researcher of astronomical and planetary sciences. Has a cardiovascular system highly susceptible to the phage. Has had 17 heart replacement surgeries.
name: Losarus
text: SCIENCE Geology Astrophysics Stellar Cartography

lore: Typical security officer aboard the starship Enterprise. Eager to join the landing party to Capella IV, which he hopes will be the first of many such assignments.
name: Lt. Grant
text: SECURITY May replace your [OS] personnel present who was just randomly selected to die. Honor

lore: Representative of relief officers serving on Federation starships. Such officers routinely fill in for crewmembers on shore leave or restricted duty.
name: Lt. Palmer
text: ENGINEER Anthropology Computer Skill

lore: Sixth. Typical Jem'Hadar guard and soldier. Assigned to station Terok Nor recently liberated by Dominion and Cardassian forces. Posted to security section.
name: Makla'Gor
text: SECURITY Astrophysics Exobiology Honor

lore: Typical chief of security for large Vidiian bases. Head of perimeter defense for the Avery III installation. Captured Tom Paris, B'Elanna Torres, and Peter Durst in 2371.
name: Maleth
text: SECURITY Leadership Physics Transporter Skill Opposing personnel are STRENGTH -1 where present.

lore: Typical of warriors loyal to the Kazon-Nistrim sect. Supervised repairs to U.S.S. Voyager after its capture in 2372. Resents Seska's hold over Culluh.
name: Maniz
text: OFFICER Archaeology Navigation Leadership

lore: Terran rebel who faithfully followed Mr. Sisko for many years. Lost an eye in a dangerous stunt.
name: Marauder
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Exobiology

lore: Typical of Maquis who initially had difficulty fitting in aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Her home colony was ceded to Cardassia in the formation of the Demilitarized Zone.
name: Mariah Henley
text: OFFICER Geology Computer Skill

lore: Typical of Maquis who initially had difficulty fitting in aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Her home colony was ceded to Cardassia in the formation of the Demilitarized Zone.
name: Mariah Henley*
text: OFFICER Geology Computer Skill

lore: Communications officer, fully rated on Excelsior-class ships. Linguistics expert who has authored an analysis on similarities of the Vulcan and Romulan languages.
name: Mark Tobiaston
text: ENGINEER Anthropology Exobiology

lore: Survey remote region; seek out new life and new civilizations to exploit.
name: Market Research
text: Greed x2 + Acquisition + Anthropology + Stellar Cartography + CUNNING>35

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: Specimen of late 20th-century genetic engineering, sworn to live and die at Khan's command. Studied the effects of the Ceti Eel while trapped on Ceti Alpha V.
name: Mas'ud
reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
text: CIVILIAN May download {Ceti Eel} to place directly on adversary he just stunned. Biology SCIENCE Geology

lore: Ensign McKnight is one of many helm officers serving aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Distant relative of a famous 20th century game designer.
name: McKnight
text: OFFICER Navigation Youth Music

characteristicsKeywords: Benzite; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Ensign Mendon is a Benzite male representative of science specialists within Starfleet. Served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2365. Looks like Mordock.
name: Mendon
text: SCIENCE Physics

lore: Little-known ship. Difficult to track due to a unique hull design that renders it invisible to long-range scans. Baran captained one in 2370.
name: Mercenary Ship
text: Long-Range Scan Shielding

lore: Conduct flagship efficiency drills in remote sector of Alpha Quadrant.
name: Military Exercises
text: SECURITY + Leadership + CUNNING>28 + ship with two or more staffing icons

lore: Large, moderately armed freighter vessel. Used by the Cardassian military to ferry troops and maintain supply lines.
name: Military Freighter
text: Tractor Beam

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Survey planetoid with minimal atmosphere to determine value of mineral deposits.
name: Mineral Survey
text: Geology + SCIENCE + CUNNING>28 When you solve, draw up to two cards.

lore: Typical member of the Chamber of Ministers. Has background in the sciences. Led Bajoran delegates in talks with Skrreean refugees.
name: Minister Rozahn
text: V.I.P. Leadership Stellar Cartography SCIENCE

lore: Representative of Miradorn vessels. Alternately commanded by Ah-Kel and Ro-Kel. Hull design impervious to most scans.
name: Miradorn Raider
text: Long-Range Scan Shielding

lore: Typical Ferengi shuttle in the mirror universe. Used by agents working for the Alliance or the Rebellion - or both. Mr. Brunt commanded one.
name: Mirror Ferengi Shuttle
text: Your [MQ] Ferengi and {Ezri} may report aboard (if {Mr. Brunt}, reports for free).

lore: Representative of Romulan security personnel. Specializes in biohazard detection. In 2372, helped search the Romulan fleet for Dominion infiltration.
name: Mopak
text: SECURITY Biology

lore: Security officer assigned to Taar's marauder. Member of Letek's away team to Portal 63's planet.
name: Mordoc
text: SECURITY Astrophysics

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Former Terran slave on Terok Nor in the mirror universe. Liberated when the Rebellion seized control in 2372.
name: Mr. Andrews
text: CIVILIAN Biology MEDICAL

lore: Commanded a Vidiian Cruiser. Attempted to harvest organs from the U.S.S. Voyager crew in 2372. Dozens like him are on the same single-minded mission.
name: Nadirum
text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Navigation DL/ {Organ Theft}

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Astrophysicist. Characteristic of Bajoran scientists now free of Cardassian rule. Had a brief encounter with Jem'Hadar on Deep Space 9 in 2371.
name: Nalan Bal
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Navigation

characteristicsKeywords: Male; Mission Specialist; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: Representative of male mercenaries operating throughout the galaxy. Worked with Baran to find the Stone of Gol.
name: Narik
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill

lore: Loyal Kazon-Nistrim typical of Culluh's soldiers. Stood proudly with his maje as a bridge officer on the captured U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Narret
text: SCIENCE Honor Computer Skill Stellar Cartography

lore: Typical Ferengi entrepreneur. Took over the Arcybite gouge-mining refineries in the Clarius system. Plans to introduce synthehol to the Gamma Quadrant.
name: Nava
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Geology SCIENCE Anthropology

lore: Representative of security personnel in the Romulan Star Empire. His detachment accompanied Senator Vreenak to Deep Space 9 in 2374.
name: Navok
text: SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill Attributes all +2 if with your Romulan V.I.P.

lore: The McAllister C-5, near Minos Korva and the Cardassian border, is representative of nebulae in the Alpha Quadrant.
name: Nebula
text: {Scan} must be played to initiate battle here. Face next dilemma here when opponent scores points.

lore: Trade center for mining and commercial vessels. Located on the border of the Nekrit Expanse.
name: Nekrit Supply Depot
text: Seed one at any mission that is in (or adjacent to) the Nekrit Expanse Region OR build at such a mission where you have a Non-Aligned [DQ] ENGINEER.

lore: Typical of young Klingons serving the Empire. Daughter of Tse'Dek. Assigned to tactical/weapons station on I.K.C. Rotarran by General Martok.
name: N'Garen
text: SECURITY Astrophysics SCIENCE Youth

lore: Typical member of Ferengi Commerce Authority. One of 432 FCA commissioners. Chairman of Slug-o-Cola, "the slimiest cola in the galaxy." Lusts after Lumba.
name: Nilva
text: V.I.P. Greed Leadership FCA Biology

lore: Identification: INTERLINK DRONE Task: Expedite aptitude dissemination. Enhance. Biological Distinctiveness: Cardassian species.
name: Nine of Eleven
text: Allows all Borg in this hive present with a [Com] Borg to share skills. Each such Borg has every shared skill at its highest level.

lore: Identification: ISOTOPE DRONE Task: Study Particle 010. Disseminate findings. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Nine of Fifteen
text: SCIENCE Physics Astrophysics If you have completed {Harness Particle 010}, all your Borg in play are each attributes all +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Identification: MULTIPLEXOR DRONE Task: Monitor multiple threat acquisition. Target. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
name: Nine of Seventeen
text: When on your ship during battle, that ship may use total WEAPONS against X different targets, where X=number of [Def] Borg aboard.

lore: Identification: NETWORK DRONE Task: Accelerate construction of transwarp gateways. Biological Distinctiveness: Bolian species.
name: Nine of Twelve
text: ENGINEER Physics Navigation If present where probing for {Establish Gateway}, once each turn, you may discard probe card to probe again.

lore: Representative of Vidiian general medical practitioners. Chose to enter military service rather than pledge himself as honatta to a single individual.
name: Nirata
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Jem'Hadar; Capturing-related card; Internment Camp 371-related personnel; Male;
lore: Fifth under Ikat'ika. Guard at Internment Camp 371. Representative of Jem'Hadar assigned to guard and escort Dominion prisoners.
name: Oken'alak
text: SECURITY Exobiology Computer Skill DL/ {Prisoner Escort}

lore: Identification: PROCUREMENT DRONE Task: Add technological distinctiveness to collective. Biological Distinctiveness: Bolian species.
name: One of Eleven
text: May "steal" unattended Equipment cards present. May download any one [BO] Equipment card in place of one card draw. ENGINEER

lore: Typical male Karemma official. Broker of tulaberry wine for the Dominion. Well versed in valuable metals. One-time business partner of Quark.
name: Ornithar
text: CIVILIAN Greed SCIENCE Geology

lore: Male representative of Klaestron engineers. Associate of Ilon Tandro. Aided in attempted kidnapping of Jadzia Dax in 2369.
name: Orren Ran
text: CIVILIAN Geology ENGINEER

lore: Romulan trained in the field of engineering. A specialist in artificial quantum singularity. Served aboard the Khazara in 2369.
name: Palteth
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill

lore: Son'a female. Chief science officer of the Li'seria. Part of the team that perfected mass production of ketracel-white for trade with the Dominion.
name: Pa'rena
text: SCIENCE Physics Exobiology Your {Ketracel-White} may report here, for free.

lore: Legate. Member of Central Command. Tried to conceal Cardassian effort to supply weapons to Demilitarized Zone colonists in 2370.
name: Parn
text: V.I.P. Treachery Archaeology Diplomacy

lore: Prevent incursions along border of Federation/Romulan Neutral Zone.
name: Patrol Neutral Zone
text: Leadership + No opposing ships in Neutral Zone X = number of Neutral Zone locations in play.

lore: Common patrol vessel of the Cardassian Union. Uses the same hull as the Cardassian shuttlecraft, but boasts a much higher performance profile.
name: Patrol Ship
text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

lore: A highly regarded risk-taker. Captained the U.S.S. Drake, lost at Minos in 2364. Former classmate of William Riker. Re-created by the Arsenal of Freedom.
name: Paul Rice
text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Nullifies one {Echo Papa 607} where present.

lore: Talaxian commander of a squadron garrisoned at the mining colony on Prema II. Tom Paris enlisted his help to reclaim Voyager from the Kazon-Nistrim in 2373.
name: Paxim
text: OFFICER Navigation Astrophysics Exobiology

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Stellar cartographer characteristic of Starfleet science personnel. Served aboard Deep Space 9 in 2372. Studied effects of the wormhole on the Denorios Belt.
name: Paxton Reese
text: SCIENCE Navigation Stellar Cartography

lore: Characteristic of Cardassian security personnel. Helped provide protection for Detapa Council prior to its 2372 evacuation from Cardassia Prime.
name: Perak
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Greed Treachery

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Investigate unsurveyed habitable planet with nitrogen-oxygen atmosphere.
name: Planet
text: Landed ship + (Geology OR Greed)

lore: Representative DaiMon in the Ferengi Alliance. In exchange for repairs to his ship, provided sensor log readings on missing U.S.S. Flemming to Jean-Luc Picard.
name: Prak
text: OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography

lore: Standard Automated Personnel Unit built by the Pralor. Its creators were annihilated when they tried to shut the androids down after reaching peace with the Cravic.
name: Pralor Unit 6263
text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Navigation

lore: Part of the large armada left behind by the now-extinct Pralor. Commanded by Pralor Unit 6263.
name: Pralor Warship
text: Tractor Beam Your {Pralor Unit}s may report aboard.

lore: Representative of Bajoran Prylars. Interested in science. Escorted Benjamin Sisko to see Kai Opaka in 2369.
name: Prylar Mond
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Exobiology

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Assistant to Par Lenor. Sneaked into a cargo bay on the U.S.S. Enterprise to scan an empathic metamorph. Accidentally triggered premature emergence.
name: Qol
text: SCIENCE Exobiology

lore: Kazon-Nistrim physician. Typical of personal attendants often retained by a first maje. Seska did not find his abilities particularly impressive.
name: Rabek
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Physics

lore: One of the Son'a assigned to the Ba'ku duck blind operation. Has been secretly looking for opportunities to steal technology from the Federation installation.
name: Rae'alin
text: ENGINEER Geology Anthropology Archaeology

lore: Typical of Hirogen whose first loyalty is to a hunting group. Skilled pilot. Served as Beta-Hirogen under Idrin; challenged his obsession with collecting relics.
name: Ranjen
text: ENGINEER Navigation x 2 Physics

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Characteristic of young, eager Bajorans serving on Deep Space 9. Assigned to security detachment under command of Odo.
name: Rano Dake
text: SECURITY Geology Youth

lore: Representative of Bajorans entering science and medical studies after the Cardassian occupation. Serves in the infirmary on Deep Space 9.
name: Rase Norvan
text: MEDICAL Biology Music Youth

lore: Typical male Kressari. Trader of botanical DNA. Aspires to become a weapon supplier.
name: Rax'Na
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Biology Treachery

lore: Interceptor/fighter used by Terran rebels in the mirror universe. Typically stolen from the Bajorans. Smiley enhanced and commanded this one.
name: Rebel Interceptor
text: May take off or land once each turn. X=3 if moving within a region.

lore: Trained medic serving under Kruge. Like most serving aboard smaller Klingon vessels, is more often called upon as a soldier.
name: Regnor
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Anthropology

lore: Young dissident. Forced to flee Cardassia with Natima Lang and Hogue because of her political views. Member of Cardassian underground.
name: Rekelen
text: CIVILIAN Youth Computer Skill Geology

lore: Typical scientist. Ordered to scan the Neutral Zone on stardate 50893. Found 20 particles of space dust per cm , 52 UV radiation spikes, and a class 2 comet.
name: Richard Wilkins
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography

lore: Large-volume ship typically used by various planetary consortiums. Primary energy supply optimized for defensive shielding.
name: Rigelian Freighter
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Representative of females throughout Kazon society. Has few rights, little power. Part of the Ogla sect. One of several women romantically involved with Jabin.
name: Ril
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology MEDICAL Geology

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Captain; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
command: Assault Vessel;Bajoran Freighter;Bajoran Interceptor;Bajoran Scout Vessel;Bajoran Raider;Alliance Interceptor;Bajoran Warship;
lore: Captain of a Bajoran transport that docked at Deep Space 9 in 2369. Commanded all manner of Bajoran vessels during his long and successful career.
name: Rinnak Pire
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Navigation May be matching commander of any [Univ] [Baj] ship.

lore: Female Boslic freighter captain. Delivered the earring of Li Nalas to Quark in 2370. Suspected of trafficking in stolen Falangian diamonds.
name: Rionoj
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Greed Navigation

lore: Typical Romulan scientist. Led team of archaeologists on an unsuccessful mission to locate an Iconian gateway in Romulan territory.
name: R'Mal
text: SCIENCE Archaeology

lore: Typical of personal physicians employed by important Alliance officials. Assigned to the Intendant. Surprised at how frequently she comes in for an exam.
name: Romara Cal
text: MEDICAL Biology Physics

lore: Romulan shuttlecraft. Favored by the Tal Shiar. Senator Vreenak commanded one on his diplomatic mission to Deep Space 9.
name: Romulan Shuttle
text: Cloaking Device

lore: Chief helmsman aboard Regency 1. Survivor of several Badlands expeditions in search of the rebel stronghold - more than any other pilot in the Alliance.
name: Rukor
text: OFFICER Navigation x 2 Astrophysics

lore: Resembles a large shuttle. Contains living accommodations. Modular design can be re-configured for different mission profiles.
name: Runabout

lore: Representative of non-military Kazon. Pledged to the Pommar sect. Bartender and cook at the dive frequented by Tersa. Remembers Neelix's last visit there all too well.
name: Saldin
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill SECURITY Archaeology

lore: Typical Starfleet ensign eagerly chasing a promotion. Served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370. Decent poker player. His grandfather was Canadian.
name: Sam Lavelle
text: OFFICER Navigation Computer Skill DL/ {Lower Decks}

lore: Tactical officer aboard the Li'seria. Among the most far gone of the Son'a - will likely die within a few months unless he receives metaphasic treatment.
name: Sam'po
text: SECURITY Navigation Treachery Stellar Cartography

lore: Ensign Carson is one of the many talented navigators serving Starfleet. Former member of Nova Squadron. Assigned to bridge duty aboard U.S.S. Defiant.
name: Sarita Carson
text: SECURITY Navigation SCIENCE

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: Loyal follower of Khan. Served as the group's physician. With the extreme health of the "supermen" rarely taxing his skills, he knew nothing to save Marla McGivers.
name: Sarod
reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
text: CIVILIAN Draw a card when you place a {Ceti Eel} on a personnel here. Exobiology Anthropology MEDICAL

lore: Specialized science ship used for an Interphase Generator experiment in 2368.
name: Science Vessel

lore: Class of small, versatile ships used by the Romulan Star Empire for reconnaissance and science missions.
name: Scout Vessel

lore: Search planet for illegal Maquis arms cache.
name: Search for Weapons
text: OFFICER + Navigation + Treachery May seed hand weapons under here.

lore: Guard against violations of Hirogen property.
name: Secure Station
text: Alpha-Hirogen + total WEAPONS>opponent's total WEAPONS here

name: Security Holding Cell
text: Has a Brig. Once each turn, player who controls station may download {Brainwash}, {Interrogation} or {Torture} to a captive held in this Brig if that player has a Tal Shiar, Obsidian Order, Resistance or Section 31 personnel (or a personnel who has SECURITY and Treachery) unopposed here. Any Nor: Promenade

lore: Subcommander Selok is a female Romulan agent. Successfully posed as Vulcan Ambassador T'Pel.
name: Selok
text: V.I.P. Treachery

lore: Overseer typical of Vidiians in charge of slave labor at large facilities like that on Avery III. Gets the most from his captives before sending them to Organ Processing.
name: Sethis
text: SECURITY Archaeology Exobiology Leadership
