lore: Identification: PURIFICATION DRONE Task: Process acquired resources. Optimize consumption. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Seventeen of Eighteen
text: Geology Stellar Cartography SCIENCE While on your ship in the Delta Quadrant, it is RANGE +2. (Cumulative.)

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Prylar;
lore: Prylar representative of members of the Bajoran clergy. Maintains the shrine aboard Deep Space 9.
name: Shandor
text: CIVILIAN Archaeology Diplomacy Honor

lore: Typical Tarlac, born into indentured servitude of the Son'a. Ru'afo's personal body sculpture attendant. Very good at what she does.
name: Sharic
text: MEDICAL Biology Computer Skill If on your Son'a ship, cancels its restriction box.

lore: Crewman First Class Simon Tarses is representative of Starfleet medical technicians. He is 1/4 Romulan, 3/4 Human.
name: Simon Tarses
text: MEDICAL Youth

lore: Vidiian researcher. Among many who believe a cure for the phage might be found by scrutinizing extinct civilizations who were wiped out by plague.
name: Sinaren
text: MEDICAL Biology Geology Archaeology

lore: Re-creation of the famous 18th century human. Originator of calculus and the classic laws of physics.
name: Sir Isaac Newton
text: SCIENCE Physics x 2

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Ensign Sito Jaxa, a Bajoran, is one of a number of navigation officers aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Sito Jaxa
text: SECURITY Navigation Youth

lore: Identification: QUANTUM DRONE Task: Investigate parallel space/time. Analyze. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
name: Six of Eleven
text: Physics Navigation SCIENCE When on your ship, may download an {Alternate Universe Door} in place of one card draw.

lore: Identification: REASSIMILATION DRONE Task: Repair and reintegrate defective drones. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Six of Nineteen
text: Just before {Rogue Borg} present initiate battle, may download a [Univ] drone to replace (discard) one of them. Exobiology DL/ {Intruder Alert!}

lore: Identification: SABOTAGE DRONE Task: Scan navigation/defense systems. Attenuate. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Six of Seventeen
text: Physics Computer Skill Once every turn, if on a ship, may reduce RANGE or WEAPONS by 2 until end of turn. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Identification: SCOUT DRONE Task: Implement initial reconnaissance. Evaluate. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Six of Thirteen
text: Astrophysics Immune to {Thine Own Self}. If present when your {Adapt: Negate Obstruction} is nullified, you may place it beneath draw deck.

lore: Identification: SENTINEL DRONE Task: Assess defensive measures. Classify. Overcome. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Six of Twelve
text: SECURITY Where present, your Borg are each CUNNING and STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.)

lore: Identification: SURVEY DRONE Task: Identify exorelics. Examine. Classify. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Sixteen of Nineteen
text: Archaeology Geology May acquire artifact(s) if on same planet or aboard a ship at same space location.

lore: Typical DaiMon. Like most Ferengi, easily manipulated by any female who tickles his lobes. Smuggled humans to the Cardassian planet Celtris III in 2369.
name: Solok
text: OFFICER Smuggling Archaeology MEDICAL

lore: Fast and deadly, the largest of Son'a ships carry isolytic subspace weapons banned by the Khitomer Accord.
name: Son'a Battleship
text: Son'a shuttlecraft may report, be carried, and launch aboard. Tractor Beam

lore: Small craft capable of atmospheric flight. Used to strafe the Ba'ku village and launch Son'a transporter drones.
name: Son'a Shuttle
text: {Transporter Drones} may report aboard (for free, once each turn).

characteristicsKeywords: Android; Female; Male; Neuter; Soong-type android;
lore: A recently produced Soong-type android ready to select its gender and appearance. Replicated using a method developed by Lt. Commander Data.
name: Soong-type Android
text: * Computer Skill Youth * Select classification and gender (male, female, or genderless) when reporting.

lore: Typical prison worker and bodyguard serving aboard Vidiian ships and installations. Fears the phage will soon leave him too weak to continue in his duties.
name: Sorum
text: SECURITY Anthropology Biology Geology DL/ {Lower Decks}

lore: Typical Lethean mercenary. Telepathically extracted Kor's knowledge of the Shroud of the Sword. Tried to help Toral steal the Sword of Kahless.
name: Soto
text: SECURITY Empathy Treachery May nullify {Lethean Telepathic Attack} where present.

lore: The final frontier...
name: Space
text: Counts as 1/2 card. Limit 4. May insert into spaceline. X = 3 + Number of adjacent [Univ] locations.

lore: Female Betazoid representative of Starfleet helm officers. Has piloted a wide variety of Federation ships, most notably the prototype U.S.S. Intrepid.
name: Stadi
text: OFFICER Empathy Navigation Honor If on a [Fed] ship, it is RANGE +1 (+2 if Intrepid class).

lore: Class ship. Heavy cruiser designation. Mainstay of the Federation Starfleet in the 2260s. Registry number NCC-1700.
name: Starship Constitution
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Univ] Federation [OS] personnel}

lore: With new modifications, ships of this class were built long after the original's launch. Starfleet continued this practice of refitting older designs into the 24th century.
name: Starship Constitution (The Motion Pictures)
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Univ] Federation [Films] personnel}

lore: Chart region of intense plasma activity.
name: Study Badlands
text: Navigation x2 + Stellar Cartography x2

lore: Observe violent disturbance and compensate for disruption of computer operations.
name: Study Plasma Storm
text: SCIENCE + ENGINEER + Astrophysics + CUNNING>30 Computer Skill required to use any equipment here.

lore: Characterize radio and optical emissions from rapidly rotating neutron star.
name: Study Pulsar
text: Navigation + Astrophysics + Computer Skill

lore: Initially produced en masse for their logic and strength, Vulcan holograms were soon abandoned by the Hirogen for showing no lust for the hunt or fear of being hunted.
name: Sumek
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Stellar Cartography

lore: Initially produced en masse for their logic and strength, Vulcan holograms were soon abandoned by the Hirogen for showing no lust for the hunt or fear of being hunted.
name: Sumek*
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Stellar Cartography

lore: Military official of Tilonus IV. He twisted William T. Riker's mind using neurosomatic techniques. Typical of treacherous Tilonian government interrogators.
name: Suna
text: SECURITY MEDICAL Treachery Once per game, may download {Reflection Therapy}.

lore: Zalkonian captain. Sought to capture criminals undergoing a dangerous mutation before they could further disrupt society.
name: Sunad
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Physics Law

lore: Scan uncharted system for inhabited, habitable and resource-rich worlds.
name: Survey Star System
text: Navigation + Stellar Cartography + Diplomacy + SCIENCE

lore: Representative Ferengi DaiMon. First member of the Ferengi Alliance to make visual contact with humans. Claimed he sought "only what is equitable."
name: Taar
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Astrophysics May double {Ferengi Attack} faced in same quadrant.

lore: Representative security officer serving in the Romulan military. Assigned to bodyguard duties in the capital city on Romulus.
name: Tagus
text: SECURITY Treachery

lore: Typical guard for Federation Security. Given a low-priority post on Earth after a poor performance review at his last assignment. His next review showed no improvement.
name: Tahglio
text: SECURITY Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Ensign Taitt is representative of science specialists from Starfleet Academy. Helped the U.S.S. Enterprise destroy a Borg ship in 2370.
name: Taitt
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Geology

lore: One of the hunters serving with Karr in 2374. Accepted an optronic datacore from Kathryn Janeway in cease-fire talks, bringing holographic technology to the Hirogen.
name: Takirac
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Honor Leadership

lore: Romulan male trained in Romulan anatomy and medicine. Extensively trained in exobiology.
name: Takket
text: MEDICAL Exobiology

lore: Romulan officer representative of those serving the Romulan Star Empire. Former commander of private forces under Commander Sela.
name: Tallus
text: OFFICER Leadership

lore: Kazon of the Nistrim sect. Has served aboard Culluh's ship for many years. His opinions have come to carry a bit more weight with his maje than most.
name: Tanar
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Biology Anthropology

lore: Horned, furry, ferocious boar-like animal. A popular Klingon pet. Lieutenant Worf had one as a child. Heart of Targ is a Klingon delicacy. This one is male.
name: Targ
text: ANIMAL All non-Targ Klingons STRENGTH +1 where present. Nullifies one just-played {Rogue Borg} where present.

lore: Representative of male Romulans trained in the field of science. Specialist in the study of extra-dimensional life-forms.
name: Tarus
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography

lore: Romulan male trained in the field of security. Assistant to Commander Konsab of the Romulan Intelligence Academy.
name: Taul
text: SECURITY Treachery Archaeology

lore: Lieutenant Taurik is a Vulcan male representative of engineering junior officers serving in Starfleet.
name: Taurik
text: ENGINEER Mindmeld

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Typical of Federation security specialists serving aboard Deep Space 9. Had an encounter with an alien entity personifying Rumpelstiltskin. Likes dabo.
name: Taylor Moore
text: SECURITY Leadership Archaeology

lore: Representative of security officers serving in the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Part of the Intendant's elite assault team. Helped track down Professor Sisko.
name: Taymar Bern
text: SECURITY Anthropology Navigation Treachery

lore: Medical aide aboard a Vidiian Cruiser. When not assisting in surgery or harvesting, serves as relief science officer.
name: Telari
text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Anthropology Physics DL/ {Vidiian Harvester}

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Glinn; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Glinn who accompanied Gul Macet aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367. Confined to his quarters by Macet for attempting to access Federation tactical data.
name: Telle
text: SECURITY Computer Skill MEDICAL

lore: Soldier under the command of Goran'Agar. Third. Typical of Jem'Hadar warriors trained to operate shield-penetrating transporter systems.
name: Temo'Zuma
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Transporter Skill

lore: Identification: TACHYON DRONE Task: Neutralize concealment systems. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Ten of Nineteen
text: Astrophysics Navigation Once each turn, if on your ship, may force one opponent's ship at same location to decloak.

lore: Hidden enclave and meeting place for the Terran rebels of the mirror universe.
name: Terran Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a [TE] ENGINEER. May be seeded or built at {Terran Hideout} if no {headquarters} there.

lore: Test upgrades to faster-than-light drive components.
name: Test Propulsion Systems
text: Navigation + Physics + ENGINEER + % ship Solving player's ships are RANGE +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Representative of surgical technicians on Vidiian ships. Well versed in medical procedures and ship systems; supervises both repairs and organ harvesting missions.
name: Thaden
text: MEDICAL ENGINEER Astrophysics Navigation Transporter Skill

lore: Subcommander Thei is representative of officers serving in the Romulan Star Empire. Ally of the sisters of Duras during the Klingon Civil War.
name: Thei
text: OFFICER Geology Physics

lore: Romulan female who assisted in the capture of U.S.S. Prometheus. Majored in warp theory at an academy located on a colony world 31 light-years from Romulus.
name: Thenelak
text: ENGINEER Physics

lore: Identification: TACTICAL DRONE Task: Control offensive capabilities. Coordinate. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Thirteen of Nineteen
text: SECURITY While on your ship, WEAPONS are +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Typical U.S.S. Equinox crewman corrupted by Ransom and Burke's leadership. Science department head. Has also manned tactical since the security chief's death.
name: Thompson
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Treachery Physics

lore: Typical U.S.S. Equinox crewman corrupted by Ransom and Burke's leadership. Science department head. Has also manned tactical since the security chief's death.
name: Thompson*
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Treachery Physics

lore: Identification: TALON DRONE Task: Add biological distinctiveness to collective. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Three of Nineteen
text: Just after stunning an opposing personnel, may abduct and assimilate that adversary. SECURITY DL/ {Assimilation Tubules}

characteristicsKeywords: Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Male geologist from Tiburon. Typical of science personnel stationed aboard Deep Space 9. Guarded a Jem'Hadar warship salvaged in Gamma Quadrant.
name: T'Lor
text: SCIENCE Geology Computer Skill

lore: Re-creation of a male Romulan. Alien entity assumed this body in 2369.
name: Tomek
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics

lore: Klingon trained in the field of science. Studied the effects of warp propulsion on subspace.
name: Torin
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics

lore: Identification: TRANSWARP HUB Task: Dispatch Borg vessels throughout the galaxy.
name: Transwarp Hub
text: Seeds or plays at any nebula. Once each turn, your ship may move from here to any {Transwarp Network Gateway}, or vice versa.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Science officer in the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Assigned to Terok Nor. Finds the station rife with gossip, backstabbing, and treachery. Likes it that way.
name: T'Vor
text: SCIENCE Geology Stellar Cartography

lore: Identification: TRANSPORT DRONE Task: Determine defensive screen harmonics. Adapt. Biological Distinctiveness: Klingon species.
name: Two of Eleven
text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Where present, allows your transporters to beam through opponent's SHIELDS.

lore: Identification: TRANSWARP DRONE Task: Expand transportation network. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Two of Nineteen
text: Navigation Stellar Cartography When on your ship, may download one {Transwarp} doorway or interrupt in place of one card draw.

lore: Identification: UNITY DRONE Task: Study biological organisms. Analyze. Correlate. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Two of Seventeen
text: Your Borg present with any [Com] Borg in this hive may add their CUNNING to total wherever there is another [Com] Borg in same hive. Anthropology

lore: Representative of female mercenaries operating throughout the galaxy. Worked with Baran to find the Stone of Gol.
name: Vekor
text: SCIENCE MEDICAL Navigation Geology

lore: Large ship shunned by most hunters - there is a blind spot in its engines' ion wake, and its heavy armaments reduce the challenge of a hunt. Netek commanded one.
name: Venatic Hunter
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Largest starship in the Vidiian fleet. Capable of grappling onto an enemy ship, subduing it for boarding. Drenol commanded one.
name: Vidiian Cruiser
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Vidiian Boarding Claw}

lore: Formidable ship favored for agility in battle. Suited to hit-and-fade attacks. Sulan commanded one prior to his promotion to Chief Surgeon of the Sodality.
name: Vidiian Interceptor
text: Tractor Beam

lore: The Vidiian Sodality establishes outposts throughout its territory, often hiding them inside barren planetoids.
name: Vidiian Outpost
text: Seed one at a [VID] or [NON] mission OR build at such a mission where you have a Vidiian ENGINEER. DL/ {The Vidiian Sodality}

lore: Small, non-military Vidiian ship, still powerfully equipped in case of urgent medical needs. Both Dereth and Danara Pel have commanded one.
name: Vidiian Scout Vessel

lore: Jem'Hadar soldier. Fourth reporting to Omet'iklan. Eight years old. Amazed at the longer lifespans of other species, especially Trill.
name: Virak'kara
text: SECURITY Physics Navigation

lore: Science officer aboard U.S.S. Enterprise-B. Joined Starfleet to pursue her interest in alien environments. Has Irish lineage dating back nearly four centuries.
name: Voight
text: SCIENCE Physics Geology

lore: Typical front-line Klingon officer. Engaged Federation forces on Ajilon Prime. Once commanded the I.K.C. K'Ratak while its captain recovered from war injuries.
name: Voktak
text: OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography Treachery

lore: Guard stationed at a facility in the Kelvas system. Characteristic of the many Cardassians, resentful of the Dominion, who embraced Damar's resistance effort.
name: Vornar
text: SECURITY Transporter Skill Biology Honor

lore: Tri-lateral symmetry. Entered the Sol system at 11 a.m. on April 5th, 2063. Commanded by Solkar.
name: Vulcan Lander
text: May take off or land (uses 1 RANGE). Your Vulcans may report for duty here.

lore: Typical of relatively inexperienced hunters still learning more advanced techniques of stalking prey. Has pursued further training as Beta-Hirogen for Karon.
name: Vurond
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel;
lore: Eugenics Wars fugitive who escaped with Khan on the Botany Bay. With her superior intellect and knowledge of that ship, she quickly adapted to the Reliant's systems.
name: Wajahut
reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
text: CIVILIAN Once per game, if aboard {U.S.S. Reliant}, may relocate it to {any Kirk}'s location. Navigation ENGINEER

lore: Typical of Bajorans studying the geosciences. Part of Dr. Mora Pol's research mission to L-S VI in 2370.
name: Weld Ram
text: SCIENCE Geology Archaeology

lore: One of several crewmen serving in the science labs on U.S.S. Voyager. Billy Telfer is a hypochondriac. Also afraid of medication and counseling. Friend of Tal Celes.
name: William Telfer
text: SCIENCE Biology Stellar Cartography

lore: One of dozens of holograms freed by Iden. The Jem'Hadar reputation for raw prowess in battle made re-creations of them favorites among Hirogen hunters.
name: Wodek'idan
text: OFFICER Physics Exobiology

lore: One of dozens of holograms freed by Iden. The Jem'Hadar reputation for raw prowess in battle made re-creations of them favorites among Hirogen hunters.
name: Wodek'idan*
text: OFFICER Physics Exobiology

lore: Captain Benjamin Maxwell of the U.S.S. Phoenix is a bitter enemy of the Cardassians.
name: Benjamin Maxwell
text: OFFICER Leadership

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
lore: Captain Benjamin Sisko commands Deep Space 9. Fought in Federation-Tzenkethi war. Helped design U.S.S. Defiant. Father of Jake. Loves baseball.
name: Benjamin Sisko
text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Honor Navigation Diplomacy DL/ {Baseball}

lore: Officer serving Lurin. Participated in the failed takeover attempt of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Blamed Morta for failing to seize control of the main computer.
name: Berik
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Physics Stellar Cartography

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Thief; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: A thief from 22nd century New Jersey. Stole a time travel pod. Tried to pass as a 26th century historian to the crew of the 24th century U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Berlingoff Rasmussen
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Archaeology Greed May nullify {Time Travel Pod} if present. (Discard both.)

lore: Changelings can be hyper-sensitive to certain environmental hazards, such as the poison gas encountered on planet LS-VI. Progressive degradation causes uncontrollable outbursts.
name: Berserk Changeling
text: Unless 2 hand weapons OR 3 SECURITY OR {Changeling Sweep} OR {Shape-Shift Inhibitor} OR {Interphase Generator} OR {Mora Pol} present, kills a non-changeling present (random selection).

lore: Strike deep into Federation territory and take control of this strategically important planet.
name: Betazed Invasion
text: OFFICER x3 + SECURITY x5 + 2 hand weapons + STRENGTH>100

lore: Plotted with Lursa to seize power from Gowron with the support of the Romulans. Younger of the two Duras sisters. The pretty one.
name: B'Etor
text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership Physics Youth Greed

lore: When Data was lost with amnesia on Barkon IV, his human shipmates Beverly Crusher and William T. Riker disguised themselves as Barkonians to find him.
name: Beverly and Will
text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Beverly: MEDICAL x 2 Biology DL/ {Any tricorder} Will: Navigation Diplomacy Anthropology

lore: Dr. Beverly Crusher is the chief medical officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Dancer and thespian. Widow of Jack Crusher. Mother of Ensign Wesley Crusher.
name: Beverly Crusher
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Exobiology

lore: Dr. Beverly Crusher is the U.S.S. Enterprise-E chief medical officer. Swore she'd never use an E.M.H.
name: Beverly Crusher (First Contact)
text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology MEDICAL DL/ {Medical Tricorder} OR {E.M.H. Program}

lore: Captain of medical ship U.S.S. Pasteur in 2395 in an alternate timeline. Although divorced from Jean-Luc Picard, she never could say no to him.
name: Beverly Picard
text: OFFICER MEDICAL x 2 Leadership Biology

name: Beware of Q
text: Seeds on table during doorway phase. Your [Q] dilemmas may seed like [S/P] dilemmas. OR Seeds or plays on your Q-Flash. Once per mission location, if opponent just revealed your dilemma there, you may exchange it with a dilemma named {Q} from your {Q's Tent} or hand (discard original dilemma). OR Plays to download and seed a dilemma named Q under a mission; discard objective.

lore: In 2374, Kes' mental abilities began to grow at an astonishing rate. Soon she was able to perceive and control a new level of reality that exists in the space between subatomic particles.
name: Beyond the Subatomic
text: Name a card type. Reveal cards from top of draw deck until you reveal a card of selected type; take it into hand, remove other revealed cards from game. (If you exhaust draw deck, lose the game.)

lore: Small, easily replaceable package housing synthetic neural cells in a gelatinous organic suspension. Part of the bio-neural computer system used aboard Intrepid-class starships.
name: Bio-Neural Gel Pack
text: May report aboard your Intrepid-class ship (for free on {U.S.S. Voyager}). While on your Intrepid-class ship or {Delta Flyer}, enhances its attributes all +1. (Cumulative up to +3.)

lore: Install signal generator and leak rumors about metagenic weapon production on this barren planet.
name: Bioweapon Ruse
text: ENGINEER + Strength>35 + no Honor + (SECURITY x3 + Obsidian Order OR {Madred})

lore: Ferengi bureaucrat stationed on Ferenginar. Point of control for offworlders. Informed Jean-Luc Picard that Bok had bought his way out of Rog Prison.
name: Birta
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Anthropology SECURITY DL/ {Hail} (to any ship "flying by" your ship or facility).

lore: Large infant spaceborne life-form. Attached itself to the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2368, sucking energy from the ship.
name: Birth of "Junior"
text: Place on ship. End of each turn, RANGE reduced by 1; if reduced to 0, ship destroyed. Nullify with 3 ENGINEER.

name: Black Hole
text: Plays between two adjacent [Univ] missions named {Space}. Creates a location (span 1). End of every turn, destroys all cards here. Also, when countdown would expire, instead destroy an adjacent location and all cards there (left first, then alternating, while possible), then countdown resets. Does not count down the turn it is played. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Conduct sabotage operations on Bajoran homeworld.
name: Disrupt Alliance
text: SECURITY + CUNNING>30 + 2 [TE] leaders OR {Captain Bashir} When seeded, you may download one {Emblem} card. Opponent's side: No gametext.

lore: A directed-energy weapon can be set on overload and left to explode like a bomb.
name: Disruptor Overload
text: Plays on any ship or Away Team. Where present, destroys one Equipment card or one card used as an Equipment card (random selection).

lore: Atmospheric phenomena that inhibits use of transporters, as on Nervala IV.
name: Distortion Field
text: Plays crosswise face up on any planet location. Once each turn, flip card over. While face up, prevents all beaming down/up here. (Unique.)

lore: Time effects can be caused by the unusual warping or rifting of space.
name: Distortion of Space/Time Continuum
text: Plays on any ship. "Unstops" ship, crew, and ship's Away Teams and restores any of this turn's RANGE already used by that ship.

lore: Even minor temporal incursions can cause shock waves with far-reaching effects. Annorax's sweeping interference changed both ancient and recent history throughout the Delta Quadrant.
name: Distortion of Space/Time Continuum (Voyager)
text: Plays on any ship. "Unstops" ship, crew, and ship's Away Teams and restores any of this turn's RANGE already used by that ship.

lore: "You aren't very persistent, Mr. Sulu. The game has rules; you're ignoring them. I protest... and you come back. You didn't... come... back."
name: Distraction
text: One male or female present (random selection) "distracts" a personnel of the opposite gender (opponent's choice). If neither has Honor, both are "stopped."

lore: Respond to distress call and beware of Ferengi activity this sector.
name: Distress Mission
text: Youth x3 + CUNNING>32 OR Honor x3 + STRENGTH>36

name: Divert Power
text: Plays on table. At start of each of your turns, one of your ships with ENGINEER (or [Nav] Borg) aboard may "transfer power" until start of your next turn; subtract 1 from two of its attributes and add 2 to the remaining attribute. OR Plays on your ship with ENGINEER (or [Def] Borg) and Computer Skill aboard. WEAPONS or SHIELDS are +4 until start of your next turn, then discard objective. (Captain's Order.)

lore: Fictional private detective. Solved dozens of cases. Jean-Luc Picard is an aficionado of the original 1930s stories and the latest holonovels by Broht and Forrester.
name: Dixon Hill
text: CIVILIAN Once per game, when solving a mission where present, ignore its requirements. DL/ {Dixon Hill's Business Card}

name: Dixon Hill's Business Card
text: [Interrupt] If any mug (what ain't Swedish) just got iced and there weren't no witnesses, finger any udda mug what's woikin' for da same boss. Put da bag on 'im. [Event] Plays on da table. The udda boss' next mug what shows up has gotta be univoisal or hologrammatical, den put dis card outta commission. (No duplicatin' dis here event.)

characteristicsKeywords: blade weapon; hand weapon; Klingon-related Equipment;
lore: Fearsome, three-bladed weapon. Ubiquitous in Klingon society. Favored knife of the warrior. Has ceremonial, combat and culinary applications. Easily concealed.
name: D'k Tahg
text: Klingon use only. Reports for free. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) May report to a just-initiated personnel battle involving your [Kli] card(s).

lore: Excelsior science officer. Monitored the 2293 disaster on the Klingon moon Praxis. Unknowing host of a parasitic memory virus. Thinks Vulcans need to relax.
name: Dmitri Valtane
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Geology Computer Skill

lore: Although a thorough analysis of a DNA sample can be a time-consuming endeavor, it can also provide information crucial to successfully dealing with biomedical hazards.
name: DNA Clues
text: Place on mission. Further dilemmas requiring any MEDICAL here require 2 more if you continue OR 2 less if crew or Away Team has Exobiology and "stops" now to investigate.

lore: Geordi La Forge was infected with alien DNA. Transformed into an invisible reptilian humanoid, he was observable only when scanned with ultraviolet light.
name: DNA Metamorphosis
text: Place on one personnel present (random selection). At the end of your next turn, that personnel is placed in stasis. Cure, before then, with MEDICAL and {I.P. Scanner}.

name: Docking Pads
text: Any ship with no staffing requirements may report, dock (land) and undock (take off) here if ship is compatible with station's affiliation OR crew includes a V.I.P. OR player controlling ship has a Computer Skill personnel present at this site unopposed (just before undocking, that personnel may board ship). Player controlling station may, once per game, download {Establish Landing Protocols}. Capacity: 6 ships. Tractor Beam. Any Nor: Habitat Ring

name: Docking Ports
text: Any ship with fewer than three staffing icons may report, dock and undock here if ship is compatible with station's affiliation OR crew includes a V.I.P. OR player controlling ship has a Computer Skill personnel present at this site unopposed (just before undocking, that personnel may board ship). Freighters and transports report for free here. Capacity: 9 ships. Tractor Beam. Any Nor: Docking Ring

lore: While comprehensive docking procedures are crucial for safeguarding life and property, proceeding "by the book" can also cause delays.
name: Docking Procedures
text: Plays on any ship just as it begins to dock or undock at any facility. Ship and crew are "stopped." Docking or undocking complete at end of turn.

name: Docking Pylons
text: Any ship with fewer than five staffing icons may dock and undock here if ship is compatible with station's affiliation OR crew includes a V.I.P. OR player controlling ship has a Computer Skill personnel present at this site unopposed (just before undocking, that personnel may board ship). Ships may not report here but may repair here. Capacity: 6 ships. Tractor Beam. Any Nor: Docking Ring

lore: Officer in the Cardassian militia, unit 41. First Gul to command the Kraxon. Tactical commander of task force sent to kill the Bajoran terrorist Orta.
name: Dolak
text: OFFICER Treachery Navigation Exobiology Your [Car] ships at same location are each WEAPONS +2.

lore: Standard Personal Access Display Device for computerized information. This PADD was taken by Jem'Hadar from the New Bajor colony destroyed in 2370.
name: Dominion PADD
text: Dominion use only. Each of your personnel present is CUNNING +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: The Dominion has the ability to produce Jem'Hadar in massive numbers with incredible ease. Losses taken in their war with the Alpha Quadrant meant as little to them as their Cardassian allies.
name: Dominion War Efforts
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your {Assign Support Personnel} card is not discarded when used to download a [Dom] or [Car] "support personnel." (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}).

lore: Typical Klingon inspired by tales of glorious battle against the Dominion. Learned diplomatic skills from his father, a former Klingon negotiator.
name: Wo'Din
text: SCIENCE Diplomacy Stellar Cartography

lore: Technician at the Morska listening post. Representative of those performing less glorious duties in service of the Klingon Empire. "Dujveth'e' nuq? ...rln."
name: Woteln
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Stellar Cartography While on your outpost, opponent's span here is +2.

characteristicsKeywords: Freighter; Long-Range Scan Shielding; Tractor Beam;
lore: Xepolite merchants are suspected as fronts for secret Cardassian operations. They maintain their privacy via particle-diffusing hull alloys.
name: Xepolite Freighter
text: Long-Range Scan Shielding, Tractor Beam

lore: Seventh serving under Remata'Klan. Assigned to repair communication equipment damaged when his Jem'Hadar unit was marooned in 2374.
name: Yak'Talon
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Computer Skill

lore: Typical arms dealer. Humanoid who sold three defective Klingon disruptor rifles to Liam Bilby. Refused refund.
name: Yint
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Stellar Cartography Transporter Skill DL/ {Any Disruptor Rifle}

lore: Jem'Hadar youth. Typical juvenile recently emerged from birthing chamber.
name: Young Jem'Hadar
text: CIVILIAN At end of any of your turns, may be exchanged with one of your [Univ] Jem'Hadar in hand. Youth

lore: Common shuttlecraft used by Yridian agents and others for covert activities.
name: Yridian Shuttle

lore: Typical Zalkonian defense vessel. One commanded by Sunad traveled at warp 9.72, hunting the fugitive known as John Doe in the Zeta Gelis Cluster.
name: Zalkonian Vessel
text: Kills untransfigured {John Doe} if at same location at end of your turn.

lore: Typical skilled Klingon serving in the fleet during the war with Cardassia. Her ship took part in a raid which destroyed an outpost on Korma in 2372.
name: Zetal
text: SCIENCE Biology

lore: Common class of merchant vessel used by traders such as Kivas Fajo.
name: Zibalian Transport

lore: Representative female member of the Dosi, a physically aggressive merchant race aligned with the Dominion. Tulaberry wine expert.
name: Zyree
text: CIVILIAN Biology Greed Archaeology

lore: "Aye, they're into the machinery, all right. And they're probably into all the food processors, too."
name: ... in the Engine Room
text: 100: On a ship, reduces WEAPONS -1 and RANGE -1. 1,000: On a ship, it is "stopped" after each of its moves unless 3 ENGINEER aboard. At an {Ore Processing Unit}, suspends {Process Ore}.

lore: So numerous were tribbles on the starship Enterprise that some were beamed to K-7 along with Captain Kirk and Mr. Spock.
name: ... in the Transporters
text: 100 (or {Tribble Bomb}): On a ship or facility, when any personnel present moves away from this group, up to 10 of this group's tribbles (and/or your Tribble Bomb present) may go with that personnel; discard trouble.

lore: The starship Enterprise crew suffered numerous tribble distractions, not the least of which was Kirk sitting on one.
name: ... on the Bridge
text: 100: On a ship, suspends attribute enhancements related to its matching commander. 1,000: Where present, limits each mission attempt to 10 personnel.

lore: 1,771,561 tribbles managed to find their way into virtually every part of Deep Space Station K-7 and surrounding ships.
name: ... on the Station
text: 1,000: Just after this group breeds, up to 100 of its tribbles may "spread" (move) to an adjacent site or into/out of a facility or a landed, docked, or carried ship; discard trouble. 10,000: At {Bajoran Shrine}, prevents "conducting services."

name: 1 Tribble - Bonus
text: May report anywhere. Each non-Klingon present is CUNNING -1. Once every turn, may "stop" one personnel present (random selection).

name: 1 Tribble - Discard
text: May report anywhere. Each non-Klingon present is CUNNING -1. Once every turn, may "stop" one personnel present (random selection).

name: 1 Tribble - Go
text: May report anywhere. Each non-Klingon present is CUNNING -1. Once every turn, may "stop" one personnel present (random selection).

name: 1,000 Tribbles - Bonus
text: Breeds from {100 tribbles}. Each personnel present loses their first-listed skill. Prevents {Ooby Dooby} card draws at this location.

name: 1,000 Tribbles - Discard
text: Breeds from {100 tribbles}. Each personnel present loses their first-listed skill. Prevents {Ooby Dooby} card draws at this location.

name: 1,000 Tribbles - Rescue
text: Breeds from {100 tribbles}. Each personnel present loses their first-listed skill. Prevents {Ooby Dooby} card draws at this location.

characteristicsKeywords: Bynar; Dual-personnel; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Paired Bynars from the planet Bynaus. In the year 100100111100, upgraded weapons and holodeck systems of U.S.S. Enterprise at Starbase 01001010.
name: 10 and 01
text: ENGINEER+ENGINEER 10: Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Any Bynars} card 01: Nullifies all {Computer Crash} cards in play.

name: 10 Tribbles - Bonus
text: May report anywhere. Each Klingon present is INTEGRITY -1 and, unless {Divok} is present, loses their first-listed skill.

name: 10 Tribbles - Go
text: May report anywhere. Each Klingon present is INTEGRITY -1 and, unless {Divok} is present, loses their first-listed skill.

name: 10 Tribbles - Poison
text: May report anywhere. Each Klingon present is INTEGRITY -1 and, unless {Divok} is present, loses their first-listed skill.

name: 10,000 Tribbles - Go
text: Breeds from {1,000 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Exobiology. Cancels probing on non-Dilemma cards at (and [BO] cards targeting) this location.

name: 10,000 Tribbles - Poison
text: Breeds from {1,000 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Exobiology. Cancels probing on non-Dilemma cards at (and [BO] cards targeting) this location.

name: 10,000 Tribbles - Rescue
text: Breeds from {1,000 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Exobiology. Cancels probing on non-Dilemma cards at (and [BO] cards targeting) this location.

name: 100 Tribbles - Bonus
text: Breeds from {10 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Leadership. If on a planet, prevents scoring of {Colony} points there.

name: 100 Tribbles - Poison
text: Breeds from {10 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Leadership. If on a planet, prevents scoring of {Colony} points there.

name: 100 Tribbles - Rescue
text: Breeds from {10 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Leadership. If on a planet, prevents scoring of {Colony} points there.

name: 100,000 Tribbles - Clone
text: Breeds from {10,000 Tribbles}. Where present, prevents personnel from reporting "for free." If on a planet when that mission solved, reduces its points by 10.

name: 100,000 Tribbles - Discard
text: Breeds from {10,000 Tribbles}. Where present, prevents personnel from reporting "for free." If on a planet when that mission solved, reduces its points by 10.

name: 100,000 Tribbles - Rescue
text: Breeds from {10,000 Tribbles}. Where present, prevents personnel from reporting "for free." If on a planet when that mission solved, reduces its points by 10.

lore: One-of-a-kind trading card. Collectible icon of an ancient professional sport once played on Earth. Owned by Kivas Fajo. Still retains its original bubble gum aroma.
name: 1962 Roger Maris Baseball Card
text: Immediately play on table. During your turn, you may trade this artifact for any opponent's artifact in play. Players must immediately play traded cards as their own. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: "Once you have their money, you never give it back."
name: 1st Rule of Acquisition
text: Seeds or plays on your freighter, transport or [Fer] facility or ship. {Gold-Pressed Latinum} you download may come from your discard pile. Once per game, you may download to hand one Gold-Pressed Latinum and/or one Ferengi V.I.P.

lore: "Employees are the rungs on the ladder of success - don't hesitate to step on them."
name: 211th Rule of Acquisition
text: Plays on {Quark's Bar} or {Ferengi Trading Post}. Each time opponent wishes to play a card during your turn, opponent must first discard X cards, where X = (your dabo girls and Ferengi waiters present) - (opponent's personnel present).

lore: "It never hurts to suck up to the boss."
name: 33rd Rule of Acquisition
text: Plays on your Greed personnel at a mission or [Bor] objective opponent completed. Compliment opponent's score. If they say "thank you," score points. If not, draw up to four cards. Discard event. (Limit two per location.)

lore: "War is good for business."
name: 34th Rule of Acquisition
text: Plays on your arms dealer or Acquisition personnel. Once every turn, if a non-Rogue-Borg battle was just initiated or opponent's ship was just damaged, download two {Gold-Pressed Latinum} here (three if an arms dealer) OR draw two cards.

lore: "Peace is good for business."
name: 35th Rule of Acquisition
text: Plays on your Acquisition personnel. End of each turn, if no battles were initiated since end of your last turn, download a {Gold-Pressed Latinum} here OR draw a card. 35th Rule nullifies every {34th Rule}, and vice versa, ignoring {Scepter}.

lore: Champagne of a respected 20th-century vintage. Traditionally used to christen new ships. In the holographic world of Secret Agent Julian Bashir, also serves as an effective hand weapon.
name: '45 Dom Perignon
text: May discard to download a unique ship to replace (discard) your [Univ] ship of same class here. Once per battle, your personnel present may stun an adversary they just engaged.

lore: "Don't trust a man wearing a better suit than your own."
name: 47th Rule of Acquisition
text: Plays on your Acquisition or Greed personnel. Nullifies all {Palor Toff} cards. Whenever at same location as {any Garak} or a personnel who has more [*] icons than this one, may place that personnel atop owner's draw deck; discard event.

lore: "Free advice is seldom cheap."
name: 59th Rule of Acquisition
text: Plays on your Nagus. At any time, advise opponent to attempt a specific mission. If opponent does so voluntarily, opponent must first discard two cards from hand and/or top of the draw deck and you may draw up to two; discard event.

lore: "The riskier the road, the greater the profit."
name: 62nd Rule of Acquisition
text: Plays on your unattempted mission. Nullified if you begin an attempt with <3 (or >7) personnel, or if you play (or have played) {Scan} or {Full Planet Scan}. If you solve, score points; opponent loses points (discard event).

lore: "Never allow family to stand in the way of opportunity."
name: 6th Rule Of Acquisition
text: Plays on your Ferengi who has Greed or Treachery; place beneath draw deck another Ferengi present who names (or is named by) this one in lore. Download two Equipment cards or one [Fer] ship here OR draw up to three cards. Discard event.

lore: "Home is where the heart is, but the stars are made of latinum."
name: 75th Rule of Acquisition
text: Plays on your Acquisition personnel in their native quadrant. If that personnel helps solve a mission in another quadrant, score points OR download up to five {Gold-Pressed Latinum} there; discard event. (Once per mission.)

lore: Sensing that her plans for the interplexing beacon had been thwarted, the Borg Queen immediately implemented a new goal for the hive.
name: A Change of Plans
text: Plays to do any or all of the following: discard your current objective; return it to your hand if you have {Borg Queen} in play; and download one [BO] Objective card.

lore: The mirror universe version of Bareil Antos unexpectedly beamed aboard Deep Space 9 and took Kira Nerys hostage. He demanded a ship in exchange for her life.
name: A Fast Ship Would Be Nice
text: Kills one personnel (opponent's choice). You may substitute a bodyguard or {Guard Drone} present OR an empty ship here (moved to opponent's side of spaceline; commandeered).

lore: Seek revenge on notorious criminal who used a genetic virus to murder Klingon children.
name: A Good Day To Live
text: ({Kor} OR {Kang} OR {Koloth}) + STRENGTH>40 * +5 for each (R> personnel in Away Team.

lore: Study harsh planet where Klingon criminals are exiled "to die on their feet with honor."
name: A Good Place to Die
text: Physics + STRENGTH>33 OR Biology + Honor

lore: Former file clerk. Served under Gul Darhe'el, the infamous "Butcher of Gallitep." Impersonated Darhe'el in an attempt to force Cardassia to atone for war crimes.
name: Aamin Marritza
text: CIVILIAN Honor x 2 Computer Skill Archaeology Scores points if killed.

lore: Jean-Luc Picard felt compelled to ignore his assigned patrol duties in the neutral zone and instead join the attack against the Borg.
name: Abandon Mission
text: Plays on any ship with its matching commander or any /Ent-E personnel aboard. Crew may not attempt missions or beam off. Nullified if ship battles. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Krenim attacks repeatedly damaged the U.S.S. Voyager. Failing life support systems led Kathryn Janeway to order the evacuation of all personnel except senior staff.
name: Abandon Ship!
text: If ship damaged or RANGE reduced, personnel not needed for staffing are placed with dilemma atop mission. Rescue (opponent may capture) personnel with different ship here.

lore: Early 25th-century technology brought from an alternate future to the year 2377 by Admiral Janeway. Quickly adapted for use on Voyager, enabling it to withstand the attack of a Borg cube.
name: Ablative Armor
text: While aboard your ship or facility, opponent's ATTACK total must be more than double that ship or facility's DEFENSE total to score a hit, and more than triple to score a direct hit.

name: Access Denied
text: Seeds or plays on table. While in play, nullifies all {Establish Gateway} objectives targeting your missions. You may suspend play while you discard incident to download {Fractal Encryption Code}.

lore: Analyze automated subspace relay station for information on the Dominion.
name: Access Relay Station
text: OFFICER + SCIENCE + ENGINEER + Computer Skill x2 + CUNNING>34

lore: Purchase bilitrium from Klingon outcasts for delivery to Bajoran insurgents.
name: Acquire Illicit Explosives
text: Physics + CIVILIAN + Treachery OR Physics + Smuggling

lore: Obtain trajector transport system from society with strict laws against trading technology with outsiders.
name: Acquire Technology
text: ENGINEER + Physics + (Acquisition OR Diplomacy x3 OR Treachery x2 OR Pakled)

lore: The Borg have huge numbers of available drones which normally perform internal functions for the collective. When a task is pending, some of these drones are activated.
name: Activate Subcommands
text: Downloads one [Com] Borg drone, one [Nav] Borg drone and one [Def] Borg drone. Discard event and draw no cards this turn.

lore: A single Borg cube often carries a complement of over 64,000 drones. Most remain dormant in their alcoves until activated to perform a specific task.
name: Activate Subcommands (The Borg)
text: Downloads one [Com] Borg drone, one [Nav] Borg drone, and one [Def] Borg drone. Discard event and draw no cards this turn.

lore: "Tractor Beam" is the common term for the focused linear graviton force beam installed on most starships.
name: Activate Tractor Beam
text: Plays on your ship with Tractor Beam; it may tow any ship present which is yours or is empty. OR Plays on your outpost or ship; adds Tractor Beam (but may not carry ships aboard).

lore: Borg quickly adapt countermeasures, such as drone energy shields, to foil any new weapon used against them. Remodulating an energy weapon helps only briefly.
name: Adapt: Modulate Shields
text: Plays and remains on a {phaser} or {disruptor} just used to stun or mortally wound one of your [Com] Borg. Your Borg are immune to all weapons with that exact card title.

lore: Phased energy weapons are of limited effectiveness against the Borg. After only a few discharges, a hive is able to modify the personal shields of its drones to absorb any further attacks.
name: Adapt: Modulate Shields (The Borg)
text: Plays and remains on a {phaser} or {disruptor} just used to stun or mortally wound one of your [Com] Borg. Your Borg are immune to all weapons with that exact card title.

lore: The first experience of a hazard can be as dangerous to a Borg drone as to anyone. However, the Borg soon adapt and learn how to nullify it.
name: Adapt: Negate Obstruction
text: Nullifies a dilemma (except a Q-related dilemma) just encountered by your [Com] Borg if your Borg encountered that dilemma (or a copy) on a previous turn.

lore: By 2375, the Borg had encountered and catalogued over 10,000 different species. This vast, accumulated knowledge is sufficient to overcome virtually any obstacle.
name: Adapt: Negate Obstruction (The Borg)
text: Nullifies a dilemma (except a Q-related dilemma) just encountered by your [Com] Borg if your Borg encountered that dilemma (or a copy) on a previous turn.

name: Add Distinctiveness
text: Seeds or plays on table. X varies, where X = number of [*] icons on personnel you've assimilated as drones. Also, if you are behind by 40 or more points, once per game you may open a sealed First Contact expansion pack. Play or place in hand any or all non-seed cards in that pack (non-Borg cards are assimilated or stolen, as appropriate), then place the others out-of-play.

lore: Militant admiral opposed to the Gorkon peace initiative. Employed his covert contacts in mounting a conspiracy to assassinate the Klingon leader.
name: Admiral Cartwright
text: V.I.P. Leadership SECURITY Treachery Section 31 Once per game, may nullify any one Federation Treaty.

lore: Admiral in charge of coordinating Starfleet's anti-Borg forces. Led a fleet in defense of a Borg cube attack on Earth in 2373.
name: Admiral Hayes
text: V.I.P. Each of your Federation ships at same location is WEAPONS +1 and SHIELDS +2. Leadership

lore: Head of Borg research and strategic planning at Starfleet Tactical. Friend of Jean-Luc Picard for over 40 years. Amassed an armada to face a Borg cube at Wolf 359.
name: Admiral J. P. Hanson
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Honor SECURITY Your [Fed] ships may report here (unless [AU]).

lore: In an alternate future where Voyager had remained lost for 23 years, Kathryn Janeway decided to travel back in time and guide her younger self to a faster route home.
name: Admiral Janeway
text: V.I.P. SCIENCE ENGINEER Leadership Computer Skill Physics DL/ {Ablative Armor}

lore: While Captain Kirk regretted accepting promotion, he commanded the Starship Enterprise in later crises. Time away from the center seat did not diminish his ingenuity.
name: Admiral Kirk
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 3 Diplomacy DL/ {Commandeer Ship} Once each turn, may discard one card to draw one card.

lore: Chief of Starfleet Operations. Misguided paranoid. Faked evidence of impending Dominion invasion and urged Jaresh-Inyo to place Earth under martial law.
name: Admiral Leyton
text: V.I.P. Leadership SECURITY Treachery Allows your cards here to initiate battle against [Dom].

lore: Not a psychiatrist, mechanic, coal miner, bricklayer, scientist, physicist, moon shuttle conductor, escalator, magician or fish peddler. Just an old country doctor.
name: Admiral McCoy
text: V.I.P. MEDICAL Exobiology Cantankerousness Other MEDICAL are CUNNING +3 where present.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Admiral; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: The former captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise pursued an unprecedented treaty with the Romulans in Barash's illusion.
name: Admiral Picard
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Honor Navigation

lore: Commander of Starbase 247 in an alternate future. At odds with Governor Worf. Battled Klingons near Devron.
name: Admiral Riker
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Navigation Music Your leaders here may initiate battle against [Kli]. DL/ {Any Enterprise} (if aboard your matching facility).

lore: Starfleet veteran. Performed the wedding of Benjamin Sisko and Kassidy Yates. Reluctantly involved in Section 31 plot to discredit Senator Cretak.
name: Admiral Ross
text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy Anthropology Honor OR Section 31 (choose at start of each turn).

lore: Determine cause of a disaster that obliterated all life on this once-thriving planet.
name: Aftermath
text: ENGINEER + Physics x2 + (Honor OR Treachery)

lore: In 2372, a spaceborne creature attacked U.S.S. Voyager, trying to establish dominance. It perceived the ship as a potential rival.
name: Aggressive Behavior
text: Unless 2 Anthropology OR Leadership, Anthropology, and CUNNING>35 present, ship is damaged and one crew member is killed (random selection).

lore: Pain-inflicting device developed by the Terran Empire. Fear of punishment drives crew members to maintain maximum efficiency at all times. Ensures alertness, loyalty, and obedience.
name: Agonizer
text: Where present, each of your [MQ] personnel and [OS] Klingons is INTEGRITY and CUNNING +1. (Cumulative up to +3.)

name: Agony Booth
text: Plays on your [MQ] ship. Once every turn, if ship, its crew, or one of its Away Teams solves a mission or wins a battle against opponent's cards, you may draw up to three cards. But whenever they fail a mission attempt or fail to win such a battle, one of your personnel involved (random selection) must do nothing but return to ship (if not already aboard), then is "stopped."

lore: Report on long-term progress of quadrotriticale crop introduced here over a century ago.
name: Agricultural Assessment
text: Geology + Biology OR {any Spock} OR {any Chekov}

lore: Miradorn twins, bonded as if two halves of one being. Attacked and plundered transports for valuable objets d'art. Negotiated with Quark to sell one such item.
name: Ah-Kel and Ro-Kel
text: OFFICER+OFFICER Ah-Kel: Archaeology Smuggling Treachery Ro-Kel: Acquisition Biology Greed

lore: Help small population of clones who are suffering from replicative fading of their DNA.
name: Aid Clone Colony
text: Biology + Diplomacy + MEDICAL x2 + CUNNING>36 When you solve, may download a copy of a personnel in play.

affiliation: Any non-Dominion Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Search for the cure to Jem'Hadar addiction to ketracel-white
name: Aid Fugitives
text: MEDICAL x3 + Exobiology + ENGINEER {Hippocratic Oath} relocates here from any quadrant.

name: Airlock
text: Plays on a ship (with at least one staffing icon), outpost or docking site. Once each turn, any personnel present who has Computer Skill and either Treachery or Greed may target one opposing personnel (or {Rogue Borg}) present of lower STRENGTH or CUNNING. Target is "tossed out the airlock" (Borg, Rogue Borg and androids float in space until beamed; others die). Target's owner may counter-attack next turn.

lore: A female Vorgon criminal from the 27th century who ruthlessly sought artifacts with partner Boratus. Hunted the Tox Uthat by returning to 2366.
name: Ajur
text: SECURITY Once per game, if alone with Archaeology on a planet, may peek at all but 3 seed cards here (opponent's choice).

lore: The Borg Queen searched tenaciously for the interlink frequency connecting the errant drones of Unimatrix Zero. Analyzing those she had discovered brought her closer to finding them all.
name: Alas, Poor Drone
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may discard a [Com] or [Def] drone from hand or in play to draw one card (or two if drone was present with your {Borg Queen}).

lore: Like all cybernetic life forms, the Borg cannot survive without their organic components. Loss of the Queen brings chaos to order.
name: Alas, Poor Queen
text: Plays if {Borg Queen} (or Bluegill Queen) was just killed. All Borg (or Bluegills) in play of same player also die. (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.) OR Nullifies {Regenerate}.

lore: Warship commanded by Danar. Destroyed a scout vessel piloted by Bajoran terrorist Tahna Los after he stole a Cardassian antimatter converter.
name: Aldara
text: Tractor Beam

lore: "You will abandon that mission, Captain. My business with you takes precedence."
name: Aldebaran Serpent
text: If personnel are present, and the number of personnel in this crew or Away Team > lowest attribute present, discard event. Otherwise, place on mission; after this Q-Flash ends, crew or Away Team is stopped and you must attempt a different mission before attempting this one again.

lore: 3/4 Klingon, 1/4 Human male. Born on the 43rd day of Maktag. Son of Lieutenant Worf and K'Ehleyr.
name: Alexander Rozhenko
text: CIVILIAN Honor Youth

lore: Alien shuttle with an interface that restructures its pilot's neural pathways. Manifested in Tom Paris' mind as an Academy crush, forcing him to take the ship to her particle fountain "home."
name: Alice
text: Unless 2 Computer Skill and Biology present, personnel with most Navigation (opponent's choice if tie or none) is captured. Discard dilemma.

lore: Conscientious admiral who questioned Romulan policy. Eventually stole a scout ship and defected to the Federation in 2366.
name: Alidar Jarok
text: OFFICER Navigation Leadership

lore: Solanagen-based aliens, existing in a subspace domain, can access our universe and abduct humanoids for study.
name: Alien Abduction
text: Most CUNNING Away Team member (owner's choice if tie) is held atop mission. Cure with 3 Leadership. Nullified when mission completed.

lore: Gaming device of unknown origin which alters the laws of probability. Martus Mazur replicated several of the devices for use in Club Martus. Many found the game irresistible.
name: Alien Gambling Device
text: Use as Equipment card. Once every turn, you may cause any one random selection at same or adjacent location to be canceled and re-selected. (Cumulative.)

lore: Lanel, a Malcorian nurse, agreed to help Commander William T. Riker, but only if he would...
name: Alien Groupie
text: Plays on any Away Team that just completed a planet mission. Female groupie delays beam up of one male (random selection) for one full turn.

lore: Many planets, such as Mordan IV, have convoluted underground installations which require Away Teams to have specific technology or skills.
name: Alien Labyrinth
text: To get through this maze-like structure and continue, Away Team must have {a Tricorder} OR 2 ENGINEER.

lore: Intelligent parasites enter and take control of a humanoid. Their presence can be detected by a gill like protrusion on the back of a host's neck.
name: Alien Parasites
text: Unless INTEGRITY>32, Away Team infected. They beam back and opponent immediately controls ship and crew until "stopped." Then turn resumes.

name: Alien Parasites & REM Fatigue
text: ALIEN PARASITES: Unless INTEGRITY>32, Away Team (if any) beams back and opponent immediately controls ship and crew until "stopped." REM FATIGUE HALLUCINATIONS: Crew or Away Team dies at end of your third full turn unless cured by 3 MEDICAL OR docking at outpost.

lore: Space probes of unknown origin are frequently encountered by starships. Often such probes seek information and contact.
name: Alien Probe
text: Plays on table. Both players continue the game with their hands (cards) exposed, face up on the table.

lore: While trapped in a temporal causality loop, Data's dealing at the regular poker game was influenced by a posthypnotic suggestion sent from an earlier repetition of events.
name: All Threes
text: Plays once each turn to reveal two sets of three cards from top of your draw deck. Take one set into hand; discard the other (opponent's choice unless you have {any Data} in play).

lore: Create false documents on Bajoran homeworld pertaining to Cardassian occupation.
name: Alter Records
text: Computer Skill x2 + Obsidian Order x2 OR Computer Skill x2 + Treachery x4

name: Alternate Universe Door
text: Place one on table during the seed phase. Door is now open, allowing your [AU] icon cards to enter play. OR Stock in deck and use as follows: Plays to nullify one {Revolving Door} or {Subspace Schism}. (Discard doorway.) OR Allows one ship to pass through {Q-Net}. (Discard doorway.) OR Nullify one {Temporal Rift}, and return doorway to your hand.

lore: To solve this holographic puzzle, its challenger must turn a multicolor sphere a solid hue using neural theta waves. The symbiont Dax tried unsuccessfully for over 140 years.
name: Altonian Brain Teaser
text: Most CUNNING personnel present is "stopped." If their CUNNING<15, bonus points scored at this spaceline location do not count toward winning. Discard dilemma.

lore: Lethean male. Attempted to steal biomimetic gel from Deep Space 9 infirmary in 2371. Attacked Julian Bashir, causing telepathically induced coma.
name: Altovar
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Empathy Greed

lore: Humanoid dabo girl. In three months she didn't spill a drink, mix up a food order or short-change a bill. Actually liked by other dabo girls - and even the Ferengi waiters.
name: Aluura
text: CIVILIAN Your other dabo girls and Ferengi waiters here are attributes all +2. Youth Honor Diplomacy

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Admiral; Female; Support Personnel; Vice-Admiral;
lore: Vice-Admiral Alynna Nechayev is an antagonistic superior of Captain Jean-Luc Picard. Responsible for liaison with the Cardassians and the Maquis.
name: Alynna Nechayev
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership

lore: Nurse Alyssa Ogawa is a medical assistant and friend to Dr. Beverly Crusher.
name: Alyssa Ogawa
text: MEDICAL Biology

lore: Lieutenant (j.g.) Alyssa Ogawa married shipmate Andrew Powell in 2370. A nurse assistant to Dr. Beverly Crusher, she is studying to be a doctor.
name: Alyssa Ogawa (First Contact)
text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology DL/ {Medical Kit}

lore: Human wife of Ambassador Sarek. Though a deep admirer of the Vulcan way, she also taught her son Spock that the capacity of human emotion is just as great.
name: Amanda Grayson
text: CIVILIAN {Any Spock} or {any Sarek} may report where present (for free). Anthropology Diplomacy Honor

lore: Female Q raised as a human on Earth. Was taken to the Q continuum by Q after she could not resist the benevolent use of her powers.
name: Amanda Rogers
text: Nullifies any one Interrupt card just played OR any other card just played as an Interrupt card. (Immune to Amanda Rogers.)

lore: "They had assumed human form... in vulgar human fashion they proceeded to conceive a child. And like mockish humans they became attached to it."
name: Amanda's Parents
text: Plays on table until any Q-Flash. Each time you play an {Amanda Rogers} card (except to nullify a [Q] icon card), opponent may take that Amanda Rogers (and any two other cards) from your discard pile and place all three out-of-play.

lore: Four-armed pianist. Information broker. Ex-wife of arms smuggler. Four times widowed. Qualor II lounge performer. Knows Aktuh and Melota. Salt sucker.
name: Amarie
text: CIVILIAN Music

lore: Jem'Hadar bodyguard of Founder Leader. Third. Took the conn of the U.S.S. Defiant to navigate the ship to the Founders' homeworld.
name: Amat'igan
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 Stellar Cartography Computer Skill DL/ {Security Sacrifice}

lore: Starfleet dignitary. Scoffs at rumors of his inability to form lasting relationships. Spends much of his free time on Risa.
name: Ambassador Krajensky
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership ENGINEER Law May report on {Risa}.

lore: Vulcan ambassador. Sent Admiral Kirk on the search to restore his son Spock. Reciprocated Kirk's effort, as logic demanded, by defending him to the Federation Council.
name: Ambassador Sarek
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Mindmeld Law DL/ Any Federation Treaty

lore: Romulan Ambassador in Barash's illusion. Key figure in securing a treaty with the Federation. Commander of the Decius.
name: Ambassador Tomalak
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Exobiology Computer Skill DL/ {Treaty: Federation/Romulan}

affiliation: Any non-Federation crew  may attempt mission.
lore: Lure enemy ship to tactically advantageous space and launch an attack.
name: Ambush Ship
text: Leadership x2 + WEAPONS>9 X=30 (or 45 if opponent's occupied ship here).

lore: A male non-corporeal life-form that lives inside a female host which he enchants, as in the case of Dr. Beverly Crusher's late grandmother.
name: Anaphasic Organism
text: If Female(s) in Away Team, the one with highest total attribute numbers resigns (is discarded), unless SECURITY and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

name: Anaphasic Organism & Nagilum
text: ANAPHASIC ORGANISM: Unless SECURITY and MEDICAL present, female crew or Away Team member with highest total attributes resigns (is discarded). (Not repeatable.) NAGILUM: Half of crew or Away Team is killed (random selection, round down) unless 3 Diplomacy OR STRENGTH>40 present. Discard dilemma.

characteristicsKeywords: Hologram; Dr. Noah-related personnel; Female; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
lore: KGB agent. Kira Nerys, with a Russian accent. Brought orders to pursue Dr. Noah. Romantically involved with Secret Agent Julian Bashir. Wears exploding earrings.
name: Anastasia Komananov
text: OFFICER Honor Diplomacy DL/ {Smoke Bomb} May {Issue Secret Orders} as if she were an infiltrator.

lore: Tribal lore tells of Sky Spirits who guided the Rubber Tree People in Earth's distant past. When Chakotay found the Spirits' home in the Delta Quadrant, he was beset with visions of his ancestors.
name: Ancestral Vision
text: Seeds or plays on a [DQ] planet. End of each turn, if your Honor personnel who has INTEGRITY>7 is present, draw an extra card. (May not be nullified if {Chakotay} present.)

lore: Vital information can be retrieved from old or damaged computer systems like this one aboard a derelict Promellian battlecruiser.
name: Ancient Computer
text: Cannot get past unless 2 Computer Skill OR 3 SCIENCE OR 3 ENGINEER present.

name: Ancient Computer & Microvirus
text: ANCIENT COMPUTER: To get past requires 2 Computer Skill OR 3 SCIENCE OR 3 ENGINEER. MICROVIRUS: Unless MEDICAL and SECURITY present, kills one crew or Away Team member (opponent's choice). Discard dilemma.

lore: Although drones are physically stronger than humanoids, they cannot always overcome Soong-type androids. Data has strangled, thrown and "disarmed" various Borg.
name: Android Headlock
text: Mortally wounds a Borg drone, Jem'Hadar, {Rogue Borg} or [Holo] personnel who just engaged your android in combat. (Android engages next adversary.) OR Nullifies {Borg Kiss}.

lore: An infestation of interphasic creatures caused Lt. Commander Data to experience surreal dreams and hallucinations, resulting in his attack on Deanna Troi.
name: Android Nightmares
text: If android present, one non-android personnel (random selection) killed (three if {Interphasic Plasma Creatures} affecting you) unless Empathy OR {Dr. Soong} present.

lore: When Odo was under suspicion for murder, Bajoran nationals led by Zayra demanded that the changeling be handed over to them. Benjamin Sisko spared the constable from their "justice."
name: Angry Mob
text: Kills a SECURITY or shape-shifter present (random selection) unless remaining Away Team has INTEGRITY>27 from up to four personnel OR STRENGTH>50. Discard dilemma.

lore: Ba'ku female who became romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. In her 300 years, learned to sustain a perfect moment in time - but never learned to swim.
name: Anij
text: CIVILIAN Twice per game, may nullify a non-[Ref] interrupt and place it atop owner's draw deck. Anthropology

lore: Nucleogenic life-forms that relentlessly assaulted U.S.S. Equinox in retaliation for the crew's actions. Their attack causes a thermolytic reaction, desiccating every cell in a victim's body.
name: Ankari "Spirits"
text: Unless 3 Honor and INTEGRITY>35 present, place on ship. Now and start of each turn, kills two crew members (random selection). Cure with 3 ENGINEER and Exobiology.

lore: Respond to call for help from malfunctioning isomorphic projection alone on alien ship.
name: Answer Distress Signal
text: ENGINEER + OFFICER + MEDICAL * +10 if a [Holo] personnel in crew.

lore: Magnetic anti-matter containment vessel used by the U.S.S. Enterprise crew to shut down the Manheim Effect and to mine Cardassian ships in the McAllister C-5 nebula.
name: Anti-Matter Pod
text: May be left at any space mission. Damages next ship to stop here without 3 Navigation (discard pod). May be nullified by Transporter Skill. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Using harmless anti-matter explosives in a pyrotechnic display, acting-captain William Riker implemented a "brilliantly unorthodox" plan to confuse the Borg in battle.
name: Anti-Matter Spread
text: Plays at start of ship battle. For this battle, opposing ships' WEAPONS -1 for each personnel aboard with CUNNING<8 OR {Borg Ship} WEAPONS=16 this turn.

lore: 21st century automatic weapon. Developed for faction wars against ECON in World War III. No stun setting. Rapid-fires small-caliber bullets. Owned and often used by Lily Sloane.
name: Antique Machine Gun
text: Use as Equipment card. At start of personnel battle, may target two opposing personnel or {Rogue Borg} (random selection). Mortally wounds targets (only stuns androids).

lore: Q-created phenomena. Rift caused by anti-time particles in the future. Anomaly grows backward in time endangering all life in the past.
name: Anti-Time Anomaly
text: Plays on table. Kills literally ALL personnel in play (both players' cards) at the end of your third full turn, unless anti-time anomaly destroyed first.

lore: Female allasomorph. Shape-shifting guardian of Salia. Scouts ahead before declaring environment safe. Will do anything to protect Salia and the hope she represents.
name: Anya
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Honor DL/ {Salia} If present, must replace {Salia} just randomly selected.

lore: Terrorist device developed by Dekon Elig and Surmak Ren to fight the Cardassian occupation. When activated, releases a deadly virus which interferes with language processing abilities.
name: Aphasia Device
text: Place on ship. Quarantined. Now and end of each turn, disables one personnel aboard (random selection). If all crew disabled, all die. Cure with 2 MEDICAL and 2 Biology.

lore: Named for a sea on Romulus. Has a cloaking device prototype based on a phase inverter. Commanded by Mirok after the death of the ship's captain.
name: Apnex
text: Cloaking Device, Phasing Cloak (RANGE +4 while phased).

lore: Impetuous Queen of the Spider People, as portrayed by Kathryn Janeway. Forced Chaotica to lower his lightning shield after uncorking her pheromones on his henchman.
name: Arachnia
text: V.I.P. Opposing ships here are SHIELDS -4 unless a female is aboard. Diplomacy Treachery Honor

lore: Jem'Hadar Second under Goran'Agar. Disapproved of Goran'Agar's use of Julian Bashir and Miles O'Brien in search for cure to ketracel-white addition.
name: Arak'Taral
text: OFFICER Leadership Transporter Skill Physics DL/ {Invasive Beam-In}

lore: Chief facilitator of entire Temtibi Lagoon. Welcomes all to Risa. Curzon Dax's last romantic encounter.
name: Arandis
text: CIVILIAN Youth Music While on Risa, adds [NON]. May use opponent's {Horga'hn} to take double turns. May seed (face up) or report on {Risa}. DL/ {Jamaharon}

lore: Jean-Luc Picard was chosen to administer the Klingon Rite of Succession to select a new High Council Leader. The ritual concluded when one challenger was killed in battle.
name: Arbiter of Succession
text: Two strongest Klingon leaders at one location battle. Place on winner to score points and nullify {Klingon Civil War}. If killed, points transfer to opponent. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Force the Federation to forfeit claim to planet relinquished a century ago by the Klingon Empire.
name: Archanis Dispute
text: OFFICER x2 + Strength>45 + (VIP x3 OR <Kli> personnel OR {any Gowron})

lore: Indigenous inhabitants, such as this Mintakan bowman, often attack an Away Team out of fear.
name: Archer
text: Away Team member with highest total attribute numbers is shot and dies unless SECURITY and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

lore: "You have the power to leave each one of them with a gift proving your affection."
name: Are These Truly Your Friends, Brother?
text: If you have more cards in your discard pile than personnel in this crew or Away Team, examine one card in your discard pile (random selection). If it has a point box with a number, give it to your opponent who immediately scores those points. Otherwise, place it out-of-play. (May not be nullified.)

lore: In 2370, Quark was approached by Sakonna to arrange a covert arms deal to deliver weapons to the Maquis.
name: Arms Deal
text: Unless Acquisition OR Vulcan with Treachery OR Smuggling OR [Maq] personnel present, crew or Away Team "stopped." Discard dilemma.

lore: A malevolent being was formed when the inhabitants of Vagra II rid themselves of all the evil they had inside.
name: Armus - Skin of Evil
text: Kills one Away Team member (random selection). Discard dilemma.

lore: Armus, a remnant of the Vagrans, engulfed William T. Riker in his skin of evil. Only the finesse and skillful negotiation of Jean-Luc Picard resulted in his release.
name: Armus: Sticky Situation
text: Away Team member with highest STRENGTH is stopped if another personnel present has Diplomacy and CUNNING>7, killed otherwise. To get past requires any personnel remaining.

lore: Klingon saboteur. Disguised undercover operative. Assistant to Nilz Baris on Deep Space Station K-7.
name: Arne Darvin
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Klingon Intelligence Biology If on {K-7}, allows you to draw one card every turn that any [Kli] or opponent's [Fed] card reports here.

lore: "How can you write about something that you've never seen? I know! Why don't I take you there?"
name: Ar-Q-ologist
text: Opponent may place up to X cards from this discard pile on top of their draw deck, where X=total number of [*] and DL/ icons on lowest INTEGRITY personnel present. Nullify with Archaeology and Honor present.

lore: The Gorn attackers responsible for eradicating an outpost on Cestus III turned their deadly weaponry on the Enterprise landing party dispatched to investigate.
name: Artillery Attack
text: Kills X personnel (random selection); immediately probe: [*]: X = number of [*] icons on probe card. [Equipment]: X = 0 (discard probe card). Otherwise: X = 1.

lore: Twelve-year-old Ba'ku child. Son of Sojef. Taught Data the importance of play and having a little fun every day.
name: Artim
text: CIVILIAN Youth Your non-Treachery personnel present are each attributes all +1 (or +2 if they also have Youth).

lore: Gifted linguist. Built the Dauntless to deceive and punish the Voyager crew. Blames them for the recent assimilation of his people, "Species 116," by the Borg.
name: Arturis
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Diplomacy Anthropology Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Construct Starship}

lore: The technological advances of the 24th century offer a wide variety of state-of-the-art weaponry. Nevertheless, some still prefer the simple charm of the assassin's blade.
name: Assassin's Blade
text: Unless CUNNING>36 OR 2 SECURITY present, assassin kills one personnel present (opponent's choice) except a shape-shifter or android.

lore: The Klingon dagger of kut'luch is used in a violent ritual of bloodletting that prepares one to become a warrior. Some also use the blade for more unscrupulous purposes.
name: Assassin's Blade (Voyager)
text: Unless CUNNING>36 OR 2 SECURITY present, assassin kills one personnel present (opponent's choice) except a shape-shifter or android.

name: Assign Mission Specialists
text: Seeds or plays on table. You may download to one of your outposts up to two different mission specialists (personnel whose only skill is a regular skill) that you do not already have in play. Also, while in play, each of your mission specialists scores 5 points whenever they use their skill to meet a mission requirement. You may voluntarily discard objective at start of any of your turns. (Unique.)

name: Assign Mission Specialists (Voyager)
text: Seeds or plays on table. You may download to one of your outposts up to two different mission specialists (personnel whose only skill is a regular skill) that you do not already have in play. Also, while in play, each of your mission specialists scores 5 points whenever they use their skill to meet a mission requirement. You may voluntarily discard objective at start of any of your turns. (Unique.)

name: Assign Support Personnel
text: Seeds or plays on table. (Unique.) Your "support personnel" (those who have exactly two skills, but no special skills) may report aboard your compatible ships that have two or more staffing icons. Once each turn, you may discard objective to download a "support personnel" (once per game per Personnel card title) to your matching ship that has two or more staffing icons, or to your matching facility.

name: Assimilate Counterpart
text: Plays on table. Target an opponent's unique male personnel. Your Borg may beam to and battle target's crew or Away Team. One of your Borg who engages target in combat may abduct target. If target is occupying an {Assimilation Table}, you may probe: [Com], [Nav], [Def]: Assimilated as a counterpart. Place on target. Worth 5 points per [*] while objective on target.

name: Assimilate Homeworld
text: Plays on table. Target both a homeworld with no [BO] objective on it and your matching counterpart. Your Borg may scout that homeworld. After scouting complete, if your counterpart is at that location, you may probe: [Com]: Assimilated. Place on mission. Cards of that affiliation (except [AU] cards) may not report to any outpost for rest of game.

name: Assimilate Planet
text: Plays on table. Target a non-homeworld planet mission showing at least 35 points and with no [BO] objective on it. Your Borg may scout that planet. After scouting complete, if you have Borg at that location, you may probe: [Com], [Def]: Assimilated. Place on mission. May download one Objective card.

name: Assimilate Planet (The Borg)
text: Plays on table. Target a non-homeworld planet mission showing at least 35 points and with no [BO] objective on it. Your Borg may scout that planet. After scouting complete, if you have Borg at that location, you may probe: [Com], [Def]: Assimilated. Place on mission. May download one Objective card.

name: Assimilate Species
text: Plays on table; target (name) a species. Your Borg may beam to and battle a crew or Away Team containing a personnel of that species, but may not mortally wound. At end of battle, immediately probe (draw probe card, discard objective): [Def]: Distinctiveness added. If you won battle, and your {Borg Nanoprobes} or {Assimilation Table} present, all stunned personnel of target species present are assimilated.

name: Assimilate Starship
text: Plays on table. Target an opponent's ship. Your Borg may scout that ship. (Whenever no active Borg aboard target during your turn, you may beam one scout aboard.) After scouting complete, if your Borg have Computer Skill aboard that ship, you may probe: [Com], [Def]: Assimilated. Place on ship. May download one Objective card.

name: Assimilate Starship (The Borg)
text: Plays on table. Target an opponent's ship. Your Borg may scout that ship. (Whenever no active Borg aboard target during your turn, you may beam one scout aboard.) After scouting complete, if your Borg have Computer Skill aboard that ship, you may probe: [Com], [Def]: Assimilated. Place on ship. May download one Objective card.

lore: Proving that resistance is not always futile, Worf gave the Borg something else to assimilate.
name: Assimilate This!
text: Nullifies {Build Interplexing Beacon} OR {Crosis} OR {Orbital Bombardment}. (Also, owner of that card loses points, even if playing Borg.)

lore: Functions: Equip drone initiates with specialized adaptive implants. Access counterpart biological data; encode heuristic pathways. Augment collective distinctiveness.
name: Assimilation Table
text: Holds one personnel (occupant killed if table destroyed). Once per turn, in place of one card draw, you may download to occupant {an Implant} card.

lore: Specially equipped drones use tubule-shaped talons capable of penetrating any known alloy or energy field. Nanoprobes in the bloodstream recode the victim's DNA.
name: Assimilation Tubules
text: Plays during battle after a winner is determined. Your {Talon Drone} may select one opposing mortally wounded personnel present to instead be assimilated.

lore: Help group of former Borg to unite and end anarchy.
name: Assist Cooperative
text: ENGINEER + SCIENCE + Computer Skill x2 * +10 if you have a [Com] personnel present.

lore: Hoping to avoid detection by a Romulan Warbird, the U.S.S. Enterprise entered a giant asteroid cavern in 2370.
name: Asteroid Sanctuary
