text: Plays on any ship. If 2 Navigation aboard, hides ship to prevent any battle initiated against that ship for this turn.

lore: Spatial phenomenon created by an intrusion of subspace into normal space. The resulting discharges of plasmatic energy caused the destruction of a Vostigye science station.
name: Astral Eddy
text: Unless Navigation, Physics, and 2 ENGINEER present, one crew member (random selection) is killed.

lore: Charged particles in the atmosphere of planets which can disrupt transporter beams.
name: Atmospheric Ionization
text: Plays crosswise on any planet location. Maximum of three personnel per turn can be beamed up or down at this location. (Unique.)

lore: Upon encountering Dominion ships during a rescue attempt in 2370, Captain Keogh ordered the U.S.S. Odyssey and two runabouts to execute a predetermined attack pattern.
name: Attack Pattern Delta
text: Plays at start of ship battle. Doubles one {Tactical Console} until end of battle OR draw up to X additional Tactic cards, where X = the number of your ships in this battle.

name: Attack Wing
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +1 for each of your ships firing. DEFENSE bonus +1 if you have a Jem'Hadar attack ship defending. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% Sickbay damaged: randomly kills one MEDICAL, Exobiology or disabled personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Infirmary}).

lore: Computer controlled self-destruct countdown which can be set by the senior officers aboard a ship.
name: Auto-Destruct Sequence
text: Plays on your ship. Ship self-destructs at end of your turn. Explosion damages all other ships at same location that have SHIELDS<8.

lore: When in a hopeless situation facing insurmountable odds, most starship captains would sooner destroy their own vessel than to let it fall into enemy hands.
name: Auto-Destruct Sequence (Voyager)
text: Plays on your ship. Ship self-destructs at end of your turn. Explosion damages all other ships at same location that have SHIELDS<8.

lore: A hidden security subroutine on Deep Space 9 triggered an old Cardassian counterinsurgency program. It was designed to quell any uprising of non-Cardassian workers.
name: Automated Security System
text: Plays on {Ops}. End of every turn, targets one personnel present (random selection). That personnel is killed unless its species is Cardassian. May be nullified by 3 ENGINEER.

lore: Aid colony threatened with destruction by a stellar core fragment.
name: Avert Danger
text: Stellar Cartography + CUNNING>35 OR Astrophysics + CUNNING>35

lore: Historic time of Earth's first warp flight and contact with extraterrestrials.
name: Montana Missile Complex
text: Plays on table. Seed {Phoenix} beneath this location from outside the game ({any Zefram Cochrane} may acquire it later); Borg player may download {Stop First Contact}. Once Phoenix has taken off or {Vulcan Lander} has landed here, nullifies Stop First Contact. Native to this timeline: Zefram Cochrane, {Lily Sloane}, Phoenix, Vulcan Lander, {Solkar}, {Sevek}, {T'Shonra} and {Kathleen Tonell}.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; any Scotty; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Chief Engineer of the Starship Enterprise. Scotty was rescued by the U.S.S. Enterprise after he spent 75 years in the pattern buffer of the U.S.S. Jenolen.
name: Montgomery Scott
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Astrophysics Honor Miracle Worker Transporter Skill

lore: Member of Bajoran Institute of Science. Odo's foster father. Dr. Mora encouraged Odo to adopt humanoid form. Reconciled with his estranged "son" in 2373.
name: Mora Pol
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Exobiology x 2

lore: Klingon officer who stole Federation data from Relay Station 47.
name: Morag
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Greed

lore: Tactical officer of I.K.C. Voq'leng. Devout believer in the prophecies of the Sacred Scrolls. Banded with T'Greth in an attempt to commandeer U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Morak
text: SCIENCE Transporter Skill Astrophysics Physics If on {I.K.C. Voq'leng}, it is attributes all +1.

lore: Developer of the "Mordock Strategy." Became first Benzite in Starfleet, outscoring Wesley Crusher for appointment to the Academy. Looks like Mendon.
name: Mordock
text: SCIENCE Missions you solve are +5 points. Bonus points lost if you ever battle in this game. Computer Skill Physics

lore: Captain Morgan Bateson was in command of the U.S.S. Bozeman when it was caught in a temporal causality loop from 2278 to 2368.
name: Morgan Bateson
text: OFFICER Leadership Stellar Cartography

lore: Klingon agent sent by the High Council to keep Ruwon and Karina under surveillance. Accused Odo of insulting his honor. Threatened retribution.
name: Morka
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Klingon Intelligence Geology Stellar Cartography

lore: Lurian. Freighter captain. Frequent patron of Quark's. Part of the infamous Lissepian Mother's Day Heist. Hides a small fortune in latinum in his second stomach.
name: Morn
text: CIVILIAN Navigation Greed Acquisition Smuggling ENGINEER Biology DL/ {Gold-Pressed Latinum}

lore: Security officer. Led an assault team that boarded the U.S.S. Enterprise on Lurin's order. Befuddled by Commander Riker's bogus computer lesson.
name: Morta
text: SECURITY Computer Skill ENGINEER Geology DL/ {Prepare Assault Teams}

lore: Q was made human and evicted from the Continuum due to antics. Retained his other fine qualities.
name: Mortal Q
text: CIVILIAN Physics x 10 Geology x 10 Leadership x -1 Nullify each dilemma named {Q} you encounter. Once in play, your Q-Continuum side deck is closed.

lore: Solitary theoretician. Signed aboard U.S.S. Voyager to meet an admissions requirement at a cosmological institute. Not even his mother called him Mortimer.
name: Mortimer Harren
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics x 2 Stellar Cartography

characteristicsKeywords: Bolian; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Bolian male. Convivial barber aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Snappy conversationalist.
name: Mot the Barber
text: CIVILIAN Barbering

lore: Mr. Mot offered sage advice to his customers on a variety of subjects, but there was only one thing you could really learn from him.
name: Mot's Advice
text: Plays on any one personnel. While in play, that personnel gains the skill of Barbering.

lore: Vidiian sculptor. Would have died of the phage if not for lungs stolen from Neelix. Willing to be punished. When shown mercy instead, responded in kind to save Neelix.
name: Motura
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy x 2 SCIENCE Honor Anthropology Music DL/ {Dereth}

characteristicsKeywords: Romulan; Duras-related; General; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Romulan general who secretly provided military supplies to Duras family forces during the Klingon Civil War in 2368
name: Movar
text: OFFICER Treachery Anthropology

lore: Ferengi mercenary. Very good engineer and cook. Brunt is loyal to his partner, Ezri, with whom he is secretly infatuated. Unfortunately, he's not her type.
name: Mr. Brunt
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Navigation Honor Archaeology When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Quark}.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Male; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
lore: The Cardassian Elim Garak taught Secret Agent Julian Bashir: "There comes a point when the odds are against you and the only reasonable course of action is to quit."
name: Mr. Garak
text: CIVILIAN May end a mission attempt he is involved in just after any dilemma killed your personnel. Treachery

lore: Silent, imbibing, lurching, uttaberry-eating, faithful servant of Lwaxana Troi. The only words he was known to speak were, "Thanks for the drinks."
name: Mr. Homn
text: CIVILIAN Empaths may report for duty where present. May nullify {Empathic Echo} where present.

lore: Nog is thankful to the Intendant for making him the bartender and owner of his uncle's bar. Distrusts tall men. Likes tall women.
name: Mr. Nog
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Greed Physics Treachery DL/ {Bribery} When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Brunt}.

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Bartender; Capturing-related card; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Bartender who pretends to work for the Alliance. Quark secretly helps Terran slaves escape from Terok Nor.
name: Mr. Quark
text: CIVILIAN Smuggling Honor Computer Skill x 2 Anthropology Diplomacy DL/ {Rescue Captives} When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Rom}.

lore: Scientist who developed a mind control device using E-band emissions. Controlled Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge through his VISOR.
name: Taibak
text: SCIENCE Treachery Biology Computer Skill

lore: Obtain information and supplies from culture with highly ritualistic and gestural language.
name: Tak Tak Negotiation
text: Diplomacy x3 + CUNNING>35 OR {Neelix}

lore: Jem'Hadar Third. Delivered the proclamation that Alpha Quadrant species were no longer welcome in the Gamma Quadrant... and would be destroyed.
name: Talak'talan
text: OFFICER SECURITY Transporter Skill Astrophysics DL/ {Ultimatum} OR {Dominion PADD}

characteristicsKeywords: Vulcan/Romulan; Female; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: Female Romulan mercenary. In reality a physically altered Vulcan isolationist seeking the Stone of Gol.
name: Tallera
text: SECURITY Computer Skill SCIENCE Mindmeld Leadership Treachery

lore: Telepathic aliens with the power to create illusory worlds, often based on the memories of life-forms they've captured. Starfleet General Order 7 forbids contact with their homeworld, Talos IV.
name: Talosian Cage
text: Unless 3 Empathy OR {Christopher Pike} present, opponent may choose to discard two females (random selection) OR male with most [*] icons. Discard dilemma.

lore: Betazoid male with exceptional empathic abilities. Participated in the notorious Ghorusda disaster. Specialist in first contact with new life-forms.
name: Tam Elbrun
text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2 Honor

lore: "Children of Tama. Vorath's sword raised high. Dathon, speaking first. Tama and Enterprise at El-Adrel. Tama's tears, shivering in the wind."
name: Tama
text: Particle Scattering Device

lore: Female nurse. Member of Romulan underground. Supported Ambassador Spock's efforts to reunify Romulus and Vulcan.
name: Tamarith
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Biology Honor Music X=2 if with another Romulan underground member.

lore: Unusually old Ocampa male with strong psychokinetic powers. Follower of Suspiria. Delivered Voyager to her so she could avenge the death of her mate, the Caretaker.
name: Tanis
text: CIVILIAN Empathy x 2 SCIENCE Biology Leadership Treachery

lore: Alien device that vaporizes victims at the touch of a button. Used by James Tiberius Kirk to achieve his captaincy. A Kirk not from his universe revealed its secret to First Officer Spock.
name: Tantalus Field
text: Place on your [MQ] ship here. (Unique.) Once each turn, may discard top card of draw deck to kill a [Univ] personnel here OR discard top three to kill a unique personnel here.

lore: Aid investigation of outpost that disappeared on this planet.
name: Tarchannen Study
text: ENGINEER x2 + {I.P. Scanner} + Holodeck No outposts or stations allowed here.

lore: Ship containing the survivors of a Tarellia war plague. Infected from biological weapons, they are now refused entry everywhere.
name: Tarellian Plague Ship
text: Entire crew immediately dies from plague unless MEDICAL "beams over" (discarded) to Tarellians. Discard dilemma.

name: Target Engines
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Dominion ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% RANGE enhancements off line.

name: Target Shields
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Otherwise, drains target's SHIELDS ([Down]). SHIELDS enhancements off line.

name: Target These Coordinates
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 1. Hit = [Down][Flip] (or [Down][Flip][Flip] if target is affected by {Weak Spot}). Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Shields fluctuating: opponent's transporters, if operated by Transporter Skill personnel, may beam through SHIELDS.

name: Target Warp Field Coils
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. May not be used to fire upon a facility. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Warp drive off line: opponent may immediately download {Engine Imbalance} to this ship as an interrupt (immune to {Amanda Rogers}).

name: Target Weapons
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Dominion ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% WEAPONS enhancements off line.

lore: Female subcommander. Captain of the warbird Haakona. Investigated the Federation incursion of the Neutral Zone in the vicinity of Iconia.
name: Taris
text: OFFICER Archaeology MEDICAL Music Transporter Skill

lore: An Ullian "telepathic historian" who uses empathic skills to recall detailed historical information from his volunteers' memories.
name: Tarmin
text: V.I.P. Once per game, may glance at the cards in any one side deck for 10 seconds. Empathy

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Lieutenant Natasha Yar served as chief of security on the U.S.S. Enterprise. Courageous orphan of Turkana IV. Proved Lt. Commander Data fully functional.
name: Tasha Yar
text: SECURITY Honor Leadership

lore: Traveled to 2344 and helped prevent a disastrous war. Survivor of the Battle of Narendra III. Consort of Romulan general. Mother of Sela.
name: Tasha Yar - Alternate
text: SECURITY Honor Leadership DL/ {Starfleet Type II Phaser}

lore: Aid project to delay solidification of the planet's core.
name: Avert Disaster
text: Geology + Honor + INTEGRITY>35

lore: Each Borg drone is tied into a sophisticated subspace communications network, allowing quick activation in response to a threat.
name: Awaken
text: Downloads one [Com] or [Nav] drone. OR Plays at start of battle to download to one of your ships at that location one [Def] drone (two if opponent initiated the battle).

lore: The Borg do not typically take preemptive measures against potential hazards. Once a threat is established, however, resources are allocated both swiftly and efficiently.
name: Awaken (The Borg)
text: Downloads one [Com] or [Nav] drone. OR Plays at start of battle to download to one of your ships at that location one [Def] drone (two if opponent initiated the battle).

lore: Daughter of Chancellor Gorkon; became chancellor herself in 2293. Pursued his dream of peace with the Federation, signing the historic Khitomer Accords.
name: Azetbur
text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy Exobiology DL/ {Treaty: Federation/Klingon}

lore: Bronwyn Gail Robinson served on the U.S.S. Enterprise. Romantically involved with Thadiun Okona. Responsible for reporting the daily planet-to-ship transport logs.
name: B.G. Robinson
text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Youth Anthropology DL/ {Pattern Enhancers}

lore: 1/2 Klingon, 1/2 Romulan. Romantically involved with Lieutenant Worf. Born in Romulan prison camp in Carraya system.
name: Ba'el
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Youth

lore: The Bajoran homeworld is Bajor. The Bajorans establish outposts throughout their territory.
name: Bajoran Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Bajoran ENGINEER.

lore: The xenophobic Alliance for Global Unity attempted to overthrow the Bajoran provisional government in 2370.
name: Bajoran Civil War
text: Plays on table. Your Bajoran leaders may initiate battle against other Bajorans. OR Downloads two [Univ] Bajoran OFFICER, SECURITY or Resistance personnel. Discard event.

lore: Standard Bajoran Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
name: Bajoran PADD
text: Bajoran use only. Each of your personnel present is CUNNING +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Standard-issue phased energy weapon of the Bajoran Militia. Provides firepower equivalent to that of the Starfleet type II phaser.
name: Bajoran Phaser
text: Bajoran and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

name: Bajoran Phaser Banks
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 1. ATTACK and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a Bajoran ship firing with Resistance or Navigation aboard (or +4 if one crew member has both skills). Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

lore: Enhanced energy rifle used by the Bajoran Militia. Popular among members of the resistance during the Cardassian occupation of Bajor.
name: Bajoran Phaser Rifle
text: Bajoran and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

name: Bajoran Resistance Cell
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your [Baj] Resistance personnel may report for free to your [Baj] facility or ship or to any Bajor Region planet. Also, your Bajoran espionage cards may not be nullified. Once each turn, you may download a Bajoran espionage card to one of your unsolved missions (limit one per mission), then draw two cards if you have at least two [Baj] Resistance personnel in play.

name: Bajoran Shrine
requires: disruptor; Kai; Orb artifact; Prylar; Vedek;
text: Prylars, Vedeks, and Kais may report here. Once each turn, any player who has a Prylar, Vedek, or Kai unopposed here with any other Bajoran may "conduct services": discard one card from hand, place bottom card of discard pile beneath draw deck or out-of-play, then draw one card (or two if any Orb artifact is present). Unless station is under [Baj] or [Fed] control, Shrine is suspended and may be destroyed by any personnel using {a disruptor} at an adjacent site. {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

name: Bajoran Wormhole
text: Requires two Bajoran Wormhole cards; each inserts into a spaceline to create a location (span 1). Play one in Alpha Quadrant (Bajor Region); download the other to Gamma Quadrant. Limit one per quadrant. While in play, any ship may move from one end to the other, then is "stopped." OR Plays at any time to nullify any card which is closing or destroying Bajoran Wormhole (discard doorway).

name: Bajoran Wormhole: Mirror Universe
text: Seeds (in any phase) or plays in Mirror Quadrant. Limit one. Inserts into spaceline to create a Bajor Region location (span 1); any player may download {Bajoran Wormhole}. Any ship may move between here and another Bajoran Wormhole if damaged or if ENGINEER and SCIENCE aboard, then is "stopped." OR Plays at any time to nullify any card which is closing or destroying Bajoran Wormhole (discard doorway).

lore: Deadly plasma coolant flooded main engineering through a rupture opened by Data. Survival depended upon balance and strength. Resistance was futile.
name: Balancing Act
text: Each player whose missions with point boxes were mostly [S] or mostly [P] (by a difference of 3 or more), when seeded, loses 50 points (even if playing Borg).

lore: Rarely had Tuvok been in a more precarious position than at a Nezu colony, halfway between the ionosphere and the planet surface, dangling from a bottom of a mag-lev carriage.
name: Balancing Act (Voyager)
text: Each player whose missions with point boxes were mostly [S] or mostly [P] (by a difference of 3 or more), when seeded, loses 50 points (even if playing Borg).

lore: Humanoid envoy from the First Federation. Gentle, benevolent, and mature adult male, despite his youthful appearance. Enjoys drinking tranya.
name: Balok
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Honor Leadership

characteristicsKeywords: Captain; Male; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: Male captain of a mercenary ship raiding archaeological sites to find the Stone of Gol.
name: Baran
text: OFFICER Greed Archaeology Exobiology Computer Skill

lore: Humanoid child orphaned by his homeworld's invasion. Secreted on Alpha Onias III in a cavern equipped with advanced holotechnology. Bonded with William T. Riker.
name: Barash
text: CIVILIAN Your [Bar] personnel may report here (for free, once each turn). Doubles {Hologram Ruse}. Youth

lore: The U.S.S. Enterprise features a fully equipped barber shop, including the traditional helical pole.
name: Barber Pole
text: Plays on table.

lore: Lt. Reginald Barclay refused to transport out of fear. When forced to transport in 2369, he saw creatures in the beam and believed he had transporter psychosis.
name: Barclay Transporter Phobia
text: Plays during transport by beaming, {Dimensional Shifting} or {Iconian Gateway}. One personnel (random selection) refuses all transport until cured with {Plexing}.

lore: Contagious affliction which causes animals to de-evolve into ancestral forms. Disease named for Lieutenant Reginald Barclay.
name: Barclay's Protomorphosis Disease
text: Entire crew or Away Team (except androids) de-evolves (dies) unless MEDICAL, SCIENCE and SECURITY present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Skilled thief and decryption expert. Bareil Antos was romantically involved with both the Intendant and Kira Nerys, who gave him an Orb experience.
name: Bareil
names: The Intendant;Kira Nerys  The Intendant;Kira Nerys
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill x 2 SECURITY Biology Honor Anthropology Treachery DL/ {Any Equipment card}

lore: Vedek. Follows springball religiously. Romantically involved with Kira Nerys. Began spiritual service as a gardener; still enjoys tending the grounds.
name: Bareil Antos
text: V.I.P. Anthropology Diplomacy x 2 Honor SCIENCE Biology

lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Bajorans in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Bajoran - Bareil Antos - is part of us now."
name: Bareil of Borg
text: V.I.P. Anthropology Diplomacy x 2 Honor SCIENCE Biology While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Baj].

lore: Outcast Klingon agent posing as a human trader. Former alias: Arne Darvin. Plotted to destroy James T. Kirk. Envisioned his statue in the Hall of Warriors.
name: Barry Waddle
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Navigation Computer Skill May nullify {HQ: Return Orb to Bajor}. DL/ {Tribble Bomb}

lore: Baryon particles build up on a ship's hull after prolonged warp travel. Particles must be periodically removed with a baryon sweep, which requires evacuation of the ship.
name: Baryon Buildup
text: Plays on ship. RANGE is reduced by 2. (Cumulative.) Nullified if ship is empty and docked at your facility at the beginning of your turn.

name: Barzan Wormhole
text: Seeds (in any phase) or plays in Gamma or Delta Quadrant (limit one). Inserts into spaceline; creates a location (span 2). Any ship may move between {Wormhole Terminus} mission and here, then is "stopped." OR Once each turn, plays to relocate Barzan Wormhole to a new location in Gamma or Delta Quadrant; discard doorway.

lore: Benjamin Sisko was forced to abandon Deep Space 9 to spare Bajor from the Dominion's wrath. He left his prized baseball behind as a message to Gul Dukat that he would return.
name: Baseball
text: Plays to score points if you just commandeered opponent's facility. Lose points if opponent regains control.

lore: Changeling posing as Julian Bashir. Tried to destroy an entire fleet by causing the Bajoran sun to go nova.
name: Bashir Founder
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Treachery DL/ {Supernova} ({Tox Uthat} not required; opponent must have total usable WEAPONS>36 at this location).

characteristicsKeywords: blade weapon; hand weapon; Klingon-related Equipment;
lore: Traditional blade weapon of the Klingon warrior. According to legend, the first bat'leth, or "sword of honor," was forged by Kahless the Unforgettable some fifteen centuries ago.
name: Bat'leth
text: Each of your Klingons present is STRENGTH +2, and in each battle one of them may mortally wound one adversary they just stunned. (Cumulative.)

name: Battle Bridge Door
text: Place one atop Battle Bridge side deck during the seed phase. Battle Bridge is now open and in play (immune to cards which close doorways). OR Stock in deck and play at start of ship battle (even during opponent's turn) if you have Leadership in that battle. Allows you to draw two extra Tactic cards (cumulative) or enhances each of your ships' and facilities' WEAPONS +1; then discard doorway.

lore: Small ship owned and commanded by Neelix. Ugliest thing he ever saw, though its appearance grew on him.
name: Baxial
text: Tractor Beam May report for free to {Neelix}'s location.

lore: An aggressive 1/2 Klingon, 1/2 human, B'Elanna Torres left Starfleet Academy during her second year. Joined the Maquis after Captain Chakotay saved her life.
name: B'Elanna
text: ENGINEER SECURITY Computer Skill x 2 Astrophysics If aboard a [Maq] ship, it is attributes all +2.

lore: The half-human B'Elanna Torres embraced her Klingon heritage in dealing with the Voq'leng crew. With Kohlar's help, she convinced them her child was the Kuvah'Magh.
name: B'Elanna Daughter of Miral
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Leadership Diplomacy Honor Computer Skill x 2

lore: Former Maquis who became chief engineer of U.S.S. Voyager. Her Klingon and human halves are often at odds with each other. Married Tom Paris in 2377.
name: B'Elanna Torres
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Astrophysics Cybernetics Transporter Skill

lore: Former Maquis who became chief engineer of U.S.S. Voyager. Her Klingon and human halves are often at odds with each other. Married Tom Paris in 2377.
name: B'Elanna Torres*
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Astrophysics Cybernetics Transporter Skill

lore: Rare disease which affects aging Vulcans. A profound loss of mental control leads to emotional outbursts, elicits violence in others and eventually kills its victim.
name: Bendii Syndrome
text: One Vulcan without Youth present (opponent's choice) dies the next time you score points. Until then, all your personnel are INTEGRITY -2 where present.

lore: Cardassian Gul of the Eighth Order. Intercepted the U.S.S. Defiant en route to Cardassia Prime. Covert arms dealer with suspected Kressari connections.
name: Benil
text: OFFICER Leadership Biology Greed Smuggling

lore: The Tkon Empire was so advanced that it possessed the ability to move planets at will. The empire became extinct some 600,000 years ago during the Age of Makto.
name: Blade of Tkon
text: Immediately relocate one planet location, and all cards there, to a different place on the spaceline. Discard artifact.

lore: Sometimes obtaining information from locals requires consuming beverages of dubious nutritional value. It's best not to criticize such "counseling techniques."
name: Blended
text: To get past requires Empathy, Diplomacy, {Morn} or {any Scotty}. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (random selection).

name: Blood Oath
text: Plays on a non-Borg personnel who has INTEGRITY<8 and no Honor. Adds <R) icon beginning at start of your next turn. OR Plays on table. While you have two (R> personnel present together, all <R) personnel lose their first-listed skill and, in place of your normal card draw, you may download to that location {I.K.C. Ning'tao}, {I.K.C. Lukara}, {I.K.C. Gr'oth}, {Bat'leth}, {Blood Oath} or one (R> personnel.

lore: Blood tests are a standard method for exposing changelings. Though infiltrators are eventually found, the random testing engenders distrust among suspicious crew members.
name: Blood Screening
text: Plays on any shape-shifter who is infiltrating; exposed when countdown expires. Crew or Away Team is quarantined and may not pool their skills. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

name: Blue Alert
text: Seeds or plays on table. Each of your Intrepid-class ships and ships with no staffing requirements may use 2 RANGE to land or take off once each turn. Also, your shuttlecraft may be carried aboard and launched from your ships that have Tractor Beam. (Captain's Order.)

name: Bluegill Infestation
text: Seeds on table; place up to seven unique personnel face up beneath here from outside the game. Your copies of those personnel in play are STRENGTH +5, considered Bluegills, and may not be stunned. Also, when one of your Bluegills is killed, you must randomly select a personnel from here; if it matches one who was killed, that personnel was considered to be the Bluegill Queen. (Unique.)

name: Boarding Party
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your Boarding Pod may move to "ram" any ship present. Personnel on Pod go aboard; discard Pod. Also, once each turn, your Kazon aboard opponent's ship may use its transporters (ignoring its SHIELDS) OR steal an Equipment card aboard (score points; discard objective) OR download {Commandeer Ship} there (score double points; discard objective).

lore: Centurion serving the Romulan Star Empire. Once marooned on Galorndon Core with Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge.
name: Bochra
text: OFFICER Navigation Youth

name: Bodyguards
text: Seeds or plays on table. At start of any personnel battle, each of your bodyguards and leaders who has SECURITY in that battle may exclude from battle one of your V.I.P. or CIVILIAN personnel. If you have a non-Borg Leadership personnel or a [Def] drone remaining in the battle, instead of shuffling your combat pile you may pre-arrange the order in which your personnel will fight. Discard incident.

lore: Glinn. Cardassian biotechnology expert. Jeopardized his career when he was bribed by Quark to order a classified cranial implant for Elim Garak.
name: Boheeka
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Cybernetics Smuggling Greed

lore: Former Ferengi DaiMon. Son killed by Captain Jean-Luc Picard in battle. Seeks revenge at all costs.
name: Bok
text: OFFICER Greed ENGINEER Treachery Computer Skill

lore: Old freighter suspected of transporting weapons to Cardassian colonies in the Demilitarized Zone. Briefly commanded by Boheeka early in his military career.
name: Bok'Nor
text: Smuggling personnel in crew may use hand weapons to complete "{cargo runs.}"

lore: Cardassian surgically altered to resemble retired Starfleet officer Raymond Boone. Spied on the Federation. Attempted to frame Miles O'Brien.
name: Boone Impersonator
text: ENGINEER Treachery Computer Skill Physics DL/ {Counterintelligence}

lore: Groundskeeper at Starfleet Academy for more than 50 years. Has mentored countless cadets. Half the captains in Starfleet wouldn't be where they are without him.
name: Boothby
text: CIVILIAN Your [Fed] Youth personnel may report where present and are each attributes all +2 while here. Biology

lore: Male trained in science and exoarchaeology. Studied the effects of stolen Bajoran Orbs on the Cardassian nervous system. Had an unpleasant Orb experience.
name: Borad
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Archaeology Youth

lore: Operative sent to Deep Space 9 in 2371 to spy on Romulan delegates. Modified a replicator to beam a surveillance device near the Romulans' quarters.
name: Bo'rak
text: ENGINEER Cybernetics Transporter Skill Astrophysics Klingon Intelligence

lore: Vorta analyst. Subjected the captured crew members of the U.S.S. Defiant to a simulated invasion of the Alpha Quadrant in order to study their response.
name: Borath
text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Exobiology Cybernetics Treachery

lore: Male Vorgon criminal from the future. Aims to steal artifacts with partner Ajur. Once hunted the Tox Uthat discovered by Jean-Luc Picard on Risa.
name: Boratus
text: SECURITY Once per game, if alone with Archaeology on a planet, may peek at all but 3 seed cards here (opponent's choice).

name: Borg Cutting Beam
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 3. If you hit, you may relocate one of target's crew members (random selection; from any one site if on a Nor) to one of your ships in this battle and assimilate that personnel. Hit or direct hit = [Down]. Hull: -40%

lore: Borg information storage unit containing assimilation logistics, sensor telemetry, and vessel movements. Voyager salvaged these from the wreckage of a destroyed probe in 2375.
name: Borg Data Node
text: If present with a [Com] Borg, once each turn, may download one {Adapt} card to hand OR glance for 10 seconds at crew of any one ship or top card of any player's draw deck.

lore: It had been eight years, seven months, sixteen days, four minutes and twenty-two seconds since Data last experienced physical forms of pleasure.
name: Borg Kiss
text: Plays if you just probed for {Assimilate Counterpart}. Ignore result, draw probe card and probe again. OR Plays to draw one card for each [*] on a male you've abducted.

lore: Submicroscopic robots saturating a Borg's bloodstream. Injected into potential new drones, beginning their assimilation. Modified by the Voyager crew to use as a weapon against Species 8472.
name: Borg Nanoprobes
text: Once per turn, where present, may abduct and assimilate one personnel just stunned by your [Def] drone OR nullify a Species 8472-related dilemma (except {Gravimetric Distortion}).

lore: Picard used a tricorder to decode the memory chip implanted in the chest of a Borg drone. This chip records all instructions the drone has received from the collective.
name: Borg Neuroprocessor
text: Glance at one face-down [HA] card. OR Plays if a Borg or {Rogue Borg} has died and you have {any tricorder} in play. Nullifies a [BO] interrupt or all Rogue Borg in play.

lore: Identification: BORG OUTPOST Task: Construct Borg vessels. Disseminate resources.
name: Borg Outpost
text: Seed one at any [S] mission with no affiliation icons OR build at such a mission (or at an assimilated planet) where you have a Borg ENGINEER. DL/ {Transwarp Network Gateway}

lore: Identification: BORG QUEEN'S SHIP Task: Execute assignments under personal command of the Borg Queen.
name: Borg Queen's Ship
text: May be fully staffed by {Borg Queen}. Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

lore: Borg nanotechnological servomechanism. Can remain dormant and undetected until activated. Typical first evidence of assimilation. Rapidly takes over its victim.
name: Borg Servo
text: Unless Cybernetics and MEDICAL present, opponent (if playing Borg) assimilates one personnel present (random selection). Discard dilemma.

lore: Gigantic cubic ship of the Borg collective. Possesses powerful weapons and remarkable regenerative abilities.
name: Borg Ship
text: Place at furthest spaceline end. End of every turn: Attacks all ships, then moves. Worth points if destroyed in battle.

lore: Functions: Process and disseminate information relevant to the collective. Established transneural connections between drones. Purge individuality; bring order to chaos.
name: Borg Vinculum
text: If your [Com] Borg present, all your Borg at this location present with a [Com] Borg share regular skills (each has every such skill at highest level). (Immune to {Disruptor Overload}.)

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; DaiMon; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: DaiMon in command of the Kreechta. Observed war games between the U.S.S. Enterprise and the U.S.S. Hathaway. Attempted to claim the latter as salvage.
name: Bractor
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Stellar Cartography DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

lore: In Lt. Commander Data's dream, his perception of the leech-like interphasic creatures aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise was symbolized by the surreal actions of his friends.
name: Brain Drain
text: Plays (once every turn) on any crew or Away Team. Remove all skills and CUNNING from one personnel present until end of turn. OR Plays on {Interphasic Plasma Creatures}, doubling effects.

lore: Geordi La Forge was mentally reprogrammed to do the Romulans' bidding by a machine that accessed his mind through his VISOR's direct neural implants.
name: Brainwash
text: Plays on one personnel you've captured. Captive reports to your outpost, is under your control and may mix with your personnel regardless of affiliation.

lore: Powerful disruptor often brokered by Hagath. Guaranteed to cut through reactive armor up to 15 centimeters and shields up to 4.6 gigajoules. Quick recharge. Expensive, but well worth it.
name: Breen CRM114
text: Reports to your Breen or arms dealer. At start of battle, kills up to 5 {Rogue Borg} present. Once each turn, this Away Team may attack a landed ship or facility on same planet (damaged=[Flip]).

name: Breen Disruptor Burst
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Breen ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -35% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Breen Energy-Dampening Weapon
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 1. Requires a ship with Energy Dampener firing. Hit or direct hit = [Down][Flip] and, unless target is {U.S.S. Sao Paulo}, is {I.K.C. Ki'tang}, or has Energy Dampener, "power surge" also disables RANGE and WEAPONS. Hull: -20% Power surge: special equipment off line. Discard this damage marker at end of opponent's next turn.

name: Bribery
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your Smuggling or Greed personnel may discard one of your {Gold-Pressed Latinum} present to add [FER] to your mission there (except {Ferenginar}) until end of your next turn OR to prevent one entire point loss of up to 9 points just incurred there (discard incident) OR to release (and relocate to that personnel) one of your personnel held captive there.

lore: Jadzia Dax became romantically involved with Meridian native Deral. Dax was so enamored she attempted to follow Deral when Meridian returned to its non-corporeal state.
name: Brief Romance
text: Opponent specifies "male" or "female." Place on one personnel present of that gender (random selection). That personnel is "stopped" until countdown expires.

lore: Military advisor to the High Council leader. Loyally served both Gorkon and Azetbur, though bitterly opposed to peace with the Federation.
name: Brigadier Kerla
text: SECURITY Stellar Cartography Navigation Transporter Skill DL/ Any [Films] Klingon Chancellor

lore: Cardassian officer quickly promoted to legate in the wake of Damar's defection. Says he believes in the Dominion. Strives in vain to please the Founder.
name: Broca
text: V.I.P. Archaeology Geology ENGINEER Treachery

lore: Liquidator with the Ferengi Commerce Authority. Rude. Arrogant. Corrupt. Despised and envied by Ferengi everywhere. Strives to ruin Quark.
name: Brunt
text: V.I.P. FCA x 2 Treachery x 2 Navigation Law Greed Computer Skill DL/ {Writ of Accountability}

lore: Personal shuttle commanded by Brunt during his numerous liquidations. Transported Quark's rag-tag negotiation team to Empok Nor to rescue Ishka.
name: Brunt's Shuttle
text: May report with crew to docking site of opponent's (or uncontrolled) {Empok Nor}.

lore: Suppress Kriosian rebels seeking foothold here.
name: Brute Force
text: STRENGTH>10 x number of Away Team members (minimum 3 personnel).

name: Build Interplexing Beacon
text: Suspends your {Assimilate Homeworld} targeting {Earth}, if your {Stop First Contact} was nullified. Target a ship. Your Borg may scout target. If your Borg are aboard target orbiting {2063 Earth}, you may probe: [Com], [Def]: Transponder rods are now set in place. [Nav]: If transponder rods set, place on ship; Timeline disrupted in 2063 and suspended objective completed.

lore: Dukat and Kira Nerys found the wreckage of the Ravinok on Dozaria in 2371. Twelve crash victims, including Dukat's mistress Tora Naprem, were buried there.
name: Burial Ground
text: Plays once per turn on any player. That player must "bury" (place out-of-play) from their discard pile one card (their choice) and all other cards there of the same card type.

lore: Harry Kim played the role of Captain Proton's trusty sidekick through fiery volcanoes, crash landings, killer robots, alien invasions, and the Den of Crocodiles.
name: Buster Kincaid
text: OFFICER If with {Captain Proton}, you may discard two cards from hand to draw one. Navigation

lore: A star in the Bynars' system went nova in 2364. Only their expertise with computers allowed them to transfer information from their main computer in time to save their world.
name: Bynars Data Transfer
text: Plays on table. Glance at the top five cards of your draw deck. Place them in any order on top of and/or beneath your draw deck, then place event beneath draw deck.

lore: Binary race closely integrated with computers. Always work in pairs. Bynars have the ability to enhance specific computerized systems.
name: Bynars Weapon Enhancement
text: Plays on ship. Ship is WEAPONS +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Ambassador to Nimbus III. Hides disdain for the position with overeagerness. Released the pain of her deception when Sybok enlisted her help in the search for Vorta Vor.
name: Caithlin Dar
text: V.I.P. May work with {Sybok}, {St. John Talbot}, and {General Korrd}. Youth Honor Diplomacy Exobiology

lore: An intelligent species that exists as ionized gas and can travel in space. Penetrated the shields of the U.S.S. Enterprise seeking revenge on Q in 2366.
name: Calamarain
text: Plays at location of opponent's choice. Moves like a ship (RANGE=6). May damage (not destroy) one ship OR kill {Mortal Q} at same location (discard event). (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Independent freighter commanded by Zef'No. In 2370, ran weapons supplied by the Cardassians to the Bajoran isolationists of the Circle.
name: Calondon
text: Smuggling personnel in crew may use hand weapons to complete "{cargo runs.}"

lore: Site of the ground-breaking peace talks between the Federation and the Klingon Empire.
name: Camp Khitomer
text: Seeds or plays on table. Native to this timeline: all cards with both [Films] and [AU] icon. Once per turn, one such card reporting at this location may report for free.

lore: Escort students for botany experiment on presumably uninhabited world.
name: Camping Trip
text: SCIENCE + Youth x2 + CUNNING>35 [GQ] Vorta and Jem'Hadar may report here.

lore: A glowing device used by the Haliians to focus thoughts in a limited empathic form. Especially used to strengthen an emotional link during love.
name: Canar
text: Immediately play on one female personnel. Specify one male personnel at a different location. If those two personnel are ever present together, discard both.

lore: Hot-headed Terran rebel. Julian Bashir interrogated and tortured the Intendant. One of many "captains" fighting to overthrow the Alliance.
name: Captain Bashir
text: OFFICER Navigation SCIENCE Leadership Biology Smuggling DL/ {Interrogation} OR {Torture}

lore: Former Starfleet officer who resigned to defend his home colony. Chakotay leads a loyal group of Maquis rebels in raids on Cardassian targets near the Badlands.
name: Captain Chakotay
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Anthropology Honor Your other [Maq] personnel here are attributes all +2.

characteristicsKeywords: Trill; Captain; Female; Trill with symbiont;
lore: Aggressive, roguish Trill. Host to Dax symbiont. Once the mistress of Mr. Sisko, Jadzia Dax is now romantically involved with Captain Bashir.
name: Captain Dax
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation Archaeology Geology Leadership DL/ {Evasive Maneuvers}

lore: Respected warrior. Named his firstborn son in honor of his friend, Curzon Dax. Has watched the careers of the Enterprise crew since first encountering them in 2268.
name: Captain Kang
text: OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy Honor Physics If on a ship at a [KLI] mission, it is WEAPONS +2.

lore: Legendary starship captain. In 2267, met "Lieutenant" Sisko. 17 temporal violations. "The man was a menace."
name: Captain Kirk
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 May initiate battle against non-[Fed]. DL/ {Captain's Log} May stun adversary he just engaged. Once every turn, may "stop" one female present.

lore: Commander of I.K.C. Gr'oth. Sent to protect Klingon interests in Sherman's Planet. Dear to Captain Kirk.
name: Captain Koloth
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Anthropology SCIENCE If on {I.K.C. Gr'oth}, it is attributes all +1 for each Klingon [OS] personnel aboard (up to +3).

lore: Spaceman First Class, Protector of Earth, Scourge of Intergalactic Evil. Tom Paris played the adventurous hero in his re-creation of the original 1930's sci-fi serials.
name: Captain Proton
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation DL/ {Buster Kincaid} Your other [eHA] personnel present are attributes all +2.

lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 human. Mr. Spock was restored from death by the Genesis wave - and his friends' resolve.
name: Captain Spock
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Leadership Computer Skill Physics Mindmeld Diplomacy Honor Music Once per game, may be taken from discard pile to hand.

lore: Overconfident captain of the Starship Excelsior during testing of its failed transwarp drive. Planned on breaking old Enterprise speed records. Was really in for a shock.
name: Captain Styles
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Leadership Physics

lore: After moving up through the ranks aboard Enterprise, Lt. Sulu was given the captaincy he deserved in 2290. Holds loyalty in high regard, his crew as dear as family.
name: Captain Sulu
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Honor Physics SCIENCE

lore: A commanding officer's journal of events. While on the surface of El-Adrel IV, Tamarian Captain Dathon made entries into his log by hand.
name: Captain's Log
text: Plays on table. Each of your ships with its matching commander aboard is SHIELDS and WEAPONS +3. (Captain's Order.)

lore: A commanding officer's journal of events. Captain Ransom continued keeping his even after abandoning other military protocols and traditions.
name: Captain's Log (Voyager)
text: Plays on table. Each of your ships with its matching commander aboard is WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3. (Captain's Order.)

name: Captured
text: Seeds or plays on table. During your turn, your non-Borg crew or Away Team may capture one opposing personnel present (random selection) if you have more SECURITY present than opponent, or more hand weapons present than opponent. OR During any player's turn, you may capture one personnel just stunned in battle by your non-Borg SECURITY. Discard incident after either use.

lore: Phase-disruption weapon used by Cardassian military and civilian personnel.
name: Cardassian Disruptor
text: Cardassian and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Rifle version of the Cardassian phase disruptor. Has a 4.7 megajoule power capacity, 3 millisecond recharge and two beam settings.
name: Cardassian Disruptor Rifle
text: Cardassian and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

lore: Cardassia Prime is the homeworld of the Cardassians. The Cardassian Union establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Cardassian Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Cardassian ENGINEER.

lore: Standard Cardassian Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
name: Cardassian PADD
text: Cardassian use only. Each of your personnel present is CUNNING +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: With rumors of a metagenic weapon on Celtris III, the Cardassians lured Jean-Luc Picard into a trap in Cardassian space. He was captured in 2369.
name: Cardassian Trap
text: Unless Empathy present, opponent captures one unique, non-Cardassian personnel from you (random selection) and places it on their side as a captive, along with trap.

name: Caretaker's Array
text: Seeds at {Ocampa planet} (limit one here). Each player may seed a non-Borg [DQ] ship here. OR Plays once each turn to relocate your ship in the Badlands Region to Caretaker's Array. OR Plays at any time, for free, if a ship is about to be destroyed by {Navigate Plasma Storms}. Instead relocate ship to Ocampa planet or owner's hand.

lore: Appointed meeting to deliver cargo at this major commercial center.
name: Cargo Rendezvous
text: ENGINEER + Physics + INTEGRITY>30 OR Greed + Treachery + CUNNING>32

lore: Identity adapted by the Soong-type android Data in the fictional world of Dixon Hill. Snappy dresser with a nice tan. From South America. "Can't you tell?"
name: Carlos
text: CIVILIAN If with {Dixon Hill}, your draw deck is "on ice": draw cards from discard pile instead. Computer Skill x 2

lore: Molecular biologist. Head of Project Genesis. Once romantically involved with Admiral Kirk. Asked that he leave her to raise their son David in her world, not his.
name: Carol Marcus
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Leadership Biology x 2 Physics

characteristicsKeywords: Capturing-related card; Infiltration-related card; Morph card;
lore: Odo used his instincts as both an investigator and a shape-shifter to expose a Founder spy masquerading as Admiral Leyton on Earth in 2372.
name: Caught Red-Handed
text: Exposes (may capture) an opponent's infiltrator present with your shape-shifter OR prevents a changeling from morphing this turn OR nullifies {Common Thief}. (May not be nullified.)

lore: After Morn faked his own death, Quark "inherited" the Lurian's stolen latinum fortune. Naturally, this made him quite a hit with Morn's former partners in crime.
name: Center of Attention
text: Unless 4 SECURITY OR hand weapon and CUNNING>36 OR {any Quark} present, kills one personnel present (opponent's choice) who has Treachery or Greed. Discard dilemma.

lore: The Central Command controls every Cardassian ship, outpost and space station from its great War Room.
name: Central Command
text: Seeds or plays on {Cardassia Prime}. Once per turn, one Cardassian Gul or Legate OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Marine biology research laboratory and public aquarium located in Sausalito, California.
name: Cetacean Institute
text: Seeds or plays on table; download {George and Gracie} here. George and Gracie are not worth points while here. Native to this timeline: {Dr. Gillian Taylor} and George and Gracie.

name: Ceti Eel
text: Plays on table (for free, once each turn). At any time (limit twice every turn), you may place on any non-[Holo], non-android personnel present with your {Khan}. Personnel is now under your control, is attributes all -3, and may work with other personnel controlled by Ceti Eel. Also, this personnel is not discarded at end of turn by {Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold}.

name: Chain Reaction Pulsar
text: Attack: 5. Defense: 0. Requires a staffed ship which has three or more staffing icons firing. ATTACK bonus +1 if Akira class. Hit or direct hit = [Down] and nullifies one Event card enhancing target's attributes (once per turn). Hull: -35% Scanners off line: you may play {Scan} and {Full Planet Scan} only where you have an undamaged ship.

name: Chain Reaction Ricochet
text: Seeds or plays on table. When your {Chain Reaction Pulsar} hits (but does not destroy) a ship, after applying damage it "ricochets" to other opposing ships present (except those already damaged this battle) in the order of your choice. Second ship's damage = [Flip][Flip], third = [Flip][Flip][Flip], and so on, until one is destroyed. Discard incident.

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Duras-related; Klingon ship; Romulan ship; Scout;
lore: Small, obsolete, twenty-year-old Bird-of-Prey commanded by Lursa and B'Etor, the Sisters of Duras.
name: Cha'Joh
text: May benefit from two matching commanders. Cloaking Device

lore: Former Maquis leader now serving as first officer on U.S.S. Voyager. Deeply spiritual. Honors the heritage of his grandfathers, though far from their sacred places.
name: Chakotay
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Diplomacy Anthropology x 2 Archaeology Honor

lore: Former Maquis leader now serving as first officer on U.S.S. Voyager. Deeply spiritual. Honors the heritage of his grandfathers, though far from their sacred places.
name: Chakotay*
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Diplomacy Anthropology x 2 Archaeology Honor

lore: Anarchistic lupine race of humanoids with the reputation of violent responses to a variety of situations.
name: Chalnoth
text: Kills one Away Team member (opponent's choice) unless 3 SECURITY OR STRENGTH>40 present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Legislative body of Bajoran provisional government. Established following Cardassian withdrawal in 2369.
name: Chamber of Ministers
text: Seeds or plays on {Bajor}. A Nor may coexist here. Once per turn, one Bajoran Minister, Vedek or Kai OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Klingon leader who first embraced the notion of peace with the Federation. His vision mapped the way to the undiscovered country - the future.
name: Chancellor Gorkon
text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy x 2 Honor Anthropology Protects your Klingon Treaties from nullification.

lore: Beginning with his invasion of Cardassia in 2372, Gowron became increasingly prideful and paranoid. Nearly destroyed the Empire in his quest for glory.
name: Chancellor Gowron
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Anthropology Law DL/ {HQ: War Room} DL/ {Council of Warriors}

lore: Investigate possible changeling life signs on highly volcanic planet.
name: Changeling Research
text: SCIENCE x3 + Exobiology x2 + Geology Each {Seismic Quake} here affects two personnel.

lore: Changelings will be forced into a gelatinous state by a mid-level phaser stun. In 2372, special units were placed in many Starfleet facilities to ensure that empty rooms were in fact truly so.
name: Changeling Sweep
text: Plays to "sweep" an opponent's discard pile: examine it and place any interrupt cards (except [BO] or [Ref] cards) out-of-play.

lore: Evil ruler of Planet X, enemy of Captain Proton. Lusts after Arachnia. In 2375, waged war on photonic aliens from "the Fifth Dimension" with his fiendish Death Ray.
name: Chaotica
text: V.I.P. Once each turn, may return one [Holo] personnel here to owner's hand. Treachery x 2 Leadership

lore: Study and catalog neutrino discharge from charged plasma field.
name: Characterize Neutrino Emissions
text: Navigation + SCIENCE x2 + Astrophysics + Physics Any number of Orb artifacts may seed here.

lore: Self-taught chief engineer of Enterprise. Best friend and confidant to Jonathan Archer. From Panama City, Florida. Enjoys pecan pie.
name: Charles Tucker III
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Honor Computer Skill x 2 Diplomacy Transporter Skill x 2 DL/ {Any tricorder}

lore: Perform long-distance overview survey of this region of the Gamma Quadrant.
name: Chart Stellar Cluster
text: SCIENCE x2 + Computer Skill x2 + Stellar Cartography x2

lore: Talkative Bolian. Underwent field training soon after coming aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Has been a model - though somewhat paranoid - crewman ever since.
name: Chell
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Anthropology Biology Navigation

lore: Talkative Bolian. Underwent field training soon after coming aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Has been a model - though somewhat paranoid - crewman ever since.
name: Chell*
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Anthropology Biology Navigation

lore: Mr. Scott is chief engineer of the I.S.S. Enterprise. Scotty is a relentless taskmaster. His department has the highest rate of turnover on the ship.
name: Chief Engineer Scott
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Transporter Skill Stellar Cartography If on a [MQ][OS] ship, it is attributes all +2. Physics

lore: Ensign Chekov arranged an attack on his captain in the hopes of moving up in rank. Spent time in the I.S.S. Enterprise agony booth for his misguided ambition.
name: Chief Navigator Chekov
text: OFFICER Youth Treachery Navigation Astrophysics If on {I.S.S. Enterprise}, it is RANGE and WEAPONS +1.

lore: I.S.S. Enterprise chief medical officer. Dr. McCoy runs one of the most feared sickbays in the Empire. Never loses a subject before completing their interrogation.
name: Chief Surgeon McCoy
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Treachery DL/ {Classic Medical Tricorder}

name: Children of Light
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [Holo] personnel may mix and have no affiliation attack restrictions. OR Plays to capture all [Holo] personnel present with {Iden}, or (if he is aboard {Olarra}) all [Holo] personnel aboard one damaged ship at his location; discard incident.

lore: An ancient novelty which baffled Lt. Commander Data. The solution to the puzzle, which involves relaxation of effort, he called "fascinating."
name: Chinese Finger Puzzle
text: If android present, crew or Away Team is stopped until end of turn and androids are stopped for X full turns, where X = number of androids present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Klingon advocate. Skilled negotiator. Prosecuted a contrived hearing against Worf in 2372 to manipulate Federation involvement in the Klingon/Cardassian war.
name: Ch'Pok
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Treachery Law Computer Skill Biology

lore: I.K.C. Voq'leng crew member. After an initial attraction to Harry Kim, became romantically involved with Neelix. She was his little par'machkai; he, her fearless warrior.
name: Ch'Regha
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Archaeology Honor

lore: Noted captain. Succeeded Robert April and commanded the Starship Enterprise for 13 years. Accepted promotion in 2263 and relinquished command to James T. Kirk.
name: Christopher Pike
text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Diplomacy Leadership Your other [OS] personnel here are attributes all +1.

lore: Caught in a game of chula, Deep Space 9 senior officers divided up to explore different paths. Some paths were dead ends, while others lead to the next shap.
name: Chula: Crossroads
text: Immediately probe (then draw probe card): [Ref], [Bar], [GQ], [Fer]: "Stops" two personnel (your choice). Otherwise, "Stops" one personnel (opponent's choice).

lore: The echoing voice of the "fallen" Julian Bashir attempted to separate Sisko, Dax, and Kira before they reached the final challenge in their game of chula.
name: Chula: Echoes
text: To get past, three personnel present (random selection) are chosen. If the highest CUNNING among them is odd, all three are "stopped."

lore: In the game of chula, thialo is a decision point which requires the player to select one participant to be lost so that the others can continue.
name: Chula: Pick One to Save Two
text: To get past requires three personnel present (random selection) to face thialo. Choose one of those three to return to your hand, or all three are "stopped."

lore: In shap six of chula, players can fall into a deep crevasse. Three Deep Space 9 senior officers fell in, but landed in Quark's bar and learned that it was only part of an elaborate game.
name: Chula: The Abyss
text: To get past, three personnel present (random selection) must face the abyss. If their total CUNNING is odd, they are "stopped" and, if possible, relocated to {Quark's Bar}.

lore: The Chandra is part of an elaborate Wadi game which requires players to advance through several shaps, or levels. To get past this shap, players must precisely mimic the Chandra.
name: Chula: The Chandra
text: One person (random selection) continues, along with all crew or Away Team members who have at least one attribute number matching that personnel. Others are "stopped."

lore: The throw of the dice is the foundation of chula. Each combination of Wadi symbols determines which challenge next awaits the game's participants.
name: Chula: The Dice
text: To get past requires one personnel with INTEGRITY>6, another with CUNNING>7 and a third with STRENGTH>8.

lore: In the Wadi game of chula, participants are confronted with a virtual labyrinth of doorways. A few seem to permit passage arbitrarily, but most remain closed.
name: Chula: The Door
text: To get past, two personnel must each contribute any one of their attributes to equal a total of 5 or 21. Nullify by placing any doorway out-of-play from hand.

lore: One chula puzzle places the players in a cocktail party filled with poison gas. The antidote awaits the one who is clever (or foolish) enough to take a chance on a mysterious beverage.
name: Chula: The Drink
text: To get past, four personnel present (random selection) must be "tested." All four are "stopped" unless one has CUNNING<6 OR CUNNING>9.

lore: Shortly after discovery of the Bajoran wormhole in 2369, a delegation of Wadi visitors arrived from the Gamma Quadrant. They coerced Quark into playing their unusual game of chula.
name: Chula: The Game
text: Unless one personnel present has Greed and Treachery OR Greed and CUNNING>7, crew or Away Team is "stopped" until end of your next turn. Discard dilemma.

lore: Players face several perils throughout the game of chula. In shap four of the game played in Quark's Bar, Julian Bashir was singled out and "eliminated" by a burst of energy.
name: Chula: The Lights
text: Crew or Away Team member with total attributes closest to 22 (your choice if tie) returns to hand. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

lore: Near the end of their chula experience, three Deep Space 9 senior staff members were enticed to follow an image of Julian Bashir. He claimed to have found the way home.
name: Chula: The Way Home
text: To get past, three personnel (random selection) are chosen. Opponent may relocate one to {Quark's Bar} or your facility if the other two have combined INTEGRITY<15.

lore: Most chula puzzles play upon a participant's initial instincts - open doors are not always to be taken. Those who remember lessons from earlier shaps will fare better in the endgame.
name: Chula: Trickery
text: Opponent conceals your personnel, randomly selects one, and recites their attribute numbers. Unless you can name the selected personnel, all are "stopped." Discard dilemma.

lore: Civil disobedience can often escalate into full-scale conflict. A peaceful demonstration soon turned violent, entangling Captain Janeway and Tom Paris in a domestic brawl.
name: Civil Unrest
text: Two Away Team members are chosen (random selection). Unless one has Diplomacy, both are "stopped." Mission continues.

lore: In 2369, the U.S.S. Yangtzee Kiang crashed on a moon in the Gamma Quadrant. The crew members found themselves caught between enemy clans locked in a never-ending war.
name: Clan People
text: To get past, must have {Kai Opaka} present OR CUNNING>38 from up to five Away Team members.

lore: Commander of U.S.S. Reliant. Has a strong sense of duty. Has never met Admiral Kirk, but knows something of him from a few amusing stories told by Chekov.
name: Clark Terrell
text: OFFICER Honor x 2 Leadership Biology May replace any V.I.P. present selected to die.

lore: Typical 23rd-century personal communications device. Features flip-up antenna grid and multi-band tuning. Such equipment was developed by many races.
name: Classic Communicator
text: Once each turn, one of your [OS] personnel present may add a skill from one of your other compatible [OS] personnel at same location until end of turn. (Unique.)

lore: Standard phase-disruption weapon used in the mid-23rd century. Technology shared between the Klingon and Romulan Empires during their brief alliance in the late 2260s.
name: Classic Disruptor
text: Klingon and Romulan use only. Each of your [OS] personnel present is STRENGTH +2 (cumulative). Each of your [OS] leaders present adds SECURITY.

lore: General-purpose medical reference and diagnostic tool. Representative of devices used in the latter half of the 23rd century. Such equipment was developed by many races.
name: Classic Medical Tricorder
text: Once each turn, you may select MEDICAL OR Biology OR Exobiology. Until re-selected, your MEDICAL- or SCIENCE-classification [OS] personnel present gain that skill. (Unique.)

lore: Multipurpose hand-held device typical of those employed by many races in the late 23rd century. Jadzia Dax said of this one, "I just love classic 23rd-century design."
name: Classic Tricorder
text: Once each turn, you may select ENGINEER OR SCIENCE OR Geology OR Physics. Until re-selected, your ENGINEER- and SCIENCE- classification [OS] personnel present gain that skill. (Unique.)

lore: Starfleet personal defense and security weapon. Styling is typical of those used in the late 23rd and early 24th centuries. The pistol grip cradles and amplifies a Type I phaser.
name: Classic Type II Phaser
text: Federation use only. Each of your [OS] personnel present is STRENGTH +2 (cumulative). Each of your [OS] leaders present adds SECURITY.

lore: Secretly escort covert operatives to the Romulan homeworld.
name: Cloaked Mission
text: Navigation + Diplomacy + Honor

name: Clone Machine
text: Seeds or plays on {Mariposa}, {Boreth}, a [Dom] facility, or an {Infirmary}. While you have {Koroth} OR a MEDICAL, Biology, or Exobiology personnel who has INTEGRITY<6 present, once each turn you may report to them (for free) a copy of any unique non-[Holo], non-android personnel that is in play. Once every turn, if your Vorta just died, you may suspend play to download any version of that persona here.

lore: Rare colony of microscopic lifeforms which kill, absorb and then take the shape of other organisms. Must change form every few days.
name: Coalescent Organism
text: Unless Exobiology present, one personnel (random selection) dies at end of your next turn. If others present at the death, organism is passed on to one of them (random selection), etc.

name: Collect Metaphasic Particles
text: Seeds or plays on {Ba'ku Planet}. You may attempt it using these requirements: Any Son'a personnel + {Injector Assembly One} in orbit + Treachery x2 + no opposing ships or personnel here When you solve, you may take a double turn and, for rest of game, all your personnel are STRENGTH +2, add Youth, and may "unstop" themselves once each turn.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Colonel; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; The Circle-related personnel;
lore: Member of Bajoran Militia and the Circle. Participated in DS9 siege of 2370. Deceived General Krim, under orders from Jaro Essa. Tried to kill Benjamin Sisko.
name: Colonel Day
text: OFFICER SECURITY Treachery Navigation

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Colonel; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
lore: During Captain Sisko's absence after the death of Jadzia Dax, Kira Nerys was promoted to command DS9. She soon learned the responsibilities of the captain's chair.
name: Colonel Kira
text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Diplomacy Leadership Computer Skill X=2 if a [Rom] personnel in play.

lore: Warrior of low political standing. Father of Mogh. Forced to represent Kirk and McCoy at their trial. His reputation was improved when their innocence was later proven.
name: Colonel Worf
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Law Honor Archaeology Astrophysics

lore: Communities are commonly founded on uninhabited planets. Many are not charted by the Federation.
name: Colony
text: Build on any planet mission you completed. Each unopposed CIVILIAN inside at start of its owner's turn scores 1 point.

lore: Survive training exercises at this formidable Kazon-Ogla base.
name: Combat Training
text: STRENGTH>50 + any Maje * +5 for each Kazon-Ogla present, up to four.

lore: Communications officer aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Lt. Uhura is the object of Security Chief Sulu's constant advances. Knows how to handle him.
name: Comm Officer Uhura
text: OFFICER Youth ENGINEER Computer Skill Anthropology Treachery DL/ {Mirror Dagger}

name: Commandeer Ship
text: Plays on your Computer Skill personnel who is aboard opponent's empty ship (except a Borg cube). That personnel commandeers ship and, while objective in play, may meet up to three of its staffing icons. OR Seeds or plays on table. Opponent may not return to hand any ship which has your personnel aboard as an intruder or infiltrator.

name: Commandeer Ship (Voyager)
text: Plays on your Computer Skill personnel who is aboard opponent's empty ship (except a Borg cube). That personnel commandeers ship and, while objective in play, may meet up to three of its staffing icons. OR Seeds or plays on table. Opponent may not return to hand any ship which has your personnel aboard as an intruder or infiltrator.

lore: Female commander of a fleet that intercepted starship Enterprise in 2268. Sought the heart of Mr. Spock.
name: Commander Charvanek
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Diplomacy Physics Archaeology Once in play, X = 3 on every {Patrol Neutral Zone} mission (even if already solved).

lore: Over the years, Ensign Chekov's distinguished career would include many promotions, and positions as acting science officer, security chief, navigator, and first officer.
name: Commander Chekov
text: OFFICER Navigation SECURITY Astrophysics Biology If on {Starship Enterprise}, it is WEAPONS +2.

lore: In Barash's illusion, Data was second in command of the U.S.S. Enterprise under Captain Riker.
name: Commander Data
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Computer Skill Music Astrophysics

lore: Leeta is one of the few Bajorans in the mirror universe to join the Terran Rebellion. Responsible for debriefing Ezri following the cloaking device affair.
name: Commander Leeta
text: SECURITY Leadership Diplomacy Youth DL/ {Mission Debriefing}

lore: After an early career aboard Enterprise, Yeoman Rand desired greater duties. She soon returned as transporter chief, and was later Excelsior's communications officer.
name: Commander Rand
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Transporter Skill Biology Leadership

characteristicsKeywords: Romulan; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: In an alternate future, the nemesis of the U.S.S. Enterprise confronted Captain Picard but cooperated to investigate an anomaly in the Neutral Zone.
name: Commander Tomalak
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership

lore: In Barash's illusion, Deanna Troi left the U.S.S. Enterprise to take a position at Starfleet Command as Admiral Picard's diplomatic counselor.
name: Commander Troi
text: V.I.P. Empathy Diplomacy Honor Anthropology

lore: Though over time Lt. Uhura accepted promotions and transfers, she seized each chance to return to Enterprise. Got to play for a captive audience on Nimbus III.
name: Commander Uhura
text: OFFICER Once per game, may capture an all male Away Team present. Computer Skill ENGINEER Music

name: Commander's Office
text: Once each turn, any player who has a matching [Cmd] OFFICER unopposed here may, in place of one card draw, download to hand one Captain's Order card ({Captain's Log}, {Lower Decks}, {Yellow Alert}, {Senior Staff Meeting} or any card so marked). Matching OFFICER personnel may {file mission report}s here. This site is always the "innermost" site of any Nor (may not separate {Ops} from any other site). Any Nor: Ops Module

lore: When Odo confronted a minor thief on the Deep Space 9 promenade, the cutthroat attempted to kill the constable.
name: Common Thief
text: If any equipment present, discard one (random selection). Otherwise, kills a personnel present (opponent's choice) who has STRENGTH+CUNNING<15. Discard dilemma.

lore: Although Tau's theft of the main computer processor from U.S.S. Voyager was elaborately staged, Kathryn Janeway regarded him as little more than a petty criminal.
name: Common Thief (Voyager)
text: If any equipment present, discard one (random selection). Otherwise, kills a personnel present (opponent's choice) who has STRENGTH+CUNNING<15. Discard dilemma.

lore: Rush to plug information leaks occurring from this remote border sector.
name: Compromised Mission
text: Treachery x 2 + Computer Skill + STRENGTH>35 Opponent's side: [FED] Treachery x2 + Computer Skill + STRENGTH>35

lore: Rao Vantika accessed the Deep Space 9 computer system through a temperature control panel. He sabotaged the data network by purging everything in active memory.
name: Computer Crash
text: Seeds or plays on table. No player may play a {Q's Tent} doorway, download any card or play any card that requires downloading. Discard event at end of your next turn.

name: Computer Weapon & Hyper-Aging
text: ICONIAN COMPUTER WEAPON: Unless SCIENCE present, re-boot by discarding all non-Personnel cards in hand and replenishing from top of draw deck. (Not repeatable.) [4] HYPER-AGING: Entire crew or Away Team is quarantined (dies when countdown expires). Cure with SCIENCE and 2 MEDICAL.

name: Construct Starship
text: Seeds or plays on table. In place of your normal card play, you may download any outpost or {headquarters} (if you have a matching ENGINEER at an appropriate location) OR download {Spacedock} (even to a docking site) OR download a unique ship to your facility that has a Spacedock (if you have an ENGINEER aboard who is that ship's matching commander). Discard objective OR draw no cards this turn.

lore: Seek aid from the Alsaurian resistance in freeing prisoners taken by the Mokra.
name: Contact Resistance
text: SECURITY + Leadership + STRENGTH>40 OR Resistance + CUNNING>30

name: Containment Field
text: Seeds or plays on table. (Not duplicatable.) Each player who uses a DL/ icon, {Hidden Fighter}, or {Going to the Top} must first stack a card from hand face up here. Before each player's turn begins, they reclaim up to two of those cards; if they still have any here, they must skip that turn. Also, nullifies each {Destroy Radioactive Garbage Scow} (its owner loses its points), {Static Warp Bubble}, and {Telepathic Alien Kidnappers}.

lore: Praetor Neral presides over the Continuing Committee of the Romulan People, the final authority on Romulus.
name: Continuing Committee
text: Seeds or plays on {Romulus}. May coexist with {Office of the Proconsul}. Once per turn, one Tal Shiar personnel OR {any Neral} may report for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: In 2368, U.S.S. Enterprise personnel were given amnesia by Satarrans, who then attempted to trick the crew into attacking Lysian ships and a Lysian command station.
name: Conundrum
text: Unless INTEGRITY>40, this ship must do nothing but chase (at normal speed) and attack one of your opponent's ships on this spaceline (your choice). Discard dilemma.

lore: Flush out enemy hiding amidst the radiation of this anomaly.
name: Corner Enemy Ship
text: Leadership + Navigation + Stellar Cartography May attempt only if your total WEAPONS>15 here.

name: Cortical Node Implant
text: Plays on your Borg. If a [Com] Borg, once each turn, may "transfer data" if present with a {Borg Data Node}: draw one card (may not be converted to a download). Also, each of your Borg with a Cortical Node Implant may, once every turn, suspend play to "regulate implants": subtract 2 from any attribute and add 2 to any other attribute until end of turn.

lore: A long space object as thin as a proton but with the gravitational attraction of a hundred stars.
name: Cosmic String Fragment
text: Ship is sucked in and destroyed unless Astrophysics OR ENGINEER OR Navigation aboard. Discard dilemma.

name: Council of Warriors
text: Plays on your [KLI] mission showing less than 30 points (or on {Qo'noS}), if unattempted. Nullified if you play (or have played) {Scan}, {Full Planet Scan}, or a non-Klingon personnel. If you solve by end of your next turn, place objective in point area; place here all ships your ships destroy in battle and all personnel your Klingons kill in personnel battle to score points equal to WEAPONS or STRENGTH printed on card.

lore: The Founder posing as Julian Bashir used his position as chief medical officer to gain valuable information for the Dominion, while secretly undermining the efforts of his enemies.
name: Counterintelligence
text: Plays on your infiltrator. Until end of turn, subtract (rather than add) infiltrator's classification, skills and attributes from infiltrated crew's or Away Team's totals.

lore: A Federation student intern when she discovered her true identity as a Q, Amanda took a dim view of the over-manipulative use of power upon other species.
name: Countermanda
text: Nullifies {Telepathic Alien Kidnappers} OR if opponent just played {Res-Q} or {Palor Toff}, suspend that action, look through opponent's discard pile and put any three cards out-of-play.

lore: Build hidden monitoring station in the Neutral Zone.
name: Covert Installation
text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Treachery

lore: Build station.
name: Covert Installation II
text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Treachery WORMHOLE: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

lore: Build station.
name: Covert Installation II (back)
text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Treachery If you have a staffed ship here, you may play {Long-Range Scan} here to "detect Wormhole" (flip mission over).

lore: Retrieve crashed scoutship in Federation territory.
name: Covert Rescue
text: Diplomacy + Leadership + CUNNING>35

lore: Borg implant that interprets and logs all instructions sent to a drone. Operates on an array of transpectral frequencies capable of transmission across hundreds of light-years.
name: Cranial Transceiver Implant
text: Plays on your drone; it is CUNNING +2. If a [Com] Borg, once each turn, you may download any [BO] objective OR discard your current objective.

lore: Re-creation of notorious exobiologist. Cured the Fostossa virus through cruel experiments on Bajoran prisoners.
name: Crell Moset
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Treachery Once each turn, may discard a personnel present to play a [Car] personnel and/or draw up to two cards.

lore: In 2063, U.S.S. Enterprise-E crew member William T. Riker participated in Zefram Cochrane's historic warp flight. He and Geordi La Forge substituted for the missing Phoenix crew.
name: Crew Reassignment
text: Plays on table. Your /Ent-E personnel may staff ships as [Stf]. Also, each of your personnel with a special staffing icon may report to your ship with same icon. (Captain's Order.)

name: "Crimson Forcefield"
text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. Harmless pyrotechnic ruse nullifies opponent's Tactic card unless opponent has an OFFICER with CUNNING>8 aboard a ship or facility in this battle. Hit = [Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip]. Hull: -40% Cloaking Device off line.

lore: The crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E faced concurrent problems in 2063. The Borg required Picard's attention on the ship while Riker and the away team worked with Cochrane on Earth.
name: Crisis
text: To get past requires Leadership (or [Com] and [Def] icons) in Away Team and an OFFICER-classification personnel (or 2 [Def] Borg) aboard your ship at this location.

lore: Retrieving a computer processor stolen from U.S.S. Voyager required a coordinated effort. As the crew performed scans from orbit, Captain Janeway conducted reconnaissance on the surface.
name: Crisis (Voyager)
text: To get past requires Leadership (or [Com] and [Def] icons) in Away Team and an OFFICER-classification personnel (or 2 [Def] Borg) aboard your ship at this location.

lore: Unusual necklace containing a shape-shifting key reminiscent of changelings. Used to secure a hidden stasis chamber protecting Croden's daughter, Yareth, in the Chamra Vortex.
name: Croden's Key
text: Seeds only in Gamma Quadrant. Use as Equipment card. Where present, allows docking/undocking at, and walking into/out of, any player's ship or facility (as appropriate).

lore: Fanatical Borg lieutenant of Lore. Captured Lt. Commander Data with the lure of emotions.
name: Crosis
text: Plays on {Rogue Borg}. Doubles their STRENGTH, including himself. Two Borg = 4 STRENGTH each, three Borg = 6 STRENGTH each, etc. (Not cumulative.)

name: Crossover
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your [MU] personnel may ignore their [MU] icon when reporting OR just after you report {Smiley}, {Benjamin Sisko}, {Professor Sisko}, {Jake Sisko}, {Bareil}, {The Intendant}, {Grand Nagus Zek}, {Maihar'du}, {Ezri}, {Rom}, or {Quark}, you may download a {Multidimensional Transport Device} to that personnel (or vice versa, if you reported Device as your normal card play; discard incident).

lore: An ancient sublight vessel. Designed to carry and store cryogenically frozen humanoids until a cure for their death could be found and used to regenerate them.
name: Cryosatellite
