text: Seed at a space location. May seed one additional artifact and up to 3 [AU] personnel here. They are earned when Cryosatellite earned; then discard Cryosatellite.

lore: Spaceborne life-form strips biological energy from planets and ships. Sensitive to modulation much like crystal can shatter from a high pitch note.
name: Crystalline Entity
text: Space mission: kills all life on ship unless SHIELDS>6 OR Music aboard. Planet mission: kills entire Away Team unless SCIENCE and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

lore: First maje of the Kazon-Nistrim. Romantically involved with Seska. Commands a Kazon Raider. Seeks to capture U.S.S. Voyager and its technology at any cost.
name: Culluh
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 ENGINEER Treachery Greed Archaeology Diplomacy DL/ {Boarding Party}

lore: Aid observation of primitive society.
name: Cultural Observation
text: Anthropology + Leadership + STRENGTH>30

lore: Develop vaccine for Teplan Blight deliberately introduced here by the Dominion.
name: Cure Blight
text: MEDICAL x3 + SCIENCE + Anthropology * +5 if MEDICAL-related Equipment card present.

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Develop anti-viral agent for fatal disease that lies dormant in its natural environment.
name: Cure Deadly Virus
text: Exobiology x3 + Biology x2 OR {Danara Pel} Until solved, personnel on planet are quarantined.

name: Cybernetics Expertise
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your android may report for free if Cybernetics present and may report to your personnel who has Cybernetics x2. Also, once each turn, you may exchange a card from hand for an android in your discard pile.

lore: Civil but dangerous gangster. Believes in killing when for a purpose. Is resolved to obtain "the item" he believes was entrusted to Dixon Hill by Jessica Bradley.
name: Cyrus Redblock
text: CIVILIAN When revealed, your dilemmas with "murder" or "crime" in title kill a personnel (random selection). Leadership x 2

lore: Race which explores the galaxy by giving other species the temporary ability and strong compulsion to come to them.
name: Cytherians
text: Place on ship. Ship must do nothing but travel to far end of spaceline at normal speed. When reached, discard dilemma. Score points.

lore: Even a knowledge as vast as The Doctor's has limitations. In 2375, he called upon a holographic "consultant" to assist in removing a parasitic alien that had attacked B'Elanna Torres.
name: Cytoplasmic Life-form
text: Unless 3 Exobiology present, place on mission. Each of its skill requirements must be met by a different personnel when solving it.

name: Dabo
text: Plays on {Quark's Bar}. Any player who has a personnel here (except {any Quark}) may "wager" 1 to 3 cards from discard pile (except {Kevin Uxbridge}/{Amanda Rogers}) and probe: [Equipment], [Event], [*]: Place wager in point area (2 points per card). Otherwise: Place wager out-of-play; if station's controller has any Quark here, for each dabo girl here that player may draw one card OR download one {Gold-Pressed Latinum} here.

lore: Terrifying energy creature created and manipulated using an Orb fragment. The controller of the Dal'Rok channels the fears of Bajoran villagers into a powerful destructive force.
name: Dal'Rok
text: Place on mission. Now and start of each turn, kills personnel with lowest total attributes at this location. May be nullified by INTEGRITY+CUNNING+STRENGTH>150 at this location.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Glinn; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Ambitious Glinn. Reports to Dukat. Witnessed his commanding officer's triumphal retaking of Terok Nor. Oversees engineering operations aboard the station.
name: Damar
text: OFFICER Physics ENGINEER Treachery Computer Skill May report where your {Dukat} is present.

lore: Gul. Commander of the Galor-class warship Aldara. Pursued the Bajoran terrorist Tahna Los in 2369. Enjoys vole fights.
name: Danar
text: OFFICER Navigation x 2 ENGINEER Astrophysics

lore: Hematologist who treated a phage outbreak on Fina Prime. Became romantically involved with The Doctor when she spent nearly three weeks on U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Danara Pel
text: MEDICAL Biology x 2 Computer Skill Honor Navigation Stellar Cartography

lore: Quark agreed to provide mercenaries for Rao Vantika's attempted theft of a deuridium shipment. Failure to complete his contract would have been a fatal mistake.
name: Dangerous Liaisons
text: To get past requires 3 Treachery and Acquisition OR 2 SCIENCE and 2 SECURITY OR {Ty Kajada}. Nullify by discarding {Recruit Mercenaries} from hand.

lore: Lt. Commander Data is a sentient android created by Dr. Noonien Soong. Has positronic brain. Desires to be human. Once left his head in San Francisco.
name: Data
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Music Astrophysics Exobiology

lore: Lt. Commander Data had an emotion chip installed in 2371. Cries yellow tears. Soong-type android who, for 0.68 seconds, almost joined the Borg.
name: Data (First Contact)
text: OFFICER Astrophysics Computer Skill x 2 ENGINEER Exobiology DL/ {Fractal Encryption Code}

lore: When the Soong-type android Data began feeling emotions secretly generated by Lore, Geordi La Forge performed a series of diagnostics on him.
name: Data and Geordi
text: OFFICER+ENGINEER Data: ENGINEER Music Computer Skill Geordi: ENGINEER Physics DL/ {Tricorder}

characteristicsKeywords: Android/Human/Romulan; Captain; Dual-personnel; Male; Soong-type android;
lore: To search for Spock on Romulus, the Soong-type android Data and his human captain, Jean-Luc Picard, disguised themselves as Romulan citizens.
name: Data and Picard
text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Data: ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill Picard: Diplomacy Anthropology Archaeology

lore: When Lt. Commander Data rescued the temporarily mortal Q from the Calamarain in 2366, Q awarded him with the gift of laughter.
name: Data Laughing
text: Nullifies {Calamarain}. OR Doubles {Data's Head} this turn. OR Plays on a ship affected by {Lore Returns}; you gain control of that ship and all {Rogue Borg Mercenaries} aboard.

lore: Data could shuffle playing cards as if they were isolinear chips removed by an intoxicated engineer. Will Riker often quipped, "Sometimes I wonder if he's stacking the deck."
name: Data, Keep Dealing
text: If you have in play {any Data} or {any Hollander}, look at the top two and bottom two cards of your draw deck. Replace in any order, two on top and two on bottom.

lore: Soong-type android body recovered from Devidia II.
name: Data's Body
text: OFFICER ENGINEER, Computer Skill, Music, Astrophysics, Exobiology During seed phase, may report for duty at your outpost.

lore: An excavation under the Earth city of San Francisco in 2369 discovered that the head of Lt. Commander Data had been lying there undisturbed for centuries.
name: Data's Head
text: Use as Equipment card. Head has CUNNING=10 and Computer Skill. While on a ship, RANGE, WEAPONS and SHIELDS are +2. (Not Cumulative.)

lore: Lt. Commander Data's citations include Starfleet Command Declaration for Valor and Gallantry, Medal of Honor with Clusters, Legion of Honor and Star Cross.
name: Data's Medals
text: Plays on any leader in a battle you just won to score bonus points. Stays on that leader. Points lost if leader killed. (Not cumulative.)

lore: "Darmok and Jalad at Tanagra. The beast of Tanagra. Rosani, his army. Picard and Dathon at El-Adrel. Sokath, his eyes uncovered!"
name: Dathon
text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Nullifies Tamarian-related dilemmas where present.

lore: Gifted scientist. Like his father, often bends the rules. His impatience was Project Genesis' breakthrough and downfall. Proud - very proud - to be Admiral Kirk's son.
name: David Marcus
text: SCIENCE Biology Computer Skill Physics Geology You may use {The Genesis Device} on your planet here.

lore: Command codes, known only to key personnel, are needed to disable many system-level instructions.
name: Deactivation
text: Nullifies {Auto-Destruct Sequence} (unless {Fractal Encryption Code} present), {Red Alert} or {Static Warp Bubble}. OR Erases an Away Team of only [Holo] personnel. (Captain's Order.)

lore: A Borg force field prevented Data from accomplishing his first goal, and caused him to seek another option.
name: Dead End
text: Unless you have at least 50 points, cannot get past; place dilemma atop mission; it may not be attempted by a player with less than 50 points. (Unique.)

lore: Astronaut Colonel Stephen Richey was found 283 years after his death on Theta 116 VIII. He was caught in an unchanging eternal trap created by well-meaning aliens.
name: Dead in Bed
text: Kills any one personnel currently in stasis.

characteristicsKeywords: Betazoid/Human; Counselor; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Lt. Commander Deanna Troi is a 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 Human empath. Counselor for U.S.S. Enterprise. Imzadi to William T. Riker. Loves chocolate.
name: Deanna Troi
text: OFFICER Empathy Diplomacy

lore: 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 human counselor of U.S.S. Enterprise-E - and Reginald Barclay. After years of friendship, is once again romantically involved with William T. Riker.
name: Deanna Troi (The Borg)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Empathy Anthropology All your [Ent-E] personnel add [Cmd].

lore: Commander Deanna Troi is ship's counselor aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 Human. Complained there wasn't time to argue about time.
name: Deanna Troi (First Contact)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Empathy Navigation Once per game, may "unstop" her Away Team.

lore: Alpha-Hirogen who agreed to hunt alongside the crew of Voyager. A master in tracking, but overly prone to the fervor of an imminent kill. Commands a Hunting Vessel.
name: Decaren
text: OFFICER Leadership SCIENCE Honor Anthropology Diplomacy Physics

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Powerful ship created in Barash's illusion. Commanded by Tomalak. Transported Admiral Picard and Deanna Troi to a Romulan peace conference.
name: Decius
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Formerly known as Terok Nor. Now a Bajoran trading center and administrative facility run by the Federation.
name: Deep Space 9 (back)
text: Seeds during dilemma phase at a {Bajor Region} location. If commandeered by any personnel who is not Bajoran or Federation affiliation, flip card over. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Federation frontier station, circa mid-2260s. Consists mostly of fabrication facilities and storage units.
name: Deep Space Station K-7
text: Plays at {2267 Sherman's Planet}; may be used by all players' compatible cards. Once per turn, one [OS] card reporting at this location may report for free. (Not duplicatable.)

name: Defend Homeworld
text: Seeds or plays on table. When opponent initiates battle against your card at a homeworld matching that card's affiliation, just after it is targeted you may download there any number of {HQ} cards and compatible ships, leaders, SECURITY personnel, and hand weapons. Once per game, you may discard objective to download a SECURITY personnel OR any HQ card (except {Return Orb to Bajor}).

lore: Wartime upgrades to Deep Space 9's defensive systems in 2372 included enhanced shield emitters, rotary phasers, microtorpedo launchers and 5,000 new torpedoes.
name: Defense System Upgrade
text: Plays on your space facility. WEAPONS=6 (or WEAPONS +4) and SHIELDS +6. (Cumulative.) OR Fully repairs a damaged facility if your compatible ENGINEER aboard; discard event.

lore: Constructed by the Terran Rebellion using stolen plans of the U.S.S. Defiant. Commanded by Benjamin Sisko during the defense of rebel-held Terok Nor.
name: Defiant
text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods)

lore: Commemorative inscription mounted on the bridge of the U.S.S. Defiant. Serves as an inspiration to the Defiant crew.
name: Defiant Dedication Plaque
text: Plays on table. Each of your ships with its matching commander aboard is RANGE +2, or +3 if ship is Defiant class. (Not cumulative. Captain's Order.)

lore: Female Obsidian Order operative. Sabotaged weapons systems of the U.S.S. Defiant in an attempt to ruin the joint scientific project between Bajor and Cardassia.
name: Dejar
text: ENGINEER Obsidian Order Stellar Cartography Treachery

lore: Alien hologram with a deranged hatred of organic life. Murdered all the filthy animals aboard his ship, then attacked The Doctor and B'Elanna Torres when they responded to his distress call.
name: Dejaren
text: Two personnel (one [Holo] and one non-[Holo]) are killed (random selection) if their individual CUNNING<9. To get past requires 2 Computer Skill remaining.

lore: Convey documents to Grand Nagus Zek on the Ferengi homeworld; beware enemy patrols.
name: Deliver Message
text: V.I.P. + Diplomacy + Acquisition OR {Quark Son of Keldar} OR {Nog}

lore: Take provisions and equipment to settlers.
name: Deliver Supplies
text: (CIVILIAN x2 OR {Kasidy Yates}) + freighter or transport in orbit with Transporter Skill aboard

lore: Designed and often commanded by Tom Paris. Sports an ultra-aerodynamic tetraburnium alloy hull, retractable nacelles, unimatrix shielding, and photonic missiles.
name: Delta Flyer
text: May report aboard your {U.S.S. Voyager} (for free). DL/ {Evasive Maneuvers}

name: Delta Quadrant Spatial Scission
text: Seeds or plays on table. You may have up to two copies of each unique [DQ] Personnel and Ship card in play. Also, once each turn, you may place a unique [DQ] Personnel or Ship card from your hand out-of-play if you have a copy of that card in play (once per game per card title): all copies in play are attributes all +2 until start of your next turn, and you may play a personnel or draw a card.

lore: Daughter of Hikaru Sulu. Helmsman of the Enterprise-B. Shocked but pleased, James T. Kirk declared: "It wouldn't be the Enterprise without a Sulu at the helm."
name: Demora Sulu
text: OFFICER Navigation Exobiology Stellar Cartography If on {any Enterprise}, it is RANGE +1.

lore: Deadly flying parasites decimated the populations of Levinius V, Theta Cygni XII, Ingraham B, and finally Deneva, where they killed George Samuel Kirk and his wife, Aurelan.
name: Denevan Neural Parasites
text: Attacks half of Away Team (random selection, round up). You may protect one selected personnel for each {phaser}, {disruptor}, or unselected [Def] Borg present; others are killed.

lore: With some help from Reginald Barclay, the 3/4 Klingon, 1/4 human Alexander Rozhenko created a holodeck program of the Ancient West for himself and his father.
name: Deputy Rozhenko
text: SECURITY Scores 5 points when {Sheriff Worf} stuns an opposing personnel who has Treachery. Youth Law

lore: Vidiian honatta to Motura. Tasked with obtaining new organs for his charge's survival. Duty-bound to take them from the living if a dead "donor" is unavailable.
name: Dereth
text: MEDICAL Navigation x 2 ENGINEER Geology Exobiology DL/ {Organ Theft} OR {Vidiian Harvester}

lore: The U.S.S. Enterprise destroyed a radioactive garbage scow by towing it into a sun. It could have been destroyed in place, but the act would have contaminated Gamelan V.
name: Destroy Radioactive Garbage Scow
text: Plays to discard {Scow}. Kills all personnel at that location unless aboard ship or {Thermal Deflectors} present. If mission not done yet, reduce its points.

name: Devidian Door
text: Plays on table. While in play, allows you to play a card "from the future." Once each turn, you may say "Devidian Door" and play one Personnel or Equipment card to any planet. At any time during your next turn (or at game end, if sooner), you must show a Devidian Door from hand and place it out-of-play, or you lose the game. (Immune to cards which close doorways.)

lore: Disguised beings from Devidia II traveled to troubled times and squalid places to steal and consume neural energy from souls who would not be missed.
name: Devidian Foragers
text: Look through any one discard pile and place two personnel out-of-play. Add their attribute numbers to one of your [AU] icon personnel for this turn.

lore: 1/4 Betazoid 3/4 Human. Skilled negotiator. Abused his empathic powers to gain advantage. Had a dangerous liaison with Counselor Deanna Troi.
name: Devinoni Ral
text: V.I.P. Empathy Diplomacy Treachery

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Warbird used to accomplish the escape of Romulan spy Selok from the Federation in 2367. Commanded by Admiral Mendak.
name: Devoras
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Vorta in charge of Internment Camp 371. Responsible for training and equipping Jem'Hadar troops. Accepts nothing less than perfect obedience.
name: Deyos
text: SECURITY May draw a card for each non-Youth Jem'Hadar that enters play here. Treachery x 2 Archaeology

lore: Crafty but dishonored head of wealthy Klingon House. Tried to acquire the assets of the House of Kozak - using money. Former member of High Council.
name: D'Ghor
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Acquisition Greed Computer Skill

lore: While infiltrating the Klingon Empire, a changeling posing as Martok killed two guards in an isolated corridor. They never expected such treachery from an honorable warrior.
name: Dial Martok for Murder
text: Plays to allow your infiltrator to initiate battle, with +4 STRENGTH, against up to two opposing personnel present (your choice). Infiltrator is not exposed. Discard event.

lore: Powerful form of folded space transport, capable of penetrating all known shields and forcefields. Repeated use of the technology causes a fatal degradation of the subject's cellular chemistry.
name: Dimensional Shifting
text: During your turn, discard a random card from hand to place any number of your personnel and equipment at one mission aboard any ship at the same mission.

lore: Mediate dispute between civilizations on Peliar Zel's two moons.
name: Diplomacy Mission
text: Diplomacy + INTEGRITY>30 + CUNNING>30

lore: Participate in historic interstellar conference at this neutral diplomatic site.
name: Diplomatic Conference
text: One V.I.P. from each of four different affiliations Personnel on planet may mix to attempt.

lore: naDHa'ghach. Klingon ritual of shame. A disgraced warrior (and his descendants for seven generations) are shunned and declared non-existent to the rest of Klingon society.
name: Discommendation
text: Plays on any Klingon who survived a losing battle. That Klingon is now Non- Aligned, has no Honor and loses points.

lore: Jean-Luc Picard overrode the holodeck safety protocols during the Borg invasion of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Without those protocols, even a holographic bullet can kill.
name: Disengage Safety Protocols
text: Plays on table. While in play, suspends Holographic Safety Protocols ([Holo] personnel may mortally wound). Also, [Holo] weapons mortally wound instead of stun.

lore: Captain of U.S.S. Yamato. Retrieved stellar "Rosetta Stone" artifact from Denius III. Searched for - and unfortunately found - the mythical planet of Iconia.
name: Donald Varley
text: OFFICER Archaeology Stellar Cartography Computer Skill {Iconia Investigation} and {Reopen Dig} have [FED].

lore: Technician who programmed enhancements for the Hirogen holograms under orders from Decaren. Later joined Kejal to help build a better life for his creations.
name: Donik
text: ENGINEER Youth Computer Skill x 2 SCIENCE Physics Honor Your [Hir][Holo] personnel may report here.

lore: Jean-Luc Picard had an Ahab-like obsession with his revenge against the Borg. If his chest had been a cannon, he would have shot his heart upon them.
name: Don't Call Me Ahab
text: "Stops" one OFFICER with INTEGRITY>6 AND any number of /Ent-E personnel present (opponent's choice).

lore: "Stay where thou art."
name: Door-Net
text: Plays on one of your Doorway cards in play (your choice) until any Q-Flash. Doorway is now closed. May be nullified by {Alternate Universe Door} OR by showing 2 Diplomacy from your hand during your turn.

lore: On stardate 42679.2, the U.S.S. Enterprise encountered a duplicate of Jean-Luc Picard from six hours in the future. He was eventually killed by Jean-Luc Picard.
name: Doppelganger
text: Plays on table. While in play, if a unique personnel moves to the same location as its duplicate, the duplicate is discarded unless {Clone Machine} in play.

lore: Served under Goss. While trapped with Kol in the Delta Quadrant, set up a lucrative exploitation of the Takarians by posing as one of their "Great Sages."
name: Dr. Arridor
text: MEDICAL Treachery Exobiology Anthropology Physics Leadership Acquisition

lore: Soon after her first five-year tour of duty aboard the Enterprise, Nurse Chapel earned a medical doctorate. She later accepted a post at Starfleet Command.
name: Dr. Chapel
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Archaeology Computer Skill

lore: Female humanoid from Tyrus VIIA. Scientist who invented the particle fountain mining system. Also developed exocomps.
name: Dr. Farallon
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Physics DL/ {Exocomp} Doubles all {Particle Fountain}s in your point area.

lore: 20th-century marine biologist. Helped Admiral Kirk safely bring George and Gracie to the 23rd century, where she then signed on aboard a Starfleet science vessel.
name: Dr. Gillian Taylor
text: CIVILIAN May exclude {George and Gracie} from any personnel battle or random selection here. Biology SCIENCE

lore: 20th-century marine biologist. Helped Admiral Kirk safely bring George and Gracie to the 23rd century, where she then signed on aboard a Starfleet science vessel.
name: Dr. Gillian Taylor*
text: CIVILIAN May exclude {George and Gracie} from any personnel battle or random selection here. Biology SCIENCE

lore: Brilliant Romulan astro-archaeologist. Member of the Romulan underground. Works closely with Spock for reunification of the Vulcan and Romulan peoples.
name: Dr. Koramar
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Archaeology Honor Stellar Cartography

lore: Dr. La Forge is a Starfleet specialist in xenology and exobiology. Father of Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge. Husband of Captain Silva La Forge.
name: Dr. La Forge
text: SCIENCE Exobiology

lore: Haakonian who developed the metreon cascade weapon. Deeply regretful of the hundreds of thousands of Talaxians killed by his invention. Dying of metremia.
name: Dr. Ma'Bor Jetrel
text: SCIENCE MEDICAL Exobiology Physics Honor

lore: Leonard H. "Bones" McCoy. Chief medical officer of the starship Enterprise. Awarded the Legion of Honor.
name: Dr. McCoy
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Biology Once per game, may nullify a dilemma requiring MEDICAL where present. DL/ Any "{I'm a Doctor, not}..." card

lore: Leonard H. "Bones" McCoy. Retired from Starfleet in 2270, but returned a year later on Kirk's request. Retired again in 2293 - and would again return.
name: Dr. McCoy (The Motion Pictures)
text: MEDICAL Twice per game, may take topmost personnel of discard pile into hand. MEDICAL Exobiology Biology

lore: Vhnori thanatologist. Studied Harry Kim in the hopes of learning more about his people's afterlife. Believes the truth is out there.
name: Dr. Neria
text: MEDICAL Anthropology Biology Physics

characteristicsKeywords: Hologram; Capturing-related card; Male; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
lore: Archenemy of Secret Agent Julian Bashir, replaced by the transporter pattern of Benjamin Sisko. Gathered the world's finest minds to start a new human race.
name: Dr. Noah
text: CIVILIAN Once each turn, may capture most CUNNING personnel present. Leadership Treachery

lore: "Well, well, well. What seems to be the problem?"
name: Dr. Q, Medicine Entity
text: Diagnosis: One of your Event cards on the spaceline (opponent's choice) is the problem. Treatment: Opponent must move the "problem card" to a different appropriate spaceline location.

lore: Ferengi male scientist. Inventor of the revolutionary, but controversial, metaphasic shield technology. Endured skepticism from the scientific community.
name: Dr. Reyga
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Stellar Cartography Astrophysics

lore: "The Pasteur of archeological medicine." Christine Chapel's missing fianc . Disappeared on Exo III. Before dying, placed his consciousness in this android body.
name: Dr. Roger Korby
text: MEDICAL Archaeology Computer Skill Cybernetics DL/ {Scorched Hand}

lore: Strong believer in the Prophets. While with Shakaar resistance cell, lost his left arm saving Kira Nerys from Cardassians. Refuses synthetic replacement.
name: Furel
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Biology Geology Resistance DL/ {Sniper}

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; future-related ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commanded by Admiral Riker in an alternate future. U.S.S. Enterprise-D was fitted with a third warp engine nacelle, greatly enhancing its speed and power.
name: Future Enterprise
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Arms dealer. Owed his cousin Quark a shuttle. Made good on his debt, but booby-trapped the ship. Involved with Hagath. Helped rescue Ishka from the Dominion.
name: Gaila
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Greed x 2 Smuggling ENGINEER SECURITY DL/ {Hidden Fighter}

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commanded by Keras during the incursion of Neutral Zone in 2266. Possibly the first Romulan ship with a cloaking device. Named for the firefalls on Romulus.
name: Gal Gath'thong
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Any Romulan [OS] personnel}

lore: Jean-Luc Picard went undercover in 2370 posing as a mercenary and artifact smuggler.
name: Galen
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Computer Skill Treachery Leadership Navigation Music

lore: Ru'afo's first officer. Once the most vengeance-minded of the Son'a, recent time with the Ba'ku - and a persuasive Federation captain - has softened his hatred.
name: Gallatin
text: OFFICER Anthropology SCIENCE Computer Skill Honor Transporter Skill

lore: Belligerent Beta-Hirogen. Clashed with Decaren, Netek, and Kathryn Janeway during the hologram hunt. Finally came to respect the Voyager crew as worthy prey.
name: Gann
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Navigation Biology Transporter Skill Astrophysics

lore: Pockets of space, such as those in the Mar Oscura nebula, dangerously phase out when coming in contact with a ship.
name: Gaps in Normal Space
text: Place between two Mission cards. Creates a gap with a span of 4. Ships stopping on the gap kill one personnel (random selection).

lore: Cardassian male. Virtual player in the Vorta scenario testing the resolve of Alpha Quadrant species. Risked his life in the defense of his comrades.
name: Garak
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Computer Skill Honor May replace anyone present randomly selected to die.

lore: Exposed to a psychotropic compound on Empok Nor, Elim Garak lost control. He hunted down and killed members of his away team because it seemed like "fun."
name: Garak Has Some Issues
text: Place on ("stops") a personnel present (random selection). Start of each turn, they kill another personnel present with lower CUNNING (opponent's choice). Cure with 2 Exobiology.

name: Garak's Tailor Shop
text: Obsidian Order personnel may report here (for free if {any Garak}). Once each turn, any player who has a personnel unopposed here who has both Obsidian Order and Treachery may glance at top card of opponent's draw deck. Also, any player who doesn't control station but has Obsidian Order unopposed here may report Cardassian personnel and Cardassian-compatible Equipment cards here. {Terok Nor} OR {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

lore: As a prank, Jake Sisko and Nog released Garanian bolites in the Replimat. Though harmless, the bolites caused temporary pigmentation fluctuations and severe itching.
name: Garanian Bolites
text: Two personnel (random selection) are "stopped" unless their combined CUNNING>15 OR {Hypospray} present. Mission continues.

lore: Open secret inquiry on early history of Klingon foster child raised on this Federation planet.
name: Gault
text: Exobiology + OFFICER + Honor x2

lore: DaiMon who reprogrammed the Federation hologram intercepted by Nunk. "Mastermind" of a plan to return Voyager to the Alpha Quadrant through a geodesic fold.
name: Gegis
text: OFFICER Computer Skill SCIENCE Acquisition Greed Your [Holo] and [Fer] cards may mix at this location.

lore: Vorta who ordered an attack on the U.S.S. Defiant in 2374. Skeptical of using Kudak'Etan and other Jem'Hadar alphas. His suspicions were justified.
name: Gelnon
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy MEDICAL Stellar Cartography Treachery DL/ {VR Headset} OR {Ketracel-White}

lore: Female Minoran empath. Tested by the Vians as a representative of her planet. Saved Dr. McCoy. Her willingness to sacrifice her own life saved her people.
name: Gem
text: CIVILIAN Empathy x 2 Honor

lore: Chief of staff serving the High Council leader. Conspired to assassinate Gorkon and ensure no peace in his time. Fond of Shakespeare, particularly in the original Klingon.
name: General Chang
text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Anthropology Law SECURITY DL/ {To Be Or Not To Be}

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; General; High Council; Male; Sybok-related personnel;
lore: Once-renowned military strategist exiled to Nimbus III by the High Council. Released the pain of his dishonor when Sybok enlisted his help in the search for Qui'tu.
name: General Korrd
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Physics Navigation May work with {Sybok}, {St. John Talbot}, and {Caithlin Dar}.

lore: "First Omet'iklan, can you vouch for the loyalty of your men?" "We pledge our loyalty to the Founders from now until death." "Then receive this reward... may it keep you strong."
name: Obedience Brings Victory
text: Plays once per turn if your Vorta just "rationed" {Ketracel-White}. Draw two cards (in place of one draw, may download {Subjugate Planet} to that location or {Victory Is Life} to hand).

name: Obelisk of Masaka
text: Seeds or plays on table. Each time a card provides multiple card draws, only one may be converted to a download. Also, to move or initiate battle, each ship with one or more staffing icons (and each Interceptor) requires at least two crew members aboard. Once each turn (unless opponent has {The Mask of Korgano} in play), you may download {Masaka Transformations} targeting yourself, then discard incident.

lore: Changeling posing as Miles O'Brien. Infiltrated Earth in 2372 with three other Founders. Gloated about their disruptive activities to Benjamin Sisko.
name: O'Brien Founder
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Transporter Skill Physics Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Homefront}

lore: Transport Vulcan crew member to their home planet to participate in a cultural ceremony.
name: Observe Ritual
text: Vulcan + Diplomacy + Anthropology Vulcans and {Amanda Grayson} may report on planet.

lore: Gul Ocett, Cardassian female officer. Commander of a Galor-class warship. Pursuer of DNA program.
name: Ocett
text: OFFICER Archaeology Navigation Honor

lore: In 2371, Geordi La Forge received implants allowing him to see without his VISOR. They include enhanced capabilities such as infrared and zoom focus over 500 meters.
name: Ocular Implants
text: Plays on your Borg, android or {any Geordi}. Once each turn where present, may glance for 10 seconds at either one Away Team OR bottom seed card of mission.

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling security chief of Deep Space 9. Not very good at pretense. Always investigates Quark.
name: Odo
text: SECURITY SECURITY Computer Skill x 2 Honor x 2 Law Once per turn, may "stop" {any Quark} present.

lore: Odo donned civilian clothes and went aboard Deep Space Station K-7 in 2267 to search for an explosive tribble. Recently made human by the Great Link.
name: Odo (The Trouble with Tribbles)
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY x 2 Computer Skill Honor DL/ {Classic Communicator}

lore: Changeling who confused the crew of the U.S.S. Defiant by posing as Odo.
name: Odo Founder
text: SECURITY SECURITY Computer Skill Law Treachery Not exposed by {Blood Screening} or if he morphs.

lore: In 2370, a Bajoran science probe revealed a life-form on L-S VI with DNA patterns similar to those of Odo. Tests indicated that the entity had some shape-shifting properties.
name: Odo's "Cousin"
text: To get past requires 2 Exobiology and Geology. If you overcome, one SCIENCE may stay behind ("stopped") to score points.

lore: Lt. Commander Data has a deactivation switch hidden in his back. Reluctantly, he informed Dr. Crusher of its existence to aid in the re-assembly of Lore.
name: Off Switch
text: Place any android in stasis until end of turn. While in stasis, immune to {Android Nightmares}, {Chinese Finger Puzzle} and {Dead in Bed}. OR Nullifies another Off Switch.

lore: From his office in Paris, the President of the United Federation of Planets leads the representative council.
name: Office of the President
text: Seeds or plays on {Earth}. Once per turn, one Federation Ambassador, Admiral, Vice-Admiral or President OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: The Proconsul heads the Romulan Senate. Neral was Proconsul during the 2368 Vulcan Unification ruse.
name: Office of the Proconsul
text: Seeds or plays on {Romulus}. Once per turn, one Romulan General, Admiral, Senator or Proconsul OR {Sela} or {Tomalak} OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Stolen Hirogen ship. Commanded by Iden on his quest to free "Children of Light" from the Hirogen, Nuu'bari, and other Delta Quadrant civilizations.
name: Olarra
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam Your [Holo] cards may report aboard.

lore: Stolen Hirogen ship. Commanded by Iden on his quest to free "Children of Light" from the Hirogen, Nuu'bari, and other Delta Quadrant civilizations.
name: Olarra*
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam Your [Holo] cards may report aboard.

lore: Ferengi arms dealer. DaiMon. Glutton. Always requests that Amarie play Melor Famagal. Referred to as "the fat Ferengi" by the Qualor II locals.
name: Omag
text: OFFICER Greed Smuggling Music Archaeology DL/ {Calandra}

name: Omega Directive
text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on your ship with matching commander aboard. (Nullified if no [Cmd] personnel aboard.) While ship is at same location as an {Omega Particle}, it may ignore affiliation attack restrictions, and end of each turn you must probe: DL/ : Threat eliminated. Discard Particle; draw two cards and score points; discard objective.

lore: Unstable molecule that can power an entire planet - or render warp travel impossible in the wake of its explosion. Designated Particle 010 by the Borg, who regard it as harmonious perfection.
name: Omega Particle
text: Plays on your outpost; any player may download {Omega Directive} or {Harness Particle 010}. When countdown expires, destroys outpost and all ships here; mission is span +3.

lore: First assigned to Weyoun. Sought to destroy rebel Jem'Hadar and their Iconian Gateway on Vandros IV. Killed the Weyoun 4 clone for questioning his loyalty.
name: Omet'iklan
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Astrophysics Computer Skill Allows your cards here to initiate battle against [Dom].

lore: Futuristic Borg created when The Doctor's holo-emitter accidentally fused with nanoprobes. His unique systems include reactive body armor and internal transporters.
name: One
text: SCIENCE Youth May beam himself through any SHIELDS. Shares all regular skills from all Borg at this location.

lore: Angosian male. Biochemically altered into a formidable perfect warrior ranked Subhadar.
name: Roga Danar
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Computer Skill Biology Leadership

lore: Upon Hugh's return to the Borg collective, the Borg became self-aware. Soon, many unquestioningly followed their first leader, Lore.
name: Rogue Borg Mercenaries
text: Plays on any occupied ship. Battles crew now and at start of every players' turn. Two Borg =2 STRENGTH each, three =3 each, etc. Surviving Borg remain.

lore: Served at tactical aboard U.S.S. Voyager during Tuvok's absence in 2371. Received a promotion to lieutenant for exceptional service during the Caretaker incident.
name: Rollins
text: SECURITY Leadership Geology Archaeology

lore: Brilliant yet befuddled Ferengi engineer. Works for the Bajorans aboard Deep Space 9. Quark's brother. Nog's father. Gaila's cousin. Has a crush on Leeta.
name: Rom
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Astrophysics Honor Navigation Physics X=4 or 9.

lore: In 2367, Geordi La Forge was captured by a Romulan ship while piloting a shuttle to Risa. He was brainwashed into an assassination plot against Klingon Governor Vagh.
name: Romulan Ambush
text: Destroys opponent's ship with SHIELDS<6 present with your D'deridex-class ship. Crew killed, except one personnel (your choice) is made captive.

lore: 23rd-century device based on prototype successfully tested on the Gal Gath'thong. After one was lost to a Federation spy operation in 2268, the technology was revised and enhanced.
name: Romulan Cloaking Device
text: Reports only aboard your Romulan ship or to {Sherman's Peak}. While on your Romulan ship (or your [OS] ship with 2 ENGINEER aboard), ship has a Cloaking Device.

lore: Directed-energy weapon used by Romulans and other races. Disruptor fire can be identified by a high residue of antiprotons that linger for several hours.
name: Romulan Disruptor
text: Romulan and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel STRENGTH +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

lore: Enhanced energy rifle used throughout the Romulan Star Empire. Generates an elevated level of residual anti-protons which are detectable for several hours after firing.
name: Romulan Disruptor Rifle
text: Romulan and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

lore: Romulus is one of the two homeworlds for the Romulans. The Romulan Star Empire establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Romulan Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Romulan ENGINEER.

lore: Standard Romulan Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
name: Romulan PADD
text: Romulan use only. Each of your personnel CUNNING +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

lore: Lt. Commander Data played blackjack while trapped in the surreal casino of the Hotel Royale. Tex said, "Boy, you have got the brass..." Data said, "Hit me."
name: Royale Casino: Blackjack
text: Play one game of blackjack, using CUNNING numbers. Players must show entire hand. Closest to 21 without going over wins points. Others lose points. Ties=0.

lore: An away team from the U.S.S. Enterprise was trapped in the illusionary Hotel Royale until they won enough money in the casino to buy the bank and their way out.
name: Royale Casino: Craps
text: Show a personnel from hand. If CUNNING = 7 or 11 OR opponent cannot match your number, win points. Otherwise, opponent wins points.

lore: A U.S.S. Enterprise away team became trapped in an illusory world based on the badly written Hotel Royale, a Todd Matthews novel filled with "endless clich and shallow characters."
name: Royale Casino: Slots
text: Show a personnel from hand; if two of its attributes match, win points (if all three, win double points). Otherwise, lose points.

lore: Leader of the Son'a, a people banished from their home planet by the Ba'ku. Will let nothing stand in the way of his revenge upon them, least of all his Federation allies.
name: Ru'afo
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Biology Leadership Treachery x 2 Astrophysics DL/ {Injector Assembly One}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Equinox-related personnel;
lore: Accomplished exobiologist and diplomat. Captain of U.S.S. Equinox. Called "Rudy" by his crew. Lost in Delta Quadrant, has relaxed Starfleet protocols and principles.
name: Rudolph Ransom
text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology SCIENCE Diplomacy Transporter Skill Treachery

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Equinox-related personnel;
lore: Accomplished exobiologist and diplomat. Captain of U.S.S. Equinox. Called "Rudy" by his crew. Lost in Delta Quadrant, has relaxed Starfleet protocols and principles.
name: Rudolph Ransom*
text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology SCIENCE Diplomacy Transporter Skill Treachery

lore: Android created millennia ago by the Old Ones of Exo III. Used by Roger Korby as a bodyguard. Occasionally circumvents his programming. Mysterious and spooky.
name: Ruk
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Exobiology Geology

lore: Kazon-Nistrim bodyguard reporting directly to Seska. Instrumental in planning the assault to take Voyager in 2372.
name: Rulat
text: SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill Geology Your other [Kaz] SECURITY present are attributes all +1.

lore: Track distress signal; locate survivors of ship sabotaged by Orion Syndicate.
name: Runabout Search
text: Transporter Skill + MEDICAL + (Honor OR Greed) If you solve, may download {Odo} or {Quark} here.

lore: Arrogant Gul. Gathered support in the early stages of the anti-Dominion resistance, despite his disdain for covert tactics. His Cardassia's dead, and won't be coming back.
name: Rusot
text: OFFICER Your [Car] personnel with resistance in lore may report where present. Treachery Astrophysics

lore: Deep Space 9 was besieged by the Alliance for Global Unity in 2370. Odo used his shape-shifting abilities to monitor the intruders' activities and report back to Commander Sisko.
name: The Walls Have Ears
text: Once each turn, plays on opponent's occupied ship or facility. Report a changeling there OR score points if you have an intruder aboard.

lore: During brief telepathic connections, Kes learned the purpose of Species 8472's invasion of the Delta Quadrant. As the Borg discovered, they were quite capable of carrying out their threats.
name: The Weak Will Perish
text: Kills five [Univ] Borg drones present (random selection) and each personnel present who has printed STRENGTH<5. (Immune to {Adapt: Negate Obstruction}.)

lore: Alien space probe of unknown origin. Traveled to Earth to contact the extinct humpback whale. Its powerful transmission caused total power loss aboard nearby ships and starbases.
name: The Whale Probe
text: Place on mission. End of every turn, moves one location toward and off spaceline's long end. All ships, personnel, and facilities are in stasis while here. (Unique.)

lore: Away Teams from the U.S.S. Enterprise used an array of Thermal Deflectors to delay Bersallis III firestorms long enough to allow evacuation of the population.
name: Thermal Deflectors
text: Plays on table. While in play, nullifies {Firestorm}, {Thought Fire}, {Plasma Fire}, {Fire Sculptor}, and {Phaser Burns}.

lore: Damage to warp drive components, such as the throttle assembly of the Phoenix, can result in subspace-related theta particle emissions. Deadly if not inoculated quickly.
name: Theta-Radiation Poisoning
text: Play on any ship or outpost here (opponent's choice). End of each turn, one personnel present without {Medical Kit} killed (random selection). Cure with 6 ENGINEER.

lore: Attempting a mission with only a few personnel is dangerous. Lt. Commander Data suffered amnesia while alone on Barkon IV. He was lost and eventually "killed."
name: Thine Own Self
text: Plays on opponent's one- or two-person Away Team on a planet (unless in a facility). Away Team is "lost" (place under mission). Capture (or opponent rescues) by solving mission.

lore: Immature drones of Wysanti species; irrelevant designations: Rebi and Azan. Assigned by the First to accelerate the development of new drones in their hive.
name: Third and Fourth
text: Third: Youth SCIENCE Transporter Skill Fourth: Youth Exobiology Computer Skill DL/ {Maturation Chamber}

lore: Identification: TACTIC DRONE Task: Survey. Compile tactical data. Encode. Report. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Third of Five
text: Geology Stellar Cartography Biology If on your {Borg Scout Vessel}, it is attributes all +2 (or +4 in Alpha Quadrant). DL/ {Hugh}

lore: Senior security officer aboard U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Led the ship's internal defense during the Borg attack of 2373. Transferred from U.S.S. Hood.
name: Thomas McClure
text: SECURITY Leadership Exobiology

lore: Convicted traitor. Maquis sympathizer. Best pilot Harry Kim has ever seen. In an alternate reality, a bar fight cost Tom Paris his future aboard the U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Thomas Paris
text: CIVILIAN Navigation x 2 Transporter Skill SECURITY Treachery (May convert to Honor for rest of game).

lore: Lt. Commander Thomas Riker is William Riker's double. Created during a transporter accident in 2361.
name: Thomas Riker
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Geology Music

lore: Lady Grilka's bodyguard and would-be suitor. Bad-tempered commander of the guard for the House of Grilka. Despises the Ferengi coward Son of Keldar.
name: Thopok
text: SECURITY Biology Transporter Skill DL/ {Bat'leth}

lore: General in the Breen Confederacy. Key figure in forging the Dominion/Breen Alliance. Respects the Founder. Accepts Weyoun. Disregards Damar.
name: Thot Gor
text: OFFICER Your Breen and Jem'Hadar ships in battle together are each WEAPONS +2. Leadership x 2 MEDICAL

lore: Breen general. Successor to Thot Gor. Ordered the installation of Breen weaponry on Jem'Hadar ships. Seeks to secure Romulus and Earth for the Breen.
name: Thot Pran
text: OFFICER Archaeology Exobiology Transporter Skill

lore: In 2364, The Traveler took the U.S.S. Enterprise to a place where ideas and reality intermix. In such a place, one's own thoughts can be deadly.
name: Thought Fire
text: If {The Traveler: Transcendence} is affecting you, all crew or Away Team members with (CUNNING+INTEGRITY)<12 are killed unless Empathy present.

lore: Outlawed Ferengi mind control device. Transmits signals that implant sensory experiences and triggers emotions and memories.
name: Thought Maker
text: Place in hand until played once as an Interrupt card. Look at opponent's draw deck for ten seconds and rearrange as desired.

lore: Cardassian forensics expert briefly stationed on Terok Nor during the occupation. Odo's impressions of him were superimposed over a dark memory from his past.
name: Thrax
text: SECURITY Physics Exobiology Law Computer Skill

lore: Identification: TACTICIAN DRONE Task: Auxiliary processor of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Bajoran species.
name: Three of Nine
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Once each turn, may place one card from hand beneath draw deck, then draw a card.

lore: The Borg Queen was also on the first cube to attack Earth, even though all Borg on it were destroyed. "You think in such three-dimensional terms. How small you've become."
name: Three-Dimensional Thinking
text: Plays if you have {Borg Queen} or a counterpart aboard one of your ships being destroyed. Immediately relocate any or all crew to another of your ships in play.

lore: Kazon-Nistrim serving as Seska's aide. Assigned a suicide mission by Culluh as part of an elaborate plan to take U.S.S. Voyager. Determined to succeed.
name: Tierna
text: SECURITY Navigation Honor Stellar Cartography DL/ {Kazon Bomb} (as an interrupt, where Tierna present).

lore: "My brothers and sisters of the Continuum have taken me back! ... I feel like celebrating!"
name: Tijuana Crass
text: Plays on table. (May not be nullified.) While in play, any points derived from {Ressikan Flute} count for all players AND opponent's {Data Laughing} cards are converted to Event cards to be played on the table when used.

characteristicsKeywords: Vulcan; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Dr. Selar is a female Vulcan medical doctor. Served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise for many years.
name: Dr. Selar
text: MEDICAL Computer Skill Mindmeld

lore: Reclusive genius who perfected the positronic brain originally proposed in the 20th century. Ex-husband of Juliana. "Father" of the androids Data and Lore.
name: Dr. Soong
text: SCIENCE Cybernetics x 2 Computer Skill ENGINEER Once each turn, may reprogram any androids present.

lore: Romulan Astrophysical Academy member on deep space duty in 2351. Beamed to the present via a micro-wormhole to the U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Dr. Telek R'Mor
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics x 2 Stellar Cartography Honor ENGINEER May report directly to any ship.

lore: El-Aurian refugee "rescued" from the nexus in 2293 by the Enterprise-B. Spent the next 78 years obsessed with finding a way to return, no matter the cost.
name: Dr. Tolian Soran
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Treachery Worth points while placed under {The Nexus}.

lore: When the U.S.S. Enterprise attempted to evade Q's energy net, the net collapsed into a sphere and chased the vessel at high warp.
name: Drag Net
text: Plays on table. At the end of each of your turns you may move any one {Q-Net} in play one location in either direction.

lore: Ships and facilities are vulnerable to unwanted quests when their shields are lowered.
name: Dropping In
text: Plays if any SHIELDS are less than 4 or were just lowered for beaming. Your Transporter Skill may beam your cards through those SHIELDS. OR Nullifies your {Dead End}.

lore: "This sapling is planted as an affirmation of life, in defiance of the drought, and with expectations of long life. Whatever comes, we will keep it alive as a symbol of our survival."
name: Drought Tree
text: Plant on a planet mission you completed to score bonus points. Points may be nullified by any unopposed Away Team.

lore: In 2367, suspected sabotage to the warp core of the U.S.S. Enterprise led to an investigation of the crew. Suspicions ran rampant before Jean-Luc Picard put an end to the "witch hunt."
name: Drumhead
text: If present, discard one crew member of INTEGRITY<5 ({Norah Satie}'s choice if in play, or random selection); otherwise, to get past requires {Jean-Luc Picard} OR Law. Nullify with {Plexing}.

lore: Romulan boy. A bright and active member of Spock's underground. Once showed Spock Romulan artifacts depicting the syllabic nucleus of the Vulcan alphabet.
name: D'Tan
text: CIVILIAN Youth Archaeology Where present, Romulans without Treachery are INTEGRITY +1.

characteristicsKeywords: Hologram; Dr. Noah-related personnel; Male; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
lore: Dr. Noah's associate. Skilled baccarat player, but less so than Secret Agent Julian Bashir. Carries a cigar rigged with a knockout agent. Transformed to appear as Worf.
name: Duchamps
text: CIVILIAN At start of battle, may stun up to three adversaries present (your choice). SECURITY Treachery

lore: Klingon for "land the ship." Though K'Vort-class ships were larger and more heavily armed than the B'rel design they were based upon, only the 23rd-century original had this ability.
name: Duj Saq
text: Plays on table. Your B'rel-class ships may each use 1 RANGE to land or take off once each turn, and report on planets that have a matching affiliation icon. (Captain's Order.)

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Gul. Ex-prefect of Bajor. Commander of the Prakesh. Father of Ziyal. Cardassian Union liaison with Dominion. Desires to regain command of Terok Nor.
name: Dukat
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Computer Skill

lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Union in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Cardassian - Dukat - is part of us now."
name: Dukat of Borg
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Computer Skill While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Car].

lore: Agent of the Department of Temporal Investigations. Just wants the truth. Starts at the beginning. Hates jokes. Probably would have talked to Kirk himself.
name: Dulmer
text: SCIENCE Anthropology Exobiology SECURITY

lore: Device designed to interfere with electromagnetic radiation flow. Inhibits the use of transporter annular confinement beams and the electrical systems of most ships.
name: Duonetic Field Generator
text: Place on planet. No beaming up or taking off from planet. Nullify with 3 ENGINEER OR Miracle Worker.

lore: While most in touch with her Betazoid heritage, Deanna Troi loved her human father's tales of the Ancient West. She always wanted to play the "mysterious stranger."
name: Durango
text: CIVILIAN Empathy Honor SECURITY If with {Sheriff Worf}, both are STRENGTH +2.

lore: Ceremonial Bajoran lamp lit in memory of a recently deceased loved one. The ornate candle burns continually, entreating the Prophets to guide the dead to the afterlife.
name: Duranja
text: "Guides" your Bajoran who died on your previous turn from discard pile to point area (worth points equal to INTEGRITY; "in play" for uniqueness only). Discard event.

lore: Son of Ja'rod. Contender for leadership of the Klingon High Council. Member of a powerful political family.
name: Duras
text: V.I.P. Leadership Computer Skill Treachery Greed

lore: Taibak and Kell used E-band emissions transmitted to Geordi La Forge's VISOR to influence the engineer's actions. La Forge was being programmed to assassinate Governor Vagh.
name: E-Band Emissions
text: Seeds or plays on table. May not be nullified if {Kell}, {Taibak} or {Entek} in play. {Brainwash} is immune to {Kevin Uxbridge} and gives captive infiltration icons for its own affiliation(s).

lore: A deadly hovering anti-personnel device with the ability to fire phasers and to anticipate and adapt to its target's defenses. Created by the Arsenal of Freedom on Minos.
name: Echo Papa 607 Killer Drone
text: Use during Away Team and Rogue Borg battles. First time used in battle, STRENGTH=10. Next time used in a separate battle, STRENGTH=20, etc.

lore: When the Federation tried to contact the pre-industrial society on Rubicun III, the Edo Probe demanded in ship-shuddering tones that Jean-Luc Picard "State the purpose!"
name: Edo Probe
text: Abandon mission attempt until any player completes a different mission OR continue but lose points if you do not solve mission this turn.

lore: A ship discovered in 2364 by the U.S.S. Enterprise to be protecting the peaceful society on Rubicun III. It was described as "half in, half out of our universe."
name: Edo Vessel
text: X=8 However, there is always a 50/50 chance any attack is nullified.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Take-charge captain of U.S.S. Enterprise during Picard's Celtris III mission. Negotiated first Cardassian armistice. When he gives an order, expects his crew to get it done.
name: Edward Jellico
text: OFFICER Diplomacy ENGINEER Stellar Cartography Leadership DL/ {Treaty: Federation/Cardassian}

lore: Former soldier in a Jem'Hadar security detail. Outraged by the destruction of Lakarian City, he pledged his life to the resistance against the Dominion.
name: Ekoor
text: OFFICER Once each turn, your [Univ] [Car] SECURITY may report for free where present. Leadership Honor

lore: Nearly invisible predatory electromagnetic creature. First encountered by Dathon and Captain Jean-Luc Picard on El-Adrel IV.
name: El-Adrel Creature
text: Attacks two strongest members in Away Team (owner's choice if tie). Kills one of them (random selection) unless their combined STRENGTH>16. Discard dilemma.

lore: The Butcher of Bozeman, meanest gunslinger in the West. Frank's boy. Assumed Data's traits in a holodeck glitch - including his dexterity with a deck of cards.
name: Eli Hollander
text: CIVILIAN Treachery DL/ {Prisoner Exchange} Opponent may not use SECURITY skill where present.

lore: Elim Garak forced himself to interrogate Odo in an attempt to regain favor with his father, Enabran Tain.
name: Elim
text: SECURITY Treachery x 2 Computer Skill x 2 Obsidian Order Random selections here involving only opponent's personnel are instead your choice. DL/ {Interrogation}

lore: Former member of Obsidian Order. Exiled to Terok Nor in 2368. Maintains some contact with Cardassian intelligence. Distrusts Dukat. Son of Enabran Tain.
name: Elim Garak
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Obsidian Order Treachery Anthropology May avoid any random selection.

name: Eliminate Starship
text: Plays on table. Target an opponent's ship. Your Borg may battle that ship. If they destroy it in battle, immediately probe (draw probe card, discard objective): [Bor]: Wreckage. You may download {Salvage Starship}. [AU]: Energy distortion. You may download {Temporal Rift}. [BO]: Collateral damage. One other opposing ship present is damaged (random selection).

name: Eliminate Starship (The Borg)
text: Plays on table. Target an opponent's ship. Your Borg may battle that ship. If they destroy it in battle, immediately probe (draw probe card, discard objective): [Bor]: Wreckage. You may download {Salvage Starship}. [AU]: Energy distortion. You may download {Temporal Rift}. [BO]: Collateral damage. One other opposing ship present is damaged (random selection).

lore: Return to analyze and destroy last traces of deadly nanobiogenic weapon accidentally re-released.
name: Eliminate Virus
text: MEDICAL + Exobiology + Computer Skill * Points do not count when {Harvester Virus} in play.

lore: Hard working scientist, gourmet cook, and amateur bartender. Always eager to be selected for special assignments.
name: Elizabeth Cutler
text: SCIENCE Biology Exobiology Geology May volunteer for random selections (if applicable).

lore: Female chief medical officer of the U.S.S. Lexington. Julian Bashir's medical-school rival. Able to distinguish a preganglionic fiber from a postganglionic nerve.
name: Elizabeth Lense
text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Biology Physics

lore: Wry, 100-year-old judge who presided over Jadzia Dax's Klaestron extradition hearing in 2369. Shows no signs of slowing down, despite her advanced age.
name: Els Renora
text: V.I.P. Law x 2 MEDICAL Anthropology

name: Emblem of the Alliance
text: Seeds or plays on table; you may download {The Art of Diplomacy}. Your [KCA] cards, {Grand Nagus Zek}, {Maihar'du}, {Rom}, and {Quark} may mix and have no affiliation attack restrictions. Once each turn, you may report a [KCA] personnel for free if you have in play a [KCA] leader who names (or is named by) them in lore. {Ore Processing Unit}s on [MQ] Nors are immune to {Reactor Overload} if 2 ENGINEER present.

name: Emblem of the Empire
text: Seeds or plays on table; you may download {The Art of Diplomacy}. Your [TE] cards, {Benjamin Sisko}, {Jake Sisko}, {Rom}, and {Quark} may mix and have no affiliation attack restrictions. Your [TE] facilities and staffed ships are immune to {Navigate Plasma Storms}. {Ore Processing Unit} on {Mirror Terok Nor} is immune to {Reactor Overload} if 2 ENGINEER present, and may {Process Ore} while under [Fed] control.

lore: With the field density between the mirror universe and their own closing quickly, Mr. Scott and Dr. McCoy rushed to complete modifications to the transporters.
name: Emergency Conversion
text: To get past requires 2 Astrophysics and Transporter Skill.

name: Emergency Evacuation
text: Seeds or plays on table. If your ship or facility is being destroyed or just encountered {Abandon Ship}, you may place entire crew under that Abandon Ship dilemma OR download {Escape Pod} (ignoring {Computer Crash}) to save entire crew of ship or facility OR relocate entire crew to a planet at that location. Discard incident after use.

lore: Devices which allow quick remote activation of a transporter when in danger.
name: Emergency Transporter Armbands
text: Beam your Personnel up or down at any time, except during a dilemma (unless specifically permitted). May be used during battle before the winner is determined.

lore: An emerging intelligence seized control of the Enterprise in 2370 to seek out particles it needed to evolve. The crew interacted with it on the holodeck, helping to find this nourishment more quickly.
name: Emergent Life-form
text: Place on ship. Now and start of each turn, opponent may move ship to another location (using its RANGE). If ship has Holodeck, cure with 2 ENGINEER and Astrophysics aboard.

lore: Inventor of the transporter and father figure to Jonathan Archer. Dreams big. Honorary president of the Association of Transporter Technicians.
name: Emory Erickson
text: V.I.P. ENGINEER Transporter Skill x 3 Physics Computer Skill x 2

lore: In 2370, following the suicide of partially empathic Lt. Daniel Kwan, Deanna Troi experienced visions of a past murder, reliving it through the participants' eyes.
name: Empathic Echo
text: One personnel present with Empathy (random selection) is killed unless SECURITY and MEDICAL present.

lore: "It's accelerating. You have no more time for games."
name: Empathic Touch
text: When your personnel is about to be killed, if your Empathy personnel is present, stop both personnel to prevent that.

lore: Cardassian mining station abandoned in 2372.
name: Empok Nor
text: Seeds (uncontrolled) during mission phase at a [Univ] mission. Dilemmas related to Empok Nor may seed beneath station. No reporting aboard. Once no dilemmas remain, any player may commandeer; then flip over. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Abandoned mining station recently repaired and activated.
name: Empok Nor (back)
text: When first flipped, each player may download to station any number of different compatible Site and Equipment cards. Normal reporting now allowed. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Estranged father of Elim Garak. Former head of the Obsidian Order. Led covert Obsidian Order/Tal Shiar raid on the Founders' homeworld.
name: Enabran Tain
text: V.I.P. Leadership SECURITY Treachery Computer Skill Obsidian Order x 2

lore: Subspace communications are sometimes abruptly terminated by the transmitter.
name: End Transmission
text: Play on table. Immediately end your turn. (Unique.)

lore: Whirlpool-like space/time phenomena that can destroy a ship, as it nearly did the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2365.
name: Energy Vortex
text: Plays immediately after opponent plays any non-Interrupt card from hand. That card returns to their hand and a different one must be played instead.

name: Engage Cloak
text: Seeds or plays on table. When your staffed ship cloaks or phases, it may relocate here (capacity one ship). Just before that ship decloaks or dephases, return it to its former location; it may immediately move (up to its full RANGE) once for each of your full turns it was on this objective. (If ship returns to spaceline on your turn, it may also use that turn's RANGE).

lore: Most major starships are outfitted with shuttle hangars and equipment necessary to launch and recover shuttlecraft.
name: Engage Shuttle Operations
text: Plays on table. Your shuttlecraft may take off and land (using full RANGE) and be loaded, carried, and launched by your ships with Tractor Beam and ENGINEER aboard (uses 0 RANGE).

lore: Jem'Hadar warships are designed as mobile bases for attack ships, allowing the Dominion to quickly mobilize and maintain a massive strike fleet.
name: Engage Shuttle Operations: Dominion
requires: Battleship; Jem'Hadar Attack Ship; Shuttlecraft; Tractor Beam; Warship;
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your shuttlecraft and Jem'Hadar attack ships may be loaded aboard and launched from your Dominion warships and battleships with Tractor Beam.

lore: An improperly balanced warp drive system poses a serious hazard. Even a minor misalignment can propel a ship into an artificial wormhole.
name: Engine Imbalance
text: Place on ship. It may not "fly by" a location without stopping, and its RANGE is exhausted each time it moves. Cure with 2 ENGINEER, Computer Skill, and Physics.

lore: Representative of specialized engineering instruments. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Engineering Kit
text: Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the extra skill of ENGINEER where present.

lore: Compact assortment of tools for making modifications and repairs to propulsion and computer systems. Many engineers develop a personal attachment to their set.
name: Engineering Kit (Voyager)
text: Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the extra skill of ENGINEER where present.

lore: Representative of Personal Access Display Devices designed specifically for engineering functions. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Engineering PADD
text: Gives all of your SCIENCE-classification personnel the extra skill of ENGINEER where present.

lore: Representative of specialized tricorders optimized for engineering use. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Engineering Tricorder
text: Gives all of your MEDICAL-classification personnel the extra skill of ENGINEER where present.

lore: Diagnostic device specially calibrated for use on mechanical systems. The layout of the Starfleet version is intentionally similar to their standard tricorder to allow for easy operation.
name: Engineering Tricorder (Voyager)
text: Gives all of your MEDICAL-classification personnel the extra skill of ENGINEER where present.

lore: Highly valued assistant to Chief O'Brien. Called "Quique" by his friends. Joked that he wants to grow up to be O'Brien - just not as old and grizzled.
name: Enrique Muniz
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Honor Navigation Geology

lore: Pavel Andreievich Chekov. Feisty 22-year-old Russian navigator of the starship Enterprise. Protege of Mr. Spock. Considers Klingons "cossacks."
name: Ensign Chekov
text: OFFICER Youth Navigation SCIENCE If on {Starship Enterprise}, it is RANGE +2.

lore: In 2267, Miles O'Brien beamed his away team aboard the original starship Enterprise to save Captain Kirk from Barry Waddle's assassination attempt.
name: Ensign O'Brien
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics Honor Transporter Skill DL/ {Classic Communicator}

lore: 29-year-old Vulcan on first deep space assignment aboard Captain Sulu's U.S.S. Excelsior in 2293. Joined Starfleet under pressure from his parents.
name: Ensign Tuvok
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Mindmeld Youth Once per game, may cancel ship battle at same nebula.

lore: Trains Obsidian Order operatives. Enemy of Ghemor. Had Kira Nerys surgically altered to appear Cardassian in 2371. Rather liked by Garak.
name: Entek
text: SECURITY Treachery Exobiology Biology Obsidian Order

lore: Legendary prototype designed for deep space travel. Commanded by Jonathan Archer. First Starfleet vessel to bear the name that would symbolize Starfleet's elite.
name: Enterprise
text: Attributes all +1 for each [Sta][Cmd] aboard (limit 5).

lore: Self-contained garment for protecting personnel in a hostile environment. A variable magnetic field can be activated in the boots when working in zero-gravity.
name: Environmental Suit
text: You may discard this equipment to prevent a personnel present from being killed by a dilemma or a Tactic card (that personnel is stopped instead).

lore: E.M.H. on U.S.S. Equinox. Designed and performed criminal experiments on alien life after his ethical subroutines were deleted by the ship's crew.
name: Equinox Doctor
text: MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Treachery x 2 Computer Skill DL/ {Medical Kit} OR {Starfleet Type II Phaser}

lore: E.M.H. on U.S.S. Equinox. Designed and performed criminal experiments on alien life after his ethical subroutines were deleted by the ship's crew.
name: Equinox Doctor*
text: MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Treachery x 2 Computer Skill DL/ {Medical Kit} OR {Starfleet Type II Phaser}

lore: Captain Eric Pressman commanded the U.S.S. Pegasus before it was lost in space following a failed experiment.
name: Eric Pressman
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Treachery

lore: Angosian escape pod used by Roga Danar in 2366. Escape pods can be used in an emergency to save a crew.
name: Escape Pod
text: Plays on ship being destroyed. Escape pod saves entire crew. Unseen by enemy ships, crew remains in pod until personnel rescued. Discard after rescue.

lore: Rapid-deploy emergency evacuation modules. Most starships are equipped with such systems.
name: Escape Pod (Voyager)
text: Plays on ship being destroyed. Escape pod saves entire crew. Unseen by enemy ships, crew remains in pod until personnel rescued. Discard after rescue.

affiliation: Any 'Espionage... on Federation' card may play here.  Also, mission may be attempted if {Selok} in Away Team.
lore: Infiltrate Starfleet HQ; compile intelligence dossier on the Federation homeworld.
name: Espionage Mission
requires: Espionage... on Federation; Founder; Sector 001 Region;
text: Tal Shiar x2 OR Obsidian Order x2 OR FCA x2 OR Klingon Intelligence x2 OR 2 Founders

lore: Bajorans have investigated Cardassian activities before, during and after the 30-year occupation. In 2371, Odo contacted an old Cardassian acquaintance to investigate the Obsidian Order.
name: Espionage: Bajoran on Cardassian
text: Plays on any Cardassian mission (for free if you have a Resistance personnel there). Your Bajoran personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: No strangers to oppression, many Bajorans fought the 2374 Dominion occupation from within. With Odo's help, Kira's small "resistance cell" paved the way for the Dominion withdrawal.
name: Espionage: Bajoran on Dominion
text: Plays on any Dominion mission (for free if you have {Odo} there). Your Bajoran personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Since withdrawing from Bajor in 2369, Cardassians have kept a watchful eye on Bajoran activities.
name: Espionage: Cardassian on Bajoran
text: Plays on any Bajoran mission. Your Cardassian personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Cardassian spies are masters of undercover operations. In 2371 Miles O'Brien was framed by a surgically altered Cardassian posing as retired Starfleet officer Raymond Boone.
name: Espionage: Cardassian on Federation
text: Plays on any Federation mission. Your Cardassian personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Cardassians have long been suspicious of the Klingon Empire. The unprovoked Klingon invasion of 2372 demonstrated the need to step up the Union's intelligence-gathering activities.
name: Espionage: Cardassian on Klingon
text: Plays on any Klingon mission. Your Cardassian personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Dominion intelligence operations conducted against the Federation have included the initial Eris ruse, Borath's virtual invasion scenario and even changeling infiltration of Earth.
name: Espionage - Dominion on Federation
text: Plays on any Federation mission (for free if your <Fed> personnel is there). Your Dominion personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: A changeling impersonating General Martok manipulated Gowron so craftily that the Chancellor abandoned the Khitomer Accords and declared war on its long-time ally the Federation.
name: Espionage - Dominion on Klingon
text: Plays on any Klingon mission (for free if your <Kli> personnel is there). Your Dominion personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Romulan counter-espionage protocols are second to none. The vigilance of the Tal Shiar protected the Star Empire from enemy spies for decades - until the Dominion arrived.
name: Espionage - Dominion on Romulan
text: Plays on any Romulan mission (for free if your <Rom> personnel is there). Your Dominion personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Federation intelligence-gathering has often relied on sympathetic informants and electronic surveillance.
name: Espionage: Federation on Klingon
text: Plays on any Klingon mission. Your Federation personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Klingon espionage against the Federation has included data stolen from Relay Station 47 by Morag.
name: Espionage: Klingon on Federation
text: Plays on any Federation mission. Your Klingon personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Romulan spies are still everywhere.
name: Espionage: Romulan on Bajoran
text: Plays on any Bajoran mission. Your Romulan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Romulan infiltration of Cardassian facilities has gone largely undetected for decades.
name: Espionage: Romulan on Cardassian
text: Plays on any Cardassian mission. Your Romulan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Romulan spies are everywhere.
name: Espionage: Romulan on Federation
text: Plays on any Federation mission. Your Romulan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Romulan espionage against Klingons has included efforts to de-stabilize the Klingon government by programming assassins and supporting rebel forces.
name: Espionage: Romulan on Klingon
text: Plays on any Klingon mission. Your Romulan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

name: Establish Dominion Foothold
text: Seeds or plays on a mission in Alpha or Delta Quadrant if none of your [Dom] cards have been in that quadrant yet this game. If your Dominion personnel subsequently complete that mission, you may download a Dominion facility with up to five different Equipment cards there; score points (discard objective). You may complete this objective only once in each quadrant.

name: Establish Gateway
text: Seeds or plays on table. Target a space mission with no [BO] objective on it. Your Borg may scout that location. After scouting complete, if you have Borg at that location, you may probe: [Com], [Nav]: Sector cleared. Place on mission. Download to here one {Transwarp Network Gateway} (if possible). May download one Objective card.

name: Establish Gateway (The Borg)
text: Seeds or plays on table. Target a space mission with no [BO] objective on it. Your Borg may scout that location. After scouting complete, if you have Borg at that location, you may probe: [Com], [Nav]: Sector cleared. Place on mission. Download to here one {Transwarp Network Gateway} (if possible). May download one Objective card.

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Help found a new "Home of Light" for holograms liberated from Hirogen training facilities.
name: Establish Home Planet
text: Leadership + ENGINEER x2 + Computer Skill x2 * +25 if all personnel in Away Team are [Holo].

lore: Diligent adherence to landing procedures is crucial to the successful operation of runabouts, shuttles and other small spacecraft.
name: Establish Landing Protocols
text: Seeds or plays on table. Each of your ships which has no staffing requirements may use 1 RANGE to land or take off once each turn. (Captain's Order.)

lore: Help Klingon pioneers begin a new Empire on this world very much like Qo'noS.
name: Establish Settlement
text: Diplomacy + Anthropology + Honor OR {Miral Paris} * Discard up to five [DQ] Klingons for +5 each.

lore: Build remote station on this planet located in a cloak-disrupting emission nebula.
name: Establish Station
text: SCIENCE + ENGINEER + SECURITY + CUNNING>35 Cloaking Devices do not function here.

name: Establish Tractor Lock
text: Plays on your Nor with Tractor Beam and your personnel unopposed in {Ops} OR on your staffed ship with Tractor Beam. Immediately target another ship at same location. That ship may not move or initiate battle. You may discard objective at any time. You must discard objective if your ship or Nor moves, battles or has SHIELDS < target's RANGE.

name: Establish Trade Route
text: Seeds or plays on a space mission with a point box that you seeded. You may attempt it using these requirements: Greed + (freighter OR transport OR [Fer] ship) + Acquisition x3 + CUNNING > (mission points x2) When you solve mission, you may download {Ferengi Trading Post} (plus up to two Equipment cards) here; discard objective.

lore: Ktarian female. Attempted to use a psychotropically addictive game to gain control of the Federation in 2368.
name: Etana Jol
text: SCIENCE Treachery Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Bartender; Cook; Male; President; Senator; Waiter;
lore: Tends to leave jobs quickly. Tried working as a cook, bartender, waiter, fan club president, and even student senator before joining Starfleet.
name: Ethan Novakovich
text: SCIENCE Biology Computer Skill Physics

characteristicsKeywords: T'Lani; Ambassador; Female; Harvester Virus-related card;
lore: Female T'Lani ambassador. Worked with Sharat to end war with the Kellerun. Schemed to eliminate everyone with knowledge of the harvester virus.
name: E'Tyshra
text: V.I.P. MEDICAL Leadership Treachery

lore: Evacuate American Indian colony.
name: Evacuation
text: Diplomacy x3 + STRENGTH>35

lore: Evaluate progress of terraforming station.
name: Evaluate Terraforming
text: MEDICAL + Biology + Exobiology OR {Geordi La Forge} + MEDICAL x2

name: Evasive Maneuvers
text: Attack: -2. Defense: 4. DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a ship with no staffing requirements defending. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -35% Plasma leak: randomly kills one ENGINEER, Astrophysics or Physics personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Ore Processing Unit}).

lore: Gul Evek, Cardassian male officer. Administers area ceded to Cardassians in a treaty with the Federation.
name: Evek
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology

name: Examine Singularity
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your ship with SCIENCE, Astrophysics and CUNNING>30 in crew may close {Black Hole} where present. Relocate all ships there to one other location in any quadrant, place Black Hole out-of-play and score points (discard objective). Also, once each turn, you may download (even from discard pile) {Bajoran Wormhole}, {Temporal Wake} or {Deactivation}.

lore: Assist new archaeological dig.
name: Excavation
text: Archaeology OR CUNNING>32

lore: Assist new archaeological dig.
name: Excavation II
text: Archaeology OR CUNNING>32 WORMHOLE: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

lore: Assist new archaeological dig.
name: Excavation II (back)
text: Archaeology OR CUNNING>32 If you have a staffed ship here, you may play {Long-Range Scan} here to "detect Wormhole" (flip mission over).

lore: Before Benjamin Sisko and Admiral Leyton could implement extreme security measures on Earth in 2372, they had to obtain authorization from Federation President Jaresh-Inyo.
name: Executive Authorization
requires: Chairman; Chancellor; Counterpart; Founder; General; Governor; High Council Leader; Intendant; Kai; Legate; Minister; Nagus; President; Proconsul; Queen;
text: To get past requires a President, High Council Leader, General, Legate, Chancellor, Proconsul, Chairman, Intendant, Minister, Kai, Founder, Nagus, Governor, Queen, counterpart, or {PADD}.

lore: Study and evaluate enormous cluster of collapsed proto-stars.
name: Explore Black Cluster
text: Stellar Cartography + Leadership OR CUNNING>50

lore: Study and evaluate collapsed proto-stars.
name: Explore Black Cluster II
text: Stellar Cartography + Leadership OR CUNNING>50 If destroyed, flip mission over.

lore: Study and evaluate collapsed proto-stars.
name: Explore Black Cluster II (back)
text: Stellar Cartography + Leadership OR CUNNING>50 If your Klingon ENGINEER is here, in place of your normal card play you may flip mission over; draw no cards that turn.

lore: Study gigantic structure completely enclosing a star.
name: Explore Dyson Sphere
text: ENGINEER x3 + Navigation + Computer Skill + Physics

name: Explore Gamma Quadrant
