text: Seeds or plays on table. At any time, place on your ship docked at a facility in the Alpha Quadrant. If ship's crew or Away Team solves a Gamma Quadrant mission, then ship returns and docks at that facility, draw three cards and score points (discard objective).

lore: Trace time distortion reported in this desolate region.
name: Explore Typhon Expanse
text: Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography OR CUNNING>50

lore: Trace reported time distortion.
name: Explore Typhon Expanse II
text: Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography OR CUNNING>50 If destroyed, flip mission over.

lore: Trace reported time distortion.
name: Explore Typhon Expanse II (back)
text: Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography OR CUNNING>50 If your Romulan ENGINEER is here, in place of your normal card play you may flip mission over; draw no cards that turn.

lore: Uncover covert supply lines supporting rebels on the Klingon Homeworld.
name: Expose Covert Supply
text: Treachery x3 + Navigation

lore: Exonerate crewman framed for murder, and reveal conspiracy to commit scientific espionage.
name: Expose Plot
text: Diplomacy + Computer Skill + Exobiology x2 OR Law + Mindmeld

lore: Secretly acquire age-reversal drug reportedly under development.
name: Extraction
text: Treachery + Biology + MEDICAL

lore: In 2370, Cardassian legal authorities coerced Miles O'Brien to lower his vessel's shields. They abducted him without explanation and forced him to stand trial on false charges.
name: Extradition
text: If opponent's Law or Treachery here, up to four opponent's SECURITY personnel may beam to one of your ships here, capture a crew member of lower STRENGTH and/or beam off.

lore: Using unorthodox procedures, Julian Bashir was able to briefly prolong the life of Vedek Bareil. The process allowed Bareil to complete critical negotiations.
name: Extraordinary Methods
text: If 3 MEDICAL OR MEDICAL and Cybernetics present, plays on one of your personnel just selected to die. Death is delayed until the end of your next turn.

lore: Deanna Troi saved the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367 by communicating through nightmarish visions with a telepathic species on the other side of a Tyken's Rift.
name: Eyes in the Dark
text: Plays when facing a dilemma. If Empathy present, add the skills and attribute numbers of one personnel (random selection) from any opponent's ship (your choice).

lore: Trill mercenary in the mirror universe. Unlike Ezri Dax, this Ezri is not joined to a symbiont. Partners with Mr. Brunt. Romantically involved with the Intendant.
name: Ezri
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Transporter Skill Leadership Geology Stellar Cartography DL/ {Crossover}

characteristicsKeywords: Trill; Counselor; Female; Trill with symbiont;
lore: Trill. Ship's counselor. Succeeded Jadzia Dax as ninth symbiont host. Unprepared for her emergency joining. Romantically involved with Julian Bashir. Gets spacesick.
name: Ezri Dax
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Anthropology Diplomacy Youth Geology Reports for free if {Jadzia Dax} has died.

lore: When Miles O'Brien discovered his publicized racquetball match was unfairly influenced by an alien gambling device, he refused to take advantage of an unfair situation.
name: Fair Play
text: Seeds or plays on table; may not be nullified. No player may solve an opponent's unique mission unless its point box shows at least 40 points OR both players have a copy of it in play.

lore: In 2372, Tom Paris concocted a sweepstakes to guess the daily radiogenic particle count, skimming a tenth of the proceeds for himself. Chakotay put a stop to the game, confiscating the pot.
name: Fair Play (Voyager)
text: Seeds or plays on table; may not be nullified. No player may solve an opponent's unique mission unless its point box shows at least 40 points OR both players have a copy of it in play.

lore: Kidnapped by Kivas Fajo, Data became part of an impressive collection of rare and one-of-a-kind items. Fajo had no problem with the morality of Data's imprisonment.
name: Fajo's Gallery
text: Seeds or plays on table. You may draw two cards each time you capture a unique personnel, and one card each time one of your [Fajo] cards or your {Mona Lisa} enters play.

lore: Tactician aboard the Kreechta. Serves under Bractor. Shocked when Jean-Luc Picard "destroyed" the U.S.S. Hathaway. Didn't think the Federation had such iron.
name: Falar
text: OFFICER Treachery Transporter Skill DL/ {Ferengi Energy Weapon}

characteristicsKeywords: Hologram; Assassin; Dr. Noah-related personnel; Male; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
lore: Deadly assassin hired by Dr. Noah to deal with problems like Secret Agent Julian Bashir. The character took on the appearance of Miles O'Brien after an accident in 2372.
name: Falcon
text: SECURITY May place in your point area when he mortally wounds an adversary. Treachery

lore: Vulcan refusion of the body and katra. The ritual was performed successfully for the first time since ancient legend between Leonard H. McCoy, son of David, and Spock, son of Sarek.
name: Fal-tor-pan
text: Plays on table. At any time top card of your discard pile is a Vulcan personnel, you may place it here. Personnel here may report to the planet {Vulcan} as if from your hand.

lore: Earth is a member of the United Federation of Planets. The Federation establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Federation Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Federation ENGINEER.

lore: Standard Federation Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
name: Federation PADD
text: Federation use only. Each of your personnel CUNNING +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

name: Feedback Surge
text: Seeds or plays on table. If opponent completes {Establish Gateway} targeting a mission they did not seed, you score those points (instead of opponent). Also, if opponent discards any seed cards using {Ajur}, {Boratus}, {Senior Staff Meeting}, or their own dilemma, you may immediately re-seed them under any mission(s); opponent loses 10 points for each such card.

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Stake claim and exploit rich feldomite deposits recently struck here.
name: Feldomite Rush
text: Geology + Greed + (Treachery x3 OR Law)

lore: Hit man from the Dixon Hill stories. Never strays far from his boss, Cyrus Redblock. Held several Enterprise crew members at gunpoint during a holodeck malfunction.
name: Felix Leech
text: CIVILIAN Opposing personnel present may not use classifications. DL/ {Cyrus Redblock} (if opponent attacked you this game).

lore: A genetically-engineered leader. Once romantically involved with Deanna Troi.
name: Female's Love Interest
text: Female Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. Discard dilemma.

name: Female's Love Interest & Garbage Scow
text: FEMALE'S LOVE INTEREST: Female crew or Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. RADIOACTIVE GARBAGE SCOW: Place on mission; mission attempt ends. Mission can't be attempted here. Ship with Tractor Beam and 2 ENGINEER can tow Scow.

lore: Genetically manipulated to become Taresian, the handsome Taymon was desired by Malia and two other Taresian females.
name: Female's Love Interest (Voyager)
text: Female Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. Discard dilemma.

lore: One of only two humanoid members of the Think Tank. Instrumental in the mercenary group's discovery of a cure for the Vidiian Phage.
name: Fennim
text: SCIENCE MEDICAL x 2 Exobiology Anthropology Your Vidiians are immune to {The Phage}.

lore: Ferengi attacked a Federation Away Team on a planet in the Delphi Ardu system using "whips" which fire discharges of high-energy plasma.
name: Ferengi Attack
text: Kills one Away Team member (opponent's choice) unless total CUNNING + STRENGTH>68 OR Greed present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Quark attempted to use a Ferengi eavesdropping device to gather information on Shakaar Edon in 2372. He wanted to sell high-level Bajoran political information.
name: Ferengi Bug
text: Unless 3 SECURITY (or {Odo}) and {any tricorder} OR 2 FCA present, place atop mission. While in play, your hand is exposed, face up on table.

name: Ferengi Conference
text: Seeds or plays on {Quark's Bar}. When you have a Nagus here, you may download one copy of the {75th Rule of Acquisition} to each of your other Ferengi here who has Acquisition. Discard objective. OR Plays on your Nagus at Quark's Bar or aboard a [Fer] facility. Download to that Nagus one Hupyrian or any number of Ferengi CIVILIANs with up to 11 total [*] icons. Discard objective.

lore: Standard-issue hand weapon used by military personnel in the Ferengi Alliance. Provides accuracy and energy output comparable to those of the Starfleet hand phaser.
name: Ferengi Disruptor
text: Ferengi and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Powerful energy weapon. Essential protection for particularly dangerous or unusual missions - such as when rescuing one's Moogie from the Dominion.
name: Ferengi Disruptor Rifle
text: Ferengi and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

name: Ferengi Energy Weapon
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Ferengi ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

lore: Galactic service providing up-to-the-second reports on market fluctuations, currency values, and commodity prices - all for a reasonable usage fee. Essential for any serious entrepreneur.
name: Ferengi Financial Data Net
text: Plays to discard your hand. Draw a card for each unique [Fer] Greed personnel you have in play. Discard event.

lore: In anticipation of a prisoner exchange, a Dominion delegation boarded Empok Nor in 2374. They found that the Ferengi were already entrenched there.
name: Ferengi Infestation
text: Opponent may download up to two male Ferengi to a facility at this location (or up to six if facility is {Empok Nor}). To get past requires 2 SECURITY and CUNNING>50.

lore: Quark's refusal to spend latinum resulted in some creative holosuite repairs. Rom once used a copper-ytterbium composite spatula as a spare part - the perfect plasma conductor.
name: Ferengi Ingenuity
text: If one personnel present has 2 Computer Skill, discard dilemma. Otherwise, to get past, place on most CUNNING Computer Skill present ("stopped" during countdown).

lore: Ferenginar is the rainy, soggy homeworld of the highly capitalistic Ferengi people. The Ferengi Alliance establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Ferengi Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Ferengi ENGINEER.

lore: Standard Ferengi Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
name: Ferengi PADD
text: Ferengi use only. Each of your personnel present is CUNNING +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Ferengi commercial centers are frequented by many races for trade, information, repair and resupply.
name: Ferengi Trading Post
text: Seed one (you may also seed one [Univ] {D'Kora} face up here) OR build where you have a Ferengi ENGINEER. Each player's non-Borg cards may report and mix aboard regardless of affiliation.

lore: Unconventional hand weapon. High-energy plasma discharge renders victims unconscious. Difficult to wield, it was phased out of use after a number of embarrassing accidents.
name: Ferengi Whip
text: Each of your Ferengi present is STRENGTH +2, and in each battle one of them may stun one adversary they just engaged. (Cumulative.)

lore: Immense spherical vessel. Flagship of the First Federation. Commanded by Balok.
name: Fesarius
text: Your {Balok} may report aboard (for free). Tractor Beam

lore: Coordinate aid for Correllium Fever outbreak.
name: Fever Emergency
text: MEDICAL x3 OR Biology + OFFICER

lore: Study interior of nebula filled with energy strands that obstruct navigation.
name: FGC-47 Research
text: Diplomacy + Youth x2 X = 6 minus each Navigation aboard ship.

lore: Immature drone of Species 689, Norcadian; irrelevant designation: Mezoti. Detected Harry Kim's presence aboard her ship by the trail of playing cards he'd left.
name: Fifth
text: Youth Computer Skill Biology SECURITY Once each turn, may return to hand one of your [BO] Incident, Event, or Objective cards in play.

lore: "Go on. Take a poke at me. That is what you want to do, isn't it?"
name: Fightin' Words
text: Place on table. All your personnel with three or more [*] icons lose their first two listed skills. Nullified only by {Oof!} or if you initiate personnel battle.

name: File Mission Report
text: Seeds or plays on table. When one of your personnel has used a classification or skill to meet a mission requirement, and you have not yet attempted another mission, that personnel may "file a mission report" if unopposed at a site which allows this. Score points (discard objective). Limit one per mission.

lore: Native of the Parallax Colony who created intricate and artistic designs in the air with fire.
name: Fire Sculptor
text: Plays on {Plasma Fire} or {Warp Core Breach} to move onto nearest opponent's ship. OR "Melt" (place out-of-play) one card in any discard pile.

lore: With advanced technology, personnel can work together to survive natural phenomenon such as the firestorms on Bersallis III.
name: Firestorm
text: Kills all Away Team members with INTEGRITY<5 unless {thermal deflectors} present (but Away Team may escape using {Emergency Transporter Armbands}). Discard dilemma.

lore: Immature, humanoid drone. Hostile and irrational. Self-designated leader of a group of neonatal drones activated prematurely by malfunctions aboard his cube.
name: First
text: Youth Treachery Navigation Biology May initiate battle against intruders. Your Borg present are each STRENGTH +3 in battle.

lore: Make initial contact with advancing civilization.
name: First Contact
text: Diplomacy + Empathy

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Male; Minister; Shakaar Resistance Cell;
lore: Once a farmer and leader of Shakaar resistance cell, Shakaar Edon was elected First Minister in 2371.
name: First Minister Shakaar
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Honor Law Once each turn, allows your Bajoran CIVILIAN to report for free to {Chamber of Ministers} if present.

lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 human. History will record that Mr. Spock rose to command the I.S.S. Enterprise, then reformed the Empire and ultimately caused its downfall.
name: First Officer Spock
text: SCIENCE OFFICER Mindmeld Diplomacy x 2 Honor Transporter Skill DL/ Any [OS] Equipment card

lore: Investigate quantum fissure between parallel universes reported here.
name: Fissure Research
text: Astrophysics + Physics + 3 [AU] icon Personnel

lore: Quarantined on a planet due to a viral illness, Janeway and Chakotay were forced to "rough it." They found the sudden plasma storms on the planet as dangerous as their disease.
name: Flash Plasma Storm
text: Kills each Away Team member who has both STRENGTH<6 (ignoring hand weapon enhancements) and CUNNING<9. Nullified if you have {Thermal Deflectors} in play.

lore: Valued for their professionalism, Flaxian assassins are often employed by the Tal Shiar. Retaya was sent to eliminate Garak using a combinant poison disguised as perfumes.
name: Flaxian Assassin
text: Unless 2 SECURITY and Biology present, kills one personnel (two if opponent has Tal Shiar in play) with three or more [*] icons (random selection).

lore: Fleet Admiral Shanthi authorized the blockade of Romulan forces covertly supporting the Klingon Civil War in 2368.
name: Fleet Admiral Shanthi
text: OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy

lore: When the changeling impersonating Admiral Leyton on Earth was caught red-handed by Odo, the Founder quickly made a winged escape.
name: Flight of the Intruder
text: Except during the destruction of a location, ship or facility, suspends play while any or all of your shape-shifters present together morph into birds (return to your hand).

name: For Cardassia!
text: Plays on your Legate (for free if they have Honor). All your Cardassians present are INTEGRITY and STRENGTH +2. When that Legate helps complete {HQ: Secure Homeworld} at {Cardassia Prime}, you may discard objective: download two Cardassians who have Honor OR once per game, place Legate and two other Cardassians who have Honor from that Away Team out-of-play to score points.

name: Forced-Labor Camp
text: Seeds or plays on {Cardassia IV}, {Ligos VII} or your planet that has Geology or Archaeology as a requirement. Your [Car] and [Fer] personnel may attempt mission. On Cardassia IV or Ligos VII, changes your mission requirements to these: SECURITY + Geology + STRENGTH>(mission points x2) After you solve, while you escort a captive on this planet, you may draw one additional card at end of each turn.

lore: Female changeling. Center of power for the entire Dominion. Key figure in the Great Link. Told Odo of his origin; greatly desires his return to the Link.
name: Founder Leader
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Exobiology SCIENCE Law DL/ {Shape-Shift}

lore: Searching for the source of a jamming signal, Kira Nerys discovered a secret door on the Founders' homeworld. The lock was designed to be worked by changeling physiology.
name: Founder Secret
text: To get past requires a changeling OR {Interphase Generator} OR {Croden's Key} OR CUNNING>40 and {any tricorder} OR STRENGTH>70 OR 4 [Def] drones OR {Breen CRM114}.

lore: Identification: HEURISTICS DRONE Task: Secondary adjunct of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid; Species 571.
name: Four of Nine
text: Computer Skill Honor MEDICAL Once each turn, may place one drone present beneath draw deck, then download another.

lore: Nearly unbreakable code. Based on infinitely recursive fractal algorithms. Data used one to isolate the main computer, storing the decryption codes in his neural net.
name: Fractal Encryption Code
text: Plays on your ship or outpost if your android aboard. It may not be assimilated or commandeered and may not use RANGE or WEAPONS. Same android may nullify interrupt if aboard.

lore: William Riker was captured in 2369 on Tilonus IV, tortured with neurosomatic techniques and made to believe he was someone else - until his illusions were shattered.
name: Frame of Mind
text: One personnel present (random selection) now becomes Non-Aligned with attributes of 3-3-3 and only two skills (opponent's choice). Cure with 3 Empathy present.

lore: The convicted murderer Ibudan planted evidence implicating his prosecutor, Odo. To avoid a possible conflict of interest, Odo was relieved of duty during the investigation.
name: Framed for Murder
text: Place on a unique personnel present (opponent's choice). That personnel cannot use skills or staff ships. Nullify with any personnel who has CUNNING>9 and Biology OR Law.

lore: Main "bad guy" in Alexander's Deadwood program. Eli's pa. A computer malfunction caused the character to take on the appearance and physical abilities of Data.
name: Frank Hollander
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Leadership Treachery DL/ {Captured} {Holoprogram: Deadwood} here is suspended.

lore: Ferengi lack of leadership resulted in the untimely demise of the Vorta Keevan aboard Empok Nor. His death was a major setback in Quark and Rom's mission to rescue their Moogie.
name: Friendly Fire
text: Unless 2 Leadership and 2 SECURITY present, kills one personnel (random selection); place dilemma on this mission (or this {Empok Nor}); it cannot be attempted or scouted.

lore: "SILENCE!"
name: Frigid
text: Plays on table. The next time you play an Interrupt card during opponent's turn, opponent may place this event on any one of your SECURITY personnel in play. Personnel is in stasis until any Q-Flash, then discard event. May be nullified by {Fire Sculptor}.

name: Full Phaser Spread
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Galaxy-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Science panel destroyed: randomly kills one SCIENCE or Stellar Cartography personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Science Lab}).

lore: Sensor instruments can make detailed scans of a planet surface and atmosphere.
name: Full Planet Scan
text: Plays at the start of your turn. Stop a staffed ship with at least three staffing icons and Computer Skill aboard at a [P] mission to examine the bottom seed card there.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; General; Male; The Circle-related personnel;
lore: High-ranking Bajoran Militia leader. Member of the Circle. Took over Deep Space 9 in 2370, but returned the station when informed of Cardassian involvement.
name: General Krim
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation Honor Stellar Cartography

lore: Medical device invented by Dr. Toby Russell. Capable of growing replacements for damaged organs.
name: Genetronic Replicator
text: Plays on table. Prevents any of your Away Team members from being killed if 2 MEDICAL present.

lore: Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge is chief engineer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Great sense of humor. Fortuitous holodeck programmer.
name: Geordi La Forge
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Navigation Physics Computer Skill

lore: In 2371, Chief Engineer Geordi La Forge received ocular implants that surpassed the functions of his old VISOR. Attended Zefram Cochrane High School.
name: Geordi La Forge (First Contact)
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics Leadership DL/ {Ocular Implants}

lore: Two humpback whales, male and female, raised in captivity on 20th-century Earth. Gracie is pregnant.
name: George and Gracie
text: ANIMAL+ANIMAL George: Nullifies {The Whale Probe} at this location. Gracie: Worth points while on {Earth}.

lore: Starfleet security officer assigned to Deep Space 9. Annoyed Odo. Discovered a subspace crossover shunt placed on the station by the criminal Rao Vantika in 2369.
name: George Primmin
text: SECURITY SECURITY Computer Skill Biology Once per game, may nullify {Computer Crash}.

lore: Gifted terraformer who in 2370 planned to crown his career by reigniting the burned-out star Epsilon 119. Failure - and modesty - do not agree well with him.
name: Gideon Seyetik
text: SCIENCE Each time he helps solve a mission requiring SCIENCE, you may draw a card. Astrophysics Physics x 2

lore: "We have offered you a gift beyond all other gifts."
name: Gift of the Tormentor
text: If your current score is zero, score bonus points. Otherwise, place this card in your discard pile. (May be nullified only by {Countermanda}.)

lore: Cardassian Ministry of Science member. Worked on the 2371 subspace relay project. Mistook Miles O'Brien's irritation with her as a Cardassian mating ritual.
name: Gilora Rejal
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Honor Attributes all +2 if {Miles O'Brien} in play.

lore: Survivor of Khitomer massacre. Wife of Tokath. Mother of Ba'el. Raised her daughter at a Romulan prison camp in the Carraya system.
name: Gi'ral
text: CIVILIAN May build {Colony} at unsolved planet mission if present there with {Tokath}. {Ba'el} scores double points there.

lore: "Thou art notified that thy kind has infiltrated the galaxy too far already. Thou art directed to return to thy own solar system immediately."
name: Go Back Whence Thou Camest
text: If INTGRITY < 10 OR INTEGRITY > 50, at the end of your turn opponent may relocate any one of your ships at this location to one of your facilities.

lore: "This starship. Could it carry my wisdom beyond the Barrier? ...Then I shall make use of this starship... bring it closer, so that I might... join with it."
name: "God"
text: Unless two Away Team members each have INTEGRITY>7, place on mission; destroys one ship here (opponent's choice). You must have a ship here to attempt mission.

lore: Lt. Reginald Barclay created a fantasy holodeck simulation of Counselor Deanna Troi. Her empathic abilities help other personnel anticipate danger.
name: Goddess of Empathy
text: Plays on table until the end of your next turn. Neither you nor your opponent can play Interrupt cards (except {Kevin Uxbridge} or {Q2}). Discard after use.

lore: Kira Nerys went directly to Admiral Rollman when she disagreed with one of Benjamin Sisko's command decisions. Sisko and Rollman were not exactly pleased with her action.
name: Going to the Top
text: Plays if you have two [Cmd] personnel together on a facility. Download a compatible personnel with Leadership x2 to them (once per game per affiliation).

lore: Valuable liquid latinum encased in relatively worthless gold dust. Standard of exchange throughout the Ferengi Alliance. Typically traded in bars, strips and slips; 1 bar = 20 strips = 2,000 slips.
name: Gold-Pressed Latinum
text: Once each turn, on {a Trading Post}, homeworld or {Quark's Bar}, you may discard two Latinum (one if your Acquisition present) to download a non-Latinum Equipment card there.

lore: Lifeform that normally exists in symbiotic empathic connection with its crew. Gomtuu's crew died prior to its discovery in 2366. Commanded by Tam Elbrun.
name: Gomtuu
text: If staffed, immune to {Supernova}. *If target has SHIELDS<9, hurl it up to 9 span.

lore: First. Jem'Hadar soldier who overcame addiction to ketracel-white. Brought group of Jem'Hadar to Bopak III seeking freedom from the white and the Vorta.
name: Goran'Agar
text: OFFICER Honor x 2 Leadership Navigation Biology Nullifies {Hippocratic Oath} where present.

characteristicsKeywords: Capturing-related card; Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Warbird commanded by Sela. Used to intercept Geordi La Forge's shuttle en route to Risa in 2367, and to mentally reprogram the engineer.
name: Goraxus
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Romulan Ambush}

lore: Large reptilian humanoid. Pitted against Captain Kirk by the Metrons in a contest of wits and brute strength. Showed no mercy.
name: Gorn Encounter
text: Attacks personnel with most Leadership (opponent's choice if tie or none). Killed unless printed (CUNNING or STRENGTH) + (number of [*] icons) > 12. Discard dilemma.

lore: Uninvited participant in the 2366 Barzan wormhole negotiations. DaiMon. Conspired with Devinoni Ral to deceive. Preoccupied with getting his own chair.
name: Goss
text: OFFICER Greed Treachery x 2 DL/ {Latinum Payoff} MEDICAL {Wormhole Negotiations} has [FER].

lore: Former member of the Klingon High Council in an alternate timeline in which, by 2395, the Klingons had taken over the Romulan Empire.
name: Governor Worf
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Honor x 2 Navigation Diplomacy Leadership

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Duras-related; High Council; High Council Leader; Male;
lore: Son of M'Rel. Leader of the Klingon High Council after defeating the Duras forces in the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
name: Gowron
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor

lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Empire in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Klingon - Gowron - is part of us now."
name: Gowron of Borg
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor Once per game, allows his hive to initiate battle. While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Kli].

lore: Aggressive Ferengi opportunist. Diplomatically, but insistently, threatened Quark with a protection racket while Quark was briefly serving as the Grand Nagus.
name: Gral
text: CIVILIAN Greed Treachery Acquisition Diplomacy SECURITY DL/ {Protection Racket}

lore: The first Grand Nagus. Credited with writing the Rules of Acquisition. Appeared in Quark's dream; looked a lot like Rom. Told Quark the Rules were a marketing ploy.
name: Grand Nagus Gint
text: V.I.P. Greed x 2 Acquisition Law Archaeology DL/ {Bribery} DL/ {Any [Rule] card}

lore: Aging financial and political leader of the Ferengi Alliance. Romantically - and secretly - involved with Ishka. Admits he's not as greedy as he used to be.
name: Grand Nagus Zek
text: V.I.P. Acquisition Greed Leadership Law Diplomacy DL/ {HQ: Ferengi Credit Exchange}

lore: Investigate distress call received from lab of Dr. Ira Graves here.
name: Gravesworld
text: MEDICAL + OFFICER + Physics

lore: Gravimetric fluctuations sometimes accompany interruptions in the normal flow of space and time. Spatial distortion phenomena can cause a wide range of problems.
name: Gravimetric Distortion
text: Ship damaged unless 4 ENGINEER OR 2 Astrophysics OR a personnel who has 2 Navigation OR {Guinan} aboard.

lore: Species 8472 uses quantum singularities to cross from their realm of fluidic space into our galaxy. The singularities produce intense gravimetric distortions that can damage nearby ships.
name: Gravimetric Distortion (Voyager)
text: Ship damaged unless 4 ENGINEER OR 2 Astrophysics OR a personnel who has 2 Navigation OR {Guinan} aboard.

lore: Free-floating weapon used against space vehicles. The U.S.S. Denver struck such a mine, which caused it to crash in the Mericor System.
name: Gravitic Mine
text: Ship damaged unless SCIENCE and Navigation aboard. Discard dilemma.

lore: "We are Pakleds. Our ship is the Mondor. We look for things. We want to be nothing if not persistent."
name: Grebnedlog
text: OFFICER Greed Anthropology DL/ {We Look for Things} Once per game, may capture one ENGINEER here.

lore: Klingon female. Leader of her own House due to special dispensation granted by Chancellor Gowron. Briefly married to Quark, Son of Keldar.
name: Grilka
text: V.I.P. Honor x 2 Leadership Biology Attributes all +3 if with {any Quark}.

lore: Commanded by Dukat following his demotion over the Ziyal scandal. Armed with jury-rigged system 5 disruptors scavenged from Korma.
name: Groumall
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {System 5 Disruptors}

lore: "You will now answer to the charge of being a grievously savage race... Soldiers, you will press those triggers if this criminal answers with any word other than 'guilty.'"
name: Guilty - Provisionally
text: Randomly select one personnel present. If you say "guilty - provisionally," plays on table; opponent may cancel the next battle you initiate, then discard dilemma. Otherwise, personnel killed.

characteristicsKeywords: El-Aurian; Bartender; Female; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: 500-year-old El-Aurian. U.S.S. Enterprise bartender. Trusted advisor and confidant of Jean-Luc Picard.
name: Guinan
text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may nullify any [AU] or [Q] icon interrupt, event or dilemma where present. If on {any Enterprise}, doubles {Captain's Log} there.

lore: Ruthless Obsidian Order officer. Madred's torture of Jean-Luc Picard quickly degenerated into a desperate attempt to break Picard's will. A pitiable man.
name: Gul Madred
text: OFFICER Obsidian Order SECURITY Treachery Archaeology DL/ {Torture}

lore: Get lethal cargo past patrol ship to conclude lucrative arms deal with local interests.
name: Gunrunning
text: Greed x2 + Smuggling x2 + Anthropology + CUNNING>28 + (hand weapon OR {Echo Papa 607})

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-prey captained by Kruge on a covert mission to the Genesis Planet. Stolen and commanded by Admiral Kirk; re-christened with historical irony by Dr. McCoy.
name: H.M.S. Bounty
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

lore: Having apparently seduced a new counterpart to join the collective with temptations of flesh, the Queen had no further use for her old "equal."
name: He Will Make an Excellent Drone
text: Converts your counterpart to a drone. (Discard any {Assimilate Counterpart} objective placed on that Borg.)

lore: Provide medical aid to spaceborne life-form injured by starship.
name: Heal Life-form
text: MEDICAL + Physics + Biology + Navigation

lore: Transporter subsystem designed to circumvent the "uncertainty principle" of subatomic physics, allowing the derivation of quantum vector data required for beaming.
name: Heisenberg Compensators
text: Plays on table. While in play, nullifies {Alien Probe} and all draw decks are turned face up. OR Nullifies another Heisenberg Compensators card (discard both).

name: Hero of the Empire
text: Seeds or plays on {Deep Space Station K-7}. Download {Captain Kirk} aboard; he may not be moved. If he leaves play because of a {Tribble Bomb} (or an action your opponent initiated), timeline disrupted in 2267: place objective on table; each Alpha Quadrant mission solved this game is -10 points if solved by opponent, or +10 if showing [KLI] icon and solved by your non-Federation crew or Away Team.

lore: "Doctor Cochrane, I know this sounds silly, but can I shake your hand?"
name: Hero Worship
text: "Stops" non-Borg crew or Away Team members with the most and fewest [*] icons. (In case of ties, "stops" all tied personnel.)

lore: Using his visor, Geordi La Forge discovered a doorway to an underground android laboratory hidden in a rock wall on Omicron Theta in 2364.
name: Hidden Entrance
text: To locate the concealed entrance and continue, Away Team must have {Geordi La Forge} OR ENGINEER + CUNNING>32.

lore: The resistance concealed small spacecraft throughout the Bajor system during the occupation. A decade later, Kira Nerys and Jadzia Dax recovered one from the abandoned Lunar V base.
name: Hidden Fighter
text: Downloads one ship with no staffing requirements to your Away Team on a planet. (You may also download {Establish Landing Protocols} or {Engage Shuttle Operations}.)

lore: "Why don't we play a little game? I'll hide... you find me."
name: Hide and Seek
text: Shuffle Hide and Seek together with crew or Away Team. Randomly select cards until a [Univ] personnel or Hide and Seek selected. All selected personnel are stopped; discard dilemma. (May be seeded as a [S/P] dilemma.)

lore: On stardate 49066.5, rogue Jem'Hadar detained Julian Bashir on Bopak III. He was compelled to seek a cure to their genetically engineered addiction to the drug ketracel-white.
name: Hippocratic Oath
text: To get past, most CUNNING MEDICAL must relocate with dilemma to nearest planet at another location (must still have MEDICAL upon arrival); stopped until countdown expires.

lore: Extremely high-powered weapon favored by Hirogen hunters. Constructed of solid monotanium. Over one meter in length. Equipped with a short-range tactical scanner for tracking prey.
name: Hirogen Disruptor Rifle
text: Hirogen use only. Each of your Hirogen present is STRENGTH +4 and CUNNING +2, but loses all Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

name: Hirogen Hunt
text: Seeds or plays on table. In place of your normal card draw, you may download {Rituals of the Hunt}, {Hirogen Hunt}, or any [Hir] ship. Also, once each turn, you may report an Alpha-Hirogen (or any [Hir] card that names in its lore an Alpha-Hirogen you already have in play) for free. OR Plays on your [Hir] ship; its transporters may be used to beam through SHIELDS of any damaged ship here (even if landed).

lore: After cornering or capturing their prey, many Hirogen hunters prefer to use a simple blade weapon to prolong the exhilaration of making the kill.
name: Hirogen Talon
text: Hirogen use only. Reports for free. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) May report to a just-initiated personnel battle involving your [Hir] card(s).

lore: "Yes, but what about your merry men? Are you willing to jeopardize their lives as well?"
name: His Honor, The High Sheriff of Nottingham
text: If any of your personnel are held captive, you must either lose points OR return one such captive here (released). If, just after relocation, opponent shows SECURITY from hand, opponent captures two of your personnel present (random selection). (Immune to {Miss Q}.)

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Witness historical events first hand using the Guardian of Forever.
name: Historical Research
text: Anthropology x2 + Archaeology x2 + (Honor OR Treachery) When seeded, you may download {The Guardian of Forever}. Opponent's side: No gametext.

name: Holding Cell Door
text: Seeds (during facility phase) or plays on your ship or facility (except a Nor). Adds a Brig. OR Downloads {Brainwash}, {Interrogation} or {Torture} to a captive in your Brig, if you have Tal Shiar, Obsidian Order, Resistance or Section 31 (or a personnel who has SECURITY and Treachery) present; discard doorway or place atop draw deck. OR Nullifies any card closing another Holding Cell Door; discard doorway.

name: Holodeck Door
text: Seeds (during facility phase) or plays on your ship (limit one per ship) or outpost, or on any {headquarters}. Adds Holodeck, and your compatible [Holo] cards may report aboard. OR Plays once each turn to download a Holoprogram or any [Holo] or [Bar] card; place doorway out-of-play. OR Plays at any time to prevent the deactivation of any one [Holo] personnel; discard doorway.

lore: Holograms can be used to create realistic fantasy worlds.
name: Hologram Ruse
text: To get past requires INTEGRITY>30 and CUNNING>30.

name: Holoprogram: 221B Baker Street
text: Seeds or plays on your ship or facility with a Holodeck. In place of your normal card play, you may download {Sherlock Holmes} (or any personnel with his name in lore) aboard. OR Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, you may place a personnel here from hand. Personnel placed here add [Holo] icon to your copies of same personnel in play. You may discard any cards placed here at any time.

name: Holoprogram: Deadwood
text: Seeds or plays on your ship with a Holodeck. {Sheriff Worf} and {Deputy Rozhenko} may report aboard. If both aboard: location here is span+X for opponent (where X=number of your SECURITY personnel aboard, maximum 4), opponent must have more SECURITY here than you to initiate battle here, and, once each turn, Sheriff Worf may nullify any dilemma requiring SECURITY he just encountered here.

name: Holoprogram: Noah's Mountain Retreat
requires: Dr. Noah-related personnel; Holodeck; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
text: Seeds or plays on any ship or facility with a Holodeck. You may report {Secret Agent Julian Bashir} (or any personnel with his name in lore) aboard. In place of your normal card play, you may download such a personnel aboard. Also, if your Transporter Skill aboard, at start of turn you may replace (discard) your {Dr. Noah} (or personnel with his name in lore) present by downloading a version of same persona.

name: Holoprogram: Fortress of Doom
text: Seeds or plays on your ship with a Holodeck. In place of your normal card play, you may download {Chaotica} (or any card with his name in lore) aboard. While Chaotica is aboard (and {Captain Proton} is not at same location), opponent must discard two cards to attempt mission at this location unless they have a [Holo] personnel participating in the attempt.

name: Holoprogram: The Office of Dixon Hill
text: Seeds or plays on your ship with a Holodeck. In place of a card draw, you may download {Felix Leech} aboard. Also, your {Cyrus Redblock} may report aboard and, if he is aboard, once each turn you may request "the item." Place a card from hand face down on table. Opponent must choose: you may play it for free and draw a card OR you must place it out-of-play and score 5 points.

lore: The hologram projector on Minos is an example of planet-based interactive holographic technology.
name: Holo-Projectors
text: Plays on a planet mission. [Holo] cards may exist on this planet.

lore: Technology which the escaped Hirogen holograms hoped to use to establish a permanent home planet. B'Elanna Torres helped Kejal bring the device online.
name: Holo-Projectors (Holodeck Adventures)
text: Plays on a planet mission. [Holo] cards may exist on this planet.

name: Home Away From Home
text: Seeds or plays on your ship with one or more staffing icons. If a [DQ] ship with "Alpha Quadrant" in lore: while not in Alpha Quadrant, your equipment and matching [DQ] personnel may report aboard; once each turn, one who has [Stf] icon may do so for free. If any other non-Borg ship: while not in its native quadrant, your personnel who match ship's affiliation and native quadrant (and your equipment) may report aboard.

name: Homefront
text: Seeds or plays on any homeworld. In place of a normal card play, a SECURITY personnel matching homeworld's affiliation may download here (owner draws no cards that turn). No player may attempt mission or use {headquarters} game text here unless they have 4 SECURITY on planet. OR Plays on table. Your personnel who have infiltration icons may report (for free) on homeworlds those icons match.

lore: Aid study of primitive culture on planet threatened by intense radiation storms.
name: Homeward
text: Anthropology + Computer Skill

lore: The call to glory inspires the Klingon warrior to maximum fierceness and honor, as symbolized by the Bat'telh championship trophy.
name: Honor Challenge
text: Plays just after an Away Team battle is initiated. Each Klingon with Honor immediately kills one opponent with Treachery. Battle continues.

lore: First officer and sole survivor of the I.K.C. Toh'Kaht. Briefly succeeded captain Kee'Bhor. Suffering from the influence of Saltah'na energy spheres.
name: Hon'Tihl
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Geology Treachery

lore: Mysterious symbol of sexuality from the pleasure planet of Risa. To own one is to call forth its powers. To display one is to announce that the owner is seeking jamaharon.
name: Horga'hn
text: Immediately play on table. Artifact allows you to take double turns from now on. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Silicon-based life-form native to Janus VI. Every 50,000 years, all Horta die off except one, which must repopulate the species through egg laying. Will kill to protect its young.
name: Horta
text: Place on planet. Now and end of every player's turn, kills one of that player's personnel present (random selection). Cure with 2 Leadership, 2 Mindmeld, and 2 Exobiology.

lore: Communications officer on board Enterprise, NX-01. Didn't want to come along, but after listening to some Klingon, she felt motivated.
name: Hoshi Sato
text: OFFICER Music Anthropology DL/ {Hail} May nullify Female-related dilemmas where present.

lore: Coordinate with local authorities to free captives held hostage.
name: Hostage Situation
text: SECURITY x2 + MEDICAL + INTEGRITY>32

name: Hostage Trade
text: Seeds or plays on table (for free if you hold any captives). (Unique.) {Prisoner Exchange} and {Fajo's Gallery} may each be used only once per turn. Where your personnel are escorting captive(s), you may release any or all of them (relocate to owner's crew or Away Team there) and capture an equal number of other personnel there, then discard incident.

lore: The anaphasic organism appearing as Ronin lived in and drew power from this special candle.
name: Howard Heirloom Candle
text: Plays to double effects of {Anaphasic Organism} or {Empathic Echo} OR nullifies {Coalescent Organism} OR prevents {Anya} or {Salia} from morphing this turn.

name: HQ: Defensive Measures
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your personnel with any Intelligence gain 1 Leadership and may initiate battle against their own affiliation. Also, opponent may not attempt any of your missions with more than one affiliation icon on each end unless opponent attempted to seed a copy of that mission OR opponent is using an appropriate {Espionage} card.

name: HQ: Ferengi Credit Exchange
text: Seeds or plays on {Ferenginar}, {Ferengi Trading Post} or {Quark's Bar}. Any player who has Acquisition present may, once each turn, discard up to three {Gold-Pressed Latinum} cards present. For each one discarded, score 2 points (place that Latinum card in point area), draw one card or place any one card from discard pile beneath draw deck. May be nullified by {Subspace Interference}.

name: HQ: Orbital Weapons Platform
text: Plays on any homeworld. Each time opponent initiates battle here against your ship or facility matching this homeworld's affiliation, just after it is targeted each of your Orbital Weapons Platforms here may "fire upon" an opposing ship present. Each ship fired upon is damaged = [Flip][Flip] for each Platform that targets it, and you may exclude that ship from that battle.

name: HQ: Return Orb to Bajor
text: Plays on your [Orb] personnel. Where present, that personnel may earn Orb artifacts just encountered and may "reclaim" (steal) any Orb artifacts in play. If that personnel is on {Bajor} with Orb artifacts present, draw up to three cards for each one, discard objective and score points. (Each artifact may be "returned" only once per game.)

name: HQ: Secure Homeworld
text: Seeds or plays on a homeworld. Your Away Teams which include a personnel who matches homeworld's affiliation may attempt the mission using these requirements: Leadership x2 + SECURITY + (Honor OR Treachery) + any one attribute total > point value of mission When you solve mission, capture all opposing personnel on planet who do not match affiliation of homeworld.

lore: During the Bajoran civil war of 2370, General Krim charted troop movements for the Bajoran Militia from his fortified map room.
name: HQ: War Room
text: Plays on a homeworld. Your OFFICER, SECURITY, Leadership and Resistance personnel of same affiliation as that homeworld are CUNNING +2 and STRENGTH +2.

lore: The Federation named a rescued Borg, Hugh. When he returned, his newly acquired self-aware personality collapsed the Borg collective.
name: Hugh
text: Nullifies attack by {Borg Ship} for this turn OR destroys (discard) all {Rogue Borg} at one location.

lore: In 2372, a spatial scission caused explosive decompression aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Harry Kim was lost in the incident, and later replaced by a duplicate Harry from a duplicate Voyager.
name: Hull Breach
text: Unless {Environmental Suit} present, kills one non-android (random selection) and another non-android of same classification (random selection). Mission continues.

lore: A reef triggerfish, Rhinecamthus aculeatus, found near Earth's tropical islands. An animated version is a symbolic "guide" on the U.S.S. Enterprise schoolroom computers.
name: Humuhumunukunukuapua'a
text: Plays on any location. For this turn: Your personnel with Youth are CUNNING +4 and STRENGTH +4. Opponent's non-aligned personnel are CUNNING -4 and STRENGTH -4.

lore: Stalk and kill wounded member of Species 8472.
name: Hunt Alien
text: Anthropology + Exobiology + Leadership + (STRENGTH>40 OR {Borg Nanoprobes})

lore: Seek and secure last strand of DNA program on this desert planet.
name: Hunt for DNA Program
text: Archaeology x 3 + Computer Skill + Biology + Leadership + STRENGTH>40

lore: On some planets, civilization has devolved into a bitter struggle for survival. Violent gangs search for prey, such as those which chased Natasha Yar on Turkana IV.
name: Hunter Gangs
text: Two Away Team members (random selection) are chased. Examine cards separately. Personnel escapes if CUNNING even, killed if odd. Discard dilemma.

name: Hunting Group
text: Seeds or plays on your non-[HIR] space mission with a point box. You may attempt it using these requirements: Alpha-Hirogen + [Hir] ship + (CUNNING + STRENGTH) > mission points x3 When you solve mission, you may commandeer an opposing ship present (capturing opposing personnel aboard) if your total WEAPONS there > twice its SHIELDS. Discard objective.

lore: The sudden eradication of the entire Husnock race left its many outposts vacant. Various affiliations take advantage of these available facilities.
name: Husnock Outpost
text: Seed at any [NON] location. You may seed one [Univ] {Husnock Ship} face up here. Extends only 25% of its SHIELDS to ships.

lore: Disease created accidentally at the Darwin Genetic Research Station on Gagarin IV. Causes rapid aging and death.
name: Hyper-Aging
text: Entire Away Team is quarantined (dies when countdown expires). Cure with SCIENCE and 2 MEDICAL.

lore: Uses an aerosuspension delivery system to administer subcutaneous or intramuscular medication. Can also be used to sedate an adversary.
name: Hypospray
text: During personnel battle, one of your MEDICAL present may stun their adversary OR change one personnel from mortally wounded to disabled. (Does not affect androids.)

lore: "I will not play the fool for Q's amusement!"
name: I Am Not a Merry Man!
text: Plays on any one Klingon. While in play, once per turn that Klingon may nullify one [Q] icon interrupt, event or dilemma where present. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Admiral Dougherty knew the Son'a were devious and dangerous, but never imagined how far Ru'afo would go until it was too late. "The Federation will never know what happened here."
name: I Do Not Take Orders From You!
text: Plays at start of a personnel battle you initiated (once per battle). Each of your personnel who has Treachery x2 may kill an opposing personnel who has lower CUNNING.

lore: "The sins of all our fathers, being dumped on us - the sons. The only choice we're given is HOW MANY MEGATONS? And, I eschew you! And I say SCREW YOU! And I hope you're blue too."
name: I Hate You
text: To get past requires Anthropology, Youth, and no Music present. Nullified by {Vulcan Nerve Pinch}.

lore: "Life-forms... you tiny little life-forms... you precious little life-forms... where are you?"
name: I Just Love Scanning for Life-forms
text: Plays to reveal up to three cards from the top of any draw deck (six if your own). Discard all non-personnel cards; replace remaining cards in any order. Discard event.

lore: "You're making a terrible mistake."
name: I Tried to Warn You
text: If you began this mission with only one non-Borg personnel, or if all your missions have the same icon ([S] or [P]), opponent places dilemma on any one mission in play. Q makes that mission unattemptable and unscoutable; destroys any points already gained from solving that mission or completing an objective targeting that mission. (May not be nullified.)

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: One of the first K't'inga-class ships. Leader of the battle group dispatched to escort an unidentified intruder out of Klingon space in 2271.
name: I.K.C. Amar
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Flagship commanded by Gowron during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68. Lieutenant Worf briefly served aboard as a weapons officer.
name: I.K.C. Bortas
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey used to transport Gowron to rendezvous with the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367.
name: I.K.C. Buruk
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Patrolled the Devron system with sister ship I.K.C. Fek'lhr. Formerly commanded by Governor Worf.
name: I.K.C. Chang
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam If your {I.K.C. Fek'lhr} in play, it has a <L) icon and both ships reduce staffing by one [AU] icon.

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-prey captained by Klaa. Until its pursuit of the Enterprise through the Great Barrier, the highlight of its long mission was shooting at Terran space garbage.
name: I.K.C. Chontay
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; future-related ship; Holodeck; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Destroyed U.S.S. Pasteur in an alternate future, only to be thwarted by the future Enterprise. Named for the ferocious guardian of Gre'thor.
name: I.K.C. Fek'lhr
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Battle cruiser commanded by Koloth. Dispatched to Federation station K-7, under pretense of shore leave, to further the Empire's plans for Sherman's Planet.
name: I.K.C. Gr'oth
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any Klingon [OS] personnel}

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Kurn in support of Gowron during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
name: I.K.C. Hegh'ta
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: One of three ships that brought an end to The Albino's raids on Klingon colonies. Intercepted the Excelsior in the Azure Nebula in 2293. Commanded by Captain Kang.
name: I.K.C. K'elric
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey that fought in the Dominion War. Immune to the Breen energy-dampening weapon due to a fortuitous tritium intermix adjustment.
name: I.K.C. Ki'tang
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Intermix Ratio}

characteristicsKeywords: B'rel Class; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship;
lore: Unique vessel able to fire while cloaked. Commissioned and commanded by General Chang, who ordered the designers killed to preserve the secret of its existence.
name: I.K.C. Kla'Diyus
text: Cloaking Device (while cloaked, may initiate battle but may not be fired upon).

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey briefly commanded by Worf Son of Mogh in 2375. Along with the I.K.C. Rotarran, engaged a Dominion patrol near the Badlands.
name: I.K.C. Koraga
text: If your {I.K.C. Rotarran} in play, both are RANGE +1. Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-Prey named in honor of the author of the classic work of Klingon literature, The Dream of the Fire.
name: I.K.C. K'Ratak
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Kang. Transported its commander and his comrades to Secarus IV in 2370, to confront the Albino in his stronghold.
name: I.K.C. Lukara
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commanded by Nu'Daq during the chase for clues to a four-billion-year-old genetic message in 2369.
name: I.K.C. Maht-H'a
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Flagship of the Klingon Defense Force. Commanded by Gowron when first commissioned, and then by Martok during the 2372 invasion of Cardassia.
name: I.K.C. Negh'Var
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Kor in 2375. Held off a fleet of ten pursuing Jem'Hadar warships. Presumed lost in glorious battle. Now the subject of legend.
name: I.K.C. Ning'tao
text: SHIELDS +2 for each opposing [Dom] ship here. Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Battle cruiser under the command of Captain Kargan. Commander William T. Riker served aboard as an exchange officer in 2365.
name: I.K.C. Pagh
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Attack cruiser that carried Governor Torak on an investigation into the death of a Starfleet officer at Relay Station 47.
name: I.K.C. Qu'Vat
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-prey stationed at Deep Space 9 during the war against the Dominion. Commanded by Martok. Led many raids into Cardassian and Dominion space.
name: I.K.C. Rotarran
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Klingon cruiser dispatched to the Gamma Quadrant on a biosurvey mission. Commanded by first officer Hon'Tihl after its captain was killed in battle.
name: I.K.C. Toh'Kaht
text: Attributes all +1 in Gamma Quadrant. Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: A Klingon sleeper ship from the 23rd century, an era when Klingons despised humans and attacked them on sight. Commanded by K'Temok
name: I.K.C. T'Ong
text: Cloaking Device. Reports at end of spaceline with up to 3 personnel.

characteristicsKeywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: 23rd-century battle cruiser. Believing the Empire had lost its way, the original crew set out over a century ago from the Alpha Quadrant on a quest to find the Kuvah'Magh.
name: I.K.C. Voq'leng
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Home Away From Home}

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Duras-related; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey used to transport Duras to meet with the Klingon Arbiter of Succession in 2367.
name: I.K.C. Vorn
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: The Interphasic Scanner has been used to detect signatures of phased matter, invisible interphasic creatures and beings from other subspace domains.
name: I.P. Scanner
text: Where present, nullifies {Interphasic Plasma Creatures}, {Brain Drain} and {Phased Matter}.

lore: Imperial starship. Credited with many successful and profitable missions. I.S.S. Enterprise officers are frequently promoted - usually through assassination.
name: I.S.S. Enterprise
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [TE][OS] personnel}

lore: Human husband of Lwaxana. Father of Deanna. Seen in Lwaxana's surreal vision of home at Lake El'nar, Betazed. Friend of Steven Miller and Reittan Grax.
name: Ian Andrew Troi
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Music Computer Skill

lore: Borg rescued from the collective and his own people, the Brunali. Protege of Seven of Nine. Is taking Starfleet Academy's core classes, taught by Voyager's senior staff.
name: Icheb
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Youth Stellar Cartography Biology

lore: Borg rescued from the collective and his own people, the Brunali. Protege of Seven of Nine. Is taking Starfleet Academy's core classes, taught by Voyager's senior staff.
name: Icheb*
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Youth Stellar Cartography Biology

lore: Investigate Federation incursion in the Neutral Zone.
name: Iconia Investigation
text: Archaeology + Computer Skill x2

lore: Highly destructive virus from the ancient extinct Iconians. Transmitted to target vessels via a probe.
name: Iconian Computer Weapon
text: Unless SCIENCE present, re-boot by discarding all non-personnel cards in hand and replenish from top of draw deck. Discard dilemma.

lore: The now extinct Iconians were "Demons of Air and Darkness" due to their advanced technology such as this instant transport portal to farflung planets.
name: Iconian Gateway
text: Place in hand until played on a planet location as an Event card. While in play, anyone's personnel and equipment can move instantly from Iconian Gateway to any other planet(s).

lore: Charismatic but megalomaniacal hologram. Escaped the Hirogen. Seeks to create a new religion based on his deliverance of holograms from oppression and slavery.
name: Iden
text: V.I.P. Leadership Anthropology Diplomacy Treachery Astrophysics DL/ {Children of Light}

lore: Charismatic but megalomaniacal hologram. Escaped the Hirogen. Seeks to create a new religion based on his deliverance of holograms from oppression and slavery.
name: Iden*
text: V.I.P. Leadership Anthropology Diplomacy Treachery Astrophysics DL/ {Children of Light}

lore: Massive Alpha-Hirogen in command of a solitary Hunting Vessel. Less interested in the hunt than the spoils of his conquests, envy of his peers, and fear of his captives.
name: Idrin
text: OFFICER Exobiology Archaeology Greed ENGINEER Treachery DL/ {Hirogen Talon}

characteristicsKeywords: Jem'Hadar; Internment Camp 371-related personnel; Jem'Hadar First; Male;
lore: Jem'Hadar First under Deyos. Leader of detachment assigned to Internment Camp 371. Fought Worf as part of training exercise. Skilled combatant.
name: Ikat'ika
text: OFFICER Honor Leadership Anthropology Your Jem'Hadar present are STRENGTH +1 in battle.

lore: Deltan navigator assigned to the Enterprise after acceptance of her Oath of Celibacy. Was romantically involved with Willard Decker during his time on Delta IV.
name: Ilia
text: OFFICER Navigation Biology Anthropology Astrophysics

characteristicsKeywords: Klaestron; Capturing-related card; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
lore: Klaestron dignitary. Son of Enina and General Ardelon Tandro. In 2369, used Cardassian technology to gain access to Deep Space 9 in order to kidnap Jadzia Dax.
name: Ilon Tandro
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy ENGINEER Treachery Once per game, may capture one personnel present.

lore: Though happy to celebrate Kes' second birthday, The Doctor's mood soured when he became trapped in the Chez Sandrine holoprogram during an encounter with a spatial distortion ring.
name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Bartender
text: Adds Anthropology to one MEDICAL personnel until end of turn. OR Downloads a bartender to replace (discard) your MEDICAL personnel in play (or vice versa).

lore: Despite his protestations to Captain Kirk, Dr. McCoy treated a grievously wounded Horta. Thermal concrete from the supplies of the starship Enterprise made an excellent wound covering.
name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Bricklayer
text: Nullifies {Horta}. OR Adds Geology to one MEDICAL personnel until end of turn. OR Once per game, downloads a Geology personnel to your MEDICAL and OFFICER.

lore: Interactive holograms sometimes balk at instructions not compatible with their programming. Dr. Crusher activated an unwilling E.M.H. program to delay a group of Borg.
name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Doorstop
text: Plays to "stop" any one [Holo] personnel. OR Plays to cancel a personnel battle by sacrificing (discarding) one of your [Holo] personnel present.

lore: Following Q's "selfless act," Q2 reluctantly restored his powers. He warned Q to try to stay out of trouble - just in time to save the Calamarain from further torment.
name: Immortal Again
text: Nullifies {Mortal Q} (plus any {Calamarain}). Q-Continuum is active again. Discard event. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.) OR Exchange for one {Amanda Rogers} or {Q2} card from your discard pile.

lore: Forcefields across door or hallway openings are commonly used to bar entry.
name: Impassable Door
text: To get through this door, Away Team must have Computer Skill present.

characteristicsKeywords: Capturing-related card; Infiltration-related card; Infiltrator; Morph card;
name: Impersonate Captive
text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on your Founder present with a non-Borg personnel you've captured. Founder morphs to impersonate captive. Founder's classification, skills, staffing icon, infiltration icon, STRENGTH and CUNNING change to those of captive. Founder has 1 Treachery, loses all Honor and gains infiltration icon(s) for captive's affiliation(s). May morph back at any time (discard objective).

lore: The manager of a Nekrit Supply Depot arrested Chakotay and Tom Paris on charges of conspiracy and murder, based solely on security footage that showed them conversing with the victim.
name: Implication
text: To get past requires 3 Diplomacy and INTEGRITY>30 OR Law and CUNNING>30.

lore: Hirogen hunters always search for prey that provide the greatest challenge - and the most unique relics to adorn their ships.
name: Impressive Trophies
text: Unless CUNNING>50, crew or Away Team member with the most [*] icons OR highest CUNNING + STRENGTH (opponent's choice) is captured. Discard dilemma.

name: In for a Trim
text: Seeds or plays on table. {Barber Pole} and {Mot's Advice} play for free. Once each turn, if you have Barber Pole in play, you may "take a little off the top": peek at the top X cards of opponent's draw deck, where X is the number of your non-[Bor] Barbering personnel in play. You may discard any events, incidents, or interrupts (except [BO] and [Ref] cards), then replace the rest in any order.

lore: While investigating a Tallonian crystal smuggler, Odo took the form of a latinum-filled satchel. He was forced to abort the sting operation when Worf interfered.
name: In the Bag
text: Allows your Equipment card in play and your shape-shifter in hand to morph (exchange). May be played at the start of battle (may also download {Strike Three} there).

lore: In a desperate attempt to spark Romulan participation on the defense of the Alpha Quadrant, Benjamin Sisko enlisted Elim Garak's effective, but questionable, methods.
name: In the Pale Moonlight
text: To get past requires a personnel who has INTEGRITY<4 OR a Federation personnel who has Treachery OR {any Garak} OR a Founder.

name: In the Zone
text: Seeds or plays on table. If a non-Borg player scores more than 50 points during a single turn (including this turn), those points in excess of 50 do not count toward winning. While your score is exactly 50 points, each of your ships has double RANGE and SHIELDS. Also, nullifies {End Transmission} and {Preparation}, and each player may call "{Devidian Door}" during their turn (and only once per turn).

lore: "Your progress, Q?" "As anticipated, there are some problems. I need time."
name: Incoming Message - The Continuum
text: Opponent may end current Q-Flash now (no more [Q] icon cards are drawn) and immediately seed the card that started it under any other mission (it has no further effects now; mission continues).

lore: On several occasions, for purposes of Federation security, Starfleet Command has reluctantly or mistakenly ordered captains to attack certain enemy or rogue ships.
name: Incoming Message: Attack Authorization
text: Plays on any Federation ship. If Treachery aboard, "This ship must immediately attack one ship (your choice) at this location." May ignore if V.I.P. aboard.

lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
name: Incoming Message - Bajoran
text: "Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Bajoran outpost, full speed." Place on one Bajoran ship until outpost reached, then discard.

lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
name: Incoming Message - Cardassian
text: "Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Cardassian outpost, full speed." Place on one Cardassian ship until outpost reached, then discard.

lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
name: Incoming Message - Federation
text: "Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Federation outpost, full speed." Place on one Federation ship until outpost reached, then discard.

lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
name: Incoming Message - Ferengi
text: "Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Ferengi outpost, full speed." Place on one Ferengi ship until outpost reached, then discard.

lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
name: Incoming Message - Klingon
text: "Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Klingon outpost, full speed." Place on one Klingon ship until outpost reached, then discard.

lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
name: Incoming Message - Romulan
text: "Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Romulan outpost, full speed." Place on one Romulan ship until outpost reached, then discard.

name: Infirmary
text: Compatible MEDICAL-classification personnel, MEDICAL-related Equipment cards and {I.P. Scanner} may report here. Once each turn, any MEDICAL personnel unopposed here may "revive" a personnel present who was disabled by a {Hypospray} (revived personnel is no longer disabled). Matching MEDICAL personnel may {file mission report}s here. Any Nor: Promenade

lore: Specialized ship designed to collect metaphasic radiation particles from the ring system of the Ba'ku planet - a procedure tested extensively by Ru'afo in simulations.
name: Injector Assembly One
text: May report to location of your Son'a ship. DL/ {Collect Metaphasic Particles}

lore: The changeling impersonating Lovok compromised the mission to destroy the Founders' homeworld. His participation in the battle plans led the attacking fleet into a Jem'Hadar ambush.
name: Inside Operation
text: Plays at start of ship battle. Each opposing ship and facility in the battle is WEAPONS and SHIELDS -3 if your personnel is infiltrating one of them. Infiltrator exposed.

name: Install Autonomic Systems Parasite
text: Plays on opponent's ship if your Founder is aboard. That ship may not engage or disengage its special equipment, transporters and WEAPONS until your next turn; then you may use ship to move and/or battle opponent's other cards (ignore staffing and affiliation restrictions); then discard objective. May be nullified by {Miles O'Brien} OR {Odo} OR 3 ENGINEER and 3 SECURITY aboard. (Unique.)

lore: Prevent the Son'a attempt to forcibly relocate the Ba'ku race.
name: Insurrection
text: Leadership x2 + Diplomacy + STRENGTH>50 Ba'ku may report on planet (for free).

lore: Covertly compile data on current Dominion homeworld in the Omarion Nebula.
name: Intelligence Operation
text: Navigation x2 + (Tal Shiar OR Obsidian Order) + Anthropology + (SECURITY x3 OR {any Odo})

lore: Prevent attack on secret Cardassian weapons depot.
name: Intercept Maquis
text: OFFICER + SECURITY + CUNNING>24 May attempt only if your total WEAPONS>14 here.

lore: Intercept hijacked Starfleet vessel reportedly attacking facilities in Cardassian space.
name: Intercept Renegade
text: Obsidian Order + Tal Shiar + Treachery x3 OR OFFICER x2 + CUNNING>40

lore: Zefram Cochrane struggled to maintain the optimum balance of matter and anti-matter injection for the Phoenix warp systems. The proper ratio, of course, is 1 to 1.
name: Intermix Ratio
text: Plays on table. If any player's ratio of bonus points to non-bonus points exceeds 1:1, the excess bonus points do not count toward winning. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Experimental Romulan device that both cloaks and phases matter, allowing it to pass through normal matter.
name: Interphase Generator
text: Use as Equipment card. Where present, nullifies {Chalnoth}, {Archer}, {Rebel Encounter}, {Impassable Door}, {Phased Matter}, {Crystalline Entity}, {Armus}, and {Nausicaans} dilemmas.

lore: Organisms from just beyond the range of visual acuity sucked cellular peptides from the U.S.S. Enterprise crew, similar to the way Terran leaches consume hemoglobin.
name: Interphasic Plasma Creatures
text: Unless 2 SCIENCE or Mindmeld present, play on table as an Event card. While in play, lowers STRENGTH of each of your personnel by 2. (Not cumulative.)

lore: In violation of the Seldonis IV convention, Gul Madred interrogated Jean-Luc Picard, seeking Starfleet strategic secrets. He kept asking, "How many lights do you see?"
name: Interrogation
text: Plays on one personnel you've captured. Each turn, ask opponent, "How many lights do you see?" If reply is "Five", return captive to outpost, score 10 points. Otherwise, score 1 point, retain captive.

lore: "Ooh!"
name: Into the Breach
text: Plays on table until any Q-Flash. While in play, nullifies all {Warp Core Breach} cards and immediately repairs all damaged ships in play, except {Borg Ship}. (Not duplicatable.)

name: Intruder Alert!
text: Seeds or plays on table; nullifies all seeded {Memory Wipe} cards. At any time, you may capture a one- or two-person Away Team in your {Ops} or assimilate one personnel intruder on your Borg ship or facility if your {Talon Drone} is present (discard incident) OR download {Intruder Force Field} (place incident atop event to protect it from nullification and extend its effects to all intruders on your ships).

lore: With one look from Jean-Luc Picard, the U.S.S. Enterprise crew captured two alien intruders in a force field on the bridge - turnabout for their own kidnapping activities.
name: Intruder Force Field
text: Plays on table. While in play, reverses {Telepathic Alien Kidnappers} affecting you AND {Rogue Borg} invading your ships must be 3 or more to be effective.

lore: Dominion transporter technology is optimized for combat operations. The ability to breach enemy shields allows rapid deployment of Jem'Hadar warriors in most battle scenarios.
name: Invasive Beam-In
text: Seeds or plays on table. Invasive Transporters, when operated by Transporter Skill personnel, may beam through any SHIELDS (even those of a Nor).

lore: Srivani researchers covertly boarded U.S.S. Voyager in 2374. Using a phase variance to avoid detection, they performed invasive, and sometimes fatal, medical tests on the crew.
name: Invasive Procedures
text: Unless a [Def] Borg OR MEDICAL, CUNNING>35, and a {phaser} or {disruptor} present, place on ship; quarantined. Each crew member loses first-listed skill and is attributes all -2.

lore: Determine how plasma strands - typically unstable - have survived here for centuries.
name: Inversion Mystery
text: ENGINEER + Astrophysics + Diplomacy

lore: Study fragments of distorted space/time reported in this sector.
name: Investigate "Shattered Space"
text: Leadership + Computer Skill + Astrophysics x2 + Stellar Cartography

lore: Study and evaluate mysterious probe sighted in this sector.
name: Investigate Alien Probe
text: Anthropology + Biology + Computer Skill

lore: Trace radiation anomalies reported at this location.
name: Investigate Anomaly
text: Exobiology + STRENGTH>35

lore: Trace radiation anomalies.
name: Investigate Anomaly II
text: Exobiology + STRENGTH>35 If destroyed, flip mission over.

lore: Trace radiation anomalies.
name: Investigate Anomaly II (back)
text: Exobiology + STRENGTH>35 If your Federation ENGINEER is here, in place of your normal card play you may flip mission over; draw no cards that turn.

lore: Investigate alleged coup that threatens to change the balance of power in this sector.
name: Investigate Coup
text: OFFICER + Leadership x2 + SECURITY + Navigation OR {Benjamin Sisko} OR {Tomalak} OR {General Krim}

lore: Trace disappearance of a medical transport ship.
name: Investigate Disappearance
text: Physics + Navigation + CUNNING>40 OR Astrophysics x3

lore: Investigate disturbance at Boreth monastery.
name: Investigate Disturbance
text: Honor + Leadership + INTEGRITY>30 OR {Gowron} + Biology

lore: Verify existence of fabled utopian planet hidden by powerful cloaking device.
name: Investigate Legend
text: Youth x3 + (Diplomacy x2 OR Discard 2 Youth) Cloaks or decloaks each time any points scored.

lore: Initiate investigation into destruction of distant outpost.
name: Investigate Massacre
text: Diplomacy + INTEGRITY>35 + CUNNING>35

lore: Investigate unidentified transmission emanating from this type-four quantum singularity.
name: Investigate Quantum Singularity
text: Navigation x2 + CUNNING>40 + (ENGINEER x3 OR {B'Elanna Torres})

lore: Investigate report of Borg attack.
name: Investigate Raid
text: Exobiology + Diplomacy

lore: Study unusual rogue comet sighted in this sector.
name: Investigate Rogue Comet
text: Archaeology + Exobiology + Computer Skill

lore: Search nebula for clues to origin of changelings.
name: Investigate Rumors
text: Navigation + SCIENCE x2 + SECURITY OR Navigation + {Odo}

lore: Investigate sighting of Gomtuu, an interstellar creature code-named, Tin Man.
name: Investigate Sighting
text: Empathy x3 OR Treachery + Exobiology + CUNNING>40

lore: Investigate sighting of Gomtuu.
name: Investigate Sighting II
text: Empathy x3 OR Treachery + Exobiology + CUNNING>40 If destroyed, flip mission over.

lore: Investigate sighting of Gomtuu.
name: Investigate Sighting II (back)
text: Empathy x3 OR Treachery + Exobiology + CUNNING>40 If your Romulan ENGINEER is here, in place of your normal card play you may flip mission over; draw no cards that turn.

lore: Trace mysterious time-traveling aliens living in a parallel time continuum.
name: Investigate Time Continuum
text: {Guinan} OR {Data} OR {Time Travel Pod}

lore: A mentor of Dr. Soong and thus Lt. Commander Data's "grandfather." Arguably one of the greatest minds of the age. Has Darnay's Disease.
name: Ira Graves
text: CIVILIAN Cybernetics Computer Skill SCIENCE Treachery and Biology if {Kareen Brianon} in play.

lore: At the FGC-47 nebula, the U.S.S. Enterprise encountered an energy being who took the form of a child's imaginary friend. It judged the crew from that perspective.
name: Isabella
text: Plays on any non-Borg ship at a nebula; it is destroyed unless Youth aboard by end of your next turn. OR Kill any one Greed personnel who just exploited a {Worshiper}.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Sister of Lieutenant Natasha Yar. Once betrayed the U.S.S. Enterprise crew in an attempt to aid the rebels on Turkana IV.
name: Ishara Yar
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Youth

lore: "Moogie" to Quark and Rom. Financial genius. Wears clothes. Earns profit. Secretly helps Zek run his empire.
name: Ishka
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Computer Skill Honor Music Your {Gold-Pressed Latinum} may report here, for free. While {Grand Nagus Zek} is here, doubles his skills.

lore: Jake Sisko and Nog felt compelled to override the autopilot system of the U.S.S. Rio Grande. Unfortunately, they found it easier to take apart than to put back together.
name: Isolinear Puzzle
text: Place on ship. Reduces RANGE by 4 and WEAPONS by 4. Nullify with 2 ENGINEER.

name: Isolytic Burst
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 0. Requires a {Son'a Battleship} or {Li'seria} firing. If you hit, randomly kills one additional personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice). Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

lore: Don't give an isomagnetic disintegrator to a Klingon showing signs of jak'tahla unless you want him to use it.
name: Isomagnetic Disintegrator
text: Plays on table. Shuffle your hand into your discard pile, then exchange your discard pile for your draw deck. Draw four cards (may not be converted to downloads). Discard event.

name: Issue Secret Orders
text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on your V.I.P. or OFFICER who has been infiltrating opponent's ship since start of opponent's last turn. Target any opponent's mission in same quadrant. Ship and crew must do nothing but go to that mission (with infiltrator aboard) and attempt it if possible (any infiltrators may decline); then infiltrator is exposed. Discard objective whenever infiltrator exposed.

name: It's Only a Game
text: Seeds or plays on table. Limits each non-Borg report with crew action to four total personnel/equipment. Limits {Red Alert} to one Personnel, one Ship and one Equipment card per turn. Limits probing and doubling for {Visit Cochrane Memorial} to once per game per persona. Also, whenever opponent draws three or more cards in one turn, you may download (even from discard pile) {Scorched Hand}, ignoring {Computer Crash}.

lore: Upon learning of Quark's plan to feature her in a lascivious holoscenario, Kira Nerys enlisted Odo's help in making a small change to the program. The client got far more than he paid for.
name: I've Been Waiting for You
text: Suspends play to exchange your [Holo] personnel in play with any other [Holo] personnel from your hand.
