lore: Jem'Hadar Honored Elder. Became Second under Kudak'Etan when the alpha was promoted above him. Unsure about the new order of things.
name: Ixtana'Rax
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Stellar Cartography Other [GQ] Jem'Hadar present are attributes all +1.

lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Grissom. Has served as such for over four years without serious incident, due largely to his cautious, "by the book" command style.
name: J. T. Esteban
text: OFFICER Geology Exobiology Astrophysics

lore: First maje of the Kazon-Ogla in 2371. Has laid claim to the Ocampa planet. His efforts to tap its subterranean resources have been thwarted by the Caretaker.
name: Jabin
text: OFFICER Leadership Astrophysics Geology Treachery Greed

lore: Lt. Commander aboard U.S.S. Stargazer under best friend Jean-Luc Picard. Husband of Beverly Crusher. Advised their son Wesley to seek his own way.
name: Jack Crusher
text: OFFICER Honor Archaeology Music Leadership Computer Skill

lore: Lt. Commander Jadzia Dax is the eighth Trill host of the Dax symbiont. Underwent zhian'tara closure rite in 2371. Level 3 pilot. Married to Worf. Likes tongo.
name: Jadzia Dax
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Astrophysics Exobiology Navigation x 2 Anthropology

lore: Trill. Disregarded her commitments to both Starfleet and Trill custom in order to honor a Klingon blood oath sworn by her symbiont's previous host, Curzon Dax.
name: Jadzia Dax (Blaze of Glory)
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Diplomacy Anthropology Honor Other (R> personnel present are attributes all +2.

lore: Yridian dealer of information who uncovered the Romulan prison camp in the Carraya system.
name: Jaglom Shrek - Information Broker
text: Look at opponent's draw deck for twenty seconds, then replace unshuffled.

lore: Jake Sisko and Nog are best friends. Loiterers. Frequently chased away from "their spot" by Odo. Briefly owned 100 gross of self-sealing stem bolts.
name: Jake and Nog
text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Jake: Youth Biology ENGINEER Nog: Youth Acquisition ENGINEER

lore: Federation News Service correspondent - and spy - during the Dominion War. Has his sources.
name: Jake Sisko
text: CIVILIAN Once each turn, if {any PADD} present, may peek at top card of any deck OR file a mission report at any site. Youth Biology DL/ {File Mission Report}

lore: A mysterious sexual ritual from Risa. One signifies desire for Jamaharon by displaying a Horga'hn, as Jean-Luc Picard did accidentally in 2366, thereby attracting Joval.
name: Jamaharon
text: Nullifies {Horga'hn} OR nullifies {Parallel Romance} OR if planet {Risa} is on spaceline, immediately move any one male personnel alone on a planet to Risa.

lore: Famous captain thought lost in 2293. Returned from the nexus 78 years later to make a difference once more.
name: James T. Kirk
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Computer Skill Honor DL/ Any Captain's Order card Scores 5 points each time he helps solve a mission.

lore: The ruthless Captain Kirk took command of the I.S.S. Enterprise by assassinating Captain Pike. Uses the deadly Tantalus Field to maintain his control.
name: James Tiberius Kirk
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Treachery x 2 Archaeology DL/ {Tantalus Field} DL/ {Classic Communicator}

lore: Male Grazerite. President of the United Federation of Planets. Reluctantly imposed martial law on Earth in 2372 at the urging of Admiral Leyton.
name: Jaresh-Inyo
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Biology Law DL/ {HQ: Secure Homeworld}

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Male; Minister; The Circle-related personnel;
lore: Ambitious member of Chamber of Ministers. Leader of Alliance for Global Unity, a.k.a. the Circle. Minister Jaro was allied with Vedek Winn until exposed as a traitor.
name: Jaro Essa
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Greed Treachery x 2 CUNNING +3 if with {Vedek Winn}.

lore: Father of Duras, Lursa and B'Etor. Disappeared shortly after transmitting security codes to the Romulans, precipitating the Khitomer massacre.
name: Ja'rod
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership ENGINEER Computer Skill Attributes all +5 if with {Toral}.

lore: "Do you love me?"
name: Jealous Amanda
text: Plays on table. The next time any Away Team encounters a {Love Interest}, {Parallel Romance} or {Alien Groupie}, your opponent may override that card's normal result by relocating the affected personnel to any planet location. Discard event. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Escaping from their captors on Kesprytt III, Jean-Luc Picard and Beverly Crusher discovered they had been telepathically linked by psi-wave implants.
name: Jean-Luc and Beverly
text: OFFICER+MEDICAL Jean-Luc: Diplomacy Archaeology Honor Beverly: MEDICAL Exobiology DL/ {Hypospray}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Born in LaBarre, France. Has an artificial heart. Reads Shakespeare. Something of a Renaissance man.
name: Jean-Luc Picard
text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Archaeology Navigation Music

lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Once assimilated by the Borg. Became obsessed with their destruction. Still hears echoes of the collective.
name: Jean-Luc Picard (First Contact)
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Diplomacy Archaeology DL/ {Sense the Borg} DL/ {Make It So}

lore: Incubation module used to breed Jem'Hadar warriors. Each infant grows at a greatly accelerated rate, and is able to fight within days of emergence.
name: Jem'Hadar Birthing Chamber
text: Where present, each of your Jem'Hadar Birthing Chambers allows you to report one [Univ] {Young Jem'Hadar} (for free) each turn, regardless of quadrant.

lore: Standard-issue Jem'Hadar sidearm. Energy from a tritium microfusion reaction is accumulated in a phased polaron source, then pulse-discharged through a parabolic arkenium emitter.
name: Jem'Hadar Disruptor
text: Dominion and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Jem'Hadar weapons have nonvariable energy settings, but their polaron beams can be enhanced with chemicals such as anticoagulants, nerve agents and osteosolvents.
name: Jem'Hadar Disruptor Rifle
text: Dominion and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

lore: Injured by phaser fire, Meso'Clan could no longer contribute to his unit. He requested that he be put to death rather than continue to consume ketracel-white.
name: Jem'Hadar Sacrifice
text: Plays on your [KW] personnel. He sacrifices (dies) to keep all your {Ketracel-White} present from counting down this turn OR to substitute for a Founder present who is about to die.

name: Jem'Hadar Shrouding
text: Seeds or plays on table. During your turn, you may place here one or two Jem'Hadar from hand or in play, then draw a card. (These Jem'Hadar are not in play.) OR Plays once every turn (for free) on an opponent's Away Team (unless it is on a homeworld). Initiate battle against that Away Team by playing up to an equal number of personnel to it from your Jem'Hadar Shrouding on table. Discard incident.

lore: Dedicated wife of Paul Manheim. Once romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard.
name: Jenice Manheim
text: CIVILIAN {Ressikan Flute} is limited to 4 Music personnel. One male present is attributes +2 (+4 if {Paul Manheim}).

lore: Lieutenant Jenna D'Sora had a brief, unsuccessful romantic relationship with Lt. Commander Data. Wooed by crystillia flowers from Telemarius III.
name: Jenna D'Sora
text: SECURITY Stellar Cartography Music

lore: Chairman of research at Cold Station 12. Close friend of Phlox. His optimism sometimes leads him to jump to dangerous conclusions.
name: Jeremy Lucas
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Honor DL/ Any MEDICAL-related Equipment card

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: Khan's lieutenant and most trusted friend. Became his first officer aboard the U.S.S. Reliant when, after nearly two decades, they escaped Ceti Alpha V.
name: Joachim
reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Astrophysics Navigation Physics Treachery If on {U.S.S. Reliant}, it is WEAPONS +3.

lore: Takaran male. Attempted to steal Dr. Reyga's metaphasic shield technology to claim as his own.
name: Jo'Bril
text: SCIENCE Treachery Astrophysics Physics Greed

lore: The human Benjamin Sisko assumed the identity of Jodmos, son of Kobor, to help rid the Klingon Empire of a suspected changeling at Ty'Gokor.
name: Jodmos
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation Honor May stun adversary without Honor he just engaged.

lore: A Zalkonian male with amnesia and the ability to heal by touch alone. Romantically involved with Dr. Crusher. Later evolved into a pure energy being.
name: John Doe
text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may prevent one other personnel from being killed on a ship where present.

lore: Son of a respected Federation official. Captain of U.S.S. Enterprise-B. Usually confident in dealing with reporters, but on the ship's maiden voyage was having an off day.
name: John Harriman
text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Geology Honor

lore: London physician and companion of Sherlock Holmes. Recounted a full five dozen of the sleuth's cases. On the holodeck, Geordi La Forge was Data's Watson.
name: John Watson
text: MEDICAL If with {Sherlock Holmes}, you may discard your hand at start of turn. ENGINEER Physics

lore: Captain of Enterprise, NX-01. Leaped into deep space to make the future quantifiably better for all mankind.
name: Jonathan Archer
text: OFFICER Honor Diplomacy Navigation Leadership x 2 Anthropology DL/ {Porthos} DL/ {Captain's Log}

lore: Humanoid settler of Nimbus III. Released the pain of his impoverishment when Sybok enlisted his help in the search for the knowledge sought by all since time began.
name: J'Onn
text: CIVILIAN If with {Sybok}, may play {Release This Pain} once during each of opponent's turns (as an interrupt). SECURITY

lore: Medic who built neural interfaces to subdue the Voyager crew. Patched them up after hunters stabbed, shot, beat, phasered, and bat'lethed them in Karr's holoscenarios.
name: Jorik
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Computer Skill x 2 Treachery

lore: Zibalian transport and merchant vessel commanded by Kivas Fajo. Houses his collection of rare and one-of-a-kind objects. Used to imprison Data in 2366.
name: Jovis
text: Once per game, you may capture an android on an undocked ship here. DL/ {Kivas Fajo}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; genetically enhanced; Male;
lore: Lt. Julian Bashir. Genetically enhanced. Salutatorian at Starfleet Medical. Requested assignment to DS9 so he could practice "frontier medicine." Likes tennis.
name: Julian Bashir
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL x 2 Exobiology Biology DL/ {Kukalaka}

lore: Dr. Juliana O'Donnell Soong Tainer. Data's co-creator and "mother." Unaware that Dr. Soong stored her mind in a Soong-type android to prolong her life.
name: Juliana Tainer
text: SCIENCE Geology, Computer Skill, Cybernetics, Music After first use as an android, X=4 but "stopped."

lore: Cloned reincarnation of Klingon spiritual leader Kahless the Unforgettable. Installed as ceremonial Emperor in 2369.
name: Kahless
text: V.I.P. Honor x 2

lore: Female ghojmok to young Worf in the employ of the House of Mogh prior to the Khitomer Massacre. Spurned K'mpec because "he was too fat."
name: Kahlest
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Honor Music Klingons with Honor are STRENGTH +2 where present.

lore: Revered Kai of Bajor. Lost her son in the Kendra Valley Massacre. First recognized Benjamin Sisko as the Emissary of the Prophets.
name: Kai Opaka
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 3 Diplomacy Honor Anthropology Orb artifacts may not be nullified.

lore: Vedek Winn became Kai of Bajor in 2370. Concluded Cardassian treaty negotiations by Bareil Antos. Finally accepted Benjamin Sisko's role as the Emissary.
name: Kai Winn
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Treachery Honor (if {The Emissary} in play). DL/ Any Bajoran treaty

lore: Female Romulan. Member of task force sent to destroy the Founders. Helped Julian Bashir, Worf, and Elim Garak escape from Internment Camp 371.
name: Kalenna
text: SECURITY Anthropology Biology Honor

lore: Vulcan game of intricate strategy. Players must find the seeds of order, even in the midst of profound chaos. Tuvok observed that novices often try merely to introduce a spatial balance.
name: Kal-Toh
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, unless {Alien Probe} in play, you may discard one card from hand; opponent must discard one of same type (if they cannot, discard Kal-Toh).

lore: Ambassador to the Federation. Believed Project Genesis was a weapon against his people. Predicted there would be no peace while Kirk lived. Proven wrong by history.
name: Kamarag
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Law Archaeology

lore: Faced Kirk at Beta XII-A. Swore blood oath against the Albino with Kor, Koloth, and Curzon Dax to avenge the death of his firstborn son.
name: Kang
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor SECURITY Physics DL/ {Blood Oath}

lore: Young Kazon-Ogla now come of age. Bravely earned his name like his brother, Kinell, before him. The only Kazon to ever form a real bond with a "Federation."
name: Karden
text: OFFICER Youth Navigation x 2 Physics Anthropology Biology Honor

characteristicsKeywords: Trill; Ambassador; Female; Support Personnel; Trill with symbiont;
lore: Famous Trill Ambassador Kareel Odan. Romantically involved with Dr. Beverly Crusher. Symbiont transplant from male to female host in 2367.
name: Kareel Odan
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Computer Skill

lore: Technical assistant to Dr. Ira Graves. Admitted to having been attracted to him, despite decades of age difference.
name: Kareen Brianon
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill ENGINEER Youth May nullify {Male's Love Interest} where present.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Captain; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Captain of the I.K.C. Pagh when Commander William T. Riker served as an exchange officer.
name: Kargan
text: OFFICER Honor Computer Skill

lore: Female Romulan "delegate" and saboteur. Assistant to Ruwon. Planned to help him sabotage the Bajoran wormhole and Deep Space 9.
name: Karina
text: V.I.P. Treachery Transporter Skill SCIENCE

lore: Diligent Alpha-Hirogen. Commanded a Hunting Vessel that stalked a member of Species 8472. Has an unrivaled understanding of the behavior of prey.
name: Karon
text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Anthropology x 2 Navigation Exobiology DL/ {Hirogen Disruptor Rifle}

lore: Alpha-Hirogen who captured Voyager in 2374. Used its holodecks to study his prey's history. Hoped for lessons to save his own culture from stagnation and extinction.
name: Karr
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor Law Computer Skill Anthropology Astrophysics

lore: Blade weapon used by the Jem'Hadar and Dominion allies. Similar to the Klingon bat'leth in function and effectiveness.
name: Kar'takin
text: Each of your Jem'Hadar, Breen and Dosi present is STRENGTH +2, and in each battle one of them may mortally wound one adversary they just stunned. (Cumulative.)

lore: Freighter captain for Bajoran Ministry of Commerce. Smuggled weapons for the Maquis in 2372. Loves baseball. Romantically involved with Benjamin Sisko.
name: Kasidy Yates
text: CIVILIAN Navigation x 2 Smuggling Transporter Skill May add 2 card draws to "{cargo runs}" she completes.

lore: Chief Medical Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2365. Dislikes transporters and turbolifts.
name: Katherine Pulaski
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL SCIENCE Suspends effects of {Doppelganger} where present.

lore: Inspired in 2063 with a new view of humanity's place in the cosmos, her work helped end post-atomic horror and led to world government in 2113.
name: Kathleen Tonell
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology

lore: Former science officer of U.S.S. Al-Batani. Dog lover. Inspired by Amelia Earhart, Leonardo da Vinci, and her father. Has promised herself to get her crew home.
name: Kathryn Janeway
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Diplomacy Leadership Computer Skill Physics Astrophysics

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Commanded U.S.S. Enterprise after hijacking it from Starbase 74. Intended to start a war with the Federation and die in glorious battle. Once captained I.K.C. Buruk.
name: Kavok
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Commandeer Ship} Physics May report directly to any empty [Fed] ship.

lore: First officer. Shocked by DaiMon Bok's free gift of the derelict U.S.S. Stargazer to the human Picard. Placed Bok under arrest for using an illegal thought maker.
name: Kazago
text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Honor

lore: Tierna's "rescue" by the Voyager crew was part of an elaborate ruse. The Kazon was on a suicide mission, carrying a chemical injection that would convert is blood into a powerful explosive.
name: Kazon Bomb
text: Unless 3 SECURITY and CUNNING>35 OR 2 SECURITY and {any tricorder} OR 3 [Def] Borg present, kills all personnel present who have printed STRENGTH<7. Discard dilemma.

lore: Attend meeting of rival Kazon sects.
name: Kazon Conference
text: OFFICER x3 + SECURITY + Diplomacy * +5 for each different Maje present.

lore: Typical sidearm employed by the various Kazon sects. Simple design is slightly less powerful than comparable Starfleet arms, but it easily mass-produced even without replicator technology.
name: Kazon Disruptor
text: Kazon use only. Reports for free (once each turn). Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Relatively unsophisticated beam weapon used by the Kazon. No-frills design abandons aesthetic features in favor of inexpensive production. As deadly as it is ugly.
name: Kazon Disruptor Rifle
text: Kazon use only. Reports for free (once each turn). Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

lore: Devious, aloof Vorta. Extorted a Federation Away Team into destroying his marooned, white-starved Jem'Hadar unit before it could turn on him. Hates Ferengi.
name: Keevan
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Anthropology Diplomacy Geology DL/ {Hostage Trade}

lore: 1/2 Klingon, 1/2 Human female. Federation Ambassador to the K'mpec government. Mate of Lieutenant Worf. Mother of Alexander.
name: K'Ehleyr
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Honor

lore: Botanist. Vegetarian. Keiko Ishikawa married Miles O'Brien aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367. Lt. Commander Data served as father of the bride.
name: Keiko O'Brien
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Biology Attributes all +2 if with {Miles O'Brien}.

lore: Cardassian hologram created by the Hirogen. Self-taught engineer of advanced skill. Her name, the Bajoran word for "freedom," was given to her by Iden.
name: Kejal
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Honor DL/ {Holo-projectors}

lore: Cardassian hologram created by the Hirogen. Self-taught engineer of advanced skill. Her name, the Bajoran word for "freedom," was given to her by Iden.
name: Kejal*
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Honor DL/ {Holo-projectors}

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; High Council; Male; Mission Specialist;
lore: Male High Council emissary. Covert Romulan agent. Attempted to use Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge to assassinate Klingon Governor Vagh.
name: Kell
text: V.I.P. Treachery

lore: Aliens from the Andromeda Galaxy demonstrated their power to Captain Kirk by distilling two crew members to their chemical components. Crushing a container instantly killed the victim.
name: Kelvan Show of Force
text: To get past, two non-android, non-holographic personnel present are selected (opponent's choice). One of those two is "crushed" (killed, random selection).

lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Odyssey. In 2370, ordered to investigate the Jem'Hadar threat and rescue Benjamin Sisko. Knew Jadzia Dax, but not on friendly terms.
name: Keogh
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Physics Geology DL/ {Attack Pattern Delta}

lore: Expert strategist. Followed orders despite misgivings about provoking another war with the Federation. In a different reality, he could have called Kirk friend.
name: Keras
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Astrophysics Geology Honor DL/ {Engage Cloak} DL/ {Auto-Destruct Sequence}

lore: Four-year-old Ocampa. Mentored by The Doctor and Tuvok. Has begun to tap latent abilities few others of her species have. Was romantically involved with Neelix.
name: Kes
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Empathy DL/ {The Gift} OR {Beyond the Subatomic}

lore: In 2376, a vengeful Kes returned to Voyager, an outcast with powers far beyond any other Ocampa. Angry with Janeway, who encouraged her to unlock these abilities.
name: Kes (The Borg)
text: CIVILIAN Empathy x 2 Physics Navigation Treachery MEDICAL May not be stunned.

lore: Four-year-old Ocampa. Mentored by The Doctor and Tuvok. Has begun to tap latent abilities few others of her species have. Was romantically involved with Neelix.
name: Kes*
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Empathy DL/ {The Gift} OR {Beyond the Subatomic}

lore: Isogenic enzyme controlled by the Vorta. Genetically addicted Jem'Hadar need a constant supply of "the white" to stay alive. Withdrawal prevents shrouding and leads to killing rampages.
name: Ketracel-White
text: Where present, prevents "white deprivation." Counts down only if you have [KW] personnel present. (Your Vorta may "ration" just one Ketracel-White present to count down.)

lore: Immortal omnipotent being called a Douwd. Lived secretly as a human. Took a human wife who was killed by the Husnocks at Delta Rana IV.
name: Kevin Uxbridge
text: Nullifies any one Event card in play (except for {Treaty} cards) OR any other card played as an Event card. (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.)

lore: A Douwd, a race of sentient energy beings of "disguises and false surroundings." He is capable of using his enormous powers to stop threats with a single thought.
name: Kevin Uxbridge: Convergence
text: Destroys all Event cards in play at any one spaceline location (including those on ships).

lore: Genetically engineered criminal exiled to Ceti Alpha V by Kirk. Bent solely on avenging the death of his wife.
name: Khan
reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
text: V.I.P. [Fed] opponents need {any Kirk} present to solve mission here. Leadership Treachery x 2 Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commander Toreth's Warbird. Covertly used by N'Vek and Counselor Deanna Troi to accomplish the defection of Vice-Proconsul M'ret in 2369.
name: Khazara
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Reopen investigation into Khitomer massacre.
name: Khitomer Research
text: Honor x3 + Computer Skill + Treachery

lore: While visiting Bajor, Kira Nerys was captured by the Alliance for Global Unity, also known as the Circle. The Alliance sought to overthrow the Bajoran provisional government.
name: Kidnappers
text: Place on a female present (random selection). Until end of opponent's turn, she is "stopped" and may be captured by opponent's SECURITY present; then discard dilemma.

lore: Female Vorta field operative. Dispatched to rescue an injured Founder shipwrecked on Torga IV. Distrusted Benjamin Sisko long enough to fail her mission.
name: Kilana
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Treachery SCIENCE Archaeology

lore: Ironically, Kira Nerys trained Legate Damar's freedom fighters in Resistance tactics. The Bajoran accepted a Starfleet commission to help ease the racial tensions.
name: Kira
text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation Honor x 2 X=3 vs. [Dom].

lore: Changeling who, under the guise of Kira Nerys, attempted to understand Odo's loyalty to the solids. Discovered he had feelings for Kira.
name: Kira Founder
text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill Treachery

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Shakaar Resistance Cell;
lore: Outspoken Major in Bajoran Militia. Assigned as first officer of Deep Space 9. Former member of Shakaar resistance cell. Romantically involved with Odo.
name: Kira Nerys
text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation x 2 Computer Skill X=3 vs. [Car].

lore: A Klingon physician. Has a research laboratory and clinic at the Klingon outpost on Maranga IV. Plays the part of "Molor" in the annual Kot'baval Festival.
name: Kitrik
text: MEDICAL Exobiology SCIENCE Cybernetics Music

lore: Unscrupulous, murderous, conceited Zibalian trader. Collector. Notorious member of Stacius Trade Guild.
name: Kivas Fajo
text: CIVILIAN Greed x 2 Acquisition Treachery Each unduplicated artifact present is worth 5 points. Makes parallel use of opponent's {Palor Toff} cards.

lore: Treacherous collector of rare one-of-a-kind antiquities. Once tried to add Lt. Commander Data to his collection.
name: Kivas Fajo - Collector
text: Choose any player to immediately draw three new cards from the top of their draw deck. Discard event after use.

lore: Aggressive captain who hunted the Enterprise without authorization in 2287. Was demoted and assigned menial translation and clerical duties on Qo'noS.
name: Klaa
text: OFFICER Leadership Anthropology Biology Greed Treachery

lore: Klaestron IV is a member of the United Federation of Planets. Its inhabitants also maintain a strong alliance with the Cardassian Union.
name: Klaestron Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Klaestron ENGINEER.

lore: Zakdorn quartermaster controlling the Starfleet surplus depot at Qualor II. A typical bureaucrat of the type that delights in delays that make life difficult for officers.
name: Klim Dokachin
text: Plays on table. Opponent loses their regular card draw if they played a unique personnel this turn.

lore: Powerful political "houses" in Klingon society can form factions that vie for control. Gowron and his supporters defeated the forces of Duras in the civil war of 2367-68.
name: Klingon Civil War
text: Plays on table. While in play, when a Klingon ship destroys any opponent's Klingon ship, winner scores points = loser's WEAPONS + SHIELDS. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Warning for the dead to beware; a Klingon warrior is about to arrive. In Klingon myth, killed warriors with honor go to Sto-Vo-Kor. Dishonored dead go to Gre'thor.
name: Klingon Death Yell
text: Plays on any just killed Klingon with Honor. Yell to warn the dead and earn bonus points. May play only one death yell for each such Klingon.

lore: Phase-disruptor used by Klingons and other races. Similar to a phaser.
name: Klingon Disruptor
text: Klingon and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel STRENGTH +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

lore: Standard phase disruptor fitted with attachable shoulder stock. Rifle components include extended-charge capacitance cell, high-energy augmented accelerator and requisite induction coil.
name: Klingon Disruptor Rifle
text: Klingon and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

lore: The Klingon Homeworld is Qo'noS. The Klingon Empire establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Klingon Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Klingon ENGINEER.

lore: Standard Klingon Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
name: Klingon PADD
text: Klingon use only. Each of your personnel CUNNING +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

lore: Device employed to verify death in the Sonchi ritual. Also used in the nentay (Rite of Ascension) to test courage. Can make a two-ton Rectyne monopod jump 5 meters.
name: Klingon Painstik
text: Return your {Arbiter of Succession} to your hand at any time, nullifying its points. OR One unique personnel just killed may not be reported for duty again by any player.

lore: Under Klingon law, Lieutenant Worf claimed right of vengeance against Duras in 2367.
name: Klingon Right of Vengeance
text: If any Klingon is killed in an away team battle, all other Klingons present may immediately re-attack with double STRENGTH.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; High Council; High Council Leader; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Klingon High Council Leader prior to Gowron. Appointed Jean-Luc Picard as Arbiter of Succession in 2367.
name: K'mpec
text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy

lore: Worf's son Alexander returned from 40 years in the future to influence his younger self to embrace the way of the warrior and avoid life as a peacemaker.
name: K'mtar
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Honor Attributes all +5 if with {Alexander Rozhenko}.

lore: Pursued the criminals Korris and Konmel in 2364 until their deaths on the U.S.S. Enterprise. Offered Worf a position in the Klingon Defense Force.
name: K'nera
text: OFFICER SECURITY Transporter Skill Honor Scores 5 points when {Korris} or {Konmel} killed in battle.

name: Kobayashi Maru Scenario
text: Seeds or plays on a mission; adds Computer Skill to mission requirements. At the start of each mission attempt here, one attempting personnel (random selection) is placed beneath this incident ("in play" for uniqueness only). When a player solves this mission, all of their compatible personnel beneath this incident join the solving crew or Away Team (any other personnel are discarded). (Unique.)

lore: Captain of I.K.C. Voq'leng. Seized a chance to end his crew's long journey of hardship and isolation, casting the unborn child of B'Elanna Torres as the Kuvah'Magh.
name: Kohlar
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Honor Anthropology Leadership Stellar Cartography DL/ {Auto-Destruct Sequence}

lore: Piloted a shuttle sent into the Barzan wormhole by Goss in 2366. After posing as the Takarians' "Lesser Sage," returned to the Alpha Quadrant via the same wormhole.
name: Kol
text: SCIENCE Navigation Treachery Greed Computer Skill Stellar Cartography

lore: Called d'akturak, "ice man", by Curzon Dax due to his negotiating prowess. Commanded the I.K.C. Gr'oth during the Sherman's Planet sabotage mission in 2267.
name: Koloth
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Exobiology Honor Klingon Intelligence DL/ {Bat'leth}

lore: Tuvok was possessed by trianic energy beings known as the Komar. The entities sought to collect neural energy from the U.S.S. Voyager crew members.
name: Komar Possession
text: Place on one personnel present (random selection). Now and start of each turn, "stops" that personnel and one other personnel present (random selection). Cure with 3 SECURITY.

lore: Klingon warrior who destroyed the cruiser T'Acog and hijacked the Talarian ship, Batris, with Korris.
name: Konmel
text: OFFICER Navigation

lore: Dahar master. Legendary warrior. Former ambassador to Vulcan. Victorious at Klach D'Kel Brakt. Swore blood oath against the Albino. Sought the Sword of Kahless.
name: Kor
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Anthropology Honor Music Other Klingons present are each STRENGTH +2.

lore: Tall Klingon male. Captain of a shuttle who traded with mercenaries in 2370.
name: Koral
text: CIVILIAN Navigation Archaeology

lore: First officer of the I.K.C. Gr'oth under Captain Koloth. Klingon expert on Regulan blood worms and Denebian slime devils. Outspoken critic of Captain Kirk.
name: Korax
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Physics Exobiology

lore: High-ranking female intelligence operative. Often assigned by the Obsidian Order to keep a close watch on the Central Command.
name: Korinas
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Treachery Obsidian Order

lore: Klingon high cleric at Boreth Monastery. Responsible for cloning Kahless the Unforgettable in 2369.
name: Koroth
text: SCIENCE Biology Archaeology Anthropology

lore: Klingon warrior who destroyed the cruiser T'Acog and hijacked the Talarian ship, Batris, with Konmel.
name: Korris
text: OFFICER Honor

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Capturing-related card; Male; Rura Penthe-related personnel;
lore: Warden of the penal asteroid Rura Penthe. His greatest pleasures are watching fights among his inmates and delivering his welcoming speech to new prisoners.
name: Koth
text: SECURITY Exobiology Geology Treachery DL/ {Forced-Labor Camp} (your [Kli] may attempt.)

lore: Powerful civilian leader. Former exarch of Cardassian settlement on Bajor. Believed his son Rugal was killed in 2362 terrorist attack.
name: Kotran Pa'Dar
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Geology

lore: A male from Mizar II. Mizarians value peace above all else and employ passive resistance. They have been conquered six times in 300 years.
name: Kova Tholl
text: CIVILIAN Scores bonus points if killed by an attack in which you do not retaliate. Diplomacy

lore: Chairman of the Tal Shiar. Seeks appointment to the Continuing Committee. Suffers from Tuvan Syndrome. Conspired with Sloan to bring down Senator Cretak.
name: Koval
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Treachery Tal Shiar (when [Rom]). x 2 Exobiology Your Tal Shiar may report here.

lore: One of the finest public conservators on Cardassia. Assigned to defend Miles O'Brien. Deeply disturbed when he "won" the case and O'Brien was freed.
name: Kovat
text: CIVILIAN Honor Diplomacy Law Anthropology

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Ambassador; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: The changeling appearing as Ambassador Krajensky seized the U.S.S. Defiant in an effort to start a war between the Federation and the Tzenkethi.
name: Krajensky Founder
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Law Leadership ENGINEER Treachery DL/ {Issue Secret Orders}

lore: Klingon who tried to acquire topaline mining rights on Capella IV. Interfered in Capellan politics by supporting Maab's attempt to overthrow Teer Akaar.
name: Kras
text: OFFICER Acquisition Geology Treachery Navigation

lore: Captain of the I.K.C. Amar. His tendency to rash behavior has earned him a ruthless reputation - even by Klingon standards.
name: Krase
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Astrophysics MEDICAL Your [Kli] [Films] ships here are each SHIELDS +2.

lore: Son of Grand Nagus Zek. Missed his chance to show his father he could be a good nagus when he tried to seize power quickly, rather than accumulate it quietly.
name: Krax
text: V.I.P. Youth Greed MEDICAL May serve as Nagus (if you have no Nagus in play).

lore: Cardassian warship sent to intercept the U.S.S. Defiant and the renegade Thomas Riker in 2371.
name: Kraxon
text: WEAPONS +3 and SHIELDS +2 vs. Defiant-class ships. Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: D'Kora-class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Marauder commanded by Tog. Briefly imprisoned Lwaxana Troi, whom Tog had abducted from Betazed following the 2366 Trade Agreements Conference.
name: Krayton
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: D'Kora-class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Ferengi marauder. Under the command of Bractor in 2365, interrupted a mysterious battle between the Federation starships Enterprise and Hathaway.
name: Kreechta
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Complete covert weapons transfer to agents supplying the Circle.
name: Kressari Rendezvous
text: OFFICER + (Treachery x2 OR Smuggling) * Discard up to four hand weapons for +5 each.

lore: Aid suppression of warring factions.
name: Krios Suppression
text: Honor + Diplomacy + STRENGTH>35

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Battle cruiser of the Klingon Chancellor in the late-23rd century. Under command of Chancellor Gorkon, made a fateful rendezvous with the Enterprise-A in 2293.
name: Kronos One
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Any Klingon [Films] personnel}

lore: Klingon commander with a festering hatred of the Federation. Attempted to seize the secret of the Genesis weapon - the secret of ultimate power.
name: Kruge
text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Biology Physics Worth 15 points while {The Genesis Device} on his ship.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; High Council; Male; Mission Specialist;
lore: Senior member of the Klingon High Council. Presided over the installation of Gowron as head of the council in 2367.
name: K'Tal
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy

lore: Psychotropically, mesmerizingly addictive game device. One by one, its players are made susceptible to complete mental control.
name: Ktarian Game
text: Place on ship. Now and start of each of your turns, one person aboard (random selection) is disabled. Cured when non-disabled CUNNING>30 OR android aboard.

lore: Captain of the sleeper ship I.K.C. T'Ong, on a crucial mission ordered by the High Command in the late 23rd century. Awoke 75 years later in a much-changed galaxy.
name: K'Temoc
text: OFFICER Astrophysics Transporter Skill Geology DL/ {Engage Cloak}

lore: Arrogant First under Gelnon. Commanded the captured U.S.S. Defiant in 2374. One of the first Jem'Hadar bred in the Alpha Quadrant. Ignored his Second's advice.
name: Kudak'Etan
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Anthropology ENGINEER DL/ {Commandeer Ship} OR {Victory Is Life}

lore: Beloved childhood companion (and first surgical patient) of Julian Bashir. Loaned to, and especially treasured by, Leeta. A timeless symbol of innocence and security.
name: Kukalaka
text: Your non-Borg personnel present are each INTEGRITY +2, or +3 if {Leeta} present. Also, each player is limited to one {Brain Drain} OR one {Going To The Top} every turn. (Unique.)

lore: Famed female Klingon scientist and warp-field specialist who evaluated the metaphasic shield.
name: Kurak
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Computer Skill Physics Honor

lore: Statues which open to reveal a multitude of similar but smaller figurines inside, representing the belief that each person is a community of individual voices and desires.
name: Kurlan Naiskos
text: Place in hand until played on any ship as an Event card. If ship has all 7 personnel types aboard, its RANGE, WEAPONS and SHIELDS are tripled. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Son of Mogh. Brother of Lieutenant Worf. Member of the Klingon High Council.
name: Kurn
text: OFFICER Honor Computer Skill Navigation Diplomacy

lore: Humanoid leader of the Think Tank, an elite group that solves problems - for a price. Brilliant tactician. Often does the exact opposite of what an adversary expects.
name: Kurros
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Treachery x 2 Diplomacy Acquisition Leadership

lore: Captain K'Vada transported Captain Jean-Luc Picard and Lt. Commander Data on an undercover mission to Romulus.
name: K'Vada
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation

lore: Surgically altered Romulan. In 2367, posed as Geordi La Forge so Taibak could brainwash the real La Forge without raising suspicions.
name: La Forge Impersonator
text: ENGINEER Navigation Computer Skill Treachery May report wherever {Taibak} is present, for free.

lore: When attacked by a powerful cloaked drone at Minos, acting-captain Geordi La Forge used atmospheric turbulence to locate and target the hidden enemy.
name: La Forge Maneuver
text: Plays to expose any one cloaked ship at a planet location. It is vulnerable (as if it were decloaked) if the next action is an attack against that ship.

lore: An Away Team that is unprepared to complete its mission will undoubtedly experience delays. Mission progress may be impossible until additional personnel arrive.
name: Lack of Preparation
text: Non-Borg: Cannot get past (lose 10 points) unless you could have met mission requirements at start of attempt. Borg: Must have [Com], [Nav] and [Def] personnel to proceed.

lore: Malon legend warns of poisonous monsters, the Vihaar. When aiding a damaged Malon ship in 2375, a U.S.S. Voyager away team discovered the threat they'd dismissed was all too real.
name: Lack of Preparation (Voyager)
text: Non-Borg: Cannot get past (lose 10 points) unless you could have met mission requirements at start of attempt. Borg: Must have [Com], [Nav], and [Def] personnel to proceed.

lore: Kazan-Ogla who maintains the settlement on the Ocampa planet. Has searched unsuccessfully for a way to penetrate the Caretaker's subterranean shield.
name: Lagren
text: ENGINEER Physics Geology Exobiology

lore: Male of American Indian descent. Actually The Traveler in disguise. Wesley Crusher left Starfleet Academy to study transcendence of thought with him.
name: Lakanta
text: CIVILIAN Ship he is on can leave one end of spaceline and enter other end. {Wesley Crusher} attributes +4, if present.

lore: Soong-type android "daughter" of Lt. Commander Data, created by replication of his own positronic pathways. Lal is the Hindi word for "imzadi."
name: Lal
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Youth When reporting, select any two skills present.

lore: Jem'Hadar Third. Alpha. Realigned targeting sensors on U.S.S. Defiant captured by Dominion forces in 2374. His initiative pleased First Kudak'Etan.
name: Lamat'Ukan
text: SECURITY Leadership Computer Skill x 2 Transporter Skill While on your ship, it is WEAPONS +2.

lore: Humanoid mathematician once assimilated as the Borg, Two of Nine. Still linked with Marika and P'Chan.
name: Lansor
text: SCIENCE When reported, may download {Marika} and {P'Chan} (if not in play). Physics SECURITY

lore: Gold-pressed latinum, which cannot be replicated, is a valuable metal used as currency in many less-developed sectors, primarily outside Federation space.
name: Latinum Payoff
text: Plays if Greed aboard your ship when it destroys another ship in battle (once per destroyed ship). X=3 for each OFFICER aboard destroyed ship.

name: Launch Portal
requires: Borg Sphere; Scout; Shuttlecraft; Tractor Beam;
text: Suspends play to do any or all of the following: download {Engage Shuttle Operations} or {Escape Pod}; download (once per game) a scout ship, shuttle or Borg Sphere to your ship with Tractor Beam; and (except during a mission attempt) launch any or all of your carried ships with crew. Discard, or place on Engage Shuttle Operations to protect it from nullification and extend its effects to scout ships.

lore: Dr. Leah Brahms was responsible for much of the warp engine design for Galaxy-class starships.
name: Leah Brahms
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER

lore: Professional assassin called an "eliminator." Doesn't crave latinum, but doesn't like being cheated. Brunt called him a psychopath during the 2374 Ishka rescue.
name: Leck
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Exobiology Treachery Once per game, may kill any one personnel present.

lore: Bajoran dabo girl. Formed the Guild of Restaurant and Casino Employees with Rom. Amateur sociologist. Was formally separated from Julian Bashir on Risa in 2373.
name: Leeta
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Youth Computer Skill Leadership Music DL/ {Dabo} OR {Kukalaka}

lore: Damar became legate in 2374. Weary of Dominion rule, he led the resistance effort to free Cardassia in 2375. Rumored to have secret mountain stronghold.
name: Legate Damar
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Computer Skill Honor SECURITY Physics DL/ {For Cardassia!}

lore: Gul in command of the Reklar. Clashed with Captain Edward Jellico over troop and ship movements along the Federation-Cardassian border.
name: Lemec
text: OFFICER Geology MEDICAL Music Transporter Skill

lore: "Wasn't it your own Hardy that said 'Nothing reveals humanity so well as the games it plays?' ... Actually, you reveal yourself best in how you play."
name: Lemon-Aid
text: If you are at least 20 points ahead of your opponent, graciously give this card to opponent, who scores bonus points. (May not be nullified.)

lore: Colonel. Former member of Ornathia resistance cell. Part of historic Pullock V raid. Grateful to Shakaar for liberating his brother from Gallitep prison camp.
name: Lenaris Holem
text: OFFICER Honor Leadership Physics Resistance

lore: Renaissance man whose accomplishments as a scientist, artist, mathematician, philosopher, astronomer, inventor, anatomist, and geologist dwarfed all his contemporaries.
name: Leonardo da Vinci
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Astrophysics Biology Geology Physics DL/ {Mona Lisa}

lore: Altovar tried to steal biomimetic gel from the Deep Space 9 infirmary. When interrupted by Julian Bashir, he assaulted the doctor telepathically. Such attacks are usually fatal.
name: Lethean Telepathic Attack
text: Unless 2 Empathy present, place on one personnel ({Julian Bashir} if present, otherwise random selection). Personnel is disabled (killed if CUNNING+STRENGTH<16).

lore: Father of modern holography. Designed the E.M.H. series. Was briefly romantically involved with Leeta in 2373. Suffering from acute subcellular degradation.
name: Lewis Zimmerman
text: ENGINEER Your compatible [Holo] cards may report here (for free, once each turn). ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Admiral; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Dominion changeling appearing as Admiral Leyton. Exposed by Odo outside Starfleet headquarters; escaped using his shape-shifting abilities.
name: Leyton Founder
text: V.I.P. Leadership SECURITY Treachery May report on {Earth}. DL/ {Flight of the Intruder}

lore: Hero of the Bajoran resistance. Cardassian prisoner at Hutet labor camp. Temporary first officer of Deep Space 9. Titled Navarch by provisional government.
name: Li Nalas
text: V.I.P. OFFICER Resistance Honor Geology May seed under {Cardassia IV}.

lore: Low-ranking Orion Syndicate member. Obeys Raimus, his superior, in order to protect his wife and children. Holds that family is "the most important thing."
name: Liam Bilby
text: CIVILIAN Honor Treachery Geology Leadership Orion Syndicate

lore: Liberate prisoner being held by Kazon sect on the surface of this desert planet.
name: Liberation
text: SECURITY + (Transporter Skill OR {Neelix}) Ocampa may report on planet (for free).

lore: Maquis ship commanded by Captain Chakotay in 2371. 30-year old vessel - with a 39-year old engine that has been rebuilt and modified many times over.
name: Liberty
text: Your [Maq] personnel may report aboard. May be your seed at {Caretaker's Array}.

lore: A special form of sensor scan capable of detecting life-forms on planets or in space.
name: Life-form Scan
text: Glance at the cards in your opponent's hand for ten seconds.

lore: Lieutenant (j.g.) Lightner is an expert marksman. Member of the winning team in the 2369 Starfleet Academy Parrises Squares Championship.
name: Lightner
text: SECURITY Youth Astrophysics DL/ {Starfleet Type III Phaser Rifle}

lore: In her time aboard U.S.S. Enterprise-E, Lily Sloane adjusted admirably to rayguns, force fields, bionic zombies, and the holographic world of Dixon Hill.
name: Lily
text: CIVILIAN If with {Dixon Hill}, once per game may cancel a personnel battle here. ENGINEER Physics

lore: Structural design engineer of Phoenix. Took first steps into the new frontier. Helped overcome Borg in 2063. Said, "Jean-Luc, blow up the damned ship!"
name: Lily Sloane
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Physics DL/ {Auto-Destruct Sequence} If on {Phoenix}, meets two [Stf] staffing requirements.

lore: After a bar fight with Klingons on Station K-7, Captain Kirk ordered a lineup. No crewman claimed responsibility for starting the brawl, but none pointed the finger at Mr. Scott, either.
name: Lineup
text: To get past requires four personnel present (random selection) to "form a lineup." All four are "stopped" unless one has INTEGRITY<5 OR INTEGRITY>8.

lore: "We must respond personally. The universal translator would be recognized."
name: Linguistic Legerdemain
text: Unless Anthropology and Exobiology present, X=1+number of affiliation icons on this mission with no matching personnel present; place on mission; it cannot be attempted.

lore: Ex-wife of a coalition arms merchant on Turkana IV. Misses her old lifestyle, but likes the opportunities offered by the Federation.
name: Lisa Azar
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Greed

lore: Flagship of the small Son'a fleet and base of operations for the entire race. Commanded by Ru'afo.
name: Li'seria
text: Son'a shuttlecraft may report, be carried, and launch aboard. Tractor Beam

lore: Traditional Vulcan greeting and farewell gesture. Originated by Surak, the father of Vulcan philosophy, who led Vulcan into its era of peace some 2,000 years ago.
name: Live Long and Prosper
text: Saves any Vulcan who was just randomly selected to die. OR Once per turn, returns an opponent's personnel who just died to opponent's hand; draw one card for each of its [*] icons.

lore: Klingon warrior. Believed killed at Khitomer massacre. Actually held prisoner by Romulans in Carraya system.
name: L'Kor
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Music

lore: Quark's greed led him to critical evidence in a lockbox which ultimately solved a five-year-old murder case.
name: Lockbox
text: Unless Greed present, Away Team "stopped" (discard dilemma). Otherwise, score points if you solve mission this turn.

lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Eliminate resistance at location designation Wolf 359. Locutus of Borg commands.
name: Locutus' Borg Cube
text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 at Wolf 359. Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Federation. "The knowledge and experience of the human - Jean-Luc Picard - is part of us now."
name: Locutus of Borg
text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Navigation Archaeology Music While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Fed].

lore: Dangerous, violent Betazoid. Unable to sense even his own emotions. Murdered Crewman Darwin. Sought to atone after a mindmeld with Tuvok. Skilled floriculturist.
name: Lon Suder
text: ENGINEER Physics Biology Treachery Honor May initiate personnel battle, against any affiliation.

lore: Dangerous, violent Betazoid. Unable to sense even his own emotions. Murdered Crewman Darwin. Sought to atone after a mindmeld with Tuvok. Skilled floriculturist.
name: Lon Suder*
text: ENGINEER Physics Biology Treachery Honor May initiate personnel battle, against any affiliation.

name: Long Live the Queen
text: Seeds or plays on table. Reveal (then discard) incident to do one of the following: If your {Borg Queen} was just killed, download another Borg Queen. OR Prevent your Borg Queen present with your [Def] drone from being captured (drone is captured instead). OR Suspend any {Regenerate} while you place out-of-play from targeted discard pile up to six cards without a [BO] or [Bor] icon.

lore: Detects ships and phenomena at interstellar distances using ship sensors.
name: Long-Range Scan
text: Glance at the cards aboard any ship for ten seconds.

characteristicsKeywords: Hologram; Bodyguard; Capturing-related card; Chaotica-related card; Male;
lore: Inferior serving as bodyguard to Chaotica. Enforces his liege's rule, imprisoning infidels in the Dungeon of Pain or Mines of Mercury. Often seizes Constance Goodheart.
name: Lonzak
text: SECURITY Worth 5 points for each female captive present (double if {Chaotica} also present). Law

lore: First maje of the Kazon-Hobii. Has twice attended meetings with rivals in the hopes of ending skirmishes his small sect lacks the reserves to defend against.
name: Loran
text: OFFICER Leadership MEDICAL Physics Archaeology

lore: Evil Soong-type android. Data's "elder brother."
name: Lore
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Computer Skill Treachery x 2 SECURITY Transporter Skill Leadership Doubles all {Rogue Borg} and {Crystalline Entities} in play.

lore: Data's charismatic android brother. Identical except has more emotional ability. Had a negative effect on Data. Became Borg leader known as The One.
name: Lore Returns
text: Plays where {Rogue Borg} have eliminated a ship's crew. With Lore, your {Rogue Borg} may now use ship to attack ships and/or beam to battle Away Teams.

lore: Circuitry in Lore's finger was used to control and manipulate Lt. Commander Data with emotions.
name: Lore's Fingernail
text: Plays on table. While in play, all Soong-type androids (including Lt. Cmdr. {Data}) and {Exocomps} lose their affiliation and are non-aligned personnel.

lore: If a ship's orbit decays, it can be drawn toward a planet and burn out in its atmosphere.
name: Loss of Orbital Stability
text: Plays on any ship orbiting a planet. Ship has NO RANGE until end of turn, and is destroyed at end of its owner's next turn unless SHIELDS>4; then discard interrupt.

lore: High-ranking colonel in the Tal Shiar. Proponent of a temporary alliance with the Obsidian Order to destroy the foundation of the Dominion.
name: Lovok
text: OFFICER Tal Shiar Computer Skill Navigation SCIENCE Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Colonel; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling. Impersonated Colonel Lovok during the 2371 attack on the Dominion homeworld. Led the Romulan/Cardassian fleet into a Jem'Hadar ambush.
name: Lovok Founder
text: OFFICER Tal Shiar Computer Skill Navigation SCIENCE Transporter Skill Treachery

lore: Junior officers aboard all starships cooperate in their duties while competing for promotion and advancement, such as Ensigns Taurik, Sito, Lavelle and Ogawa.
name: Lower Decks
text: Plays on table. Each of your non-holographic, universal personnel is attributes all +2. (Captain's Order.)

lore: Close friendships often form between those serving together on a starship. This was especially true of Maquis who many times fought side-by-side before joining the U.S.S. Voyager crew.
name: Lower Decks (Voyager)
text: Plays on table. Each of your non-holographic, universal personnel is attributes all +2. (Captain's Order.)

lore: Jean-Luc Picard regretted his reckless youth until Q's alternate timeline antics revealed that he would have been a mere assistant astrophysics officer.
name: Lt. (j.g.) Picard
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Navigation

lore: Junior navigator of the starship Enterprise. Rapidly promoted by Captain Kirk. Remained on the Fesarius with Balok as an intercultural "exchange student."
name: Lt. Bailey
text: OFFICER Navigation Anthropology Diplomacy Stellar Cartography

lore: When a chance encounter with Lt. Watley in 2267 suggested a predestination paradox, Julian Bashir began to believe he was his own great-grandfather.
name: Lt. Bashir
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Biology DL/ {Classic Medical Tricorder}

lore: Senior geologist aboard the starship Enterprise. Eager to study a mysterious asteroid discovered in 2268.
name: Lt. D'Amato
text: SCIENCE Geology x 2 Archaeology

lore: Though Jadzia Dax had never met the handsome Mr. Spock, the Trill fondly recalled her symbiont's encounter with Dr. McCoy: "He had the hands of a surgeon."
name: Lt. Dax
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Astrophysics Anthropology DL/ {Classic Tricorder}

lore: John Kyle is relief helmsman and transporter technician aboard starship Enterprise. Born in Sheffield, England. Holds level 2 pilot certificate. Studies alien graphology.
name: Lt. Kyle
text: ENGINEER Navigation Transporter Skill Anthropology

lore: Scientist recently assigned to the starship Enterprise. According to Captain Kirk, she seems like a "nice, likeable girl." He thinks they could become friends.
name: Lt. Moreau
text: SCIENCE Physics Stellar Cartography

lore: Starship Enterprise engineering assistant. Discovered "Ensign" O'Brien incompetently performing a maintenance task.
name: Lt. Nagata
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Geology Honor Youth

lore: Benjamin Sisko posed as a 23rd-century Starfleet lieutenant to thwart Barry Waddle's plot to kill Captain Kirk. Couldn't resist talking to the legendary captain.
name: Lt. Sisko
text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Diplomacy Navigation May report where {Captain Kirk} is present (for free).

lore: Originally assigned to the starship Enterprise as senior physicist, Hikaru Sulu quickly transferred to the helm. Hobbies include botany, fencing, and antique firearms.
name: Lt. Sulu
text: OFFICER Physics Navigation Biology SCIENCE If on {Starship Enterprise}, it is WEAPONS +2.

lore: Dedicated communications officer of the starship Enterprise. Opened hailing frequencies countless times. In Swahili, her name means "freedom."
name: Lt. Uhura
text: OFFICER Youth Computer Skill Music ENGINEER Navigation DL/ {Hail}

lore: Dierdre Watley recently transferred from the Lexington to the starship Enterprise. Plays flute and piccolo. Julian Bashir speculated that she was his great-grandmother.
name: Lt. Watley
text: SCIENCE MEDICAL Youth Music Stellar Cartography

lore: Female Vorta who supervised the installation of Breen weaponry on Dominion ships. Hopes one day her service will bring her to the Founder Leader's attention.
name: Luaran
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Biology Treachery Physics May report aboard your {Enhanced Attack Ship}.

lore: Agent of the Department of Temporal Investigations. Calculates dates over a century old to the exact day of the week. Hates predestination paradoxes.
name: Lucsly
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill MEDICAL Law DL/ {Temporal Investigations}

lore: In a play to convince Nilva to support Grand Nagus Zek's reinstatement, Quark was altered to appear female.
name: Lumba
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Biology DL/ {Nilva} Doubles first-listed skill of each [Univ] [Fer] male present. May nullify gender-related dilemmas where present.

lore: Friend of Kira Nerys. Romantically involved with Furel. Member of Shakaar resistance cell. Fought provisional government over soil reclamators.
name: Lupaza
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Resistance Smuggling Computer Skill

lore: Though exiting the nexus is as simple as wishing it so, its temptations are so great that few desire to leave. Those pulled away against their will are forever changed by their experience.
name: Lure of the Nexus
text: Prevent a personnel from leaving {The Nexus} for one full turn. OR Save a ship being destroyed by The Nexus; relocate ship to adjacent location with all personnel under The Nexus aboard.

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Capturing-related card; DaiMon; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: DaiMon who illegally mined vendarite on Ligos VII. Tried to take over the U.S.S. Enterprise. Would've succeeded, too, if it weren't for those meddling kids.
name: Lurin
text: OFFICER Leadership Greed Geology Transporter Skill DL/ {Forced-Labor Camp}

lore: Elder of the two Duras sisters. Plotted with Romulan Sela to start the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
name: Lursa
text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership Geology Greed

lore: Section 31 operative. Secretive man with seemingly limitless access. Attempted to recruit Julian Bashir. Involved in infecting Odo with the changeling virus.
name: Luther Sloan
text: SECURITY Section 31 x 2 SECURITY Treachery Honor Computer Skill May report anywhere.

lore: Betazoid mother of Deanna Troi. Daughter of the Fifth House, Holder of the Sacred Chalice of Rixx, Heir to the Holy Rings of Betazed.
name: Lwaxana Troi
text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2

lore: Trabe governor. Constantly plotting vengeance on the Kazon sects that killed his parents, continuing a cycle of hatred and persecution between their peoples.
name: Mabus
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Diplomacy SECURITY Once per game, may kill one Maje present.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Cardassian observer on board the U.S.S. Enterprise during the Phoenix incident of 2367. High-ranking Gul in the Central Command. Strict disciplinarian.
name: Macet
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Honor MEDICAL

lore: Initially microscopic virus that absorbs growth hormones from host organisms to augment its own mass. After emerging, specimens continue to grow to billions of times their original size.
name: Macrovirus
text: Place on ship. Now and start of each turn, kills lowest STRENGTH OR lowest CUNNING crew member (opponent's choice). Cure with 2 Exobiology and 2 SCIENCE.

lore: Adventurous El-Aurian who spent time exploring worlds such as Earth. Met a time-traveling crew from the U.S.S. Enterprise in the 19th century.
name: Madam Guinan
text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may nullify any [AU] icon interrupt, event or dilemma where present. Anthropology

lore: Katherine Pulaski entered the holodeck on a bet that Data could not solve a Sherlock Holmes-style mystery without already knowing the outcome.
name: Madam Pulaski
text: CIVILIAN Unique missions seeded by both players are worth +10 points if you complete them. MEDICAL

lore: Gul Madred, Cardassian officer in the Obsidian Order. Specializes in prisoner interrogation. Tortured Jean-Luc Picard time after time in 2369.
name: Madred
text: OFFICER Once per turn, may add 1 to {Interrogation} or {Torture} if at your outpost. SECURITY x 2

lore: High-res encoding of 20th century rock 'n' roll, known for its enervating rhythms and unbearable volume. "You don't know what we can find... on a Magic Carpet Ride."
name: Magic Carpet Ride OCD
text: May seed at a space location. Owner may relocate any ship at this location (and ship's Away Teams, if any) to any planet location on spaceline. Discard artifact.

lore: Nechani official and chairman of his planet's judicial committee. Though his people divide spiritual matters from government, his faith is quite strong.
name: Magistrate Drang
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Archaeology Law Anthropology

lore: Maglocks such as those securing the U.S.S. Enterprise-E deflector dish require triple-input authorization. The need for coordinated effort prevents accidental activation.
name: Maglock
text: To get past, crew must have at least 3 OFFICER with STRENGTH>5 each.

lore: Miles O'Brien used the polar magnetic field of Parada IV to shield his runabout from the sensors of pursuing ships.
name: Magnetic North
text: Plays on your ship that has no staffing requirements if it is orbiting a planet. Prevents battles from being initiated against that ship. Discard interrupt when ship moves.

lore: Hupyrian servant. Grand Nagus Zek's bodyguard, pilot and handkerchief valet. Took a vow to speak only to his master. As loyal as he is silent.
name: Maihar'du
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 DL/ {Bodyguards} OR {Security Sacrifice} Exobiology DL/ {Scepter of the Grand Nagus}

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Set down on this world to perform complete repairs and upgrades on ship systems.
name: Maintenance Overhaul
text: Landed ship + ENGINEER + Computer Skill When you solve, you may download {Divert Power}.

lore: Physically altered, the half-Betazoid, half-human Deanna Troi was coerced to assume the identity of a Tal Shiar major in the 2369 M'ret defection plot.
name: Major Rakal
text: V.I.P. Romulan: Tal Shiar, Empathy, Treachery Federation: Empathy, Diplomacy, INTEGRITY +4, CUNNING -1

lore: Chief archon in Cardassian Judiciary. Presided over trial of Miles O'Brien. Outraged when human intervention forced her to acquit him. Tried to resist the Dominion.
name: Makbar
text: V.I.P. Law x 2 Anthropology MEDICAL Treachery Doubles {Extradition} here.

name: Make It So
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, if your staffed ship has its matching commander aboard, you may "unstop" it (once per game per Ship card title) OR download {Ready Room Door} (to download a Captain's Order) OR , if that ship is in battle (even during opponent's turn), download a Tactic card (once per game per Tactic card title). Discard incident after use, unless that matching commander has [Ent-E] icon.

lore: "We are Pakleds. We look for things...things to make us go. You are smart. Can you make our ship go? Do not try to trick us. We can tell."
name: Make Us Go
text: To get past, place most CUNNING ENGINEER present atop mission with dilemma. At the end of your next turn, place both out of play if you do not have CUNNING>24 here.

lore: Head of security aboard Enterprise. Experienced weapons expert, qualified bodyguard and crack shot.
name: Malcolm Reed
text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Law Leadership Transporter Skill Other SECURITY personnel present are attributes all +1.

lore: One of the many beautiful women who reside on the paradise planet of Risa.
name: Male's Love Interest
text: Male Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. Discard dilemma.

name: Male's Love Interest & Plague Ship
text: MALE'S LOVE INTEREST: Male crew or Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. TARELLIAN PLAGUE SHIP: Entire crew or Away Team immediately dies unless MEDICAL beams over (discarded). Discard dilemma.

lore: Mari fruit vendor whose waterplums caught Neelix's eye.
name: Male's Love Interest (Voyager)
text: Male Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. Discard dilemma.

lore: At times, Away Teams must open obstructed doors in confined passageways by hand, as did Lt. Commander Data on stardate 41503.7.
name: Malfunctioning Door
text: To get through door, must have Soong-Type Android present OR a combined STRENGTH>27 from up to four Away Team members.

lore: Klingon serving under Kruge. Prefers to work the night shift. Captured when his ship was commandeered. Prepared to die for this dishonor. Kirk saw otherwise.
name: Maltz
text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Astrophysics Geology

lore: At the place where ideas and reality intermix, Jean-Luc Picard saw his mother Yvette Gessard Picard, who asked, "(Is this) the end of the universe, or... the beginning?"
name: Maman Picard
text: If this is a Federation ship, immediately transport it to any end of the spaceline (opponent's choice).

lore: "Criminal! How plead you?"
name: Mandarin Bailiff
text: Opponent captures one personnel present (random selection). You may prevent this by "posting bail": you lose points and opponent gains points. X = number of [*] icons on that personnel.

name: Manheim's Dimensional Door
text: Plays on any planet. Affects all players. While in play, whenever any player has a card in hand matching one just played by the opponent, the Manheim Effect (a temporal "hiccup") may occur. Opponent's card is suspended while player shows matching card, returns it to hand and plays any card from hand as if played normally. (Not duplicatable.) Nullify with {Anti-Matter Pod}.

lore: Male leader of the Cairn, a telepathic species who had no concept of spoken language until Federation contact was initiated by Lwaxana Troi in 2370.
name: Maques
text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2 Diplomacy

lore: Bajoran entomology student. Dabo girl. Orphaned by Cardassians. Romantically involved with Jake Sisko. Accepted to the science academy on Regulus III.
name: Mardah
text: CIVILIAN Youth Biology SCIENCE

lore: Veteran Klingon warrior. Achieved many glorious victories. Trained in battlefield medicine. Former member of Gowron's elite High Council honor guards.
name: Margh
text: SECURITY Honor Geology MEDICAL Transporter Skill

lore: Bajoran assimilated as a Borg while on U.S.S. Excalibur. Became Three of Nine. She escaped the Borg in 2375.
name: Marika
text: ENGINEER When reported, may download {Lansor} and {P'Chan} (if not in play). Astrophysics Stellar Cartography

lore: Bajoran assimilated as a Borg while on U.S.S. Excalibur. Became Three of Nine. She escaped the Borg in 2375.
name: Marika*
text: ENGINEER When reported, may download {Lansor} and {P'Chan} (if not in play). Astrophysics Stellar Cartography

lore: Senior engineer on U.S.S. Equinox. Frequent attacks by the Ankari "spirits" have made her claustrophobic. Eventually became part of the U.S.S. Voyager crew.
name: Marla Gilmore
text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill

lore: Senior engineer on U.S.S. Equinox. Frequent attacks by the Ankari "spirits" have made her claustrophobic. Eventually became part of the U.S.S. Voyager crew.
name: Marla Gilmore*
text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill

lore: The mirror version of Lt. Moreau is assigned to the I.S.S. Enterprise chem lab. Romantically involved with James Tiberius Kirk. Likes being a "captain's woman."
name: Marlena Moreau
text: SCIENCE Biology Physics Treachery Anthropology DL/ {Classic Tricorder}

lore: Chancellor of Acamar III. With the help of Captain Picard, she completed an amnesty agreement to return the Gatherers to Acamar in 2366.
name: Marouk
text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy May nullify {Yuta} where present, scoring 3 points.

characteristicsKeywords: Chameloid; Female; Rura Penthe-related personnel; Shape-shifter;
lore: Chameloid prisoner on Rura Penthe. Helped set up Kirk and McCoy in exchange for a full pardon. Her powers of shape-shifting, though great, take "a lot of effort."
name: Martia
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Treachery Exobiology Anthropology Greed

lore: Highly decorated general and High Council member. Accepted Worf, Alexander and Jadzia into the House of Martok. Lost his left eye battling the Jem'Hadar.
name: Martok
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Navigation x 2 DL/ {D'k Tahg} Your [Kli] ships at same location are each WEAPONS +2.

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Founder; General; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling who posed as General Martok. Advised Chancellor Gowron to end the Empire's long-standing alliance with the Federation.
name: Martok Founder
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Treachery DL/ {Treacherous Advice} OR {Dial Martok for Murder}

lore: El-Aurian con artist. Proprietor of Club Martus. Rival of Quark. Replicated a gambling device which changes the laws of probability. Always knows when they're bluffing.
name: Martus Mazur
text: CIVILIAN Greed Astrophysics Anthropology If {Alien Gambling Device} in play, duplicates its text here.

lore: Masaka attempted to transform the U.S.S. Enterprise into an ancient temple and grounds by rearranging its matter.
name: Masaka Transformations
text: Plays on any player. That player must shuffle entire hand, place on bottom of draw deck, then draw the same number of cards from the top. Discard event after use.

lore: The planet Angel One was dominated by its women who were intolerant of dealing with men.
name: Matriarchal Society
text: Cannot get past unless at least two female Away Team members are present.

lore: The population of the planet Taresia is ninety percent female due to the low birth rate of males - and the fact that, in order to reproduce, the male must be killed.
name: Matriarchal Society (Voyager)
text: Cannot get past unless at least two female Away Team members are present.

lore: Conflicted admiral under orders from the Federation Council to oversee the Ba'ku relocation. Dislikes working with Ru'afo, but will do it for the Federation.
name: Matthew Dougherty
text: V.I.P. Scores 10 points if helps complete {Collect Metaphasic Particles}. Leadership Treachery SCIENCE

lore: Functions: Prepare neonatal drones for integration into the collective. Protect and accelerate development. Restructure synaptic pathways; facilitate formation of thoracic nodes.
name: Maturation Chamber
text: Once each turn, you may download to Chamber one [Univ] drone in place of one card draw OR report to Chamber one [Univ] drone (for free).

name: Maximum Firepower
text: Attack: 6. Defense: -3. Hit = [Flip][Flip] (or [Flip][Flip][Flip] if you have {Future Enterprise}, {I.K.C. Chang}, {I.K.C. Fek'lhr}, {Decius}, any [AU] ship with the word "future" in its lore firing). Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Transporters off line.

lore: First officer of U.S.S. Equinox. Almost dropped out of Starfleet. Was once romantically involved with B'Elanna Torres. Still the p'tak she claimed him to be.
name: Maxwell Burke
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Treachery Computer Skill x 2

lore: First officer of U.S.S. Equinox. Almost dropped out of Starfleet. Was once romantically involved with B'Elanna Torres. Still the p'tak she claimed him to be.
name: Maxwell Burke*
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Treachery Computer Skill x 2

lore: Respected admiral. Friend of Soval. Sent the crew of Enterprise out into the final frontier to go where no man had gone before.
name: Maxwell Forrest
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Leadership x 2 Astrophysics DL/ Any NX-class ship

lore: Representative of specialized medical equipment. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Medical Kit
text: Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

lore: Collection of medical instruments. Though no substitute for a fully equipped medical facility, such devices are often sufficient to save lives when nothing more is available.
name: Medical Kit (Voyager)
text: Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

lore: Representative of Personal Access Display Devices designed specifically to facilitate medical diagnoses. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Medical PADD
text: Gives all of your ENGINEER-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

lore: Standard Personal Access Display Device pre-loaded with an extensive database of diseases, treatments, surgical procedures, and other medical information.
name: Medical PADD (Voyager)
text: Gives all of your ENGINEER-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

lore: Respond to reported medical emergency.
name: Medical Relief
text: Biology + Exobiology + MEDICAL

lore: Representative of a specialized tricorder optimized for medical use. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Medical Tricorder
text: Gives all of your SCIENCE-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

lore: "A-koo-chee-moya... to my father... Kolopak... if you can hear me among these unnamed stars, I ask you to continue to watch over me as you've always done... A-koo-chee-moya."
name: Meditation
text: Plays on table. At any time, you may discard one card from hand. For rest of that turn, each time you draw a card, you may do so from the bottom of your draw deck.

characteristicsKeywords: blade weapon; hand weapon; Klingon-related Equipment;
lore: Blade weapon favored by many Klingons for close-combat situations. Typically made of baakonite. The mek'leth's size and perfect balance make it an excellent offensive weapon.
name: Mek'leth
text: May report wherever you have a Klingon present. Each of your Klingons present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Satarran operatives use biolelectric fields to cause selective memory suppression. Victims retain basic skills and aptitudes, but lose their sense of identity and affiliation.
name: Memory Wipe
text: Seeds on table; your opponent's cards may mix regardless of affiliation. OR Plays on a non- [Bor] ship; ship, crew and ship's Away Teams lose affiliation and become [Non].

lore: Commander of the warbird Devoras. Aided the escape of Romulan operative Selok from the Federation.
name: Mendak
text: OFFICER Treachery Exobiology

lore: Relic from ancient Menthar-Promellian war. Aceton assimilators trap passing ships, drain power, then emit deadly radiation.
name: Menthar Booby Trap
text: Place on ship; it cannot move. Unless MEDICAL present, one crew member killed (random selection). Cure with 2 ENGINEER.

lore: Assimilation is considered by many to be a fate worse than death. "Don't hesitate to fire. Believe me, you'll doing them a favor."
name: Mercy Kill
text: Plays to immediately kill one of your personnel just abducted, captured or assimilated as a drone. OR "Kills" (nullifies) any one of your Event cards in play.

lore: Jem'Hadar Fourth under Goran'Agar. Injured by discharge from Miles O'Brien's crude phaser. Willing to be sacrificed to preserve dwindling supply of the white.
name: Meso'Clan
text: SECURITY Honor Stellar Cartography DL/ {Jem'Hadar Sacrifice}

lore: Revolutionary shields using overlapping subspace fields. Invented by Ferengi Dr. Reyga.
name: Metaphasic Shields
text: Plays on your ship. SHIELDS +2 for each SCIENCE classification personnel aboard.

lore: Norcadian girl being raised on Voyager. Of the four Borg children rescued from a damaged cube, was quickest in reclaiming her individuality. Likes sculpting and bugs.
name: Mezoti
text: CIVILIAN Youth Computer Skill Biology Once each turn, may "unstop" your Borg present.

lore: Norcadian girl being raised on Voyager. Of the four Borg children rescued from a damaged cube, was quickest in reclaiming her individuality. Likes sculpting and bugs.
name: Mezoti*
text: CIVILIAN Youth Computer Skill Biology Once each turn, may "unstop" your Borg present.

lore: Lt. Commander Eddington. Security officer assigned to Deep Space 9 because of Starfleet concerns about Odo. Defected to the Maquis.
name: Michael Eddington
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Treachery Honor Computer Skill

lore: Villain of Hotel Royale, an early 21st century pulp novel written by Todd Matthews about shady casino characters. Made real by unknown intelligence.
name: Mickey D.
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Automatically wins {Royale Casino} side games, if present.

lore: Rare subatomic spaceborne life-form that can cause severe damage to a starship's hull.
name: Microbiotic Colony
text: Ship damaged unless SCIENCE, ENGINEER and OFFICER aboard. Discard dilemma.

lore: Genetic weapon designed to attack humanoids who have specific DNA sequences.
name: Microvirus
text: Kills one Away Team member (opponent's choice), unless MEDICAL and SECURITY present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Former housekeeper and confidante of Enabran Tain. Hid members of Damar's resistance in her basement. Procured a com unit and other equipment for their use.
name: Mila
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Computer Skill Honor DL/ {Any Equipment card}

lore: Transporter chief. Conn and Tactical expert. Loathes "Cardies." Plays cello. Loves Keiko. Begat Molly.
name: Miles O'Brien
text: ENGINEER SECURITY Transporter Skill x 2 Music Navigation DL/ {Near-Warp Transport}

lore: Chief of operations on Deep Space 9. Friend of Julian. Father of Molly and Kirayoshi. Husband of Keiko. Likes kayaking, darts and historical battle simulations.
name: Miles O'Brien (Blaze of Glory)
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Honor Transporter Skill DL/ {Defense System Upgrade}

lore: "Starfleet Admiral Q, at your service!"
name: Military Privilege
text: Plays on table until any Q-Flash. All Federation and Non-Aligned personnel in play with OFFICER classification are now CIVILIAN instead, and vice versa.

lore: Replenish dilithium supply from world conquered decades ago.
name: Mine Dilithium
text: Geology + Transporter Skill Solving player's ships are RANGE +1.

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Collect valuable material from the tunnels beneath this apparently abandoned world.
name: Mine Gallicite
text: ENGINEER + Geology + (Diplomacy OR Treachery + STRENGTH>40)

affiliation: Any crew may attempt mission (if same player controls a Nor with an Ore Processing Unit here).
lore: Scan system for mineral resources suitable for processing by mining station located here.
name: Mining Survey
text: ENGINEER + SCIENCE + Geology + Physics {Nor} or {Empok Nor} may seed and {Process Ore} here.

lore: First maje of the Kazon-Pommar sect. Agreed to host negotiations between the Trabe and several Kazon sects in 2372. Gained little prestige from the debacle.
name: Minnis
text: OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy Navigation Biology Computer Skill x 2

lore: Knockout brunette in a computer-generated gin joint. Programmed by the Bynars to distract William T. Riker. His feelings for her remained quite passionate for years.
name: Minuet
text: CIVILIAN Once each turn, your {Bynars} card may play for free. Once every turn, may "stop" up to two males present.

lore: 1/4 Klingon, 3/4 human daughter of B'Elanna Torres and Tom Paris. Has her father's charm and mother's temper. In a possible future, helped Janeway negotiate with Korath.
name: Miral Paris
text: OFFICER Youth Honor Anthropology ENGINEER Diplomacy (x2 if {Treaty: Federation/Klingon} is in play)

lore: 1/4 Klingon, 3/4 human daughter of B'Elanna Torres and Tom Paris. Has her father's charm and mother's temper. In a possible future, helped Janeway negotiate with Korath.
name: Miral Paris*
text: OFFICER Youth Honor Anthropology ENGINEER Diplomacy (x2 if {Treaty: Federation/Klingon} is in play)
