lore: Malcorian scientist befriended by Jean-Luc Picard. Departed Malcor III aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Mirasta Yale
text: SCIENCE Physics Astrophysics Worth bonus points to you while in play.

lore: Scientist in charge of developing and testing the interphase generator in 2368.
name: Mirok
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics

lore: Small blade weapon used for personal protection. Ubiquitous in the mirror universe. Quite handy when an unexpected career-advancement opportunity presents itself.
name: Mirror Dagger
text: Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) May report to a [MQ] facility for free OR to a just-initiated personnel battle involving your [MQ] card(s).

lore: Jean-Luc Picard reflected upon introducing an unstable element into a critical situation.
name: Mirror Image
text: Seeds or plays on table. All {Red Alert}, {Kivas Fajo - Collector}, {Masaka Transformation}s and {The Traveler: Transcendence} cards affect all players. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Cardassian ore processing facility controlled by the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance in the mirror universe.
name: Mirror Terok Nor (back)
text: Seeds at {Bajor}. If commandeered, new controller may flip card over. (Not duplicatable.) {Quark's Bar} may seed or play on this Nor; [eDS9] {Ops} may not.

lore: Cardassian ore processing facility commandeered by the Terran Rebellion in the mirror universe.
name: Mirror Terok Nor
text: Seeds during dilemma phase at {Bajor}. If commandeered, new controller may flip card over. (Not duplicatable.) {Quark's Bar} may seed or play on this Nor; [eDS9] {Ops} may not.

lore: Indoctrinated by Vedek Winn, Neela attempted to assassinate Vedek Bareil. She might have succeeded if not for the intervention of her superior officer, Miles O'Brien.
name: Misguided Activist
text: One V.I.P. or [Cmd] personnel present (random selection) is killed (only "stopped" if 2 SECURITY OR {Miles O'Brien} present). Mission continues.

lore: Bureaucracies require field commanders to submit a complete "after action report" on any mission. Though necessary, the process can be time consuming.
name: Mission Debriefing
text: Seeds or plays on table. Whenever any crew or Away Team finishes a mission attempt (whether successful or not), it is "stopped." (Captain's Order.)

lore: Keeping detailed records of missions and discoveries is an essential part of any crew's daily routine. This is even more critical for the only Federation crew in the Delta Quadrant.
name: Mission Debriefing (Voyager)
text: Seeds or plays on table. Whenever any crew or Away Team finishes a mission attempt (whether successful or not), it is "stopped." (Captain's Order.)

lore: When under extreme stress, even highly trained veterans can experience lapses in judgement. Miles O'Brien and Worf fought each other while they were besieged by Jem'Hadar in 2373.
name: Mission Fatigue
text: Unless Empathy and Leadership present, place on mission; each subsequent dilemma seeded here stops one non-Borg personnel present (random selection) when revealed.

lore: Operator of the junction room on deck 16 of U.S.S. Voyager. Knows the bowels of the ship better than almost anyone aboard - including Captain Janeway.
name: Mitchell
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Navigation Astrophysics

lore: Portable holographic projector designed by Henry Starling. Based on 29th-century technology he stole from the Timeship Aeon. Acquired by The Doctor in 2373 - or was it 1996?
name: Mobile Holo-Emitter
text: May be "worn" by (placed on) one of your [Holo] personnel; you may remove it during your turn. Wearer moves normally. While worn, does not count as an Equipment card.

lore: Father of Worf and Kurn. Followed the traitor Ja'rod to Khitomer, suspecting him of conspiring with Romulans. Rumored to have survived the massacre.
name: Mogh
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Leadership Honor x 2 Computer Skill Archaeology Music

lore: Priceless original oil painting by ancient Earth scientist Da Vinci. Stolen from the Louvre in 2243. Recovered from the collection of Kivas Fajo in 2366.
name: Mona Lisa
text: Use as Equipment card. If destroyed, the player directly causing the destruction (if any) loses points. (Not duplicatable.)

characteristicsKeywords: Hologram; Female; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
lore: Capable valet to Secret Agent Julian Bashir. She speaks seven languages, has degrees in biology, chemistry, and physics, and can fly anything from a jet to a helicopter.
name: Mona Luvsitt
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Biology Physics Navigation Anthropology

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Particle Scattering Device; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commanded by Grebnedlog. Uses technology stolen from Romulans, Jarada, other races - and Geordi La Forge. "We are strong now. We have better weapons."
name: Mondor
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Particle Scattering Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Ferengi soldier in the Terran Rebellion. The mirror version of Rom seeks vengeance against the Alliance.
name: Mr. Rom
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Navigation x 2 Physics Geology When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Nog}.

lore: Chief engineer of the starship Enterprise. Nicknamed "Scotty." Big enough to take a few insults.
name: Mr. Scott
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Leadership Astrophysics Transporter Skill DL/ {Classic Type II Phaser} If on a Constitution-class ship, it is attributes all +2.

lore: Scotty knows his ship like the back of his hand. With his help, a chimpanzee and two trainees could run her.
name: Mr. Scott (The Motion Pictures)
text: ENGINEER Miracle Worker ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill x 2 Transporter Skill DL/ {Divert Power} May meet any one additional staffing requirement.

lore: After years collecting duties for (and being romantically involved with) the Intendant, the mirror Benjamin Sisko became leader of the Terran Rebellion.
name: Mr. Sisko
text: SECURITY Leadership x 2 Biology Navigation Honor Your [TE] personnel (except [AU]) are attributes all +1.

lore: Highly logical starship Enterprise first officer. First Vulcan in Starfleet. Suppresses his human half. Fascinating.
name: Mr. Spock
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Computer Skill Exobiology Music OFFICER Mindmeld x 2 DL/ {Vulcan Nerve Pinch} If with {Captain Kirk}, both are attributes all +2.

lore: Vulcan in the mirror universe. Tuvok is a member of the rebellion that grew from the former Terran Empire. Still doesn't smile.
name: Mr. Tuvok
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Mindmeld Exobiology DL/ {Vulcan Mindmeld}

lore: Modifies transporter function to allow beaming to an alternate universe. Developed in the mirror universe. Used by Smiley, Professor Sisko, the Intendant, and others to cross over.
name: Multidimensional Transport Device
text: Reports in Alpha or Mirror Quadrant. Twice each turn, where present, allows transporters to beam to opposite quadrant (anywhere at corresponding location), ignoring all SHIELDS.

lore: New technology designed for the U.S.S. Prometheus, allowing it to split into three separate ships during battle. Programmed with hundreds of computer-controlled attack patterns.
name: Multivector Assault Mode
text: Plays at start of battle (once per battle) involving your {U.S.S. Prometheus} OR at least three of your ships. One of those ships is WEAPONS and SHIELDS +5 until end of battle.

lore: Tom Paris underwent a horrifying evolution after a transwarp test flight. His mutating DNA caused internal organs to shift, atrophy, and reform. His outward transformation was no less disturbing.
name: Mutation
text: Plays to shuffle top two cards of any discard pile into owner's draw deck. OR Plays once each turn; discard one card to draw two.

lore: An intruder with a stolen phaser can pose an unpredictable threat, especially if she doesn't know the difference between "stun" and "maximum."
name: My First Raygun
text: Immediately probe (then discard probe card): [Event], [Interrupt], [AU], /Ent-E: Kills a personnel (random selection). Otherwise: "Stops" a personnel (random selection).

lore: In 2369, Jadzia Dax was transported from the Bajoran wormhole to Deep Space 9 by one of the objects Bajorans call "Tears of the Prophets."
name: Mysterious Orb
text: May seed at a space location. Place in hand until played at any time to relocate any one personnel to anywhere in play, then discard artifact.

lore: Extra-dimensional entity willing to kill in order to understand the concept of mortality.
name: Nagilum
text: Half of crew is killed (random selection, round down) unless 3 Diplomacy OR STRENGTH>40 aboard. Discard dilemma.

lore: Romulan Ambassador to the Federation in 2293. Conspired with Admiral Cartwright and General Chang in the assassination of Chancellor Gorkon.
name: Nanclus
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Treachery Tal Shiar Geology May work with [Fed] and [Kli] cards if no Honor present.

lore: Originally, submicroscopic robots used for medical therapy. Now, self-replicating sentient life-forms who can disable computer systems.
name: Nanites
text: Damages afflicted ship unless 2 SCIENCE OR Diplomacy present. Discard Dilemma.

lore: Seven of Nine used a Borg procedure to resuscitate Neelix in 2374, nearly nineteen hours after his death. The Collective has restored drones after almost four times that duration.
name: Nanoprobe Resuscitation
text: Plays once every turn to return top card of your discard pile to hand. If it is a Personnel card and you have any [Com] Borg in play, you may report it to that Borg's location.

lore: 1/2 Ktarian, 1/2 human born on Voyager; raised by its crew. Daughter of Samantha. Goddaughter of Neelix. Mentored by Seven of Nine. Official captain's assistant.
name: Naomi Wildman
text: CIVILIAN While aboard {U.S.S. Voyager}, doubles first-listed skill of other personnel present. Youth

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cardassian ship; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Dukat. Commandeered near the Cardassian outpost on Korma. Named for Tora Ziyal's mother. Carried Jodmos to Ty'Gokar in 2373.
name: Naprem
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: The writings of ancient Chinese philosopher Sun Tzu on the art of warfare are still taught at Starfleet Academy. "He will triumph who knows when to fight... and when not to fight."
name: Narrow Escape
text: Plays on your staffed, undocked ship if its SHIELDS are less than half of opponent's total usable WEAPONS here. You may immediately move ship up to its total RANGE.

lore: Professor of Political Ethics. Dissident. Romantically involved with Quark. Member of Cardassian underground. Likes Samarian Sunsets.
name: Natima Lang
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Honor Leadership Attributes all +2 if with another Cardassian dissident.

lore: Tall humanoid species with a quick temper. A Nausicaan once stabbed Jean-Luc Picard through the heart with a knife.
name: Nausicaans
text: Three Nausicaans pick a fight. One Away Team member is killed (random selection) unless STRENGTH>44. Discard dilemma.

name: Navigate Plasma Storms
text: Seeds or plays on table. End of every player's turn, if any ship is in the Badlands Region, that player must probe: [Interrupt], [Doorway]: Flare-up. All ships and facilities in space in that region without 3 Navigation aboard are damaged. [Objective]: Maelstrom. All ships and facilities in space in that region without 5 Navigation aboard are destroyed. [Event]: Plasma storms subside. Discard objective.

lore: Successful completion of a mission in deep space requires proper charting and navigational skills. Maps of the known universe can be essential to a crew in unfamiliar territory.
name: Navigational Hazards
text: To get past requires Stellar Cartography and 2 Navigation.

lore: Seven of Nine and Harry Kim enhanced the Astrometrics Lab aboard the U.S.S. Voyager, allowing the crew to plot a new course that took five years off their expected journey home.
name: Navigational Hazards (Voyager)
text: To get past requires Stellar Cartography and 2 Navigation.

lore: Physically disconcerting transport at high-speed.
name: Near-Warp Transport
text: Allows beaming from ship to a neighboring spaceline location. Transport a maximum of six of your personnel and/or your equipment.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Assassin; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
lore: Religious activist. Assassin. Sabotaged systems and planted a bomb on Deep Space 9 in 2369. Believed she was following the will of the Prophets.
name: Neela
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Archaeology Treachery DL/ {Bajoran Phaser}

lore: Lt. Commander Neela Daren is a specialist in stellar cartography. Accomplished pianist. Romantically involved with Captain Jean-Luc Picard.
name: Neela Daren
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Music

lore: Talaxian jack-of-all-trades. Has served on a Trabalian freighter, mining colony, and Voyager. Serves as cook, morale officer, guide, and sometimes ambassador.
name: Neelix
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Navigation Diplomacy ENGINEER Geology

lore: Talaxian jack-of-all-trades. Has served on a Trabalian freighter, mining colony, and Voyager. Serves as cook, morale officer, guide, and sometimes ambassador.
name: Neelix*
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Navigation Diplomacy ENGINEER Geology

lore: Proconsul Neral of the Romulan Senate plotted with Sela and Pardek to invade Vulcan.
name: Neral
reports: Office of the Proconsul, Continuing Committee
text: V.I.P. Treachery Youth

lore: Impatient Alpha-Hirogen who took over the hunt for the escaped Hirogen holograms. Appreciated the irony of their prowess, but underestimated them nevertheless.
name: Netek
text: OFFICER Transporter Skill Navigation Geology Stellar Cartography Exobiology

lore: Device which can be used to control a crew by activating pain causing implants.
name: Neural Servo Device
text: Plays on any non-aligned ship. Unless 2 SECURITY aboard, use ship and crew for one turn as your own. Discard event.

lore: A common space station design used by many races for research or trade. Personnel and ships from all affiliations are frequent visitors at such facilities.
name: Neutral Outpost
text: Seed one at any [S] mission OR build at any [S] mission where you have any ENGINEER. Does not repair ships.

lore: Skilled pilot serving under Rekar. Her family's brushes with the Tal Shiar have left her highly suspicious and distrustful of others - even by Romulan standards.
name: Nevala
text: ENGINEER Navigation Computer Skill x 2 Physics Astrophysics DL/ {Romulan PADD}

lore: Seek contact with advanced civilization at this distant planet.
name: New Contact
text: Diplomacy + Leadership + Empathy + Anthropology

lore: The New Essentialists Movement asserts that decadence and complacency are eroding the foundations of the Federation. Worf was temporarily swayed by this group while on Risa.
name: New Essentialists
text: Unless INTEGRITY>40 and 2 Honor OR CUNNING>40 and 2 Treachery present, place one non-Borg Away Team member (random selection) atop draw deck. Nullify with {Jamaharon}.

lore: Security guard aboard the Krayton. Served with Tog during the Lwaxana Troi incident. Played chess with William Riker. Isn't bragging about the outcome.
name: Nibor
text: SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill Transporter Skill

lore: Natural leader kicked out of Starfleet Academy after the Nova Squadron accident and cover-up of 2368.
name: Nick Locarno
text: CIVILIAN Navigation x 2 Computer Skill Leadership Youth Transporter Skill

lore: Nefarious gangster and arms dealer. Infrequent patron of a highbrow San Francisco restaurant. Featured in several Dixon Hill stories, including The Big Goodbye.
name: Nicki the Nose
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Treachery Greed DL/ {Tommygun}

name: Nightmare
text: Plays on non-Borg opponent if you have a [Bor] card or {Borg Ship} dilemma in play. Each turn, peek at one to three cards in opponent's hand (random selection) and store at least one of them beneath incident. Nullified only by {Plexing} or when stored cards exceed cards in opponent's hand. (When nullified, choose one stored card to place beneath opponent's draw deck; return others to opponent's hand.)

lore: Lieutenant Worf's human foster brother. Son of Sergey and Helena Rozhenko.
name: Nikolai Rozhenko
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Computer Skill Treachery

lore: Federation undersecretary in charge of Agricultural Affairs. Assigned to oversee development of Sherman's Planet. Misused the priority-one distress channel.
name: Nilz Baris
text: V.I.P. Biology Law OR Diplomacy (change at any time). DL/ {Incoming Message - Federation} (to any location).

lore: Telepathic Mari. Chief Examiner of the Constabulary. The unusual laws of her species have reduced crime, but created a black market for illicit violent thoughts.
name: Nimira
text: SECURITY Empathy Law MEDICAL

lore: Chief of security aboard I.K.C. Voq'leng. His great-grandfather was the ship's original captain when it first set out over 100 years ago.
name: Nirok
text: SECURITY Exobiology Navigation Astrophysics

lore: Microscopic life-forms that normally live in asteroids but can infest and damage ships by ingesting nitrium.
name: Nitrium Metal Parasites
text: Place on ship. Ship is destroyed when countdown expires. Cure with 2 SCIENCE OR 2 ENGINEER.

lore: Seeking to purge all knowledge of the harvester virus, E'Tyshra captured Julian Bashir and Miles O'Brien. Keiko's persistence led to their rescue moments before they were to be killed.
name: No Loose Ends
text: Unless SCIENCE, OFFICER and Computer Skill OR {Keiko O'Brien} OR Resistance OR any [Def] drone present, kills all MEDICAL and ENGINEER present. Discard dilemma.

name: No Way Out
text: Seeds or plays on table. All personnel must mortally wound and stun their adversaries when possible. Once every turn, if your unique personnel who has 2 Honor or [KW] icon is killed in personnel battle, you may discard incident to place them in your point area (worth points equal to printed INTEGRITY; "in play" for uniqueness only).

lore: "From hell's heart, I stab at thee! For hate's sake... I spit my last breath at thee!"
name: No, Kirk ... The Game's Not Over
text: Plays if you just changed a mission's point value using {The Genesis Device}. Discard all planet facilities, landed ships, and ships in orbit there, and all personnel on planet.

lore: Acting science officer of U.S.S. Equinox. Fiercely loyal to Rudolph Ransom. Demoted to crewman by Kathryn Janeway when he joined U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Noah Lessing
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Geology Biology

lore: Acting science officer of U.S.S. Equinox. Fiercely loyal to Rudolph Ransom. Demoted to crewman by Kathryn Janeway when he joined U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Noah Lessing*
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Geology Biology

lore: Dedicated, hardworking ensign. The first Ferengi in Starfleet. Friend of Jake. Briefly served as chief engineer of U.S.S. Valiant under Captain Watters.
name: Nog
text: ENGINEER Physics Honor Youth Acquisition ENGINEER (if aboard your Defiant-class or [Fer] ship).

lore: Some natives are highly suspicious of outsiders. The Ennis and Nol-Ennis rejected Benjamin Sisko's efforts to end their longstanding feud.
name: None Shall Pass
text: To get past requires STRENGTH>53 OR 3 Diplomacy OR 2 Anthropology OR Guramba.

lore: Ore mining and processing station representative of facilities throughout Cardassian territory.
name: Nor
text: Seeds or plays at any [CAR] location (except a {Bajor Region} location).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Admiral; Female; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Admiral Norah Satie assigned Captain Jean-Luc Picard to the U.S.S. Enterprise. Zealous investigator who exposed the alien conspiracy of 2364.
name: Norah Satie
text: V.I.P. Leadership

lore: With insufficient transporter power for Scotty to beam him off the aircraft carrier Enterprise, Chekov was captured and interrogated by the U.S. Navy. Being Russian didn't help him.
name: Now Would Be a Good Time
text: Unless Transporter Skill aboard your ship or facility here beams up entire Away Team, one personnel present (opponent's choice) is captured. Discard dilemma.

lore: Captain of the I.K.C. Maht-H'a. Pursued DNA program in 2369.
name: Nu'Daq
text: OFFICER Archaeology Navigation Exobiology

lore: A rare, invisible pocket of space caused by turbulence during star formation. Absorbs all energy.
name: Null Space
text: Ship hits null space turbulence and is damaged unless 2 Navigation aboard. Discard dilemma.

lore: Ferengi romantically involved with Leosa. Sent her to get information from Reginald Barclay on the Pathfinder Project. Plans to spend his payoff on lobe enlargements.
name: Nunk
text: ENGINEER Greed Stellar Cartography Anthropology Once per game, may capture one [Holo] personnel present.

lore: Christine Chapel is head nurse of the starship Enterprise. Holds degrees in medical archaeology and biological research. Hopelessly attracted to Mr. Spock.
name: Nurse Chapel
text: MEDICAL Biology Archaeology Exobiology Reports for free if {Dr. McCoy} or {Mr. Spock} in play.

lore: Nutation adjusts the shield frequency phase rotation, thereby increasing shield efficiency. Used against the Borg in 2367.
name: Nutational Shields
text: Plays on your ship. SHIELDS +2 for each ENGINEER classification personnel aboard.

lore: Member of the Romulan underground. Spearheaded defection of Vice-Proconsul M'ret to the Federation.
name: N'Vek
text: SCIENCE Honor Biology Computer Skill

lore: Ensign Obarakeh is typical of Starfleet security personnel. She monitors and administrates computer encryption safeguards. Plays the Algolian chimes.
name: Obarakeh
text: SECURITY Music Computer Skill

lore: "Well, you wiggle to the left, you wiggle to the right; you do the Ooby Dooby with all your might; Ooby Dooby; Ooby Dooby; Ooby Dooby Ooby Dooby, Dooby Dooby doo wah, doo wah, doo wah."
name: Ooby Dooby
text: Draw one card for each non-android Youth present, then discard one card for each Music present. All Youth, Music and {Zefram Cochrane} present are "stopped."

lore: Surprised by Benjamin Sisko's rather unconventional response to Q's antagonism, the allegedly omnipotent being protested, "You hit me! Picard never hit me!"
name: Oof!
text: Nullifies {Fightin' Words}. OR Place each {Amanda Rogers}, {Kevin Uxbridge} and {Q2} in opponent's point area out of play; opponent loses 5 points for each. (Immune to Amanda Rogers.)

lore: The bestseller Oo-mox for Fun and Profit guides a female around the highly erogenous Ferengi ear, from the tympanic tickle and eustachian tube rub to the infamous auditory canal nibble.
name: Oo-mox
text: Plays on table, "stopping" all male Ferengi in play. Until countdown expires, doubles regular skills of all male Ferengi in play, and they are attributes all +2.

lore: In 2374, an ill-prepared band of Ferengi arranged a prisoner exchange aboard Empok Nor. Their profound lack of competence made the process even more difficult than they had expected.
name: Oops!
text: Unless Leadership present, kills one personnel (random selection) and "stops" all others present. To get past requires three [Stf] personnel OR three [Def] drones OR {Nog}.

name: Open Diplomatic Relations
text: Seeds on table during doorway phase; you may seed one {Treaty} during this phase (cumulative). At any time, you may exchange two cards in hand for a Treaty in your discard pile. OR Plays on opponent's ship. Your Away Teams which have a V.I.P. may beam to and from that ship, and it may not voluntarily move while your V.I.P. aboard. Discard objective if your personnel battle aboard that ship.

name: Operate Wormhole Relays
text: Seeds or plays on table. once each turn, your staffed ship with two or fewer staffing icons and SCIENCE, Physics x2, and Astrophysics aboard may move through {Barzan} or {Bajoran Wormhole} (or between two {Transwarp Network Gateway}s by using RANGE equal to twice the span of the destination location, and is not stopped.

lore: Disguised serpentine alien device used by the Devidians. When irradiated with the correct energy, the head comes alive and allows Devidians to control their time travel.
name: Ophidian Cane
text: Place in hand until played as an Interrupt card to allow 3 through {Devidian Door} OR double {Devidian Foragers} (to four personnel) OR double {Empathic Touch}.

name: Ops
text: Compatible OFFICER-classification personnel may report here. Any player may, in place of their normal card play, download to an unopposed site on this station one card which may play there (if reporting a ship or personnel, must be of matching affiliation); player draws no cards that turn. Any Computer Skill personnel unopposed here may commandeer station. Any Nor: Ops Module

name: Ops: Mirror Universe
text: Cards with same [KCA] or [TE] icon as this Nor are considered to match its affiliation for purposes related to its sites. Compatible OFFICER-classification personnel may report here. Any player may, in place of their normal card play, download to an unopposed site on this station one card which may play there (if reporting a ship or personnel, must be of matching affiliation); player draws no cards that turn. Any Computer Skill personnel unopposed here may commandeer station. Any [MQ] Nor: Ops Module

lore: In 2369, Benjamin Sisko encountered the Orb of Prophecy and Change. This contact caused him to experience a flashback to his first meeting with his wife-to-be, Jennifer.
name: Orb Experience
text: Plays on any personnel with INTEGRITY>6. Adds [Orb] icon. OR Plays if you have an Orb artifact present with your [Orb] personnel. Peek at any one card in the game.

lore: Shard of Bajoran Orb from the Celestial Temple. The fragment was set in a bracelet and used by the Sirah to create and control the Dal'Rok.
name: Orb Fragment
text: Use as Equipment card. May keep {Dal'Rok} from killing at same location. Also, any player may play Dal'Rok from hand as an Event card at same mission. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Negotiate for return of stolen Orbs still on Cardassian homeworld.
name: Orb Negotiations
text: Diplomacy x3 + [Baj] V.I.P. OR [Orb] personnel Any number of Orb artifacts may seed here.

lore: Third of the nine mysterious energy vortices called Tears of the Prophets by the Bajorans. Grants visions of the future. Only Orb not stolen by Cardassians during the occupation.
name: Orb of Prophecy and Change
text: Use as Equipment card. Once each turn, you may glance at the top card of your draw deck. Insert it anywhere within your draw deck if you wish. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Bajoran Orb. Transported U.S.S. Defiant across time and space to encounter starship Enterprise. Also used by Kira Nerys to travel back to the Cardassian occupation to learn of her mother's fate.
name: Orb of Time
text: Use as Equipment card. Once each turn, your ship or Away Team (if this Orb and your [Orb] personnel present) may time travel (except to board opponent's ship or outpost).

lore: Acquired by Zek from one of his contacts on Cardassia III. The Grand Nagus used the Orb to contact the Prophets, then sold it to the Bajoran government at a substantial profit.
name: Orb of Wisdom
text: Use as Equipment card. Your personnel here are each INTEGRITY +3. Each turn, one of your cards played here plays for free if your [Orb] personnel present. (Not duplicatable.)

name: Orbital Bombardment
text: Plays on your non-[Fed] ship. It is WEAPONS +4 against planet facilities, and may target landed ships in battle (those ships may not return fire). Also, if this ship is at a planet location at end of your turn (and has not battled this turn), you may probe: [*]: Targets hit. Kills up to two opposing personnel on planet (random selection). Opponent may counter-attack next turn.

name: Ore Processing Unit
text: Compatible ENGINEER-classification personnel and ENGINEER-related Equipment cards may report here. If {Automated Security System} on {Ops} at this station, personnel may not move to here from an adjacent site, or vice versa. This unit does not {process ore} when station is under Federation or Bajoran control. Any Nor: Docking Ring

name: Organ Theft
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, stop your Vidiian using {Vidiian Harvester} to "steal organs" from any non-[Holo] personnel present (except an android or shape-shifter). Discard victim; you may report two [Univ] Vidiians (or download one) and, until end of your next turn, your Vidiians may ignore {The Phage}. If victim belonged to opponent, you may discard objective (thrice per game) to score points.

lore: Pacifistic energy beings known as Organians imposed upon the United Federation of Planets and the Klingon Empire the treaty that those warring factions were unable to forge for themselves.
name: Organian Peace Treaty
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Federation- and Klingon-affiliation cards that have [OS] icons may mix and cooperate. (Immune to {The Devil}.)

lore: Typical explosion device. One was hidden in a floor panel of a runabout carrying Quark to testify before a Federation Grand Jury. Odo's attempt to beam it out accelerated its destruction.
name: Orion Syndicate Bomb
text: Damages ship unless Transporter Skill OR any Orion Syndicate personnel present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Bajoran terrorist leader. Has an intense hatred for Cardassians as a result of being tortured while in captivity. Speaks with the aid of a voice synthesizer.
name: Orta
text: CIVILIAN Resistance Leadership SCIENCE Opposing personnel STRENGTH -1 where present.

lore: Romulan medic. Borg, liberated in 2368. Since then has worked with Riley Frazier, trying to forge cooperation among warring factions of Borg from his former cube.
name: Orum
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Cybernetics Computer Skill Exobiology Anthropology

lore: Romulan medic. Borg, liberated in 2368. Since then has worked with Riley Frazier, trying to forge cooperation among warring factions of Borg from his former cube.
name: Orum*
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Cybernetics Computer Skill Exobiology Anthropology

lore: On a mission inside Dominion space, the U.S.S. Defiant was surrounded by Jem'Hadar vessels. In the face of superior firepower, Benjamin Sisko elected to surrender.
name: Outgunned
text: Plays at start of battle against opponent's only ship here. If undocked and your total WEAPONS involved > its SHIELDS x3: battle cancelled; ship commandeered and crew captured.

lore: Rogue Borg conducted a brief but deadly raid on the remote Federation outpost Ohniaka III in 2369. 274 personnel were lost.
name: Outpost Raid
text: If at your outpost: two personnel are killed (opponent's choice) unless STRENGTH>81. Discard dilemma. OR Elsewhere: requires STRENGTH>18 to pass.

lore: Overseer of ore processing on Terok Nor in the mirror universe. Less demanding than his predecessor, Overseer Odo, but just as hated by the Terran slaves.
name: Overseer Mardel
text: ENGINEER Exobiology Anthropology Geology

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Male; Shape-shifter; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: The mirror version of Odo supervises ore processing on Terok Nor. Has strict rules of obedience. The only changeling his contemporaries have ever seen.
name: Overseer Odo
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Geology Computer Skill DL/ {Process Ore}

lore: Resident of Terok Nor during Cardassian occupation of Bajor. Wife of collaborator. Extortionist. Hired Quark to steal hidden list of other collaborators.
name: Pallra
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Greed Treachery Your {Trazko} may report where present (for free).

lore: Rich merchant and trader from an unknown race. Friend of Kivas Fajo. Snappy dresser.
name: Palor Toff - Alien Trader
text: Exchange this card for any non-Personnel card in your discard pile.

lore: Large spider-like creature inhabiting the Bajoran moons. One-time food source for Resistance fighters. Caused Dax concern, since Trill/symbiont biochemistry cannot tolerate insect bites.
name: Palukoo
text: Unless Resistance OR ANIMAL present, "bites" a non-android present (random selection). If Trill with symbiont, dies now (discard dilemma); otherwise, disabled until countdown expires.

name: Panel Overload
text: Seeds or plays on table. Discard incident to nullify {Bynars Weapon Enhancement} or {Genetronic Replicator}. You may place incident on any outpost to prevent its {Spacedoor}s from re-opening (nullified by 4 ENGINEER aboard).

lore: Emissary of the Ferengi Trade Mission. Sabotaged his own ship to force a rescue by the U.S.S. Enterprise, creating the opportunity to bribe Ambassador Briam.
name: Par Lenor
text: V.I.P. Greed Diplomacy ENGINEER Astrophysics

lore: At the Parallax Colony, one couple spent their lives endlessly contradicting each other, despite Alexander's reminding them about the higher... the fewer.
name: Parallax Arguers
text: If that was cool, X=5. OR If you just argued, play an Event card now (X=0). OR Nullifies Parallax Arguers (X=opponent's Arguers points +5).

lore: Relationships in parallel universes take different courses. In one, Worf and Deanna Troi were married and had two children: Shanara, 2, and Eric Christopher, 3.
name: Parallel Romance
text: If present, one male and one female (random selection) have affair. They are STRENGTH -2 each and stopped now and for your next two full turns.

lore: Male senator from the Krocton Segment of Romulus. Delegate at the 2293 Khitomer conference. Betrayer of Spock.
name: Pardek
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Treachery

lore: Romulan officer accidently phased by interphase generator experiment.
name: Parem
text: OFFICER Treachery

lore: Technical advisor to Senator Vreenak. Trained by Tal Shiar. In 2374, counseled the senator during his mission to Deep Space 9.
name: Parthok
text: ENGINEER MEDICAL Leadership Tal Shiar Computer Skill

lore: Experimental orbital station built by Dr. Farallon for mining a planet from space. Rumored to be effective for atmospheric depletion.
name: Particle Fountain
text: If 2 ENGINEER present in Away Team, play particle fountain (maximum of one) on just completed planet mission for bonus points.

lore: A Tamarian Ship used a particle scattering field to change the atmosphere of El-Adrel IV, stranding Jean-Luc Picard and Dathon on the planet in 2368.
name: Particle Scattering Field
text: Plays on one of your ships with a Particle Scattering Device. No beaming to or from a planet is allowed where ship present. You may discard Field at any time.

lore: Commander of the Pi. Rescued from Galorndon Core by the U.S.S. Enterprise crew. Refused to "pollute his body" with an infusion of Worf's Klingon ribosomes.
name: Patahk
text: OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography Physics If aboard {Pi} with {Bochra}, Pi is attributes all +2.

lore: Devices which amplify transporter signals to enhance transporter beam power in hazardous areas.
name: Pattern Enhancers
text: Plays on table. Allows your personnel and equipment unlimited beaming through {atmospheric ionization} or {distortion field}s.

lore: Reclusive scientist who experimented with nonlinear time. Traveled to other dimensions, of which he said words paled "because the images are so vibrant."
name: Paul Manheim
text: SCIENCE Where present, may nullify {Manheim's Dimensional Door} OR double its effect. Astrophysics x 2

lore: Senior systems engineer aboard U.S.S Enterprise-E. Amateur geologist, studying with friend Inge Eiger. In command during Geordi La Forge's absence.
name: Paul Porter
text: ENGINEER Physics Geology DL/ {Any PADD} Computer Skill

lore: Investigate M-class planet and wormhole reported near T-tauri-type star.
name: Paxan "Wormhole"
text: Diplomacy + CUNNING>30 + Android Relocate opponent's ship if no android aboard.

lore: Humanoid who cared for his parents, Dornar and Ansha, until the Borg assimilated him as Four of Nine.
name: P'Chan
text: CIVILIAN When reported, may download {Lansor} and {Marika} (if not in play). Computer Skill Honor MEDICAL

lore: Search for U.S.S. Pegasus, reported lost in this sector.
name: Pegasus Search
text: Navigation + Diplomacy + Leadership + Treachery + INTEGRITY>40 OR {Interphase Generator}

lore: Waiter. Female. Used synthetic lobes to appear male. Wore clothes and sought profit in violation of Ferengi law. Romantically involved with Quark - briefly.
name: Pel
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Diplomacy Biology May avoid selections that target males or females.

lore: "Unfortunately there's only one penalty box. If any of you should be sent there, dear Tasha must give up the box to you... and go into nothingness."
name: Penalty Box
text: If any Penalty Box already in play, put its occupant out-of-play and replace with new victim (random selection). Discard event. Otherwise, place on table and put one personnel present (random selection) here. (If nullified, return occupant to owner's hand.)

lore: Norcadian entertainment producer. Arrogant. Corrupt. Abducts aliens from all over the sector and forces them to fight in the Tsunkatse matches.
name: Penk
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition SECURITY Treachery x 2 Greed DL/ Any other card that has "Tsunkatse" in title or lore

lore: Surreal 1931 Salvador Dali painting stolen by Kivas Fajo.
name: Persistence of Memory
text: Place in hand until played at any time on {Horga'hn} OR {Thought Maker} OR {Mona Lisa} OR {Static Warp Bubble} OR {Kivas Fajo - Collector} OR {The Traveler: Transcendence} OR "{Devidian Door}" OR {Supernova} OR {Black Hole} OR {Anti-Time Anomaly}. Reverses that card. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Phasing cloak prototype created in violation of the Treaty of Algeron, which forbids the Federation from developing cloaking technology. Salvaged from the U.S.S. Pegasus.
name: Phased Cloaking Device
text: May seed under {Pegasus Search}. Use as an Equipment card. While aboard your ship, that ship has a Phasing Cloak (RANGE +4 while phased).

lore: Phased personnel vibrate out of sync with normal matter, rendering them undetectable. Phased people cannot interact with non-phased people.
name: Phased Matter
text: Away Team is split into two Away Teams (your choice). Larger team is phased and cannot beam until cured by ENGINEER and SCIENCE in another Away Team on planet.

name: Phased Polaron Beam
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Dominion ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

lore: In times of war, it is not unusual for a crew to adopt rituals recognizing its accomplishments in battle. In 2374, the crew of the U.S.S. Defiant ceremonially displayed used phaser cells.
name: Phaser Array Power Cell
text: Once per turn, plays to score points if your ship survived a battle in which it and an opponent's card both fired WEAPONS.

name: Phaser Banks
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Federation ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

lore: Even on stun settings, phased energy weapons can cause severe injuries and burns if not fired judiciously in bursts.
name: Phaser Burns
text: If you have {phaser}s or {disruptor}s present during a personnel battle, before a winner is determined randomly select two opposing stunned cards to die.

lore: Denobulan miracle worker. Former chairman of immunology at his alma mater. Has a great smile.
name: Phlox
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Honor Exobiology If a [Sta] personnel present dies, you may discard two cards to return that personnel to hand.

lore: Earth's first faster-than-light ship. Launched via a Titan missile. Commanded by Zefram Cochrane.
name: Phoenix
text: May take off and land once per game. Worth points while in orbit.

name: Photon Torpedo
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have an Akira-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -35% Tactical panel overload: randomly kills one SECURITY or Computer Skill personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Security Office}).

lore: A noncorporeal life-form took hostages when another of its kind was unknowingly captured and experimented on by the Voyager crew. The Doctor ultimately negotiated their safe return.
name: Photonic Energy Being
text: Three crew members (random selection) are held with dilemma atop mission; discard all when countdown expires. Cure with [Holo] personnel OR Anthropology and Diplomacy.

lore: Ship suspected of attempting a covert mission to Galorndon Core in Federation territory.
name: Pi
Picard Maneuver
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 0. If you initiated ship battle with your matching commander aboard your ship, it appears to be in two places at once and has a 50/50 chance to avoid all damage this battle. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% EPS taps overloaded: Opponent may immediately download to this ship one {Plasma Fire} or {Warp Core Breach} (if possible).

lore: "You might have lived if you'd had a real one, instead of this unreliable piece of technology."
name: Picard's Artificial Heart
text: Immediately seed under this mission (even if a space mission). When mission completed (or scouted), owner places in hand until played as an Interrupt card, once per game, on any one personnel in play. That personnel dies whenever that personnel's STRENGTH is used. (May be nullified only by {Katherine Pulaski}, if present.)

lore: Investigate origin site of famous deadly plague.
name: Plague Planet
text: MEDICAL + Biology + Archaeology If you solve, you automatically overcome {Plague Ship}s. Opponent's side: If you solve, all {Plague Ship}s score no points.

lore: Tailor. Merchant. Elim Garak is suspected of being a spy by his friend Julian Bashir. Raises Edosian orchids as a hobby. Haggled with the Sisters of Duras.
name: Plain, Simple Garak
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Acquisition Biology May be replaced by another version at any time. *May be replaced by another version at any time.

lore: "Damn it all to Hell!"
name: Pla-Net
text: Immediately choose whether or not to nullify the next seed card at this location. If you choose to nullify, lose points. Otherwise, if that seed card turns out to be a dilemma and it "stops," disables or puts in stasis any of your personnel, lose points.

name: Plans of the Obsidian Order
text: Seeds or plays on table. Wherever you have an Obsidian Order personnel in play, your Cardassian espionage cards play at any time (for free) and may not be nullified. Also, once each turn, you may discard one of your Cardassian espionage cards from hand or table, then draw one card. At any time you may discard this objective from table to download one Cardassian espionage card.

name: Plans of the Tal Shiar
text: Seeds or plays on table. Wherever you have a Tal Shiar personnel in play, your Romulan espionage cards play at any time (for free) and may not be nullified. Also, once each turn, you may discard one of your Romulan espionage cards from hand or table, then draw one card. At any time you may discard this objective from table to download one Romulan espionage card.

name: Plasma Energy Burst
text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +4 and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a D'Kora-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Otherwise, causes electromagnetic disruptions ([Down]). EM burst: until end of your next full turn, WEAPONS disabled and all ENGINEER-classification personnel are "stopped."

lore: Intensely hot combustion of ionized plasma gas. Dangerous fire which can destroy a ship.
name: Plasma Fire
text: Plays on any ship, except {Borg ship}. Fire damages ship at end of next turn and continues damaging each turn. SECURITY puts it out. Discard after use.

name: Plasma Torpedo
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Romulan ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

lore: Device designed by Geordi La Forge to improve warp engine quantum efficiency. Wesley Crusher opined that it was obsolete and needed a subprocessor matrix overhaul.
name: Plasmadyne Relay
text: While on a ship, RANGE and SHIELDS are +2. While at a station or outpost, SHIELDS are +4. (Cumulative.)

lore: A Betazed relaxation method taught to Reginald Barclay by Deanna Troi. Stimulating a nerve cluster behind the ear releases natural endorphins and helps to reduce anxiety.
name: Plexing
text: Nullifies {Empathic Echo} OR {Parallax Arguers} OR {Frame of Mind} OR {System-Wide Cascade Failure} OR {Thought Maker}. (May not be nullified.)

lore: Search ancient civilization site for treasures or artifacts.
name: Plunder Site
text: Treachery + Archaeology + STRENGTH>30

name: Population 9 Billion - All Borg
text: Seeds or plays on table. If your Borg have completed {Stop First Contact} (or {Build Interplexing Beacon}), place incident on {Earth}; you may download a {Borg outpost} there. Your [Bor] cards may subsequently report on Earth or to that outpost; and your subsequently completed [BO] objectives targeting missions in the Alpha Quadrant score double points.

lore: Portal 63 is the last remaining protector of the Tkon Empire, which went extinct 600,000 years ago. Challenges those who awaken him.
name: Portal Guard
text: Unless at least one Away Team member has CUNNING>7 OR Honor, the entire Away Team must abort mission and beam up or die.

name: Post Garrison
text: Plays on any mission. Opponent may not attempt, scout or complete a [BO] objective targeting that mission, but may battle your cards at that location regardless of affiliation attack restrictions. If on a planet, objective nullified if you have fewer than three Jem'Hadar or SECURITY personnel on planet; otherwise, nullified if you have fewer than two staffed ships at that location.

lore: Neral is the president of the Continuing Committee and Praetor of the glorious Romulan Star Empire. Has not aged well under the mantle of leadership.
name: Praetor Neral
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Biology Adds SECURITY to each of your Tal Shiar personnel.

lore: Type-3 Cardassian warship. Rescued the Detapa Council from Cardassia Prime just prior to the 2372 Klingon invasion. Commanded by Dukat.
name: Prakesh
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Automated Personnel Unit built by the Pralor. Found adrift in space by Voyager. Abducted B'Elanna Torres in the hopes she could build more androids of its kind.
name: Pralor Unit 3947
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Astrophysics Geology Navigation

lore: Each starship is assigned a unique security code to prevent remote access to its vital systems. With knowledge of the code, a ship can be ordered to lower its own shields.
name: Prefix Code Transmission
text: Plays on your ship when firing on a target that has a matching affiliation icon or that your infiltrator is aboard. Opposing DEFENSE total reduced by half (round down).

lore: Mission briefings with senior staff are important for information and planning. Lack of preparation can be costly in some instances.
name: Preparation
text: Plays if you have personnel with four different classifications at a mission you have not attempted. Glance at bottom seed card. OR Nullifies {Lack of Preparation} (but still lose points).

name: Prepare Assault Teams
text: Plays on table. You may download to one of your crews or Away Teams one hand weapon. While in play, your SECURITY may function as leaders. Also, at start of personnel battle, you may split your cards into two assault teams (face down). Attacker chooses one team to participate in the battle. (The other team does not participate and is not "stopped.")

name: Prepare the Prisoner
text: Seeds or plays on table. Captives you {Brainwash} are not required to relocate to an outpost. Opponent's {Rescue Captives} card affects only captives at one location where opponent has a crew or Away Team (rescued personnel relocate to that crew or Away Team). Each turn, you may draw one card by placing one capturing-related card from your hand beneath your draw deck or discard pile.

lore: Stop malfunctioning Cardassian warhead from attacking defenseless, highly populated planet.
name: Prevent Annihilation
text: ENGINEER x2 + Leadership x2 + Computer Skill x2 OR {B'Elanna Torres}

name: Primary Energy Weapon
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Borg ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

lore: Gamma quadrant space facility. Long-time source of ketracel-white for Jem'Hadar troops.
name: Primary Supply Depot
text: Seeds at any non-homeworld Gamma Quadrant mission. Your non-weapon equipment may seed aboard (limit three). Resets countdowns of {Ketracel-White} aboard. Does not repair ships.

lore: First contact requires caution, subterfuge or force. Solkar's historic visit to Earth was peaceful, but Federation/Klingon contact in 2218 would ignite a century of hostilities.
name: Primitive Culture
text: To get past, requires 3 Vulcans OR Anthropology and CIVILIAN OR Vorta and 4 Jem'Hadar OR 2 Tal Shiar OR 2 Obsidian Order OR Acquisition and 2 Greed OR 6 Klingons OR 4 [Def] Borg.

lore: Humanoids inhabiting a desolate planted captured Neelix and Kes while the two crewmen were searching for food. The cave-dwellers particularly like Kes' golden locks.
name: Primitive Humanoids
text: Unless 2 Leadership and Anthropology present, place two Away Team members (random selection) with dilemma atop mission until solved (or planet assimilated).

lore: Locate secret alien prison facility and rescue wrongfully incarcerated crew members.
name: Prison Break
text: Diplomacy + Navigation + Computer Skill May seed up to two [DQ] personnel under here.

lore: Captured by a Hunter, Tosk was led through the corridors of Deep Space 9 to show that he had been apprehended - the ultimate humiliation for a Tosk.
name: Prisoner Escort
text: Plays on a personnel you just captured. If you place captive in your Brig, its owner loses points (once per persona per game).

name: Prisoner Exchange
text: Seeds or plays on table. During your turn, you may release a personnel you hold captive (relocate to owner's ship or facility at same location). Release any or all of your own personnel held captive at that location (relocate them to your ship or facility there), or instead download any one personnel there; then discard incident.

name: Process Ore
text: Plays on an {Ore Processing Unit}. Start of each turn, if you control this Nor at a planet location and you have a matching ENGINEER or SECURITY personnel unopposed here, you may "process ore." Discard one card from hand, place bottom card of discard pile beneath draw deck or out-of-play, then draw up to two cards.

characteristicsKeywords: Hologram; Capturing-related card; Dr. Noah-related personnel; Female; Professor; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
lore: Seismologist replaced by an image of Jadzia Dax. Built the lasers Dr. Noah planned to use to destroy the world. Romantically involved with Secret Agent Julian Bashir.
name: Professor Honey Bare
text: SCIENCE Geology Physics DL/ {Rescue Captives} May play {Volcanic Eruption} as an event at her location.

characteristicsKeywords: Hologram; Male; Professor; Sherlock Holmes-related personnel;
lore: Sherlock Holmes' enemy. Accidentally made sentient in 2365. Built a simulation of the Enterprise and its crew.
name: Professor Moriarty
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Leadership Computer Skill Treachery Once each turn, you may place an additional personnel under {Holoprogram: 221B Baker Street}.

lore: Scientist who abandoned her work for the Alliance to join the Rebellion at the urging of Benjamin Sisko. Bonded with Jake, the son she would never have.
name: Professor Sisko
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics {Any Sisko} may report where present (for free if Jake).

name: Promenade Shops
text: Non-Borg CIVILIAN personnel may report here regardless of affiliation. Any player who has a non-Borg personnel present may probe: [Event], [Interrupt], [Equipment]: Shopping. Draw probe card. [Objective], [Car], [Kli]: Brawl. Must immediately initiate a personnel battle (if opposed by non-Borg at this site). Any Nor: Promenade

lore: Ferengi ensign who manned the conn station in Barash's illusion. Riker thought him one of the few elements of the simulation he could get used to.
name: Prot
text: OFFICER Youth Archaeology Navigation Geology

lore: Guard medical shipments to colony suffering from outbreak of Rudellian plague.
name: Protect Shipment
text: Leadership + SECURITY x2 + MEDICAL + Honor + WEAPONS>9

name: Protection Racket
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your Ferengi who has Treachery (or your non-Ferengi who has Treachery x2) may "threaten" (place incident on) any non-Borg personnel at this location. Make any request of opponent. Incident nullified if opponent complies. Threatened personnel loses first-listed skill and opponent must probe each turn: [Doorway], [*]: Assassin strikes. Threatened personnel killed.

lore: An unknown anomaly brought from the Gamma Quadrant was actually a protouniverse in its early stages. Its growth would have destroyed DS9 had it not been returned to space.
name: Protouniverse
text: Plays on {"Subspace Seaweed"}; ship or facility destroyed when countdown expires. Nullify with Astrophysics, SCIENCE and 2 ENGINEER aboard, but ship or facility damaged.

name: Pulse Disruptor
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Klingon ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Pulse Phaser Cannons
text: Attack: 4. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Defiant-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Tractor beam off line.

lore: Correctional technique used on Orellius. Colonists who commit crimes are imprisoned in the box to suffer from heat and dehydration.
name: Punishment Box
text: Place on planet. Now and start of each mission attempt here, cannot get past unless one OFFICER is "placed in the box" ("stopped") until end of turn.

lore: On Rubicun III, mediators arrested Wesley Crusher when he fell into a garden. He was designated for death, which created a Prime Directive dilemma for Jean-Luc Picard.
name: Punishment Zone
text: One Away Team member (random selection) is killed OR beam up that personnel at a penalty. Double penalty if Federation.

lore: An alien probe housing a playful software life-form exited the Bajoran wormhole in 2369. Miles O'Brien dubbed the program "Pup" after it disrupted computer systems to get attention.
name: "Pup"
text: Place on ship. Disables RANGE until start of your next turn; then WEAPONS until start of your next turn; then SHIELDS; then repeats. Nullify with 4 Computer Skill OR {any Miles}.

lore: Inspect and make offer on moon that just came on the market in this upscale sector.
name: Purchase Moon
text: Greed + Acquisition + Geology + Astrophysics + discard 1 to 4 {Gold-Pressed Latinum} (X = number discarded) Opponent's side: Greed + Acquisition + Geology + Astrophysics + discard 3 Gold-Pressed Latinum Points: [30]

lore: Incorrigible omnipotent being. Member of the Q Continuum. Q exhibits a child-like petulance and sense of playfulness.
name: Q
text: Unless 2 Leadership and INTEGRITY>60, opponent may download up to 2 [Q] cards and place them atop their Q-Continuum side deck; crew or Away Team has a Q-Flash of 4 cards, then is stopped. Discard dilemma.

lore: Q, stripped of his powers, helped the U.S.S. Enterprise crew develop a plan to save Bre'el IV from destruction. Guinan used a simple serving fork to verify his claim of mortality.
name: Q Gets the Point
text: To get past requires 2 Treachery or {Mortal Q}, but one such personnel (opponent's choice) is "forked" ("stopped") if opponent has {any Guinan} in play. Nullified by any Guinan.

name: Q the Referee
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, you may play one [Ref] card for free OR discard (or place beneath draw deck) one of your [Ref] cards from hand or in play to draw a card. Also, you may suspend play while you download any other [Ref] card (ignoring {Computer Crash}), then discard incident.

lore: Member of the Q who observed Q's act of self-sacrifice and re-instated him in the Q continuum.
name: Q2
text: Nullifies {Amanda Rogers} OR {Kevin Uxbridge} OR a [Q] icon dilemma OR a dilemma with the word "Q" in title.

lore: When threatened, fight. When in doubt, surprise them. Brute strength is not the most important asset in a fight. Real power is in the heart. A Klingon does not run away from his battles.
name: Qapla'!
text: If an opponent attacks you, during that battle your Klingons with Honor add INTEGRITY to STRENGTH. (Not cumulative.)

name: Q-Flash
text: Seeds on (opens) Q-Continuum side deck (any number of [Q] cards). When opponent's crew or Away Team has a Q-Flash, draw cards from here, one at a time, discarding duplicates. Dilemmas drawn are encountered (while personnel present only). Opponent plays other cards drawn (if possible). When [Q] cards leave pay, place them face up here only (even if closed); when side deck empty, shuffle to replenish it.

lore: Q used an enormous forcefield grid in space to stop the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2364.
name: Q-Net
text: Plays between two adjacent spaceline locations. No ship may pass the Q-Net unless 2 Diplomacy aboard.

lore: "My good fortune is your good fortune."
name: Q's Fantasy Women
text: Plays on a male present (opponent's choice) until any {Q-Flash}. If he helps you solve a mission, opponent scores points. Discard event.

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: "This is the dressing for a game that we will play."
name: Q's Planet
text: Any unique personnel Owner inserts anywhere on spaceline. Each player may place up to 3 seed cards here from hand, discard pile, or {Q's Tent}. Until solved, an additional 40 points are needed for any player to win. May also be stocked in Q's Tent. (May not be nullified. Not duplicatable.)

name: Q's Tent
text: Place one atop Q's Tent side deck (up to 13 different cards) during the seed phase. Q's Tent is now open and in play. OR Stock in deck and use as follows: Once per turn, play to take a card from tent into your hand, either your choice (discard doorway) or random selection (place doorway on top of your draw deck). Must show card to opponent. Draw no cards this turn.

lore: Wearing Napoleonic uniforms and firing musket-shaped energy weapons, Q's creatures attacked William Riker and his away team. Worf gave them their colorful moniker.
name: Q's Vicious Animal Things
text: Unless 22 < STRENGTH < 55, one Away Team member is killed (random selection) and opponent re-seeds dilemma under a different unsolved planet mission.

lore: "Think fast, Commander Riker."
name: Q-Type Android
text: Opponent places dilemma on one non-[Holo] Personnel at this location, then chooses: If android, all copies of that card become human (STRENGTH -4); otherwise, becomes Q-type androids (STRENGTH +4) OR if non-[Bor], seed that personnel under an unsolved {Q's Planet}; discard dilemma. (May be nullified only by {Mortal Q} or {any William T. Riker} present.)

lore: Rendezvous with nefarious merchants at squalid camp.
name: Qualor II Rendezvous
text: Treachery + Greed OR {Amarie} Aligned personnel on planet in stasis until mission solved.

lore: "It's so unlike you, Jean-Luc, to have a sense of humor. Especially about getting stabbed through the back... So if you had to do it all over again... ?"
name: Quandary
text: "Restore" one personnel from your discard pile (there may not be a version of the same persona in play) and shuffle into crew or Away Team. Opponent then selects one personnel (random selection). If it is not "restored" personnel, discard it and lose points.

lore: A fragile intersection of countless parallel realities. An attempt to scan one using a subspace differential pulse was interrupted by a Bajoran warship - with disastrous results.
name: Quantum Fissure
text: To get past requires Astrophysics and Physics. Also, cannot get past if opponent has a ship here with two or more staffing icons that is staffed, undocked, and undamaged.

lore: Sentient dimensional beings whose young incubate in black holes. When nesting in a Romulan ship's artificial singularity engine, a frozen-time effect occurs.
name: Quantum Singularity Lifeforms
text: If a Romulan ship present, all ships and personnel here are placed in stasis. Cure with {Emergency Transporter Armbands}, {Timepod Ring} or new ENGINEER arriving.

lore: Advanced technology that can propel a ship many times faster than warp drive. Though the Voyager crew never reliably adapted the system, the Think Tank still took interest in the theory.
name: Quantum Slipstream Drive
text: Plays on your ship that has full RANGE available (for free if {U.S.S. Dauntless}). Move ship to end of another spaceline OR elsewhere on same spaceline. RANGE is used; discard event.

name: Quantum Torpedo
text: Attack: 5. Defense: 0. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Sovereign-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -15% Sensors off line: crew cannot attempt space missions.

lore: Bartender and proprietor of Quark's Bar, Grill, Gaming House and Holosuite Arcade. Longtime nuisance to Odo.
name: Quark
text: CIVILIAN Greed Treachery Smuggling Acquisition Anthropology Diplomacy X=2 or 7. Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Small Cloaking Device}

lore: Quark wedded Grilka by brek'tal ritual to head the House of Kozak (as the House of Quark) on Qo'noS. The Ferengi saved his be'nal from financial ruin.
name: Quark Son of Keldar
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Computer Skill x 2 Honor Greed Attributes all +3 if with {Grilka}.

name: Quark's Bar
requires: Bartender; Dabo Girl; Ferengi; Ferengi ship; Waiter;
text: {Morn} and Ferengi may report here. Once each turn, a bartender, a dabo girl, a waiter, {any Quark} or {any Rom} may report here for free (or download here in place of a normal card play; player draws no cards that turn). Any player who has Morn unopposed here may draw an additional card at end of each turn. Any player who kills any waiters or dabo girls here in battle must discard two cards for each. Ferengi ships may report, dock, undock and repair at this Nor. {Terok Nor} OR {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

name: Quark's Isolinear Rods
text: Seeds or plays on table. You may ignore each opponent's {Computer Crash}. Also, you may nullify any or all cards preventing you from playing {Q's Tent} (discard incident after card taken from tent). Once per game, you may download to hand {Intermix Ratio}, {The Big Picture} or a non-OFFICER who has Computer Skill x2 (discard incident). Does not count down while you have {any Quark} in play.

lore: Briefly captained by Quark. Faster than a Romulan interceptor. A belated delivery from its former captain, Gaila, who had owed Quark a ship for some time.
name: Quark's Treasure

lore: Negate Vulcan underground operation here.
name: Quash Conspiracy
text: Tal Shiar + INTEGRITY<21 No ship-to-ship beaming at this location.

lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Assimilate human homeworld by direct attack, Earth date 2373. Borg Queen commands.
name: Queen's Borg Cube
text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 at {Earth}. Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

lore: Identification: BORG SPHERE Task: Contingency for Borg Cube - Bombard Earth in the past; stop first contact. Borg Queen commands.
name: Queen's Borg Sphere
text: May be reported aboard, carried aboard and launched from any of your Borg cubes. DL/ {Temporal Vortex}

lore: Search ancient vault for the Sword of Kahless and other artifacts plundered centuries ago.
name: Quest for the Sword
text: Archaeology + SCIENCE + {any tricorder} + STRENGTH>32 + (Honor OR Treachery)

lore: Member of the Q who felt immortal life had become futile, meaningless, and unendurable. Lobbied to be made mortal so he could commit suicide and upset the Continuum's status quo.
name: Quinn
text: Thrice per game, nullifies an interrupt or event just played or revealed (even {a Treaty}), unless immune to {Kevin Uxbridge} or {Amanda Rogers}.

lore: Captain of U.S.S. Enterprise-C when it entered a temporal rift during the Battle of Narendra III in 2344. Ordered a return to the historic battle from 2366.
name: Rachel Garrett
text: OFFICER Honor ENGINEER Leadership Diplomacy Astrophysics

lore: Barges containing dangerous waste can be adrift for centuries. One such barge threatened Gamelon V in 2367.
name: Radioactive Garbage Scow
text: Place on mission; mission attempt ends. Mission can't be attempted here. Ship with Tractor Beam and 2 ENGINEER can tow Scow.

lore: The Malon civilization produces over six billion isotons of industrial by-product every day. Their freighters haul away the toxic waste and dispose of it in other regions of the galaxy.
name: Radioactive Garbage Scow (Voyager)
text: Place on mission; mission attempt ends. Mission can't be attempted here. Ship with Tractor Beam and 2 ENGINEER can tow Scow.

lore: Ensign Rager is an experienced conn officer. Served on the U.S.S. Enterprise from 2367 to 2369. Piloted the ship inside a Dyson Sphere found near Norpin V.
name: Rager
text: OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography Youth Scores 5 points if helps solve {Explore Dyson Sphere}.

lore: Farian crime lord and thief. Oversees a significant Orion Syndicate operation based on Farius Prime. When he tells you to do something, you just do it.
name: Raimus
text: ENGINEER Acquisition Leadership Treachery x 2 Orion Syndicate

lore: Weekly poker game aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise honed the tactical and bluffing skills of many officers.
name: Raise the Stakes
text: Your opponent must forfeit the game OR agree the eventual winner may randomly select and keep one card from loser's 60-card deck. (Cumulative.)

lore: Passing through a molecular reversion field in a shuttle, Guinan, Ro Laren, Keiko O'Brien and Jean-Luc Picard reverted to children's bodies but retained adult knowledge.
name: Rascals
text: All unique crew members (maximum of 4, random selection) are kids. STRENGTH=2 and Youth replaces first-listed skill. Cure with 2 MEDICAL and Biology.

lore: Starfleet officer who served on the U.S.S. Rutledge in the Federation/Cardassian war. Captured at Setlik III in 2347 and subsequently killed while in captivity.
name: Raymond Boone
text: ENGINEER Attributes all +2 if with {Miles O'Brien} or {Benjamin Maxwell}. Computer Skill Physics

lore: First maje of the Kazon-Ogla. Personally oversees the training of new Ogla warriors. Intimately familiar with the base on Tarok. Commands a Kazon Warship.
name: Razik
text: OFFICER Treachery Leadership Anthropology Geology SECURITY

lore: Ex-resistance fighter pilot. Down on his luck. Deals in scrap metal. Sometime smuggler. Enjoys listening to classical Bajoran music such as Varani.
name: Razka Karn
text: ENGINEER Navigation x 2 Smuggling Music Resistance

lore: In 2369, thrusters and subspace field technology were used to relocate Deep Space 9 near the Bajoran Wormhole. This move guarded Bajor's claim to the Celestial Temple.
name: Reaction Control Thrusters
text: Plays for free to move your space facility, if your 2 ENGINEER aboard, to an adjacent location in same region OR plays to add 2 to each of your ships' RANGE this turn. Discard event.

name: Reactor Overload
text: Seeds or plays on table. If any player has "processed ore" to draw two cards per turn at any one {Ore Processing Unit}, destroys that site. OR Seeds or plays on table. Place on your ship or facility. EM surge disables each android aboard until Cybernetics present; erases all [Holo] cards aboard; kills each Borg aboard (unless [Com] drone in hive); and kills all {Rogue Borg} aboard. Return incident to your hand after either use.

name: Ready Room Door
text: Once per turn, plays to download to one of your ships its matching commander (draw no cards this turn) OR to download one Captain's Order. After any use, discard doorway; place it atop your draw deck; or place it atop one of your Captain's Order events to protect that event from nullification.

name: Ready Room Door (Voyager)
text: Once per turn, plays to download to one of your ships its matching commander (draw no cards this turn) OR to download one Captain's Order. After any use, discard doorway; place it atop your draw deck; or place it atop one of your Captain's Order events to protect that event from nullification.

name: Reassimilate Lost Drone
text: Seeds or plays on table. Target an opponent's non-[Bor] Borg. If you have {Borg Queen} in play, you may probe: [Def]: Coercion. If your Borg ship is at same location, target is abducted and relocated to that ship. [Com]: Collaboration. If abducted target is present with Borg Queen, place on target (assimilated); worth 5 points per [*] while objective on target (10 points per [*] if target is {One}).

lore: Belligerent rebels from war-torn worlds often hide out on other planets and can endanger an Away Team.
name: Rebel Encounter
text: Kills one Away Team member (random selection) unless STRENGTH>44 OR you bribe rebels first by discarding an Equipment card, if present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Wysanti twins living under Seven of Nine's guidance. Freed from the Borg in 2376. Can still use their neural interfaces to share information - and cheat at Kadis-Kot.
name: Rebi and Azan
text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Rebi: Youth Exobiology Computer Skill Azan: Youth SCIENCE Transporter Skill

lore: Wysanti twins living under Seven of Nine's guidance. Freed from the Borg in 2376. Can still use their neural interfaces to share information - and cheat at Kadis-Kot.
name: Rebi and Azan*
text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Rebi: Youth Exobiology Computer Skill Azan: Youth SCIENCE Transporter Skill

lore: Ves Alkar, a Lumerian, used these mysterious objects in a ritual that would turn another person into a "receptacle" for all negative thoughts, causing rapid aging and death.
name: Receptacle Stones
text: Place in hand until played as an Event on crew of an opponent's ship. Any space dilemmas you encounter this turn also apply to that ship and crew. Discard event.

lore: Cardassians sabotaged much of Terok Nor during their evacuation. The new Federation and Bajoran occupants salvaged and repaired what they could.
name: Reclamation
text: Plays to take into hand from your discard pile up to two Equipment or Site cards OR one previously earned "use as Equipment card" artifact (for re-use).

lore: Quark hired mercenaries in 2369 to help Rao Vantika steal a deuridium shipment. Individuals of questionable character are easily found for this kind of illegal operation.
name: Recruit Mercenaries
text: Downloads [Non] and/or [Fer] Treachery personnel with up to 7 total [*] icons to where you have Treachery present. "Pay" them (lose points).

lore: The state of maximum crew and systems readiness aboard starships.
name: Red Alert!
text: Plays on table. In place of your normal card play, you may report for duty any number of Ship, Personnel, and Equipment cards.

name: Reflection Therapy
text: Plays on a personnel (except {Suna}) if your Treachery > Honor present. Replace one regular skill with one level of another regular skill (discard if skill lost). Any player may nullify with 3 Empathy present. OR Plays on an opponent's personnel affected by {Frame of Mind}; personnel is captured. Discard objective if rescued or (on a later turn) to download {Brainwash} or {Interrogation} to this captive.

lore: Prevent Skrreean refugee vessel from landing on Bajor.
name: Refuse Immigration
text: Vedek + Leadership + Diplomacy + CUNNING>28 OR Leadership x2 + INTEGRITY<30 + WEAPONS>10

lore: Massive flagship of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Commanded by Regent Worf. Has a stolen cloaking device installed - and sabotaged - by Rom.
name: Regency 1
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Stolen Cloaking Device}

lore: The Borg use neural energy to collectively repair damaged biological and technological components. The Queen often serves as the focal point.
name: Regenerate
text: Plays to fully repair and "stop" any {Borg Ship} dilemma or Borg ship (nullifying any cards reducing its attributes) OR to shuffle your discard pile into draw deck. Discard event.

lore: Commander in chief of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance, General Worf rules with an iron fist - often literally.
name: Regent Worf
text: V.I.P. OFFICER Treachery Leadership Navigation On a [KCA] ship, may select any matching [KCA] personnel aboard as its matching commander. DL/ {Make It So}

lore: Fictional character inspired by the Sherlock Holmes stories. Romantically involved with Professor Moriarty.
name: Regina Barthalomew
text: V.I.P. If with {Professor Moriarty}, copies of your unique personnel under {Holoprogram: 221B Baker Street} may report for free (twice each turn).

lore: Lieutenant Reginald Barclay is a talented but socially shy systems diagnostic engineer. Former victim of holodiction. Has phobia of traveling by transporter.
name: Reginald Barclay
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill

lore: Dedicated member of the Pathfinder Project. Established a means for Voyager to regularly communicate with Earth from tens of thousands of light-years away.
name: Reginald Barclay (The Borg)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Astrophysics Honor Delta Quadrant [FED] missions you solve are +5 points.

lore: Lieutenant Reginald Barclay helped repair the Phoenix in time for its historic flight. Member of Alpha Team. Hypochondriac. Hero worshiper.
name: Reginald Barclay (First Contact)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill DL/ {Plexing} Doubles {Visit Cochrane Memorial} where present.

lore: "We are Pakleds. We have an engineer. He is Reginod."
name: Reginod
text: ENGINEER Greed Geology Physics DL/ {Plasmadyne Relay} Once per game, may steal one hand weapon present.

lore: Use protomatter to re-initiate fusion process of this dead stellar core.
name: Reignite Dead Star
text: SCIENCE x2 + ENGINEER + Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography OR {Gideon Seyetik}

lore: Collect radiogenic particles from the rings of this gas giant to fully restore warp efficiency.
name: Reinitialize Warp Reaction
text: Astrophysics + Physics + (SCIENCE OR ENGINEER) Restores solving ship's RANGE used this turn.

lore: Seized and commanded the U.S.S. Prometheus. Planned to deliver it to the Tal Shiar. Didn't anticipate the resourcefulness of two Starfleet holograms.
name: Rekar
text: OFFICER SECURITY Treachery Exobiology Leadership Geology DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

characteristicsKeywords: Capturing-related card; Cardassian ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: In response to tensions along the Cardassian/Federation border, this ship was sent to attend diplomatic talks with the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Reklar
text: WEAPONS +2 and SHIELDS +1 while you have a captive. Tractor Beam

name: Release This Pain
text: "Share your pain with me ..." Plays once each turn for free on a personnel present with your {Sybok}. "... and gain strength from the sharing." Personnel loses all Treachery, is under your control, is considered to have "Sybok" in lore, and may work with your Sybok and your personnel with "Sybok" in lore.

name: Relics of the Chase
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per battle, your Hirogen may capture an opposing personnel he just stunned. Also, once each turn, your Hirogen using a {Hirogen Talon} may place in point area one opponent's personnel he just killed in personnel battle (or, if he is an Alpha-Hirogen, one captive he is escorting); score points equal to that personnel's highest printed attribute.

lore: Alleviate planet of Ice Age conditions following type-C asteroid impact.
name: Relief Mission
text: Geology OR Physics

lore: Alleviate Ice Age conditions.
name: Relief Mission II
text: Geology OR Physics WORMHOLE: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

lore: Alleviate Ice Age conditions.
name: Relief Mission II (back)
text: Geology OR Physics If you have a staffed ship here, you may play {Long-Range Scan} here to "detect Wormhole" (flip mission over).

lore: Relocate settlers before moon becomes uninhabitable due to core tapping project.
name: Relocate Settlers
text: V.I.P. + Diplomacy + SECURITY x2 OR SECURITY x2 + Treachery OR {Kira Nerys}

lore: A crew can go insane from lack of REM (rapid eye movement) sleep.
name: REM Fatigue Hallucinations
text: Personnel who encountered dilemma die when countdown expires unless cured by 3 MEDICAL OR boarding your outpost.

lore: Jem'Hadar Third who was marooned with Keevan on a deserted planet. Took charge of his men after the First and Second were lost during the incident.
name: Remata'Klan
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Honor Physics DL/ {No Way Out}

lore: Miles O'Brien's fascination with the famous 1836 battle led him to create this massive scale model. Kira and Worf teased him about his toy. Molly noted she let him play with her toys.
name: Remember the Alamo
text: Randomly kills an opposing personnel in a personnel battle you just lost (limit once per battle). OR Once per game, plays on a planet to randomly kill a SECURITY personnel.

lore: With Borg intruders overrunning every defensive checkpoint, Jean-Luc Picard struggled with modifications to make resources more effective.
name: Remodulation
text: Nullifies {Adapt: Modulate Shields}. OR "Remodulates" your hand. Discard one or two cards and draw an equal number from the bottom of your draw deck.

lore: Recently constructed space facility designed to support Dominion expansion into other quadrants.
name: Remote Supply Depot
text: Build where you have a Dominion ENGINEER. Your equipment may report aboard, for free, regardless of quadrant. Resets countdowns of {Ketracel-White} aboard. Does not repair ships.

lore: During the Bajoran Gratitude Festival, participants inscribe their troubles on small scrolls. Burning the renewal scrolls in a special brazier symbolically turns their problems to ash.
name: Renewal Scroll
text: Plays if you have three or more Bajorans in play. "Burn" (discard from hand) any number of cards and "renew" (draw) an equal amount, plus two more. Discard event.

lore: Revive excavation and seek rumored clues to Iconian artifacts.
name: Reopen Dig
text: Archaeology + OFFICER x2

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Recharge power cells of a monument built to commemorate a Nakan massacre.
name: Repair Memorial
text: ENGINEER + Computer Skill + Honor x2 Personnel here are each attributes all -2.

lore: Investigate malfunction of subspace radio telescope.
name: Repair Mission
text: ENGINEER x3 + Computer Skill

lore: Stabilize and make use of high-speed propulsion device built by alien explorer.
name: Repair Null Space Catapult
text: ENGINEER + Physics + (Diplomacy OR Treachery) May relocate solving ship to any spaceline location.

lore: Nucleonic radiation from the explosion of a stolen - and incorrectly installed - food replicator mutated the cells of a Kazon-Nistrim crew, fusing them with inorganic matter.
name: Replicator Accident
text: Ship is damaged and entire crew is killed unless ENGINEER, Physics, and CUNNING>30 present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Probe reports of mysterious Ferengi activity in this sector.
name: Reported Activity
text: Navigation + Honor x2 OR Navigation + ENGINEER x2

lore: Away Teams led by Security Chiefs like Tasha Yar have at times been sent to rescue captured personnel, as on this occasion at Mordan IV in 2364.
name: Rescue Captives
