text: All your personnel currently held captive are returned to your outpost(s), nullifying {Interrogation}, {Brainwash} and {Torture}, if any or all are in progress.

lore: Negotiate with Federation survey team to recover injured Founder from shipwreck.
name: Rescue Founder
text: Diplomacy x2 + MEDICAL + Strength>45 + Cunning>35

name: Rescue Personnel
text: Plays on your ship docked at a facility in the Alpha Quadrant. Target your Away Team on a planet which is either in a different quadrant or at a time location. If ship travels there, beams up Away Team and returns to facility, draw one card per personnel "rescued" (up to 5) and score points (discard objective). Limit one such "rescue" per location. (Unique.)

lore: Free Bajoran prisoners held secretly at Hutet labor camp.
name: Rescue Prisoners
text: STRENGTH>40 + (Transporter Skill OR landed ship) May seed [Univ] [Baj] personnel under here.

lore: Conduct genetic research on lethal virus that destroys Vidiian cellular structures.
name: Research Phage
text: Vidiian + MEDICAL x2 + Exobiology x2 + SCIENCE + Physics OR Think Tank personnel

name: Resistance Is Futile
text: Plays on your completed {Establish Gateway}, {Assimilate Planet}, or {Salvage Starship} objective. Increases objective's points by 10 while your [Def] Borg at that location. OR Plays on opponent's {Q's Planet}. The 40 additional points it requires are irrelevant to your Borg while your [Com] Borg is at that location. OR Seeds or plays on table. Your [Nav] Borg may report directly to your {Borg sphere}s.

lore: Q once saved Captain Jean-Luc Picard's life following an injury from a compressed teryon beam.
name: Res-Q
text: Regenerates a card. Exchange this event for any one card from your discard pile.

lore: Artifact from Kataan, a now-dead planet. 1,000 years after Kataan's demise, a space probe gave Jean-Luc Picard this flute and a lifetime of memories in less than an hour.
name: Ressikan Flute
text: Immediately score points; X=the number of different Music personnel present (limit 5). Then, play on table; points may be nullified by {The Devil}. (Not duplicatable.)

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Search for fuel and food sources on this world with an inhospitable atmosphere.
name: Restock Supplies
text: Geology + Anthropology + (Biology OR cook) Transporter Skill required to beam up/down here.

lore: Restore moon knocked off orbit by passage of nearby black hole.
name: Restore Errant Moon
text: ENGINEER + Astrophysics + Leadership

lore: Attempt to restore civilians killed by metreon cascade weapon on the Talaxian moon of Rinax.
name: Restore Victims
text: SCIENCE x2 + Physics x3 + Transporter Skill x2 Talaxians may report on planet (for free).

lore: Even a Borg cube ship can lose contact with the collective consciousness and begin marauding through space. Proper protocol re-establishment reintegrates it into the collective.
name: Retask
text: Downloads [Univ] {Borg Cube} and seven drones ([Bor], [Bor], [Bor], [Com], [Nav], [Nav], [Def]) to replace any {Borg Ship} dilemma in play. Discard event and dilemma. Draw no cards this turn.

lore: Flaxian. Posed as a perfume salesman. In reality an assassin who mixes his "fragrances" to create deadly toxins. Hired to kill Garak in 2371.
name: Retaya
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Biology Treachery Physics

lore: Kazon-Nistrim serving under Culluh. Accompanied him at Sobras conference. Received files from Jonas on Tom Paris' experimental transwarp flight.
name: Rettick
text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Computer Skill Physics Treachery

lore: Communicate with electromagnetic life-form on ship and return it to its native environment.
name: Return Life-form
text: Computer Skill x2 + Astrophysics + Exobiology + Diplomacy OR {Kathryn Janeway}

lore: Transport famous officers to a reunion
name: Reunion
text: Miracle Worker OR Cantankerousness OR {Spock} X = 15 points if one present, 40 if all three.

name: Revenge Is a Dish Best Served Cold
text: Seeds on table during facility phase; you may download {U.S.S. Reliant}. Once each turn, your {Khan} (or any personnel with his name in lore) may report for free aboard U.S.S. Reliant; at end of every turn, you must discard all other personnel you have in play. At start of each of your turns, if your Khan and {The Genesis Device} are aboard your U.S.S. Reliant, score 30 points (only 15 if opponent has {any Kirk} in play).

lore: One might meet an unfortunate end if the timeline were to be altered.
name: Revisionist History
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn (thrice per game), you may discard a card from hand to search your discard pile for an [AU] Event and take it into hand.

lore: Awaken people trapped in cryonic hibernation on this planet recovering from a glacial freeze.
name: Revive Settlers
text: Computer Skill + Diplomacy + CUNNING>35 + ([Holo] personnel OR discard one unique personnel)

lore: Surreal door created by unknown aliens, found on Theta 116 VIII. Open to entry but seemingly closed to exit.
name: Revolving Door
text: Plays on any [Doorway] or {Iconian Gateway}; it is closed while this card is face up. At start of any player's turn, that player may discard a non-personnel card from hand to "revolve" (flip) this card. (Unique.) OR Nullifies Revolving Door.

lore: "Still chasing your own tail?"
name: Rhetorical Question
text: If crew or Away Team completes mission on this attempt, discard dilemma. Otherwise, opponent may place dilemma on any one of your non-Borg ships in play (at this location if possible). While dilemma in play, you may not re-attempt this mission and ship must do nothing but return to one of your facilities; then discard dilemma. (Immune to {Q2}.)

lore: Lieutenant and helm officer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-C. In 2366, served as liaison with U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Romantically involved with Tasha Yar.
name: Richard Castillo
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation

lore: Professor Richard Galen was a mentor to Captain Jean-Luc Picard. Greatest archaeologist of the 24th century. Discoverer of the DNA program.
name: Richard Galen
text: SCIENCE Archaeology x 2 Biology Exobiology

name: Riker Maneuver
text: Attack: 4. Defense: -1. Requires a ship at a nebula firing; ATTACK bonus +3 if {William T. Riker} aboard. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip], and another opposing ship present (your choice) is also hit = [Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Plasma containment rupture: opponent may immediately download {Plasma Fire} to this ship.

lore: In 2370, the human William T. Riker accompanied Ro Laren on a clandestine mission to investigate the Maquis. He posed as a Bajoran freedom fighter.
name: Riker Wil
text: SECURITY Navigation Treachery Diplomacy Music While at your [FED] mission, adds [BAJ].

lore: Human science officer of U.S.S. Roosevelt. Assimilated as a Borg at Wolf 359. Freed a year later when her ship was damaged. Romantically involved with Chakotay.
name: Riley Frazier
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Astrophysics Geology Your other Borg present are each CUNNING +2.

lore: Human science officer of U.S.S. Roosevelt. Assimilated as a Borg at Wolf 359. Freed a year later when her ship was damaged. Romantically involved with Chakotay.
name: Riley Frazier*
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Astrophysics Geology Your other Borg present are each CUNNING +2.

lore: Oafish crewman serving Regent Worf. Keeper of the key to Security Chief Garak's restraining collar. Accused the Cardassian of stealing it. Found it in his own boot.
name: Rinox
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Archaeology Treachery DL/ {Prisoner Escort}

lore: Have a good, relaxing holiday on the pleasure planet.
name: Risa Shore Leave
text: Music + Youth + CIVILIAN x2 + Female + Male

lore: In his grief, the Douwd Kevin Uxbridge re-created his dead wife, Rishon. As if she were real, he responded to her stubborn tendency to keep him calm at tense moments.
name: Rishon Uxbridge
text: Plays atop one Event card in play; it is immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.

lore: "Remember that bug bite? ... The galaxy can be a dangerous place when you're on your own."
name: Risky Business
text: If only one personnel in crew or Away Team, that personnel dies (erased if [Holo]); seed dilemma beneath mission to be encountered again. Otherwise, if you have any one-person crews or Away Teams anywhere in play, choose one of them to die OR lose points. (Dilemma does not affect Borg.)

name: Rituals of the Hunt
text: Plays on your prey (any opponent's personnel); you may return incident to hand at any time. (Unique.) Know your prey. Your Hirogen who have Anthropology add prey's printed regular skills. Stalk your prey. Your equipment and [Hir] personnel may report aboard your [Hir] ships. Capture your prey. If present with prey, your Hirogen using {Hirogen Talon} may capture them (discard incident).

lore: Famed deaf mute mediator from Ramatis III. Spoke with a chorus of three telepaths.
name: Riva
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2

lore: Ensign Ro Laren is a Bajoran female. Protege of Captain Jean-Luc Picard. Sympathetic to the Maquis. A bit of a renegade.
name: Ro Laren
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Navigation Treachery

lore: Former Starfleet officer. Defected to the Maquis in 2370. Used a low-intensity particle beam to expose a Federation attack force hiding in a nebula.
name: Ro Laren (Blaze of Glory)
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Navigation Astrophysics Your other [Maq] personnel here are each CUNNING +2.

lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Hood and former commanding officer of William T. Riker. Years ago, he and Jean-Luc Picard served together as lieutenants on the same ship.
name: Robert DeSoto
text: OFFICER If on {U.S.S. Hood}, your compatible V.I.P.s may report aboard. Leadership Honor Exobiology

lore: Ensign transporter specialist. Romantically involved with Wesley Crusher, Lefler's Laws include "You gotta go with what works" and "Life isn't always fair."
name: Robin Lefler
text: ENGINEER Where present, nullifies {Ktarian Game} and {Wesley Crusher} is CUNNING +2. Youth Transporter Skill

lore: Led Romulan delegation to DS9 to receive Starfleet's intelligence dossier on the Dominion. Had secret orders to destroy the station and nearby wormhole.
name: Ruwon
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Anthropology Treachery SECURITY

lore: Vulcan cadet mentored by Spock. Steeped in rules and regulations, she prefers to do things "by the book." Was determined to learn how Kirk beat the Kobayashi Maru.
name: Saavik
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Navigation Stellar Cartography Mindmeld DL/ {Any [Ref] card} OR {Kobayashi Maru Scenario}

lore: Kathryn Janeway convinced several Kazon majes to hold a peace conference with the Trabe leader Mabus. He in turn betrayed her trust and attempted to massacre the Kazon leadership.
name: Sabotaged Negotiations
text: To get past, four personnel present (random selection) "attend a conference." If their total INTEGRITY<24, each one without Treachery x2 is killed.

lore: Vulcan male assistant of Sarek. Attempted to use his telepathic skills to repress Sarek's Bendii Syndrome during the crucial Legaran Conference of 2366.
name: Sakkath
text: V.I.P. Mindmeld Diplomacy Youth Suspends {Bendii Syndrome} where present.

lore: Female Vulcan. Gunrunner. Bought weapons from Quark in 2370. Helped the Maquis abduct Gul Dukat, but failed to establish a forced mindmeld with him.
name: Sakonna
text: ENGINEER Treachery Mindmeld Physics Acquisition

lore: Allasomorph leader of Daled IV. Shape-shifter. Parents killed in civil war. Raised by Anya on Klavdia III. Expected to unite her people. Likes Wesley Crusher.
name: Salia
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology Youth Exobiology

lore: Benjamin Sisko constructed a clock while being affected by the energy matrix of Saltah'na telepathic spheres. The spheres were storing the energy of an ancient power struggle.
name: Saltah'na Clock
text: Place on ship or facility here (opponent's choice). Personnel aboard must initiate battle whenever possible (no leader is required and affiliation attack restrictions do not apply).

affiliation: Any crew may attempt mission. Your {Salvage Starship} objective may target this location.
lore: Survey wreckage for recyclable ship systems and other items of value.
name: Salvage Operation
text: ENGINEER OR Archaeology OR Greed X=20 if one skill present, 30 if two, 40 if all three. Opponent's side: Any crew

name: Salvage Starship
text: Seeds or plays on table. Target a space mission with a point box where an opponent's ship was destroyed (or {Wolf 359}), if no [BO] objective on it. Your Borg may scout that location. If you have Borg there, you may probe: [Nav], [Def]: Place on mission. May search opponent's discard pile for one ship to place underneath objective. Add its special equipment to all of your ships.

lore: Separated from her husband Greskrendtregk by the Caretaker's actions. Their child, Naomi Wildman, has been raised on U.S.S. Voyager. Head of xenobiology.
name: Samantha Wildman
text: SCIENCE Exobiology x 2 Computer Skill DL/ {Naomi Wildman} Anthropology DL/ Any SCIENCE-related Equipment card

lore: Respond to distress call from Pakled ship.
name: Samaritan Snare
text: ENGINEER + Discard one Equipment card Federation must attempt mission if present.

lore: Crotchety 19th Century author popularly known as Mark Twain. Visited the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2369 during the Devidian time travel incident.
name: Samuel Clemens
text: CIVILIAN Once per game, may leave play when {Devidian Door} is "shown" and score points. Diplomacy

lore: This 19th century watch was discovered in a cave along with Data's head in 2369. After returning to the past, Clemens left the watch again to maintain the timeline.
name: Samuel Clemens' Pocketwatch
text: Place in hand until played as an Interrupt card. One action that must happen on your next turn (such as your card draw), happens now instead.

lore: Illustrious Vulcan Federation ambassador. Over 200 years old. Married at least three times: to a Vulcan princess, to Amanda, and to Perrin. Father of Spock.
name: Sarek
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 3 Mindmeld

lore: Adjutant to First Minister Shakaar. Referred to by the First Minister as his entire "senior staff." Used to tend the gardens outside the Chamber of Ministers.
name: Sarish Rez
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Transporter Skill Biology DL/ {First Minister Shakaar} OR {Senior Staff Meeting}

lore: Alien child from Drema IV. Her radio pleas for help were answered by Lt. Commander Data in violation of the Prime Directive.
name: Sarjenka
text: Primitive alien begs for help. Ignore her (discard dilemma) OR help her and earn points, but all Away Teams here are "stopped."

lore: Plunder rich ruins at this famous archaeological site.
name: Sarthong Plunder
text: Archaeology x2 + STRENGTH>40

lore: Robotic minion of Chaotica. Warns of invaders and deals with intruders. Nearly conquered the world in the final chapter of one of The Adventures of Captain Proton.
name: Satan's Robot
text: Participates in battle like a personnel; has NO STRENGTH vs. a Borg or android adversary, otherwise STRENGTH=8. May capture any female or [Holo] adversary it stuns. (Unique.)

lore: Captain Satelk is the Vulcan Starfleet officer who presided over the inquiry into Cadet Joshua Albert's death at the Academy Flight Range in 2368.
name: Satelk
text: OFFICER Leadership Mindmeld Diplomacy

lore: Sensor instruments can detect life signs and molecular signatures at a distance with accuracy.
name: Scan
text: Plays at the start of your turn. Stop a staffed ship with at least three staffing icons and Computer Skill aboard at a [S] mission to examine the bottom seed card there.

lore: To protect the integrity of the timeline in 2267, Miles O'Brien monitored starship Enterprise scan cycles to identify when the U.S.S. Defiant could decloak without being detected.
name: Scan Cycle Check
text: Plays on your Transporter Skill. Your ships there decloak/dephase while that personnel operates transporters, then recloak/rephase. OR Nullifies {Scan} or {Full Planet Scan}.

name: Scanner Interference
text: Seeds or plays on table. Nullifies each {Scan} and {Full Planet Scan} unless owner has 2 Computer Skill aboard a staffed ship at targeted mission. Just after opponent scans mission (after seed cards are replaced) you may discard incident to seed one card there from hand, discard pile or {Q's Tent}. At any time you may discard incident to download {Atmospheric Ionization}, {Distortion Field} and/or {Particle Scattering Field}.

lore: Traditional cane of the Grand Nagus of the Ferengi Alliance. Symbol of his power and authority. The gnarled hardwood shaft is crowned by a nagus head made of gold-pressed latinum.
name: Scepter of the Grand Nagus
text: Your Nagus present may allow one [Rule] card to play for free each turn, prevent opponent from nullifying [Rule] cards here and stun one adversary he just engaged in battle. (Unique.)

lore: Representative of specialized scientific analytical apparatus. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Science Kit
text: Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the extra skill of SCIENCE where present.

name: Science Lab
text: Compatible SCIENCE-classification personnel, SCIENCE-related Equipment cards, {I.P. Scanner} and {PADD}s may report here. Once each turn, if station at a [S] mission and player who controls station has a SCIENCE personnel unopposed here, that player may scan bottom seed card under the mission. Matching SCIENCE personnel may {file mission report}s here. Any Nor: Docking Ring

lore: Representative of Personal Access Display Devices designed specifically for scientific analysis functions. Such equipment has been deployed by many races.
name: Science PADD
text: Gives all of your MEDICAL-classification personnel the extra skill of SCIENCE where present.

lore: Standard Personal Access Display Device pre-loaded with an extensive database of scientific information in a broad sampling of disciplines.
name: Science PADD (Voyager)
text: Gives all of your MEDICAL-classification personnel the extra skill of SCIENCE where present.

lore: Beverly Crusher scanned Jo'Bril's body for tetryon traces during her 2369 "murder" investigation. Her scientific approach eventually revealed that Jo'bril had faked his own death.
name: Scientific Method
text: To get past requires MEDICAL and 3 SCIENCE.

lore: Plasma gas from the ruptured coolant tank liquified all the organic skin grafted onto Data's endoskeletal structure.
name: Scorched Hand
text: Plays to cause each player who has more than 12 cards in hand to shuffle all but 6 (random selection) and place beneath draw deck. (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.)

lore: "Crusher gets more shrill with each passing year."
name: Scottish Setter
text: If no ANIMAL present, play on one personnel present (random selection) until any Q-Flash. That personnel's classification changes to ANIMAL. May be nullified by {Amanda Rogers}.

lore: Many species send specially designed scout ships into unexplored sectors of space. If the species is aggressive, the arrival of a scout ship is a harbinger of trouble.
name: Scout Encounter
text: Opponent may download to this location one scout ship with one or two [Univ] crew members. That ship may (if possible) initiate battle against you or move away.

lore: Use an anti-tachyon pulse to implode this artificially-created temporal phenomenon.
name: Seal Rift
text: SCIENCE x2 + ENGINEER x2 OR {Admiral Janeway} Until solved, [AU] ships may report here.

lore: Search for officer kidnapped from Deep Space 9 by Maquis.
name: Search and Rescue
text: Navigation x2 + Honor + OFFICER + CUNNING>35

lore: Locate secret base of escaped slaves.
name: Search for Rebels
text: SECURITY + CUNNING>30 + 2 [KCA] leaders OR {Professor Sisko} When seeded, you may download one {Emblem} card. Opponent's side: No gametext.

lore: Investigate possible crash location of Cardassian prisoner transport Ravinok.
name: Search for Survivors
text: OFFICER x2 + Computer Skill x2 + STRENGTH>30 May seed [Univ] [Car] and [Univ] [Baj] personnel under here.

lore: The place that started it all. Changed the galaxy as we know it.
name: Seat of Starfleet
text: Seeds or plays on {2154 Earth}. Once per turn, one [Sta] personnel may report for free here. (Not duplicatable.) DL/ {UFP: One Small Step}

lore: Immature drone of Brunali species; irrelevant designation: Icheb. A model of efficiency, yet failed to establish order among the young drones of his hive.
name: Second
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Youth Stellar Cartography DL/ {Divert Power} Doubles regular skills of other drones present.

lore: Bashir... Julian Bashir. Role in a holoprogram created by his friend Felix, of a spy for Great Britain in the Cold War of 20th-century Earth. Has escaped countless traps.
name: Secret Agent Julian Bashir
text: OFFICER Geology MEDICAL Biology DL/ {'45 Dom Perignon} Your personnel may not be captured where present.

name: Secret Compartment
text: Plays on a ship or facility. (Unique.) If it is controlled by opponent and your Acquisition is present, you may probe: [Interrupt], [Doorway]: Alarm. Opponent may capture one of your personnel present (random selection); discard doorway. [Event], [Equipment]: Success. Download to here up to two Equipment cards or one "use as Equipment card" artifact (as if earned from a mission attempt); discard doorway.

lore: Attempt retrieval of floating Federation wreckage at Borg massacre site.
name: Secret Salvage
text: Treachery x4 OR Navigation x2 + Computer Skill

lore: Retrieve wreckage at Borg massacre site.
name: Secret Salvage II
text: Treachery x 4 OR Navigation x 2 + Computer Skill If destroyed, flip mission over.

lore: Retrieve wreckage at Borg massacre site.
name: Secret Salvage II (back)
text: Treachery x 4 OR Navigation x 2 + Computer Skill If your Klingon ENGINEER is here, in place of your normal card play you may flip mission over; draw no cards that turn.

lore: Attend joint intelligence exchange on this Cardassian world regarding Klingon military movements.
name: Security Briefing
text: SECURITY + Diplomacy x2 + V.I.P. x3 You may play {System 5 Disruptors} for free here.

lore: Although the mirror universe Elim Garak hates the Intendant, he is still able to please her now and then. Not Regent Worf's type.
name: Security Chief Garak
text: OFFICER Computer Skill SECURITY Biology Treachery x 2 DL/ Any Cardassian Equipment card

lore: The mirror universe equivalent of Lt. Sulu is chief of security and second officer aboard I.S.S. Enterprise. Desires command of both the ship and Uhura.
name: Security Chief Sulu
text: OFFICER SECURITY Biology Computer Skill Navigation Treachery DL/ {Classic Type II Phaser}

name: Security Office
text: Compatible SECURITY-classification personnel and hand weapons may report here. Whenever a personnel battle was just initiated on this station, any player's personnel here, if one has SECURITY, may move there (if possible) and join the battle. Matching SECURITY personnel may {file mission report}s here. Any Nor: Promenade

lore: Dr. Manheim's laboratory deep inside a remote planetoid used a system of forcefields and targeting laser to bar entry and protect a revolutionary experiment.
name: Security Precautions
text: To get past, Away Team must have {Jenice Manheim} OR android OR {phaser} OR {disruptor} OR 3 SECURITY.

lore: Charged with ship and mission safety, security personnel are willing to voluntarily expose themselves to hazards or threats, as Tasha Yar did on many occasions.
name: Security Sacrifice
text: One SECURITY personnel present may sacrifice (substitute) for another personnel who has been randomly selected to die.

lore: Study new spaceborne life-form reported in this system.
name: Seek Life-form
text: Exobiology + Astrophysics + ENGINEER

lore: While on a scientific mission to planet L-S VI, Dr. Mora Pol's away team experienced a volcanic disturbance. The quake released noxious gases which cut short their research.
name: Seismic Quake
text: One Away Team member (random selection) is "stopped" if opponent's score is odd, killed otherwise. Cannot get past (shuffle back into seed cards here) unless Geology present.

lore: Influenced by the Ktarian Game, the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise chased and captured the last unaffected human crew member... Wesley Crusher.
name: Seize Wesley
text: Plays on opponent's ship under influence of {Ktarian Game} dilemma. All remaining personnel are disabled. If {Wesley Crusher} aboard, he is made your captive.

lore: 1/2 Romulan, 1/2 Human female. Daughter of alternate timeline Lieutenant Natasha Yar. Powerful operative and key figure in the Romulan hegemony.
name: Sela
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Treachery Youth

lore: Used in producing reverse-ratcheting routing planers. Jake and Nog traded 5,000 wrappages of yamok sauce for 100 gross of stem bolts, which they sold for seven tessipates of Bajoran land.
name: Self-Sealing Stem Bolts
text: Once each turn, may be downloaded from draw deck to replace (discard) your other Equipment card at a homeworld (or vice versa if you have {any Jake} or {any Nog} present).

lore: Female Romulan. Piloted a warbird in the secret Tal Shiar/Obsidian Order operation to destroy Dominion homeworld in 2371. Served under Colonel Lovok.
name: Selveth
text: ENGINEER Navigation x 2 Stellar Cartography Geology

characteristicsKeywords: Romulan; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Senator;
lore: Female Romulan. Kimara Cretak was liaison to Deep Space 9 in 2375. Coordinated a fleet of warbirds attempting to deliver weapons to a Bajoran moon.
name: Senator Cretak
text: V.I.P. Honor Law SECURITY Physics Your [Rom] ships at same location are WEAPONS +2.

lore: Romulan military strategist. He studied, and grudgingly approved, Benjamin Sisko's plan for an attack on the Dominion shipyards at Chin'toka.
name: Senator Letant
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Stellar Cartography Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Attack Pattern Delta}

lore: Vice-Chairman of the Tal Shiar. Secretary of the War Plans Council. Key Romulan senator for over 14 years. Negotiated the non-aggression pact with the Dominion.
name: Senator Vreenak
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Tal Shiar x 2 Anthropology Leadership Law DL/ Any Romulan treaty

lore: Standard operating procedure on starships is to call a meeting of senior officers or department heads to help find solutions of paramount problems.
name: Senior Staff Meeting
text: Plays on ship with OFFICER, ENGINEER, MEDICAL, SCIENCE and SECURITY aboard, just before the initial attempt of a space mission. First dilemma encountered is discarded. (Captain's Order.)

lore: "Yes, I know - the Borg."
name: Sense the Borg
text: Plays if a Borg ship, Borg personnel, {Borg Ship} dilemma or {Rogue Borg} just entered play. Download to hand {Weak Spot} OR {Hugh} OR {Borg Neuroprocessor} OR {Ready Room Door}.

lore: Investigate reports of politically "sensitive" activities by an information dealer in sector.
name: Sensitive Search
text: Computer Skill + CUNNING>28

name: Service the Collective
text: Seeds or plays on table. Whenever your current objective targets either a homeworld OR your mission that has an affiliation icon matching your counterpart there, your Borg are not restricted from probing on same turn they complete scouting. Also, while a personnel you've assimilated as a counterpart is on your ship, that ship is WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against counterpart's former affiliation(s).

lore: Devious Cardassian operative. Broke her cover after becoming trapped in the Delta Quadrant aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Formed an alliance with the Kazon-Nistrim.
name: Seska
text: ENGINEER Leadership Treachery x 2 Transporter Skill SECURITY Exobiology Computer Skill

lore: Devious Cardassian operative. Broke her cover after becoming trapped in the Delta Quadrant aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Formed an alliance with the Kazon-Nistrim.
name: Seska*
text: ENGINEER Leadership Treachery x 2 Transporter Skill SECURITY Exobiology Computer Skill

lore: Abrasive Gul. Loyal to Damar, though he believes the resistance movement would do better without the interference of the former terrorist, Kira Nerys.
name: Seskal
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Anthropology

lore: Male Vulcan scientist. An expert in planetary development and ecological systems. Served on Solkar's survey vessel.
name: Sevek
text: MEDICAL Biology Geology Mindmeld

lore: Borg freed from the Collective. Slowly reclaiming her human past and individuality, guided by Kathryn Janeway, The Doctor, and the rest of the Voyager crew.
name: Seven of Nine
text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Stellar Cartography x 2 Physics Exobiology Computer Skill x 2 Music

lore: Identification: PROFICIENCY DRONE Task: Tertiary adjunct of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
name: Seven of Nine (The Borg)
text: ENGINEER Stellar Cartography Computer Skill Physics May apply [Com], [Nav], and [Def] to staffing. May draw a card in place of your normal card play.

lore: Borg freed from the Collective. Slowly reclaiming her human past and individuality, guided by Kathryn Janeway, The Doctor, and the rest of the Voyager crew.
name: Seven of Nine*
text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Stellar Cartography x 2 Physics Exobiology Computer Skill x 2 Music

lore: "Shaka, when the walls fell," means inability to understand. The incomprehensible Tamarians spoke entirely in metaphors.
name: Shaka, When the Walls Fell
text: Must have 2 Diplomacy and CUNNING>30 to communicate and proceed.

lore: Leader of Shakaar resistance cell. Farmer. Refused to return soil reclamators to provisional government in 2371. Old friend of Kira Nerys.
name: Shakaar Edon
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Resistance x 2 Leadership Geology Other Bajorans present are STRENGTH +2.

lore: From the Great Link, the Founders manipulate their expanding empire. The ability to appear as members of any species has proven invaluable to their success.
name: Shape-Shift
text: Allows your Founder in play to morph into a different Founder (exchange it with one in hand OR discard it to download one there). (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.)

lore: Prototype device developed by the Obsidian Order. Emits a quantum stasis field that prevents a changeling from altering its biomolecular structure.
name: Shape-Shift Inhibitor
text: Plays on table. Each player must first discard a personnel card in order to download a non-[Bor] personnel. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

characteristicsKeywords: Kellerun; Ambassador; Harvester Virus-related card; Male;
lore: Kellerun ambassador. Helped negotiate cease fire with the T'Lani. Worked on project to eliminate harvester virus and associated technology in 2370.
name: Sharat
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Exobiology Treachery Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Lt. Commander Shelby is an ambitious Starfleet officer. Assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise as a specialist on the Borg.
name: Shelby
text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology

lore: Sheriff of Deadwood, South Dakota, as played by Worf. Though initially reluctant to spend time with his son, the Klingon soon saw the appeal of Alexander's scenario.
name: Sheriff Worf
text: SECURITY STRENGTH +1 for each opposing SECURITY personnel present. Leadership Computer Skill Law

lore: The role of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's brilliant detective was often assumed by the Soong-type android Data.
name: Sherlock Holmes
text: CIVILIAN Biology Physics Music Computer Skill At start of your turn, you may draw cards (without downloading) until your hand is equal to opponent's.

lore: 105 years, 1 month, and 12 days ago - a Friday.
name: Sherman's Peak
text: Seeds or plays on table; download {Deep Space Station K-7} here. Any players may download {Organian Peace Treaty}. If a {Tribble Bomb} at this location is nullified by being examined, also nullifies {Hero of the Empire}. Native to this timeline: all cards with both [OS] icon and [AU] icon (except [MQ] cards).

lore: Tractor beams are focused linear graviton beams which can be used to seize or tow objects in space.
name: Ship Seizure
text: If your ship has tractor beams, tow away (discard) any empty ship in the same orbit as your own ship (except empty ships at their outpost).

lore: Lily was stunned when Jean-Luc Picard, in a rage against the Borg, destroyed the traditional Enterprise exhibit in the observation lounge. "You broke your little ships."
name: Shipwreck
text: Suspends ALL ship attribute enhancements for the rest of this turn. (May be played at start of battle.) OR Nullifies all {Wall of Ships} cards in play.

lore: Data protected his Away Team from machine gun fire by taking a few bullets from behind, then simply waiting until the magazine was empty. No vital systems were damaged.
name: Shot in the Back
text: "Stops" SECURITY androids and OFFICER androids, if any present. Otherwise, kills one non-android Away Team member (opponent's choice).

lore: Neurologist who founded the science of psychoanalysis on Earth in the late 19th century. Data looked to this re-creation for interpretations of his first nightmares.
name: Sigmund Freud
text: MEDICAL Your personnel and equipment may report where present (if [AU]). Biology DL/ {Alternate Universe Door}

lore: Twisted male Cardassian living in exile. Disfigured in a terrorist attack during the occupation of Bajor. Nurtures a great hatred for the Bajorans who injured him.
name: Silaran Prin
text: CIVILIAN Smuggling Treachery ENGINEER Exobiology Each Shakaar resistance cell member in play has <P).

lore: Famed Federation strategist. Grandmaster of the game Stratagema.
name: Sirna Kolrami
text: V.I.P. Leadership

lore: Commander of the Imperial Romulan Warbird Terix during the Pegasus incident of 2370.
name: Sirol
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation ENGINEER Treachery

lore: In anticipation of a Cardassian takeover in 2373, Benjamin Sisko sabotaged the Deep Space 9 central computer. The resulting damage hampered Terok Nor for quite some time.
name: Sisko 197 Subroutine
text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on your Nor's {Ops}. Nor may not be moved or commandeered. Any player may nullify with 4 Computer Skill present. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Lursa and B'Etor, like their father before them, collaborated with the Romulan Star Empire.
name: Sisters of Duras
text: V.I.P.+V.I.P. Lursa: Treachery Leadership Geology Greed B'Etor: Treachery Physics Youth Greed

lore: Quark was "encouraged" to help Rao Vantika commandeer a shipment of deuridium arriving at Deep Space 9.
name: Skullduggery
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed (only "stopped" if that personnel has Treachery OR Acquisition OR Greed OR Smuggling OR INTEGRITY<5). Mission continues.

lore: Stasis chambers holding homicidal Cardassians infected with a biogenic compound. Left aboard the abandoned Empok Nor and rigged to activate should anyone come aboard.
name: Sleeper Trap
text: Opponent may download to one site or planet here up to three different [Univ] Cardassians and one hand weapon. They may (if possible) initiate personnel battle. Discard dilemma.

lore: Device obtained by Quark. Illegal under Bajoran law. Quark gave it to Natima Lang so she could elude Cardassian authorities, but warned her it would only work for a short time.
name: Small Cloaking Device
text: Reports for free if your Smuggling or Acquisition present. While aboard your ship with no staffing requirements, ship has a Cloaking Device. Counts down only while engaged.

lore: Holographic technology is notoriously finicky. Before The Doctor acquired his mobile emitter, attempts to project him outside of sickbay or the holodeck invariably met with problems.
name: Small Oversight
text: Plays on a [Holo] personnel who is not wearing a {Mobile Holo-Emitter}. [Holo] and [Cmd] personnel present are each attributes all -3 and lose first-listed skill for rest of turn.

lore: Second leader of the Terran Rebellion. Miles O'Brien commanded the Defiant, which he helped construct using plans stolen from Deep Space 9.
name: Smiley
text: ENGINEER Navigation Transporter Skill Leadership Anthropology DL/ {Construct Starship} OR {Crossover}

lore: Small, hand-held device used to create a diversion in combat situations. Used by Deep Space 9 personnel during battle against occupying forces from the Circle.
name: Smoke Bomb
text: Plays at start of personnel battle; any or all of your non-Borg personnel may hide from that battle. OR Plays to "stop" one crew or Away Team where you have personnel present.

lore: Geordi once told Data that technological perfection can shave too close. That, of course, depends on the desired results.
name: Smooth As an Android's Bottom?
text: Once every turn, plays to reveal the bottom three cards of your draw deck. Take any non-personnel into hand; discard others. OR Prevents the death of any one Youth personnel.

name: Sniper
text: Seeds or plays on table. At start of each battle you initiate on a planet, if you have a {phaser} or {disruptor} present, target one personnel present. (Cumulative.) Immediately probe (then place probe card beneath draw deck): [Stf], [KW], [Equipment], [Maq]: Hit. Target(s) mortally wounded. [Objective], [Interrupt], [Doorway], [AU]: Glancing blow. Target(s) stunned. [Fed], [Fer], [Bor], [Cmd]: Sniper spotted. Discard incident.

lore: Leader of the small community of Ba'ku that settled a new world in the Briar Patch. Ardent supporter of a simple way of life, free of advanced technology.
name: Sojef
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Diplomacy Biology Archaeology

lore: Initiated Vulcan/Earth contact in 2063. The first Vulcan to wish Zefram Cochrane peace and long life.
name: Solkar
text: OFFICER Honor Archaeology Exobiology Mindmeld DL/ {Live Long and Prosper}

lore: Klingon brothers. Kurn and Worf fought together during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68 to help Gowron restore stability and honor to the Empire.
name: Sons of Mogh
text: OFFICER+SECURITY Kurn: Honor Computer Skill Navigation Worf: Honor x 2 Navigation Diplomacy

lore: Ensign Sonya Gomez is an anti-matter specialist. Snappy conversationalist. Once spilled hot chocolate on Captain Picard. Has total recall.
name: Sonya Gomez
text: ENGINEER Physics Youth Suspends {Anti-Matter Pod} where present.

characteristicsKeywords: J'Naii; Androgynous; Female; Mission Specialist; Neuter;
lore: Androgynous J'Naii. Illegally had female feelings. Once romantically involved with Commander William T. Riker. Underwent therapy for this perversity.
name: Soren
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics

lore: Technician who accompanied a Romulan delegation, led by Ruwon and Karina, to Deep Space 9 in 2369.
name: Sorus
text: ENGINEER Cybernetics Computer Skill Physics Treachery

lore: DaiMon who sought the Tox Uthat. Followed Vash to Risa, only to be deceived by the treacherous human female and facially assaulted by Jean-Luc Picard.
name: Sovak
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Archaeology Greed SCIENCE

lore: Orbital repair and building facility for starships. Such facilities have been developed by many races.
name: Spacedock
text: Plays on outpost. Instantly repairs your damaged ships if they stop here. Also repairs non-aligned ships.

name: Spacedoor
text: Seeds on your outpost during facility phase. Outpost is SHIELDS -8 (cumulative). In place of your normal card play, you may return your empty ship docked here (and all cards played on it) to owners' hands, nullifying any {Static Warp Bubble} targeting you OR download Spacedock or one compatible [Univ] ship to outpost. Flip Spacedoor over after either use.

name: Spacedoor (back)
text: You may use opponent's {Red Alert}! (only at this outpost) as if you had a copy in play. At the end of your turn, you may discard a card from hand to flip Spacedoor over. (Immune to cards that close doorways.)

name: Space-Time Portal
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [AU] cards may seed and (once per turn) play. At any time, discard doorway to download {Alternate Universe Door} (except to table) OR play {Wormhole} on a location to relocate your ship there (stopped) OR nullify {Temporal Rift} OR return one of your ships to owner's hand OR (once per game) report with crew one [AU] ship (all crew must be [AU]) to any location.

lore: A rupture in space connected U.S.S. Voyager with its duplicate created by a spatial scission. The two crews had to separate their "siamese ships" that shared a single supply of anti-matter.
name: Spatial Rift
text: Two personnel present (random selection) "disappear" (discarded) if their combined CUNNING<15. To get past requires Astrophysics and 2 ENGINEER remaining.

name: Sphere Encounter
text: Seeds or plays on table. Each of your {Borg sphere}s is RANGE +4. Also, whenever opponent initiates an attempt of one of your [S] missions that you have scouted, you may report with crew to that location any number of Borg spheres (downloading spheres, personnel and equipment as desired); each may initiate battle (regardless of your current objective) or move away.

name: Spiral-Wave Disruptor
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Cardassian ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 Human son of Sarek and Amanda Grayson. Over 140-year-old ambassador. On private mission to Romulus. Mindmelded with Picard.
name: Spock
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Computer Skill Leadership SCIENCE Mindmeld

lore: Female cat who lives aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Sometimes mistaken for a male. Finicky gourmet. Has refused over 74 different feline supplements.
name: Spot
text: ANIMAL Has 9 lives ("stopped" when killed first 8 times). * Once every turn, may "pounce" to disable until end of turn any one personnel present (and herself).

lore: Ambassador to the worthless lump of rock known as Nimbus III. Released the pain of his cynicism when Sybok enlisted his help in the search for Eden.
name: St. John Talbot
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Computer Skill Law May work with {Sybok}, {General Korrd}, and {Caithlin Dar}.

lore: They have two settings, stun and kill. It would be best not to confuse them.
name: Starfleet Phaser Pistol
text: Starfleet use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2 (or +3 if that personnel has SECURITY). (Cumulative.)

lore: Least powerful of the standard hand-held Federation defensive weapons. Low profile favored by Starfleet captains. Smaller in size than the type II phaser, and easily concealed.
name: Starfleet Type I Phaser
text: Federation use only. Reports for free. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) May report to a just-initiated personnel battle involving your [Fed] card(s).

lore: Handheld weapon can be set for stun, heat and disruption. PHASER is an acronym for PHASed Energy Rectification.
name: Starfleet Type II Phaser
text: Federation and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: Versatile Starfleet hand weapon. Has 16 different power settings ranging from stun to disruption. Beam dispersal can be configured from broad-range to extreme precision.
name: Starfleet Type II Phaser (Voyager)
text: Federation and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: More powerful than other hand-held Federation energy weapons and has longer-lasting charge. Rotatable beam modulation. Stored aboard ship in armory racks.
name: Starfleet Type III Phaser Rifle
text: Federation and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

lore: Most powerful standard-issue Starfleet hand weapon. Equipped with fully autonomous recharge, multiple target acquisition, and gyrostabilization.
name: Starfleet Type III Phaser Rifle (Voyager)
text: Federation and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

lore: Famous painting by Dutch impressionist Vincent van Gogh. Painted at Saint-R my in 1889. Dubiously owned by Kivas Fajo 477 years later. A highly prized commodity.
name: Starry Night
text: If earned at same location as {Quark's Bar}, a Trading Post or a homeworld, immediately download here (earn) up to two "use as Equipment card" artifacts. Discard Starry Night.

lore: Original U.S.S. Enterprise. Starfleet registry number NCC-1701. Responded to Deep Space Station K-7 distress call in 2267. Commanded by Captain Kirk.
name: Starship Enterprise
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any Federation [OS] personnel}

lore: Venerable Starfleet ship refit in 2270. Completed many successful missions before being transferred to Captain Spock's command and retired for use as a training vessel.
name: Starship Enterprise (The Motion Pictures)
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Crew Reassignment}

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Prototype; Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam;
lore: Unsuccessful transwarp test ship later refitted as the prototype for one of Starfleet's most durable and ubiquitous classes of ship. Commanded by Captain Sulu.
name: Starship Excelsior
text: Tractor Beam, Stellar Cartography

lore: Dr. Beverly Crusher experienced a shrinking universe, shaped by her own thoughts, inside a static warp bubble created by Ensign Wesley Crusher.
name: Static Warp Bubble
text: Plays on table. Opponent must discard one card before ending each turn. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Former Federation officer who defected to Romulus in 2349. Later, apparently had second thoughts. Joined Spock's Romulan underground in 2369.
name: Stefan DeSeve
text: CIVILIAN Romulan: Treachery, Greed Federation: OFFICER, Treachery, INTEGRITY -1

lore: Stellar flares release tremendous amounts of energy and emit radiation across the entire electromagnetic spectrum. Large flares can cause severe damage throughout a star system.
name: Stellar Flare
text: Damages and "stops" all ships at this location except those that are docked, landed, or carried OR have 2 Navigation and Astrophysics aboard OR have SHIELDS>11. Discard dilemma.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian ship; Dominion ship; Energy Dampener; Federation ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'hadar Attack Ship; Jem'Hadar Ship;
lore: Jem'Hadar attack ship briefly commanded by Luaran. Upgraded with Breen weapons technology. Stolen by members of Damar's rebellion; commanded by Kira.
name: Stolen Attack Ship
text: Energy Dampener, Invasive Transporters

lore: Regent Worf detained Zek in the mirror universe, demanding a cloaking device as ransom. To save their Nagus, Quark and Rom stole one from a Klingon ship. General Martok was not pleased.
name: Stolen Cloaking Device
text: May not report aboard a [MQ] facility. While on your ship with at least one staffing icon, ship has a Cloaking Device. On a [Fed] non-[MQ] ship, to cloak requires [Fed] Treachery aboard.

lore: Discover cause of repeated asteroid impacts on this resource-abundant planet.
name: Stop Bombardment
text: Astrophysics + ENGINEER + Geology + Leadership

name: Stop First Contact
text: Suspends your {Assimilate Homeworld} targeting {Earth}, if scouting complete. Target {Montana Missile Complex} (downloading as necessary). If you have a staffed ship orbiting that location, you may probe: [Def]: Phoenix destroyed here. Timeline disrupted in 2063. Discard objective. Suspended objective completed. May download one Objective card.

name: Storage Compartment Door
text: Place one atop Tribble side deck during the seed phase. Side deck is now open and in play. Once each turn, you may draw up to 3 cards from side deck, then play or discard each. OR Stock in deck and play (once each turn) to download from your Tribble side deck one Trouble or Tribble card, or to nullify any card that is closing another Storage Compartment Door; then discard doorway.

name: Strafing Run
text: Attack: 4. Defense: -1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Hideki-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Bridge damaged: randomly kills one OFFICER, Leadership or Navigation personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Ops}).

lore: Dukat's disguise as a Bajoran farmer and seer named Anjohl allowed him to forge an alliance with Winn Adami that was both dangerous and disgusting.
name: Strange Bedfellows
text: If a male and female present, lowest INTEGRITY male and lowest INTEGRITY female are "stopped" (discarded if their INTEGRITY numbers are the same).

name: Strategema
text: Seeds or plays on table. {Ooby Dooby} and {Rogue Borg Mercenaries} are nullified. {Q's Planet} may not enter play. Your opponent may not initiate battle or play {Outgunned} at a homeworld against your force containing a card matching that homeworld's affiliation.

lore: Aid preparations for an offensive invasion.
name: Strategic Diversion
text: Treachery x3 + STRENGTH>30

lore: If the holographic ma tre d' hadn't delayed the Borg, they would have killed Jean-Luc Picard before he could have completed his plan.
name: Strict Dress Code
text: Sacrifice one Diplomacy, one [Holo] or two [Def] personnel present (killed); otherwise, one personnel present is killed (opponent's choice). Mission continues.

lore: Bearing a striking resemblance to a bag of explosives, Odo surprised three Jem'Hadar warriors on Vandros IV.
name: Strike Three
text: Plays at start of personnel battle. Each of your shape-shifters present may stun up to three opposing non-shape-shifters (random selection) and is exposed if infiltrating.

lore: Investigate mysterious void.
name: Study "Hole in Space"
text: Leadership + Diplomacy + INTEGRITY>40

lore: Research gaseous comet trail in this system's Oort cloud for military or commercial use.
name: Study Cometary Cloud
text: Navigation + SCIENCE + Physics + Computer Skill

lore: Investigate appearance of humanoid remains on the asteroids of this planet's ring system.
name: Study Interment Site
text: SCIENCE + Astrophysics + Honor + Anthropology OR {Harry Kim}

lore: Study the behavior patterns of this colony of space-dwelling life-forms.
name: Study Interstellar Colony
text: SCIENCE + Anthropology + Exobiology Ocampa are disabled while here.

lore: Research vibrating neutron star.
name: Study Lonka Pulsar
text: Navigation + Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography

lore: Study and chart nebula.
name: Study Nebula
text: Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography + CUNNING>40

lore: Study stream of plasma flowing between binary stars.
name: Study Plasma Streamer
text: Astrophysics + Youth

lore: Monitor emerging phenomenon and record the effects of its radiation on the crew.
name: Study Protonebula
text: Astrophysics + Biology + Navigation x2 Once per game, you may download {One} to your ship here. Opponent's side: Once per game, you may download a [BO] objective.

lore: Study rare collision between two gas giants.
name: Study Stellar Collision
text: Stellar Cartography

lore: First officer serving under Commander Charvanek. Traced a communication signal that led to the discovery of Federation spies aboard his ship.
name: Subcommander Tal
text: OFFICER SECURITY Computer Skill Anthropology DL/ {Intruder Alert!} OR {Classic Disruptor}

name: Subjugate Planet
text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on a non-homeworld, non-[DOM] planet mission you seeded. You may attempt mission using these requirements: Vorta + Treachery + 4 Jem'Hadar + STRENGTH>(point value of mission x2) When you solve mission, you may download {Remote Supply Depot} (plus one {Ketracel-White}) here; discard objective.

lore: "There will be no legal trickery."
name: Subsection Q, Paragraph 10
text: Every player with more than ten cards in hand loses 1 point for each card in excess of ten. (May not be nullified.)

lore: Instabilities in subspace can cause fractures and chain reactions leading to temporal relocation, death, or worse.
name: Subspace Fracture
text: Entire crew or Away Team is killed unless ENGINEER, SCIENCE, Leadership, and CUNNING>28 present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Disruptions of subspace communications can be caused by nebulae and other phenomena.
name: Subspace Interference
text: Prevents (nullifies) reception of {Incoming Message} OR {Hail} OR {Subspace Schism}. Both cards are discarded.

lore: Solonagen-based aliens from another subspace domain accessed our space to abduct people for experiments.
name: Subspace Schism
text: Plays within five seconds of either players' card draw. That player must discard that card and re-draw.

lore: In 2370, a runabout piloted by Jadzia Dax collided with a protouniverse. The "subspace seaweed" lodged in the ship's warp nacelle until it was transferred to DS9's science lab.
name: "Subspace Seaweed"
text: Unless 3 Navigation aboard, place on ship. Reduces RANGE by 3 (cumulative). Your Transporter Skill may subsequently beam dilemma to your {Science Lab} at same location.

lore: Dangerous aftermath of a stellar, planetary, or lunar explosion. The shock wave created by the "incident" on Praxis was felt even beyond the boundaries of Klingon space.
name: Subspace Shock Wave
text: Ship is damaged and two crew members are killed (random selection) unless a Navigation personnel who has CUNNING>7 aboard. Discard dilemma.

lore: Bok beamed to and from the U.S.S. Enterprise using a subspace transporter that forced his body into a state of quantum flux. Though dangerous, such devices have greatly extended range.
name: Subspace Transporter
text: Plays on your ship. Each turn, ship may beam one of your Treachery personnel to and/or from anywhere at same or adjacent location. Nullified only by {Subspace Interference}.

lore: Dr. Serova proved in 2370 that disastrous rifts occur in the fabric of space due to the excessive use of warp drive. Discovery led to a Federation-wide speed limit of warp 5.
name: Subspace Warp Rift
text: Plays crosswise on any spaceline location. Any ship passing over here without stopping incurs damage.

lore: During a prison break aboard Dominion Internment Camp 371, a captive Breen and a Jem'Hadar guard obligingly removed each other from existence.
name: Suicidal Attack
text: Plays to kill one personnel (your choice) who is escorting your Breen or Romulan as a captive OR who just engaged one of your personnel in combat. Your personnel also dies.

lore: Chief Surgeon of the Vidiian Sodality. Divided B'Elanna Torres into two beings - fully human and fully Klingon - to study the phage's effects on Klingon genetic material.
name: Sulan
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Transporter Skill Exobiology x 2 Treachery Computer Skill x 2 Physics

lore: Female, coelenterate life-form. Regarded by Kurros as perhaps the most gifted member of the Think Tank. Expert on temporal physics and tectonic instabilities.
name: Sullin
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE ENGINEER Geology x 2 Physics x 2

lore: The explosion of a star, usually caused by natural processes toward the end of its life cycle.
name: Supernova
text: You must have {Tox Uthat} on table. Place atop any mission. Everything there is destroyed (discarded), but leave Mission card underneath for span reference.

lore: First maje of the Kazon-Mostral. Has slyly arranged brief - but effective - alliances with other majes against larger sects. Commands a Kazon Raider.
name: Surat
text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Diplomacy SECURITY Astrophysics

lore: Chief administrator of Ilvian Medical Complex. Former Bajoran resistance member. Helped develop an aphasia virus which years later would infect Deep Space 9.
name: Surmak Ren
text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Biology Resistance May nullify {Aphasia Device} where present.

lore: Jem'Hadar soldiers have the capability to "shroud," or cloak themselves. This allows them to hide virtually anywhere, and they frequently take their adversaries by surprise.
name: Surprise Assault
text: Unless Leadership, 2 OFFICER and 2 SECURITY present OR 2 hand weapons present, kills two personnel (lowest CUNNING first, then lowest STRENGTH). Discard dilemma.

lore: Study this "live fast, die hard" volcanic planet in this sector.
name: Survey Instability
text: Geology + STRENGTH>35

lore: Study and chart dark matter nebula.
name: Survey Mission
text: Stellar Cartography + Physics

lore: Legendary first bat'leth. 1500-year-old blade weapon forged by Kahless the Unforgettable. Used to slay the tyrant Molor. Discovered by Worf, Kor and Jadzia Dax in 2372.
name: Sword of Kahless
text: Use as Equipment card. Where present, your Klingons with Honor are attributes all +3; {Kahless} is STRENGTH +7 more and may not be killed in personnel battle. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Vulcan son of Sarek; half-brother to Spock. Banished for his emotional, spiritual beliefs. Quests for Sha Ka Ree.
name: Sybok
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Treachery Mindmeld Empathy Anthropology DL/ {Release This Pain}

lore: Identify treatment options for ailing Trill host and assess status of symbiont.
name: Symbiont Diagnosis
text: Trill with symbiont + MEDICAL x3 + OFFICER + Diplomacy x2 + Anthropology + CUNNING>45

lore: The Groumall was jury-rigged with large planetary disruptors salvaged from the destroyed outpost on Korma. The upgrade required emptying the cargo bay, which cost Dukat his profits.
name: System 5 Disruptors
text: Plays on your freighter, transport or merchant vessel. Ship is WEAPONS +4, but is SHIELDS -1 and no longer qualifies as a freighter, transport or merchant vessel.

lore: Lal was affected by a positronic matrix failure. Lt. Commander Data's incomplete knowledge of Dr. Soong's work led to subtle design flaws in the matrix.
name: System-Wide Cascade Failure
text: Mission continues, but one android present (your choice) dies at end of turn unless {Dr. Soong} OR {Ira Graves} present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Bajoran whose brother and grandfather were killed in Crell Moset's grisly experiments. Under Teero's influence, helped his fellow Maquis seize U.S.S. Voyager in 2377.
name: Tabor
text: ENGINEER Honor Youth SECURITY Resistance Stellar Cartography

lore: Bajoran whose brother and grandfather were killed in Crell Moset's grisly experiments. Under Teero's influence, helped his fellow Maquis seize U.S.S. Voyager in 2377.
name: Tabor*
text: ENGINEER Honor Youth SECURITY Resistance Stellar Cartography

lore: Network of active tachyon beams between many ships. Devised by Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge in 2368 to detect cloaked vessels.
name: Tachyon Detection Grid
text: Must have at least four of your ships in play to use. Play on any cloaked ship to detect its presence. Ship is forced to de-cloak for rest of turn.

lore: Standard display on most modern starships. Combines weapons control with target acquisition and analysis subroutines. Highly effective in the hands of a trained tactical officer.
name: Tactical Console
text: Plays on your ship docked at your facility. While you have {Miles O'Brien} or a SECURITY-classification personnel aboard, ship is weapons +3. (Captain's Order.)

lore: Member of Kohn-Ma terrorist group. Wanted for crimes against the Cardassian people. Tried to collapse the entrance to the Bajoran wormhole in 2369.
name: Tahna Los
text: CIVILIAN Resistance Treachery Physics ENGINEER

lore: Commanding officer of the Romulan warbird that crossed the Romulan Neutral Zone in 2364.
name: Tebok
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation

lore: Excommunicated Vedek. Worked in counterintelligence for the Maquis. Experimented with using mind control to recruit agents. Honed his techniques on Tuvok.
name: Teero Anaydis
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Exobiology MEDICAL Anthropology Computer Skill

lore: Legate. Exposed his status as a dissident to protect Kira Nerys. Has Yarim Fel syndrome. Knows more about the Cardassian government than anyone alive.
name: Tekeny Ghemor
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Honor x 2 May glance at any Cardassian player's [HA] card(s).

lore: Male bodyguard of Sela. Stationed on Romulus. Lieutenant operative in the Tal Shiar's new Android Research section.
name: Telak
text: SECURITY Treachery Tal Shiar Cybernetics

lore: Unknown aliens abducted Captain Jean-Luc Picard for telepathic studies about authority in 2366.
name: Telepathic Alien Kidnappers
text: Plays on table. At end of each turn, guess a card type and point to a card in your opponent's hand. Card must be shown. If guessed correctly, card is discarded.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Bodyguard; Duras-related; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Served for four years as a bodyguard in the house of Duras. Took a position aboard Terok Nor to escape the unpredictable demands of Lursa and B'Etor.
name: Telok
text: SECURITY Leadership Computer Skill Treachery Stellar Cartography

lore: Localized distortion causes time to repeat ad infinitum. U.S.S. Bozeman was trapped for 90 years in a temporal loop that held the U.S.S. Enterprise for 17.4 days.
name: Temporal Causality Loop
text: Unless SCIENCE and CUNNING>35, undo your last two actions of this turn and end turn. Discard dilemma.

lore: The Federation Department of Temporal Investigations regulates and assesses possible damage to the timeline caused by time travel. They're never short of work.
name: Temporal Investigations
text: Plays on table. Once every turn, if opponent reports an [AU] personnel or ship to Alpha Quadrant spaceline, you may draw one card OR download {Lucsly} and/or {Dulmer}.

name: Temporal Micro-Wormhole
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [AU] Personnel and Equipment cards may report for duty. Once per game, you may download {Space-Time Portal} (or nullify its report with crew) OR download {Dr. Telek R'Mor}. Once each turn (twice per game), you may report a personnel aboard your ship regardless of affiliation, then discard doorway; for rest of game, that personnel may mix with your other affiliations.

lore: Debilitating disorientation caused by prolonged exposure to a temporal disturbance, similar to nitrogen narcosis ("the bends"). Jean-Luc Picard experienced this in 2369.
name: Temporal Narcosis
text: Plays when opponent is using {Horga'hn}, {Revolving Door}, {Emergency Transporter Armbands} or {Energy Vortex}. Your next turn take a double turn.

lore: Time displacement caused by ultra high energy explosions such as that which affected the U.S.S. Enterprise-C at Narendra III.
name: Temporal Rift
text: Plays on your ship. Ship disappears. When countdown expires, ship reappears here.

lore: Time travel can afford the user certain abilities that might not be available to those native to the current time.
name: Temporal Shifting
text: Plays on a player. That player must choose to either discard three cards from hand or discard one [AU] card. If that player discards an [AU] card, he/she may draw up to four cards. Discard event.

name: Temporal Vortex
text: Plays on a time location. While in play, any ships may time travel between here and corresponding spaceline location. OR Suspends play while you place doorway on {Borg Ship} dilemma or {The Sheliak}. While in play, dilemma disappears. OR Plays on table. While in play, nullifies {Distortion of Space/Time Continuum}. OR Relocates one of your ships at a time location to spaceline location of opponent's choice.

lore: The Borg sphere used chronometric particles to create a temporal vortex. The pursuing U.S.S. Enterprise-E was pulled in when it flew through the wake of the anomaly.
name: Temporal Wake
text: Plays if any ship or Away Team just time traveled. Choose your other ship or Away Team which was present; it follows. OR Nullifies {Anti-Time Anomaly}.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Warbird commanded by Sirol. "Accidentally" sealed the U.S.S. Enterprise inside an asteroid in 2370.
name: Terix
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Mining station built in Bajoran system. Operated by Cardassians using Bajorans in forced-labor conditions.
name: Terok Nor
text: Seeds at a {Bajor Region} location. If commandeered by any personnel who is Bajoran or Federation affiliation, flip card over. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Planets such as Velara III can be transformed to support life. The process takes many decades.
name: Terraforming Station
text: Seed on any planet mission. If still in play at end of game, redefine that mission's requirements for next game with same opponent.

lore: Subterranean base of the Terran Rebellion. Hidden on a small planetoid in the treacherous Badlands.
name: Terran Rebellion HQ
text: Seeds or plays on {Terran Hideout}; it is now the homeworld of [Fed][TE] cards. Once per turn, one [TE] personnel (except [AU]) OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Kazon-Pommar well connected with Minnis. Has had prior dealings with Neelix. Infatuated with a dancer who works at a bar on Sobras. Not her type.
name: Tersa
text: OFFICER Anthropology Diplomacy Treachery Exobiology

lore: Provide aid for a helium ignition project attempting to revitalize dying sun.
name: Test Mission
text: Physics + INTEGRITY>28

lore: Aid helium ignition project.
name: Test Mission II
text: Physics + INTEGRITY>28 If destroyed, flip mission over.

lore: Aid helium ignition project.
name: Test Mission II (back)
text: Physics + INTEGRITY>28 If your Federation ENGINEER is here, in place of your normal card play you may flip mission over; draw no cards that turn.

lore: Intense masses of subspace particles, unstable in normal space, which require ships to route through safe corridors.
name: Tetryon Field
text: Plays crosswise on any spaceline location. All ships must stop here before proceeding on next turn, unless Navigation aboard.

lore: Kohlar's first officer; scorned his reading of the Scrolls. Defeated in combat by Tom Paris when the Nehret set in. Cured by the Kuvah'Magh - with The Doctor's help.
name: T'Greth
text: OFFICER Leadership Geology Navigation ENGINEER

lore: Associate of Taibak. Provided security services during the mental reprogramming of Geordi La Forge.
name: Tharket
text: SECURITY MEDICAL Treachery DL/ {Prisoner Escort} Once per game, may nullify {Rescue Captives} here.

lore: Infamous humanoid criminal. Mercenary captain of a spacefaring group of bandits. Engineered a genetic virus that killed firstborn sons of Kor, Kang and Koloth.
name: The Albino
text: CIVILIAN Greed Treachery Leadership MEDICAL Exobiology x 2

name: The Art of Diplomacy
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [MQ], [Maq], Resistance, and Orion Syndicate personnel who are using a hand weapon may use 2 Treachery as if it were 1 Diplomacy (ignoring reductions from rifles) and, once each turn, may place incident out-of-play to kill one other personnel present. Once per game, you may discard incident to download one hand weapon to one of your personnel who has 2 Treachery.

lore: Inorganic, genderless Think Tank member. Has the mind of a mathematician and the soul of an artist. Interviewed Seven of Nine to assess her worthiness as a recruit.
name: The Artificial Intelligence
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Biology Stellar Cartography Computer Skill x 2

lore: Jean-Luc Picard had to convince Lily Sloane that she was on a starship orbiting Earth. To defeat the Borg, Captain Picard's crew had to succeed on the ship as well as on the planet.
name: The Big Picture
text: Plays on table. Each player who has not solved (or scouted) at least two missions with point boxes (one [S] and one [P]) needs an additional 40 points to win. (May not be nullified.)

lore: Though facing a long voyage across uncharted space, Kathryn Janeway never lost sight of her ultimate goal - to get her ship and crew home.
name: The Big Picture (Voyager)
text: Plays on table. Each player who has not solved (or scouted) at least two missions with point boxes (one [S] and one [P]) needs an additional 40 points to win. (May not be nullified.)

lore: Senior advisor and science officer aboard Gal Gath'thong during 2266 Neutral Zone incursion. Cautioned Keras to proceed carefully against the starship Enterprise.
name: The Centurion
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Stellar Cartography Honor Other Romulans at this location are attributes all +1.

lore: This wreckage was quickly dated to 2033-2079 due to its 52 star American flag, an example of the importance of such knowledge when dealing with ancient artifacts.
name: The Charybdis
text: Plays on table. Artifacts at completed missions cannot be acquired until Archaeology present. (If Charybdis destroyed, anyone present may acquire artifact.)

lore: 20,000-year-old depiction of an ancient Bajoran city. Among the most revered icons of their faith. Some thought B'hala a legend until this painting helped The Emissary find its underground ruins.
name: The City of B'hala
text: May seed only at {Bajor}. Use as Equipment card. If present where attempting a [BAJ] mission, encounter seed cards in reverse order. (Immune to {Disruptor Overload}.)

lore: In 2371, U.S.S. Voyager entered what the crew thought was a nebula rich in omicron particles. It was in fact a massive life-form whose physiology reacted violently to the intrusion.
name: The Cloud
text: Unless 2 MEDICAL, 2 ENGINEER, and 2 Astrophysics present, ship is damaged and "stopped" until end of your next turn. Discard dilemma.

lore: The Clown was most interested in the minds of those who had truly known fear and could appreciate what he represented. He was most unreasonable when dealing with anyone less.
name: The Clown: Beneath the Mask
text: To get past, one personnel must have total attributes>23.

lore: Though The Clown existed only through the minds linked to his system, he was willing to execute one to ensure the obedience of the others, perpetuating his role as fear personified.
name: The Clown: Guillotine
text: Unless 2 Diplomacy present, kills one personnel (random selection) and "stops" each personnel whose total attributes are lower than killed personnel until end of your next turn.

lore: The subconscious world of the Kohl settlers turned nightmarish when a character arrived to embody their anxiety and fears, playing games with them according to his own malicious rules.
name: The Clown: My Festival
text: To get past, crew or Away Team must have no fewer personnel than lowest INTEGRITY present and no more personnel than highest INTEGRITY present.

lore: Linked directly to the minds of his "guests," The Clown could use their deepest fears to torment them. The Doctor's timely arrival spared Harry Kim a violent reenactment of a childhood trauma.
name: The Clown: Playing Doctor
text: One personnel (random selection) and all others present who have the same first-listed skill are killed (only "stopped" if a [Holo] personnel present).

lore: Ardra recreated the human mythical figure the Devil on Ventax II.
name: The Devil
text: Destroys any one {Treaty} card on table OR one {Horga'hn} on table OR one {Wind Dancer}.

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: "...the greatest adventure of all time..."
name: The Discovery of Sha Ka Ree
text: {Sybok} X=number of personnel present with Sybok in lore.

lore: E.M.H. on U.S.S. Voyager. Years of continuous use have expanded his program to include a vast knowledge of Delta Quadrant species and a love of opera.
name: The Doctor
text: MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Biology x 2 MEDICAL Music Computer Skill DL/ {Mobile Holo-Emitter} (ignoring [AU]).

lore: Emergency Command Hologram. At his request, The Doctor was granted the privilege in 2376 to command U.S.S. Voyager in emergencies like the Quarren incident.
name: The E.C.H.
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Navigation Physics MEDICAL DL/ Any Maneuver card

lore: Quark acquired a Bajoran earring in 2370. Kira Nerys quickly identified it as that of Bajoran resistance hero Li Nalas, leading to the rescue of Li and others from the Hutet labor camp.
name: The Earring of Li Nalas
text: Use as Equipment card. Once in play, if {Li Nalas} then earned from {Rescue Prisoners}, doubles its point box. Also, Resistance personnel are attributes all +3. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Benjamin Sisko discovered the Celestial Temple in 2369. Reluctantly accepts Bajoran reverence.
name: The Emissary
text: V.I.P. All other Bajorans in play are INTEGRITY +2. Your Bajorans may report for duty where present. Diplomacy DL/ {Bajoran Wormhole}

name: The Emperor's New Cloak
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Treachery personnel may steal unattended Equipment cards present and, if aboard an opponent's ship that has Cloaking Device, may place objective on ship: it may not be cloaked; steal a {Cloaking Device} Equipment card aboard or download your own aboard. (If you bring Device aboard {any Enterprise} or same ship as {Regent Worf}, discard objective and score points.)

lore: Ornate book of 285 sayings, attributed to Grand Nagus Gint, which guide Ferengi commerce. They're really only guidelines; calling them "rules" was just a clever marketing ploy.
name: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition
text: Once each turn, you may place a [Rule] card beneath draw deck from hand to draw a card (if your Ferengi is present) or to download a [Rule] card to hand (if your Nagus is present).

lore: Nomadic marauders and thieves from Acamar III. "We Gatherers value our freedom. We do what we want and we answer to no creature."
name: The Gatherers
text: Unless {Marouk} OR INTEGRITY>36 present, discard all Equipment and Artifacts in Away Team, plus one card (random selection) from your hand. Discard dilemma.

lore: Torpedo created by Project Genesis. Reorganizes matter at the subatomic level to achieve rapid terraforming on a planetary scale. Its matrix utilized dangerously unstable protomatter.
name: The Genesis Device
text: Use as Equipment card. (Unique.) If not playing [Fed], may place atop planet mission here during your turn. Choose at start of your next turn: mission worth double OR zero points.

lore: Distortions from Kes' expanding powers threatened to destroy Voyager. To save her friends, she permanently left the ship. To thank them, she pushed them 9,500 light-years closer to home.
name: The Gift
text: If you have {Kes} aboard your ship at a spaceline location, place her out-of-play and relocate that ship to another spaceline location in same quadrant. Ship is "stopped."

lore: The Great Hall of Qo'noS is the seat of power for the entire Klingon Empire.
name: The Great Hall
text: Seeds or plays on {Qo'noS}. Once per turn, one Klingon Emperor, Chancellor or personnel with "High Council" in lore OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Changelings intermingle in the Great Link, merging form and thought into one communal entity.
name: The Great Link
text: Seeds or plays on {Founders' homeworld}. {Ketracel-White} on planet does not count down. Once per turn, one Founder OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: The allasomorph Anya could appear in many forms. In 2365, while escorting Salia aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, Anya took the form of a monstrous guardian to protect her charge.
name: The Guardian
text: Suspends play while you place interrupt on your shape-shifter. It morphs (STRENGTH +6; exposed if infiltrating). Discard interrupt if shape-shifter morphs again.

name: The Guardian of Forever
text: Plays on planet {Gateway} (limit one). Once per turn, one or more personnel present may time travel to a time location in this quadrant, or may return here from there (with any of owner's other personnel present). OR Plays once each turn to nullify any card that is closing Guardian, or to draw up to four cards if your Archaeology or Anthropology personnel just time traveled back to Guardian; place doorway out-of-play.

lore: The Parallax Poet's cosmic lesson for Alexander was, "Every moment requires a purpose. Every purpose requires a plan. The Higher... The Fewer."
name: The Higher... The Fewer
text: Subtract X from your total score, where X=the number of personnel in this crew or Away Team.

lore: "You want to review your rapid progress? To where humans learned to control their military with drugs?"
name: The Higher... The Q-er
text: If no CIVILIAN present, add X additional [Q] icon cards to this Q-Flash, where X = number of personnel present with a [Cmd] icon.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Female; Intendant; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Kira Nerys commands Terok Nor in the mirror universe. Enjoys being intimate with her friends - and enemies.
name: The Intendant
text: V.I.P. Leadership Navigation Exobiology May replace anyone present who was just targeted by any gender-related dilemma. Treachery x 2

lore: "You slaughtered millions in silly arguments about how to divide the resources of your little world."
name: The Issue is Patriotism
text: You must immediately initiate a battle at one location that has opposing ships or Away Teams (if any). Stopped cards are unstopped long enough to battle. No leaders are required and no affiliation restrictions apply. (Immune to {Miss Q}.)

lore: The Juggler hosted Lwaxana Troi and Alexander Rozhenko's visit to the Parallax Colony, all the time juggling his three worlds.
name: The Juggler
text: Choose any player to re-shuffle the cards in their draw deck.

name: The Kazon Collective
requires: Kazon-Hobii; Kazon-Mostral; Kazon-Nistrim; Kazon-Ogla; Kazon-Oglamar; Kazon-Pommar; Kazon-Relora; Maje;
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Kazon affiliation is immune to assimilation. Once each turn, if you have a Maje in play, you may report another Kazon of his sect for free. OR Plays on your {Kazon Warship}. Your [Kaz] Personnel and Ship cards (except other Warships) may report aboard.

lore: "... And I will make them PAY for what they've done!"
name: The Line Must Be Drawn Here
text: Seeds or plays on table. Any player who plays {Amanda Rogers}, {Kevin Uxbridge} or {Q2} loses 5 points, even if playing Borg. (Cumulative. Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: In legend, Masaka was chased by Korgano across the sky like the Terran moon chases the sun. Jean-Luc Picard masked himself as Korgano to fool Masaka.
name: The Mask of Korgano
text: Plays on one of your personnel. While in play, changes it from normal to [AU] icon personnel, or vice versa.

lore: "Red Alert!"
name: The Naked Truth
text: Opponent may play a unique personnel from hand to your crew or Away Team. That personnel is under your control (compatible with your cards regardless of affiliation; assimilated if playing Borg) and is stopped. (Opponent may not report the same personnel more than once per game in this manner.)

lore: "...outweigh..." "The needs of the few." "Or the one." Spock made the ultimate sacrifice not because it was noble, but because it was logical.
name: The Needs of the Many ...
text: Nullifies any dilemma (or Tactic card just placed as a damage marker) about to destroy your ship. Discard one of that ship's crew members (opponent's choice).

lore: Believing themselves bound for an afterlife, the Vhnori used a device to send their dead through spectral ruptures, unaware the bodies were being sent to decompose on distant asteroids.
name: The Next Emanation
text: Seeds or plays on table. Opponent's non- [Univ] personnel discarded from play are placed under here instead of in discard pile.

name: The Nexus
text: Seeds like a dilemma. When encountered, place on far end of spaceline. (Not duplicatable.) Destroys all ships present; place personnel aboard (or on planet here) under doorway (they are in play). End of every turn, moves one location toward opposite end. At end of spaceline, place on table. At any time, any player may relocate their personnel under here to any planet (even a time location). (Immune to {Revolving Door}.)

lore: Crowd favorite in the Tsunkatse matches broadcast by Penk. Electrifying Pendari known for his superior strength, bad temper, and keen sense of smell.
name: The Pendari Champion
text: SECURITY Leadership Geology In battle, may pair first (and select his adversary).
