lore: Highly adaptive, deadly virus that has plagued the Vidiians for over two millennia. Destroys genetic codes and cellular structure, requiring constant replacement of decaying organs and tissue.
name: The Phage
text: Plays at start of mission attempt or personnel battle to kill any one Vidiian present. OR Kills any one of your Vidiians; place that Vidiian beneath draw deck or in hand.

lore: Tanis taught Kes to reach out with her mind, embrace the essence of life, and then transform it into death. "Hurt people, help them... give life, kill. It's all the same."
name: The Power
text: Plays once each turn to draw a card OR draw two and discard one of them (your choice) OR draw three and discard one (opponent's choice). (May not be converted to downloads.)

lore: The Doctor gave an unimpeachable performance on the holodeck in 2375, negotiating with transdimensional aliens who mistook a Captain Proton program for reality.
name: The President of Earth
text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy x 2 MEDICAL Personnel present with {Chaotica} are attributes all -3.

lore: Reclusive race of strict legalists. Consider humanoids inferior. The Treaty of Armens ceded several planets to the Sheliak.
name: The Sheliak
text: Place at furthest spaceline end. End of every turn: If at [P] where encountered, destroys all outposts and Away Teams here; mission worth -10 points; discard dilemma. Otherwise: moves.

lore: Fiercely territorial species whose small ships disable enemy vessels by emitting interferometric pulses. Dubbed "the Swarm" by those few who have survived their armadas.
name: The Swarm
text: Place on ship; WEAPONS are disabled and SHIELDS -2. After start of your next turn, cure with 3 ENGINEER and Physics in crew. If countdown expires, ship destroyed.

lore: Advanced ship boasting technology designed by its crew, including a neutronium alloy hull, isomorphic projectors, and subspace cloaking device. Commanded by Kurros.
name: The Think Tank's Ship
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: A shattered comet created a danger to ships and the Bajoran wormhole. The three silithium-laden "vipers" had to be guided through to the other side, fulfilling a Bajoran prophecy.
name: The Three Vipers
text: Ship damaged unless ENGINEER and 2 Navigation present. Even if not damaged, crew "stopped" unless SCIENCE, OFFICER and Astrophysics present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Tau Alpha C native able to transcend space. Phases out from exertion. Appeared to Wesley as Lakanta.
name: The Traveler
text: V.I.P. If aboard your ship with Youth, allows ship to move from one spaceline location to any other spaceline location, then "phases out" (returns to hand).

lore: Benevolent humanoid from Tau Alpha C who could transcend space and time with thought.
name: The Traveler: Transcendence
text: Place beside any player's draw deck. That player must draw one extra card at the end of each turn. Also, while in play, nullifies {Static Warp Bubble}. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Tog abducted Lwaxana Troi and her half-human daughter Deanna Troi. After beaming the pair out of their clothes, he planned to exploit their Betazoid skills.
name: The Trois
text: V.I.P.+CIVILIAN Lwaxana: Empathy x 2 Diplomacy DL/ {Wolf} Deanna: Diplomacy Empathy DL/ {Plexing}

lore: Captain Proton villains portrayed by the Delaney sisters, Megan and Jenny. Threatened to use their Brain Probe to make Buster Kincaid their slave. He didn't mind.
name: The Twin Mistresses of Evil
text: SCIENCE+SCIENCE Demonica: Doubles skills of {any Harry Kim} present. Malicia: Doubles skills of {any Tom Paris} present.

name: The Vidiian Sodality
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, you may report either a MEDICAL-classification Vidiian or a MEDICAL-related Equipment card for free. OR Plays on your {Vidiian Cruiser}. Your Vidiians may report aboard.

lore: The New Providence colony on Jouret IV was scooped up by the Borg in 2366, just as Federation and Romulan outposts along the Neutral Zone had been destroyed in 2364.
name: The Wake of the Borg
text: Plays on opponent's Neutral Zone mission if they seeded 3 or more. End of opponent's next turn, all non-[Bor] ships, facilities and personnel there are returned to hand.

lore: Small device used to monitor the auto-timer on the time travel pod appropriated by Berlinghoff Rasmussen. As he was uncertain how to reprogram the timer, the ring was very precious to him.
name: Timepod Ring
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may peek at the top card of your deck. Also, you may discard this event and the top card of your draw deck to nullify an [AU] dilemma.

lore: Gul Jasad paused for a moment on the brink of an assault against Deep Space 9. He eventually called off the attack and withdrew his ships.
name: Time to Reconsider
text: Plays to "stop" your ship and crew. Prevents opponent (unless playing Borg) from initiating a counter-attack this turn at that location.

lore: Craft from the future, stolen in the past by Berlinghoff Rasmussen for his own gain.
name: Time Travel Pod
text: Place in hand until played once as an Interrupt card on any ship. That ship travels into the future (disappears for up to 5 turns). Pre-announce the return time.

lore: Kaelonian. Romantically involved with Lwaxana Troi. Must submit to The Resolution at age 60.
name: Timicin
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Scores 10 points if helps solve {Test Mission}.

lore: Klingon mercenary used by Verad. Helped capture Jadzia in an attempt to steal the Dax symbiont.
name: T'Kar
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 ENGINEER Treachery

lore: Revered elder. High priestess of the ancient temple at Mount Seleya. The only Vulcan known to have actually performed a successful fal-tor-pan ceremony.
name: T'Lar
text: V.I.P. MEDICAL Mindmeld x 2 Anthropology Leadership DL/ {Fal-tor-pan}

lore: taH pagh taHbe'. DaH mu'tlheghvam vlqelnlS. quv'a', yabDaq San vaQ cha, pu' je SIQDI'? pagh, Seng blQ'a'Hey SuvmeH nuHmey SuqDI', 'ej, Suvmo', rlnmoHDI'?
name: To Be or Not to Be
text: Plays on table. May discard event just after a battle your opponent initiated to damage all opposing ships (including {I.K.C. Kla'Diyus}) in that battle. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Dr. Toby Russell is a controversial neurogeneticist. Creator of the genetronic replicator therapy for spinal injury that saved Lieutenant Worf.
name: Toby Russell
text: MEDICAL Physics

lore: DaiMon. Presented flowers to Lwaxana Troi. Abducted her from Betazed, hoping to exploit her empathic skills during negotiations. She called him a "toad-faced troll."
name: Tog
text: OFFICER Greed Anthropology Exobiology Once per game, may capture one Empath present.

lore: Established a secret prison camp in the Carraya system for dishonored Klingon survivors of the Khitomer massacre.
name: Tokath
text: OFFICER Anthropology Honor

lore: Unusually calm and intelligent Ferengi. Science officer aboard Bok's marauder. Questioned his commander's actions in the Jason Vigo incident.
name: Tol
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Astrophysics Stellar Cartography

lore: Best pilot aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Also acts as medical assistant. Led design and construction of the Delta Flyer. Prolific holodeck programmer. 20th-century history buff.
name: Tom Paris
text: OFFICER Navigation x 3 ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill MEDICAL Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Romulan; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Commander of a D'deridex-class warbird. Frequent nemesis of the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Tomalak
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership

lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Star Empire in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Romulan - Tomalak - is part of us now."
name: Tomalak of Borg
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership For rest of game, all your ships have Cloaking Device. While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Rom].

lore: Jem'Hadar Second. Served under Omet'iklan for three years. In defiance of the First's orders, fought Worf during preparations for the joint Vandros IV mission.
name: Toman'torax
text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Stellar Cartography May pair first when in personnel battle.

lore: Holographic weapon. Version of Thompson submachinegun, model 1921. Can empty a 100-round drum in 4 seconds. "Pinched" from Nicky the Nose's henchman by Dixon Hill.
name: Tommygun
text: Use at start of personnel battles. May stun one {Rogue Borg} or personnel present (random selection) OR erase up to 100 [Holo] personnel present (your choice).

name: Tongo
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may declare a move from the list below. Each player simultaneously reveals a bet from hand (a personnel card; yours must be Ferengi). Player with highest total attributes on bet is winner. Acquire. Winner: discard bet, then draw up to two cards. Confront. Winner: report bet. Loser: place bet on draw deck. Evade. Winner: place bet under draw deck. Loser: discard bet.

lore: Klingon male, born in Romulan prison camp in Carraya system. Protege of Lieutenant Worf.
name: Toq
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Computer Skill Youth

lore: Half-Bajoran daughter of Tora Naprem and Dukat. Survived crash of the Ravinok on Dozaria. Rescued in 2372. Talented artist. Fond of Elim Garak.
name: Tora Ziyal
text: CIVILIAN Youth May seed under {Dozaria}. Geology {Dukat} is INTEGRITY +3 if present.

lore: Governor Torak served near the Federation border commanding Sector 2520 in 2369.
name: Torak
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Geology

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Duras-related; High Council; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Illegitimate son of Duras. Claimed leadership position on the High Council at bidding of Duras' sisters, Lursa and B'Etor.
name: Toral
text: V.I.P. Leadership Youth

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Gul; Male;
lore: Gul. Sent to Deep Space 9 to kill Natima Lang and other dissidents. Political enemy of Garak.
name: Toran
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation Treachery Stellar Cartography

lore: Female captain of Imperial Romulan warbird, Khazara. Father killed by Tal Shiar. Uncovered M'ret defection plot.
name: Toreth
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Navigation

lore: Kruge's first officer. Led the boarding party sent to secure Enterprise. His promotions came slowly; past captains have said he doesn't know when he's being spoken to.
name: Torg
text: OFFICER Leadership SCIENCE Navigation Computer Skill

lore: Jean-Luc Picard was captured by Cardassians in 2369. He was subjected to intense physiological and psychological torture in an effort to obtain strategic Federation information.
name: Torture
text: Plays on a personnel you've captured. When countdown expires, captive dies and owner loses points (including any {Madred} bonuses).

lore: Chief engineer of the ship that first brought the Ba'ku to their new home in 2066. Now one of the more respected "elders" in their idyllic community.
name: Tournel
text: CIVILIAN Leadership ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics

lore: The Grand Nagus enjoys absolute control over Ferengi business affairs from his Chamber of Petitioners.
name: Tower of Commerce
text: Seeds or plays on {Ferenginar}. Once per turn, one Ferengi V.I.P., CIVILIAN or Hupyrian OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Dangerous quantum phase inhibitor invented in the future by Kal Dano who hid it in the 22nd century for safekeeping.
name: Tox Uthat
text: Place in hand until played on table as an event ({supernova} can be played on later turn) OR as an interrupt (prevents {supernova}). Discard after use.

lore: Vulcan female. Dr. T'Pan served as director of the prestigious Vulcan Science Academy. Preeminent expert in subspace morphology.
name: T'Pan
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Mindmeld

characteristicsKeywords: Merchant vessel; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam; Vulcan ship;
lore: Vulcan merchant vessel named for the only person to ever turn down a seat on the Federation Council. Stolen from Surplus Depot Zed-15 at Qualor II.
name: T'Pau
text: May report for duty at {Qualor II}. Tractor Beam

lore: Female Vulcan first officer of Enterprise, NX-01. Finds humans to be fascinating. Dislikes the smell of dogs.
name: T'Pol
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Mindmeld Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology DL/ Any Interrupt with "Vulcan" in title or gametext

name: T'Pol/Soong Maneuver
text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +3 and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a NX-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Burn and Turn: until the end of your next full turn, this ship may not move to a mission where an opponent has a ship.

lore: Small incendiary devices can be used to create diversions and gain strategic control. An exploding grenade helped Neelix and Mabus escape an underground Kazon prison.
name: Trabe Grenade
text: Kills one Away Team member who has SECURITY or Leadership (random selection) unless that personnel has CUNNING>8. Mission continues.

lore: Commanded by Macet. Dispatched to intercept U.S.S. Phoenix, reportedly attacking Cardassian vessels in violation of the 2366 peace treaty.
name: Trager
text: Tractor Beam

lore: John Doe was persecuted by other Zalkonians who did not understand his evolution into a higher form. He is now a benevolent energy being with metaphysical powers.
name: Transfiguration
text: Plays on {John Doe} after he has prevented a death. Each turn he may nullify one Event card (except Transfiguration) where present. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Convey members of a telepathic species from the Fima system to their home planet.
name: Transport Colonists
text: Diplomacy + Honor + INTEGRITY>40 * +5 if Empathy or Mindmeld present.

lore: Device that emits an energy field preventing the operation of transporters within a radius of several meters. Used by the Enterprise crew in their defense against the Son'a.
name: Transport Inhibitor
text: Your personnel present may choose to prevent any beaming to or from this equipment. Opponent's personnel present may discard this equipment if it is unattended.

lore: Transporter chief aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Lt. Kyle was punished by First Officer Spock for failing to compensate for a transporter malfunction in 2267.
name: Transporter Chief Kyle
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Archaeology DL/ {Agonizer}

lore: Crucial transporter systems component. Kazon of the Nistrim sect stole one from U.S.S. Voyager. First Maje Jal Culluh used this new technology against his enemies, the Kazon-Relora.
name: Transporter Control Module
text: While aboard your ship or facility with your ENGINEER or Transporter Skill personnel present, that ship or facility has transporters.

lore: Typical reconnaissance devices modified by the Son'a to fire isolinear tags. Transporters can lock onto a tagged object, overcoming any interference with normal targeting scanners.
name: Transporter Drones
text: Participates in battle like a personnel, using STRENGTH=8 vs. adversary's CUNNING. May capture any adversary it stuns by beaming them to your ship here.

name: Transporter Mixup
text: Seeds or plays on table. (Unique.) If up to four of your personnel are beaming up from a planet in their native quadrant, you may replace (discard) them by downloading an equal number of others to complete the transport. Each [Univ] personnel may be replaced by any [Univ] personnel native to opposite quadrant; others may be replaced only by opposite versions of their personas. Discard incident.

lore: New Borg technology which creates an artificial subspace tunnel that increases effective warp speed.
name: Transwarp Conduit
text: Select a ship. It can move double range for this turn.

name: Transwarp Network Gateway
text: Seed one during facility phase on any spaceline end OR play on any spaceline location where you have a [Nav] Borg. Any player may play a {Transwarp Conduit} (or another copy of this doorway) to allow moving any or all of that player's ships from this Transwarp Network Gateway to another. OR Downloads Transwarp Conduit (discard doorway).

name: Transwarp Network Gateway (The Borg)
text: Seed one during facility phase on any spaceline end OR play on any spaceline location where you have a [Nav] Borg. Any player may play a {Transwarp Conduit} (or another copy of this doorway) to allow moving any or all of that player's ships from this Transwarp Network Gateway to another. OR Downloads Transwarp Conduit (discard doorway).

lore: Emotional trauma, such as the Prophets' first interrogation of The Sisko, can cause disability or even death. Others face the grim choice of lending aid or completing their mission.
name: Trauma
text: Place on personnel present with the most [*] icons (your choice if tie). That personnel is disabled. If you solve this mission before countdown expires, that personnel dies.

lore: Crack pilot aboard Enterprise, NX-01. Itching to get into deep space. Loves the sweet spot.
name: Travis Mayweather
text: OFFICER Honor Diplomacy Astrophysics Navigation x 2 Computer Skill Once every turn, may nullify {Full Planet Scan}.

lore: Hireling used by Pallra during her extortion plan. Assassin. Recovered secret list of collaborators. Attempted to kill Quark - twice.
name: Trazko
text: CIVILIAN Greed Computer Skill Stellar Cartography

lore: For many months, a changeling posing as General Martok manipulated the Klingon Empire through choice lies whispered in the ear of Chancellor Gowron.
name: Treacherous Advice
text: Peek at an opponent's hand. You may discard one of those cards for each Leadership personnel present with one of your infiltrators who is infiltrating. Discard event after use.

lore: Bajor's non-aggression pact with the Dominion, signed in 2373, was endorsed by the Emissary himself. He hoped to spare Bajor from the inevitable Federation/Dominion war.
name: Treaty: Bajoran/Dominion
text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Kai Winn} or {The Emissary} in play). Your Bajoran and Dominion affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: The Klingon Empire established a permanent military presence on the Bajoran station Deep Space 9 when Chancellor Gowron reinstated the Khitomer Accords in 2373.
name: Treaty: Bajoran/Klingon
text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Chancellor Gowron} in play). Your Bajoran and Klingon affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: In 2371, the Bajoran and Cardassian peoples finally began to put their long conflict behind them, with the signing of a peace treaty between Legate Turrel and the newly elected Kai Winn.
name: Treaty: Cardassian/Bajoran
text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Bareil Antos}, {Kai Winn}, or {Turrel} in play). Your Cardassian and Bajoran affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: Gul Dukat's secret negotiations with the Dominion in 2373 secured a strong ally for the Cardassian Union, and positioned Dukat as the new head of the Cardassian government.
name: Treaty: Cardassian/Dominion
text: Seeds or plays on table (plays for free if you have {Dukat} in play). Your Cardassian and Dominion affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: In 2369, the Bajoran provisional government applied for Federation membership. That same year, Bajor invited Starfleet to administer the recently acquired space station Terok Nor.
name: Treaty: Federation/Bajoran
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Federation and Bajoran affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: The Federation and the Cardassian Union concluded three years of negotiation in 2370. The resulting treaty brought an end to hostilities and established the Demilitarized Zone.
name: Treaty: Federation/Cardassian
text: Plays on table. Your Federation and Cardassian affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate. (May be seeded if you have {Klaestron outpost} in play.)

lore: Federation and Dominion forces led by Benjamin Sisko and Weyoun worked together in 2372 to attack renegade Jem'Hadar on Vandros IV and destroy their Iconian gateway.
name: Treaty: Federation/Dominion
text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Weyoun} or {Benjamin Sisko} in play). Your Federation and Dominion affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: Past treaties between these powers included the Treaty of Alliance creating mutual aid and defense without intervention.
name: Treaty: Federation/Klingon
text: Plays on table. Your Federation and Klingon affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: Past treaties between these powers include the Treaty of Algeron, which created a neutral zone and outlawed Federation cloaking devices.
name: Treaty: Federation/Romulan
text: Plays on table. Your Federation and Romulan affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

characteristicsKeywords: Federation treaty; Klingon treaty; Romulan treaty;
lore: Three major Alpha Quadrant powers, in an uncharacteristic show of solidarity in 2373, focused their resources against the Dominion threat in a united stand at station Deep Space 9.
name: Treaty: Federation/Romulan/Klingon
text: Plays on table. While you have no open side decks, your [Fed], [Rom], and [Kli] affiliations are compatible and ignore affiliation attack restrictions. They may not attempt opponent's missions.

lore: After the Romulan Star Empire's entry into the Dominion war in 2374, Senator Cretak established a Romulan military presence on Deep Space 9 - and a fragile trust with Colonel Kira Nerys.
name: Treaty: Romulan/Bajoran
text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Colonel Kira} or {Senator Cretak} in play). Your Romulan and Bajoran affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: Responding to the Dominion threat, Romulans and Cardassians became secret allies in 2371 and assembled a joint Tal Shiar/Obsidian Order strike force in the Orias system.
name: Treaty: Romulan/Cardassian
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Romulan and Cardassian affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: On Proconsul Neral's authority, Senator Vreenak negotiated a strategic non-aggression pact with the Dominion, forcing the humans and Klingons to bear the brunt of Dominion aggression.
name: Treaty: Romulan/Dominion
text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Senator Vreenak} in play). Your Romulan and Dominion affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: Historically bitter enemies, these two powers had a brief, failed alliance to share technology around 2268.
name: Treaty: Romulan/Klingon
text: Plays on table. Your Romulan and Klingon affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

name: Tribble Bomb
text: Plays for free on your tribble group if your {Barry Waddle} at same location. (Unique.) When countdown expires, kills one personnel present (your choice). Once per turn, any player's personnel present who has {any tricorder} may "search" for Bomb: Shuffle Bomb into all your tribbles present (if any). That player randomly examines half of those cards (round up); Bomb is nullified if so examined.

lore: Representative of a multipurpose handheld device combining sensors, computers, and recorders. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Tricorder
text: Gives all of your ENGINEER-classification personnel the extra skill of SCIENCE where present.

lore: Romulan female assigned to install, safeguard and operate the cloaking device loaned to Starfleet for use aboard the U.S.S. Defiant.
name: T'Rul
text: ENGINEER Physics SECURITY Exobiology Ship she is aboard is RANGE +1 when cloaked.

characteristicsKeywords: D'Kora-class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam; Transport;
lore: Modified transport commanded by Gegis, who planned to use his profit from stolen Borg nanoprobes to install multiphasic shielding and a gold-pressed latinum hull.
name: Trullux
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: "You can do it, Amanda... close your eyes... remember them."
name: Trust Me
text: Plays on table until any Q-Flash. Each time you play an {Amanda Rogers} card (except to nullify a [Q] icon card), opponent may place two non-Artifact cards from outside the game into opponent's own discard pile.

lore: Vulcan female from Vulcana Regar. Competed against Wesley Crusher, Mordock, and Oliana Mirren for acceptance to Starfleet Academy.
name: T'Shanik
text: SCIENCE Mindmeld Computer Skill Youth

lore: Vulcan scientist. In 2063, on an extended survey far from Vulcan, her scanning instruments detected a warp signature emanating from an uncharted system.
name: T'Shonra
text: SCIENCE Navigation Mindmeld Music Stellar Cartography

lore: Variety of water-based Psi 2000 virus. Passed by perspiration. Creates dangerous intoxication-like instability among a crew.
name: Tsiolkovsky Infection
text: Place aboard ship. It is now infected. Mission continues, but all personnel, while aboard, lose their first-listed skill. Cure with 3 MEDICAL. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Formidable vessel commanded by Penk, from which he broadcasts his popular fighting circuit. Heavily shielded to prevent anyone from abducting his competitors.
name: Tsunkatse Ship
text: Your personnel with "Tsunkatse" in lore may report aboard. Tractor Beam

affiliation: Any non-Dominion Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Meet with aggressive Dosi negotiators to discuss lucrative wine contract and distribution rights.
name: Tulaberry Wine Negotiations
text: Acquisition x3 + (STRENGTH>30 OR Guramba) OR {Pel} + {any Quark}

lore: Klingon elder. Longtime advisor and attendant to the House of Kozak. Conducted brek'tal ritual for the Lady Grilka and her Ferengi mate, Quark Son of Keldar.
name: Tumek
text: CIVILIAN Exobiology Honor SCIENCE Law DL/ {Grilka}

lore: Rash hunter. Grudgingly took part in a holodeck scenario of Nazi Germany's 20th-century occupation of France. Never grasped Karr's aims in studying the Voyager prey.
name: Turanj
text: SECURITY Treachery x 2 Leadership Geology Stellar Cartography

lore: Legate. Politician and diplomat. Negotiated historic 2371 treaty between Cardassia Prime and Bajor with Bareil Antos and Kai Winn.
name: Turrel
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Anthropology Astrophysics Protects your Cardassian treaties from nullification.

lore: Vulcan security chief of U.S.S. Voyager. Janeway's tactical officer and confidant for many years. Former instructor at Starfleet Academy. Breeds prize orchids.
name: Tuvok
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Computer Skill Mindmeld Biology Music Law

lore: Intense electromagnetic charges caused Voyager to fall into a state of structural flux. The fluctuations created a warping effect, turning the ship into a constantly shifting maze.
name: Twisted
text: Cannot get past unless at least half of personnel in crew or Away Team (round up) each have CUNNING>7.

lore: Identification: TRANSTATOR DRONE Task: Primary adjunct of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Two of Nine
text: SCIENCE Physics SECURITY Once each turn, may discard a card from hand to place bottom two cards of discard pile beneath draw deck.

lore: Perfectly flat spaceborne creatures from a two-dimensional spatial continuum. Ensnared the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367 and impeded Counselor Deanna Troi's empathic abilities.
name: Two-Dimensional Creatures
text: Place on ship. Empaths aboard are disabled. Ship can't move until SCIENCE and ENGINEER aboard, discarding dilemma and curing empaths.

lore: Starship from the 23rd century. Registry NCC-1941. Modernized to defend against Borg technology. Captained by Morgan Bateson.
name: U.S.S. Bozeman
text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +2 vs. Borg ships and {Borg Ship} dilemma. Tractor Beam

lore: Starship found trapped in a Tyken's Rift in 2367. All but one of crew killed by REM sleep deprivation.
name: U.S.S. Brittain
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Unique ship constructed and commanded by Arturis. Equipped with an operational quantum slipstream drive. Designed to appear as an experimental Starfleet vessel.
name: U.S.S. Dauntless
text: May be fully staffed by {Arturis}. Holodeck DL/ {Quantum Slipstream Drive}

lore: Unique ship constructed and commanded by Arturis. Equipped with an operational quantum slipstream drive. Designed to appear as an experimental Starfleet vessel.
name: U.S.S. Dauntless*
text: May be fully staffed by {Arturis}. Holodeck DL/ {Quantum Slipstream Drive}

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: NX-74205. Built to battle Borg. Recommissioned to oppose the Dominion. First ship to test ablative armor and quantum torpedoes. Captained by Benjamin Sisko.
name: U.S.S. Defiant
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods)

lore: Starfleet vessel, registry NCC-20381. In 2364, was assigned a routine mission of exploration in and around the Lorenze Cluster under the command of Paul Rice.
name: U.S.S. Drake
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: The fifth Starfleet ship named Enterprise, launched in 2363. Built at the Utopia Planetia shipyards orbiting Mars.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Specially commissioned in 2286 to replace the famous ship lost one year earlier. Proudly continued the mission of its predecessor under the command of James T. Kirk.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-A
text: DL/ {Any Federation [Films] personnel} OR {James T. Kirk} Tractor Beam

lore: Third Federation ship so christened, launched on stardate 9715. Became fully operational the following Tuesday.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-B
text: Tractor Beam (unless any attribute is reduced). El-Aurians may report aboard.

lore: Predecessor of U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Famous for heroic action in Battle of Narendra III, where it also entered a temporal rift. Commanded by Rachel Garrett.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-C
text: Enters play damaged at any location. Tractor Beam

lore: Commissioned in 2372. Sixth starship in the Enterprise line. Optimized to battle the Borg. 700 meters long. Infiltrated by Borg in 2373.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-E
text: WEAPONS +3 vs. Borg ships and {Borg Ship} dilemma. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Federation ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: NCC-72381. Science vessel pulled from Alpha Quadrant by the Caretaker. Its rogue crew designed an enhanced warp drive, killing nucleogenic life-forms for fuel.
name: U.S.S. Equinox
text: X=4 if any crew member has "U.S.S. Equinox" in lore. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Federation ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: NCC-72381. Science vessel pulled from Alpha Quadrant by the Caretaker. Its rogue crew designed an enhanced warp drive, killing nucleogenic life-forms for fuel.
name: U.S.S. Equinox*
text: X=4 if any crew member has "U.S.S. Equinox" in lore. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam;
lore: Science vessel assigned to survey and investigate the Genesis Planet in 2285. Named for one of Earth's earliest space explorers.
name: U.S.S. Grissom
text: Tractor Beam, SCIENCE

lore: Registry number NCC-42296. Named for the 20th century admiral, Sir Horace Hood. Commanded by Captain Robert DeSoto.
name: U.S.S. Hood
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Captained by Satelk. Helped U.S.S. Enterprise defend timeship Premonition from a Borg attack in 2376. Armed with experimental Chain Reaction Pulsar weapon.
name: U.S.S. Jupiter
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Chain Reaction Pulsar}

lore: NCC-71832. Starship sent into Gamma Quadrant to investigate the Dominion. Victim of Jem'Hadar suicide tactics. Commanded by Keogh.
name: U.S.S. Odyssey
text: Attributes all +1 in Gamma Quadrant. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; future-related ship; Holodeck; Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam;
lore: Medical relief vessel. Starfleet registry NCC-58928. Captained by Beverly Picard in an alternate future.
name: U.S.S. Pasteur
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam, MEDICAL If your {Future Enterprise} in play, it has a (L> icon and reduces its staffing by one [AU] icon.

lore: Modified prototype on which an experimental cloak was secretly tested in 2358. Some of the crew mutinied against Captain Erik Pressman for his violation of treaty.
name: U.S.S. Pegasus
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Phased Cloaking Device}

lore: Commanded by Captain Benjamin Maxwell. Last assigned to the Cardassian/Federation border.
name: U.S.S. Phoenix
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Holodeck; Prototype; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Prototype Starfleet vessel, NX-59650. Boasts ablative armor, regenerative shielding, and multivector assault mode. Captured by Romulans during a test flight.
name: U.S.S. Prometheus
text: May download {Multivector Assault Mode} when in battle. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Holodeck; Prototype; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Prototype Starfleet vessel, NX-59650. Boasts ablative armor, regenerative shielding, and multivector assault mode. Captured by Romulans during a test flight.
name: U.S.S. Prometheus*
text: May download {Multivector Assault Mode} when in battle. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Khan-related card; Tractor Beam;
lore: NCC-1864. Placed at the disposal of Project Genesis to locate a suitable Stage Three testing site. Captured at Ceti Alpha V and subsequently commanded by Khan.
name: U.S.S. Reliant
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Khan-related card; Tractor Beam;
lore: NCC-1864. Placed at the disposal of Project Genesis to locate a suitable Stage Three testing site. Captured at Ceti Alpha V and subsequently commanded by Khan.
name: U.S.S. Reliant*
text: Tractor Beam

lore: First runabout assigned to Deep Space 9. Towed the Prakesh through the Bajoran Wormhole. Commanded by Benjamin Sisko.
name: U.S.S. Rio Grande
text: DL/ {Activate Tractor Beam}

lore: Replacement for the U.S.S. Defiant. NCC-75633. Briefly commanded by Admiral Ross during delivery to Deep Space 9. Captained by Benjamin Sisko.
name: U.S.S. Sao Paulo
text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods).

lore: Captained by Jean-Luc Picard on a historic 22-year mission of exploration. Thought destroyed in 2355 at Maxia Zeta until returned by DaiMon Bok.
name: U.S.S. Stargazer
text: Tractor Beam. Once each game, may be taken from discard pile to hand.

lore: Named for Horatio Hornblower's fictional flagship. Briefly commanded by Lt. Commander Data during the Klingon Civil War blockade.
name: U.S.S. Sutherland
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: NCC-63549. Helped lead Starfleet forces against invading Borg cube in 2373. Briefly commanded by Fleet Admiral Shanthi during its shakedown cruise.
name: U.S.S. Thunderchild
text: SHIELDS +4 vs. Borg ships and {Borg Ship} dilemma. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Federation ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: NCC-74656. Commanded by Kathryn Janeway. Pulled 70,000 light years from the Alpha Quadrant. Its crew has spent nearly seven years on a long trek home.
name: U.S.S. Voyager
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Bio-Neural Gel Pack} DL/ {Blue Alert}

lore: Named for a Japanese WWII battleship. Sister ship of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Commanded by Captain Donald Varley.
name: U.S.S. Yamato
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Starfleet runabout commanded by Kira Nerys during Tahna Los' 2369 encounter with the Sisters of Duras. Registry number NCC-72453.
name: U.S.S. Yangtzee Kiang
text: May be used by Bajoran affiliation.

name: Ultimatum
text: Seeds or plays on table; you may immediately download {Bajoran Wormhole}. Once per game, your [Dom] ENGINEER at any [DOM] mission in Alpha Quadrant may download there {Remote Supply Depot} with up to two Equipment cards. Also, you may discard incident to place in your point area one ship just destroyed by your Dominion ship; score bonus points equal to highest attribute printed on that Ship card.

lore: Fifth. Jem'Hadar alpha assigned to Kudak'Etan. Well versed in the Alpha Quadrant anomaly. Once guarded prisoners repairing the commandeered U.S.S. Defiant.
name: Umat'Adan
text: SECURITY SCIENCE Navigation Stellar Cartography DL/ {Wormhole Navigation Schematic} (once per turn).

lore: Investigate genetic research conducted here by Federation scientist Dr. Richard Galen.
name: Uncover DNA Clues
text: SCIENCE + Archaeology + (Leadership x2 OR {Ocett}) {Hunt for DNA Program} adds [CAR][BAJ][FER].

lore: While on a medical mission to Ajilon Prime in 2373, Julian Bashir found himself in the middle of a live combat situation.
name: Under Fire
text: Immediately probe (then place probe card atop draw deck): [Doorway], [Interrupt], DL/ , [Bor]: Kills two personnel (random selection). Otherwise: "Stops" one personnel (random selection).

lore: Borg refugees from a destroyed spherical vessel were able to beam aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-E without being detected. This led to a nasty surprise for Inge Eiger.
name: Undetected Beam-In
text: Opponent may download to this location up to 4 Borg drones or {Rogue Borg Mercenaries} (they do not battle now). Nullify dilemma with {Shelby} OR 4 SECURITY.

lore: A murder in the holosuite puzzled the Deep Space 9 authorities. How could someone have entered a room to commit the crime without leaving a trace?
name: Unnatural Causes
text: Plays on any crew or Away Team if one of its members was just killed other than in battle. One personnel present (random selection) is "stopped" to investigate.

lore: As part of his plan to steal the newly developed metaphasic shield technology, Jo'Bril sabotaged the initial testing, faked his own death and killed the inventor.
name: Unscientific Method
text: Most CUNNING SCIENCE personnel present without Greed or Treachery is killed. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

lore: Retrieve crewman possessed by the consciousness of a despotic ruler and restore rightful leader.
name: Unseat Dictator
text: MEDICAL + SECURITY + (Empathy OR Mindmeld OR STRENGTH>55)

lore: Pretending to be upset over Rom's departure from Deep Space 9, Quark disabled docking ring security sensors. His treachery allowed intruders to board and control the station.
name: Untrustworthy Associate
text: Unless CUNNING>40, opponent places on any one ship or facility here. Opponent's cards may beam, dock, and undock with ship or facility (as appropriate). Nullify with 4 SECURITY.

lore: When a Ferengi dies, his body is desiccated and apportioned into flat, circular containers to be sold as collectibles. The remains of noteworthy individuals can become quite valuable.
name: Vacuum-Desiccated Remains
text: Once per turn, place out-of-play any Ferengi just killed by your opponent's card. Draw cards and/or download {Gold-Pressed Latinum}: up to three total if a V.I.P., two otherwise.

lore: Klingon Governor of the Kriosian system. Target of an assassination attempt by Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge, acting under Romulan mind control.
name: Vagh
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Anthropology

lore: Tal Shiar agent. Aware of assassination plot against Elim Garak. Unhappy to discover that her records mischaracterized him as a cobbler, not a tailor.
name: Vakis
text: V.I.P. Tal Shiar MEDICAL Biology Treachery

lore: First maje of the Kazon-Oglamar. Expertly uses the slim resources of his sect in hit-and-run attacks, often staged near nebulae and other astronomical phenomena.
name: Valek
text: OFFICER Leadership SCIENCE Astrophysics Navigation Greed

lore: Vulcan protege of Spock whom he intended as his replacement. Made a choice to sabotage peace negotiations with the untrustworthy Klingon Empire.
name: Valeris
text: SCIENCE Navigation Mindmeld Treachery Diplomacy -3 (while infiltrating).

lore: Klingon operative romantically involved with Kruge. Obtained top secret documents on Project Genesis. It was the pinnacle of her career in espionage.
name: Valkris
text: SCIENCE Klingon Intelligence Smuggling Physics Computer Skill

lore: The dying criminal Rao Vantika used a microscopic generator to transfer his consciousness into Julian Bashir. Eventually Vantika's essence was beamed out of the possessed doctor.
name: Vantika's Neural Pathways
text: Place on a non-changeling present (random selection). Loses skills, classification and INTEGRITY; gains Treachery x2. Cure at {Infirmary} site with MEDICAL and Transporter Skill.

lore: Orphan of parents killed by Cardassians. Succeeded her father as tetrarch of the Paqu. Compromised with rival village of Navot. Friend of Jake Sisko and Nog.
name: Varis Sul
text: V.I.P. Youth Leadership Diplomacy Geology

lore: Only five of these pistols were made before being banned by the Federation. These vicious weapons disrupt the body from the inside out, causing a slow and painful death.
name: Varon-T Disruptor
text: Use as Equipment card. Doubles your personnel's STRENGTH where present. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Extraordinary archaeology treasure hunter. Traveled with Q. Romantically involved with Captain Jean-Luc Picard. Lovable character, not to be trusted.
name: Vash
text: CIVILIAN Archaeology x 2 Treachery Anthropology

characteristicsKeywords: Trill; Female; The Circle-related personnel; Trill with Symbiont; Vedek;
lore: Trill with symbiont. Jadzia Dax posed as a vedek to sneak Kira Nerys past members of the Circle and into the Chamber of Ministers. Joked about keeping the nose.
name: Vedek Dax
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Anthropology Physics Navigation Exobiology

lore: Religious leader who protested scientific teachings of Bajoran wormhole origins. Orchestrated assassination attempt on Bareil. Aspires to be Kai - by any means.
name: Vedek Winn
text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership Diplomacy Once every turn, may "stop" one personnel present.

lore: Romulan general. Commander of the Romulan fleet at the close of the Dominion war. Committed the Romulan Star Empire to the final attack on Cardassia.
name: Velal
text: OFFICER SECURITY Transporter Skill Archaeology Captain's Log is +1 on your D'deridex-class ships.

lore: Grieving over the dead body of his brother Ro-Kel, Ah-Kel swore vengeance against the killer of his twin.
name: Vendetta
text: Unless Law present, place on one crew or Away Team member (opponent's choice). If that personnel dies, opponent scores points.

lore: Substantiate report of information broker working here.
name: Verify Evidence
text: Navigation x2 + (CUNNING>24 OR {any tricorder}) + (Leadership x2 OR hand weapon OR Smuggling)

lore: Treacherous Lumerian ambassador. Uses receptacle stones to deposit his negative emotions in others in order to enhance his negotiation skills.
name: Ves Alkar
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x2 if female empath(s) at same location (they are Empathy -1). Empathy Treachery

lore: Massive living machine created by an unknown race around the lost NASA space probe Voyager VI. Left a trail of destruction during its return to Earth in search of its creator.
name: V'Ger
text: Ship is destroyed unless 2 Empathy OR Diplomacy, Anthropology, and Computer Skill present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Self-aware holoprogram of a 20th-century Las Vegas singer. His keen insights helped Bashir, Odo, Kira, Worf, Nog, and others aboard Deep Space 9 through difficult times.
name: Vic Fontaine
text: CIVILIAN DL/ Any card (if an opponent's dilemma just "stopped" a personnel present). Music

lore: "I am First Omet'iklan. And I am dead. As of this moment we are all dead. We go into battle to win back our lives. This we do gladly, because we are Jem'Hadar. Remember... victory is life."
name: Victory Is Life
text: Once per turn, downloads an Equipment card to a Jem'Hadar who just helped solve a mission or win a personnel battle against opponent's cards.

name: Vidiian Boarding Claw
text: Plays on any undocked ship present with your staffed, "unstopped" {Vidiian Cruiser}. Those ships may not fire WEAPONS at each other; yours may not move. Your personnel may travel through Claw to and from other ship. If other ship moves, both ships are first damaged (discard Claw). You may discard Claw during your turn.

lore: Combination disruptor/medical device. A neural resonator stuns potential victims; sophisticated quantum imaging scanners and microtransporters extract live organs from the unwilling donor.
name: Vidiian Harvester
text: Each of your Vidiians present is STRENGTH +2 and gains 1 MEDICAL, and in each battle one of them may stun one adversary they just engaged. (Cumulative.)

lore: After years of poverty, the Takarians were eager to be rid of their Great Sages. Fortunately, Chakotay and Tom Paris were there to keep them from being sent away on "wings of fire."
name: Villagers With Torches
text: Seeds or plays on table. Whenever opponent begins a planet mission attempt with fewer than three personnel, all are killed unless opponent has {Thermal Deflectors} in play.

name: Visit Cochrane Memorial
text: Seed or plays on {Earth}. (Unique.) When your unopposed [Ent-E] personnel or human ENGINEER personnel present, you may probe (once per game per persona): [Fed], [Sta]: "Oooh." Draw one card. [Event], [Interrupt]: "Aaaaah." Play one personnel to planet. [Fajo], [Equipment]: "Wow!" Download probe card (or a copy). [Non], [Doorway]: "I thought it'd be bigger." Discard one card.

lore: First officer under Klaa. Helped track the Enterprise by intercepting their distress signal and impersonating Starfleet Command. She has wonderful muscles.
name: Vixis
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Computer Skill Astrophysics DL/ {Incoming Message - Federation}

lore: Many planets suffer from geological instabilities. This can cause problems for unsuspecting - and unprepared - guests.
name: Volcanic Eruption
text: Place on planet if no facility is on planet. Now and start of every player's turn, randomly kills one of their personnel present. Nullified if {Thermal Deflectors} is in play.

lore: If gone unchecked, Cardassian voles quickly multiply. Chewing through power conduits, the prolific rodents pose a serious and widespread threat to computer systems.
name: Vole Infestation
text: Unless hand weapon OR ANIMAL OR {Guard Drone} present, place on ship. Disables special equipment; all attributes -2. To nullify, evacuate ship at your outpost until end of turn.

lore: In 2366, two Vorgons from the 27th century attempted to steal the Tox Uthat artifact uncovered on Risa by Jean-Luc Picard and Vash.
name: Vorgon Raiders
text: If you have {Ajur} and {Boratus} together in play, discard them and "steal" (use as your own) any one artifact in play or just played as an Interrupt card.

lore: Vulcan serving on U.S.S. Voyager. Twin of Taurik. Tried to bond with B'Elanna Torres when enduring Pon farr in 2373. Purged the blood fever in ritual Koon-ut-kal-if-fee.
name: Vorik
text: ENGINEER Mindmeld Physics Geology Anthropology

lore: Standard visual interface used by the Dominion. Virtual-reality eyepiece facilitates face-to-face communications and provides an unobstructed 360-by-360 view outside the ship.
name: VR Headset
text: Each VR headset aboard your [Dom] ship allows one Vorta, Jem'Hadar, or Cardassian present to enhance WEAPONS and SHIELDS +1 and (if Vorta) to serve as matching commander.

lore: Vulcan technique which suppresses the life signs of a subject, simulating death until the individual is revived. Spock "killed" his captain in order to prevent Romulans from executing him.
name: Vulcan "Death Grip"
text: Allows your Vulcan to save your other non-android present who was just mortally wounded or selected to be killed or captured. "Victim" is instead in stasis until end of turn.

lore: Ancient Vulcan ritual which telepathically links minds to intimately share each other's thoughts and knowledge.
name: Vulcan Mindmeld
text: Plays on your Mindmeld personnel. Personnel gains the skills of one of your other personnel present until end of turn. Discard interrupt.

lore: Vulcans are the only species known to use this method of rendering an opponent unconscious. However, Lt. Commander Data was able to master the technique.
name: Vulcan Nerve Pinch
text: Plays at start of personnel battle. Your Vulcans and Soong-Type Androids may each place one opposing personnel or {Rogue Borg} (random selection) in stasis until end of your next turn.

lore: Ancient Vulcan telepathic weapon. Kills by magnifying aggressive and violent thoughts, but can be blocked by peaceful thoughts.
name: Vulcan Stone of Gol
text: Place in hand until played as an Event card. Kills everyone in an Away Team without Youth OR CUNNING>7. Discard artifact.

lore: A wall display of all ships to bear the name Enterprise is a tradition built into each new ship of the line. This exhibit is in the observation lounge aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-E.
name: Wall of Ships
text: Downloads {any Enterprise}. Discard event. OR Plays on table. Adds 1 to RANGE, WEAPONS and SHIELDS of each of your Enterprises. (Cumulative.)

name: War Council
text: Seeds or plays on your [Neu] or [Non] facility (except {Colony} or a Nor). Your [Non] cards do not work with aligned cards and have standard attack restrictions. Each of your [Non] CIVILIAN and V.I.P. personnel native to this quadrant is CUNNING +2; once each turn, one such personnel reporting aboard may do so for free. OR Plays on your crew or Away Team that has 4 Treachery. Draw up to three cards; discard incident.

lore: In warp propulsion systems, if the magnetic confinement field collapses, matter and antimatter collide causing the ship to explode.
name: Warp Core Breach
text: Plays on any ship, except {Borg ship}. Ship explodes at end of owner's next turn, unless ENGINEER aboard by then. Discard after use.

lore: Investigate gravity wells in globular cluster.
name: Warped Space
text: SCIENCE x2 + Navigation + Astrophysics Opponent's side: Span: 1

lore: In an alternate timeline caused by the events of Narendra III, the Federation entered into war against the Klingon Empire. 40 billion lives were lost.
name: Wartime Conditions
text: Plays on table only if a Federation ship is attacked by another ship. While in play, the Federation may battle the attacking ship's affiliation at will.

lore: "Lower your shields and surrender your ships. We will add your biological and technological distinctiveness to our own. Your culture will adapt to service us. Resistance is futile."
name: We Are the Borg
text: Downloads two [Def] drones; discard event. OR Plays on table. Each turn, report one of your [Bor] cards for free or make an additional end-of-turn draw (immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}).

name: We Look for Things
text: Plays on your staffed Pakled ship. May discard incident to "acquire" one artifact, event, or equipment enhancing attribute(s) of an opposing ship present (once per game per card title). Opponent must give you that card (or download a copy of it) for your use. OR Downloads a copy of any artifact (as if earned), event, or equipment enhancing attribute(s) of an opponent's ship. Discard incident.

lore: Sensing the hive's thoughts, Jean-Luc Picard ordered all ships to fire on a critically vulnerable point, even though it did not appear to be a vital system.
name: Weak Spot
text: Plays on a ship being targeted by two or more ships. For this battle, reduces its SHIELDS by 4 (not cumulative) OR suspends its SHIELDS enhancement from any one card.

lore: Arms storage compartment used aboard a space station or starship. Accessible only with the proper authorization codes.
name: Weapons Locker
text: Plays on {Ops}, {Security Office}, {Cargo Bay} or any ship. If your personnel present are unopposed, your hand weapons may report there (for free if at a site).

lore: Bloodthirsty hologram programmed to be Hirogen prey. Turned the tables, leading the slaughter of 43 hunters during his escape. Became Iden's tactical officer.
name: Weiss
text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Anthropology Geology Opposing personnel are STRENGTH -1 where present.

lore: Bloodthirsty hologram programmed to be Hirogen prey. Turned the tables, leading the slaughter of 43 hunters during his escape. Became Iden's tactical officer.
name: Weiss*
text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Anthropology Geology Opposing personnel are STRENGTH -1 where present.

lore: Ensign Wesley Crusher was a child prodigy. Prot g of the Traveler. Son of Dr. Beverly Crusher. Saved the U.S.S. Enterprise 3 1/2 times as a teenager.
name: Wesley Crusher
text: OFFICER Youth Computer Skill Navigation ENGINEER Astrophysics

lore: "You have only one chance to save them now. Send them back to the ship."
name: Wesley Gets the Point
text: If you have {Wesley Crusher} present or on any planet, he scores bonus point and dies.

lore: Vorta field supervisor. Skilled negotiator. Key figure in the war effort. Reports directly to the Founder Leader. Self-proclaimed expert at telling - and spotting - lies.
name: Weyoun
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Treachery Law Biology

lore: Activated after his predecessor's suspicious death, this clone of the Vorta Weyoun had subtle errors. He hoped to end the Dominion War by defecting to Odo's side.
name: Weyoun 6
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Law Biology May replace any changeling present selected to die.

lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Dominion in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Vorta - Weyoun - is part of us now."
name: Weyoun of Borg
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Treachery Law Biology While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Dom].

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'Hadar Ship; Tractor Beam; Warship;
lore: Jem'Hadar warship under the command of Weyoun. Stationed at Terok Nor during the Dominion/Cardassian reoccupation of the mining station.
name: Weyoun's Warship
text: Invasive Transporters, Tractor Beam DL/ {Engage Shuttle Operations: Dominion}

lore: "Excuse me. I'd... just like to ask a question."
name: What Does God Need With a Starship?
text: Nullifies {"God}." OR Plays once every turn. Opponent chooses: you may download a ship to any location OR you may "stop" or "unstop" (your choice) any ship in play.

lore: The Traveler transcends space with thought. Took the U.S.S. Enterprise to Galaxy M-33, then to an even greater extragalactic distance.
name: Where No One Has Gone Before
text: Plays on table. Allows all your ships to leave one end of the spaceline and enter the other end.

lore: "This creature is not what she appears to be. She's an imp, and where she goes trouble always follows."
name: Where's Guinan?
text: If {Guinan} or {Madam Guinan} is in your crew or Away Team, relocate each El-Aurian present to any planet of your opponent's choice. (May be nullified only by {Guinan} if she has not already nullified a card this turn.)

name: White Deprivation
text: Seeds or plays on table. At start of every player's turn, all of that player's [KW] personnel present together must battle (and stun or mortally wound when able) opposing non-changelings present, or (if none) any non-changelings present, or (if none) each other (split randomly into two equal groups). Also, one [KW] personnel in each of that player's crews and Away Teams dies (random selection).

lore: Son of Matt Decker. Succeeded Kirk as captain of the Starship Enterprise, at the admiral's recommendation. Personally oversaw nearly every aspect of its refit.
name: Willard Decker
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Computer Skill Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Cook; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Commander William T. Riker is the executive officer of U.S.S. Enterprise. Imzadi to Deanna Troi. Gourmet cook. Jazz musician.
name: William T. Riker
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation Honor Music

lore: Commander Will Riker led Earth's first defeat of the Borg in 2367. In 2063, led the secret effort to repair the Phoenix and reinstate Earth's first warp flight.
name: William T. Riker (First Contact)
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor Music DL/ {Anti-Matter Spread}

lore: Sentry of the Parallax Colony. Only allows those whose hearts are joyous to pass.
name: Wind Dancer
text: To get past, {Lwaxana Troi} must be present OR at least one Away Team member must have: Youth OR Music OR STRENGTH>9.

lore: Lwaxana Troi suffered a collapse as a Betazoid defense from psychic trauma. The wolf symbolized a barrier in her metaconscious mind.
name: Wolf
text: Saves any personnel with Empathy who has been randomly selected to die or to be captured. OR Nullifies {Barclay Transporter Phobia}.

lore: Lieutenant Worf is chief of security on the U.S.S. Enterprise. Klingon warrior and Starfleet officer. Son of Mogh. Raised on Earth by foster parents.
name: Worf
text: SECURITY Honor x 2 Navigation Diplomacy

lore: Lt. Commander Worf was promoted in 2371. Klingon commander of U.S.S. Defiant during the Borg attack of 2373.
name: Worf (First Contact)
text: OFFICER Honor x 2 Leadership Navigation DL/ {Assimilate This!}

lore: 24th-century Klingon disguised as a 23rd-century trader. Brought back in time by Barry Waddle. Refused to discuss the mystery of the Klingon forehead ridges.
name: Worf (The Trouble with Tribbles)
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Navigation Anthropology Once per game, may capture {Barry Waddle} if present.

lore: Worf resigned his Starfleet commission to join Gowron during the 2367-68 Klingon Civil War. Saved the I.K.C. Bortas from destruction by Duras forces.
name: Worf Son of Mogh
text: SECURITY SECURITY Leadership Honor x 2 DL/ {Qapla'!} If with {Gowron} on {I.K.C. Bortas}, it is all attributes +3.

lore: An unstable tunnel through subspace that links to locations in normal space/time.
name: Wormhole
text: Requires two wormholes. Play one on your ship. Play the other at any location (even a time location). Ship relocates to that location (and then is "stopped").

lore: The Bajoran Wormhole is the only one known to be stable. One terminus is in the Alpha Quadrant near Bajor; the other, in the Gamma Quadrant near the Idran system.
name: Wormhole Navigation Schematic
text: Allows your ship with SCIENCE and Navigation aboard to travel through {Bajoran Wormhole} without being "stopped." (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.) OR Nullifies {The Three Vipers}.

lore: Study and negotiate for exclusive use of Barzan wormhole.
name: Wormhole Negotiations
text: Diplomacy x5 OR Honor x4 OR Treachery x4

lore: Advanced technology often causes natives to believe personnel are divine, as occurred for the U.S.S. Enterprise crew on Mintaka III and other worlds.
name: Worshiper
text: If Away Team's Greed>Honor, score bonus points. Otherwise, Away Team is stopped unless {Edo Vessel} or Anthropology present. Discard dilemma.

name: Writ of Accountability
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, downloads an FCA personnel; discard incident. OR Seeds or plays on table. Place on your [Fer] FCA personnel. If opponent has used {Subspace Schism}, {Brain Drain} or {Horga'hn} more than twice OR played {Static Warp Bubble}, {Anti-Time Anomaly} or {Black Hole} more than once OR used their own dilemma(s) to score more than 15 points or to discard other dilemmas, they lose the game.

lore: Jean-Luc Picard had intended to step through an Iconian Gateway to the U.S.S. Enterprise, but lack of time forced him to settle for a nearby Romulan Warbird instead.
name: Wrong Door
text: If opponent just used {Iconian Gateway}, redirect the exit to another planet. OR Nullifies one {Q's Tent} played from hand. OR Move {Revolving Door} to a different doorway.

lore: Famous lawman, gunfighter, and gambler. Reportedly never passed up an opportunity to earn money. Killed only when he had to. Recreated by the Melkotians.
name: Wyatt Earp
text: SECURITY Law Leadership Acquisition DL/ {Captured} (immediately target a Treachery personnel).

lore: Avaricious Ferengi. Plotted with Gegis and Nunk to extract the 3.6 million Borg nanoprobes from Seven of Nine's body and sell them at six bars of latinum per unit.
name: Yeggie
text: MEDICAL Greed Biology Cybernetics Treachery DL/ {Borg Nanoprobes} (if present with any Borg personnel).

lore: Matter-of-fact Vorta. Met a disorganized group of Ferengi aboard Empok Nor. Agreed to release Ishka in exchange for Keevan. Got less than he bargained for.
name: Yelgren
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology Music DL/ {Prisoner Exchange}

lore: State of increased readiness and watchfulness. Declared by a captain in anticipation of danger or when a crisis situation has lessened.
name: Yellow Alert
text: Plays on table. While in play, cancels (discards) and prevents {Red Alert!} AND all your Personnel are each CUNNING +1 (Not cumulative.) (Captain's Order.)

lore: Janice Rand is yeoman to Captain Kirk aboard the Enterprise. Captain of the Academy Diving Team in 2264-65. Student of horticulture and xenobotany.
name: Yeoman Rand
text: OFFICER Youth Biology ENGINEER DL/ {File Mission Report} [OS] personnel may file mission reports aboard her ship.

lore: Particularly brusque Klingon who aided Verad's takeover of Deep Space 9 in 2370. Immobilized Odo in a containment device.
name: Yeto
text: SCIENCE Treachery Stellar Cartography Transporter Skill

lore: On more than one occasion, Odo has assumed the form of a rodent in order to remain undercover during an investigation or conceal himself from a potential threat.
name: You Dirty Rat
text: Plays on your shape-shifter. It morphs into a rat (treated as disabled and may not be targeted or participate in battle). May morph back (discard interrupt) at any time.

lore: "If I return you to your ship, will you agree to give my request a full hearing?"
name: You Will in Time
text: If you began this mission attempt with only one personnel, opponent may name one of your unique personnel in play. That personnel is in stasis. On every turn, opponent may make a request of you; if you comply, remove personnel from stasis. (May not be nullified.)

lore: The genetic density of Species 8472 is superior to all known forms of life. Any wound inflicted by them will spread infection throughout a victim's body, consuming it from the inside out.
name: Your Galaxy Is Impure
text: Randomly select a personnel to be killed. Place on mission. At the start of each mission or scouting attempt here, kills one personnel present (your choice). (Immune to {Adapt: Negate Obstruction}.)

lore: An Acamarian of the clan Tralesta. Carrier of a microvirus engineered to instantly kill anyone with a particular genetic makeup.
name: Yuta
text: Opponent chooses a number X. Randomly examine crew or Away Team one by one. If (INTEGRITY + CUNNING - STRENGTH) = X, discard that personnel and dilemma.

lore: Zaldans, who look human except for their webbed fingers, are infuriated by courtesy. They view it as insulting dishonesty.
name: Zaldan
text: Unless 2 Treachery OR a {disruptor} OR {Wesley Crusher} OR Exobiology present, kills two Away Team members who have Diplomacy (random selection).

lore: Alien information storage device salvaged from John Doe's escape pod. Uses a chemically based system for molecular energy encoding.
name: Zalkonian Storage Capsule
text: Plays on table. Each turn, you may store one hand card here (may be returned to hand at any time). If destroyed, shuffle stored cards and place group on top or bottom of draw deck.

lore: Bajoran male who operates the Transit Aid Center on Deep Space 9. Stirred xenophobic sentiment against Odo during the Ibudan murder investigation.
name: Zayra
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Archaeology Transporter Skill May play {Hate Crime} as an interrupt where present.

lore: Kressari male. Commader of the Calondon. Agent who supplied Cardassian weapons to the Circle in 2370.
name: Zef'No
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill SECURITY Treachery Smuggling Stellar Cartography

lore: Inventor of warp drive. Reluctant hero. First human to make contact with an alien species. Likes tequila, rock 'n' roll, money and naked women.
name: Zefram Cochrane
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER x 2 Computer Skill Astrophysics May play {Visit Cochrane Memorial} on same planet.

lore: Gazing at the celestial harmony, Zefram Cochrane escaped the squalor of his time and dreamed of the conquest of space. And how much money he could make.
name: Zefram Cochrane's Telescope
text: Use as Equipment card. Once each turn, if on a planet with your personnel, allows you to glance at bottom seed card at one adjacent non-planet location.

lore: Nausicaan officer who stabbed young Jean-Luc Picard through the heart in a brawl at Starbase Earhart in 2327. Dom-jot player.
name: Zon
text: SECURITY OFFICER Treachery Guramba May nullify {Nausicaans} dilemma where present.

lore: The Ventaxians' ancestors sold the souls of the entire planet to their "devil," Ardra, in exchange for 1,000 years without war, famine or poverty. "As the hour of Ardra's return approaches, fear has overwhelmed my people..."
name: Acost Jared 2E
text: Anthropology Law Leadership

lore: The engineering staff of Deep Space 9 is faced with the constant challenge of making Starfleet, Cardassian, and Bajoran technology work together.
name: Altman 2E
text: Biology ENGINEER Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel; The Circle-related personnel;
lore: Representative of female Bajorans serving in the militia. Dispatched by General Krim to help the Circle secure Deep Space 9.
name: Anneli 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Arms dealer; Female; High Council; Nurse;
lore: Typical surgeon serving under Martok. Former nurse and arms dealer. She developed new combat stimulants and advised the High Council on their use.
name: B'amara 2E (Second Edition)
text: MEDICAL Biology Honor Physics Computer Skill

lore: After the retaking of Deep Space 9 in 2374, the number of Starfleet personnel aboard was increased in all departments. The medical staff was nearly doubled, in case of a surprise Dominion attack.
name: Bandee 2E
text: Biology MEDICAL Computer Skill

lore: Typical civilian researcher studying pre-warp civilizations throughout Federation space. Supervised an anthropological study on Mintaka III.
name: Barron 2E (Second Edition)
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Archaeology Geology

lore: Leader of the Eastern faction warring on Solais V. He was betrayed by his most trusted advisor during the first attempt at peace negotiations.
name: Berild 2E
text: Archaeology Law Leadership OFFICER

lore: "The Barzan has been a society dependent on others for generations. We want that to end. The appearance of this stable wormhole in our space provides us with our first true natural resource. We have neither the experience nor the technology to exploit it. But you do."
name: Bhavani 2E
text: Diplomacy Honor Law Leadership Physics

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Bodyguard; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Representative of Bajoran security officers serving aboard Deep Space 9. Often served as a bodyguard for visiting dignitaries and key personnel.
name: Brilgar 2E (Second Edition)
text: SECURITY Anthropology Law

lore: Identification: Calibration Drone Task: Track hive resource usage. Optimize. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eleven of Ninety 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Archaeology Biology Geology DL/ {Masaka Transformations} (targeting yourself).

lore: Typical Starfleet petty officer. She manned the bridge engineering station during Enterprise's battle with a group of augments in 2154.
name: Callaghan 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics Stellar Cartography Youth

name: Labor Camp 2E (Second Edition)
text: Plays on an {Ore Processing Unit} or your non-homeworld planet mission (for free if {Forced-Labor Camp} present). Start of each turn, if your [Car] or [Fer] personnel present is escorting a captive, score 5 points. (Unique.)

lore: "You were lucky, Kurn, but luck always runs out. Someday, I will stand over your broken corpse and drink to the victory of the Duras!"
name: Larg 2E (Piece of Baktag)
text: Biology OFFICER SCIENCE Treachery While this personnel is attempting a mission, he is attributes +1 for each Assault and Maneuver event you command (have in play) (limit +3).

lore: "The Prophets teach us that while violence may keep an enemy at bay, only peace can make him a friend."
name: Lasting Peace 2E
text: To play this interrupt, you must command (have in play) a [Baj] Diplomacy personnel. Order - Place an equal number of [Baj] personnel and non-[Baj] personnel from your discard pile on top of your deck in any order.

lore: "The truth is, not everyone can be a dabo girl. First of all, you have to be able to wear the clothes, and believe me, that's not easy."
name: Leeta 2E (Dabo Girl)
text: Anthropology Honor When this personnel is randomly selected during a mission attempt, you may make one of your other [Baj] personnel present gain one skill he or she already has until the end of that mission attempt.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Dabo Girl; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Dissident; Female;
lore: Inspired by the bravery of her husband Rom, Leeta joined in the underground efforts to oust the Dominion from Deep Space 9.
name: Leeta 2E (Rebel Supporter)
text: Anthropology Honor When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. While you have more than ten cards in your discard pile, each of your Dissident personnel present is attributes +1.

lore: Often light-years away from established judicial bodies, the senior staff of a starship is given some discretionary power in dealing with matters of law.
name: Legal Proceedings 2E
text: Plays on your planet mission. Add Law to this mission's requirements. When you complete this mission, score 5 points.

lore: "I have come to negotiate a Federation withdrawal from the borders, not to be dictated to by some mere captain." Commander: Reklar.
name: Lemec 2E (Posturing Negotiator)
text: Diplomacy Geology MEDICAL OFFICER Transporter Skill Treachery While you have a higher score than each of your opponents, this personnel is Cunning +2 and Strength +2.

lore: Member of the Trill ministry of science. One of her past hosts, Nilani, was married to one of Dax's past hosts, Torias.
name: Lenara Kahn 2E (Wormhole Theorist)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Physics SCIENCE When you play this personnel, you may examine the top four cards of your deck. You may reveal one event and take it into hand. Place the remaining cards on the bottom of your deck in any order.

lore: "Would an honorable warrior ever refuse a challenge?"
name: Let Honor Guide You 2E
text: Assault. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin combat (personnel battle) involving your [Kli] Honor personnel. If you win, randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: "...I have done what Bajor needed me to do. I've allowed myself to be a slave to my reputation all of these years. And now, it is enough."
name: Li Nalas 2E (Legend of Bajor)
text: Geology Honor Leadership OFFICER Bajoran Resistance. When you play this personnel, you may draw a card. When this personnel is killed, you must discard a card from hand.

lore: The threat of continued Dominion advances caused Starfleet to commit many ships and resources to the protection of Federation territory.
name: Line of Defense 2E (Second Edition)
text: Plays on table. Your ships are SHIELDS +3 while at missions with matching affiliation icons.

lore: "It's just like in the old days. Every once in a while the Cardassians would get too close, and we'd turn around and give them a bloody nose."
name: Lupaza 2E (Resistance Fighter)
text: MEDICAL Computer Skill SECURITY Transporter Skill When you play this personnel, you may download {Just Like Old Times}.

lore: "I didn't ask you about Minos Korva. I asked how many lights you see. ... I don't understand how you can be so mistaken."
name: Madred 2E (Calculating Captor)
text: Archaeology Obsidian Order OFFICER SECURITY Treachery x 2 When you play this personnel, you may download a [Pun] card.

lore: Proximity to severe stellar phenomena can disrupt shipboard systems. In 2364, intense magnetic fields from the Delos star overloaded many consoles on the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Magnetic Field Disruptions 2E (Second Edition)
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Astrophysics or Navigation. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

lore: Chief Archon. She believes efficient execution of Cardassian jurisprudence makes good viewing and is uplifting for the public.
name: Makbar 2E (Emissary)
text: V.I.P. Law x 2 Treachery x 2 DL/ {Any [Pun] card}

lore: "How am I supposed to protect this ship without proper weapons?"
name: Malcolm Reed 2E (Weapons Expert)
text: Honor Section 31 OFFICER SECURITY x 2 Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Augment; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: Devious augment from the time of Khan. Kept as a frozen human embryo until grown by Arik Soong.
name: Malik 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: SECURITY Leadership OFFICER Treachery x 2 When "stopped" by a dilemma, draw a card. When killed by a dilemma, discard your hand.

lore: A species with no native concept of spoken language, the Cairn communicate telepathically by sharing mental images. "The way my people communicate. It is... direct. Nothing is hidden."
name: Maques 2E (Cairn Delegate)
text: Diplomacy Honor Empathy x 2

lore: "The clan wars are over, Brull. It is a past we're ashamed of. It is why you had to leave. Now it is time to come home."
name: Marouk 2E (Sovereign of Acamar)
text: Diplomacy Law Leadership x 2 While a Gatherer is at this mission, he gains Geology and loses Thief.

lore: "Kahless said, 'Great men do not seek power, they have power thrust upon them.'" Commander: I.K.S. Rotarran.
name: Martok 2E (Leader of Destiny)
text: Honor x 2 Leadership x 2 OFFICER While this personnel is facing a dilemma, if you command (have in play) an Assault or Maneuver event, each of your Honor Klingons present is attributes +1.

lore: Member of the primary shift in Ops in Terok Nor. Unusually reserved for a Cardassian, he does his best to avoid making waves with the Bajorans and Jem'Hadar soldiers he is forced to work with.
name: Mavek 2E (Science Officer)
text: Biology Geology Navigation SCIENCE When you play this personnel, if your non-Cardassian is at this mission, you may download an equipment.

lore: Starfleet executive who authorized the early launch of Enterprise during the Broken Bow incident. Admiral who worked closely with the Vulcans.
name: Maxwell Forrest 2E (Broken Bow)
text: V.I.P. Law Leadership Diplomacy MEDICAL Your [Sta] personnel at [S] missions are attributes all +1.

lore: "It's for your own good, Benny. Wipe away the words. Destroy them before they destroy you."
name: Meaningless Words 2E
text: Unless you choose to discard the top three cards of your deck, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped.

lore: "...it's a practice that was abolished on our world centuries ago. ... A perverse source of pleasure, perhaps. A way to exercise control over another..."
name: Memory Invasion 2E
text: Your opponent examines your hand and chooses a card. Unless you choose to discard that card, randomly select three personnel to be stopped.

lore: "Yes, this is a tight enclosed space. Yes, there's not a lot of room to move. But a disciplined mind doesn't allow itself to be sidetracked by niggling psychological disorders like claustrophobia."
name: Mental Discipline 2E
text: Plays in your core (on table). When your unique personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a personnel with the same card title from hand to make him or her attributes +1 and gain one of the discarded personnel's skills until the end of that dilemma.

lore: "...the Maquis aren't killers. Our quarrel is with the Cardassians, not you. Leave us alone... we'll leave you alone." Commander: Guingouin.
name: Michael Eddington 2E (Noble Hero)
text: ENGINEER Leadership SECURITY Treachery While an opponent's ship is in an ship battle at this mission, that opponent cannot play interrupts.

lore: "I'm afraid I need to take command of the station for the next few hours."
name: Michael Eddington 2E (Traitor to Starfleet)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill SECURITY Treachery Order - Return this personnel to his owner's hand to return an opponent's Leadership personnel present to his or her owner's hand.

lore: Small, solar-powered, inorganic collective life-form native to Velara III. Sabotaged Federation terraforming operations to protest the destruction of their home.
name: Microbrain 2E (Second Edition)
text: To get past, one Exobiology OR Geology personnel (opponent's choice) is "stopped." Nullify with a personnel who has either 3 Exobiology OR 3 Geology.

lore: Many former prison inmates serve in the Militia out of a sense of obligation, so those who fought to win their freedom won't have to.
name: Militia Patrol 2E
text: Assault. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin personnel battle involving your Bajoran Resistance personnel. If you win, randomly kill three opponent's personnel involved. That opponent may lose 5 points to prevent this.

lore: "We will set up a muon feedback wave inside the transfer beam. The particles will accumulate in their dilithium chamber. When they go to warp speed, their engines will explode."
name: Mirok 2E (Interphase Researcher)
text: ENGINEER Physics SCIENCE Treachery When an opponent attempts this mission with an ENGINEER personnel, that opponent discards a card from hand.

lore: A changeling disguised as Ambassador Krajensky nearly tricked the crew of the U.S.S. Defiant into starting a war.
name: Misdirection 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: Unless SECURITY, Exobiology, and {any tricorder} OR Section 31 OR Mindmeld OR a changeling present, play on table as [Event]: Your personnel present with an infiltrator are CUNNING -2.

lore: Not a legal expert - just a dabo girl. Complained about the lurid requirements in her contract with Quark. Later advocated the abolition of such terms.
name: Sarda 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Honor Law DL/ {Intuition}

lore: "Once again, we've saved civilization as we know it."
name: Mission Accomplished 2E
text: Plays in your core (on table). When you complete a mission, if you command (have in play) a staffed ship at that mission with its Commander aboard, score 5 points.

name: Molecular Reversion Field 2E
text: Unless you have two personnel who each have INTEGRITY>5, CUNNING>5, and STRENGTH>5, or have two personnel who have total attributes>38, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship.

lore: One of many Reman soldiers under the command of Shinzon. Former deuterium purification specialist. He helped develop the thalaron radiation generator.
name: Chagrith 2E (Second Edition)
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Geology Physics

lore: Task: Evaluate analytical efficiency of Borg drones. Improve.
name: Computation Drone 2E
text: Navigation Computer Skill Each of your other Borg present is Cunning +1.

lore: "Reconciliation with the Gatherers is impossible. ... For almost a century now, they've been parasites, moving from star system to star system, living on what they could find or steal."
name: Dallan 2E
text: MEDICAL Navigation Physics

lore: Representative of one of the many young female officers stationed on Enterprise. Their experiences aboard would be invaluable in their careers.
name: Dallas 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: SCIENCE Physics
