lore: 1/2 Napean, 1/2 human representative of Starfleet engineers. Inherited his empathic sense from his mother. Formerly served at Utopia Planitia Yards.
name: Daniel Kwan 2E (Second Edition)
text: ENGINEER Physics Empathy

characteristicsKeywords: Android; Male; Soong-type android; The One-related personnel;
lore: Loyal brother of Lore. The Soong-type android was swayed by emotions to join The One's cause.
name: Data 2E (The Sky's the Limit)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Exobiology Biology Treachery Mortally wounds each opponent he stuns in battle.

lore: Geochemist representative of science specialists assigned to Galaxy-class starships. Intrigued by the symbiotic nature of the Trill species.
name: Davies 2E (Second Edition)
text: SCIENCE Physics Geology

lore: Still mindful of the bad timing of the withdraw from Bajor and the subsequent discovery of the wormhole, some Cardassians embraced alliance with the Dominion solely for the goal of subjugating the Bajorans once more.
name: Davin 2E
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Law Treachery When you play this personnel, discard the top card of an opponent's deck.

lore: Typical Bajoran vedek. He collects antique Bajoran mandalas. Tried to acquire one in an auction at Quark's Bar in 2373. Interested in human culture.
name: Dohlem 2E (Second Edition)
text: CIVILIAN Youth Anthropology Diplomacy Navigation

lore: Characteristic of male Klingon warriors supporting attempts by the House of Duras to regain power after their defeat in the Klingon Civil War.
name: Dokar 2E (Second Edition)
text: OFFICER Biology Treachery Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Holodeck; Invasive Transporters; Tractor Beam;
lore: Twice the size of a Galaxy-class starship, battleships of this design served in the Alpha Quadrant war.
name: Dominion Battleship 2E (Things Past)
text: Attributes all +3 if Founder, Vorta, and Jem'Hadar aboard. Holodeck, Tractor Beam, Invasive Transporters.

lore: Typical Reman surgeon. Doctor who worked under The Viceroy aboard the Scimitar in 2379. He studied the cloning techniques used in creating Shinzon.
name: Dralvak 2E (Second Edition)
text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology Treachery

lore: Mercenary pilot freed from a Cardassian prison by Quark. He was one of the men hired by Rao Vantika to help steal a deuridium shipment from Deep Space 9.
name: Durg 2E
text: Acquisition Exobiology MEDICAL Navigation Treachery

lore: Typical Obsidian Order operative trained in exobiology and medical interrogation. Expert at surgically altering operatives for long-term assignments.
name: Emok 2E (Second Edition)
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Obsidian Order

lore: "Kivas finds a way to get what he wants from his people. His rewards for loyalty are lavish. His punishments for disloyalty are equally lavish. You won't find anyone here who'll help you escape."
name: Flink 2E
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER MEDICAL

lore: Male Shape-shifter serving as a representative of the Founder population. Greeted Odo when he returned to the Great Link.
name: Founder Architect 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: V.I.P. While attempting a mission, X=number of different events in play. Astrophysics Law

lore: Being a navigator on the Enterprise NX-01 is an exciting experience. Visiting new worlds and seeing new stars is definitely worth the time put in at Starfleet Academy.
name: Gaeta 2E
text: Anthropology Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Navigation When you play this personnel, choose an opponent. That opponent must discard the top card of his or her deck for each headquarters mission he or she has in play.

lore: "We Gatherers value our freedom. We do what we want and we answer to no creature."
name: Galnar 2E
text: Navigation Computer Skill SCIENCE

lore: Representative Starfleet officer serving aboard the NX-class ships in the 2150s. The crew routinely faced illness and injury in the line of duty.
name: Garrid 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: MEDICAL Biology SCIENCE

lore: Talented Ferengi officer. Recruited by Bok to help in the capture and ransom of Jason Vigo. Devotee of the Rules of Acquisition.
name: Gozar 2E (Strange New Worlds)
text: OFFICER Acquisition Exobiology Leadership Navigation Treachery Diplomacy

lore: Leader of the Western faction warring on Solais V. His level-headedness at the first, failed attempt at peace talks helped keep the channels of dialogue open.
name: Grenis 2E
text: Geology Leadership OFFICER

characteristicsKeywords: Benzite; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel;
lore: Benzite female. One of many runabout pilots stationed on DS9. Transported a survey team to Torga IV in 2373. Was married by Benjamin Sisko.
name: Hoya 2E (Second Edition)
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Navigation

characteristicsKeywords: Jem'Hadar; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Representative of Jem'Hadar soldiers posted to Terok Nor in 2374. Second assigned to protect the Founder Leader during visits to Odo's quarters.
name: Imat'Korex 2E (Call to Arms)
text: SECURITY Biology Computer Skill

lore: A telepathic species with the ability to retrieve lost memories, the Ullians undertook a project to build a 'library' of thoughts, recovered from species throughout the galaxy. "We believe that the history of a world is contained in the personal experience of its people."
name: Inad 2E
text: Anthropology Biology Exobiology Honor Empathy

lore: Bajorans on the Infirmary staff proved every bit as reliable as the Starfleet personnel.
name: Jabara 2E (Second Edition)
text: Exobiology MEDICAL Computer Skill

lore: Yridian informant. Told Worf of the secret prison camp in the Carraya system. Likes to tinker with his warp drive. Commanded a Yridian Shuttle.
name: Jaglom Shrek 2E (Energize)
text: CIVILIAN Navigation Physics Transporter Skill Greed DL/ {Jaglom Shrek - Information Broker}

characteristicsKeywords: T'Lani; Harvester Virus-related card; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Representative of male T'Lani who worked together with their former Kellerun enemies to destroy the weapon known as the harvester virus.
name: Jakin 2E (Call to Arms)
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation

lore: Typical Glinn of the Third Battalion. Psychotropic drug test subject. Revived from stasis on Empok Nor when a Starfleet salvage team arrived in 2373.
name: Jerax 2E (Second Edition)
text: SECURITY Biology Geology

lore: Representative of Reman navigators serving aboard the Scimitar. A former assault trooper, he was recruited to join a boarding party in 2379.
name: Jorvas 2E (Second Edition)
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Navigation SECURITY

lore: "The thing to remember is that the Klingons prefer to use their knives and bat'leths in close combat. So if we get boarded, you can expect severe lacerations, broken bones, and blunt force traumas."
name: Kahmis 2E
text: Leadership SECURITY Transporter Skill

lore: "Fear of the Dominion has given my people an excuse to do what they were born to do. To fight. And to conquer."
name: Khos 2E
text: Biology MEDICAL Navigation OFFICER When an opponent's personnel is killed, this personnel is attributes +2 until the end of this turn (limit +4).

lore: "Quark, you obsequious toad, your so-called Gamma Quadrant merchandise had better be legitimate or I'll toss you out the nearest airlock."
name: Kolos 2E
text: Acquisition Navigation Transporter Skill

lore: For a Klingon seeking glory in relics of the past, the greatest hope is to find the long-lost Sword of Kahless.
name: Kroval 2E
text: Archaeology Geology SCIENCE

lore: Though most Ferengi seek profit without physical confrontation, others cite the 52nd Rule of Acquisition as reason for a more direct approach: "Never ask when you can take."
name: Krunk 2E (Strange New Worlds)
text: ENGINEER Physics Transporter Skill

lore: Wary of bizarre rumors and skeptical of any significant financial opportunities, the Ferengi largely avoided contact with the Federation for many decades.
name: Letek 2E (Strange New Worlds)
text: Biology Geology OFFICER Treachery While you have a higher score than each of your opponents, this personnel is attributes +1 and gains MEDICAL and Treachery.

lore: The Caldonians are well-respected as scholars dedicated to pure research. Their representative in the Barzan wormhole negotiations was thus understandably intimidated by the potential administrative demands of a winning bid.
name: Leyor 2E
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Diplomacy SCIENCE

lore: Typical relief operations officer in the 24th century. Relishes the chance to explore new frontiers. Originally considered a security career.
name: Lian T'su 2E (Second Edition)
text: OFFICER Navigation Transporter Skill Astrophysics

lore: Representative of junior security officers aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Assigned to compile the duty roster for his department.
name: Lopez 2E (Second Edition)
text: SECURITY Biology Honor DL/ {Federation PADD}

lore: Follower of Kahless. Representative of young male Klingons eager to study the teachings of Kahless at the sacred Boreth monastary.
name: Losta 2E (Energize)
text: OFFICER Geology Navigation Youth DL/ {Lower Decks} (if present with {Kahless} or on {Boreth}).

lore: Grizzled leader of a Maquis cell. Former resident of Juhraya. Trusted Ro Laren despite Kalita's caution. Knows someone will take his place. Likes hasperat.
name: Macias 2E (Energize)
text: CIVILIAN Leadership MEDICAL Exobiology May exchange for a [Maq] personnel in your discard pile.

lore: "...without the drug, the Jem'Hadar will run amok, killing everyone and everything in their path. ...If the Cardassians can't bring down the minefield and re-open the supply line from the Gamma Quadrant, they should poison the last ration of white, eliminating the Jem'Hadar before it's too late."
name: Magren 2E
text: Biology MEDICAL Physics

lore: Versatile class of ship designed early in the 24th century by the Federation. Crew complement can vary widely.
name: Maquis Raider 2E (Energize)
text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: One of many staff doctors assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise. Took charge of sickbay in 2368 after Beverly Crusher was incapacitated.
name: Martin 2E (Second Edition)
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Computer Skill

lore: Representative of the veteran officers assigned to Enterprise. Starfleet hoped their experience would prove useful in deep space.
name: McDermott 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: OFFICER Honor Leadership SECURITY Transporter Skill

lore: Established over 500 years ago, the Detapa Council ostensibly leads the Cardassian government. Over time, its true power has eroded as the Central Command and Obsidian Order have acted with increasing autonomy.
name: Megar 2E
text: Anthropology Biology Law

lore: Typical Klingon operative. She was ordered by Gowron to observe commercial operations within the Bajoran sector of 2373. Collector of bronze statues.
name: Meraht 2E (Second Edition)
text: OFFICER Klingon Intelligence Transporter Skill Honor Exobiology Anthropology

lore: Although there was some initial friction, Starfleet and Bajoran security forces aboard Deep Space 9 were soon working together smoothly.
name: Mills 2E
text: Geology Physics SECURITY

lore: With the influx of resources from their treaty with the Dominion, the Cardassians were able to significantly increase the size of their fleet. However, most Cardassian shipyards were converted to the construction and maintenance of Jem'Hadar ships.
name: Modern Galor 2E
text: Tractor Beam. When you play this ship, discard a card from hand. If you command (have in play) a [Dom] personnel, you may then draw a card.

lore: Representative Ferengi security officer. Often part of away teams to strange, new worlds. Helped steal an energy converter. Disgusted by clothed females.
name: Mordoc 2E (The Next Generation)
text: SECURITY Stellar Cartography Treachery Transporter Skill

lore: The trust among a mercenary crew grows shorter as the time between payoffs grows longer. "I did not come this far to be cheated. I want it all. Now."
name: Narik 2E (Energize)
text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill

lore: "The Praetor's power has always been the Romulan fleet. They must be behind Shinzon for him to have overthrown the Senate."
name: Noram 2E
text: Exobiology Leadership OFFICER

lore: Genetically engineered soldiers, the Jem'Hadar have no interest in glory and no tolerance for politics. They cannot be bribed or reasoned with. They are consummate professionals, ultimate weapons.
name: Noret'ikar 2E
text: Geology Leadership OFFICER Transporter Skill

lore: "No Jem'Hadar has ever lived thirty years. ... If we reach twenty we are considered 'Honored Elders.'"
name: Odera'Klen 2E
text: Anthropology SECURITY

lore: "...my business here is crucial. It demands immediate attention. And as a member of the Cardassian Central Command I must assure you, Commander, that what we have to discuss is most crucial indeed."
name: Parn 2E (Second Edition)
text: Archaeology Diplomacy Leadership OFFICER Treachery

lore: One of many human astrophysicists aboard Deep Space 9 who studies the Bajoran Wormhole. Stayed with her crew during the siege of 2370.
name: Paulson 2E (Second Edition)
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Transporter Skill

lore: "I don't think we can look at space travel the same way anymore. We're going to have to change. ... It won't be easy at all."
name: Rabal 2E
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill

lore: Jem'Hadar Sixth representative of soldiers stationed aboard Terok Nor during the Dominion occupation of 2374. Struggled to decipher Cardassian egotism.
name: Rak'tazan 2E (Call to Arms)
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Astrophysics

lore: Task: Recover cybernetic components from non-functional Borg drones. Redistribute.
name: Reclamation Drone 2E
text: ENGINEER MEDICAL When your Borg present is about to be killed by a dilemma, you may stop your other Drone present to place that Borg on top of his or her owner's deck instead.

lore: Identification: RECONNAISSANCE DRONE Task: Scout areas where resistance is anticipated. Secure. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
name: Six of Ninety-Six 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: Exobiology SECURITY Transporter Skill Navigation When you play this personnel, you may shuffle any deck then peek at the top two cards.

lore: Middleman in a network that smuggled crystals off the Tallonian homeworld. In an uncharacteristic show of cooperation, Quark and Odo attempted a sting on the operation in 2372.
name: Regana Tosh 2E
text: Acquisition Geology SCIENCE Treachery

lore: Demilitarized Zone colonist typical of those who joined the Maquis. Enjoys fishing. Believes his family has bad luck.
name: Reide 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Exobiology Physics

lore: Identification: REQUISITIONS DRONE Task: Assess resources for evaluation. Obtain. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species
name: Six of Seven 2E (Reflections 2.0)
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Physics Once per game, may download {Bynars Data Transfer} in place of your normal card play.

lore: Relatively new members of the Federation, the Bolians have quickly distinguished themselves in all branches of Starfleet service. Rixx became the first Bolian to command a Federation starship when he was given the U.S.S. Thomas Paine.
name: Rixx 2E
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Leadership OFFICER

lore: "The Dominion has endured for 2,000 years, and will continue to endure long after the Federation has crumbled into dust."
name: Rodak'koden 2E
text: Honor Physics SECURITY Transporter Skill When you play this personnel, if you command (have in play) a Vorta, you may draw two cards, then discard three cards from hand (only discard two if you command (have in play) an event in your core (on table)). When you play this personnel, if you command (have in play) a Vorta, you may draw two cards, then discard three cards from hand (only discard two if you command (have in play) an event in your core (on table)).

lore: Typical low-level member of the Obsidian Order. Captured during Enabran Tain's attack on the Founder homeworld and held at Internment Camp 371.
name: Rogesh 2E (Second Edition)
text: SCIENCE Obsidian Order Physics Navigation Treachery

lore: Representative of the many senators navigating the perilous and delicate political landscape on Romulus. Seeks to better the Star Empire for his two sons.
name: Sabrun 2E (Second Edition)
text: V.I.P. Law Diplomacy Exobiology

lore: One of many colonists living on Volan III in the Demilitarized Zone. Bolian member of Cal Hudson's Maquis cell. He helped plan Dukat's kidnapping.
name: Sark 2E (Energize)
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Transporter Skill

lore: One of many ambassadors serving in the Federation Diplomatic Corps. Distant relative of Earth politician. Gambler and poker player.
name: Seth Mendoza 2E (Second Edition)
text: V.I.P. Anthropology Diplomacy Law

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Prylar;
lore: Prylar representative of members of the Bajoran clergy. Maintains the shrine aboard Deep Space 9.
name: Shandor 2E (Second Edition)
text: CIVILIAN Archaeology Diplomacy Honor

lore: Zalkonian captain. Sought to capture criminals undergoing a dangerous mutation before they could further disrupt society.
name: Sunad 2E (Second Edition)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Physics Law

lore: "Senators, consider the opportunities for the Empire. At last, the destinies of the planets Romulus and Remus will be united. Shinzon of Remus is offering us a chance to make ourselves stronger!"
name: Talvin 2E
text: Anthropology Geology OFFICER

lore: Over a century after the Gatherers left Acamar, the clan divisions that drove them away were still fundamental to their way of life - and death. "... there are no other members of the Lornak clan here, so I claim his possessions."
name: Temarek 2E
text: Biology Geology SECURITY

lore: Characteristic of Reman assault troops. Soldier who fought in many conflicts during the Dominion War. He is eager to serve Shinzon and The Viceroy.
name: Thexor 2E (Second Edition)
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Transporter Skill Treachery DL/ {Reman Disruptor Rifle}

lore: Vorta advisor sent to Deep Space 9 by the Founders. Replaced Weyoun. Witnessed the surrender of the Dominion to the Alpha Quadrant alliance.
name: Tholun 2E (Call to Arms)
text: MEDICAL Archaeology Computer Skill Treachery Law

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Representative of Cardassian technicians stationed on Terok Nor in 2374. Assigned to analyze the changes to the repurposed ore processing facilities.
name: Thorel 2E (Call to Arms)
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Geology

lore: Typical Vulcan admiral. She presided over Worf's extradition hearing in 2372. Threatened to hold both Worf and Ch'Pok in contempt of court.
name: T'Lara 2E (Second Edition)
text: V.I.P. Leadership Law Exobiology Mindmeld

lore: Tamarian first officer. One of many sons of Tama. "Kiteo, his eyes closed. Picard and Dathon at El-Adrel. Mirab, with sails unfurled. Temba, at rest."
name: Togaran 2E (Second Edition)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Leadership Transporter Skill

lore: "If your soldiers are addicted to a drug that can't be replicated and only you can provide, that gives you a great deal of control over them."
name: Tozara'Kesh 2E
text: ENGINEER Exobiology Navigation OFFICER

lore: Most Klingons inducted into the Order of the Bat'leth spend much of their lives focused only on reaching that goal. Others see it as a chance to atone for a past wasted in pursuits not worthy of a true Klingon.
name: T'vis 2E
text: Diplomacy Honor Law SECURITY

lore: One of several Starfleet designs introduced in the 2370s, the Sovereign-class starship would become the Federation's primary deep-space exploration vessel.
name: U.S.S. Sovereign 2E
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Of the Federation's many research departments, the Archaeology Council is among these most limited by the Prime Directive. It has nevertheless been responsible for countless discoveries on planets throughout the quadrant.
name: Van Orton 2E
text: Archaeology Biology SCIENCE

lore: Jem'Hadar Third previously assigned to the Dominion relay station on Callinon VII. Administrator Kilana's pilot on several key missions.
name: Varen'agor 2E (Call to Arms)
text: OFFICER Biology Navigation Physics

lore: In 2286, the Lornak clan of Acamar massacred their Tralesta rivals, ending a long blood feud. That violence still marks the surviving Lornak in the eyes of the Gatherers - and the few others who still believe in clan vengeance.
name: Volnoth 2E
text: Anthropology Archaeology ENGINEER Exobiology

lore: One of the honored few selected to crew the I.K.S. Negh'Var on its glorious maiden voyage to invade the Cardassian homeworld.
name: Vorax 2E
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Geology Computer Skill

lore: Shot in the chest by the Lenarians, Jean-Luc Picard's life was left hanging in the balance due to the damage his artificial heart received.
name: A Bad End 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Kills half of your "stopped" personnel at this location (your choice, round up). To get past requires 2 Biology.

lore: "It has been too long since you last fought at my side. But now that time has come again. We will do great deeds in the coming days. Deeds worthy of song."
name: A Chance for Glory 2E
text: Assault. Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin personnel battle or a ship battle involving your [Kli] personnel. If you win, score 10 points.

lore: Brothers Krit and Nahsk were Morn's co-conspirators in the Lissepian Mother's Day Heist. Their run-in with Quark could have been much less pleasant.
name: A Pleasant Surprise 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: To get past, "stop" a personnel with CUNNING>6 and either Diplomacy or Treachery (random selection).

lore: Q gave Jean-Luc Picard the opportunity to change the reckless mistakes of his youth and live a life free from danger.
name: A Second Chance at Life 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Discard a non-personnel card from hand to report a personnel from your discard pile. Discard event.

lore: "Don't you see? I have to be punished, we all have to be punished. Major, you have to go out and tell them I'm Gul Darhe'el."
name: Aamin Marritza 2E (Honorable Patriot)
text: Honor x 2 Computer Skill While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may discard an event from hand to make him gain a skill of your choice that he does not already have until the end of that mission attempt. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: Intercept Starfleet officer en route to shore leave.
name: Abduction Plot 2E (Second Edition)
text: Transporter Skill + Treachery + CUNNING>34 + (any Intelligence + Leadership OR Law + OFFICER) Opponent's side: [FED] Navigation x3 + SHIELDS>6 [Fed] shuttlecraft may report with crew (limit 2) here.

lore: "It's not clear to me yet why the Prophets made me their Emissary, but I know that they gave me back my life for a reason."
name: Akorem Laan 2E (Revered Poet)
text: Anthropology Law Navigation Physics While two [Baj] personnel are in your discard pile, this personnel is attributes +2.

lore: Ship tasked with investigating criminal activity in Cardassian space. In 2369, it pursued the Bajoran terrorist Tahna Los to Deep Space 9.
name: Aldara 2E (Energize)
text: Tractor Beam. While you have a higher score than each of your opponents, each of your Cardassians aboard this ship is CUNNING +1.

lore: "Good luck charm" aboard the I.K.S. Rotarran with a talent for mishaps. 3/4 Klingon, 1/4 human son of Worf and K'Ehleyr. Joined the House of Martok.
name: Alexander Rozhenko 2E (Metamorphosis)
text: ENGINEER Honor Transporter Skill Youth If aboard your ship when it wins a battle, draw a card.

lore: Conscientious admiral who defected to the Federation in 2366. Disinformed by Romulan High Command. Neither a butcher nor a hero.
name: Alidar Jarok 2E (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Navigation DL/ {Tactical Scan} OR {Life-form Scan}

lore: Vindictive Criminal and Lethean Thief who assaulted Julian Bashir while stealing bio-mimetic gel in 2371. He was later arrested by Odo.
name: Altovar 2E (Emissary)
text: MEDICAL Empathy Exobiology Treachery x 2 DL/ {Lethean Telepathic Attack} (as an event, where Altovar present).

lore: "So what do we do now?"
name: Alyssa Ogawa 2E (Enterprise Medical Assistant)
text: Biology Exobiology Medical When your other personnel present is about to be killed, you may stop this personnel and place a card from hand on top of your deck to place that other personnel on top of your deck.

lore: Mediate an end to Gatherer raids in this area.
name: Amnesty Talks 2E (Second Edition)
text: Anthropology + Diplomacy x2 + Law OR Leadership + SECURITY + Treachery x2 OR {Marouk}

lore: Academy Superintendent during the Nova Squadron incident in 2368. Promoted to rear admiral prior to accepting the post. A formidable woman.
name: Andrea Brand 2E (Second Edition)
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Navigation Law Transporter Skill

lore: In 2365, two Antedeans planned to bomb the conference on Pacifica. Without Lwaxana Troi's help, Starfleet would not have learned their robes were lined with explosive ultritium.
name: Antedean Assassins 2E (Second Edition)
text: To get past, one Anthropology OR Empathy personnel (opponent's choice) must be "stopped." Nullify with a personnel who has either 2 Anthropology OR 2 Empathy.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Capturing-related card; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: "Father" of many augment embryos from the time of Khan. Skilled doctor and geneticist. Human who traded goods and data with the Orion Syndicate.
name: Arik Soong 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: MEDICAL Biology x 2 Archaeology Treachery x 2 Cybernetics May release captives here.

lore: A plot to maintain military tensions between the Klingons and the Federation targeted key personnel for elimination.
name: Assassination Attempt 2E (Second Edition)
text: Opponent may download an assassin here. Unless Transporter Skill and a personnel with INTEGRITY>7 OR a personnel with SECURITY x2 present OR no assassin on planet, one personnel is killed (random selection).

lore: General Chang, Admiral Cartwright, and others conspired to derail the Federation-Klingon peace process by assassinating key leaders on both sides.
name: Assassination Plot 2E (Energize)
text: Name a skill. Kill an opposing personnel (random selection) with that skill present with your assassin. Return your assassin to owner's hand. Discard event.

lore: "The previous tenant."
name: Assimilation Techniques 2E
text: Replicate - Discard a [Bor] card from hand. (You may discard a [Bor] card from hand when you play this event. If you do, put this event in your hand instead of destroying it.) To play this event, you must command three [Bor] personnel. Download an interrupt. Destroy this event.

lore: "We've been using your plasma exhaust..."
name: Assist Cloaked Ship 2E
text: Diplomacy + ENGINEER + OFFICER + Transporter Skill + INTEGRITY>33 You may attempt and complete this mission using your [Kli] personnel with these requirements: Leadership + Navigation + SECURITY + Treachery + STRENGTH>36.

lore: "Space. The great unknown. Only now, we're going to know it a little better."
name: Astrometrics Lab 2E
text: Plays in your core (on table). Order - Discard a card from hand to make your ship with your Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography personnel aboard RANGE +2 until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "You can tell Baran that I'm working as fast as I can."
name: Authenticate Artifacts 2E
text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Anthropology or a personnel who has 2 Archaeology, your opponent chooses an Anthropology or Archaeology personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: Repair severe damage at automated facility.
name: Automated Repair Station 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: Physics + Computer Skill + ENGINEER + CUNNING>30 Solving player may download and use {Spacedock} here.

lore: "I am not sure that I remembered all of the codes for the security system. You should warn anyone going down there."
name: Automated Weapons 2E
text: Unless you have 2 Security or a Hand Weapon, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then all your other personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: On Cardassia Prime, no crime goes unsolved and all criminals are punished. With conviction guaranteed before trial, the people's faith in Cardassian justice is assured.
name: Awaiting Trial 2E (Second Edition)
text: Plays on table (for free if you have three [Car] personnel in play). At the end of each of your turns, if you have a captive, draw an extra card. (Cumulative.)

lore: "I do not understand."
name: B-4 2E (Dangerous Simpleton)
text: Computer Skill While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may reveal three Androids from hand to make him Cunning +7 and gain Intelligence and Treachery. These effects last until the end of the mission attempt. You may only do this once each turn.

lore: Conducting illicit negotiations with a pair of volatile Klingons requires an experienced eye and careful haggling, much like the day-to-day life of a tailor.
name: Back Room Dealings 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Treachery or INTEGRITY<4. To get past requires STRENGTH>24 remaining.

lore: "In war, there is nothing more honorable than victory."
name: BaH! 2E
text: Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin a ship battle involving your [Kli] ship. That ship is Weapons +1. If you win, score 10 points.

lore: Lightship built by Ben Sisko in 2371 from ancient Bajoran designs. Has artificial gravity. Unexpectedly traveled beyond Bajor's Denorios Belt.
name: Baraka 2E (Tenth Anniversary Collection)
text: Solar Sail DL/ {Shipwright}

lore: Bajorans often seek guidance from their religious leaders. Members of the Vedek Assembly help many fellow Bajorans explore their pagh and gain enlightenment.
name: Esteemed Vedek 2E (Second Edition)
text: Plays on table; download a Vedek personnel. Also, while in play, each [Baj] personnel is INTEGRITY +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: "That's pitiful! A crew of Ferengi scrap peddlers could do better than that. Select another target. We'll do it again."
name: Battle Drills 2E
text: Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin an ship battle involving your ship with your Gul aboard. That ship is Weapons +2. If you win, randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: Investigate unusual bio-readings.
name: Battle Reconnaissance 2E (Call to Arms)
text: ENGINEER + Computer Skill + Transporter Skill + STRENGTH>32

lore: "The truth is, I quit the Academy because... I realized I couldn't make it in Starfleet. And believe me, no one was sorry to see me go."
name: B'Elanna Torres 2E (Creative Engineer)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 When an opponent is about to discard a card from hand, you may place a card from your hand on top of your deck to randomly select that opponent's card from all eligible cards.

lore: "I'm already involved in a very messy, very bloody business. And the only way I can see to end it is to bring the Romulans into the war. I'm prepared to do whatever it takes to accomplish that goal..."
name: Benjamin Sisko 2E (Man of Resolve)
text: Diplomacy ENGINEER Leadership OFFICER SECURITY Order - This personnel loses Diplomacy and gains Treachery until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "You're looking in the wrong corner for a hero, ma'am. I've made the best of a bad life for my crew. That's my contribution."
name: Benjamin Sisko 2E (Outlaw)
text: Acquisition Anthropology Biology Leadership Navigation Order - Choose one for this personnel to gain: "Honor personnel present are Cunning +1"; or "Treachery personnel present are Cunning +1". This effect lasts until this order is executed again.

lore: Shipwright Benjamin Sisko built and commanded the Baraka, a replica Bajoran lightship. Human. Recreated a legendary interstellar journey.
name: Ben Sisko 2E (Tenth Anniversary Collection)
text: ENGINEER Honor Navigation Astrophysics Anthropology DL/ {Construct Starship}

lore: "The Sisko is of Bajor, but he will find no rest there."
name: Benjamin Sisko 2E (The Emissary of the Prophets)
text: Anthropology Archaeology Diplomacy x 2 Honor x 2 Leadership x 2 When you play another non-Treachery Bajoran at this mission, you may discard a card from hand to draw a card. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: While coordinating the evacuation of the Bajoran moon Jeraddo, Kira Nerys found herself sympathizing with the stubborn farmer Mullibok.
name: Between Duty and Respect 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: To get past requires Geology, Leadership, and OFFICER OR Honor, Archaeology, and SCIENCE (all requirements doubled if 4 or more Bajor Region missions in play).

lore: "I can't overestimate the danger of Thalaron radiation... A microscopic amount could kill every living thing on this ship..."
name: Beverly Crusher 2E (Chief Medical Officer)
text: Biology Exobiology MEDICAL x 2 Computer Skill When your other personnel present is about to be killed, you may discard a card from hand to place that personnel on top of your deck. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "My feelings about my husband's death will have no effect on the way I serve you, this vessel, or this mission."
name: Beverly Crusher 2E (Chief Physician)
text: Biology Exobiology MEDICAL x 2 When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, you may take a [TNG] personnel from your discard pile into hand.

name: Bleeding to Death 2E
text: Unless you have Biology + MEDICAL x2 OR Honor x2 + INTEGRITY>30, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then place this dilemma in your core (on table). At the start of each of your turns, place the top card of your deck on this dilemma. When you complete a mission, all your cards here are shuffled and placed on top of your deck, then this dilemma is removed from the game.

lore: "Hirogen vessels produce an ion wake approximately 5,000 meters long. Inside it, there's too much interference for their sensors to detect anything."
name: Blind Spot 2E
text: Plays on your ship. When an opponent's ship moves away from this mission, this ship may follow using its RANGE from your next turn.

lore: "While in our space, your vessel will not exceed warp three, and your weapons systems will remain off-line. You will avoid unnecessary scans, and you will not conduct surveys of any kind. You will make no attempt to explore our space. And you will avoid all communications with non-military craft."
name: B'omar Stipulations 2E
text: Unless you have Diplomacy + CUNNING>30 OR Leadership + STRENGTH>30, all of your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: "You did what you had to do. You did what you thought best. I just made sure you listened to yourself."
name: Boothby 2E (Groundskeeper)
text: Anthropology Honor Each of your Cadets is attributes +1 while he or she is facing a dilemma.

lore: "Take every last man, form a boarding party, armed heavily. ... We are Klingons!"
name: Born for Conquest 2E
text: Assault. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin personnel battle involving your [Kli] Officer personnel. If you win, score 10 points and randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: Selfless hero held prisoner on Cardassia IV. Bajoran willing to sacrifice himself to rescue Li Nalas. Never gave up hope of returning him to Bajor.
name: Borum 2E (Energize)
text: MEDICAL Resistance Honor DL/ {Starfleet Type II Phaser} May exchange for a [Baj] leader in your discard pile.

lore: "...they will die. But not before they kill me for betraying them..."
name: Bound By Addiction 2E
text: Replicate - Kill your Jem'Hadar. (You may kill a Jem'Hadar you command when you play this event. If you do, put this event in your hand instead of destroying it.) To play this event, you must command three [Dom] personnel. Place a Jem'Hadar that you do not command from your hand on your ship. Destroy this event.

lore: Cardassian warship commanded by Ocett. One of two vessels sent to investigate a significant Federation archaeological discovery in 2369.
name: Bralek 2E (Second Edition)
text: Tractor Beam DL/ Any [TNG] [Car] personnel

lore: "By the time the Dominion is done with you, all you'll want is a quick death."
name: Bred for Battle 2E
text: Assault. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Discard two cards from hand to begin personnel battle involving your Jem'Hadar. Your non-Jem'Hadar present are not involved in the personnel battle. If you win, randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: "Praetor, this is the man known as Sloan. Unlike the doctor, his mind is quite susceptible to our data retrieval methods. Under questioning, he has confirmed much of what the doctor and the senator have told you."
name: Broken Captive 2E
text: Your opponent chooses one of his or her captives. Unless you have the skills on that captive, all your personnel are stopped.

lore: "You don't like me. ... No problem. I have many friends that don't like me."
name: Brull 2E (Encampment Leader)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Diplomacy Honor Leadership Navigation

lore: "Intruder alert! ... Security detail to deck 29."
name: Brutal Struggle 2E
text: Assault. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin combat (personnel battle) involving your Leadership personnel. If you win, randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: "Ever since the Bajorans overthrew the Cardassian Empire, they've been getting more and more aggressive."
name: B'tanay 2E
text: Tractor Beam. When you play this ship, remove all the cards in your discard pile from the game.

lore: "My apologies, Captain. I'm afraid the Jem'Hadar are sadly deficient in the social graces. You and I should talk in private."
name: Building a Bridge 2E
text: To play this event, you must command (have in play) three [Dom] personnel. Plays in your core (on table). When you complete a mission, for each Vorta that used any of his or her skills to complete that mission, each opponent discards a card from hand and you may draw a card.

lore: Diagnostic tech on the NX-01. Has a keen sense of hearing. Trained with Lt. Reed to become a bodyguard.
name: Burrows 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Astrophysics Transporter Skill May volunteer for random selections (if applicable).

lore: Thieves, time travel, mysterious artifacts, and digging in caves made for a refreshing change from the demands of commanding a starship.
name: Captain's Holiday 2E (Second Edition)
text: To get past requires 2 Archaeology OR 2 Geology.

lore: Whether preparing captives for interrogation, trial, torture, incarceration, punishment, or other purposes, Cardassian methods are well-established.
name: Cardassian Processing 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: Unless Diplomacy, Honor, Transporter Skill, and CUNNING>30 OR Law, SECURITY, and STRENGTH>40, one personnel is captured (random selection).

lore: From supplies to raw materials to contraband, there are as many kinds of cargo as there are places in the galaxy to take it.
name: Cargo Run 2E
text: Plays on your space mission. Add Acquisition to this mission's requirements. When you complete this mission, score 5 points. (Unique.)

lore: Commander Donatra appealed to Suran for support when she came to realize not only that do the ends not justify the means, but that Shinzon's goals had little to do with hers.
name: Change of Heart 2E
text: To play this interrupt, you must command three [Rom] personnel. When a random selection is made by a dilemma, you may ignore its results and select again.

lore: "They mush have done it in the past. They went back and assimilated Earth."
name: Changed History 2E
text: Plays on table. When you win an ship battle involving your [Bor] ship, you may reveal the top card of the loser's deck. If it is a personnel you do not have in play, you may place him or her on that ship. (You now control that personnel).

lore: "Say what you came to say. But I doubt I'm going to believe you."
name: Chorgan 2E (Leader of the Gatherers)
text: Law Leadership Physics Transporter Skill While this personnel is facing a dilemma, if another Gatherer is present, this personnel is attributes +1 and gains Diplomacy and Leadership.

lore: "...perhaps they're giving us some sort of behavioral test. Like a laboratory rodent who must work his way out of a maze."
name: Chula: Move Along Home 2E
text: Randomly select three personnel. If the highest Strength among those personnel is even, all three of them are stopped.

lore: Battle over strategically significant system.
name: Clash at Chin'toka 2E (Call to Arms)
text: ENGINEER + Navigation + two leaders + CUNNING>36

lore: "You will withdraw or I will be forced to destroy your ship and your away team."
name: Clear Ultimatum 2E
text: To play this interrupt, you must command (have in play) three [Rom] personnel. Order - Examine an opponent's hand. Choose an event or interrupt revealed. That opponent discards it.

lore: To outrun the reflexes and agility of his Jem'Hadar captors, Miles O'Brien used the even swifter response time of a transporter's energizing coil.
name: Close Call 2E (Call to Arms)
text: One personnel present (random selection) is killed if that personnel does not have Computer Skill or Transporter Skill. To get past requires 2 Diplomacy OR 3 SECURITY remaining.

lore: A hologram of Lewis Zimmerman wanted to delete The Doctor's growing interest in music to stabilize the EMH's program.
name: Cluttering Irrelevancies 2E (Strange New Worlds)
text: Once per turn, plays at start of mission attempt to target your [Holo] personnel. That personnel gains any skill until the end of the mission attempt, then returns to hand.

lore: Although there are many command styles, the best leaders share the ability to make difficult decisions and take swift action in a crisis.
name: Command Decisions 2E (Second Edition)
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you stop a personnel with Leadership or OFFICER. To get past requires STRENGTH>24.

lore: "As first officer, it is my responsibility to point out any actions that may be mistakes by a commanding officer. Sir." "Then maybe it's time you found other responsibilities. You're relieved."
name: Confined to Quarters 2E
text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel has Leadership, all three are stopped.

lore: Prevent the spread of a lethal disfiguring virus - at any cost.
name: Control Plague 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: Biology + Exobiology + MEDICAL x2 + CUNNING>34

lore: "Direct hit, sir. Moderate damage to their aft shield generators."
name: Crippling Attack 2E
text: Unless you have Leadership x2 + OFFICER OR Navigation x2 + SHIELDS>6, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then this dilemma is placed on your ship.

lore: "'...and let slip the dogs of war.'"
name: Cry "Havoc!" 2E
text: Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin an engagement (ship battle) involving your Leadership personnel. If you win, randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: "Your work is finished. The Orb you are seeking. The Orb of the Emissary... You're never going to find it."
name: Cultist Attack 2E
text: Pah-wraith. To play this interrupt, you must command (have in play) a [Baj] Treachery personnel. Order - Each player removes all interrupts in his or her discard pile from the game.

lore: Klingon honor and Ferengi greed are not a natural match. To win the heart of Grilka, Quark had to dispel many Klingon prejudices against the Ferengi.
name: Cultural Differences 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Acquisition or Anthropology. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

lore: "Life is an endless stream of choices. Unfortunately, you have chosen to make my life more difficult."
name: Cyrus Redblock 2E (Civil Criminal)
text: Acquisition Leadership Treachery For each [Crime] event you have in play, this personnel is attributes +2 (limit +6)

lore: "I'm Captain Kathryn Janeway. This is Commander Tuvok. We're from the Federation starship Voyager."
name: Damaged Reputation 2E (Second Edition)
text: If INTEGRITY>50, lose 5 points. To get past requires 2 Diplomacy OR any Intelligence and 2 Treachery OR STRENGTH>30 (STRENGTH>50 if this is a [DQ] mission).

lore: "...I'm willing to spill a little Klingon blood to get the job done..."
name: Damar 2E (Loyal Glinn)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Order - If this personnel is present with your Gul, shuffle your deck. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: Irascible Gul assigned to pursue Tahna Los. Captain of the Aldara. Has mapped Klingon, Romulan, and Starfleet-patrolled space for the Cardassian Union.
name: Danar 2E (Emissary)
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation ENGINEER Stellar Cartography

lore: Deep underground passages such as those on Xantoras pose a problem for transporters. Without climbing skills, they may also pose a problem to away team personnel.
name: Dangerous Climb 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Unless STRENGTH>40 OR 2 Geology and CUNNING>20 present, kills one Away Team member (random selection).

characteristicsKeywords: Human/Alien; Male; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
lore: "I come from right about here ... approximately nine hundred years from now."
name: Daniels 2E (Temporal Agent)
text: Anthropology Section 31 Physics SECURITY When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, return him to his or her owner's hand.

lore: The Butcher of Gallitep. Gul and labor camp commandant during the occupation of Bajor. Later impersonated by former file clerk Aamin Marritza.
name: Darhe'el 2E (Second Edition)
text: ENGINEER Treachery x 2 Exobiology Geology Leadership DL/ {Fajo's Gallery}

lore: "I aspire, sir. To be better than I am."
name: Data 2E (Aspirer)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Exobiology OFFICER Computer Skill x 2 While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he is Integrity +2 and gains Honor.

lore: DGMA Continental Championship 2005
name: Data 2E (Aspirer)*
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Exobiology OFFICER Computer Skill x 2 While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he is Integrity +2 and gains Honor.

lore: Pinocchio-like in his desire, the Soong-type android would gladly trade his superior abilities to be human. Learning to whistle "Pop Goes the Weasel."
name: Data 2E (The Next Generation)
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Astrophysics ENGINEER When reported, select Anthropology, Physics, or Navigation.

lore: "Darmok on the ocean. ... Tanagra on the ocean. Darmok at Tanagra. ... Jalad on the ocean. Jalad at Tanagra. ... The beast at Tanagra. ... Darmok and Jalad on the ocean." Commander: Tama.
name: Dathon 2E (Speaker of Tama)
text: Diplomacy x 2 Honor x 2 Leadership OFFICER While your other Diplomacy personnel is present, you may meet Strength requirements of each dilemma this personnel faces using Integrity instead.

lore: Ship's counselor and occasional ambassador. 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 human. Formerly romantically involved with William T. Riker as his imzadi.
name: Deanna Troi 2E (The Next Generation)
text: OFFICER Empathy Anthropology Diplomacy Honor DL/ {Intuition} DL/ {Life-form Scan}

lore: Starship work is hazardous. When danger arises, one must place the good of the crew ahead of one's own life.
name: Dedication to Duty 2E (Energize)
text: One unique personnel is "stopped" (random selection). Choose one: kill that personnel OR opponent may draw cards equal to the number of [*] on that personnel. Mission continues.

lore: "...one disaster after another keeps bringing us back together..."
name: Defend Our People 2E
text: Replicate - Discard a [Maq] personnel from hand. (You may discard a [Maq] personnel from hand when you play this event. If you do, put this event in your hand instead of destroying it.) To play this event, you must command three [Fed] [Maq] personnel. Each opponent places a random card from hand on top of his or her deck. Destroy this event.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Warbird commanded by Tomalak. Often assigned to the Neutral Zone. Encountered the U.S.S. Enterprise twice in 2366.
name: Deranas 2E (Second Edition)
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam Attributes all +2 in Neutral Zone.

lore: Permanently close ancient portal held by renegade Jem'Hadar.
name: Destroy Iconian Gateway 2E (Call to Arms)
text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Physics + STRENGTH>34

lore: The bitterness of defeat and the exultation of triumph have taught many leaders a great lesson: they must preserve in peace what they have won in war.
name: Dignitaries and Witnesses 2E (Reflections 2.0)
text: To get past requires INTEGRITY>20 and an Admiral OR STRENGTH>30 and a General OR CUNNING>30 and 3 Leadership OR STRENGTH>20 and a Maje.

lore: Powerful form of folded space transport, capable of penetrating all known shields and forcefields. Repeated use of the technology causes a fatal degradation of the subject's cellular chemistry.
name: Dimensional Shifting 2E (Second Edition)
text: During your turn, discard a random card from hand to place any number of your personnel and equipment at one mission aboard any ship at the same mission.

lore: "Come see for yourself...You'll realize I'm telling the truth."
name: Diplomatic Offer 2E
text: Play on table. When your [Sta] Diplomacy personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to make that personnel attributes +1 and gain Leadership. These effects last until the end of that dilemma. You may only do this once each turn.

lore: "Captain Picard, may I welcome you in the time-honored tradition of my people..."
name: Diplomatic Overture 2E
text: Plays on a mission, if your [Fed] Diplomacy personnel is at that mission. While a Diplomacy personnel is at this mission, that personnel's owner must discard a card from hand to use his or her skills.

lore: Sensors are essential for navigation, research, and tactical response.
name: Disable Sensors 2E
text: Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Begin an ship battle involving your Leadership personnel. If you win, place this event on an opponent's ship involved. Otherwise, destroy this event. Hull: -35% Personnel aboard this ship cannot attempt missions.

lore: Surprise attacks and boarding parties, such as the incident orchestrated by Valeris and General Chang in 2293, can wreak havoc on unsuspecting vessels.
name: Disgraceful Assault 2E (Energize)
text: Opponent may [Flip] (or [Flip] [Flip] if they have an [Objective] in point area). Unless 2 SECURITY and Transporter Skill present, one personnel (opponent's choice) is killed. Discard dilemma.

lore: "There was an alien here who'd taken Romulan form. I was firing at her. The doctor got in the way."
name: Disruptor Accident 2E
text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless you choose to kill that personnel, he or she and a second randomly selected personnel are stopped.

lore: "There's no doubt, Captain. Right down to your regressive strain of Shalaft's Syndrome. He's a clone."
name: DNA Analysis 2E
text: Unless you have a personnel who has MEDICAL x2 or a personnel who has SCIENCE x2, your opponent chooses a MEDICAL or SCIENCE personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: To deter tampering with its deadly mission, the Dreadnought's security systems included an identity check of anyone boarding the vessel.
name: DNA Security Scan 2E (Energize)
text: To get past, must have 2 ENGINEER, 2 Computer Skill, and CUNNING>15X. X=number of [Objective] cards in opponent's discard pile (limit 6). Nullify with {Scan Cycle Check}.

lore: "Are you truly prepared to have your hands drenched in blood? He's not planning to defeat Earth, he's planning its annihilation. And his sins will mark us and our children for generations." Commander: Valdore.
name: Donatra 2E (Compassionate Patriot)
text: ENGINEER Leadership OFFICER Physics While this personnel is facing a dilemma, she gains Honor and Security.

lore: Two assassins boarded Kronos One, slaughtering any crew in their path and fatally wounding Chancellor Gorkon. Gorkon's final words begged Kirk to continue the peace initiative.
name: Don't Let It End This Way 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Kills half of your "stopped" personnel at this location (your choice, round up). To get past requires 2 SECURITY.

lore: Acting chief petty officer on the U.S.S. Valiant. Red Squad cadet from Tycho City, Lunar Colony. She misses the beauty of dawn on the moon.
name: Dorian Collins 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: ENGINEER Anthropology Honor Youth Geology, Transporter Skill (if with another cadet).

lore: "A true victory is to make your enemy see they were wrong to oppose you in the first place. To force them to acknowledge your greatness."
name: Dukat 2E (Liberator and Protector)
text: Diplomacy Leadership OFFICER Treachery x 2 When this personnel uses a skill to complete a mission, each of your opponents discards the top three cards of his or her deck. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: Call to Arms Release September 2003
name: Dukat 2E (Liberator and Protector)*
text: Diplomacy Leadership OFFICER Treachery x 2 When this personnel uses a skill to complete a mission, each of your opponents discards the top three cards of his or her deck. You may do this only once each turn.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Duras-related; High Council; High Council; Male;
lore: Son of a traitor, Ja'rod, and a traitor himself. Member of the Klingon High Council.
name: Duras 2E (Life From Lifelessness)
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Law Diplomacy Computer Skill Once each turn, may kill an opponent's personnel here that just completed a mission.

lore: "What appeared in the form of Captain Rice is an intelligence gathering device used during the Ersalrope Wars..." "If it's found out, it encases the subject to await a more detailed interrogation later."
name: Echo Papa Stasis Field 2E
text: Randomly select an OFFICER or SECURITY personnel to be stopped.

lore: "Why Constable, you seem positively disappointed in me. ... you considered me a close friend. No wonder you feel betrayed."
name: Elim Garak 2E (Agent of the Obsidian Order)
text: Exobiology Obsidian Order Computer Skill SECURITY Treachery While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may discard a personnel from hand to give him one of the discarded personnel's skills until the end of that mission attempt.

lore: "Did you know there are over five thousand subspecies of termites on Loracus Prime?"
name: Elizabeth Cutler 2E (Eager Entomologist)
text: Biology Exobiology While this personnel is attempting a planet mission and the first mission you completed this game was a space mission, she gains Exobiology and Geology.

lore: Portable transport technology capable of beaming a single target over a short distance. Data carried a prototype version of the device.
name: Emergency Transport Unit 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: You may return this equipment to hand to prevent a personnel present from being killed by a dilemma (that personnel is placed on your ship here and is "stopped").

lore: "I always suspected you'd be famous, just never thought you'd be more famous than me."
name: Emory Erickson 2E (Father of the Transporter)
text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill x 3 While this personnel is facing a dilemma, each ENGINEER personnel present is attributes +1 and gains Transporter Skill.

lore: "It's accelerating. You have no more time for games."
name: Empathic Touch 2E (Second Edition)
text: When your personnel is about to be killed, if your Empathy personnel is present, stop both personnel to prevent that.

lore: Retired mastermind planning a dramatic comeback. Working with the Tal Shiar and his fellow Cardassians to destroy the Founders. Mentored Elim Garak.
name: Enabran Tain 2E (The Gamma Quadrant)
text: V.I.P. Obsidian Order Tal Shiar Treachery x 2 SECURITY DL/ {Combined Strike}

lore: Negotiate with natives for use of their newly-constructed starbase.
name: Encounter at Farpoint 2E (Second Edition)
text: Empathy + Exobiology + Honor + INTEGRITY>25 OR Acquisition + Diplomacy + Treachery + CUNNING>30

lore: Test security vulnerabilities of harsh work camp and devise escape plan.
name: Escape Gulag 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: Geology + Transporter Skill + ENGINEER + CUNNING>36 Opponent's side:[KLI] SECURITY x2 + Geology + ENGINEER + Law

lore: Plotted to seize control of the Enterprise using psychotropic devices cleverly disguised as a fun and addictive game.
name: Etana Jol 2E (Ktarian Operative)
text: Exobiology x 2 MEDICAL Computer Skill SCIENCE Treachery Order - If this personnel is aboard your ship, discard a personnel or ship from hand that matches her ship's affiliation to draw a card. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: Maneuver among icy comet fragments during hot pursuit.
name: Evade Dominion Squadron 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Stellar Cartography + Navigation x2 + CUNNING>34 + (Geology OR Leadership)

lore: "Do you deny that the Federation is engaging in organized terrorist activities against the Cardassian people? Deliberately undermining this treaty?" Commander: Vetar.
name: Evek 2E (Attache to the Demilitarized Zone)
text: Anthropology Diplomacy Law Leadership OFFICER SECURITY When you play this personnel, you may discard a card from hand to download a Capture card.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Captain; Capturing-related card; Gul; Male;
lore: Harsh interrogator who excels in extracting confessions from Maquis terrorists. Gul. Patrols the Badlands as captain of the Vetar.
name: Evek 2E (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Leadership If you hold a captive, gains Biology and Law.

lore: "You two, get out there and see that no one gets through that door!"
name: Explicit Orders 2E
text: When your [Dom] personnel is attempting a mission, discard a [Dom] personnel of a different species from hand to make him or her gain the discarded personnel's skills until the end of that mission attempt.

lore: Though most starships are outfitted with emergency forcefields in the event of a hull breach, there is unfortunately a slight delay before they can be activated.
name: Explosive Decompression 2E (Second Edition)
text: Kills X personnel (random selection), where X=number of opponent's [Univ][S] mission with point boxes. If >9 personnel remain, opponent may [Flip][Flip].

lore: When advanced technology is damaged, the power flowing through those systems can instead arc through adjacent walls and across passageways.
name: Exposed Power Relay 2E (Energize)
text: X personnel (random selection) are stopped, where X=number of opponent's missions showing 25 points or less. Cannot get past if >9 personnel remain.

lore: When Kira Nerys encountered her doppelganger from the mirror universe, they were both taken aback by not only their similarities but also their differences.
name: Eye to Eye 2E (Reflections 2.0)
text: Player with the most cards in hand chooses two personnel to be stopped. If tied, cannot get past.

lore: After encountering a quantum duplicate of herself and the U.S.S. Voyager crew, Kathryn Janeway worked with her doppelganger to try to prevent further death or damage.
name: Face to Face 2E (Energize)
text: Player with the least points chooses one personnel to be killed. If tied, ship is damaged and stopped until end of next turn.

lore: "Once we get back to Enterprise and we can finally understand each other, the first words out of your mouth better be 'thank you.'"
name: Failure To Communicate 2E
text: Unless you have a personnel who has Anthropology x2 or a personnel who has SECURITY x2, your opponent chooses an Anthropology or SECURITY personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: The skill of a Klingon warrior is feared only slightly more than the fury of the Klingon temper.
name: Ferocity 2E
text: Assault. Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). When you win personnel battle or an ship battle involving your [Kli] personnel, you may destroy this event to randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved. (Unique.)

lore: To prevent the assassination of Captain Kirk in 2268, the crew of the U.S.S. Defiant needed to blend into the background of daily life aboard the Starship Enterprise.
name: Fitting In 2E (Fractured Time)
text: Plays once each turn to give your non-[AU] personnel a skill from an [AU] personnel present until end of turn.

lore: The universe is full of hucksters, charlatans, swindlers, confidence men, and Ferengi.
name: Flim-Flam Artist 2E (Energize)
text: Your opponent may immediately draw a card. To get past requires Diplomacy and 2 Computer Skill OR Law and CUNNING>32 (CUNNING>50 if this is a [DQ] mission).

name: For the Sisko 2E (Energize)
text: Plays on table if you have three [Baj] personnel in play. In place of your normal card play, discard a non-personnel card from hand to place two [Baj] personnel from your discard pile on top of your draw deck.

name: Forcing Their Hand 2E
text: To play this event, you must command (have in play) three [Rom] personnel. Plays in your core (on table). An opponent may play a card he or she owns that is on this event as if that card were in his or her hand. At the start of each of your turns, place each card here in its owner's discard pile. Order - Place a random card from an opponent's hand on this event. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "We shall always retain the best part of the other... inside us."
name: Forever Linked 2E
text: Plays in your core (on table). When your personnel is killed, you may place him or her on this event. (You no longer command (have in play) him or her.) When your [Fed] personnel is facing a dilemma, you may place a personnel from this event in his or her owner's discard pile to make that [Fed] personnel gain a skill from that discarded personnel until the end of this turn.

lore: The Prophets would not respond to Kai Winn's prayers despite her zeal. Dukat, in his lust for power, twisted her rejection to the service of the Pah-Wraiths.
name: Forsaken 2E (Call to Arms)
text: To get past requires 2 Honor OR 2 Treachery. Each Honor or Treachery personnel that helps overcome this dilemma is placed on the bottom of owner's draw deck.

lore: "The resonator was believed to have been destroyed during the Time of the Awakening. Only one piece is known to have survived and it was placed in a Vulcan museum under heavy guard. A year ago, that piece was stolen from the museum. Soon after, mercenary ships began raiding archaeological sites across the quadrant."
name: Fortune 2E (Raider for Hire)
text: While your Treachery personnel is a board this ship, he or she is attributes +1 for each Artifact you have in play (limit +3). Tractor Beam

lore: "What you need is clarity. I can give you that."
name: Founder Leader 2E (Beguiling Teacher)
text: Anthropology Exobiology Leadership x 2 SCIENCE Treachery When you play this personnel, each of your other [TN] personnel is Cunning +1 until the end of this turn.

lore: The steadfast obedience of the Jem'Hadar to their leaders often made working with other species difficult.
name: Friction 2E (Reflections 2.0)
text: Plays on table if you control three [Dom] personnel. Each non-Jem'Hadar personnel enters play "stopped."

lore: "Before I went into that interrogation center, I asked the Prophets to give me strength to get the rest of you out of there. And... in exchange I... I said I'd give up my life. ... it only cost me an arm. I felt that the Prophets were generous."
name: Furel 2E (Resistance Fighter)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Biology ENGINEER Geology When you play this personnel, you may download {Resistance Tactics}.

lore: Legendary starship captain. In 2267, met "Lieutenant" Sisko. 17 temporal violations. "The man was a menace."
name: Captain Kirk
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 May initiate battle against non-[Fed]. DL/ {Captain's Log} May stun adversary he just engaged. Once every turn, may "stop" one female present.

lore: Conn officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2364. Son of two Starfleet officers. Blind at birth, he has used the VISOR to see since the age of five.
name: Geordi La Forge 2E (The Next Generation)
text: OFFICER At [S]: Navigation, Astrophysics, Stellar Cartography At [P]: ENGINEER, Physics, Computer Skill

lore: When it comes to logic and emotions, Romulan women may differ from Vulcan women, but that is not the only thing Spock finds distracting about Commander Charvanek.
name: Getting Under Your Skin 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: Plays on table if you control three [Rom] personnel. Once each turn, when you play an event on table, opponent reveals top card of deck. If it is a personnel, score 5 points. (Unique.)

lore: Gifted terraformer who in 2370 planned to crown his career by reigniting the burned-out star Epsilon 119. Failure - and modesty - do not agree well with him.
name: Gideon Seyetik 2E (Second Edition)
text: SCIENCE Each time he helps solve a mission requiring SCIENCE, you may draw a card. Astrophysics Physics x 2

lore: "It has been my experience that... men just don't seem to have a head for this sort of thing. That's why women dominate the sciences."
name: Gilora Rejal 2E (Subspace Researcher)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Computer Skill SCIENCE While this personnel is facing a dilemma, she gains Physics and SCIENCE.

lore: Although some creatures have intricate greeting rituals, others will defend themselves violently at the first sign of danger.
name: Gomtuu Shock Wave 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Unless 2 Diplomacy and INTEGRITY>32 OR Empathy and INTEGRITY>35 present, all undocked ships at this location are damaged and relocated one location toward far end of spaceline.

lore: "We can handle all the pleasantries later. Now, let's get down to business. I'll match anyone's best offer, and add the gold on top of it."
name: Goss 2E (Direct Negotiator)
text: Acquisition MEDICAL OFFICER Treachery While you have six or more cards in hand, this personnel gains Diplomacy, Transporter Skill, and Treachery.

lore: "By right and tradition, I am the sole leader. All who oppose me are traitors." Commander: I.K.S. Bortas. Chancellor
name: Gowron 2E (Sole Leader of the Empire)
text: Honor Law Leadership x 2 SECURITY When your Honor Klingon present is about to be stopped or killed by a dilemma, you may discard a Treachery Klingon from hand to prevent that. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "I cannot tell you how grateful I am, captain. The Klingons were going to execute me tomorrow. Of course, they say that every day. It's one of the little games they like to play."
name: Grathon Tolar 2E (Hologram Forger)
text: ENGINEER Exobiology Computer Skill x 2 Treachery x 2

lore: "According to the Federation database, it travels through subspace, emerging occasionally without warning."
name: Graviton Ellipse 2E
text: Unless you have (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography), Engineer, and Physics OR Shields + unused RANGE this turn>13, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship.

lore: "Our best guess is that the tetryon field reacted to the probe's shielding, producing a massive graviton wave."
name: Graviton Wave 2E
text: Unless you have Astrophysics or Stellar Cartography + Physics + CUNNING>32 OR Biology + MEDICAL x2, randomly select a SCIENCE personnel to be killed.

lore: "The FCA has ears everywhere."
name: Grimp 2E (Pessimist)
text: Acquisition Computer Skill Transporter Skill Order - Discard four [Rule] cards from your hand to score 5 points.

lore: "We must do this again some time."
name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner? 2E
text: Choose a personnel who has Diplomacy OR INTEGRITY>6 to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

lore: Maquis raider commanded by Michael Eddington in retaliatory strikes against Cardassian colonies. Uses many components salvaged from ambushed ships.
name: Guingouin 2E (Energize)
text: Once each turn, may land or take off using 1 RANGE.

lore: "...we have you completely surrounded and outnumbered. Would you like something to eat, Captain? Or maybe something to drink?"
name: Gunboat Diplomacy 2E
text: Plays in your core (on table). When you play a Vorta, you may choose an opponent to choose one: you may download a Jem'Hadar; or each player scores 5 points.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Romulan warbird sent to investigate the Neutral Zone incursion of two Federation starships in 2365. It covertly pursued one of them to the lost homeworld of the Iconians.
name: Haakona 2E (Second Edition)
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. When you play this ship, you may download {Engage Cloak} or a [Pursuit] card.

lore: "All of us in this colony have been living in the dark ages. It's like we're victims of a 200-year-old joke. Until you came, all we could see was to the wall of our biosphere. Suddenly our eyes have been opened to the infinite possibilities."
name: Hannah Bates 2E (Biosphere Expert)
text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill SCIENCE

lore: Argrathi criminal remediation relies on false memories of imprisonment. After being accused of espionage, Miles O'Brien received a memory of a 20-year incarceration.
name: Hard Time 2E (Reflections 2.0)
text: One personnel (random selection) is returned to hand; X = the number of [*] on that personnel. To get past requires at least X personnel remaining.

lore: When the Chameloid Martia took the form of Captain Kirk on Rura Penthe, the warden of the penal colony was unsure who was the escapee and who was the doppelganger.
name: Head to Head 2E (Energize)
text: Player with most points chooses one personnel to be killed. If tied, two personnel killed (random selection) and Away Team stopped until end of next turn.

lore: Disillusioned with a modern Klingon society corrupted by the illusion of peace, Korris and Konmel sought to live their lives like true Klingons.
name: Heart of Glory 2E (Energize)
text: Plays on your Klingon (for free if {Korris} or {Konmel}). X varies, where X=number of personnel this Klingon stuns or mortally wounds (limit three). (Unique.)

lore: Banished from the Continuum, Q lamented his transformation into a "normal, imperfect, lumpen human being."
name: Helpless 2E (Reflections 2.0)
text: One Away Team member is chosen (random selection). If that personnel does not have a skill in mission requirements, that personnel and one other personnel (random selection) are "stopped" (even if playing Borg).

lore: "The FCA's involved now. And those Nausicaans working for Brunt aren't just for show."
name: Hired Muscle 2E
text: Unless you have Acquisition x2 OR choose to discard three cards from hand, your opponent chooses a [Non] personnel to be placed on top of his or her owner's deck.

lore: "Senators, are there any others who wish to speak?" Praetor.
name: Hiren 2E (Romulan Praetor)
text: Archaeology Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Diplomacy Law Treachery When you play this personnel, you may download {Prejudice and Politics}.

lore: The Melkotians, a race of xenophobic telepaths, could project powerful hallucinations into the minds of trespassers in their territory, drawn from the historical images in their minds.
name: History Repeats Itself 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Randomly select three personnel (or six personnel if more than nine personnel present). If any of those personnel has Anthropology, all three of them are "stopped".

lore: Uneasy educator recruited to be Captain Archer's communications officer. Fluent in countless languages. Capable relief cook.
name: Hoshi Sato 2E (Straight and Steady)
text: SCIENCE Music Anthropology Geology Computer Skill Exobiology DL/ {We're Ready}

lore: Test revolutionary shield design within star's superdense corona.
name: Host Metaphasic Shielding Test 2E (Second Edition)
text: Diplomacy + ENGINEER + Navigation + SCIENCE When you solve, may download {Metaphasic Shields} here.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: "...this is our last chance. If we cannot reach the Albino, we can at least die an honorable death trying to reach him."
name: I.K.S. Lukara 2E
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam While your [Kli] personnel at this mission is in personnel battle, you may add this ship's Weapons to your total Strength.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Attack cruiser that competed to solve an archaeological puzzle uncovered by Federation scientist Richard Galen. The ship's captain was less than pleased with the outcome of the chase.
name: I.K.S. Maht-H'a 2E
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. While an opponent's Archaeology personnel is at this mission, that opponent must discard a card from hand to use that personnel's skills.

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Klingon Defense Force Bird-of-Prey commanded by Kargan. Tritanium hull plating attracted subatomic bacteria in 2365.
name: I.K.S. Pagh 2E (The Next Generation)
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam In battle, draw an extra Tactic.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Like the battleground where Kahless and Lukara withstood the attack of five hundred warriors, this ship is where the chancellor stands against new enemies of the Klingon Empire.
name: I.K.S. Qam-Chee 2E
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. While this ship is at an opponent's mission, if this ship is staffed, each of your opponent's personnel and ships at this mission is attributes -1.

lore: "I yield. I cannot defeat this Klingon. All I can do is kill him. And that no longer holds my interest."
name: Ikat'ika 2E (Honorable Warrior)
text: Anthropology Biology Honor Leadership OFFICER While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may make him attributes +2. If you do this, he is killed at the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "I was driving starships while your great grandfather was still in diapers. I'd think you'd be grateful for some help!"
name: In the Way 2E
text: Randomly select a personnel. If that personnel has a skill listed in this mission's requirements (or any alternate requirements listed in game text you are using to attempt it), he or she is stopped.

lore: "...how did a Reman get to be Praetor? I don't get it."
name: Inside Collaborators 2E
text: Unless you have a personnel who has Diplomacy x2 or a personnel who has Treachery x2, your opponent chooses a Diplomacy or Treachery personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: Seek cause of missing outposts.
name: Investigate Destruction 2E (Strange New Worlds)
text: Stellar Cartography + Diplomacy + OFFICER OR Navigation + SECURITY + Treachery

lore: Confer with colonial leaders about recent tensions.
name: Investigate Maquis Activity 2E (Energize)
text: Diplomacy + Leadership x2 + STRENGTH>37 + no [Maq] *+5 if this is your first completed mission.

lore: Board derelict and investigate status.
name: Investigate Stalled Ship 2E
text: (Astrophysics x2 OR Stellar Cartography x2 OR Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography) + SCIENCE x2 + CUNNING>34 OR Diplomacy x2 + OFFICER x2 + INTEGRITY>32 Any affiliation may attempt and complete this mission using these requirements: Biology + OFFICER + Treachery x2 + STRENGTH>36.

lore: A broken container of invidium disrupted the U.S.S. Enterprise's systems in 2366 before it was rendered inert by Geordi La Forge and Reginald Barclay.
name: Invidium Leak 2E (Second Edition)
text: Cannot get past unless crew has 3 ENGINEER OR a personnel with CUNNING>7 and MEDICAL OR a personnel with CUNNING>7 and Physics.

lore: "It must be gratifying for an 'Elder,' to end his career with a victory."
name: Ixtana'Rax 2E (Honored Elder)
text: Anthropology Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Honor Leadership Navigation OFFICER When this personnel uses one of his skills to complete a mission, he is killed.

lore: "What do you know of this human? .... I have received intelligence indicating he's on his way here."
name: Romulan Intelligence Network 2E
text: Plays in your core (on table). At the start of each of your turns, if you have a [Rom] personnel at an opponent's planet mission, you may examine the top two cards of that opponent's deck. Place one of those cards on the bottom of that deck and the other one on top. (Unique).

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Flagship of the Romulan forces during the final battles of the Dominion War.
name: Rovaran 2E
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. When you win an ship battle involving this ship, you may examine the loser's hand and choose a card to be removed from the game. Order - Discard a Maneuver card from hand to begin an ship battle involving this ship.

lore: "Nature decays, but latinum lasts forever."
name: Rule Of Acquisition #102 2E
text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) To play this event, you must have three [Fer] personnel in play. Plays on table. At the end of each of your turns, place the top card of your deck on this event. Order - Discard a card placed on this event to draw a card.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Cardassian resistance; Dissident; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: A proud nationalist, Gul Rusot joined Damar's underground resistance movement. Served on Terok Nor. Dissident.
name: Rusot 2E (Things Past)
text: OFFICER Biology Geology Treachery If with {Damar}, gains Leadership and SECURITY.

lore: Intelligence analyst sent to retrieve information on the Dominion threat. Secretly commanded the Kilhra to destroy Deep Space 9.
name: Ruwon 2E (Homefront II)
text: SECURITY Exobiology Tal Shiar Leadership Treachery Diplomacy

lore: "Do you propose to lecture me on logic?"
name: Sakonna 2E (Gunrunner)
text: Acquisition ENGINEER Physics Treachery Order - This personnel gains one skill from one of your captives. She keeps this skill until the start of your next turn. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: Study wreckage and crew member of lost scout.
name: Salvage Borg Ship 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Astrophysics + ENGINEER + MEDICAL + Computer Skill * +10 if a [Bor] card in play. Opponent's side: Your Borg ships may report with crew here. Points: [35]

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; genetically enhanced;
lore: Genetically enhanced introvert. She became romantically involved with Julian Bashir on DS9.
name: Sarina 2E (Call to Arms)
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Physics SCIENCE Exobiology DL/ {Meditation} (if with {Jack}, {Lauren}, or {Patrick}). Regular skills doubled if with Jack, Lauren, and Patrick.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: "He would only have built a weapon of such scope for one reason. He's going after Earth."
name: Scimitar 2E (Predator)
