text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. When you win an ship battle involving this ship, the loser discards the top card of his or her deck.

lore: Pel posed as a male waiter in order to bypass Ferengi commerce laws and earn profit. Rom exposed her secret, jealous that she had usurped his position at Quark's side.
name: Secret Identity 2E (Call to Arms)
text: One personnel (opponent's choice) is discarded. If you did not seed this dilemma, you may download a personnel of the same affiliation to join crew or Away Team.

lore: In times of crisis, those who wear the uniform have to be prepared for any contingency.
name: Security Drills 2E (Fractured Time)
text: Plays on table. Name a skill (or two skills if you have no cards in hand). Your [DS9][Fed] and MACO personnel may use 2 SECURITY as the named skill(s).

lore: "Do you know what the Romulans will do to you if they discover who you are?"
name: Security Sweep 2E
text: To play this interrupt, you must command (have in play) two [Rom] Security personnel. Order - Reveal the top three cards of an opponent's deck. If they are all personnel, score 10 points. Place them in the same order on the bottom of that opponent's deck.

lore: "Wait it's me. Odo." "You don't say." Morph.
name: Seeing Double 2E
text: Choose one: Place your Founder from your headquarters mission aboard a ship; or exchange any number of your [Dom] personnel at your headquarters mission with an equal number of your personnel aboard a ship. Destroy this event.

lore: "Do not be distressed. Your dream of reunification is not dead. It will simply take a different form - the Romulan conquest of Vulcan."
name: Sela 2E (Devious Schemer)
reports: Continuing Committee, Office of the Proconsul
text: Tal Shiar Leadership OFFICER SECURITY Treachery x 2 While an opponent's SECURITY personnel is at this mission, that opponent must discard a card from hand to use that SECURITY.

lore: "...welcome to Romulus. I trust you've enjoyed your visit."
name: Sela 2E (Devious Schemer)*
reports: Continuing Committee, Office of the Proconsul
text: Tal Shiar Leadership OFFICER SECURITY Treachery x 2 While an opponent's Security personnel is at this mission, that opponent must discard a card from hand to use that Security.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; genetically enhanced; Male;
lore: Maladjusted misfit and genetically enhanced genius. He visited DS9 with Lauren, Patrick, and Sarina.
name: Jack 2E (Call to Arms)
text: CIVILIAN Astrophysics Computer Skill Physics Law DL/ {Telepathic Alien Kidnappers} (if with {Patrick}, {Sarina}, or {Lauren}). Regular skills doubled if with Patrick, Sarina, and Lauren.

lore: "I told you this was gonna be a tough assignment when we came here. Of course, I didn't realize it was going to be this tough."
name: Jadzia Dax 2E (Problem Solver)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Physics Computer Skill SCIENCE When you are about to place an event in your discard pile, you may stop this personnel to place it on the bottom of your deck instead.

characteristicsKeywords: Trill; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Trill with symbiont;
lore: Science officer who reported to Deep Space 9 in 2369. Female Trill joined with the Dax symbiont in 2367. Very different from Curzon.
name: Jadzia Dax 2E (Emissary)
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Navigation If in [GQ]: Geology, Physics, Archaeology, Exobiology

lore: "No Klingon warrior would leave a comrade behind while he goes off to battle."
name: Jadzia Dax 2E (Sworn Ally)
text: Anthropology Diplomacy Physics SCIENCE While this personnel is present with an Honor Klingon, she is attributes +1 and gains Honor.

lore: Nova Squadron navigator. In 2368, she attempted to perform an illegal Kolvoord Starburst maneuver with Wesley Crusher and Sito Jaxa. Talented cadet.
name: Jean Hajar 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 Transporter Skill Physics Youth Astrophysics DL/ {Space Boomer}

lore: "Wheels within wheels. I'm starting to forget which side I'm on." Commander: Fortune
name: Jean-Luc Picard 2E (Galen)
text: Anthropology Archaeology Leadership SCIENCE While an artifact is in your discard pile, each of your Smuggler personnel and Thief personnel is attributes +1.

lore: "Let's see what's out there. ... Engage!" Commander: U.S.S. Enterprise-D
name: Jean-Luc Picard 2E (Starship Captain)
text: Diplomacy Honor Law Leadership Navigation OFFICER Order - This personnel loses Diplomacy, Law, and Navigation and gains Anthropology, Archaeology, and SCIENCE until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "I am Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the Federation starship Enterprise." Commander: U.S.S. Enterprise-D.
name: Jean-Luc Picard 2E (Starship Captain)
text: Diplomacy Honor Law Leadership Navigation OFFICER Order - This personnel loses Diplomacy, Law, and Navigation and gains Anthropology, Archaeology, and Science until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: On the edge of known space, he was one of many Enterprise crew captured by Orion slavers. Did not sell well. Held it together long enough to be rescued.
name: Jeffrey Pierce 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: SECURITY Anthropology Computer Skill Diplomacy

lore: "Maybe this wasn't such a good idea after all."
name: Jem'Hadar Ambush 2E
text: Assault. Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin personnel battle or a ship battle involving your [Dom] personnel. If you win, score 10 points.

lore: "All I know is that the Vorta say to do something, and you do it. Because if you do not, they will send in the Jem'Hadar, and then you die."
name: Jem'Hadar Strike Force 2E
text: Assault. Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin personnel battle or a ship battle involving your [Dom] personnel. If you win, score 10 points and randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: Many individuals have faked their own death to conduct illicit activities with impunity. In 2369, Jo'Bril used such a ploy in an attempt to steal Dr. Reyga's metaphasic shield technology.
name: Patient Schemer 2E (Second Edition)
text: Seeds or plays on table. When your assassin, thief, or {Jo'Bril} is about to be killed by a dilemma, return them to your hand instead.

lore: Headstrong captain of the Enterprise NX-01. Son of warp engine designer Henry Archer. Negotiated with Vulcans, Andorians, Xindi, and Orions.
name: Jonathan Archer 2E (Homefront III)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy ENGINEER Leadership Honor SECURITY DL/ {Reaching Out}

lore: "I recognize that look. ... The one that says, 'something's bothering me and I don't know what to do about it.' ... You want to tell me about it?"
name: Joseph Sisko 2E (Creole Chef)
text: Anthropology Biology Honor Each of your [Fed] [DS9] personnel present is attributes +1.

lore: "The next time I start getting nostalgic for the old days, shoot me."
name: Just Like Old Times 2E
text: Assault. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin combat (personnel battle) involving your Bajoran Resistance personnel. If you win, score 15 points.

lore: Tuvok performed a mindmeld with Lon Suder hoping to give a sense of order, but received homicidal rage in return.
name: Justice or Vengeance 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Unless 2 SECURITY and Anthropology OR Honor, Exobiology, and INTEGRITY>32, opponent chooses: kills one Treachery personnel (random selection) OR kills two [DQ] personnel (random selection).

lore: "The greatest warrior of them all." Clone of the unforgettable Klingon leader. Fulfilled prophecy. Installed as ceremonial Emperor in 2369.
name: Kahless 2E (The Next Generation)
text: V.I.P. Honor x 2 Anthropology Leadership x 3 DL/ {Warrior's Birthright}

lore: "My life ended on Khitomer. I served a proud family, a strong house. All that is gone."
name: Kahlest 2E (GhojmoH of Worf)
text: Anthropology Honor MEDICAL Each of your other Honor Klingons present is Cunning +1.

lore: "We do the best we can, considering the circumstances."
name: Kalandra 2E (Battlefield Surgeon)
text: Biology Honor Leadership MEDICAL While your other MEDICAL personnel at this mission is facing a dilemma, he or she is attributes +2.

lore: The perfect mate, an empathic metamorph. Kriosian mutant romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. Dutifully married Alrik despite her bond to Jean-Luc.
name: Kamala 2E (Second Edition)
text: V.I.P. Anthropology x 2 Archaeology Empathy When reported, select any skill present.

lore: Rigorous leader promoted to first officer of the U.S.S. Valiant by Tim Watters. Icy Red Squad cadet. Fiercely loyal to her captain.
name: Karen Farris 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Leadership Youth ENGINEER, Astrophysics (if with another cadet).

lore: "Although we are on a peaceful mission, we are ready to go into battle instantly. I know I can count on every Klingon warrior in this crew to serve and die in that battle." Commander: I.K.S. Pagh.
name: Kargan 2E (Rash Captain)
text: Leadership OFFICER Computer Skill When you play this personnel, you may download a Maneuver card.

lore: Intelligence analyst who posed as a diplomat on Deep Space 9 for a briefing on the Dominion. She questioned Kira Nerys' friendship with "the Founder" Odo.
name: Karina 2E (Homefront II)
text: SCIENCE Tal Shiar Physics Treachery Transporter Skill

lore: "My name is Kathryn Janeway, captain of the Federation starship Voyager."
name: Kathryn Janeway 2E (Clever Captain)**
text: Diplomacy ENGINEER Leadership x 2 SCIENCE

lore: "This case of white must last until we're rescued - at least ten days, possibly more. I will ration the supply. Don't worry. I am the Vorta. I will take care of you all."
name: Keevan 2E (Conniving Liar)
text: Anthropology Diplomacy Exobiology Geology Treachery x 2 When you play a Jem'Hadar at this mission, you may choose to have each player draw a card.

lore: Arrogant engineer. Believed his promotion to chief engineer of Enterprise was endangered by Charles Tucker III's continued presence.
name: Kelby 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Astrophysics DL/ {Divert Power} (unless {any Tucker} present).

lore: Events in 2373 sparked investigations at a medical facility at Adigeon Prime. A handful of recipients of accelerated critical neural pathway formation were found to be serving in Starfleet, hiding their uncanny abilities. Genetically Enhanced
name: Kelly 2E (Relief Tactical Officer)
text: ENGINEER Physics SECURITY

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: "It seems that the Enterprise can track us even though we are cloaked. I intend to find out if they can or they cannot."
name: Khazara 2E (Energize)
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. Order - If this ship is on your {Engage Cloak}, examine an opponent's hand and choose one of those cards. That opponent exchanges that card with the top card of his or her deck. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "Just like you have to protect the lives of your men, I have to protect our... property."
name: Kilana 2E (Dissembling Envoy)
text: Archaeology Diplomacy MEDICAL Transporter Skill Treachery Order - Examine a number of cards from the top of your deck equal to the number of your Changelings present. Replace those cards in any order. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: Comfort woman aboard Terok Nor in 2346. Romantically involved with Dukat. Worked all hours in hope of a better life for her family.
name: Kira Meru 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Exobiology Geology DL/ {Comfort Women}

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Colonel; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
lore: During Captain Sisko's absence after the death of Jadzia Dax, Kira Nerys was promoted to command DS9. She soon learned the responsibilities of the captain's chair.
name: Colonel Kira 2E (Second Edition)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Diplomacy Leadership Computer Skill X=2 if a [Rom] personnel in play.

lore: "My priorities are straight, Commander; let's not be confused here - my loyalties are to Bajor." Bajoran Resistance
name: Kira Nerys 2E (Impassioned Major)
text: Honor Leadership OFFICER SECURITY When this personnel uses a skill to complete a mission, you may take one of your personnel from an opponent's brig or from your discard pile into hand.

lore: "Half the Alpha Quadrant is out there right now, fighting for my freedom. ... Yassim was right - I have to do something."
name: Kira Nerys 2E (Reformed Collaborator)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Treachery When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. While a Cardassian or Vedek is in your discard pile, this personnel is attributes +1, loses Treachery, and gains Honor and Physics.

lore: "You want me to go behind enemy lines and teach a bunch of Cardassians how to be resistance fighters?"
name: Kira Nerys 2E (Starfleet Emissary)
text: Leadership OFFICER SECURITY You may play this personnel at {Bajor} or {Cardassia Prime}. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to make a non-Bajoran present attributes +2 until the end of that dilemma. You may play this personnel at Bajor or Cardassia Prime. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to make a non-Bajoran present attributes +2 until the end of that dilemma.

lore: Husband and father who lived in the Singha refugee camp in 2346. Married to Kira Meru, who he called the bravest woman he'd ever known.
name: Kira Taban 2E (Fractured Time)
text: MEDICAL Resistance Biology Honor Physics Scores points if killed.

lore: Flagship of a Bajoran blockade in 2375. Commanded by Colonel Kira in opposition to the Romulan fortification of their medical facilities on Derna.
name: Kitara 2E (Energize)
text: DL/ {Souls of the Dead}

lore: "The Tyrant Molor" in the Kot'baval Festival. Eager to help warriors deepen their understanding of Klingon heritage. Research on Maranga IV outpost.
name: Kitrik 2E (The Next Generation)
text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Geology Computer Skill

lore: "Their actions threaten the alliance. They disobeyed and must be punished. ... When one of us dies that way, it diminishes us all."
name: K'nera 2E (Klingon Defense Force Commander)
text: Honor Law OFFICER SECURITY Transporter Skill

lore: "Isolated pockets of humanoids. It appears to be a pre-warp civilization at an early stage of industrial development."
name: Kolaran Raiders 2E
text: Choose a personnel who has Leadership or Security to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

lore: "Come on, old comrade. For the last time, let's sharpen our blades."
name: Koloth 2E (D'akturak)
text: Diplomacy x 2 Exobiology Honor When you play this personnel, if you command {Kang} or {Kor}, you may download an Assault card.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Male; Stone of Gol-related personnel; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: Dour smuggler of few words. Acquired part of the Stone of Gol for Baran. Commanded a Klingon shuttle. Disliked games and replicated bloodwine.
name: Koral 2E (The Next Generation)
text: CIVILIAN Archaeology Smuggling Navigation Treachery Stellar Cartography

lore: High cleric of Boreth. Responsible for cloning Kahless in an attempt to restore hope to his people.
name: Koroth 2E (The Next Generation)
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Biology MEDICAL Once per game, if on {Boreth}, may download {Kahless} OR {Clone Machine} there.

lore: Renegade captain that sought an honorable death. To him, peace was a living death. Deserted with Konmel and Kunivas to restore Imperial glory.
name: Korris 2E (The Next Generation)
text: OFFICER Honor ENGINEER SECURITY May volunteer for random selections (if applicable).

lore: "I can't help thinking what a perfect metaphor this game is for our present situation. Two players. Two minds. Two strategies. Each trying to outmaneuver the other, testing the enemy's defenses..."
name: Kotra 2E
text: To play this event, you must command (have in play) three [Car] personnel. Plays in your core (on table). When an opponent discards a personnel from the top of his or her deck during your turn, score 5 points. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "I am the First. And I have declared victory." Commander: U.S.S. Defiant.
name: Kudak'Etan 2E (Arrogant First)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Leadership Navigation OFFICER Order - Discard a Vorta from hand to place this personnel and any number of your Jem'Hadar present aboard a ship at the same mission.

lore: "I have accepted the transition. I am a Bajoran security officer. The uniform is simply... uncomfortable."
name: Kurn 2E (Bajoran Security Officer)
text: Law Navigation OFFICER SECURITY When you win personnel battle involving this personnel, you may return him to his owner's hand to kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: "In science we look for the obvious. We track in a straight line. If something looks too good to be true, it usually isn't true. If there appears to be more to something than meets the eye, there usually is more. We take it step by step."
name: Mora Pol 2E (Pioneering Scientist)
text: Exobiology x 2 Physics SCIENCE x 2

lore: Standard-issue tricorder. Geordi La Forge asked Data to use one to analyze solar probes discovered in a secret chamber of the Amargosa observatory. Data had other ideas.
name: Mr. Tricorder 2E (Reflections 2.0)
text: May report to {any Data}. Your personnel present who have both OFFICER and ENGINEER all add Computer Skill. Androids here are attributes all -6.

lore: Tuvok was forced to question many of U.S.S. Voyager's crew to solve a mystery. The efforts took focus away from his other duties.
name: Murder Investigation 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Randomly select three personnel (or six personnel if more than nine personnel present). If any of those personnel has SECURITY, all of them are "stopped."

lore: "I cannot believe this was an arbitrary attack..."
name: Nanite Attack 2E
text: Unless you have Diplomacy x2 + ENGINEER x2 OR SECURITY x2 + a Hand Weapon, this dilemma is placed on your ship.

lore: "There are some who believe the future of Cardassia should not remain in the hands of military." Dissident
name: Natima Lang 2E (Professor of Political Ethics)
text: Diplomacy Honor Law Leadership Computer Skill When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand.

lore: Brutal predators often target unprotected shipping lanes, plundering vulnerable freighters and non-military vessels. Only the most fortunate escape such encounters.
name: Nausicaans: Pirates 2E (Energize)
text: Unless you have 2 Navigation, 3 SECURITY, and STRENGTH>40 OR a Cloaking Device and CUNNING>40, two personnel (random selection) are killed. Discard dilemma.

lore: "Fine. Whatever. Starfleet will get its Krieger Wave converter. These things take time. I've had a few setbacks, that's all."
name: Nel Apgar 2E (Temperamental Researcher)
text: Physics x 2 SCIENCE Treachery When you play this personnel, you may draw three cards, then place three cards from hand on the bottom of your deck in any order.

lore: "Two Romulan warships uncloaking "
name: Nelvana Trap 2E
text: Maneuver. Plays on an opponent's mission. When an opponent moves a ship to this mission, you may destroy this event to take each [Rom] ship from your copies of {Engage Cloak}, place them at this mission, and begin an engagement (ship battle) involving them. If you win, randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: "You do prefer it this way, don't you? As it was meant to be. ... 'Once more unto the breach, dear friends...'"
name: No Peace in Our Time 2E
text: Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Each of your [Kli] Treachery personnel is Cunning +2. Order - Destroy this event to begin an engagement (ship battle) involving your [Kli] Treachery personnel. If you win, randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: "Kahless would rather die than live under Molor's tyranny."
name: Noble Cause 2E
text: Decay: 2. (When there are two cards on this event, destroy it.) To play this event, you must command (have in play) three [Kli] personnel. Plays in your core (on table). When you destroy an Assault or Maneuver event you own, you may place it on this event. When this event is destroyed, you may take each card here into your hand.

lore: Tenacious rival of Ocett and Jean-Luc Picard in pursuit of the DNA program. Commanded the I.K.S. Maht-H'a on behalf of the High Council.
name: Nu'Daq 2E (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER Archaeology Exobiology Leadership Navigation Treachery DL/ {Dig}

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Female; Gul; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Dogged rival of Nu'Daq, Galathon, and the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise in the pursuit of the DNA program. Female gul in command of the Bralek.
name: Ocett 2E (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Archaeology Exobiology Navigation Treachery DL/ {Dig}

lore: "Sometimes I have to remind you just how good I am."
name: Odo 2E (Constable)
text: Honor Law Leadership Navigation Computer Skill x 2 SECURITY x 2 While an opponent's Thief or Treachery personnel is at this mission, that personnel cannot use his or her abilities.

lore: "...it's as if Odo and Curzon have been...joined. It's proving to be an interesting experience for both of us."
name: Odo 2E (Curzon Odo)
text: Anthropology Diplomacy Law x 2 SECURITY This personnel is Cunning +1 for each Diplomacy personnel in your discard pile (limit +4). This personnel is Strength +1 for each SECURITY personnel in your discard pile (limit +4).

lore: "The Link was paradise. But it appears I'm not ready for paradise."
name: Odo 2E (Wayward Link)
text: Law Leadership Computer Skill SECURITY When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. When your Bajoran present is about to be killed by a dilemma, you may stop him or her and this personnel to prevent that.

lore: Suffering from felicium withdrawal, T'Jon threatened William T. Riker's life in an attempt to manipulate Jean-Luc Picard. Picard refused to enable the Ornaran's addiction.
name: Ornaran Threat 2E (Second Edition)
text: Randomly select a personnel to be "stopped." Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and MEDICAL OR 2 SECURITY and STRENGTH>25, that personnel is killed.

lore: "We are not leaving here. And neither are you."
name: Out of Options 2E
text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) To play this event, you must command (have in play) three [Rom] personnel. Plays in your core (on table). When an opponent begins a mission attempt, examine his or her hand and choose a card to place on this event. When this event is destroyed, return each card here to its owner's hand.

lore: "Not our universe. Not our ship. Something ... parallel."
name: Parallels 2E
text: Reveal a number of cards from the top of your deck equal to the number of events the opponent to your left has in his or her core (on table). If any of the revealed cards are a copy of a personnel attempting this mission, stop each of those personnel. Place the revealed cards on the bottom of their owner's deck in any order.

name: Pardek 2E (Betrayer)
text: Anthropology Diplomacy Treachery Order - If this personnel is present with an opponent's personnel, return this personnel to his owner's hand to reveal the top four cards of that opponent's deck. You may place a personnel revealed in his or her owner's discard pile. Replace the remaining the remaining cards in the same order.

lore: Special security officer aboard the Apnex. Assigned to guard the prototype phase-inverting cloaking device. Worked as a bartender before joining the military.
name: Parem 2E (Engage)
text: SECURITY Astrophysics Physics Treachery Attributes all +1 when facing a dilemma.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; genetically enhanced; Male;
lore: Idiot savant who visited DS9 to meet Julian Bashir. Genetically enhanced and emotional. Likes parties.
name: Patrick 2E (Call to Arms)
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Archaeology Anthropology DL/ {Surprise Party} (if with {Jack}, {Lauren}, or {Sarina}). Regular skills doubled if with Jack, Lauren, and Sarina.

lore: "The mighty Federation will fall before us."
name: Peacemaker or Predator? 2E
text: Examine a number of cards from the top of an opponent's deck equal to the number of [Rom] Leadership personnel you command (have in play). Replace those cards in any order. Destroy this event.

lore: Commodore Decker, driven to the edge of madness by the loss of his entire crew, sacrificed himself in a vain attempt to destroy the "Planet Killer."
name: Personal Duty 2E (Second Edition)
text: To get past requires Leadership OR OFFICER. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (random selection).

lore: "It is highly unstable. No more than fifteen seconds."
name: Personal Forcefield 2E
text: Name a unique personnel you command (have in play). For the rest of this turn, when he or she is about to be killed by a dilemma, prevent that. Destroy this event.

lore: Alien physiologist who keeps an exotic menagerie. Denobulan doctor and occasional counselor. Has three wives, adhering to his world's polyamorous customs.
name: Phlox 2E (Broken Bow)
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Biology SCIENCE DL/ {Sickbay} Attributes all +1 for each ANIMAL present.

lore: Parts of B-4's assembly were found strewn across the Kolaran system. Many planetary scans were required to locate all the positronic signatures.
name: Picking Up the Pieces 2E (Energize)
text: To get past requires Geology or Computer Skill. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (random selection).

lore: Confronted with Sir Guy of Gisbourne's archers, Jean-Luc Picard, posing as Robin Hood, ordered his crew deeper into Q's recreation of Sherwood Forest.
name: Pinned Down 2E (Second Edition)
text: To get past, two personnel (random selection) must be "stopped." Then, if any [Q] card in play, another personnel (random selection) is "stopped."

lore: "I'm reading six distinct positronic signatures, spread out over a few kilometers on the planet's surface."
name: Planetary Survey 2E
text: Choose a personnel who has Geology or Computer Skill to be stopped. If you cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: "You were down for a good thirty seconds."
name: Plasma Shock 2E
text: Randomly select a personnel. If that personnel has STRENGTH>6, he or she is stopped. Otherwise, he or she is killed.

lore: "... You've taken aboard a known criminal. You will turn him over to us."
name: Political Leverage 2E
text: Capture. Choose an opponent's personnel aboard a ship at the same mission as your staffed [Car] ship. Place that personnel in your brig. That opponent may discard the top four cards of his or her deck to prevent this. Destroy this event.

lore: Most space-faring races employ highly adaptable systems in starship design to allow the rapid transfer of power in any situation.
name: Power to the Shields 2E
text: Maneuver. When your ship with your Engineer personnel aboard is in an engagement (ship battle), it is Shields +4 until the end of that engagement (ship battle).

lore: "Congratulations, captain. You wanted them angry. They're angry."
name: Power to the Weapons 2E
text: Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin an ship battle involving your Leadership personnel. If you win, randomly kill two opponent's personnel involved.

lore: Conduct training exercise near Saturn.
name: Practice Orbital Maneuvers 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: Navigation + SECURITY + 3 cadets Opponent's side:Astrophysics + Leadership + Navigation + SECURITY + CUNNING>36

lore: In 2372, with a Klingon invasion imminent, Gul Dukat secured this warship to evacuate the Detapa Council from Cardassia Prime.
name: Prakesh 2E (Second Edition)
text: Tractor Beam. While this ship is in an ship battle you did not begin, it is Shields +4.

lore: Gifted scientist who first detected the solidification of his planet's molten core. In 2370, his research proved key in the efforts to reliquefy the core.
name: Pran Tainer 2E (Atrean Seismologist)
text: Geology x 2 Physics Computer Skill SCIENCE

lore: "I want to thank you, captain. ... For convincing the President to implement these security measures. It feels like we're finally on the right track."
name: Precautionary Measures 2E
text: When your [2eDS9] personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, stop one of your [E] personnel present to prevent that.

lore: "The dilithium matrix has got to be aligned within .3 microns."
name: Preeminent Precision 2E
text: To play this event, you must command three [Sta] personnel. Play on table. Order - Stop your [Sta] Engineer aboard your ship to make that ship Range +2 until the end of this turn.

lore: "The military does not dictate policy on Romulus."
name: Prejudice and Politics 2E
text: Plays in your core (on table). Order - If your Praetor or Senator is on {Romulus}, reveal the top card of an opponent's deck. If it is a personnel, that opponent places that card in his or her hand. Otherwise, score 5 points, and that opponent places that card on the bottom of his or her deck. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: Often housing political prisoners, clandestine Cardassian camps use hard labor as punishment.
name: Prison Compound 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: Plays if you control three [Car] personnel to score points. X=the total number of [*] on all your captives.

lore: "All Cardassians are required to give the Bureau of Identification one of their first molars. It's usually extracted at age ten."
name: Process Identification 2E
text: To play this event, you must command (have in play) three [Car] personnel. Examine the top five cards of your deck. Take one of those cards into hand and place the others on the bottom of your deck in any order. Destroy this event.

lore: Defend civilian government from Klingon patrols.
name: Protect The Escapees 2E (Strange New Worlds)
text: ENGINEER + Honor + Navigation + INTEGRITY>30 Solving player may initiate battle against [Kli].

lore: "...Alkar is flooding her with this... psychic waste... All these negative emotions pouring into her may have caused a chemical response in her brain."
name: Psychic Receptacle 2E
text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select a personnel who has that skill. While a personnel who has that same card title is facing a dilemma, he or she cannot use his or her skills. This effect lasts until the end of this mission attempt.

lore: "Your cell membranes went through hyper-thermal induction. The temperature of your blood rose by 37 degrees in a matter of seconds."
name: Psycho-Kinetic Attack 2E
text: Unless you have Exobiology + MEDICAL x2 OR Honor + Empathy, randomly select a SECURITY personnel to be killed.

lore: In 2369, the Cardassian Union used the capture of Jean-Luc Picard to gain leverage in its negotiations with Starfleet.
name: Psychological Pressure 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Seeds or plays on table. For each different regular skill in dilemma or mission requirements that is also on your captive, opponent must discard a card from hand to use that skill to meet those requirements (or choose not to).

lore: While investigating mysterious positronic signatures, Jean-Luc Picard and his crew were forced to flee from attacking natives.
name: Pursuit Just Behind 2E (Second Edition)
text: Kills X personnel (random selection), where X=number of opponent's [Univ][P] missions with point boxes. If >9 personnel remain, destroys three Equipment present.

lore: "Hello, computer..."
name: Quaint Technology 2E
text: Unless you have Anthropology x2 + Computer Skill OR Diplomacy x2 + CUNNING>34, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: "Most of our systems are down and we haven't been able to contact anybody off the bridge."
name: Quantum Filament 2E
text: Unless you have (2 Astrophysics OR 2 Stellar Cartography) and 2 Navigation OR 2 ENGINEER, SCIENCE, and SHIELDS>8, this dilemma is placed on your ship.

name: Quantum Incursions 2E (Fractured Time)
text: Seeds like a [S/P] dilemma. QR Code

lore: "I want the Federation back. I want to sell root beer again!"
name: Quark 2E (Resistance Informant)
text: Acquisition Anthropology Diplomacy Computer Skill When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. When this personnel is facing a dilemma, he may gain a skill from your Dissident present until the end of that dilemma. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: In 2371, Odo was informed that three former agents of the Obsidian Order had died the previous day from "natural causes," while two more perished in "accidents."
name: Quite a Coincidence 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on a personnel just played. When personnel is killed, discard event to score points.

lore: "This is an Earth vessel. You're in no position to take command."
name: Racial Tension 2E
text: Randomly select two personnel. Unless they are the same species, both are stopped.

lore: Student of B'hala, the lost Bajoran city. Former Prylar promoted to the rank of Ranjen to serve as minister overseeing the excavation project.
name: Ranjen Koral 2E (Second Edition)
text: SCIENCE Anthropology Archaeology x 2 Computer Skill DL/ {Dig}

lore: "You can let your engineers play with the machines. I'm sending out search parties."
name: Rash Aggression 2E
text: Assault. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin personnel battle involving your [Baj] Treachery personnel. If you win, choose an opponent's personnel involved to be killed.

lore: "Let's just say I miss the old days on Bajor."
name: Razka Karn 2E (Scavenger)
text: Acquisition Archaeology Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Navigation While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to replace his Integrity with the Integrity of a [Baj] personnel in your discard pile until the end of that dilemma.

lore: Resistance fighter. One of the few Maquis to survive Jem'Hadar attacks in 2373. Wife of Michael Eddington. Bluffed about a cloaked missile strike.
name: Rebecca Sullivan 2E (Energize)
text: MEDICAL Biology Honor Music Astrophysics Geology

lore: "Computer ... re-route the power flow in the Cargo Bay Four transporter through the auxiliary replicator system."
name: Reconfiguration 2E
text: To play this event, you must command (have in play) two Engineer personnel. Shuffle any player's deck to draw a card. Destroy this event.

lore: While playing to maintain his darts winning streak at Quark's, Miles O'Brien aggravated an old kayaking injury, necessitating shoulder surgery and forfeiting his darts game.
name: Recurring Injury 2E (Second Edition)
text: To get past, one personnel with Biology OR MEDICAL (opponent's choice) must be "stopped." Nullify with a personnel who has either 2 Biology OR 3 MEDICAL.

characteristicsKeywords: Capturing-related card; Cardassian ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: In response to tensions along the Cardassian/Federations border, this ship was sent to attend diplomatic talks with the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Reklar 2E (Second Edition)
text: WEAPONS +2 and SHIELDS +1 while you have a captive. Tractor Beam

lore: "You may discipline me, but only I discipline the men. That is the order of things."
name: Remata'Klan 2E (Unit Leader)
text: Exobiology Honor Leadership OFFICER SECURITY When this personnel is an eligible target for a random selection, you may exclude another [Dom] personnel present from that selection.

lore: Insurgents and guerilla fighters often use unorthodox techniques to keep larger enemy forces off-balance.
name: Resistance Tactics 2E (Second Edition)
text: Seeds or plays on table. Discard event to cancel a just-initiated battle involving your Resistance, [Maq], or [DS9][TE] personnel.

lore: To disable a station's deflector array (which has been turned into an anti-graviton beam), one could access the EPS feed and overload the waveguide. But there are alarms.
name: Restricted Area 2E (Call to Arms)
text: If nine or fewer personnel in crew or Away Team, one is "stopped" (random selection). If more than nine personnel in crew or away team, three are captured (random selection).

lore: Recover technology previously lost on less-advanced planet.
name: Retrieve Materiel 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: Anthropology + Transporter Skill + CUNNING>30 Solving player may download one [22][Equipment] here.

lore: Confident cadet ordered by Admiral Leyton to sabotage Earth's power grid in 2372. Red Squad member later assigned to the U.S.S. Valiant.
name: Riley Shepard 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: SECURITY Biology Navigation Youth Computer Skill, Navigation (if with another cadet).

lore: Respected mediator. Deaf and mute Ramatin male. Taught sign language to warring factions on Solais V. Gave the Klingons a word for "peacemaker."
name: Riva 2E (Warp Pack: Emissary)
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Honor When reported, each player draws a card.

lore: Maquis sympathizer and Bajoran officer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Found a new father figure in Macias. Betrayed Jean-Luc Picard's trust in her.
name: Ro Laren 2E (The Maquis)
text: SECURITY Navigation Leadership Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Bleed Resources}

lore: Maquis sympathizer and Bajoran officer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Found a new father figure in Macias. Betrayed Jean-Luc Picard's trust in her.
name: Ro Laren 2E (The Maquis)
text: SECURITY Navigation Leadership Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Bleed Resources}

lore: An Enterprise away team was exposed to a psychotropic compound in 2151. Experiencing intense anxiety and hallucinations, they claimed to see beings inside solid rock.
name: Rock People 2E (Call to Arms)
text: To get past requires three personnel with Geology OR three personnel with SCIENCE classification.

lore: "Ferengi can be very focused. Especially when no one bothers to talk to them. ... Not that I mind. I'm used to being ignored."
name: Rom 2E (Diagnostic and Repair Technician)
text: ENGINEER x 2 Navigation Physics Computer Skill While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he is attributes +1 and gains Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography, Honor, and Physics.

lore: "...we'll die together. Side by side, heads held high, knowing we did our best. ... If that's what's written, then that's what's written."
name: Rom 2E (Undercover Spy)
text: ENGINEER Honor Physics When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. While this personnel is present with your Dissident, he gains Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography, ENGINEER, and Computer Skill.

lore: Tal Shiar pilot aboard the Serrola. She distrusts Cardassians, but willing to work with them to eliminate the threat posed by the Dominion.
name: Selveth 2E (Homefront II)
text: ENGINEER Navigation Geology Tal Shiar Treachery Astrophysics

lore: "That's your response? More research? More delays? I suppose I shouldn't have expected anything different."
name: Serova 2E (Warp Field Theorist)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography x 2 ENGINEER x 2 Physics SCIENCE While this personnel is facing a dilemma, each of your other ENGINEER personnel present is CUNNING +1.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; D'deridex Class; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Flagship commanded by Enabran Tain and Lovok. Led a Tal Shiar-Obsidian Order flotilla tasked to destroy the Founders and thereby collapse the Dominion.
name: Serrola 2E (Second Edition)
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam Attributes all +2 in [GQ].

lore: "This is ridiculous. I'm not the changeling. If I were, don't you think I'd put up a little more of a fight?"
name: Set Up 2E
text: Infiltration. Plays in your core (on table). When an opponent's personnel is about to be randomly selected, if your Infiltrator is at that mission, you may destroy this event to instead choose the opponent's personnel to be selected from all eligible possibilities.

lore: Red Squad cadet typical of those assigned to train on the U.S.S. Valiant in 2373. Although loyal to Tim Watters, he secretly misses home.
name: Seth Matthews 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Archaeology Youth

lore: "We are Borg. ... You are individuals. You are small, and you think in small terms."
name: Seven of Nine 2E (Representative of the Hive)
text: ENGINEER Exobiology Physics Computer Skill SCIENCE While this personnel is facing a dilemma, she is Strength +2 and gains SECURITY.

lore: Leader of a resistance cell whose victories during the Occupation included the liberation of the Gallitep labor camp. He remained equally devoted to his people years after trading that violent past for the life of a farmer.
name: Shakaar Edon 2E (Resistance Leader)
text: Biology Geology Leadership x 2 SECURITY Each of your other [Baj] personnel present is Strength +1 (or +2 while in personnel battle).

lore: "Wonderful! Wonderful! I like you, human. Most people become ill at the sight of live taspar."
name: Shared Delicacy 2E
text: To play this interrupt, you must command (have in play) three Guls and have a captive. Order - Reveal a random card from that captive's owner's hand. He or she chooses to discard that card or discard the top three cards of his or her deck.

lore: "We will no longer bow before anyone as slaves."
name: Shinzon 2E (Reman Leader)
text: Geology Leadership OFFICER SECURITY Treachery x 2

lore: "If you had lived my life and experienced the suffering of my people, you would be standing where I am."
name: Shinzon 2E (Romulan Praetor)
text: Biology Diplomacy ENGINEER Leadership Treachery x 2 Order - Discard a card from hand to draw a card. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: An unchecked hazard aboard a starship can quickly lead to even more alarming problems. Just as with ancient sailing vessels, fire poses a particular risk.
name: Shipboard Fire 2E
text: Unless there are no damage markers on this ship, all your personnel are stopped.

lore: "We've got to get out of here! The whole thing might blow!"
name: Short Circuit 2E
text: Unless you have ENGINEER + Physics x2 OR Computer Skill x2 + SCIENCE, all of your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Sickbay: Menagerie 2E (Energize)
text: Plays on your [22] ship with at least one staffing icon. Thrice per game, you may stop your [22] MEDICAL personnel aboard to prevent one personnel present from being assimilated, controlled by {Ceti Eel}, or killed by a dilemma; personnel is stopped instead. May be nullified by {Plasma Fire}.

lore: "Synthetic organs are in place. We merely synchronize them with Kirk's autonomic nervous system, duplicating the rhythms of his body. At the same time, we duplicate the mental patterns."
name: Side by Side 2E
text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel that has that skill is stopped.

lore: Quickly repair damaged communication system; call for help.
name: Signal for Rescue 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Biology + ENGINEER + Computer Skill + SECURITY + STRENGTH>42

lore: "We were conducting some geological experiments on the surface ... It is entirely possible that we accidentally sealed you in." Commander: Terix.
name: Sirol 2E (Diplomatic Adversary)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Diplomacy Leadership Navigation OFFICER Treachery While an opponent's Treachery personnel is at this mission, that opponent must discard a card from hand to use that Treachery.

lore: With Deep Space 9 evacuated of non-critical personnel during a local plasma disruption, it was an easy matter for a mercenary team to overwhelm those left behind.
name: Skeleton Crew 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Place on mission. You may not begin a mission attempt here with fewer than six personnel.

lore: "I could have been killed. If it hadn't been for Data, and that one, brief delay he created, I would have been gone. No more me. And no one would have missed me, would they? Data may have sacrificed himself for me. Why?"
name: So Many Enemies 2E
text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel has Treachery, all three are stopped.

lore: The Bajoran Prylar worried about Kai Winn's interest in the Pah-Wraiths but remained a faithful attendant.
name: Solbor 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Honor Exobiology Once per mission, scores 5 points if your Vedek, Prylar, or Kai helps solve a mission where present.

lore: "I've failed as the Emissary and, for the first time in my life, I've failed in my duty as a Starfleet officer. ... I need time to think... clear my head."
name: Sorting Things Out 2E
text: If a personnel has been killed during this mission attempt, randomly select a personnel to be stopped.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: "The Empire considers this a matter of internal security. We regret you've become involved."
name: Soterus 2E
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. While this ship is in an ship battle, you may discard a Maneuver card from hand to make it attributes +2 until the end of that ship battle.

lore: Many Bajorans believe that what remains after death is just a shell, with the pagh leaving the body to begin a new journey: to walk with the Prophets in the Celestial Temple.
name: Souls of the Dead 2E (Second Edition)
text: Plays once each turn if you have three [Baj] personnel in play. Place a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

name: Spreading Fear 2E
text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Place a card from hand on this event to begin a ship battle involving your Jem'Hadar. If you win, randomly select one opponent's personnel involved for each of your Vorta involved. Choose one of those selected personnel to be killed.

lore: Ro Laren was able to maintain Jean-Luc Picard's confidence in her loyalty just long enough to conceal her defection to the Maquis and help her new allies evade Starfleet's trap.
name: Stalling for Time 2E (Reflections 2.0)
text: Plays once each turn on any location if you have three [TNG][Maq] personnel in play. Opponent chooses one of their personnel here to return to hand.

lore: Cardassian military policy in any conflict is to take captives when possible, for the many uses they can be put to later.
name: Standard Cardassian Procedure 2E
text: Capture. Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin an engagement (ship battle) involving your [Car] ship. That ship is Weapons +1. If you win, randomly select an opponent's personnel involved to place in your brig.

lore: "With my theories and their equipment, we might be able to alter the fragment's path."
name: Stellar Core Fragment 2E
text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 Physics or a personnel who has 2 Science, your opponent chooses a Physics or Science personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: "It is dangerous to walk a different path."
name: Straying from the Path 2E
text: Prophet. To play this event, you must command (have in play) three [Baj] personnel. If you have fewer cards in your discard pile than in your hand, exchange your discard pile with your hand. Remove this event from the game.

lore: Evaluate subspace abnormality for possible transwarp applications.
name: Study Rare Phenomenon 2E (Call to Arms)
text: ENGINEER + Navigation + Physics + SCIENCE

lore: Benjamin Sisko became trapped outside the normal flow of time after an accident caused by the 2372 subspace inversion of the Bajoran Wormhole.
name: Subspace Accident 2E (Energize)
text: Unless 3 Astrophyics OR 2 Physics and 2 SCIENCE present, personnel with most [*] icons is held with dilemma atop mission. Discard both at end of your next turn.

lore: Ensure mines operate at peak efficiency.
name: Supervise Dilithium Mine 2E (Second Edition)
text: Geology + OFFICER + SECURITY + STRENGTH>34 When seeded, you may download {Process Ore: Mining} here.Opponent's side:No gametext.

lore: "You told us the timing was perfect for an attack on the Federation! I don't understand why you now delay!" Commander: Soterus.
name: Suran 2E (Ambitious Commander)
text: Leadership Navigation OFFICER SECURITY Treachery When you play this personnel, you may download a Maneuver card.

lore: Assist with triage of heavy combat casualties.
name: Surgery Under Fire 2E (Second Edition)
text: Biology + MEDICAL + OFFICER + STRENGTH>36

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Study habitable planet with novel ecosystems.
name: Survey New World 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: OFFICER + SCIENCE + Exobiology + CUNNING>32 * +5 if landed ship or {Environmental Suit} here.

lore: "Captain, it seems so foolish of you to insist on demonstrations."
name: Sympathetic Magic 2E
text: Unless you choose to place this dilemma on your ship at this mission, all your personnel are stopped.

lore: Starship systems can be checked by computer-automated diagnostics, but this routine examination is no substitute for the scrutiny of a trained engineer.
name: Systems Diagnostic 2E
text: Choose a personnel who has Engineer or Computer Skill to be stopped. If you cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: Khan's battle experience was significant but limited to terrestrial combat. Three-dimensional thinking gave Captain Kirk and the Enterprise a clear advantage.
name: Tactical Disadvantage 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: Players show their hands and examine revealed ships. Unless your total SHIELDS > opponent's total WEAPONS, kill one personnel (random selection). Discard dilemma.

lore: "Once you're in your comfortable bed with the Federation, you won't be able to get out. We won't be able to get out."
name: Tahna Los 2E (Voice of the Kohn-Ma)
text: Acquisition Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Navigation Physics Treachery This personnel is Integrity -1 and Strength +1 for each non-Bajoran present (limit -3/+3).

name: Taken Prisoner 2E (Second Edition)
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may report a [TNG][Car] personnel (for free) to your [Car] outpost or to your [TNG][Car] ship at a mission an opponent seeded or that is worth 40 or more points. Once each turn (thrice per game), if an opponent's personnel present with your [TNG][Car] personnel is about to be killed, you may capture that personnel instead.

lore: Impatient senator and political dissident. Contempt for Hiren's bureaucracy led her to become an assassin for Shinzon. Consorts with high-ranking officers.
name: Tal'Aura 2E (Second Edition)
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Biology Computer Skill Treachery x 2 Geology DL/ {Assassination Plot}

lore: "Darmok at Tanagra. ... Picard and Dathon at El-Adrel."
name: Tama 2E (Energize)
text: Tractor Beam. While this ship is at a planet mission, if this ship is staffed, an opponent must discard a card from hand to beam to or from this planet.

lore: Technician and former petty officer aboard the U.S.S. Gandhi. Recruited into the Maquis by Thomas Riker. Enjoys studying early Earth warp technology.
name: Tamal 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: ENGINEER Anthropology SCIENCE Geology

lore: Member of an underground group that pursues the fundamentals of Vulcan philosophy. Small but growing, the movement pushes covertly for a reunification of Romulus and Vulcan.
name: Tamarith 2E (Reformist)
text: Anthropology Biology Honor MEDICAL When you complete a [FED] mission, if this personnel used any of her skills, score 5 points.

lore: "They were loose threads, untidy parts of me that I would like to remove. But when I pulled on one of those threads, it unravelled the tapestry of my life."
name: Tapestry 2E
text: Remove all the cards in your deck from the game. Take all the personnel and ships from your discard pile and shuffle them to form a new deck. Remove this event and all the other cards in your discard pile from the game.

lore: "I need a target that fights back."
name: Target Practice 2E
text: Replicate - Discard the top card of your deck. (You may discard the top card of your deck when you play this event. If you do, put this event in your hand instead of destroying it.) To play this event, you must command three [Kli] personnel. Download an Assault or Maneuver event. Destroy this event.

lore: "Hailing frequencies closed, sir."
name: Tasha Yar 2E (Chief of Security)
text: Honor Leadership SECURITY Transporter Skill When your non-SECURITY personnel on the same planet as this personnel is randomly selected to be killed, you may choose this personnel to be killed instead.

lore: "If you understood the complexities of interstellar diplomacy..."
name: Team of Ambassadors 2E
text: When your Diplomacy personnel is facing a dilemma, meet Cunning and Strength requirements of that dilemma using Integrity instead.

lore: "...look around you. You're back home... on Vulcan."
name: Telepathic Deception 2E
text: Unless you have Biology + Exobiology + SECURITY OR Empathy + CUNNING>28, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: "I was sent against my will! I'm not from your part of space. I come from a trans-dimensional realm. I don't know why I was sent here."
name: Temporal Test Subject 2E
text: Temporal. Discard an [AU] personnel from hand to take an [AU] personnel from your discard pile into hand. Destroy this event.

lore: Despite overtures of friendship from the House of Duras, the Arbiter of Succession was unswayed, noting they had manipulated the circumstances with the skill of a Romulan.
name: Temptation 2E (Second Edition)
text: To get past, three personnel (random selection) must be "tempted." Each one without Honor OR Treachery is "stopped."

lore: Jem'Hadar warship often utilized by Weyoun. It took part in numerous successful battles for the Dominion, including the taking of Terok Nor and the re-taking of the Chin'toka system.
name: Tenak'talar 2E (Weyoun's Warship)
text: Tractor Beam. When an opponent's mission attempt fails, if this ship is staffed and at that mission, score 10 points.

lore: Experienced diplomats are willing to meet their opponents on their terms and to confront challenges to their integrity with appropriate invectives when necessary.
name: Tense Negotiations 2E (Second Edition)
text: To get past, one Diplomacy OR Leadership personnel (opponent's choice) must be "stopped." Nullify with a personnel who has either 3 Diplomacy OR 3 Leadership.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: "I doubt our objectives are. . .compatible."
name: Terix 2E (Energize)
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. While this ship is at an opponent's space mission, if this ship is staffed, that opponent must discard two cards from hand to attempt this mission.

lore: "You will die far quicker than your son did, Kang. ... No vengeance today..."
name: The Albino 2E (Killer of Children)
text: Exobiology Leadership MEDICAL x 2 Treachery x 2 Order - Return this personnel to his owner's hand to kill an opponent's Honor personnel present.

lore: Linked into the Kohl mental preservation network, Harry Kim endured searing confrontations of his deepest fears.
name: The Clown: Bitter Medicine 2E (Fractured Time)
text: Place on mission. Now and start of each mission or scouting attempt here, opponent names a skill. All your personnel with that skill are attributes -2 until end of turn.

lore: "Worf, you have to go on without me. And I know that. I understand. ... You don't have to explain to me. I'm hurt. You're not. And there's a job to be done."
name: The Demands of Duty 2E
text: Your opponent chooses a personnel. Unless you choose to have all your personnel be stopped, that personnel is killed.

lore: Like information and technology, Borg drones themselves are simply another resource at the Collective's disposal - and the least limited of all of them.
name: The First of Many 2E
text: When your Borg is stopped while attempting a mission, discard the top card of your deck to unstop one of your other stopped Borg present. The Borg you unstop joins the mission attempt.

lore: For over a century, Orions have been synonymous with criminal activity. Though the planet's rightful government has tried to fight this negative image, the Syndicate wields more power.
name: The Orion Underworld 2E
text: Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin an engagement (ship battle) involving your [Non] ship with your Thief aboard. If you win, score 10 points.

lore: "...they've spent the last half century robbing the planet of every valuable resource before abandoning it."
name: The Pillage of Bajor 2E
text: To play this event, you must command (have in play) three [Car] personnel. Examine the top three cards of your deck. Take two of those cards into hand and discard the other. Destroy this event.

lore: "This isn't working, Bareil. ... I need to feel useful." "It might be interesting to explore 'useless' for awhile. See how it feels."
name: The Prophets' Guidance 2E
text: Prophet. To play this interrupt, you must command (have in play) two Vedeks. Order - Take a [Baj] personnel from your discard pile into hand.

lore: "The Senate has considered Shinzon's proposal and rejected it. He and his followers will be met with all deliberate force and sent back to that black rock they come from. Do I make myself clear?"
name: The Reman Mines 2E
text: Plays on {Supervise Dilithium Mine}. Each of your [Rom] ships is RANGE +1 for each Reman you command (have in play) (limit +3).

lore: Fight for control of critical communications array.
name: The Siege of AR-558 2E (Call to Arms)
text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Physics + Computer Skill + SECURITY + STRENGTH>38

lore: "...I seek only transportation in order to see and experience your...your reality. I am not a threat to you, your ship, or your crew."
name: The Traveler 2E (Transcendent Explorer)
text: Anthropology Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Honor Physics x 2 SCIENCE When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, place him on the bottom of his owner's deck.

lore: Shinzon's protector and counselor. Reman general who kept the Praetor on task. Helped Shinzon invade Deanna Troi's mind. Not known for his beauty.
name: The Viceroy 2E (Homefront III)
text: MEDICAL Leadership Empathy Treachery Exobiology Geology DL/ {Empathic Touch}

lore: Defiant leader and starship thief. Posed as William T. Riker. Commanded the Stolen Defiant on raids in Cardassian space. Resents his transporter double.
name: Thomas Riker 2E (The Maquis)
text: OFFICER Geology Leadership SECURITY Treachery Music DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

lore: Valiant captain given a battlefield commission. Overconfident cadet determined to succeed. Proud member of Red Squad. An inspiration to his crew.
name: Tim Watters 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: OFFICER Leadership Physics Youth Diplomacy, Leadership (if with another cadet).

lore: Beguiling adversary of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Plotted to display its broken hull on Romulus as a symbol of victory. Commanded the Deranas.
name: Tomalak 2E (Homefront III)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation Law Treachery DL/ Any Captain's Order card

lore: "How long shall we stare at each other across the Neutral Zone?" Commander: Terix.
name: Tomalak 2E (Irate Commander)
text: Diplomacy Exobiology Leadership OFFICER At the start of each of your turns, you may stop your [Rom] personnel present to reveal the top card of each player's deck.

lore: "The Institute is having an exhibition of new artists next month. He might want to include my work. ... It's a chance to show that both Bajorans and Cardassians look at the universe in the same way."
name: Tora Ziyal 2E (Beloved Daughter)
text: Anthropology Geology Honor When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to draw a card.

lore: Ambitious brute sent as an assassin to kill political dissidents in 2370. Rose to the rank of Gul. Not to be confused with the commander of Outpost 61.
name: Toran 2E (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 Astrophysics Diplomacy Physics DL/ {Assassination Plot}

lore: "People blame the military for the wars we are asked to fight." Commander: Khazara.
name: Toreth 2E (Cautious Commander)
text: Honor Leadership Navigation OFFICER When this personnel uses a skill to complete a mission, you may examine an opponent's hand and choose one of those cards to be discarded. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: The hunted species known as Tosk had no identity outside of the hunt. He befriended Miles O'Brien after traveling through the wormhole in 2369.
name: Tosk 2E (Second Edition)
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 Honor ENGINEER Computer Skill Excluded from random selections.

lore: Austere commander romantically involved with Charles Tucker III. Commander of Enterprise in Jonathan Archer's absence.
name: T'Pol 2E (Straight and Steady)
text: SCIENCE Diplomacy OFFICER Mindmeld Stellar Cartography

lore: Austere commander romantically involved with Charles Tucker III. Commander of Enterprise in Jonathan Archer's absence.
name: T'Pol 2E (Straight and Steady)
text: SCIENCE Diplomacy OFFICER Mindmeld Stellar Cartography

lore: "Captain, the spy! It's Michael Jonas! He's the one that sabotaged the ship!"
name: Traitor Exposed 2E
text: Randomly select a Treachery personnel. If that personnel has CUNNING>6, he or she is stopped. Otherwise, he or she is killed.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
lore: "I'm reading an ion storm on that trajectory, sir. Should I go around it?"
name: Traverse Ion Storm 2E
text: (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) + CUNNING>40 + (Biology + SCIENCE OR Any Intelligence + Treachery) When you score points for completing this mission, lose 5 points for each other mission that has already been completed.

lore: Space boomer born aboard the ECS Horizon. Joined Starfleet to travel as far - and as fast - as he could. Enjoys ancient gangster stories.
name: Travis Mayweather 2E (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER Navigation x 2 Astrophysics Geology Transporter Skill DL/ {Space Boomer}

lore: Contract killer employed by Vaatrik Pallra to shadow Quark and, if necessary, dispose of him.
name: Trazko 2E (Hired Muscle)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Computer Skill Treachery x 2 Order - Return this personnel to his owner's hand to kill an opponent's Treachery personnel present.

lore: Provide medical assistance to last members of disease-ravaged culture.
name: Treat Plague Ship 2E (Energize)
text: Biology + CUNNING>26 + discard one MEDICAL personnel * +10 if {Plague Planet} complete.

lore: Prioritizing the most urgent cases first, as Dr. Crusher did on Rutia IV, requires swift evaluation and unbiased medical judgment to save as many lives as possible.
name: Triage 2E (Second Edition)
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Biology or MEDICAL. To get past requires INTEGRITY>22 remaining.

lore: "The Prophets will not let anything happen to him."
name: Trial of Faith 2E
text: Prophet. To play this event, you must command (have in play) three [Baj] personnel. Plays in your core (on table). An opponent may play a card he or she owns that is on this event as if that card were in his or her hand. If he or she does, score 5 points. Order - Examine an opponent's discard pile. Place one of those cards on this event. You may do this only once each turn.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Warbird involved in the 2369 race to unravel the DNA puzzle discovered by Richard Galen. Commanded by Galathon.
name: Trolarak 2E (Energize)
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: "Romulan interests will be served through cooperation. And my role is to keep unauthorized personnel away from the cloaking device."
name: T'Rul 2E (Curt Subcommander)
text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill SECURITY Order - If this personnel is aboard a ship on your {Engage Cloak}, examine the top card of an opponent's deck.

lore: Exposed as a traitor, N'Vek went from captor to memory in the blink of an eye.
name: Twist of Fate 2E
text: When your [Rom] personnel is about to be killed, randomly select another of your personnel present to be killed instead.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: "Officially, it's classified as an escort vessel. Unofficially, the Defiant's a warship. Nothing more, nothing less."
name: U.S.S. Defiant 2E (Prototype Warship)
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. While this ship is in an ship battle, it is Weapons +1 and Shields +2. Tractor Beam

lore: "The new Praetor, someone called Shinzon, has requested a Federation envoy. ... You're the closest ship so I want you to go and hear what he has to say."
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-E 2E (Federation Envoy)
text: Tractor Beam. When you complete a [Fed] planet mission, if this ship is at that mission, score 5 points.

lore: Red Squad training ship caught behind enemy lines during the Dominion War. Captained by Tim Watters.
name: U.S.S. Valiant 2E (Necessary Evil)
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Training Cruise}

lore: "I have cut you a lot of slack in the past. I even looked the other way once or twice when I could have come down hard on you. But those days are over. ... you so much as litter on the Promenade and I will nail you to the wall."
name: Under Scrutiny 2E
text: Plays in your core (on table). When you play this event, name a personnel. While that personnel is attempting a mission, his or her owner must discard a card from hand to use his or her skills.

lore: Charles Tucker's experimentation with Xyrillian granules at Ah'len's suggestion led to surprises culinary, romantic, and even obstetric.
name: Unexpected 2E (Energize)
text: Unless you have Astrophysics and 2 Exobiology OR a female who has MEDICAL, one personnel (random selection, excluding females) is placed atop owner's draw deck.

lore: "Did you say something, pinkskin?"
name: Ungracious Hosts 2E
text: Choose a personnel. Your opponent may discard cards from hand equal to the number of [*] icons on that personnel to place him or her in your opponent's brig.

lore: "I was walking along, minding my own business, making a simple geological sweep and something stuck me in the leg."
name: Unknown Microorganism 2E
text: Unless you have Biology + MEDICAL + SCIENCE OR SECURITY x2 + a non-Hand Weapon equipment, randomly select a personnel to be killed, all of your other personnel are stopped, and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: "Might we be of assistance?"
name: Valdore 2E
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. When an opponent begins an ship battle involving your other ship, if this ship is on your {Engage Cloak}, you may place this ship at that mission to join that ship battle.

lore: "My father was a great man. A great leader. ... I try to be strong, the way he was strong, but... it's difficult."
name: Varis Sul 2E (Tetrarch of the Paqu)
text: Geology Honor Law While a [Baj] Leadership personnel is in your discard pile, this personnel gains Diplomacy and Leadership.

lore: "She was barely an adult when I found her. Idealistic. Naive. Full of dreams. And I made all her dreams come true. Didn't I? At a slight cost of course. She had to lose all those pesky ideals. But then maybe that was what made these years so wonderful, watching her lose them one by one until none were left."
name: Varria 2E (Lavishly Rewarded Aide)
text: Geology Honor Navigation SECURITY Transporter Skill

lore: Treasure hunter, archaeologist, liar, and thief romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. Partnered with Q to explore distant Gamma Quadrant ruins.
name: Vash 2E (The Next Generation)
text: SCIENCE Archaeology x 2 Treachery Anthropology Smuggling Acquisition DL/ {Dig}

lore: "The internal security net has been sabotaged... which suggests someone didn't want to be that easily found."
name: Vastly Outnumbered 2E (Second Edition)
text: If STRENGTH>55, lose 5 points. To get past requires Anthropology and 2 Honor OR two hand weapons OR INTEGRITY>28 (INTEGRITY>48 if this is a [DQ] mission).

lore: Cardassian warship that surveyed Dorvan V. Pursued the Liberty into the Badlands. Commanded by Evek.
name: Vetar 2E (Second Edition)
text: Tractor Beam DL/ Any [Pursuit] card WEAPONS +2 vs. [Maq].

lore: Human survivor who became a green-skinned slave girl in an illusion. Attempted to seduce Christopher Pike for her Talosian captors.
name: Vina 2E (Reflections 2.0)
text: CIVILIAN Honor Start of each turn, select a skill; loses skill at end of turn.

lore: "Accept this gift from the Prophets."
name: Vision of Violence 2E
text: Prophet. When your [Baj] personnel is in personnel battle, add the STRENGTH of a [Baj] personnel in your discard pile to your total STRENGTH.

lore: "What if I could travel into the future again? This time, just before the destruction of DS9? I could find out what's going to happen, then return to the present in time for us to prevent it from happening."
name: Visionary 2E
text: Temporal. To play this event, you must command (have in play) two [2eDS9] Engineer personnel. Plays in your core (on table). When you draw a card, you may discard that card to draw a card. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "The Vorta are experts at cloning." "It tends to mitigate the risk involved in so much of our work."
name: Vorta Cloning 2E
text: Plays in your core (on table). When you are about to place a Vorta in your discard pile, you may reveal a card from hand and remove it from the game to take that Vorta into hand instead.

lore: Representative of scanning devices used by 22nd-century space-faring civilizations. Used aboard Enterprise as a complement to standard-issue devices.
name: Vulcan Tricorder 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: Your [22] personnel present who have ENGINEER or SCIENCE classification all add Biology OR Geology OR SCIENCE. (May re-select once each turn.)

lore: When one of his warp field experiments trapped his mother in a collapsing warp bubble, Wesley was fortunate an expert was on hand to aid in her rescue.
name: Warp Bubble Mishap 2E (To Boldly Go)
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Physics or SCIENCE. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

lore: A Klingon proverb holds that "if a warrior does not fight, he does not breathe."
name: Warrior's Birthright 2E (Second Edition)
text: Plays on your mission. Your [Kli], [Kaz], [Hir], [TE], and [KCA] personnel may contribute their STRENGTH instead towards INTEGRITY and CUNNING requirements of mission, and dilemmas here.

lore: "Let's batten down the hatches."
name: Wavefront 2E
text: Unless you have a personnel who has 2 (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) OR a personnel who has 2 Navigation, your opponent chooses an (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) or Navigation personnel to be stopped. If your opponent cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: "If a war starts here, the blame will be yours."
name: We Will Not Surrender 2E
text: Maneuver. Plays in your core (on table). Order - Destroy this event to begin an ship battle involving your [Kli] Officer personnel. If you win, score 10 points and randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

lore: Nova Squadron pilot during the collision on stardate 45703. Cadet third class. Lost a year's worth of academy credits for his part in the cover-up.
name: Wesley Crusher 2E (Homefront III)
text: OFFICER Navigation Physics Youth Honor Computer Skill Stellar Cartography X=3 or 7.

lore: "...Mozart, who as a small child wrote astonishing symphonies. ... Wesley is such a person. Not with music, but without the equally lovely intricacies of time, energy, propulsion..."
name: Wesley Crusher 2E (Prodigy)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he gains ENGINEER, Exobiology, Navigation, and SCIENCE.

lore: "Now that I've done something for you, perhaps there's something you'd consent to do for me."
name: Weyoun 2E (Loyal Subject of the Dominion)
text: Anthropology Diplomacy Law Leadership SECURITY Treachery When this personnel uses a skill to complete a mission, you may draw a card.

lore: Maquis saboteur William Patrick Samuels was a farmer from Volan II. Covertly planted a protomatter implosion device aboard the Bok'Nor.
name: Bill Samuels 2E (Energize)
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Treachery DL/ {Organized Terrorist Activities}

lore: "I have no problem with following any rules you lay down, short of compromising your safety."
name: William T. Riker 2E (First Officer)
text: Anthropology Leadership Navigation OFFICER When this personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may unstop one of your stopped [TNG] personnel present. That personnel joins this mission attempt.

lore: "Just when I thought this couldn't get any worse."
name: William T. Riker 2E (Number One)
text: Diplomacy Leadership Navigation OFFICER While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he gains Anthropology and SECURITY.

lore: "... the details of this debriefing will remain classified, as ordered by the Command Council."
name: Williams 2E (Starfleet Commander)
text: Anthropology x 2 Leadership OFFICER While this personnel is facing a dilemma and your [Sta] personnel present is about to be stopped, you may stop this personnel to prevent that.

lore: Kai of Bajor formerly known as Vedek Winn. Won her post through ambitious political maneuvering. Fairly successful as a negotiator.
name: Winn Adami 2E (Second Edition)
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Law Treachery DL/ {Diplomatic Contact}

lore: "I return your family honor. I give you back what was wrongfully taken from you. Let your name be spoken once again. You are Worf...son of Mogh."
name: Worf 2E (Son of Mogh)
text: Honor x 2 OFFICER Physics SECURITY x 2 When you play this personnel, each opponent draws a card.

name: You Could Be Invaluable 2E (Call to Arms)
text: Seeds or plays on table. At the start of a mission attempt involving only your [DS9][Maq] personnel, you may reveal the top card of opponent's draw deck. If it is a personnel neither player has in play, opponent reports them to your attempting crew or Away Team (under your control; they gain [Maq]). Return personnel to opponent's hand (if still in play) at end of mission attempt. (Unique.)

lore: Identification: PROFICIENCY DRONE Task: Tertiary adjunct of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
name: Seven of Nine (The Borg)
text: ENGINEER Stellar Cartography Computer Skill Physics May apply [Com], [Nav] and [Def] to staffing. May draw a card in place of your normal card play.

lore: Worf resigned his Starfleet commission to join Gowron during the 2367-68 Klingon Civil War. Saved the I.K.C. Bortas from destruction by Duras forces.
name: Worf Son of Mogh
text: SECURITY SECURITY Leadership Honor x 2 DL/ {Qapla'!} If with {Gowron} on {I.K.C. Bortas}, it is all attributes +3.

lore: Commander of Starbase 247 in an alternate future. At odds with Governor Worf. Battled Klingons near Devron.
name: Admiral Riker
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Navigation Music Your leaders here may initiate battle against [Kli]. DL/ {Any Enterprise} (if aboard your matching facility).

lore: Third of the nine mysterious energy vortices called Tears of the Prophets by the Bajorans. Grants visions of the future. Only Orb not stolen by Cardassians during the occupation.
name: Orb of Prophecy and Change
text: Use as Equipment card. Once each turn, you may glance at the top card of your draw deck. Insert it anywhere within your draw deck if you wish. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Cardassian male. Virtual player in the Vorta scenario testing the resolve of Alpha Quadrant species. Risked his life in the defense of his comrades.
name: Garak
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Computer Skill Honor May replace anyone present randomly selected to die.

lore: 29-year-old Vulcan on first deep space assignment aboard Captain Sulu's U.S.S. Excelsior in 2293. Joined Starfleet under pressure from his parents.
name: Ensign Tuvok
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Mindmeld Youth Once per game, may cancel ship battle at same nebula.

lore: Romulan Astrophysical Academy member on deep space duty in 2351. Beamed to the present via a micro-wormhole to the U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Dr. Telek R'Mor
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics x 2 Stellar Cartography Honor ENGINEER May report directly to any ship.

lore: Quark wedded Grilka by brek'tal ritual to head the House of Kozak (as the House of Quark) on Qo'noS. The Ferengi saved his be'nal from financial ruin.
name: Quark Son of Keldar
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Computer Skill x 2 Honor Greed Attributes all +3 if with {Grilka}.

lore: Convicted traitor. Maquis sympathizer. Best pilot Harry Kim has ever seen. In an alternate reality, a bar fight cost Tom Paris his future aboard the U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Thomas Paris
text: CIVILIAN Navigation x 2 Transporter Skill SECURITY Treachery (May convert to Honor for rest of game).

lore: "Truth, Doctor, is in the eye of the beholder. I never tell the truth because I don't believe there is such a thing."
name: Elim Garak 2E (Plain, Simple Tailor)
text: Diplomacy Obsidian Order Computer Skill Treachery When this personnel is about to be killed by a dilemma, you may discard a personnel from hand to take this personnel into your hand instead.

lore: The Ferengi first acquired warp technology by purchasing it from another race. They have looked for subsequent advances at far lower prices.
name: Borts 2E
text: Exobiology MEDICAL Computer Skill Treachery

lore: Prevent annihilation of inhabited star system by deranged scientist.
name: Avert Solar Implosion 2E (Dangerous Missions)
text: Anthropology + Leadership + OFFICER + Honor + STRENGTH>38 OR {James T. Kirk} + {Jean-Luc Picard}

lore: Repatriate historic object to reliquary on the Vulcan homeworld.
name: Deliver Ancient Artifact 2E (Dangerous Missions)
text: Archaeology + Exobiology + Geology + SCIENCE + CUNNING>37 OR any artifact with "Vulcan" in title or lore

lore: As hard to catch as a Norpin falcon, crafty and cunning Maquis leader Michael Eddington was able to stay one step ahead of the dogged pursuit of his former commanding officer.
name: Maquis Vendetta 2E (Dangerous Missions)
text: To get past, "stop" a Leadership personnel (random selection). If that personnel has OFFICER or SECURITY, randomly select two additional personnel to be "stopped."

lore: When unknown threats appear, priority is immediately placed on defensive systems and evasive actions.
name: Shields Up! 2E (Dangerous Missions)
text: To get past, "stop" a SECURITY personnel (random selection). If that personnel has Astrophysics or Stellar Cartography or Navigation, randomly select two additional personnel to be "stopped."

name: Not Quite Domesticated Pets 2E
text: Unless you have Diplomacy + Leadership x2 + INTEGRITY>28 OR Biology + Exobiology x2 + CUNNING>34, randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If your opponent has more events in his or her core than you and he or she does not command that personnel, place that personnel at his or her headquarters mission instead and that opponent now commands that personnel.

lore: Intelligent scientist in charge of the Genesis Project. When showing off her results, she quipped, "Can I cook or can't I?"
name: Carol Marcus 2E (Life From Lifelessness)
text: SCIENCE Exobiology x 2 Honor Physics X = number of cards in opponent's hand (limit 5).
