lore: "You know, I spent my whole life getting ready for Starfleet. And on my very first mission, I'm gonna die."
name: Harry Kim 2E (Eager to Please)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Biology Physics Computer Skill SCIENCE Transporter Skill While this personnel is facing a dilemma at a [DQ] mission, each of your Computer Skill personnel present is attributes +1.

lore: "Energy wave at two-hundred forty degrees port."
name: Unbelievable Emergency 2E
text: Your opponent names a skill. For each headquarters mission you command, randomly select two personnel to be stopped. If either of those personnel that is selected has the named skill, kill that personnel instead.

lore: "The Kobayashi Maru... On the test, sir. Will you tell me what you did? I would really like to know."
name: Saavik 2E (Protegee)
text: Law Leadership Navigation OFFICER When you play this personnel, if {James T. Kirk} is at this mission, you may download {No-Win Situation}.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Female; The Circle-related personnel; Vedek;
lore: Hero of Bajor Kira Nerys posed as a vedek to enter the Chamber of Ministers. Exposed Cardassian connections to the Circle.
name: Vedek Kira 2E (Dangerous Missions)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Navigation Archaeology DL/ {Hidden Fighter}

lore: "We are working together... trust me."
name: James T. Kirk 2E (Irrational Human Being)
text: Anthropology Honor Leadership SECURITY When your Leadership personnel present is selected by a dilemma, you may stop this personnel to make that personnel attributes +3 until the end of that dilemma.

lore: "We have to work together." Commander: U.S.S. Enterprise-D.
name: Jean-Luc Picard 2E (Captain of the Enterprise)
text: Diplomacy Honor Leadership OFFICER Computer Skill SECURITY When your [Fed] personnel present is killed by a dilemma, you may make this personnel attributes +3 and gain Leadership until the end of the turn. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "I am alone."
name: Worf 2E (The Strongest Heart)
text: Honor x 2 Leadership OFFICER SECURITY When your Host or Honor Klingon present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to prevent that.

lore: "If we join together, no force can stop us." (Host)
name: Jadzia Dax 2E (The Second Heart)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Honor Physics SCIENCE Order - Stop your Honor Klingon present and destroy an event in your core to take an event from your discard pile into hand.

lore: "There is a reward for your death. ... Somebody up there wants you out of the way."
name: Martia 2E (Duplicitous Chameloid)
text: Biology Exobiology SCIENCE Treachery Order - This personnel gains one skill and one keyword from one of your personnel present. She keeps that skill and keyword until this order is executed again.

lore: Misplacing advanced technology can endanger both the development of pre-warp societies and those studying them.
name: Contaminating a Culture 2E (Captain's Log)
text: To get past requires 2 Anthropology; then place on mission until solved. If any equipment is discarded here, its owner loses points (discard dilemma).

lore: "I'm sure I speak on behalf of my entire crew when I say ... It's good to be home!"
name: A Sight For Sore Eyes 2E
text: To play this event, you must command three [Sta] personnel. Play on table. At the start of each of your turns, score 5 points. At the end of each of your turns, if you have at least 5 points, lose 5 points.

lore: Task: Irrelevant. Drone abandoned by the Collective after its ship was disabled by an unknown pathogen.
name: Fifth 2E (Neonatal Drone)
text: ENGINEER MEDICAL SECURITY Order - Stop this personnel to take a non-dilemma card you own from on top of your event into hand.

lore: Task: Irrelevant. Drone abandoned by the Collective after its ship was disabled by an unknown pathogen.
name: Second 2E (Neonatal Drone)
text: Exobiology Computer Skill SCIENCE When your unique Borg present is about to be stopped, you may discard a random card from hand and stop this personnel to prevent that.

lore: Comparable captain of Columbia, the second Warp 5 ship. Romantically involved with Jonathan Archer.
name: Erika Hernandez 2E (Captain's Log)
text: OFFICER Anthropology Diplomacy Leadership SECURITY DL/ Any Captain's Order card

lore: Cautious admiral responsible for overseeing portions of the NX project and removing "dead wood" from Starfleet's ranks.
name: Daniel Leonard 2E (Captain's Log)
text: V.I.P. Leadership Navigation x 2 DL/ Any [Sta] ship

lore: "There's only one way back to the Ogla for you, and that's if you earn your name. So I guess that's what you'll have to do."
name: Observe Kazon Ritual 2E
text: Anthropology + Honor + OFFICER + Transporter Skill + INTEGRIY>31 OR (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) + Navigation + SECURITY + Treachery + STRENGTH>34

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
lore: "We call it a spacial trajector. We're able to travel to all the planets in this quadrant."
name: Obtain Advanced Technology 2E
text: Anthropology + Diplomacy + Honor + INTEGRITY>29 OR SECURITY + Transporter Skill + Treachery + CUNNING>30

lore: "All, all this time, I thought, I thought I was so lucky. No, no family back home. Nobody to miss."
name: Bennet 2E
text: Archaeology Geology SCIENCE SECURITY When you play this personnel, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card from hand.

characteristicsKeywords: Trill; Captain; Female; Trill with symbiont;
lore: "That's 'captain.' It's an old naval tradition. Whoever is in command of a ship, regardless of rank, is referred to as 'captain.'" Commander: U.S.S. Defiant.
name: Jadzia Dax 2E (Defiant Captain)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography OFFICER Physics SCIENCE Transporter Skill While this personnel is aboard your {U.S.S. Defiant}, she loses [Stf] and gains [Cmd] and Leadership.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: "Restricting the Defiant to guard duty would be a serious mistake."
name: U.S.S. Defiant 2E (Patrolling Warship)
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. When an opponent's ship moves to this mission, if this ship's Commander is aboard it, that opponent's ship is stopped.

lore: "I can't resist a man who knows what he wants and goes after it."
name: Sweet Nothings 2E
text: To play this interrupt, you must command three [Fer] personnel. Order - Choose an opponent to reveal his or her hand. You may draw a card for each interrupt revealed.

lore: Harvest rare substance for use as replacement power source.
name: Collect Omicron Particles 2E (Captain's Log)
text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Astrophysics + Navigation Adjacent missions are span -1.

lore: "Vertiron emanations ... tunneling secondary particles. It certainly looks like a wormhole."
name: Explore Micro-Wormhole 2E
text: (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) + OFFICER + Transporter Skill + CUNNING>32 When you complete this mission, you may place any number of personnel on your ship here on your ship at an [AQ] mission.

lore: "All we know is that a member of our crew has been accused of murder."
name: Investigate Alleged Murder 2E
text: Diplomacy + Law + OFFICER + INTEGRITY>27 You may attempt and complete this mission using your [Non] personnel with these requirements: Anthropology, Security, Transporters, and Strength>28.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
lore: "A stable transuranic element inside a natural environment. This is a first."
name: Investigate Unknown Element 2E
text: Anthropology + Leadership + OFFICER + INTEGRITY>27 OR Exobiology + Geology + SCIENCE + CUNNING>30

lore: "I was raised by the Borg."
name: Seven of Nine 2E (Reclaimed Drone)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Exobiology Physics Computer Skill

lore: "You people are so used to lying you don't even tell the truth to each other!"
name: A Pattern Of Lies 2E
text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless at least one of them is a different species than the others, all three are stopped.

lore: "I think I know my way around an engine room."
name: B'Elanna Torres 2E (Straightforward Engineer)
text: ENGINEER x 2 Physics Computer Skill SCIENCE Treachery Order - If this personnel is aboard your ship, discard a card from hand to remove a Damage card from that ship. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "It's been a long road Getting from there to here."
name: A Long Road 2E
text: To play this interrupt, you must command a Navigation personnel. Order - Discard a card from hand to take up to two [Pursuit] cards from your discard pile into hand.

name: Warp Speed Transfer 2E (Captain's Log)
text: Plays on table. When your crew is attempting a space mission aboard your ship, you may suspend play to move your other staffed ship on the same spaceline (up to double its full RANGE) to that mission and place one personnel aboard on the attempting ship; that personnel joins the crew. Each ship's RANGE for this turn is used, then place incident out-of-play. (Unique.)

lore: "We dominate entire worlds. We extend our will across time."
name: Vosk 2E (Temporal Fanatic)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Exobiology Leadership OFFICER Treachery x 2 For each Temporal event in your core, this personnel is attributes +1 (limit +4). When you do not command a Temporal event, place this personnel in his owner's discard pile.

lore: With the firepower of the Starship Defiant at her disposal, the former communications officer quickly assumed a new position of power. "You are speaking to Empress Sato."
name: Empress 2E (Archive Portrait)
text: Plays on your Contender (for free if {any Hoshi}). Once per game, at the start of your turn, discard event to complete a Contender-related objective (but draw no cards).

lore: "You are being clever, Commander."
name: Charvanek 2E (Fleet Commander)*
text: Archaeology Diplomacy OFFICER Physics SCIENCE

lore: "They'll die! You'd let them suffocate? Even if we could prevent it?"
name: Compassionate Interference 2E
text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you reveal a Biology personnel from your hand OR reveal a Geology personnel from your hand, that personnel is killed instead.

lore: "You've proven a worthy opponent, Captain. I would've preferred to die fighting you, but I suppose I can settle for this."
name: Last Gasp 2E
text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you reveal a Leadership personnel from your hand or reveal an OFFICER personnel from your hand, that personnel is killed instead.

lore: "We look for things. ... Things we need. ... Things that make us go." Commander: Mondor.
name: Grebnedlog 2E (Pakled Captain)
text: Exobiology Honor Leadership OFFICER While present with a non-[Non] personnel, this personnel loses Honor and gains Transporter Skill and Treachery.

lore: "What is my purpose? ... My function? My reason for being?"
name: Lal 2E (Beloved)
text: Computer Skill While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may reveal three Androids from hand to make her attributes +4 and gain any two skills until the end of the turn. If you do this, she is killed at the end of this turn. You may only do this once each turn.

lore: "Jolan True, Mister Spock. Look what I've brought you."
name: D'Tan 2E (Curious Youth)
text: Anthropology Archaeology Geology Honor SCIENCE When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, choose an opponent to discard the top card of his or her deck.

lore: "Even with the treaty they're still skittish about protecting their border."
name: Trager 2E (Patrol Ship)
text: Tractor Beam. When this ship is about to move from an opponent's mission, subtract 2 from the Range required.

lore: "Captain, please come back down here."
name: Armed Search Party 2E
text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless they have STRENGTH>17 or you have a non-Hand Weapon equipment, for each headquarters mission you command, randomly select one of those personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig.

lore: "But that array has such a narrow scan field, we might as well break out the palm-beacons and try to find them that way."
name: Difficult Rescue 2E
text: Unless you have SHIELDS + remaining RANGE > the number of personnel attempting this mission, randomly select a personnel to be killed and all your other personnel are stopped.

lore: "It's a good thing we got him here when we did. His cortex was on the verge of synaptic collapse."
name: Psionic Attack 2E
text: Unless you have MEDICAL + SCIENCE OR SECURITY x3, randomly select a personnel to place on the bottom of his or her owner's deck. If that personnel has Anthropology, randomly select an additional personnel and place that personnel on the bottom of his or her owner's deck.

lore: "Somebody got in here and disconnected it from the primary antimatter feed."
name: Sabotaged Reactor 2E
text: Unless you have (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) + ENGINEER + Navigation OR Leadership + OFFICER + CUNNING>28, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship.

lore: After the Eugenics Wars of the 20th century, human genetic engineering was outlawed. An encounter with hostile augments in 2154 reaffirmed the need for the ban.
name: Stand-Off 2E (Captain's Log)
text: To get past requires three personnel with Anthropology OR three personnel with SECURITY classification.

lore: A highly contagious disease which kills its victims through increased body temperature and destruction of blood vessel walls. Samples were kept at Cold Station 12 in 2154.
name: Symbalene Blood Burn 2E (Captain's Log)
text: Kills one personnel (random selection). Place on facility here (your choice, quarantined). Now and start of each turn, kills one personnel aboard (your choice).

lore: "I'm going to need your help. Someone's got to defuse this thing."
name: Under Pressure 2E
text: Unless you have (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) + ENGINEER + Navigation OR Biology + MEDICAL + SCIENCE, randomly select a personnel to be killed. You may randomly select two personnel to be stopped to prevent this.

lore: Kathryn Janeway offered the disconnected drone Seven of Nine a new life free from the Borg Collective and the chance to rediscover her humanity as Annika Hansen.
name: Starting Over 2E (Captain's Log)
text: Discard your hand, then draw the same number of cards. If you have a Borg personnel in play, draw two extra cards. (No draws may be converted to downloads.) Discard event.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Colonel; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
lore: Blockade commander Kira Nerys opposed the Romulans at Derna. She commanded DS9 in 2375.
name: Colonel Kira 2E (Warp Pack)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Leadership Once each turn (twice per game), you may draw a card for each staffed [Baj] ship here.

lore: "He told me that he was scared. He was afraid Odo would kill him."
name: Zayra 2E (Bigoted Witness)
text: Anthropology Archaeology Physics Transporter Skill Treachery While this personnel is present with your non-[Baj] personnel, he cannot use his skills.

lore: "Something very strange is going on. Ensign Kim said we'd encountered a spatial distortion."
name: Baxter 2E (Wandering Security Officer)
text: Archaeology Geology SECURITY When this personnel is placed in his owner's discard pile from play, you may take an event from your discard pile into your hand.

lore: "You expect us to believe you are using every means at your disposal to track down one of your own?" Commander: Trager.
name: Macet 2E (Skeptical Commander)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Leadership OFFICER Treachery While this personnel is aboard your {Trager} and this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may meet Diplomacy and Honor requirements of that dilemma using Treachery instead.

lore: "The Gammas have many flaws."
name: Umat'Adan 2E (Eager Fifth)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Biology Navigation SCIENCE While this personnel is facing a dilemma, return your non-Alpha Jem'Hadar present to its owner's hand to make this personnel attributes +2 until the end of that dilemma. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, return your non-Alpha Jem'Hadar present to its owner's hand to make this personnel attributes +2 until the end of that dilemma.

lore: Security personnel perform a variety of duties on Voyager. Sometimes this includes guarding the brig or protecting the ship from invading forces.
name: Andreas Colter 2E
text: OFFICER Computer Skill SECURITY While this personnel is facing a dilemma, each of your SECURITY personnel present is Strength +1.

lore: "I guess I'm used to doing things a little differently. On our ship when something went wrong, you fixed it."
name: Kenneth Dalby 2E (Insubordinate Crewman)
text: ENGINEER Leadership Computer Skill SECURITY Treachery At the start of each of your turns, you may examine the top card of an opponent's deck. You may choose to place that card on the bottom of its owner's deck.

lore: Arrogant engineer believed to have improved engine performance on several ships in 2364. Finds problem solving highly therapeutic.
name: Kosinski 2E (Captain's Log)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics SCIENCE Stellar Cartography X=4 when facing a dilemma.

lore: Observant officer serving aboard U.S.S. Voyager. In 2373, she accompanied Chakotay on a shuttle mission to conduct a survey of the Nekrit Expanse.
name: Marie Kaplan 2E (Captain's Log)
text: SCIENCE Archaeology MEDICAL Biology Transporter Skill

lore: "A significant number of my crew members have expressed a desire to return, even knowing the odds." Commander: U.S.S. Enterprise-C.
name: Rachel Garrett 2E (Displaced Captain)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Diplomacy Leadership Navigation OFFICER Transporter Skill When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, randomly return one of your personnel present to his or her owner's hand.

lore: "I'm sorry to disturb you Captain, but I thought ... I thought I should inform you of my physical condition."
name: Samantha Wildman 2E (First Mother on Voyager)
text: Biology Exobiology SCIENCE When you play this personnel, you may return a non-dilemma card on your Decay event to its owner's hand.

lore: "A logical, though highly speculative analysis."
name: Tuvok 2E (Chief of Security)
text: Anthropology Biology Honor Law Leadership OFFICER SECURITY While this personnel is facing a dilemma that requires OFFICER or SECURITY at a [DQ] mission, he is attributes +2 and gains SECURITY.

lore: "I always heard primitive hew-mons lacked intelligence, but I never thought they'd be this stupid." Commander: Quark's Treasure.
name: Quark 2E (Little Green Man)
text: Acquisition Anthropology Physics While this personnel is present with a [AU] personnel, he is attributes +1 and gains Acquisition, Diplomacy, and Treachery.

lore: Profiteer representive of Ferengi second officers. Opposed Bok's decision to give away the salvaged U.S.S. Stargazer at no cost.
name: Rata 2E (Captain's Log)
text: OFFICER Treachery Acquisition Greed Geology Astrophysics

lore: "I have standing orders to fire on all Federation ships!" Commander: I.K.S. T'Ong.
name: K'Temoc 2E (Long Slumbering Commander)
text: Leadership Navigation OFFICER Treachery When this personnel is involved in combat and you command more Assault events than each opponent, you may kill this personnel to unstop each of your Klingon personnel present at the end of that combat.

lore: "Captain, we both want very much to be part of your journey."
name: Kes 2E (Curious Ocampa)
text: Biology x 2 Geology MEDICAL SCIENCE Empathy While you command a completed planet mission, place this personnel in her owner's discard pile.

lore: "It will be my job to anticipate your needs before you have them. And I anticipate your first need will be me." Commander: Baxial.
name: Neelix 2E (Morale Officer)
text: Anthropology Diplomacy Exobiology Navigation While facing a dilemma at a [DQ] mission, this personnel gains Acquisition and Honor.

lore: "I'm not going to entrust the security of Andoria to the pinkskins, or anyone else!"
name: Shran 2E (Reluctant Diplomat)
text: Diplomacy Leadership OFFICER Treachery When one of your non-Andorian personnel present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may stop this personnel to prevent that.

lore: Telepathic Reman advisor to the Praetor, Shinzon. Dominion War veteran. General of a Reman Army.
name: The Viceroy 2E (Captain's Log)
text: MEDICAL Diplomacy Empathy Treachery Biology When an opponent plays an event, you may discard a card to download an event to hand.

lore: "One more ship will make no difference in the here and now. But twenty-two years ago, one ship could have stopped this war before it started."
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-C 2E (Yesterday's Enterprise)
text: Tractor Beam. When you complete a [KLI] mission, if this ship is at that mission, score 5 points.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: "Knowing their mission must help us understand them!" "There's nothing to understand. These are Klingons, they'll attack!"
name: I.K.S. T'Ong 2E (Sleeper Ship)
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. When you win an engagement with this ship and its Commander is aboard it, you may place a [Kli] personnel from hand aboard this ship.

lore: You will seek the prophets. In the end, not for Bajor and not for the Federation. But for yourself, for your own pagh.
name: Destined Journey 2E
text: Choose a personnel who has Honor or Leadership to be stopped. If that personnel has both Honor and Leadership, you may unstop your stopped personnel present and that personnel joins the mission attempt. If you cannot choose a personnel with Honor or Leadership, all your personnel are stopped.

lore: "Soon he will feel the burning of his Vulcan blood."
name: Accelerated Aging 2E
text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel at this mission cannot use his or her first-listed skill. At the end of this turn, this dilemma is overcome.

lore: "No ... Kirk. The game's not over. To the last I will grapple with thee!"
name: Final Triumph 2E
text: Unless you choose to discard an event from your hand, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped.

name: Blow You Out of the Stars 2E
text: Plays in your core. Order - Begin an engagement involving your [Kli] personnel. If you win, place this event on an opponent's ship involved. That opponent may place one of his or her unique personnel involved in your brig to prevent this and destroy this event. If you do not win, destroy this event. (Unique.) Hull: -35%

lore: With mint frosting.
name: Cellular Peptide Cake 2E (Genesis)
text: Plays on table. At any time, you may return an opponent's Event to hand (except if [Ref], a Treaty, or immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}). Then return this card to hand and discard an Event OR Discard event.

lore: "...KHAN!"
name: Khan! 2E (Genesis)
text: Just after an opponent scores bonus points, nullify those points. OR Nullifies {The Genesis Effect}.

lore: Study final collapse of unstable and formerly forbidden planet.
name: Genesis Planet 2E (Genesis)
text: Geology + CUNNING>42 + (Biology + Exobiology + SCIENCE OR SECURITY + Transporter Skill + Treachery)

lore: "...I have the bad habit of telling the truth ... even when people don't want to hear it."
name: Kira Nerys 2E (Outspoken Major)
text: Diplomacy Honor Leadership SECURITY While this personnel is facing a dilemma, each [Baj] personnel present is attributes +1 and gains Honor.

lore: Occasionally, some of them do find their way to the surface. We don t know how. But the Ocampa seal the tunnels afterwards.
name: Subterranean Barrier 2E
text: Unless you have Biology + Exobiology + Geology + INTEGRITY>25 OR Diplomacy + Leadership + OFFICER + CUNNING>32, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

lore: Harry Kim and B'Elanna Torres were abducted by the Caretaker and exiled to the subterranean Ocampan society.
name: The Caretaker's "Guests" 2E (Genesis)
text: One personnel present (opponent's choice) is placed atop draw deck. You may place a different personnel of the same affiliation from your discard pile with this crew or Away Team.

name: Learning Curve 2E (Genesis)
text: Plays on table. At the end of each of your turns, if you played two or more [Maq] personnel this turn, you may place two cards from the top of your draw deck face down on this incident. You may play [Maq] cards from this incident as though they were in your hand. At any time, you may place this card and each card atop it beneath your draw deck to draw that many cards. (Unique.)

lore: "How we deal with death is at least as important as how we deal with life, wouldn't you say?"
name: No-win Situation 2E
text: Plays in your core. When your dilemma is prevented or its requirements are met, randomly select an opponent's personnel that was facing that dilemma to be stopped.

name: The Genesis Effect 2E (Genesis)
text: Plays on your unexamined mission. When you play this incident, name a dilemma. When attempting this mission with >2 and <8 personnel and your personnel face that dilemma at this mission, prevent and discard it. (Unique.)

lore: An original thinker, Captain Kirk took command of the Starship Enterprise as an admiral. He felt young.
name: Admiral Kirk 2E (Life From Lifelessness)
text: OFFICER Honor x 2 Diplomacy Leadership DL/ {Khan!} DL/ {The Genesis Effect}

lore: Trainee instructor at Starfleet Academy, Mr. Spock supervised the Kobayashi Maru scenario. 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 human mentor of Saavik.
name: Captain Spock 2E (The Sky's the Limit)
text: OFFICER Biology Honor Leadership Physics SCIENCE Mindmeld DL/ {The Needs of the Many}

lore: "Starfleet observer" who helped U.S.S. Voyager track his former Maquis comrades in the Badlands. Talented pilot. Has a mercenary spirit.
name: Tom Paris 2E (The Maquis)
text: SCIENCE Navigation x 2 Geology Biology Draw a card if stopped by an opponent's dilemma.

lore: Undercover Vulcan who infiltrated Chakotay's Maquis cell. Former archery teacher at the Vulcan Institute for Defensive Arts. Has three sons and a daughter.
name: Tuvok 2E (The Maquis)
text: SECURITY SCIENCE Navigation OFFICER Mindmeld DL/ {Learning Curve}

lore: "I give two minutes for you and your gallant crew." Commander: I.K.S. Qel'poh.
name: Kruge 2E (Instinctive Commander)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Klingon Intelligence OFFICER Treachery Once per game, when you win an engagement involving this personnel and there are four or less personnel aboard an opponent's ship involved, you may remove a damage event from that ship to place those personnel in your brig. You now command that ship (it is now a [Kli] ship).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: Young scientist involved with the creation of the Genesis Device. Son of Carol Marcus and James T. Kirk. Survived an encounter with Khan.
name: David Marcus 2E (Life From Lifelessness)
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Biology x 2 Exobiology Physics Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Human; genetically enhanced; Khan-related card; Male;
lore: "I have done far worse than kill you. I've hurt you. And I wish to go on hurting you." Commander: U.S.S. Reliant.
name: Khan Noonien Singh 2E (Genetically-Engineered Nemesis)
text: Exobiology Leadership Computer Skill Treachery x 2 While present with an opponent's personnel, each of that opponent's personnel is attributes -1.

lore: Identification: BORG SPHERE Task: Contingency vessel. Assimilate human homeworld. Borg Queen commands.
name: Queen's Borg Sphere 2E (Resistance is Futile)
text: May be reported aboard, carried aboard and launched from any of your Borg cubes. DL/ {Optimize Drones}

lore: "'All I ask is a tall ship, and a star to steer her by.'"
name: U.S.S. Enterprise 2E (Earth's Savior)
text: Tractor Beam. While you command a [OS] or [Films] personnel, you may play this ship at your {Earth}. When this ship is about to move between Earth and another mission, subtract 1 from the Range required.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Bodyguard; MACO; Male; Mission Specialist;
lore: Opportunistic sergeant romantically involved with Comm Officer Sato. Travis Mayweather is a MACO and bodyguard to Commander Archer.
name: Sergeant Mayweather 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: SECURITY Anthropology

lore: Idealist and mentor to Commander T'Pol. Soval thought he was too old to become a revolutionary. Vulcan dissident. Commanded the I.S.S. Avenger.
name: Crewman Soval 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Biology Exobiology Geology Anthropology

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
lore: "As soon as we get the cytoglobin, we'll be able to treat all the Level Red patients, including him."
name: Critical Care 2E
text: Honor + MEDICAL x3 + SCIENCE + CUNNING>32 When you complete this mission, you may take up to three personnel in your discard pile and place each on the bottom of his or her owner's decks.

name: The Inner Light 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: Seeds or plays on {Parvenium System}; download and seed {Ressikan Flute} here. Your personnel may attempt this mission. When you acquire Ressikan Flute, choose a personnel (they are now Kamin). When Kamin helps solve a planet mission, you may download {Drought Tree} there. (If on {Kataan} or Kamin is {Jean-Luc Picard}, double Drought Tree points and they may not be nullified.) (Unique.)

lore: Covetous commander of the Starship Defiant. A soldier all his life, Jonathan Archer was romantically involved with Comm Officer Sato.
name: Commander Archer 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 SECURITY Stellar Cartography Leadership Navigation DL/ {Watch Dog} DL/ {Tyranny}

lore: Sadistic physiologist whose finesse was useful to the Empire. The Denubulan doctor Phlox was courted by the rebels and became a reluctant dissident.
name: Chief Surgeon Phlox 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 SCIENCE Biology Physics DL/ {Will You Kindly Die?}

lore: In 2370, Data suggested Worf would be able to use an inverse warp field to restore the barriers between quantum realities. Thankfully, Mr. Data was correct, in every reality.
name: Fractured Time 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: Nine personnel (random selection) continue. Place out-of-play all other personnel in this crew or Away Team.

characteristicsKeywords: Android; Dissident; Male; Romulan underground; Soong-type android;
lore: Soong-type android in disguise as a Dissident and member of the Romulan Underground. Claimed to be from the city of Rateg.
name: Data 2E (Things Past)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Exobiology Transporter Skill Cannot be killed by dilemmas ("stopped" instead).

lore: The Vulcans approached exploration of other cultures through passive observation and impassionate logic. The High Command encouraged other cultures to adopt similar policies.
name: Strange New Worlds 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: Plays on a mission. (Unique.) Opponent's mission attempts here must use the following requirements: Anthropology + Diplomacy + Law + INTEGRITY>32

lore: Prototype Terran flagship commanded by Captain Forrest. Later captained by Commander Archer.
name: I.S.S. Enterprise NX-01 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: Attributes all +1 for each [Sta][TE] aboard (limit 4). DL/ {Suliban Cloaking Device}

lore: Confident captain in the Terran Empire. Maxwell Forrest has friends in high places. Romantically involved with Comm Officer Sato.
name: Captain Forrest 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: OFFICER Treachery Leadership Law Archaeology Biology Navigation Transporter Skill

lore: In some cultures, such as the Terran Empire, promotions are often achieved by the forced removal of one's superiors.
name: Crew Advancement 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: Opponent names an attribute. Crew or Away Team members with highest printed value of that attribute are "stopped." (In case of ties, "stops" all tied personnel.)

lore: "She was the first Galaxy-Class warship built by the Federation. Forty-two decks. Capable of transporting over six thousand troops."
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-D 2E (Battleship)
text: Tractor Beam. When you win an engagement involving this ship, you may score 5 points.

lore: Typical Terran MACO. Defended Commander Archer from a Gorn attack aboard the Starship Defiant.
name: Corporal Scott 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: SECURITY Honor MEDICAL Geology Astrophysics

lore: Ensign chaser. Tom Paris was considered the least inaccurate 31st-century recreation of U.S.S. Voyager crewmembers. He prefers a direct assault.
name: Revised Paris 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: OFFICER Astrophysics Navigation x 2 Treachery DL/ {Earn Your Rank!} OR {Space Boomer}

lore: "So whatever's down there, McCoy's in the heart of it."
name: Paranoid Escape 2E
text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Randomly select a personnel to be removed from the game. You cannot play cards that have the same title as that personnel. When you complete this mission, put the personnel removed from the game in his or her owner's hand and this dilemma is overcome.

lore: Coldly logical soldier. In the mirror universe, the Vulcan Tuvok fought for the Terran Rebellion.
name: Mr. Tuvok 2E (Shades of Gray)
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Mindmeld Memory Omega Once per game, may be taken into hand from draw deck when any player uses the DL/ on a [MQ] card.

lore: Vicious Gorn Slavemaster of the Tholian Assembly who was assigned to gut the Starship Defiant in the Mirror Universe. He does not trust Terrans.
name: Slar 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER SECURITY Computer Skill Physics Treachery x 2 X = number of [MU] personnel present

lore: Study remains of antique Vulcan ship.
name: Investigate Derelict 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: ENGINEER + Exobiology + Navigation + SECURITY When you solve, restores RANGE of all ships in region.

lore: Treacherous, scheming Cardassian. Closed the Bajoran Wormhole as a Pah-Wraith puppet.
name: Dukat 2E (Things Past)
text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may place two non-[Ref] cards from any one discard pile out of play. Treachery x 2 Transporter Skill DL/ {Kosst Amojan}

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Irritable Gul posted on Bajor during the occupation. Took leave on Terok Nor in 2346. Staged an incident to help Dukat win the favor of Kira Meru.
name: Oran 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: OFFICER MEDICAL SCIENCE Physics When reported, gains any skill until end of turn.

lore: "We want to cure you, but we need a better way to identify those with the mutation. Our testing method is too slow."
name: You Have a Disease 2E
text: Plays in your core. When your unique [Bor] personnel uses a skill to meet a requirement on a dilemma or mission, you may choose an opponent to discard a card from hand. Then you may draw a card for each headquarters mission that opponent commands. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "I don't have to imply anything. The facts speak for themselves."
name: Ambassador Gral 2E (High-Ranking Official)
text: Diplomacy Law Leadership Computer Skill While an opponent has completed more turns that you have, this personnel is attributes +2.

lore: "Oh, the absurdity of these inferior beings. 'And now, Captain James Kirk, you stand accused of the high crime of treason against a superior authority, conspiracy, and the attempt to foment insurrection.' How do you plead?"
name: Trelane's Trial 2E
text: Choose a personnel that does not have an attribute>6 to be stopped. If you cannot, for each headquarters mission you command, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

lore: "Sir, Level Two, Corridor Three reports a disturbance. Mister Sulu chasing crewmen... with a sword."
name: Swashbuckler at Heart 2E
text: Reveal your hand and place each interrupt revealed this way on top of your deck in any order. Your opponent draws up to two cards.

lore: Conscientious corporal from Hawaii. MACO who joined Enterprise for a crusade into the Delphic Expanse. Feared getting lost. Likes fast motorcycles.
name: Hideaki Chang 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Physics Stellar Cartography Biology Your other MACOs here are attributes all +1.

lore: Diligent major and MACO commander. Expert at both armed and unarmed combat. Found a sparring partner in Malcolm Reed. Likes consistency.
name: Jeremiah Hayes 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: SECURITY Honor OFFICER DL/ {Combat-Ready: Tactical Reserve} Diplomacy Leadership (if no other leader present).

lore: Communications devices integrated into all Borg allow the collective to operate seamlessly, even across large distances.
name: Neural Transceiver 2E
text: When one of your unique [Bor] personnel is facing a dilemma, discard a card from the top of your deck to give him or her a skill that one of your personnel has until the end of the turn.

lore: Task: Auxiliary processor of Unimatrix Zero-One.
name: Three of Nine 2E (Tactician Drone)
text: Archaeology Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Geology Order - Place this personnel on the bottom of her owner's deck to discard four cards from the top of your deck. Then take up to four cards from your discard pile and shuffle them into your deck.

lore: Typical MACO corporal. Holds the team sharpshooting record. She once received Vulcan neuro-pressure treatment from Charles Tucker III.
name: Amanda Cole 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: SECURITY Astrophysics Exobiology Computer Skill Stellar Cartography DL/ {Combat-Ready: Jury-Rig}

lore: "We ask you to observe with us ... the confrontation of the two opposing philosophies ... you term good and evil."
name: Excalbian Drama 2E
text: When your opponent reveals this dilemma, he or she may discard any number of cards from hand. For each card discarded this way, add 5 Integrity to this dilemma's requirements. Unless you have Integrity>30, all your personnel are stopped.

lore: The strain experienced by Lt. Bailey during his encounter with the Fesarius pushed him to the brink of mental breakdown.
name: Driven 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: When your [OS] OFFICER is facing a dilemma, discard an [OS] OFFICER from hand to make him or her attributes all +5 until the end of that dilemma.

lore: Engage enemy near vital sensor array.
name: Navigate Argolis Cluster 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: Stellar Cartography + Navigation x2 + Physics OR OFFICER + Leadership + SECURITY + STRENGTH>36

lore: "When I first met you, Major, I thought you were hostile and arrogant. But I was wrong. Bajor needs you..."
name: Kira Nerys 2E (Bit of a Fighter)
text: Honor Physics SECURITY While you have ten or more cards in your discard pile, this personnel is Cunning +1 and gains Diplomacy, Leadership, and Officer.

lore: "That was too easy."
name: Qol 2E (Lascivious Lackey)
text: Acquisition Exobiology Physics Treachery At the start of each of your turns, you may reveal an opponent's hand. If he or she reveals no events, you may take a card from beneath your {Ferenginar} into your hand. Otherwise, that opponent draws a card.

lore: "I love these classic twenty-third century designs. The black finish, the silver highlights. And it goes with the uniform."
name: Jadzia Dax 2E (Communications Staffer)
text: Archaeology Exobiology SCIENCE You may play this personnel aboard your [OS] or [Films] ship. While this personnel is present with three [AU] personnel, she is attributes +1 and gains Anthropology.

lore: Representative of MACO sergeants assigned to Enterprise in 2153. Unaccustomed to life in space, he still visits Phlox every morning.
name: Nelson Kemper 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: SECURITY Archaeology Geology

lore: Task: Monitor acquired technology. Repurpose.
name: Four of Twelve 2E (Standardization Drone)
text: ENGINEER MEDICAL SCIENCE When you discard the top card of your deck, if it is a non-Artifact equipment card, you may stop this personnel to place that card on your headquarters mission. Order - Destroy one of your equipment present to make this personnel attributes +2 until the end of this turn.

name: Condition Red 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: Plays on table. While aboard your ships, each of your [Stf] personnel gains [Cmd]. At the start of each of your turns, if opponent has more ships in play than you (including any cloaked, phased, or landed ships), you may discard a card from hand to download a ship to hand, then discard incident (unless ship is [Univ]). (Captain's Order.)

name: Dominion Hierarchy 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: Plays on your Founder; once each turn, Dominion Hierarchy plays for free. OR Plays on your Vorta present with a Founder and Jem'Hadar to make that Vorta attributes all +2 and gain a skill of your choice until tend of turn, then discard incident. OR Seeds or plays on your [Dom] facility. You may suspend play while you download {Jem'Hadar Sacrifice} or {Security Sacrifice}, then discard incident.

lore: Bounty hunter. Tellarite freighter captain. Brother of Gaavrin. Captured Jonathan Archer in 2153 but gave him the means to escape the Klingons.
name: Skalaar 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 ENGINEER Physics Acquisition DL/ {Captured} DL/ {Escape Pod}

lore: "Obviously, the first thing we should do is take this, uh ... this transtator here, and - leave it exactly where it is."
name: Miles O'Brien 2E (Engineering Staffer)
text: ENGINEER x 2 Honor Physics Transporter Skill x 2 You may play this personnel aboard your [OS] or [Films] ship. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard an equipment from hand to make a [AU] personnel present attributes +2 until the end of that dilemma.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Support Personnel;
lore: Loyal "daughter" of Arik Soong. Augment grown from a genetically engineered embryo kept from the time of Khan. Romantically involved with Raakin and Malik.
name: Persis 2E (Archive Portrait)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Astrophysics

lore: Dutiful commander. Vulcan dissident loyal to Captain Forrest. T'Pol was romantically involved with Chief Engineer Tucker during her last Pon farr.
name: Commander T'Pol 2E (Archive Portrait)
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER OFFICER SECURITY Treachery Exobiology Mindmeld DL/ {Hinder Progress}

lore: Assess potential for tactical alliance with beings last encountered in 23rd century.
name: Secure Strategic Base 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: Anthropology + SECURITY + 3 [AU] Personnel Once per game, may download {Strategic Base} here.Opponent's side:No gametext.

lore: "You see, when a Ferengi of my father's stature dies, the body is immediately vacuum-desiccated and sold as a prized collectible."
name: Krax 2E (Arrogant Heir)
text: MEDICAL Physics Computer Skill Treachery When your [Fer] Leadership personnel is killed by a dilemma, you may make this personnel attributes +3 and have him gain any skill of your choice until the end of the turn.

lore: Typical of aggressive MACOs often assigned to boarding parties. Has received extensive EV combat training. Always ready to stretch his legs.
name: Sean Hawkins 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: SECURITY Anthropology ENGINEER Transporter Skill DL/ {Security Sacrifice}

lore: Typical MACO who serves aboard Enterprise with distinction, despite having been injured more than once. She sometimes picks up the wrong uniform.
name: Sascha Money 2E (These Are The Voyages)
text: SECURITY MEDICAL Navigation Physics DL/ {Combat-Ready: Solidarity}

lore: "The Enterprise is dead in space, stopped cold during her pursuit of an alien raider by mysterious forces, and I have been somehow whisked off the bridge and placed on the surface of an asteroid, facing the captain of the alien ship."
name: Arena 2E
text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless that personnel has total attributes>18, your opponent places him or her on a planet mission.

lore: "... your intention is not peaceful. We are now considering the disposition of your ship and the life aboard."
name: Fesarius Bluff 2E
text: When your opponent reveals this dilemma, he or she may discard any number of cards from hand. For each card discarded this way, add 5 CUNNING to this dilemma's requirements. Unless you have CUNNING>30, all your personnel are stopped.

lore: "Kirk to Enterprise, lock on transporters. Beam us up."
name: Final Cry 2E
text: Plays in your core. When your [OS] or [Films] personnel is about to be killed by a dilemma, you may discard three [OS] or [Films] cards from hand to stop him or her instead.

lore: "There is no place ... that is not filled with people."
name: Mark of Gideon 2E
text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If you still have nine personnel remaining, return that personnel to his or her owner's hand, then your opponent chooses a second personnel to return to his or her owner's hand. If you still have ten personnel remaining, your opponent chooses a third personnel to return to his or her owner's hand.

lore: "Uncontrolled power will turn even saints into savages. And we can all be counted on to live down to our lowest impulses."
name: Psychokinetic Control 2E
text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel at this mission loses each skill he or she has gained. Each personnel cannot gain skills. Each personnel cannot increase his or her attributes. At the end of this mission attempt, this dilemma is overcome.

lore: Resourceful prisoner, seductress, and assassin. Kira Nerys left a trail of bodies behind while escaping her rebel captors. Misses her milk baths.
name: The Intendant 2E (Crossover)
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Law Transporter Skill DL/ {Assassination Plot} (as the assassin, even while captive).

lore: Slave girl sold in the markets of Verex III. Orion female known for her extreme appetites and her innate, intimate skills.
name: Neras 2E (Archive Portrait)
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Once per game, when reported, draw two cards.

name: Watch Dog 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: Plays on table if you have three [Sta][TE] personnel in play. Once each turn, you may play an [Event] with a countdown for free. Place any cards drawn at the end of your turn face down beneath this incident. At the start of your turn, take all cards from beneath this incident into hand. While you have cards in hand, your personnel lose their first-listed skill. (Unique.)

lore: Imposturous first officer in a 31st-century recreation. Chakotay oversaw brutal interrogations, despite describing himself as a "man of peace."
name: Revised Chakotay 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: OFFICER Anthropology Honor Treachery SECURITY DL/ {Security Sacrifice} OR {Fitting In}

lore: Interrogator who assisted in the prolonged torture of several Kyrians. 31st-century recreation of Harry Kim. Always looking for ways to advance his career.
name: Revised Kim 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Computer Skill Treachery x 2 DL/ {Reflection Therapy}

lore: "Hedgehog" ops officer in a 31st-century recreation. Neelix was one of several subjugated crewmen.
name: Revised Neelix 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Biology Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill Treachery x 2 DL/ Any hand weapon

lore: "What's wrong, Terran? Lost your nerve? Afraid to die today, eh?"
name: Telok 2E (Bodyguard)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Leadership Computer Skill SECURITY When you play this personnel, if you command three [AU] cards, draw up to two cards.

lore: Enthusiastic major, MACO, and opportunistic assassin. Second officer Malcolm Reed is largely credited with the creation of the agony booth.
name: Major Reed 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Treachery Physics DL/ {Combat-Ready: Tense Situation}

lore: Admiral's ship, NX-09. Captained by Admiral Black in the Empire's fight against the rebellion and later commanded by Crewman Soval in the strike back.
name: I.S.S. Avenger 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: DL/ {Radiation Monitoring} X=2 in [MU]

lore: Faced with time-consuming repairs, Chief Engineer Tucker was initially unaware that the sabotage was due to a suggestion implanted in his mind by Commander T'Pol.
name: Reflections 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: Randomly stops half of crew (round down). If opponent has no cards in hand, those personnel are killed instead. Nullify with a personnel with Mindmeld and Treachery.

lore: Modifies transporter function to allow beaming to an alternate universe. Developed in the mirror universe. Used by Smiley, Professor Sisko, the Intendant, and others to cross over.
name: Multidimensional Transport Device 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: Reports in Alpha or Mirror Quadrant. Twice each turn, where present, allows transporters to beam to opposite quadrant (anywhere at corresponding location), ignoring all SHIELDS.

lore: After years of oppression by their Terran colleagues, the powerful threat of the Starship Defiant incited many within the Empire to rise up.
name: Alien Conspiracy 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: Choose one personnel in crew or Away Team for each Dissident your opponent has in play. Your opponent chooses up to two of those personnel to be killed.

lore: "You saved us back in sickbay with the Tantalus field."
name: Necessary Evil 2E
text: To play this event, you must command three [AU] personnel. Remove one of your personnel from the game. Destroy this event.

lore: Mass murderer in a 31st-century recreation. An Emergency Medical Android, The Doctor designed bio-weapons that killed eight million Kyrians.
name: Revised Doctor 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology SCIENCE Treachery x 2 DL/ {Biosphere Toxin}

lore: "She'll be ready to launch in fourteen months."
name: New Advancements 2E
text: Unless you have Diplomacy + Leadership + Navigation OR a ship at a completed space mission, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if the opponent on your left commands Earth, he or she may download two [Sta] cards.

lore: "But one man can change the present."
name: One Man Cannot Summon the Future 2E
text: Plays in your core. When you play an [AU] card, if you command two non-[AU] personnel, you may draw a card and then place a card from hand on the bottom of your deck.

lore: Evil instrument of destruction who directed the orbital assault against the Kyrians. 31st-century recreation of Tuvok.
name: Revised Tuvok 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Treachery x 2 Law DL/ Any [AU][Holo] personnel

characteristicsKeywords: Android/Borg; Counterpart; Male; Soong-type android; Soong-type android;
lore: Tempted by flesh, the Soong-type android Data filled Locutus' role as an assimilated counterpart to speak to the Federation.
name: Data of Borg 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: OFFICER Astrophysics Computer Skill x 2 ENGINEER Exobiology DL/ {Resistance is Futile} At the start of each of your turns, you may return this personnel to your hand. If you do not, remove this personnel from the game.

name: Distant Control 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: Seeds on table. While your Leadership, Empathy, and Treachery present at {Drone Control Room}, your all-native Away Team present may attempt [S] missions as the crew of your empty [Rom] Drone-class ship (may not die unless they have Empathy, and may not relocate to spaceline). At the end of any dilemma, if no Empathy remains, attempt ends. You may not re-attempt this turn.

lore: Part of the United Earth military with technology two to three years more advanced than that of Starfleet. MACO troops were assigned to Enterprise in 2153.
name: Military Assault Command Operations 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: Reveal the top three cards of your deck. You may report for free any MACO personnel revealed; place all other cards revealed beneath draw deck. Discard event.

lore: "How many people does it take, Admiral, before it becomes wrong, hmm? A thousand? Fifty thousand? A million? How many people does it take, Admiral?"
name: Moral Choice 2E
text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel is a [Fed] personnel, they are all stopped. Otherwise, choose one of those personnel to be stopped.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: "... it was Dr. McCoy, with a fine sense of historical irony, who decided on a name for our captured Klingon vessel."
name: I.K.S. Qel'Poh 2E (H.M.S. Bounty)
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. While you command two missions that are worth 40 points or more, this ship is Range +2. While a personnel you command aboard this ship is facing a dilemma, you may discard a [AU] personnel from hand to make that personnel attributes +1 until the end of that dilemma.

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Capturing-related card; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-prey commanded by Kruge on a covert mission to the Genesis Planet.
name: I.K.S. Qel'Poh 2E (Clandestine Vessel)
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. While you command two missions that are worth 40 points or more, this ship is Range +2. While you have a captive, this ship is attributes +2.

lore: "What is the meaning of this attack? Where is the crew of the Reliant?"
name: U.S.S. Reliant 2E (Part of One Big Happy Fleet)
text: Tractor Beam. Order - Discard a [Non] personnel from hand to make this ship attributes +2 until the end of this turn.

lore: "Excellency, it is difficult. I try to obey, but..."
name: Shocking Betrayal 2E
text: Choose a personnel to be stopped and your opponent may discard a non-[Non] personnel from hand to choose a personnel that is the same affiliation as that discarded personnel to be killed.

lore: "You're on Enterprise. Enterprise-J to be exact, a distant relative of your ship. We're four hundred years in the future. I've brought you to a monumental moment in history, the battle of Procyon Five, where the Federation engaged the Sphere Builders. ... You are the only one who can convince them of what I have told you. It is crucial to history that you do not sacrifice yourself."
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-J 2E
text: Plays in your core. Each of your personnel at a mission that is worth 40 or more points is attributes +1. (Unique.)

name: Silaran Prin 2E (Between Darkness and Light)
text: Anthropology ENGINEER Computer Skill Treachery x 2 Order - Name a personnel. When an opponent plays that personnel, you may place this personnel in his owner's discard pile to kill that personnel. This effect lasts until this order is executed again.

lore: Conflicted captain romantically involved with Benjamin Sisko. Served prison time for transporting medical supplies to the Maquis.
name: Kasidy Yates 2E (The Maquis)
text: ENGINEER Leadership Navigation x 2 Transporter Skill Each other [Maq] personnel present is STRENGTH +2.

lore: Benjamin Sisko exploited Ferengi loyalty to the Grand Nagus, forcing Quark to use his contacts with the Karemma to help Starfleet's search for the Founders.
name: Sucking Up to the Boss 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: Plays once each turn on your [DS9][Fer] personnel. Name a skill. For the rest of the turn, while facing a dilemma with your 3 Acquisition present, personnel gains that skill.

lore: "Computer, target the vessel's tractor emitter and fire. Come about, heading nine zero three mark six. Engage at warp two." Commander: U.S.S. Voyager.
name: The Doctor 2E (Emergency Command Hologram)
text: Leadership Navigation OFFICER x 2 Computer Skill SECURITY x 2 When you play this personnel, choose one - remove a Damage card from one of your ships, or download a Maneuver.

lore: "I am Lieutenant Tuvok. And I'm Neelix."
name: Tuvix 2E (Symbiogenesis)
text: Anthropology Diplomacy Exobiology Honor Law Navigation SECURITY To play this personnel, remove two of your personnel at this mission from the game. You cannot play personnel with the same title as those personnel.

lore: "It was an accident. We're from the future. The warp core was sabotaged. It's all Cousin Gala's fault."
name: Rom 2E (Little Green Man)
text: ENGINEER Navigation Computer Skill SCIENCE While this personnel is present with a [AU] personnel, if he is attempting a mission worth 40 or more points, he is attributes +2 and gains one of every skill he already has.

lore: One of many subjugated Orion slave girls serving on Imperial Starfleet vessels. Dissident who is popular among her crewmates.
name: Crewman D'Vela 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: ENGINEER Diplomacy Navigation MEDICAL DL/ {Seductive Dance}

lore: "Everything that was human in me died that day. Never doubt that."
name: Sela 2E (Cunning Strategist)
text: Tal Shiar Leadership OFFICER SECURITY Treachery x 2 While this personnel is facing a dilemma, if this mission is worth 40 or more points, you may meet that dilemma's Integrity or Strength requirements using Cunning instead.

lore: Slower Earth cargo ships such as the E.C.S. Horizon and the E.C.S. Fortunate often fell victim to faster pirates.
name: Cargo Pirates 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: One personnel (random selection) is "stopped." Then, if you have a [DQ] personnel in play OR if your opponent has three thieves, one personnel (opponent's choice) is "stopped."

lore: Manipulative gift given to Jonathan Archer by Harrad-Sar. Beautiful Orion slave girl and thief. Seduced Kelby in a plot to capture Enterprise.
name: D'Nesh 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: ENGINEER Diplomacy Treachery Computer Skill Anthropology Orion Syndicate

lore: Slave of the situation created by D'Nesh, Maras, and Navaar. Orion captain of the Devna-Lev. A thief at heart, but a gracious host.
name: Harrad-Sar 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: OFFICER Navigation Smuggling Orion Syndicate DL/ Any slave girl

lore: Experienced gift given to Jonathan Archer by Harrad-Sar. Alluring Orion slave girl and a master thief. Nearly succeeded in capturing Enterprise.
name: Navaar 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: CIVILIAN Leadership x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Orion Syndicate DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

lore: With all political authority vanished, humanity teetered on the edge of its second Dark Age.
name: Back to Basics 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: Your opponent shuffles each personnel and ship in their discard pile into draw deck. If fourteen or more cards were shuffled in, Away Team stopped. Discard dilemma.

lore: Chief medical officer who succeeded Beverly Crusher in 2365. Talented doctor and cardiothoracic surgeon. She makes a mean chicken soup.
name: Katherine Pulaski 2E (Metamorphosis)
text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Anthropology Biology Honor Exobiology DL/ {Genetronic Replicator}

lore: "Mr. President, I don't know what to believe."
name: Nanclus 2E (Co-Conspirator)
text: Diplomacy Law Treachery Order - Choose an opponent to reveal his or her hand. For each personnel revealed, this personnel is Cunning +1 and Strength +1 (if a [Fed] personnel is revealed this way he may gain a skill of your choice as well) until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: The Great Link's savior, the changeling Odo became a Founder to save his people and secure peace at the close of the Dominion War.
name: Odo 2E (Homefront II)
text: SECURITY SECURITY Leadership Honor Law Computer Skill Anthropology Exobiology

name: Gatherers' Raid 2E
text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. Order - Place a card from hand on this event to reveal a number of cards from the top of an opponent's deck equal to the number of Gatherers you command. For each event and interrupt revealed this way, you may draw a card. (Unique.)

lore: "May your Bat'leth run red. Success!"
name: Hall of Warriors 2E
text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) To play this event, you must command three [Kli] personnel. Plays in your core. When you win combat or an engagement, place the top card of your deck on this event. Each of your [Kli] ships is attributes +1 for each card on this event. (Unique.)

name: Standard Orbit 2E
text: To play this event, you must command two missions worth 40 or more points. Plays in your core. When an opponent is about to download a card, he or she can only download from the top ten cards of his or her deck. When an opponent discards a personnel from your hand or from the top of your deck, you may place him or her on the bottom of your deck instead. (Unique.)

name: Good Shepherd 2E
text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, you may stop your [Voy] Commander to download a non-unique personnel or a [Voy] personnel who costs 1 or less and place them on this event. When this event is destroyed, place each personnel here aboard your [Voy] ship. (Unique.)

lore: "I have no intention of surrendering my forces. If I did, it would be a sign of weakness. An invitation to the Solids to cross into the Gamma Quadrant and destroy the Great Link."
name: Founder Leader 2E (Single-Minded)
text: Law Leadership x 2 SCIENCE Treachery x 2 While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a Morph card from hand to exchange a Founder in your hand with a Founder present.

lore: Causing heavy damage to the ships it encountered, the Caretaker used a displacement wave to bring vessels from all over the galaxy to his array.
name: Caretaker's Wave 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: Unless Astrophysics and Stellar Cartography OR 3 Navigation present, you choose: opponent may [Flip][Flip][Flip] OR opponent may [Flip] and/or relocate ship to {Caretaker's Array}.

lore: Gorkon's Chief of Staff in 2293, General Chang is a powerful and vocal advisor to the High Council. Commander of the I.K.S. Kla'Diyus.
name: Chang 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: OFFICER SECURITY x 2 Leadership Treachery x 2 Law DL/ {Cold Warriors}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Dabo Girl; Female; Teacher; Thief; Vedek;
lore: Grifter, thief, dabo girl, teacher, vedek - whatever the customer wants. Human working for Nunk. Briefly romantically involved with Reginald Barclay.
name: Leosa 2E (What You Leave Behind)
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Computer Skill Treachery Twice per game, may nullify {Holodeck Door} just played.

lore: "...no matter what the future holds, no matter how far we travel, a part of us, a very important part of us, will always remain here. On Deep Space Nine."
name: Benjamin Sisko 2E (Bold Captain)
text: Diplomacy ENGINEER Leadership OFFICER While at a mission worth 40 or more points, this personnel cannot be stopped by dilemmas.

lore: "The Pah-wraiths aren't what you think. And neither am I."
name: Covenant 2E
text: When your [Baj] Treachery personnel is facing a dilemma, remove a [Baj] personnel in your discard pile from the game to make that Treachery personnel gain all skills and attributes on that [Baj] personnel removed from the game until the end of this mission attempt.

lore: "Well, this is a page out of the past. I never thought I'd see either of you on a starship again." Commander: U.S.S. Pasteur.
name: Beverly Crusher 2E (Captain Picard)
text: Exobiology Honor Leadership MEDICAL OFFICER While this personnel is attempting a mission worth 40 or more points, she is attributes +1 and gains Medical.

lore: "I want comfort and I want it now. You're a comfort woman, aren't you?"
name: Parek 2E (Privileged Legate)
text: Archaeology Exobiology Law OFFICER When this personnel gains a skill, he may gain any one skill of your choice until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Gul; Male;
lore: Representative Gul of the Cardassian Guard, Seventh Order. Attacked Deep Space 9 in 2369. Eager to stake a claim in the Gamma Quadrant.
name: Jasad 2E (Emissary)
text: OFFICER Physics Navigation Treachery If in [GQ], [Car] ship he is aboard is attributes all +2.

lore: "The greatest warrior of them all." Clone of the unforgettable Klingon leader. Fulfilled prophecy. Installed as ceremonial Emperor in 2369.
name: Kahless 2E (The Next Generation)
text: V.I.P. Honor x 2 Anthropology Leadership x 3 DL/ {Warrior's Birthright}

lore: Traditional device for presenting important gifts. Its sculpted face comes to life boisterously presenting its contents to the recipient.
name: Betazoid Gift Box
text: Immediately look through your draw deck for up to thirty seconds and choose three cards to place in your hand. Reshuffle draw deck and discard artifact.

lore: Commander of Starbase 247 in an alternate future. At odds with Governor Worf. Battled Klingons near Devron.
name: Admiral Riker
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Navigation Music Your leaders here may initiate battle against [Kli]. DL/ {Any Enterprise} (if aboard your matching facility).

lore: Identification: PROFICIENCY DRONE Task: Tertiary adjunct of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
name: Seven of Nine (The Borg)
text: ENGINEER Stellar Cartography Computer Skill Physics May apply [Com], [Nav], and [Def] to staffing. May draw a card in place of your normal card play.

lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Empire in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Klingon - Gowron - is part of us now."
name: Gowron of Borg
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor Once per game, allows his hive to initiate battle. While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Kli].

lore: Romulan Astrophysical Academy member on deep space duty in 2351. Beamed to the present via a micro-wormhole to the U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Dr. Telek R'Mor
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics x 2 Stellar Cartography Honor ENGINEER May report directly to any ship.

name: 100,000 Tribbles - Clone
text: Breeds from {10,000 Tribbles}. Where present, prevents personnel from reporting "for free." If on a planet when that mission solved, reduces its points by 10.

lore: "I am the beginning; the end; the one who is many. I am the Borg... I am the collective."
name: Borg Queen
text: When reported, selects any skill; may change skill at start of each turn. May download {A Change of Plans} or a Borg drone in place of one card draw.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Born in Labarre, France. Has an artificial heart. Reads Shakespeare. Something of a Renaissance man.
name: Jean-Luc Picard
text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Archaeology Navigation Music

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; future-related ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commanded by Admiral Riker in an alternate future. U.S.S. Enterprise-D was fitted with a third warp engine nacelle, greatly enhancing its speed and power.
name: Future Enterprise
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: NX-74205. Built to battle Borg. Recommissioned to oppose the Dominion. First ship to test ablative armor and quantum torpedoes. Captained by Benjamin Sisko.
name: U.S.S. Defiant
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods)

lore: An excavation under the Earth city of San Francisco in 2369 discovered that the head of Lt. Commander Data had been lying there undisturbed for centuries.
name: Data's Head
text: Use as Equipment card. Head has CUNNING=10 and Computer Skill. While on a ship, RANGE, WEAPONS, and SHIELDS are +2. (Not Cumulative.)

lore: Mysterious symbol of sexuality from the pleasure planet of Risa. To own one is to call forth its powers. To display one is to announce that the owner is seeking jamaharon.
name: Horga'hn
text: Immediately play on table. Artifact allows you to take double turns from now on. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Statues which open to reveal a multitude of similar but smaller figurines inside, representing the belief that each person is a community of individual voices and desires.
name: Kurlan Naiskos
text: Place in hand until played on any ship as an Event card. If ship has all 7 personnel types aboard, its RANGE, WEAPONS, and SHIELDS are tripled. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Gigantic cubic ship of the Borg collective. Possesses powerful weapons and remarkable regenerative abilities.
name: Borg Ship
text: Place at furthest spaceline end. End of every turn: Attacks all ships, then moves. Worth points if destroyed in battle.

lore: Race which explores the galaxy by giving other species the temporary ability and strong compulsion to come to them.
name: Cytherians
text: Place on ship. Ship must do nothing but travel to far end of spaceline at normal speed. When reached, discard dilemma. Score points.

lore: Incorrigible omnipotent being. Member of the Q Continuum. Q exhibits a child-like petulance and sense of playfulness.
name: Q
text: Unless 2 Leadership and INTEGRITY>60, opponent may download up to 2 [Q] cards and place them atop their Q-Continuum side deck; crew or Away Team has a Q-Flash of 4 cards, then is stopped. Discard dilemma.

lore: Contagious affliction which causes animals to de-evolve into ancestral forms. Disease named for Lieutenant Reginald Barclay.
name: Barclay's Protomorphosis Disease
text: Entire crew or Away Team (except androids) de-evolves (dies) unless MEDICAL, SCIENCE, and SECURITY present. Discard dilemma.

name: Devidian Door
text: Plays on table. While in play, allows you to play a card "from the future." Once each turn, you may say "Devidian Door" and play one Personnel or Equipment card to any planet. At any time during your next turn (or at game end, if sooner), you must show a Devidian Door from hand and place it out-of-play, or you lose the game. (Immune to cards which close doorways.)

lore: Binary race closely integrated with computers. Always work in pairs. Bynars have the ability to enhance specific computerized systems.
name: Bynars Weapon Enhancement
text: Plays on ship. Ship is WEAPONS +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: The Borg use neural energy to collectively repair damaged biological and technological components. The Queen often serves as the focal point.
name: Regenerate
text: Plays to fully repair and "stop" any {Borg Ship} dilemma or Borg ship (nullifying any cards reducing its attributes) OR to shuffle your discard pile into draw deck. Discard event.

lore: Legislative body of Bajoran provisional government. Established following Cardassian withdrawal in 2369.
name: Chamber of Ministers
text: Seeds or plays on {Bajor}. A Nor may coexist here. Once per turn, one Bajoran Minister, Vedek, or Kai OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: The Central Command controls every Cardassian ship, outpost, and space station from its great War Room.
name: Central Command
text: Seeds or plays on {Cardassia Prime}. Once per turn, one Cardassian Gul or Legate OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Changelings intermingle in the Great Link, merging form and thought into one communal entity.
name: The Great Link
text: Seeds or plays on {Founders' homeworld}. {Ketracel-White} on planet does not count down. Once per turn, one Founder OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: From his office in Paris, the President of the United Federation of Planets leads the representative council.
name: Office of the President
text: Seeds or plays on {Earth}. Once per turn, one Federation Ambassador, Admiral, Vice-Admiral, or President OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: The Great Hall of Qo'noS is the seat of power for the entire Klingon Empire.
name: The Great Hall
text: Seeds or plays on {Qo'noS}. Once per turn, one Klingon Emperor, Chancellor, or personnel with "High Council" in lore OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: The Proconsul heads the Romulan Senate. Neral was Proconsul during the 2368 Vulcan Unification ruse.
name: Office of the Proconsul
text: Seeds or plays on {Romulus}. Once per turn, one Romulan General, Admiral, Senator, or Proconsul OR {Sela} or {Tomalak} OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

affiliation: Any 'Espionage... on Federation' card may play here.  Also, mission may be attempted if {Selok} in Away Team.
lore: Infiltrate Starfleet HQ; compile intelligence dossier on Federation homeworld.
name: Espionage Mission
requires: Espionage... on Federation; Founder; Sector 001 Region;
text: Tal Shiar x2 OR Obsidian Order x2 OR FCA x2 OR Klingon Intelligence x2 OR 2 Founders

lore: Traditional device for presenting important gifts. Its sculpted face comes to life boisterously presenting its contents to the recipient.
name: Betazoid Gift Box
text: Immediately look through your draw deck for up to thirty seconds and choose three cards to place in your hand. Reshuffle draw deck and discard artifact.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Shakaar Resistance Cell;
lore: Outspoken Major in Bajoran Militia. Assigned as first officer of Deep Space 9. Former member of Shakaar resistance cell. Romantically involved with Odo.
name: Kira Nerys
text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation x 2 Computer Skill X=3 vs. [Car].

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling security chief of Deep Space 9. Not very good at pretense. Always investigates Quark.
name: Odo
text: SECURITY SECURITY Computer Skill x 2 Honor x 2 Law Once per turn, may "stop" {any Quark} present.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Gul. Ex-prefect of Bajor. Commander of the Prakesh. Father of Ziyal. Cardassian Union liaison with Dominion. Desires to regain command of Terok Nor.
name: Dukat
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Computer Skill

lore: Former member of Obsidian Order. Exiled to Terok Nor in 2368. Maintains some contact with Cardassian intelligence. Distrusts Dukat. Son of Enabran Tain.
name: Elim Garak
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Obsidian Order Treachery Anthropology May avoid any random selection.

lore: Female changeling. Center of power for the entire Dominion. Key figure in the Great Link. Told Odo of his origin; greatly desires his return to the Link.
name: Founder Leader
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Exobiology SCIENCE Law DL/ {Shape-Shift}

lore: Vorta field supervisor. Skilled negotiator. Key figure in the war effort. Reports directly to the Founder Leader. Self-proclaimed expert at telling - and spotting - lies.
name: Weyoun
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Treachery Law Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
lore: Captain Benjamin Sisko commands Deep Space 9. Fought in Federation-Tzenkethi war. Helped design U.S.S. Defiant. Father of Jake. Loves baseball.
name: Benjamin Sisko
text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Honor Navigation Diplomacy DL/ {Baseball}

lore: Dr. Beverly Crusher is the chief medical officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Dancer and thespian. Widow of Jack Crusher. Mother of Ensign Wesley Crusher.
name: Beverly Crusher
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Exobiology

lore: Captain of medical ship U.S.S. Pasteur in 2395 in an alternate timeline. Although divorced from Jean-Luc Picard, she never could say no to him.
name: Beverly Picard
text: OFFICER MEDICAL x 2 Leadership Biology

lore: Lt. Commander Data is a sentient android created by Dr. Noonien Soong. Has positronic brain. Desires to be human. Once left his head in San Francisco.
name: Data
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Music Astrophysics Exobiology

characteristicsKeywords: Betazoid/Human; Counselor; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Lt. Commander Deanna Troi is a 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 Human empath. Counselor for U.S.S. Enterprise. Imzadi to William T. Riker. Loves chocolate.
name: Deanna Troi
text: OFFICER Empathy Diplomacy

lore: Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge is chief engineer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Great sense of humor. Fortuitous holodeck programmer.
name: Geordi La Forge
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Navigation Physics Computer Skill

lore: Lt. Commander Jadzia Dax is the eighth Trill host of the Dax symbiont. Underwent zhian'tara closure rite in 2371. Level 3 pilot. Married to Worf. Likes tongo.
name: Jadzia Dax
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Astrophysics Exobiology Navigation x 2 Anthropology

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; genetically enhanced; Male;
lore: Lt. Julian Bashir. Genetically enhanced. Salutatorian at Starfleet Medical. Requested assignment to DS9 so he could practice "frontier medicine." Likes tennis.
name: Julian Bashir
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL x 2 Exobiology Biology DL/ {Kukalaka}

lore: Traveled to 2344 and helped prevent a disastrous war. Survivor of the Battle of Narendra III. Consort of Romulan general. Mother of Sela.
name: Tasha Yar - Alternate
text: SECURITY Honor Leadership DL/ {Starfleet Type II Phaser}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Cook; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Commander William T. Riker is the executive officer of U.S.S. Enterprise. Imzadi to Deanna Troi. Gourmet cook. Jazz musician.
name: William T. Riker
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation Honor Music

lore: Lieutenant Worf is chief of security on the U.S.S. Enterprise. Klingon warrior and Starfleet officer. Son of Mogh. Raised on Earth by foster parents.
name: Worf
text: SECURITY Honor x 2 Navigation Diplomacy

lore: Former member of the Klingon High Council in an alternate timeline in which, by 2395, the Klingons had taken over the Romulan Empire.
name: Governor Worf
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Honor x 2 Navigation Diplomacy Leadership

lore: Plotted with Lursa to seize power from Gowron with the support of the Romulans. Younger of the two Duras sisters. The pretty one.
name: B'Etor
text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership Physics Youth Greed

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Duras-related; High Council; High Council Leader; Male;
lore: Son of M'Rel. Leader of the Klingon High Council after defeating the Duras forces in the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
name: Gowron
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor

lore: Elder of the two Duras sisters. Plotted with Romulan Sela to start the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
name: Lursa
text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership Geology Greed

lore: Highly decorated general and High Council member. Accepted Worf, Alexander, and Jadzia into the House of Martok. Lost his left eye battling the Jem'Hadar.
name: Martok
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Navigation x 2 DL/ {D'k Tahg} Your [Kli] ships at same location are each WEAPONS +2.

characteristicsKeywords: Bynar; Dual-personnel; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Paired Bynars from the planet Bynaus. In the year 100100111100, upgraded weapons and holodeck systems of U.S.S. Enterprise at Starbase 01001010.
name: 10 and 01
text: ENGINEER+ENGINEER 10: Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Any Bynars} card 01: Nullifies all {Computer Crash} cards in play.

lore: "Darmok and Jalad at Tanagra. The beast of Tanagra. Rosani, his army. Picard and Dathon at El-Adrel. Sokath, his eyes uncovered!"
name: Dathon
text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Nullifies Tamarian-related dilemmas where present.

lore: Jean-Luc Picard went undercover in 2370 posing as a mercenary and artifact smuggler.
name: Galen
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Computer Skill Treachery Leadership Navigation Music

lore: Adventurous El-Aurian who spent time exploring worlds such as Earth. Met a time-traveling crew from the U.S.S. Enterprise in the 19th century.
name: Madam Guinan
text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may nullify any [AU] icon interrupt, event, or dilemma where present. Anthropology

lore: Angosian male. Biochemically altered into a formidable perfect warrior ranked Subhadar.
name: Roga Danar
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Computer Skill Biology Leadership
