lore: Physically altered, the half-Betazoid, half-human Deanna Troi was coerced to assume the identity of a Tal Shiar major in the 2369 M'ret defection plot.
name: Major Rakal
text: V.I.P. Romulan: Tal Shiar, Empathy, Treachery Federation: Empathy, Diplomacy, INTEGRITY +4, CUNNING -1

lore: 1/2 Romulan, 1/2 Human female. Daughter of alternate timeline Lieutenant Natasha Yar. Powerful operative and key figure in the Romulan hegemony.
name: Sela
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Treachery Youth

lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Assimilate human homeworld by direct attack, Earth date 2373. Borg Queen commands.
name: Queen's Borg Cube
text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 at {Earth}. Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian ship; Cloaking Device; Keldon Class; Tractor Beam;
lore: Faster than standard Keldon-class vessels. Secretly upgraded by Obsidian Order. Staged in Orias System.
name: Keldon Advanced
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; D'deridex Class; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Upgraded by the Tal Shiar near Orias III. Used in Tal Shiar/Obsidian Order attack of the Dominion 2371.
name: D'deridex Advanced
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: The fifth Starfleet ship named Enterprise, launched in 2363. Built at the Utopia Planetia shipyards orbiting Mars.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: An ancient sublight vessel. Designed to carry and store cryogenically frozen humanoids until a cure for their death could be found and used to regenerate them.
name: Cryosatellite
text: Seed at a space location. May seed one additional artifact and up to 3 [AU] personnel here. They are earned when Cryosatellite earned; then discard Cryosatellite.

lore: High-res encoding of 20th century rock 'n' roll, known for its enervating rhythms and unbearable volume. "You don't know what we can find... on a Magic Carpet Ride."
name: Magic Carpet Ride OCD
text: May seed at a space location. Owner may relocate any ship at this location (and ship's Away Teams, if any) to any planet location on spaceline. Discard artifact.

lore: Artifact from Kataan, a now-dead planet. 1,000 years after Kataan's demise, a space probe gave Jean-Luc Picard this flute and a lifetime of memories in less than an hour.
name: Ressikan Flute
text: Immediately score points; X=the number of different Music personnel present (limit 5). Then, play on table; points may be nullified by {The Devil}. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: A malevolent being was formed when the inhabitants of Vagra II rid themselves of all the evil they had inside.
name: Armus - Skin of Evil
text: Kills one Away Team member (random selection). Discard dilemma.

lore: Spaceborne life-form strips biological energy from planets and ships. Sensitive to modulation, much like crystal can shatter from a high pitch note.
name: Crystalline Entity
text: Space mission: kills all life on ship unless SHIELDS>6 OR Music aboard. Planet mission: kills entire Away Team unless SCIENCE and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Although a thorough analysis of a DNA sample can be a time-consuming endeavor, it can also provide information crucial to successfully dealing with biomedical hazards.
name: DNA Clues
text: Place on mission. Further dilemmas requiring any MEDICAL here require 2 more if you continue OR 2 less if crew or Away Team has Exobiology and "stops" now to investigate.

lore: Many species send specially designed scout ships into unexplored sectors of space. If the species is aggressive, the arrival of a scout ship is a harbinger of trouble.
name: Scout Encounter
text: Opponent may download to this location one scout ship with one or two [Univ] crew members. That ship may (if possible) initiate battle against you or move away.

lore: Reclusive race of strict legalists. Consider humanoids inferior. The Treaty of Armens ceded several planets to the Sheliak.
name: The Sheliak
text: Place at furthest spaceline end. End of every turn: If at [P] where encountered, destroys all outposts and Away Teams here; mission worth -10 points; discard dilemma. Otherwise: moves.

lore: An Acamarian of the clan Tralesta. Carrier of a microvirus engineered to instantly kill anyone with a particular genetic makeup.
name: Yuta
text: Opponent chooses a number X. Randomly examine crew or Away Team one by one. If (INTEGRITY + CUNNING - STRENGTH) = X, discard that personnel and dilemma.

lore: In violation of the Seldonis IV convention, Gul Madred interrogated Jean-Luc Picard, seeking Starfleet strategic secrets. He kept asking, "How many lights do you see?"
name: Interrogation
text: Plays on one personnel you've captured. Each turn, ask opponent, "How many lights do you see?" If reply is "Five", return captive to outpost, score 10 points. Otherwise, score 1 point, retain captive.

lore: In 2371, Geordi La Forge received implants allowing him to see without his VISOR. They include enhanced capabilities such as infrared and zoom focus over 500 meters.
name: Ocular Implants
text: Plays on your Borg, android, or {any Geordi}. Once each turn where present, may glance for 10 seconds at either one Away Team OR bottom seed card of mission.

lore: Even a Borg cube ship can lose contact with the collective consciousness and begin marauding through space. Proper protocol re-establishment reintegrates it into the collective.
name: Retask
text: Downloads [Univ] {Borg Cube} and seven drones ([Bor], [Bor], [Bor], [Com], [Nav], [Nav], [Def]) to replace any {Borg Ship} dilemma in play. Discard event and dilemma. Draw no cards this turn.

lore: Surreal door created by unknown aliens, found on Theta 116 VIII. Open to entry but seemingly closed to exit.
name: Revolving Door
text: Plays on any [Doorway] or {Iconian Gateway}; it is closed while this card is face up. At start of any player's turn, that player may discard a non-personnel card from hand to "revolve" (flip) this card. (Unique.) OR Nullifies Revolving Door.

lore: The explosion of a star, usually caused by natural processes toward the end of its life cycle.
name: Supernova
text: You must have {Tox Uthat} on table. Place atop any mission. Everything there is destroyed (discarded), but leave Mission card underneath for span reference.

lore: The Groumall was jury-rigged with large planetary disruptors salvaged from the destroyed outpost on Korma. The upgrade required emptying the cargo bay, which cost Dukat his profits.
name: System 5 Disruptors
text: Plays on your freighter, transport or merchant vessel. Ship is WEAPONS +4, but is SHIELDS -1 and no longer qualifies as a freighter, transport, or merchant vessel.

lore: A wall display of all ships to bear the name Enterprise is a tradition built into each new ship of the line. This exhibit is in the observation lounge aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-E.
name: Wall of Ships
text: Downloads {any Enterprise}. Discard event. OR Plays on table. Adds 1 to RANGE, WEAPONS, and SHIELDS of each of your Enterprises. (Cumulative.)

lore: Like all cybernetic life forms, the Borg cannot survive without their organic components. Loss of the Queen brings chaos to order.
name: Alas, Poor Queen
text: Plays if {Borg Queen} (or Bluegill Queen) was just killed. All Borg (or Bluegills) in play of same player also die. (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.) OR Nullifies {Regenerate}.

lore: Warning for the dead to beware; a Klingon warrior is about to arrive. In Klingon myth, killed warriors with honor go to Sto-Vo-Kor. Dishonored dead go to Gre'thor.
name: Klingon Death Yell
text: Plays on any just killed Klingon with Honor. Yell to warn the dead and earn bonus points. May play only one death yell for each such Klingon.

lore: Study fragments of distorted space/time reported in this sector.
name: Investigate "Shattered Space"
text: Leadership + Computer Skill + Astrophysics x2 + Stellar Cartography

lore: Search nebula for clues to origin of changelings.
name: Investigate Rumors
text: Navigation + SCIENCE x2 + SECURITY OR Navigation + {Odo}

lore: Search for U.S.S. Pegasus, reported lost in this sector.
name: Pegasus Search
text: Navigation + Diplomacy + Leadership + Treachery + INTEGRITY>40 OR {Interphase Generator}

lore: Study and chart nebula.
name: Study Nebula
text: Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography + CUNNING>40

lore: Study and negotiate for exclusive use of Barzan wormhole.
name: Wormhole Negotiations
text: Diplomacy x5 OR Honor x4 OR Treachery x4

name: Assimilate Homeworld
text: Plays on table. Target both a homeworld with no [BO] objective on it and your matching counterpart. Your Borg may scout that homeworld. After scouting complete, if your counterpart is at that location, you may probe: [Com]: Assimilated. Place on mission. Cards of that affiliation (except [AU] cards) may not report to any outpost for rest of game.

name: Plans of the Tal Shiar
text: Seeds or plays on table. Wherever you have a Tal Shiar personnel in play, your Romulan espionage cards play at any time (for free) and may not be nullified. Also, once each turn, you may discard one of your Romulan espionage cards from hand or table, then draw one card. At any time you may discard this objective from table to download one Romulan espionage card.

lore: Vedek. Follows springball religiously. Romantically involved with Kira Nerys. Began spiritual service as a gardener; still enjoys tending the grounds.
name: Bareil Antos
text: V.I.P. Anthropology Diplomacy x 2 Honor SCIENCE Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Glinn; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Ambitious Glinn. Reports to Dukat. Witnessed his commanding officer's triumphal retaking of Terok Nor. Oversees engineering operations aboard the station.
name: Damar
text: OFFICER Physics ENGINEER Treachery Computer Skill May report where your {Dukat} is present.

lore: Cardassian male. Virtual player in the Vorta scenario testing the resolve of Alpha Quadrant species. Risked his life in the defense of his comrades.
name: Garak
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Computer Skill Honor May replace anyone present randomly selected to die.

lore: Changeling who, under the guise of Kira Nerys, attempted to understand Odo's loyalty to the solids. Discovered he had feelings for Kira.
name: Kira Founder
text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill Treachery

lore: Changeling posing as Miles O'Brien. Infiltrated Earth in 2372 with three other Founders. Gloated about their disruptive activities to Benjamin Sisko.
name: O'Brien Founder
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Transporter Skill Physics Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Homefront}

lore: Cloned reincarnation of Klingon spiritual leader Kahless the Unforgettable. Installed as ceremonial Emperor in 2369.
name: Kahless
text: V.I.P. Honor x 2

lore: Son of Mogh. Brother of Lieutenant Worf. Member of the Klingon High Council.
name: Kurn
text: OFFICER Honor Computer Skill Navigation Diplomacy

lore: Female subcommander. Captain of the warbird Haakona. Investigated the Federation incursion of the Neutral Zone in the vicinity of Iconia.
name: Taris
text: OFFICER Archaeology MEDICAL Music Transporter Skill

lore: Female captain of Imperial Romulan warbird, Khazara. Father killed by Tal Shiar. Uncovered M'ret defection plot.
name: Toreth
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Navigation

lore: Type-3 Cardassian warship. Rescued the Detapa Council from Cardassia Prime just prior to the 2372 Klingon invasion. Commanded by Dukat.
name: Prakesh
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Predecessor of U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Famous for heroic action in Battle of Narendra III, where it also entered a temporal rift. Commanded by Rachel Garrett.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-C
text: Enters play damaged at any location. Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Flagship commanded by Gowron during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68. Lieutenant Worf briefly served aboard as a weapons officer.
name: I.K.C. Bortas
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; future-related ship; Holodeck; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Destroyed U.S.S. Pasteur in an alternate future, only to be thwarted by the future Enterprise. Named for the ferocious guardian of Gre'thor.
name: I.K.C. Fek'lhr
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Kurn in support of Gowron during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
name: I.K.C. Hegh'ta
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-prey stationed at Deep Space 9 during the war against the Dominion. Commanded by Martok. Led many raids into Cardassian and Dominion space.
name: I.K.C. Rotarran
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Lifeform that normally exists in symbiotic empathic connection with its crew. Gomtuu's crew died prior to its discovery in 2366. Commanded by Tam Elbrun.
name: Gomtuu
text: If staffed, immune to {Supernova}. *If target has SHIELDS<9, hurl it up to 9 span.

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Duras-related; Klingon ship; Romulan ship; Scout;
lore: Small, obsolete, twenty-year-old Bird-of-Prey commanded by Lursa and B'Etor, the Sisters of Duras.
name: Cha'Joh
text: May benefit from two matching commanders. Cloaking Device

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Powerful ship created in Barash's illusion. Commanded by Tomalak. Transported Admiral Picard and Deanna Troi to a Romulan peace conference.
name: Decius
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commander Toreth's Warbird. Covertly used by N'Vek and Counselor Deanna Troi to accomplish the defection of Vice-Proconsul M'ret in 2369.
name: Khazara
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Historic time of Earth's first warp flight and contact with extraterrestrials.
name: Montana Missile Complex
text: Plays on table. Seed {Phoenix} beneath this location from outside the game ({any Zefram Cochrane} may acquire it later); Borg player may download {Stop First Contact}. Once Phoenix has taken off or {Vulcan Lander} has landed here, nullifies Stop First Contact. Native to this timeline: Zefram Cochrane, {Lily Sloane}, Phoenix, Vulcan Lander, {Solkar}, {Sevek}, {T'Shonra}, and {Kathleen Tonell}.

lore: "We must do this again some time."
name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner? 2E (Promo Cards)
text: Choose a personnel who has Diplomacy OR INTEGRITY>6 to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

lore: Dutiful commander. Vulcan dissident loyal to Captain Forrest. T'Pol was romantically involved with Chief Engineer Tucker during her last Pon farr.
name: Commander T'Pol 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER OFFICER SECURITY Treachery Exobiology Mindmeld DL/ {Hinder Progress}

lore: Confer with colonial leaders about recent tensions.
name: Investigate Maquis Activity 2E (Promo Cards)
text: Diplomacy + Leadership x2 + STRENGTH>37 + no [Maq] *+5 if this is your first completed mission.

lore: Hoshi Sato seized command of the Starship Defiant and declared herself Empress of the Terran Empire.
name: Comm Officer Sato 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 Anthropology Computer Skill Doubles {Male's Love Interest}.

lore: Cold-blooded killer, Kathryn Janeway. She captained the U.S.S. Voyager in a 31st-century recreation.
name: Revised Janeway 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 SCIENCE Leadership DL/ Any [DQ] card with "31st-century" in lore DL/ {The Art of Diplomacy} (effects extended to [AU][Fed][Holo])

lore: Shock-trooper in a 31st-century recreation. Seven of Nine was captured from the Borg and assimilated into Starfleet. She neutralized a Kyrian boarding party.
name: Revised Seven of Nine 2E (In A Mirror Darkly)
text: SECURITY ENGINEER SECURITY Transporter Skill DL/ {Nanoprobe Resuscitation} (targeting an [AU] card).

lore: "I'm ... doing a study. It has to do with ... work-related stress."
name: Julian Bashir 2E (Medical Staffer)
text: Biology Exobiology MEDICAL x 2 You may play this personnel aboard your [OS] or [CF] ship. At the start of each of your turns, you may take a personnel in your discard pile and place that personnel on the bottom of your deck. When you do this, each opponent may do the same with his or her discard pile and deck.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: The D-7 incorporates a solid design with firepower that the Imperial Klingon Defense force used often and without prejudice.
name: D-7 Battlecruiser 2E
text: Cloaking Device. Tractor Beam. To play this ship, you must command two [AU][Kli] personnel.

lore: "You are being clever, Commander."
name: Charvanek 2E (Fleet Commander)
text: Archaeology Diplomacy OFFICER Physics SCIENCE

lore: "Captain Smiley wants me to debrief you."
name: Leeta 2E (Enticing Rebel)
text: Diplomacy Leadership SECURITY When this personnel is randomly selected by a dilemma, you may download a card and place it in your discard pile.

name: Alternate Universe Door (Tribble)
text: Place one on table during the seed phase. Door is now open, allowing your [AU] icon cards to enter play. OR Stock in deck and use as follows: Plays to nullify one {Revolving Door} or {Subspace Schism}. (Discard doorway.) OR Allows one ship to pass through {Q-Net}. (Discard doorway.) OR Nullify one {Temporal Rift}, and return doorway to your hand.

lore: Lieutenant (j.g.) Alyssa Ogawa married shipmate Andrew Powell in 2370. A nurse assistant to Dr. Beverly Crusher, she is studying to be a doctor.
name: Alyssa Ogawa (First Contact) (Tribble)
text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology DL/ {Medical Kit}

lore: A male non-corporeal life-form that lives inside a female host which he enchants, as in the case of Dr. Beverly Crusher's late grandmother.
name: Anaphasic Organism (Tribble)
text: If Female(s) in Away Team, the one with highest total attribute numbers resigns (is discarded), unless SECURITY and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Indigenous inhabitants, such as this Mintakan bowman, often attack an Away Team out of fear.
name: Archer (Tribble)
text: Away Team member with highest total attribute numbers is shot and dies unless SECURITY and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Traditional blade weapon of the Klingon warrior. According to legend, the first bat'leth, or "sword of honor," was forged by Kahless the Unforgettable some fifteen centuries ago.
name: Bat'leth (Tribble)
text: Each of your Klingons present is STRENGTH +2, and in each battle one of them may mortally wound one adversary they just stunned. (Cumulative.)

lore: In shap six of chula, players can fall into a deep crevasse. Three Deep Space 9 senior officers fell in, but landed in Quark's bar and learned that it was only part of an elaborate game.
name: Chula: The Abyss (Tribble)
text: To get past, three personnel present (random selection) must face the abyss. If their total CUNNING is odd, they are "stopped" and, if possible, relocated to {Quark's Bar}.

lore: Players face several perils throughout the game of chula. In shap four of the game played in Quark's Bar, Julian Bashir was singled out and "eliminated" by a burst of energy.
name: Chula: The Lights (Tribble)
text: Crew or Away Team member with total attributes closest to 22 (your choice if tie) returns to hand. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

lore: Fleet Admiral Shanthi authorized the blockade of Romulan forces covertly supporting the Klingon Civil War in 2368.
name: Fleet Admiral Shanthi (Tribble)
text: OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy

lore: An Away Team that is unprepared to complete its mission will undoubtedly experience delays. Mission progress may be impossible until additional personnel arrive.
name: Lack of Preparation (Tribble)
text: Non-Borg: Cannot get past (lose 10 points) unless you could have met mission requirements at start of attempt. Borg: Must have [Com], [Nav], and [Def] personnel to proceed.

lore: One of the many beautiful women who reside on the paradise planet of Risa.
name: Male's Love Interest (Tribble)
text: Male Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. Discard dilemma.

lore: At times, Away Teams must open obstructed doors in confined passageways by hand, as did Lt. Commander Data on stardate 41503.7.
name: Malfunctioning Door (Tribble)
text: To get through door, must have Soong-Type android present OR a combined STRENGTH>27 from up to four Away Team members.

lore: The planet Angel One was dominated by its women who were intolerant of dealing with men.
name: Matriarchal Society (Tribble)
text: Cannot get past unless at least two female Away Team members are present.

lore: Representative of specialized medical equipment. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Medical Kit (Tribble)
text: Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

lore: Representative of a specialized tricorder optimized for medical use. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Medical Tricorder (Tribble)
text: Gives all of your SCIENCE-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

lore: Genetic weapon designed to attack humanoids who have specific DNA sequences.
name: Microvirus (Tribble)
text: Kills one Away Team member (opponent's choice), unless MEDICAL and SECURITY present. Discard dilemma.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; any Scotty; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Chief Engineer of the Starship Enterprise. Scotty was rescued by the U.S.S. Enterprise after he spent 75 years in the pattern buffer of the U.S.S. Jenolen.
name: Montgomery Scott (Tribble)
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Astrophysics Honor Miracle Worker Transporter Skill

lore: Klingon agent sent by the High Council to keep Ruwon and Karina under surveillance. Accused Odo of insulting his honor. Threatened retribution.
name: Morka (Tribble)
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Klingon Intelligence Geology Stellar Cartography

lore: Device designed by Geordi La Forge to improve warp engine quantum efficiency. Wesley Crusher opined that it was obsolete and needed a subprocessor matrix overhaul.
name: Plasmadyne Relay (Tribble)
text: While on a ship, RANGE and SHIELDS are +2. While on a station or outpost, SHIELDS are +4. (Cumulative.)

lore: First contact requires caution, subterfuge or force. Solkar's historic visit to Earth was peaceful, but Federation/Klingon contact in 2218 would ignite a century of hostilities.
name: Primitive Culture (Tribble)
text: To get past, requires 3 Vulcans OR Anthropology and CIVILIAN OR Vorta and 4 Jem'Hadar OR 2 Tal Shiar OR 2 Obsidian Order OR Acquisition and 2 Greed OR 6 Klingons OR 4 [Def] Borg.

lore: Q once saved Captain Jean-Luc Picard's life following an injury from a compressed teryon beam.
name: Res-Q (Tribble)
text: Regenerates a card. Exchange this event for any one card from your discard pile.

lore: Beverly Crusher scanned Jo'Bril's body for tetryon traces during her 2369 "murder" investigation. Her scientific approach eventually revealed that Jo'bril had faked his own death.
name: Scientific Method (Tribble)
text: To get past requires MEDICAL and 3 SCIENCE.

lore: Dr. Manheim's laboratory deep inside a remote planetoid used a system of forcefields and targeting laser to bar entry and protect a revolutionary experiment.
name: Security Precautions (Tribble)
text: To get past, Away Team must have {Jenice Manheim} OR android OR {phaser} OR {disruptor} OR 3 SECURITY.

lore: Least powerful of the standard hand-held Federation defensive weapons. Low profile favored by Starfleet captains. Smaller in size than the type II phaser, and easily concealed.
name: Starfleet Type I Phaser (Tribble)
text: Federation use only. Reports for free. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) May report to a just-initiated personnel battle involving your [Fed] card(s).

lore: Senior security officer aboard U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Led the ship's internal defense during the Borg attack of 2373. Transferred from U.S.S. Hood.
name: Thomas McClure (Tribble)
text: SECURITY Leadership Exobiology

lore: Representative of female mercenaries operating throughout the galaxy. Worked with Baran to find the Stone of Gol.
name: Vekor (Tribble)
text: SCIENCE MEDICAL Navigation Geology

lore: Typical Klingon inspired by tales of glorious battle against the Dominion. Learned diplomatic skills from his father, a former Klingon negotiator.
name: Wo'Din (Tribble)
text: SCIENCE Diplomacy Stellar Cartography

lore: Jake Sisko was exposed to the horrors of war when caught in the Klingon attack on Ajilon Prime. Not a soldier, he was unprepared for the hazards he faced with the colonists.
name: Hazardous Duty (Tribble)
text: To get past requires 2 OFFICER; then place on mission until solved. If any non- OFFICER dies here, its owner loses points (discard dilemma).
